Final Narrative:
Three correctional facility guards were escorting a restrained federal prison inmate when he became disruptive, requiring the use of force. 
Two guards and the inmate fell onto the Lieutenant's right leg, fracturing his fibula. He was transported to the hospital and released the following day.
Employee in the Machine Shop received second degree burns to the back of his legs after the torch he was using exploded.
A truck driver fell approximately 4 feet while descending a tanker trailer ladder.  The employee was kept overnight awaiting test results.
An employee's leg was pinned between a truck and the powered pallet jack being operated.  The employee was hospitalized for treatment/surgery at Navicent Health.
An employee working on the Line 6 Auto-Beller reached into the machine to unjam two pipes and got his hand crushed, fracturing three left-hand fingers.
An employee was hospitalized after slipping and falling while working as a member of the night freight crew, resulting in an injury to his right elbow.
Employee working the flipping machine at the casting line had fingertip amputated after it was crushed by a jammed block.
Employee sustained burns during line tie-in operations at an oil and gas site.
One employee was hospitalized after being struck by a tire when he was airing the tire up during his pre-drive inspection.
An associate was using a knife to open a bag of chili and cut off her fingertip.
An employee was struck by an excavator on 01/02/2015 and hospitalized for injuries to his leg, several broken bones in his foot, and a fracture in his left arm.

On or about 1/2/15 at 9:10 p.m., an employee was preparing to troubleshoot the hamburger bun bagger machine that was not working. He received an electrical shock when he came in contact with a proximity switch. Employee was working alone at the time of the incident.  He was admitted to the hospital for one day.
An employee stumbled and fell to the ground on the left side of her body and was admitted to Irving Baylor Medical Center with a possible hip fracture.

Two employees in a scissor lift were wrecking forms, taking forms down, and removing the forms. They lost their grip on the form, which fell and hit an employee walking below on the shoulder, knocking him to the ground. He hit his head on the concrete, causing a wound to the head, a broken collarbone, and a broken rib.
Employee amputated tip of finger when his finger got caught in the chain of a stationary exercise bicycle that he was servicing. There was no bone loss and the employee was not hospitalized.

An employee suffered a right index finger amputation. The employee's finger was injured by a thigh deboning machine. The finger was still attached at the time of the incident and was later amputated at the hospital.
An employee was injured by a customer's automobile when the car jumped the curb and pinned the employee against the Red Box movie kiosk on the convenience store's sidewalk.

Employee suffered the amputation of three fingers while working on the south in-bed fuel airlock in the energy building. He was using a hammer to hit the outside of the chute to loosen built up saw dust.  The chute leads to an airlock, which feeds the blow line to the boiler. He removed the panel cover over the airlock to see if the saw dust was falling in.  He slipped and his left hand entered the airlock. Contact with the rotating parts in the airlock resulted in the multiple-finger amputation.

An employee who was using a cordless circular saw to install wood panels around an elevator lobby received a partial amputation of his left index finger when the tip of his finger became caught in the saw.

On Friday, January 2, 2015, at 10:30 p.m., a crew of employees were changing out wooden decking boards on a platform off shore. One of the employees was walking the platform, slipped, and stepped on a protruding nail that entered the employee's right foot. First aid was applied to the employee, and the employee was later sent to a clinic for treatment. The employee was admitted to a hospital at 3:00 a.m. on January 5, 2015, from swelling on his foot due to the incident.
The employee was coming down a ladder after placing media in a nitrogen generator. Employee missed a rung, fell about 10 feet to the floor, and sustained a compound fracture to the right arm.
Employee tripped on a paver and fractured her wrist, requiring hospitalization.

Employees use a draw machine to extrude wire.  The employee bypassed the guard or disabled it to remove soap build-up on the wire coming from the die. The employee amputated the middle, ring, and pinky fingers on the right hand and the first digit of the index finger. Employee was hospitalized and released. The injury occurred on 1/3/15 at approximately 6:00 p.m.

While in the process of unloading pre-tied mats of rebar, one of the bundles fell off of the tying jig and pinned three workers underneath. Two of the workers were unharmed. A third employee suffered a fractured rib and a fractured vertebra.
Employee lost his nail, skin, and flesh from the tip of his right ring finger while closing the cardboard bailer door.

An employee suffered a trans-phalangeal amputation of the middle finger on the right hand. The employee was attempting to connect two baggage-transferring carts manually by pulling them into each other. The employee placed his hand on one baggage cart and pulled it to the second cart with his other hand in an effort to connect the two. The employee's hand was caught between the two carts, causing a middle finger amputation on his right hand at the first knuckle.

Employee was installing a new cable on a home while working from a Lunar, 28 foot fiberglass extension ladder. A gust of wind made his ladder move and he felt like it was going to fall so he jumped off the ladder toward the grass to avoid the concrete patio and landed on his back.
Worker caught a hand in a running conveyor while cleaning and rinsing it. Worker suffered broken radial and ulnar bones in the right arm. The victim was hospitalized.

An employee was hospitalized after being hit by a forklift that was unloading boxes of pulp from a flatbed stationed in the roadway. The forklift backed up and ran over the employee's leg as he was leaving work, resulting in a fractured ankle and leg.
An employee was assaulted by a patient (choking) resulting in a multi-day hospitalization.
Employee was performing inspection and preventive maintenance on a conveyor line.  His fingertip was amputated in a chain and sprocket when the line started up.

An employee was exposed to an amputation hazard while coupling rail cars. He used his foot to align the couplers. His foot slipped and got caught between the two couplers. His toe was smashed when the cars connected.

On or about 1/4/15 at 1:50 PM, employee was slicing ham when a piece of meat slipped, allowing the employee's hand to come into contact with the deli slicer.  Employee lost tip of thumb; there was no bone loss.
On January 4, 2015, at approximately 5:10 p.m., an employee slipped on a wet floor while transporting a patient from one level to another.  The employee experienced a hamstring tear.
Employee was descending a work over rig derrick via a ladder when he fell a distance. Employee suffered a lacerated spleen and fractured hip and shoulder.
An employee slipped on the ice in the parking lot and hit his head.  He was transported and admitted to Morton Hospital.
Employee was burned from his knees up to his lower abdomen after removing the strainer for maintenance on the Scott Unit.

An employee in the #2 steel-producing BOF shop was making ladle additions to the first heat steel of the day on furnace #94 when the materials reacted, causing flames and high heat to come up through the chute. The employee received first and second degree burns to the face, right wrist and forearm, and a little bit on his right abdomen.

An employee was hospitalized following injuries sustained while traveling by foot to the locker room. The employee was between the belt shop and the locker room crossing railroad tracks that had recently been covered with snow. The employee either slipped or tripped and experienced three breaks to the ankle and tibia.

Employee was loading a trailer with a forklift when the left leg of the trailer collapsed, causing the trailer to tilt to the left. This caused the forklift and employee to slide to the left, striking the trailer wall and causing an acute spinal injury to the employee.

Employee climbed up on a handrail and slipped while cleaning snow off of the framework and guard of a chip belt conveyor. Employee suffered amputation of the right index finger.  Employee was seen at Kootenai Health and was released as an out-patient.

An employee was working on a vehicle being lifted off the ground.  He stepped off the back and fell approximately 4 feet to the ground below.  When the employee hit the ground, he fractured his wrist and was taken to Grady Memorial Hospital where he received surgery.

On or about 1/4/15 at 6:05 pm, an employee was preparing to clean a room and put a door stopper at the room door. The stopper slipped catching her hand between the door and its frame resulting in the amputation of her left index finger.  Employee was taken to the hospital to reattach the finger.

On or about January 4, 2015, an employee was injured while running a gas sample. The employee was dipping out a sample with a sample cup using tongs. When he put the cup in, the hot metal splashed on him, causing burns to the ring finger and little finger on his right hand.  The employee was admitted to the KU Medical Center in Kansas City, Kansas.
A worker slipped on an alcohol foam rug and fractured his hip on January 4, 2015.  He was hospitalized for 3 days and had therapy.
Employee was loading plastic pipes onto a utility trailer.  He jumped off the trailer and broke his ankle.
A machine operator experienced a fingertip amputation while troubleshooting a jam in the Samuel Strapper machine.
Worker tripped over a box at his work station.  He was hospitalized with a fractured bone by his knee.

In a unit office/housing unit where inmates are housed, an employee was seated at a desk when an inmate walked into the office. The inmate punched him first in the face and then repeatedly punched his head. His nose was injured and he lost consciousness. He was hospitalized with a concussion.
An employee was operating an electric ride on powered industrial truck (PIT). Employee became pinned between the PIT and a steel racking system while attempting to avoid hitting another employee.

A fire suppression system inadvertently went off, causing a white cloud.  Employees working on a scaffold, 24 feet above the ground, scrambled to avoid the cloud. While descending a ladder, an employee slipped and fell 10 to 12 feet.
Employee was working on a fluid end expendable pump using a torque wrench when his left ring finger got caught in between and was amputated - halfway through the nailbed.

Employee was using her gloved hands to clean the glue-spreader machine while it was operational. The doctor rollers were not open, and the employee's glove got caught between the rollers, pulling her hand inside. Her right-hand ring and middle fingers were crushed.
A worker splashed caustic water on his left thigh and hand while cleaning the equipment on Line 3.  He was admitted to the hospital the next day.
An employee was climbing stairs to a shore tank to conduct temperature measurements.   The employee fell from the stairs approximately 20 feet to the bottom of the tank.
Employee arrived at client's home, slipped on ice, and bumped her head.

While stairs were being installed using a sky trak at the Plano Assisted Living facility, an employee on the ground who was directing the stair placement got his left index finger caught between a metal stud and the stair.  The employee was transported to Methodist Richardson and had surgery the next day to amputate his finger at the knuckle.

An employee walking from the parking lot en route to his assigned work area slipped, tearing his quadriceps tendon. The employee was discharged from the ER, but later returned to Lake West hospital that evening and was admitted. The employee has since been scheduled for surgery.

A tube hill attendant at a winter resort snow tubing hill rode a tube down the hill.  On the way down the tube crossed lanes causing it to flip.  The employee was ejected and suffered a lacerated spleen resulting in hospitalization.
Employee's face was burned by hot plastic exploding from an injection molding machine.

On or about January 5th, 2015,at approximately 1:30 pm, an employee was greasing a bearing on the Buffalo roller mill in preparation to roll corn for cattle feed.  The roller mill was being driven by a PTO.  The employees left hand was pulled by a chain into a sprocket, amputating the left index finger.  The employee was transported to Great Plains Regional Hospital with the amputated finger for treatment.
Employee was using a handheld grinder when the blade broke, cutting his left arm above the wrist.
A valve on a metal detector closed on an employee's finger, causing an amputation.
The employee's arm was caught at the head roller of raw material hopper Line #1.  The arm was surgically amputated to free him from the bagging machine.
An employee received freezing tissue-related injuries when she was sprayed with liquid oxygen while filling portable tanks.

On or about 1/5/15 at 6:30 a.m., an employee was riding a horse back to the barn after completing morning exercises. The horse reared up, could not withstand its weight, and fell over.  This resulted in injury to the employee, breaking his femur bone.
Employee slipped and fell fracturing a hip.
Snow sport ski instructor was skiing with a guest on the Roundhouse Slope when the employee fell breaking a hip.
An employee was exposed to a pinch point hazard when his left thumb was caught between the ST-80 and another metal object.

Employee's right foot was crushed and all of the toes had to be amputated at the hospital. He will require a few days of hospitalization and rehab afterwards. The job required pulling back and laying down pipe.

An employee who had just parked was walking through the parking lot toward the building when she slipped and fell on ice, fracturing two ankle bones. She was transported to the hospital and had surgery the same day.
A worker was installing a retaining wall next to Highway 285 when a gust of wind displaced a tree next to the highway. The tree struck the worker, resulting in back, pelvis, and ankle injuries.
Employee received electrical burns to the left hand while working on an electrical box.
An employee climbing the loader stairs in the grinder room caught his foot on the metal step tread, fell backward, and cracked ribs.

An employee, who had gloves on, was using a powered drill tool to drill into an unsupported block of wood.  The employee was holding the block of wood in his hands. When the employee actuated the drill, the glove got caught, resulting in a partial amputation of the thumb.

A roofer slipped on the ridge of a roof while securing roofing felt paper.  When he slipped, his nail gun came into contact with his work boot and activated, firing a nail through the boot and into his big toe.  The worker was admitted to Carney Hospital for several days during which several surgeries were performed.
On or about 1/5/15 at 5:30 PM, an employee was admitted to the hospital to be treated for swelling and an abscess.

On or about 1/5/15, at 7:45 AM, an employee supervising the first shift noticed material buildup in the conveyor and decided to clean it.  She got caught in one of the belt conveyors, breaking both her bones from her forearm.

Employee 1 and employee 2 were operating a welding robot in the fabrication department.  Employee 1 was loading a fin bank into the welding cell and was walking backwards into the welding cell while operating an overhead crane. Employee 1 stepped backwards into an open pit and fell approximately 8 feet. Employee 1 sustained the following injuries: fractured pelvis at both hip sockets, fractured ribs, fractured right elbow, fractured right shoulder.  Employee 1 is hospitalized at University Hospital in Columbia, Missouri.

An employee was wrapping meat using an automatic wrapper and putting the meat into a tall/mini shelving rack in the refrigerated market/area. The employee then transported the meat to the sale floor area.  On her way back to the market area, the employee slipped and fell to the floor.  The floor was wet from condensation.
Employee using a table saw amputated his right index finger and his right middle finger.
Employee was walking, rolled on his ankle, and broke his ankle.
Employee injured her hip and was hospitalized after she slipped and fell on the wet floor.
On Monday, January 5, 2014, an employee slipped on ice while walking to his work truck at a job site.  The employee sustained an injury to his neck and was admitted to the hospital that day.
Employee was walking from her car and slipped and fell in the parking lot. Employee was transported to the hospital by ambulance and was admitted.
On or about January 5, 2015, an employee suffered a partial amputation of the fingertip while using the patty-making machine.

On or about January 6, 2015, an employee was injured while attempting to remove a part that was stuck in the door of the Wheelabrator machine. Once the part was released from the door, the door shut on the employee's finger and amputated the tip of his left index finger.
Employee was using a portable hand grinder to cut a steel pipe. The grinder kicked back and lacerated the employees knee cutting an artery.

An employee entered a storage container that contained painting materials at the work site.  Upon entering the container, the employee lit a cigarette in the container, and an explosion occurred shortly afterwards.  The employee was burned on the face and hands.  The employee was admitted to the hospital for treatment of his burns.
A maintenance employee received a fingertip amputation while troubleshooting a stuck clamp on a cutting machine on the mechanical spinning line LH2.
Employee suffered an amputation of the tip of his left-hand index finger in a pinch point while conducting material handling operations that involved rolled steel on a support stand.
A stack of 12 x 4 foot panels of sheet rock in the hallway of an under construction building fell on the employee and broke his leg.
Employee's left-hand distal middle finger was crushed by a pallet jack. When injured, the employee was operating the pallet jack alone while moving an 1800-pound tote container.

Employees were moving equipment into the trailer and removed the stairs to the trailer.  Upon exiting the trailer, an employee forgot the stairs were removed and fell about 3 feet to the ground.  Employee has 2 broken ribs, broken scapula, and a dislocated shoulder.
On Tuesday, January 6, 2015, an employee was struck in the stomach by bushing that was sticking out of a rotary table while operating levers.
An employee fell from a stationary piece of equipment while changing a conveyor's pulley belt.  The fall was about 8 feet. The employee was hospitalized with a broken leg.

A worker was hospitalized on 01/06/2015 at 3:30 p.m. After doing some clean-up work on a roof, he fell approximately 8.5 to 9 feet while descending a ladder. The worker fractured his leg  and was hospitalized overnight at Athens Regional Medical Center. He underwent surgery, at which time a pin was inserted in the tibia of the fractured leg.

On January 6, 2015, an employee was working from a ladder, cutting a metal tank into scrap metal.  The employee stepped off the ladder and onto a tank where he slipped and fell. The employee fractured his right ankle and was admitted to the hospital for surgical repair of the fracture.
Employee sustained an amputation of two fingers when his hand was caught in the belt and pulley of the hammer mill.
An employee slipped and fell on ice and bumped her head. She was sent to the emergency room, and admitted to the hospital as a precaution.

Employee was cutting a 10-foot length of 6-inch PVC pipe into 10-inch sections. He was using a chop saw that was on a pivot because the tool he had been using would not cut the pipe. The employee was using his hand to hold the pipe.  His hand got pulled into the blade.
Employee fell from a ladder after removing one foot from the ladder and placing it on a merchandise hook approximately 9 feet above the floor. He landed on his feet and injured his left knee.

Employee received burns to his left index finger and portion of his left hand, while performing routine service on a plastic mold injection machine. Employees needed hospitalization at University of Rochester Strong Hospital.
Employee was walking in the warehouse and was struck by a forklift that was carrying insulation. The employee's head hit the ground, and the employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell on ice, causing an abrasion on his left elbow. The abrasion was followed by cellulitis and a bursal abscess.
An employee sustained battery acid burns to the face while attempting to start an air compressor on the back of a service vehicle by boosting the battery with jumper cables.

An employee was injured when the brakes on a seven-car string of loaded boxcars let loose. The cars rolled into a four-car string of empty boxcars.  The impact knocked an employee off the four-car string and he fell on the ground. The employee was hospitalized for lacerations.
The worker stepped on a floor joist and fell 10 feet. The worker sustained a broken leg and was hospitalized.

An employee was offloading a tractor trailer when the forklift being operated by a Pika Energy employee picked up a piece of cargo and pinned the employee between the cargo and the trailer wall, resulting in numerous serious injuries.
On January 6, 2015, a worker sustained a fracture to the right ankle after slipping on ice at a construction site located at 17400 N. 84th Street, Lincoln, NE  68517.

Employee was injured while repairing a forklift in the receiving department. The employee was caught between the forklift's mast and cage while reconnecting a hose. The employee was hospitalized overnight with a crushed or bruised vertebrae.
The employee was working from a stage table, approximately 2 to 3 feet above the ground.  The employee fell, breaking his hip.

Employee was collecting shoes for her customer in the shoe stockroom when she tripped over a fitting stool sitting on the floor. She fell to the floor, fracturing her right ankle.  She was carrying four boot boxes and could not see directly in front of her.

Two employees of 4 Swift Service passed out in a tank that was being cleaned.  Employees proceeded into a tank which had been closed, but was opened by an employee.  Employees went inside to clean, but were supposed to clean the outside of the tank only. Both employees were transported to the hospital, but only one employee was admitted.

Employee's garbage truck struck electrical lines hanging low in the street.  Employee climbed up approximately 10 feet to untangle the wires when he fell to the ground.  He broke his left leg and has small fractures in his neck. He was admitted to the hospital.

On January 6, 2015, at approximately 11:30 p.m., an employee was performing a change over in the secondary turn cell when the clamp/unclamp feature was activated. The employee's fingertips on both hands were caught behind the chuck of the lathe. On the left hand, the third and fourth fingers were amputated.
Employee's left thumb and finger were injured while using a router.
Employee was cleaning paper underneath the Core Machine while it was running. The belt drive snagged her arm and broke it.
An employee was visiting a patient's home. Upon entering the fence of the patient's yard, one of the patient's dogs attacked the employee. The employee received several dog bites.

The employee was installing block on a V8 line. The employee had been using a lifting chain and shipping nipple to place a V13 block on a shipping skid. The employee's hand got caught between the lifting chain and shipping nipple when the weight shifted and the chain slipped. The tip of the employee's left ring finger was amputated between the end and the first knuckle and the left middle finger was fractured.
Employee operating a forklift was injured when he stuck his arm out of the forklift cage and it was struck by a company vehicle.
Employee was pulled into a machine, causing a broken arm. Hospitalized for surgery.

Employee received a broken right tibia when he entered a belly dump trailer to remove coal ash that was stuck to the inside walls. The dump gates lost power, causing them to close on the employee's leg.

An employee was using a circular saw to cut a piece of aluminum to make repairs on a dump truck when the saw kicked back, striking the employee on the right side of the neck.  Sutures were required, and the employee was admitted to the hospital.

Employee was using a 5-6 ft extension ladder to access an exterior light fixture. Upon removing the light fixture, the fixture broke free of the wall and fell towards the employee's face. Employee attempted to dodge the falling fixture, causing him to lose his footing on the ladder. He fell from the ladder and was hospitalized with fractures to both bones in his right ankle.
Worker was burned by hot ash that blew on his face when he opened the ash hopper panel.

While testing a main rotor head an employee reached in to remove a piece of tape and the hinge started to move into the fold position.  The employee's fingertip was in a pinch point at the time and the tip of the finger was amputated at the first knuckle.

Employee was constructing a wooden pallet skid lift when the nail gun he was operating fired twice and injured his finger. The injury was underneath the employee's thumb. The employee was transported to the hospital, stayed overnight, and had surgery on his finger.
Employee fell on ice and struck his head while delivering a parcel.

On or about 1/7/2015 at 12:00 PM, employee working on a construction site was using a metal rebar to repair a broken hinge on another company's truck that was on site delivering soil material.  Employee was standing at ground level while attempting to bend the rebar. The metal rebar broke, resulting in the employee falling to the ground. Employee sustained fractures to his right hip; he was hospitalized and had emergency surgery.
An employee tripped on a floor mat, fell, and fractured the hip resulting in hospitalization to surgically repair the hip fracture.
An employee's finger was amputated in the Meat Processing department while using a band saw to cut meat.
An employee fell in the ladies restroom fracturing the femur in seven places. She was hospitalized as a result.

Employee was operating a horizontal drilling machine when the drive shaft came loose and hit the guard. This broke the guard, which then hit the employee's seat.  The employee was knocked off the machine.
Employee slipped on black ice and fell in the parking lot on Jan 7, 2015 @ 8:00 am.  He broke his ankle and had to have surgery.

On Wednesday, 01/07/2015 at 3:45 a.m., an employee working on the 180 L Differential Assembly machine and the conveyor belt system dropped a wrench. In an attempt to retrieve the wrench from between the conveyor system and the 180 L Assembly machine, her right arm was caught by the 180 L machine, resulting in a laceration and an overnight hospital stay.

Employee was crushed by falling sheetrock while it was being moved at a renovation site located at 205 Boulevard, Roland, Oklahoma. The sheetrock was leaned in an upright position, totaling 17 sheets or 1,360 pounds. The material fell on the employee's legs and crushed them.
Employee fell 8 feet from a ship's ladder, injuring his head and back. He required in-patient hospitalization.

The worker was cutting the tip of a tube of material with a utility knife. The knife slipped and the tip of the worker's left index finger was cut off. 
Urgent care stitched on the tip of finger and there was no lost time. The worker was wearing gloves.

Employee #1 was removing coffee beans from the hopper while the screw conveyor was off. When Employee #2 went to a separate room to turn on the roaster, the screw conveyor was also turned on. Employee #1 was still removing coffee, and the screw conveyor cut off his right hand at the wrist.
An employee was attempting to close a door to a loading booth he was working from. The door closed on his hand, resulting in an amputation of his right-hand little fingertip.
An employee sustained a broken left tibia from a slip and fall while walking back to the UPS truck after picking up a package.

Employee sustained crushing foot and knee injuries when a 4' x 6' steel semi-truck loading dock plate fell on top of the employee. The event required hospitalization of employee who is currently undergoing knee surgery and estimates are he will be in the hospital for two to four days.

Employee was descending a 10-foot ladder and was about halfway down when he missed a rung and fell off the ladder. Employee landed on his left side and hit his head on the paved surface below.  At the time of the incident, the employee was on the ladder outside removing sealant from the wall of the Metropolitan Medical Facility.  The employee was transported and admitted to Samcee Hospital. The employee received stitches in his head and sustained a lower back fracture.

An employee had his ring finger amputated when a heavy part being lifted and strapped on a forklift fell off. This caused the part to fly up on the other end where his hand was placed, striking his hand against a guillotine blade.

On January 7, 2015, employee sustained a hand injury while working on or near a conveyor belt while performing maintenance activities.  The employee was admitted to the Medical Center of the Rockies in Fort Collins on the same day.
An employee suffered an amputated thumb and potentially finger(s) from an injury that occurred on January 7, 2015.
Laundry employee was sorting laundry and tripped over laundry on the floor.  Employee fell onto the floor and fractured the right hip.
Employee cut his right hand between the thumb and index finger while using an alligator shear machine. Employee was taken to the hospital with possible nerve damage. Surgery was required.
On 01/07/15 at 6:45 pm, an employee's  middle index finger was amputated while unclogging a pipe of the dust collector system.
Employee was hospitalized due to a slip and fall in parking lot resulting in a fractured leg.
Employee suffered a partial amputation of the thumb while working with a band saw.

On January 7, 2015, at approximately 12:00 p.m., an employee was using a ladder to install an electrical conduit to be used for the new emergency exit signs, which were to be installed in the warehouse as well. The employee fell off the ladder and was taken to Del Sol Medical Center where he was admitted.
Employee's finger was amputated when he placed his hand in a pinch point during a test.
Employee inserting food product (chicken) into an oven suffered burns when the employee came in contact with the oven door.
Employee fell approximately 10 feet from a ladder while working on a tanker truck hatch. Employee injured the wrist and face.

An employee was grinding a long seam of a steel shell using a handheld grinder.  Completing work for the day, the employee pulled back on the grinder and dropped it, causing it to kick back and hit his right index finger.  The wound was immediately wrapped and the employee was brought to the hospital.  The employee had surgery to amputate a portion of his finger.
Employee fell from a ladder and was hospitalized.

Employee was injured in the fish preparation area when he placed his hands on the chain puller to unload racks from the precookers. The second and third fingers on his left hand were caught in the chain, and his fingers were crushed.
An employee was hospitalized for 3 days after his arm was caught in a conveyor belt machine on 1/7/15.
Employee was power washing a building and the hose had disconnected causing severe facial lacerations. Employee was admitted to the hospital.

At the No. 2 White Liquor Clarifier Tank, two employees were working on a mixer on top of a large tank to replace the gear box that rotates the mixer.  The employees removed five of the eight bolts from the flange when the flange fractured through the bolt holes of the three remaining bolts causing the unit to rotate about 10 degrees (6"). The gear housing struck one of the employees on the right leg and fractured his femur.

An employee working in the parts department was dragging boxes from the outside to the inside of a warehouse when the boxes got caught on a stack of tires.  The employee lost his balance and fell to the ground.  The employee was transported by ambulance to Baylor Hospital Dallas where he was hospitalized with a hip fracture.
Employee was working on the PACO Re-Cutter Single Spin when the right index finger was amputated.  EMS took the employee to York Hospital.
An employee was hospitalized on 01/07/2015 after he fell from a ladder and broke a rib.

Company employee was behind the store preparing to receive goods from a delivery truck.  While attempting to guide the truck back into the company's offloading dock, he was pinned between the truck and a railing.
Employee was utilizing a portable band saw "laydown saw"  to cut aluminum to be used on belt trailers when he cut the tip of his middle finger on the right hand.
Employee spilled water on the floor while making coffee. Employee then slipped and fell, breaking her left upper arm requiring surgery.

Employee was on the side of the derrick untying tubular when his fast line became caught up in his SRL. The employee was pulled away from the ladder.  The SRL stopped and so did the anchor.  Therefore, no fall resulted. The employee received contusions to the head, ribs, and chest area. He also suffered bruising to the brain and lungs and received six stitches to the forehead.  He did not lose consciousness.
Employee received a crushing injury to the end of the thumb that required reconstructive surgery.

On or about 1/8/15 at 12:10 a.m., an employee was working between two boxcars located on a private railroad when the cars began to move.  The employee tried to get out from between the cars when one of the cars pinched his left foot, resulting in fractures.

An employee was cutting a piece of wood when he slipped and made contact with the rotating blade on a DeWalt miter saw.  The employee cut off the tip of his right index finger.  The employee was taken to UPMC East for treatment.

On January 8, 2015, an Abilene Reporter-News employee was working with the large printing press in the company's press room. He stuck his hand into the roller system and had the skin on his right hand removed ("gloved") by the machine. The employee was taken to Hendricks Medical Center in Abilene, Texas, where he was awaiting surgical intervention.
Employee was adding a steel bar to the induction furnace when it flared up and splashed hot metal on the employee.  Employee was taken to Lehigh Valley Hospital.

Employee was troubleshooting a monorail lift station.  A pneumatic hoist rail on a cylinder was lowered to troubleshoot the equipment. It caught the tip of the employee's boot, fracturing two toes on the right foot.
On 01/08/15, employee suffered an amputation of the left index finger while operating a mulch machine at a well site.
An employee slipped and fell on  ice while walking in the yard to retrieve parts for a machine.
Employee reached under the guard on wrapping equipment to remove a bag that was snagged. He caught his finger in the chain and sprocket, cutting the tip of the finger.

Employee was removing concrete debris when he removed a piece of plywood that had been secured to cover a floor hole. Upon removal, the employee stepped and walked through the hole, falling 17 feet to the lower level.
Employee used a derrick with a tong to unload a utility pole out of a storage area on the ground. The pole rolled onto the employee's leg as he tried to reorient the tong. The left fibula was broken.
Around 10 am yesterday morning, an employee fell from an aerial lift while working on a pellet unit.
Employee received an embedded tack in her thigh when walking by a pintacker. Employee had the micro pin tack surgically removed from her thigh and was admitted to the hospital overnight.
Employee working on a ladder was knocked off and landed in a pile of construction debris. Employee sustaineda broken collarbone, eye socket, and skull.
An employee fell from an elevated structure.

At the facility shop area, an employee tripped over his feet and fell on an industrial sized valve stem used in hydrofracking (a piece of sharp equipment) and lacerated his abdomen.  This injury required hospitalization for two days.
An employee was working on the second floor of the inside section loading material. He fell out of a window opening onto the pavement and fractured his wrist.

Employee was working from the derrick monkey board latching and unlatching tubing. As he was unlatching the elevator that has horns and a locking mechanism, the employee's harness got caught on the horns. The horns pulled the harness and pulled him down causing small fractures in his knees that required surgery.
The employee amputated her right pinky finger when a trash room door shut on her finger.

Employee was exposed to fall hazards when he fell 6 feet from a ladder to the ground level. Employee was not wearing proper 
PPE when working at the frac tank located to the rear of the winch truck at the yard.
Employee working from a ladder on live electrical circuitry received an electrical shock during testing and service installation. The employee fell from the ladder.
Employee slipped and fell, fracturing her left hip. The facility had contractors replace the ceramic floor tile, and the employee slipped and fell on a walking and working surface.
On or about January 8, 2015, an employee fell and broke her leg in two places when she slipped on ice in the parking lot.  This resulted in an overnight stay in the hospital.
An employee was driving a Toro cart, lost control, and hit a tree.  The employee was unconscious and was air-transported to Atlanta Medical Center where he was admitted in critical condition.

On January 8, 2015, an employee's hand was injured when a gate came down on his hand while pushing birds out of their nests to gather eggs. The employee was admitted to the hospital on January 9, 2015.
Employee installing form work on a concrete wall was struck by a forklift.
The injured employee was hit by a forklift below the knees. He sustained a broken left leg.

On or about January 8, 2014, at 10:40 p.m., an employee was hospitalized for burns after cleaning the juice processing tank. He was burned on his forehead, abdomen, hands, thighs, and ankles when hot steam blew out of the tank, struck him, and forced him off the 8-foot ladder that he was using to perform his daily task.
An employee was injured on a reach truck.

On January 8, 2015, at around 11:45 am, an employee working at 22nd Terrace and 3rd Avenue SW, Miami, Florida, was performing tree-cutting operations on a bucket. While cutting tree limbs, he cut his hand with a  chainsaw. The employee was admitted to the hospital to determine if ligament damage had occurred.
Employee fell approximately 10 feet while climbing down an extension ladder located inside a 6000-gallon tank.

On January 8, 2015, at approximately 8:40 PM, an employee's leg was caught between a tugger and rolling stock another employee was moving.  The employee was taken to the hospital where he was admitted due to a possible fracture and swelling.
Maintenance employee was adjusting the level of shipping roll-up door #34 when his right middle finger became caught in the chain and sprocket.
Employee's finger got caught in the jaws of the bagging machine located in Line 3 of the plant. This resulted in the partial amputation of the tip of the left index finger.

Employee was moving a big blower blade by pulling on the fan belt. The machine was off and had proper lockout/tag out. He was there to diagnose a vibration problem on the HVAC. When pulling, his hand got trapped between the pulley and the belt. He dropped his hand and severed the ring, middle, and pinky fingers on his right hand. Each finger was amputated above the joint and was approximately less than 1 inch.

On January 8, 2015 at 10:15pm, an employee was cleaning/unclogging an automatic in-line cement powder sampler.  He used his finger to verify there was no longer a clog and the sampler actuated amputating the tip of the third finger on the employee's left hand.
Employee severed finger when an industrial metal door closed on his pinky finger.

An employee was setting a string of four railcars in the yard with his groundsman. The groundsman secured the ground hand brake on the first railcar and unhooked the string from the railcar.  The employee noticed a railcar starting to move as the manual ground brake on the first railcar failed.  He attempted to set the brake on the second car when the railcar wheel smashed his steel toe boot to the ground, fracturing his right foot and removing a toenail.

An employee fell from an 8 foot high staging (pedestrian screen). 

Employee injured his tail bone and was hospitalized.
Employee cut hand on vacuum and was hospitalized.
An employee amputated a finger tip while using a band saw.
A JP Hogan employee had three fingers amputated on 1/9/2015 while working with a Husqvarna walk-behind concrete saw.

Employee experienced a crushing injury to her left hand, leading to an in-patient hospitalization at Froedtert Hospital at the Medical College of Wisconsin. She reached around an interlock guard on the pin roller machine.
An employee fell on uneven concrete walking from the ER and broke her left wrist.
Worker was installing ductwork from a 6-foot ladder, lost his balance, and fell 15-feet through the elevator shaft. He broke both arms and his nose.

A propane-powered space heater was used inside the cab of an elevated crane during workplace operations. The space heater leaked, resulting in an explosion and fire. The employee who was trapped inside the cab sustained burns to the face and hands.

On or about January 9, 2015, an employee incurred a puncture wound to his left hand when he was enlarging a hole in a can with a "tapper" hand tool.  The tapper, which he held in his right hand, went through the can into his left hand. The injury resulted in an infection, requiring hospitalization.

On January 9, 2015, an employee in the bulk pasta area had the tip of his finger amputated while helping another employee replace the 200- to 250-pound mixer screw. His finger got caught between the mixer and mixer screw.
On or about January 9, 2015 an employee went to warm up their vehicle and while returning into the facility, slipped on ice.

On 1/9/15 at 5:45 a.m., a temporary employee of Labor Finders was operating the out feed of the gang saw and reached over to grab a board with the left arm. The employee's clothing became entangled in the rotating shaft. The employee lost the left arm and was hospitalized at Macon Medical.
Employee pinched the skin on her finger with a door knob.

On or about January 9, 2015, an employee slipped on ice on the rig floor. He put his right hand out to break his fall. His right index finger was caught between the stump and the Kelly ripping skin off the fingertip. 
The employee was treated an his hand was wrapped in gauze and he returned to work. On or about January 19, 2015, he had surgery and the finger was amputated at the first joint.
An employee's left hand was crushed on January 8, 2015, while using a punch press to assemble parts. The left pinky was amputated the following day on January 9, 2015.
A worker fell while exiting a van used to transport him to his designated work site.  He suffered a fractured right femur and will undergo surgery in the hospital overnight.
Employee incurred a partial amputation of index finger on left hand while operating a splitting saw.
Employee in the back of a trailer amputated his thumb while catching a falling pallet truck by the wheel well opening.
An employee was exposed to falls in excess of four feet while working from a ladder to install a communications cable. The ladder slipped, resulting in the employee suffering a fractured tibia.

On or about January 9, 2014 at about 0535 hrs an employee of Propetrol Services Inc. was repairing a pump at the Mabee 139-202 HA well site 10 miles north of Midland Texas. When he reached into the pump to repair a faulty plunger, the unit "kicked" and amputated the tip of his right middle finger. He was driven to Medical Center Hospital in Odessa Texas where the prognosis was that the flesh portion not the bone will be amputated.
An employee sustained severe injuries and was hospitalized after he fell approximately 15 feet from the top of the AOD vessel.

On or about October 8, 2015, at 1135 hours, a worker for Hilmar Cheese Company was unhooking a hose from a truck that he thought had finished unloading heavy cream. The truck was still loading and the hose was under pressure. When the worker unhooked the hose, the valve slammed shut on his finger. The worker was taken to Dalhart Memorial Hospital and later to BSA Hospital in Amarillo, where the distal phalanges of his right index finger were removed due to the extent of his injury.
Employee was moving pieces of wood into the hospital and incurred a splinter to his hand.  He removed the splinter and a cellulitis infection occurred, requiring hospitalization for treatment.

On January 9, 2015, an employee was walking down the steps at the customer's private residence when he slipped and fell, landing on the sidewalk.  The employee suffered a broken back and five broken ribs. He was hospitalized as result of the accident of January 9, 2015.
Employee was hospitalized due to injuries sustained from rolling over a landfill dozer.

A worker was providing instructions to two skid steer operators regarding the removal of frozen cattle feces from two cattle lanes. The skid steer operators where side by side, preparing to start the removal process when skid steer operator A honked his horn to get the attention of operator B.  At this time, the worker was walking away from the operators and returning to his truck.  The worker thought the horn was to gain his attention so he turned and walked up to skid steer operator A.  Skid steer operator A did not realize the worker had approached his skid steer and the skid steer began moving in the forward direction.  The worker's left leg was struck and run over by the rear wheel of skid steer A resulting in a fracture to the tibia and fibula.  The injury required surgery and in-patient hospitalization.

Employees were installing wood trusses on the interior 4th floor level of a newly constructed multi-family dwelling when one employee fell approximately 9 feet to lower level. The injured employee's head struck a nail gun that he was operating when he hit the floor. The injury occurred on January 9, 2015, at approximately 1 p.m.
An employee suffered an amputation while working in the facility.

On 1/9/15 at 3:45 p.m., an employee was laying cable on a flat roof and stepped through a skylight. The employee fell 20 feet, fracturing the right ankle. Employee was hospitalized overnight after surgery.

Employee 1 slipped on icy stairs and broke L-2, L-3 in her back on 1/10/15 and was hospitalized for the injury. Employee 2 fell while snow-blowing property and broke his hip on 2/5/15; he was hospitalized. Both incidents occurred at 101 Plantation St., Worcester (Company Campus).

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer. These events are captured as one report.

Employee was exposed to hot sparks from furnace number 1 in the melt shop, which resulted in his clothing catching on fire. The resulting fire caused second degree burns to the exposed employee and he was hospitalized due to burns.
An employee crushed his finger between a 55 gallon drum and a flat bed trailer. The tip of his left index finger was later amputated at the hospital.

On 1/10/15, at approximately 5:15 a.m., an employee was cleaning in the Planer Mill.  He was struck by the hood while cleaning with compressed air. The employee suffered two fractured ribs and a fractured vertebrae.
An employee slipped on ice formed on steps of a residential home when delivering mail, which resulted in a broken arm that required hospitalization.
An employee was cutting pipe with a torch. The employee was struck on the foot by falling pipe when the pipe was cut through and the brace supporting it fell.

On Saturday, 01/10/2015, at approximately 2:15 p.m., an employee was changing out a large piston when a failure occurred, crushing/smashing three of the employee's fingers on his left hand. The employee was hospitalized and underwent surgery on 01/11/2015.
Employee was pulling shavings on a winder at the trim chute and contacted the trim slitter suffering an angled cut to the nail bed and tip of the right index finger.
Employee slipped on ice.
The employee was exiting a patient's private residence and slipped and fell on the wet wheelchair ramp.  The employee broke her left leg.  The incident occurred on 1/10/15.

On January 9, 2015, an employee operating the dough rolling machine got his index and second finger caught between two rollers (dough breakers), which smashed his fingers. The employee was hospitalized overnight and required surgery.
Employee fell through a gate approximately 10 feet to the ground below. Employee suffered a head injury and 17 fractures.
An employee, who was assisted by two other employees, hurt her back while giving an aggressive resident a bath.

Employee in packout area was working with a crane. During a lift, the employee got caught in a chain. The crane's chain hook grabbed a loaded box, which fell on the employee, crushing and breaking the employee's left leg.
Employee delivering mail slipped on ice, falling on his right leg. He was taken to the hospital by ambulance and admitted for surgery, which required overnight admission.
Employee fell and broke her left hip while trying to reach for a broom to kill a spider.
A CNA developed an abscess.  The abscess was surgically removed and tested. The results of the test showed that it is MRSA.
A reporter slipped and broke two bones in her left ankle while reporting on hiking at the Palisades Interstate Park in Alpine NJ. She was hospitalized overnight.
Employee injured left leg while working with a chain saw. He was cutting a branch at the end of the day when  the saw sprung back.
A psychiatric patient hit an employee with a closed fist on the left-side forehead above the eye.
While loading a telephone cable, an employee's fingers were caught between reels. Employee was admitted to the hospital and surgery is scheduled to be conducted on 1/12/2015.
Employee slipped on ice and broke femur while working on well site in the vicinity of the Anderson 1-4-H location near Williston, North Dakota.
Employee was injured when he fell 20-40 feet from an elevated man-lift.
Employee was pulling a cart when the handle broke. Employee fell on her back and injured herself.

Using a metal lathe, a maintenance worker was polishing a shaft. The shaft kicked back and the maintenance worker was struck in the arm and hand by the shaft. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery to repair the fractured arm.
A temporary employee fell from the second story of a building under construction and was transported to the hospital with a back injury.

An employee was walking a cart in the parking lot toward the soccer field when the cart started to roll away from him.  The employee tripped and fell, hitting his head/neck on the curb in the parking lot.
Employee tripped, fell over a pallet, and broke femur. Employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was hospitalized after breaking his ankle.

On January 12, 2015, at 0745, a maintenance employee pulled a carriage saw out too far and the 350-pound saw fell to the floor, crushing his left fifth finger.  He was treated and released at Pomerene Hospital with an orthopedic surgical consult. Surgery was performed on January 14, 2015, however, the last joint of the left fifth finger could not be salvaged and was amputated.
Employee's right index finger was partially amputated when it was caught between a ball and seat on a small lathe at the facility.
An employee was injured after tripping over a stationary pallet, requiring medical assistance at the scene and transport to Hackensack Medical Center for further treatment.

Employee's finger got caught in a machine's drive belt resulting in an inpatient hospitalization and surgery. 

Temployee may lose the finger.
An employee suffered a fractured hip when he slipped and fell on a patch of black ice in the parking lot. He was taken to the hospital and underwent surgery for the hip fracture.
Worker operating a Formax machine sustained a finger amputation while attempting to clean out an overflow pan under the machine.

A worker fell approximately 9 feet from a scaffold platform to the ground below sustaining a compound fracture to the jaw and a punctured liver. The scaffold plank bridged over the apartment breezeway and was supported by two walls that were approximately 6 feet apart. The platform was used in setting the rafter trusses.
Employee fell off of a ladder that was placed on an uneven surface. The employee sustained a broken knee cap.

An employee was operating a lull (large fork lift) to move steel when he went off the road and drove over soft coal. The right side wheels left the ground and the truck tipped over, resulting in broken ribs and hospitalization.
Employee was walking through the department and fell.  Employee suffered fractures to the arm and knee and was admitted to the hospital.
Employee slipped and fell on ice breaking a leg.

An employee working at the crate loader was struck by a forklift that was backing up. The employee sustained serious injuries and was hospitalized at the Washington Regional Medical Center in Fayetteville, Arkansas, for treatment of a fractured pelvis.
Employee was changing drill bits on a pocket boring machine. He set his hand down on the machine to look under it and his hand engaged with the drill bit.
Employee was unloading a trailer and slipped on ice in the parking lot and hit his head.
Employee fell from a step ladder while assembling furniture.
Employee received burns on hands.
An employee was walking out of the store when she missed a step, tripped, and hit the Z rack that is placed against the wall.
An employee slipped on ice in the shopping center's shared parking lot while walking to lunch.  The employee was hospitalized due to a broken kneecap that resulted in surgery.
An employee slipped and fell on the ice resulting in a broken ankle.

Employee was testing a meter with an 8-ft shotgun stick in an energized zone and encountered an arc flash. This incident occurred at approximately 8:00 AM on January 12, 2015. The employee was hospitalized with 2nd and 3rd degree burns. The employee was authorized to be in the energized zone and was wearing flame retardant clothing, a hard hat, safety glasses and a high-visibility vest.

Employee was sent to Industrial Piping  Steel Co. in Corpus Christi, Texas, as a temporary worker. He was operating a machine to cut metal and had a finger amputated. He was then taken to the hospital.

On or about January 12, 2015, an employee was injured while loosening the bolts of a rod and collar assembly on a manual assist arm. A component fell and struck his hand, amputating the tip of his left little finger.
An employee delivering sodium hypochlorite attached the hose to a tank containing sulfuric acid, causing a reaction.  The employee was admitted to the hospital with respiratory distress.

The employee was tightening a belt on the wood chipper. After the repair, the employee turned the machine off. While the machine was coasting to a stop the employee got his left hand caught between the belt and pulley of the wood chipper, resulting in the amputation of two fingers.
Employee suffered an amputation injury while working on a garbage truck.

The employee was attempting to rig a steel beam with a chain sling and overhead crane. While attempting to rig this elevated beam, it fell towards the employee. The employee tried to brace/stop the beam with his hand and the fore of the beam pushed him back, striking his face and chest as well, knocking him into another steel beam.  The employee was admitted to the hospital with a broken wrist. Surgery was performed to correct the injury to the employee's wrist. 

The injury occurred in the Welding/Fabrication shop.
Worker was caught between the dock bumper and a truck, resulting in crushing injuries to the worker.  The worker was hospitalized.
Employee was breaking a bolt with a crescent wrench and it slipped.  The employee fell back and rolled onto the leg fracturing the ankle.
On January 12, 2015, an employee caught his right thumb between a powered roller and conveyor belt, which resulted in an amputation of the nail portion of the thumb.
Employee partially amputated index finger with sledge hammer.
Employee was walking and slipped and the employee's arm caught fire. Employee was hospitalized for burn injuries.
Employee fell from scaffolding at a height of approximately 15 to 20 feet.
Employee lacerated his left hand with a high-pressure water gun after losing his balance while cleaning the rubber membrane off of the inside of a tank.

Employee retrieving parts from a shelf was struck in the head by a part weighing approximately 40 to 50 pounds when the bottom of the box it was stored in gave way. Employee sustained a compression fracture of the vertebrae.
Employee sustained a puncture wound to his hand from an air nail gun while setting trusses in the vicinity of 8000 East Highway 42 in Sioux Falls, South Dakota.
An employee was hit by a forklift at the loading dock.
Employee was removing a flow line from preventer to mud tank.  The flow line pinched the employee's finger between the flange and the BOP causing the amputation.
An employee slipped on a step and fell forward injuring both knees.
An employee slipped on ice and fractured his ankle.  He had corrective surgery, requiring hospitalization.

The injured employee was installing a back flow preventer in the vertical. The employee was using a chain fall and attempting to place a gasket between the piping. The chain fall "jumped" and the pipe landed on his left thumb, which was resting on the pipe's flange. The tip of this left thumb was amputated at the nail bed and could not be reattached. 

The incident occurred in the Ag Building fire pump room.

The employee was sitting on the forklift and trying to close the container door from the forklift.  The wind was blowing and blew the container door closed.  The tip of the employee's finger was caught between the container doors.

Employee was moving pallets by hand, wearing heavy cloth gloves. A piece of wood penetrated his glove and cut his left thumb.  The incident was not reported at the time of the incident.  On January 20, 2015, the employee called his supervisor and reported that his thumb was infected and he had been admitted to the hospital.
The employee fell as she was coming out of the restroom of the building's lobby.  The employee fell to the ground and broke her hip.

On or about January 13, 2015, at about 8:05 p.m., a temporary worker was hospitalized for a compound fracture. His arm got caught in and crushed by the rubber bucket mill rollers after his sleeve became caught in the machinery. He has had surgery for the injuries sustained.  He was employed by Aerotek, Inc. and placed at the Trelleborg Wheel Systems dba Maine Industrial Tire LLC Red Lion worksite.
Employee was struck by an avalanche of waxed corrugated paper resulting in an in-patient hospitalization and compound fracture to employee's left arm.

On January 13, 2015, an employee was working at a residential site and fell 5 feet from a ladder onto the ground.  The employee was hospitalized overnight and had surgery on the arm on January 14, 2015.
On January 13, 2015, the employees were in the process of changing a heater treater tube. The leaking fluid ignited causing severe burn injuries. One employee was sent to the Minnesota burn unit.
An employee slipped and fell on the ice. The employee is hospitalized and awaiting surgery for a broken ankle.
An employee was burned while cleaning a cooking griddle.
An employee oiling a chain on a manure spreader had his glove caught in a pinch point. The employee suffered an amputation to the right index and middle fingers at the middle knuckle.

A truck loader was being used to load a dump truck with concrete. A piece of rebar was sticking out of the side of the truck. The driver and injured employee tried to manually put the rebar up on the truck. The employee saw some rebar on the ground and went to kick it out of the way of the driver so he wouldn't run over it. The rebar sticking out of the truck became dislodged and hit the employee in the left eye.

Employee was performing maintenance on the Draw Tape Conversion #14 machine and removed the side panel to grease the sprocket and chain without locking out the machine, which was still running.  As he attempted to wipe down the sprocket with a rag, it got caught in the sprocket and pulled his left hand in, causing three fingers to be amputated: two fingers down to the nail, and one below the first knuckle.
An employee fell to the floor while moving a pallet jack during material handling activities. Employee suffered a broken pelvis.
An employee lifted the guard on a table saw. His right hand came into contact with the moving saw blade amputating four fingers.

An employee was injured and admitted to the hospital due to being struck by equipment during the movement of pipe while working on a work-over rig in Northeast Colorado. The accident occurred on November 13, 2015 at approximately 1:20 pm.
An employee fell 12 feet from an aerial lift while laying ornamental sheet metal. The employee sustained a broken vertebrae.

On January 13, 2015, at approximately 3:00 PM, Employee #1 was using a vacuum hose inside a tank when the vacuum caught his hand and pulled his arm in.  The vacuum was caught on Employee #1's arm for approximately 15 seconds before he alerted Employee #2, the attendant operating the equipment, who turned the vacuum off.  Approximately one hour later, Employee #1's arm began to swell.  He was taken to the hospital, and the swelling continued.  Incisions were made into the arm to relieve pressure, and the employee was admitted overnight.

On or about 13 Jan 2015 at approximately 14:30hrs an employee fell approximately ten feet from a platform above a ceiling to the ground below suffering a fracture to his L1, cracked ribs, and broken teeth.
Employee was sprayed with hot water from the condensate return line while steaming a railcar.  Employee incurred 2nd degree burns to the right thigh and knee.

Employee was loading cargo in a chassis. While he was exiting the container, the chassis rolled away from the warehouse dock.  The forklift forks fell to the ground between the dock and the chassis and pinned him underneath.  The employee was pinned between the forks and the ground.  He was freed by the paramedics and transferred to Methodist Hospital downtown upon his request.

An employee was working at Extruder #2 (piece of equipment used to melt plastic).  As equipment was started up, a piece of equipment blew off the machine and hit the employee in the leg.  The leg was severely gashed. EMS was called and the employee was transported to UMass Medical Center in Worcester, MA.

On or about January 13, 2015, a maintenance employee of Cintas received a chemical spray of sodium hydroxide to the eyes and face requiring hospitalization.  The incident occurred during offloading of the sodium hydroxide from a contracted delivery service's truck (Hydrite).
Employee suffered an amputation on his left index finger while cutting conduit on a portable band saw.
An employee was making a connection with a drill fork when the speeding wrench struck the left hand smashing the middle finger on that hand.
An employee amputated the tip of his right index finger while operating a Kaster Vertical Saw in the saw department in the morning on 1/13/15.
An employee was struck in the shin by the fitting of a water hose when it whipped around after being blown with air from a compressor.

On 1/14/2015 at approximately 11:23a.m. an employee was using a blow down system on a National 340 pump to blow out water in the hard line. Once the 4 inch suction hose was drained, the suction hose was disconnected and a cam lock was placed on the suction hose coming from the pump. The four inch butterfly valve for the suction was left open allowing air to pressure up against the cam lock cap. The employee used this system to build air and blow down the fluid in the tubing line to the tank. The employee was standing in front of the manifold and slightly to the right approximately one foot away. When the employee opened up the manifold, the cam lock cap popped free hitting him in the shin.
Employee amputated finger on a buffing wheel.
An employee's foot was struck by an excavating machine.  The employee was admitted to the hospital and stayed overnight for surgery.
An employee cleaning up roofing material fell 7 feet off the edge of a roof.

An employee was operating a reach forklift when he struck a pallet that forced him against a compartment of the forklift when it came to an abrupt stop.  The employee sustained injuries to the hip area that required an admission to the hospital.

An employee was unjamming a stuck granulated salt spreader used on the back of a truck to salt roads.  The employee reached into the impeller and chain components while the machine was running and something grabbed his right hand and amputated his right index finger past the nail bed, but before the first joint.

The employee went to step up on a platform that leads away from and around the work area.  The employee tripped on the platform step (9 inches off of the floor) and landed on his right knee, breaking his femur.
An employee tripped on a shelving unit and broke her pelvis.
An employee was pinched between an aerial lift and walkway. While attempting to come down, the lift acted abnormally. It instead went up and pinched the employee between the lift and walkway.
An employee in PIV training was operating a stand-up forklift. He backed into a metal rack, causing himself to be pinned between the PIV and the metal rack.
An employee amputated a fingertip while working on equipment in the workplace.

An employee lost control of an electric pallet jack when unloading products from a trailer.  The pallet jack hit the dock plate and the handle struck the employee in the stomach, pinning him against the wall of the trailer.
On 1/14/15, an employee on his mail route accidentally swallowed a pen cap. The pen cap traveled to the employee's lung. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee sustained injuries to his ring and index finger while cutting a piece of wood on a table saw.  At the time of the injury on 1/14/15 it was believed that the employee had sustained lacerations to the fingers.  It was later found out on 2/4/15 that the injury to the index finger  resulted in an amputation while the employee was under medical treatment.
An employee was trying to pull down a guard on a miter saw when he had his left thumb amputated.

Worker operating a small press brake was struck in the neck by the piece that was being bent. The worker passed out, fell over a stool/chair, and struck his head on the concrete floor. He was transported to the local hospital in Parsons where he was treated, and then transported to Via Christi in Wichita where he remains hospitalized.
Employee suffered a critical head injury when he fell off an extension ladder while welding at a steel building construction site.
Employee was connecting the jiff to a trailer. Employee smashed his thumb between the jiff and the trailer connector.

At approximately 4:30 PM on January 14, 2015, an employee was lighting a gas grill to prepare lunch for employees during a work gathering.  The grill flashed, resulting in minor burns to the employee's arm and face.  The employee went to an urgent care facility, and then a hospital, where he was admitted at approximately 9:30 PM, and kept overnight.

A piece of wood was jammed in the splitter. The employee tried to unjam it by crawling up onto the machine before the saw had stopped. Somehow his thigh came into contact with the saw. The saw was idling down after being turned off.
An employee fell 16 feet from a conical cover on a tank.

An employee, in the process of dismantling a scaffold, climbed the scaffold ladder to approximately 25 feet and stepped off onto a pipe header.  Once on the pipe header, the employee slipped off and fell 25 feet to the ground below where he suffered a right arm compound fracture, a right elbow dislocation, and a fractured pelvis.  A yo-yo tie off was available that the employee was not using. The incident occurred at the 100 rack at the enterprise construction site.

On January 14, 2015, an employee was pinned between a 4,000 lb motor and the wall of an elevator, when the motor and cart slid from the forks of the truck. The employee suffered a fracture to the right femur.
Employee slipped while sweeping and injured back and right leg.
An employee was injured when he fell on ice and broke his leg.
Employee backed up against a Salamander (heating unit) to get warm and caught the back of his right pant leg on fire. Employee suffered burns to the back of his upper right leg.
The employee was walking on the property when he tripped over a concrete parking stop and injured his right knee.
An employee was engaging in pipe fitting using a portable grinder and received an amputation to his finger padding.

Employee was working on the high-speed packing line when a belt came off of the pulley. He suffered an amputation of the tip of his left index finger while trying to re-mount the conveyor belt while it was in motion.

An employee was hospitalized after sustaining an injury to his right ring finger in the coil bay.  The employee caught his right ring finger between a C-hook and a coil while operating an overhead crane remotely.
An employee was delivering a package to a residence.  When the employee walked up the driveway, she encountered a slick spot due to ice.  The employee fell and broke her left leg in two places.

The employee was checking the ink level on a print department machine without shutting it down.  As the employee reached in to check the ink tray, the employee's shirt was pulled into a roller or shaft.  The employee's left arm and shoulder were subsequently pulled into the machine.  The employee was able to pull the arm free, but suffered lacerations to the left arm and injured the shoulder.  The employee was transported to Freemont Medical Center and then transferred to a hospital in Omaha.
Employee was burned while unloading asphalt from a transportation vessel. The employee was in the process of cleaning the transfer lines from the vessel when he was burned on his face and arms.
On or about January 20, 2015, an employee was injured when a large metal plate fell on the right foot.  Toes on the foot were subsequently amputated as a result of the injuries.

Frac technicians conducting monitoring operations on water levels of gauging tanks during oil and gas drilling operations are potentially overexposed to air contaminants and respiratory irritants such as chlorine, hydrogen sulfide, and benzene.  Recently, an employee was admitted to the hospital for observation and treatment after suffering from an extreme coughing episode after working a monitoring shift at the worksite.  A second employee was treated and released.
Employee suffered an amputation of his right index finger while putting a bird's leg back into a shackle in the picking room. Employee's finger got caught in the moving shackle.
Employee removed machine guards to check the bearings. The machine engaged and his finger was pinched between the ball gear and bearings. The finger was amputated below the finger nail first knuckle.

While walking into the dining manager's office from the stove area, an employee slipped on the threshold of the office door and landed on his left elbow and onto his back. Preliminary diagnosis was concussion without loss of consciousness, acute headache, cervical sprain, thoracic spine sprain, and lumbar spine sprain.
An employee fell from the platform of a 3-step ladder when taking products down from the shelf.
Employee was rebilling pipe. While placing a spacer board between the pipe and pipe pusher, his finger got caught between the two, skinning the tip of his finger.

On January 15, 2015, at approximately 2:45 a.m., Employee #1 experienced a laceration to the right little finger while operating equipment used to remove the breast and tenders from the bird. The employee was taken to the hospital, where it was determined that a surgical amputation was necessary.

Following flashlight failure during a pre-op inspection, employee was pointing to sanitation and contacted the belt with the right index finger, avulsing the fingertip and fracturing the bone. Employee was transported to the hospital where the fingertip and bone were amputated.

An employee's finger tip on the right hand was deeply cut when his finger slipped under the conveyer belt while adjusting the tension chain.  

At the McAllen Medical Hospital the doctor amputated the fingertip.

An employee was presetting a roller channel machine.  While presetting the chuck, a jam occurred.  The employee tried to clear the jam.  The pusher activated and pinched the tip of the employee's right index finger.  The employee went to the emergency room, which documented the injury as an amputation.

An employee stuck his leg out of a golf cart while operating it and when he lost control of the buggy due to contact with water or slush on the shop floor his leg struck a pole causing a fracture that required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was walking on a catwalk when he tripped on an object that protruded from the floor of the walkway and broke his left femur.
Employee fell from the roof while descending a ladder and was hospitalized.
On January 15, 2015, the employee was caught between equipment and suffered serious injuries while operating a saw machine located at 2130 Third Avenue NW in West Fargo, North Dakota.
Maintenance employee suffered a hip injury from a fall to a lower level when he fell off a ladder.
Employee fell off of a flatbed tractor trailer bed while strapping down a palletized load.  Employee suffered a leg injury and was taken to a local hospital and admitted.

Employee was making a delivery and parked the tractor trailer behind Walgreens at 9th & Shipley.  The tractor trailer caught a low hanging wire from overhead poles on the front driver's side corner of the trailer.  The driver attempted to remove the wire from the trailer catwalk and then attempted to remove the corner cap from the trailer.  The cap came loose suddenly, hit the associate in the face, and he fell flat on the roof of the trailer.  He sustained facial and eye injuries, along with spinal injuries, and was admitted to the hospital for treatment.
While cutting a board at a 45-degree angle, the cut piece jammed and flew back at the employee, hitting the employee's fingers.

Employee was bleeding the pressure off a weighted ball used to check stormwater pipes for leaks. The weight of the water inside the PVC pipe caused the ball to slide down the pipe. Employee grabbed the rope strap with his right hand and the strap's force and sharp edge severed his right-thumb tip. 

The finger tip was recovered and delivered to Parkland Hospital, but didn't have enough bone to be reattached.

An employee using a 10-foot A-frame ladder was knocked over when another employee opened a manual overhead door they were working on. The employee fell off the ladder and sustained multiple bone fractures on both forearms and wrists.
Employee burned by flash fire at pumping station while adjusting compressor.

On 1/15/2015, employee injured two fingers on his right hand after catching it under a bundle of rebar while operating a side-loader in the yard. Part of the bone of his right ring finger was surgically removed on 1/20/15.

Employee was walking from the parking lot to the front entrance of the facility via the sidewalk near the building. About 15 yards from the door, there was a patch of ice on the sidewalk due to drainage (melting/refreezing) from the building. The employee slipped on this ice and fell.  The employee suffered a left hip injury.
Employee received 2nd and 3rd degree burns from hot liquid plastic while removing a plug.
On or about January 15, 2015 an employee was injured while working on a CNC lathe which resulted in the employee being hospitalized for over five days from the injuries sustained from the accident.

Employee was assisting a person who was under the influence into the hospital when the person/patient fell onto the employee, knocking him down and causing him to sustain a fracture to the right ankle.  Employee was hospitalized.

The employee was operating a Whirlwind pop up saw, cutting 2X2 lumber into 36-inch lengths.  The employee accidentally activated the foot pedal that controls the saw.  When the pedal was depressed, the "guard" and 8-inch saw blade came up, amputating the employee's right index, middle, and ring fingers. The employee was brought to the hospital where two of the three fingers were re-attached.  

The incident occurred in the pop-up saw area.

On 1-15-15 at 11:30AM an employee walking down stairway 2 from the third to the second floor fell. The worker has a fractured thoracic spine, a fractured middle finger, a bump on the head, and is having tests on her hip and thigh.

An employee was installing a light fixture. He was shocked and fell from the 8-foot, A-frame ladder he was using, with his feet about 4 feet off the ground. When he was shocked, the ladder and he fell in opposite directions. He has some tingling in his right arm and restrictions for both arms until further evaluation.

Employee was part of a two-man team moving furniture from a customer's location. Employees were moving a large sleep sofa to the ground level when the sofa came into contact with a metal stair rail. The injured employee's finger was between the two objects at one point, and when they came together, they severed the employee's finger below the first joint.
On or about January 16, 2015, at approximately 2:30 p.m., an employee had an allergic reaction to latex resulting in hospitalization.
An employee working in Department 429 suffered a skull fracture while loading an 88-pound disc on the west side of a 55-ton mechanical press.
An employee suffered serious injuries after being caught in a machine that was in motion. Surgery was required.
