Employee received an electric shock when he placed his wrench near an energized bolt on a conductor he was removing.
Employee was lowering a boom lift while installing fire protection piping. The hydraulics failed, causing the employee to break the lower left leg.
Employee sustained a fall from a material platform (catwalk) after fixing a jam on the material line.
An employee was run over by a forklift and suffered an amputation of his lower left leg.
Employee was tightening a strap used to tie down equipment on his truck when the pry bar came out of the hole and hit him in the mouth, fracturing the maxilla bone.
An employee was hospitalized after a pump seal failed during the repair of a pump. Pennzoil 50H and X850 oil blew into the employee's eyes, throat, and nose, resulting in inflammation and irritation.
A Disney worker was going down the stairs at the end of her shift.  She fell down 6 or 7 steps and fractured her left arm, which required surgery.

An employee was using a handheld torch to cut a hole into steel pipe when the torch hose blew. The employee suffered burns on his hand and was admitted to Lady of Lords Burn Center overnight for treatment.
Forklift Incident.
Employee was struck by a PVC pipe while installing an underground television cable.

An employee was working from a 12-foot step ladder that was folded and placed on top of an air handler. The top of the ladder was leaning against a wall. As the employee stood on the ladder finishing a wall inside a mechanical room, the ladder slid away from the wall and the employee fell to the ground. The employee suffered a left broken leg above the ankle and a broken right little finger.  The employee was admitted to University Medical Center in Jackson, Mississippi.

Worker was in a trench and was injured when an operator moved the trench box. The spreader bar on the trench box struck the worker in the back, cracking his vertebra. The worker was hospitalized one night.

Employee was on top of a hot oil tanker trailer attempting to remove the lid to fill the tanker. The lid was stuck due to sitting for a couple of weeks because of inclement weather.  The fall protection cage provided at the fill location did not fit the tanker trailer properly, leaving a gap large enough for the employee to fall beneath the cage. When the lid came loose, the employee fell from the top of the tanker trailer, under the fall protection cage, to the ground. The employee dislocated a shoulder, broke two to three ribs, and received contusions.
An employee damaged tendons in two fingers and was admitted to the hospital.
Employee fell from ladder when coming down the roof and broke his hands and neck.
Two employees were installing a murphy bed when the lifting mechanism snapped.  One employee suffered a severe laceration to a thumb and was hospitalized for two days to reattach the finger.
Employee was performing a garage audit. The garage door wasn't closing properly due to a chain malfunction. Employee's finger was caught in the door bin.

Employee amputated the fourth finger on his left hand when it was caught between a rotating belt and pulley. He was attempting to tighten a bolt on the motor of a cooling unit. The rotating belt and pulley was located in the center of the roof of the cooling unit.
Two employees were burned when a bubble tower exploded creating a flash fire during maintenance work on a well site.
Employee was using a Stihl chainsaw to flush cut a tree stump when it kicked back and cut his leg, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
The worker was taking photos of the project from the roof, when he stepped back and fell through a sky light. He fell 22 feet to the concrete floor below.
An employee fell approximately 26 feet while working on a scissor lift.

An employee was assisting the truck driver to clear small amounts of cement left in the vehicle when the rear  chute came down on the employee's left middle finger amputating the tip.  The employee was taken to hospital and the fingertip was reattached.
Employee was moving a wall while using a crane. One end of the wall fell and broke the employee's arm.  Surgery was performed, and the employee was hospitalized post-surgery.
The rope broke while a new cross arm was being installed on an electrical power pole. An employee walking under the rope was struck by the falling arm.

At approximately 9:00 p.m. on 1/16/15, an employee leaving work outside the building stepped down from the curb and broke her leg in two places. The employee was taken to the hospital where she had emergency surgery. The employee was released two days later on 1/18/15.
Employee dislocated a knee during a weapons training exercise.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after being injured as the result of a fall.
On or about January 17, 2015 an employee suffered an amputation injury while unjamming a part stuck in a CNC machine.
On or about 1/17/2015, an employee was struck by a forklift, resulting in fractures to both legs. The employee was subsequently hospitalized for these injuries.
Employee was struck by a moving vehicle while assisting a customer in the Publix Supermarket.

On January 17, 2015, an employee was exposed to a sharp hazard when a meat thermometer was caught in mid-air and went into the employee's hand.  Employee had to have inpatient ligament  surgery on January 19, 2015, due to the injury.
An employee fell off the tailgate of a box truck while closing the back door. The employee injured his back and ribs and was hospitalized.

At approximately 8:05 p.m., an employee suffered a possible amputation. The employee was sweeping mail at bin #1 and her finger was caught in the belt. The finger was then dragged between the belt and roller, resulting in a 2-cm avulsion to her middle finger on her right hand.
Employee fell from a ladder while descending. The employee broke arm/wrist.
An employee was involved in a forklift accident that resulted in hospitalization.

A mechanic suffered a thumb amputation while performing maintenance on the packing station conveyor line #7.  The employee removed the guard to see what was making a noise, lost his balance, and fell into a chain and sprocket.
Employee fell in parking lot on the way to her car after working her shift.  She fell on ice and hit her head, resulting in transport and admission to the hospital.

Employee was taking out a 10-inch hose to get water ready for the frac operation when he was struck by the hose on his ankle.  The employee flipped and fell on his head.  He bled from the left ear and suffered a closed fracture behind his left ear and internal bleeding on the brain.

The employee had finished making a drop off at the Waste Management Landfill, when he observed his back gate was open. He got out of the truck, and went to the back of the vehicle to close the gate mechanism. The truck began to roll backwards, and the employee ran to get back into the vehicle. The employee fell, landing in the path of the vehicle. The vehicle ran over the employee, causing multiple fractures on his right side and a cut to his calf.
Employee was attacked and beaten by three to four assailants and was hospitalized.
Employee was walking in the parking lot, tripped over a parking block and fell.  The fall resulted in a laceration to the employees face which required hospitalization.
An employee was exposed to a fuel spill at gas pumps #1 and #2. Employee got sick and has been throwing up blood. The employee is hospitalized at Southwest General Hospital for treatment.

Employee was injured while performing a "cold cut" on a 6" metal pipe of a gathering system. Employee was burned on the face, both arms, and knees. Employee was using a striker from the welding equipment and possibly ignited natural gas.

At the Hat Creek Production Pad, an employee slipped when climbing down a fixed ladder of a heater treater. The employee fell from an approximate height of 6' onto the ground. The employee was hospitalized for a period of 2 days at Southwest General Hospital.

Employee was working on a load former unit.  Employee hit the cycle button to retract the stripper plate while placing his hand on the cover plate.  The stripper plate returned to the extended position and employees middle finger was caught by the machine, removing the tip of the finger and part of the finger nail.
Employee working at a cash register tripped over the scanner cord.
While moving dye, employee pinched the right ring finger between the clevis and hook. The employee was taken to the hospital where the tip of the finger was amputated.
An employee working in the dish room slipped and fell, breaking a wrist. The employee was hospitalized and surgery was performed.

Employee was offloading customer hoses at facility and attempted to remove the cap off of a hose. The hose still maintained some pressure, and when the employee removed the cap, Styrene splashed onto the employee's face and midsection. The employee was sent to the hospital and was admitted overnight.
Employee slipped on ice resulting in a broken nose and a back injury. Employee has been hospitalized since January 18, 2015.
Employee was walking through the parking lot on a designated walk area while leaving work. The injured employee slipped on black ice and injured her right leg.

Employee was working from a ladder with a tool, repairing a conveyor belt system. Weight shifted and the employee tried to regain balance by stepping to the second step. Employee lost footing and fell to the ground, fracturing his femur.
An employee was exposed to hot condensate while transiting through the basement of the bleach plant. The condensate burned his lower legs.

While manufacturing a shaft pin on a metal lathe, an employee in the Bldg. #304 Machine Shop was sanding the rotating pin with an emery cloth.  The cloth bound and pulled the employee into the rotating lathe machine, resulting in a left broken hand and lacerations on the right hand that required surgery and in-patient hospitalization.
An employee was shot in store during working hours.

The employee reached around with her right hand to clean the front of the meat slicer and did not realize the slicer was on.  The tip of the employee's right index finger just below the fingernail was amputated. There was no bone loss.
Employee was walking on the sidewalk when she fell and hit her head resulting in a concussion.
Employee was operating an injection molding machine. The employee was hospitalized due to burns on hand from injection mold.
On or about January 18, 2015 at noon, an employee was working on a baler rotary valve.  The employee slipped and fell approximately 48" hitting the mid-section.

The HVAC team was removing an air-conditioning system from a roof when an employee stumbled over and fell onto angle irons that were supporting the system. The employee was hospitalized and had two surgeries on his right thigh.
Catwalk collapsed while employee was on it.  Employee landed on feet and fractured both ankles. Employee was hospitalized.
On or about January 19, 2015, an employee received a partial finger amputation while using the shrink wrap machine.

An employee was polishing a main drive shaft on the South Bend lathe.  He was wearing gloves and an apron, and his glove got caught in the lathe. It started to wrap him up and pull him in, breaking his left arm.  He pulled himself free from the machine.

A sales consultant was at the home of a client. While putting her case into her car, she fell backwards over samples that she had placed on the ground.  She was hospitalized with a broken hip and elbow.
A home health aid slipped on ice on a driveway at a client's home which resulted in a ligament sprain in both knees and a patellar tracking disorder of the right knee requiring hospitalization.

An employee was sandblasting miscellaneous steel when he lost his balance and shot blasted his bicep and chest area.  He was transported to the hospital. The extent of his injuries are not known at this time.
Employee working in the stock room at floor level lost balance while trying to catch a tub that was falling from a table. Employee fell to the ground and fractured a hip.
An employee fell from a scissor lift loading platform.
The employee suffered a fracture to her foot when the edge of a steel plate dropped and landed on her foot.

On January 19, 2015, at approximately 9:50 PM, an employee slipped while stepping from the parking lot to the sidewalk.  The employee struck her knee, resulting in the need for surgery and hospitalization.

Employee's right pinky finger distal tip was amputated when pinched in an automobile door. The employee was helping to push start a customer's car related to a battery change when the customer closed the car door on the employee's hand.

Employee making a delivery struck a tree limb with his truck when entering the facility.  The tree limb fell and remained on top of the trailer.  The employee pulled the downed limb off the top of the truck and the limb landed on him breaking his leg.
Employee was using a shear when his right middle finger went beyond the point of operation.  Injury is an amputation to the right middle finger above the first digit.
On January 19, 2015, an employee received a partial amputation of his left index finger when it got caught between two tubes while he was manually assembling a grip.

Employees were using a backhoe to remove a section of railroad rail when the rail broke loose and swung, striking an employee in the leg.  The employee received fractures to the femur and ankle.  It was estimated that the rail was 18 feet long and the employee was 15 to 16 feet from the backhoe.
An employee was injured by falling more than 7 feet from the first level of a creel while moving a yarn dolly. The injury resulted in an overnight hospital stay.
On or about January 19, 2015, an employee was operating a walk-behind lift truck and pinched his finger between the barrel lifting attachment and a stationary part.

An employee was helping another employee line up two heating plates that weighed approximately 2,000 pounds. The second employee signaled the forklift operator to set the plate down. When the forklift operator lowered the plate too quickly, the injured employee could not get his left thumb out of the way, causing the tip of his thumb to be amputated between the plates.
An employee suffered a back injury when a hopper that was being lifted by a forklift fell on the employee.

An employee delivering fuel unhooked the metal cable across the driveway to enter the facility.  When he was going back to the truck, he got caught up in the cable, tripped, and fell.  He was hospitalized with a fractured hip.
An employee was on a ladder installing a new line.  When he cut the old line, which was tight, the line whipped back and knocked the employee off the ladder.
On 1/19/15, an employee was placing items in the freezer when the employee began to see spots in the left eye and then lost vision in that eye.  Employee was hospitalized overnight.
On 1/19/15, employee was burned on the upper right and left legs and buttocks as a result of employee horse play. The employee was hospitalized in Mercy Burn Unit for a week.
An employee was feeding the sander on the Hessman Sanding Machine. A panel of plywood (18"x96"x3/4") fell from the buggy and struck him on the head, neck, and shoulders.
Employee was descending a ladder when he slipped striking his jaw and face resulting in a broken jaw, nose, and facial bones and a broken right thumb.

An employee was checking the lights on the trailer or truck, which had just been repaired.  He climbed up onto the trailer to check the lights and slipped due to the morning dew on the trailer.  He landed the wrong way and broke his left tibia.
Employee amputated tip of finger when he caught it in a clamp while running rods.

An employee sustained an amputation injury to the tip of the middle finger on his left hand while clearing a jam on a Global Partition Slotter, which makes slots in corrugated cardboard. The employee reached into an area 3x4" wide, 2' long while the equipment was running. The equipment was not guarded at the time, nor was it shut down or locked out.
An employee was injured when an excavator rolled over while moving material.
An employee suffered a severe burn injury while working on a power pole when he made contact with a live wire. The employee was sent to Utah Burn Center.
On January 20, 2015, the tip of an employee's left thumb was amputated while performing work on the Raimann #2 machine, which uses dies to remove knots from 4x4 sheets of plywood.

Employee was installing steam trace lines from an aerial lift. The individual then bent over while working; the aerial lift moved, catching the employee's head between the cage of the aerial lift and an iron beam of the support structure for the unit.

On or about January 20, 2015, at approximately 3:10 PM, an employee suffered an amputation of the left-hand ring finger, just above the first knuckle. The employee was attempting to stop heavy gauge from falling off the top of a cart.
Employee strained his back while working at the restaurant and was unable to stand up straight, requiring the employee to go to the hospital.
An employee was walking in a hallway in the Skills & Development Center, Building 1260, when she fell and fractured her hip.
An employee fell and struck her knee on the parking lot pavement.  The trauma required transport and inpatient hospitalization.
An employee dismounted a forklift into a puddle of water and slipped. The employee suffered a groin tear/sprain.
An employee was getting out of a Ford F-150 when the truck started rolling back and the front tire rolled over the employee's left leg.

Around 11 p.m. on January 20, 2015, an employee was attempting to load a trailer of frozen products. He went to roll up the dock door and the spring came loose, causing the door to come down on his left leg. He suffered a fracture to his left fibula and tibia and was sent to Memorial Hospital of York. At 8:30 a.m. he was evaluated for inpatient rehabilitation.
A worker was fabricating a spool from steel. A portion of the steel fell onto the worker's hand and sliced through the tip of his pinky.
Employee was working on the HVAC unit and amputated his left index finger when it was caught on the HVAC's unit belt.
Employee cut his finger while he was cleaning the meat slicer in the deli.

On 01/20/2015 at approximately 8:00 am, an accident occurred while the employee was operating a table saw ripping 1/8" hardboard. The employee was ripping 28" wide sheets of 1/8" hardboard 9' long by 23" wide using a table saw. His hand inadvertently slid under the front of the guard and caught the blade resulting in the loss of the right index finger between the first and second knuckle and broken bones and extensive lacerations on his middle finger, thumb and palm. He was taken to Milford Memorial Hospital then later transferred to Christiana Hospital for an overnight stay.
Sheet rock was being transported with a dolly. The dolly tipped over and injured an employee's femur.

Employees were moving a 53-foot trailer with a forklift.  The trailer shifted and began to fall towards a parked truck. One of the two employees ran between the trailer and truck to stop it from hitting the truck. Employee sustained a broken left arm, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee servicing an AC was working from a 10-foot A-frame ladder. While descending, the ladder gave way and the employee fell to the ground.

On 1/20/2015, at about 6:30 p.m., an employee helped a second employee at the Townsend Skinner machine, which separates pig fat from pig skin. The employee reached into the conveyor belt, which has serrated teeth, and his right little finger was caught. He was transported to BSA Hospital in Amarillo, Texas, and his right little finger was amputated.
Employee fell from a utility lift in Bay 3, Hanger 710, and struck his head on the concrete floor, causing a skull fracture and serious brain injury.

An employee was helping the truck driver load equipment onto a flatbed truck. They were covering the equipment with a tarp. The tarp began to slip, causing the employee to lose balance and fall onto the concrete platform 4 feet below the flatbed surface. The employee was taken to Willis Knighton North Medical Center and admitted. The employee suffered a compression fracture to the L-1 Vertebrae.
An employee fell while walking in a hallway and suffered broken leg bones. Employee has been hospitalized.
An employee was operating a table saw when he amputated his right thumb.

An employee was using a hoist to lift a 300-pound part from a roller conveyor.  The part swung as it was being lifted, striking the employee in the right leg, just above the knee.  The employee suffered a fractured leg, requiring surgery and an overnight hospitalization.

An employee operating a water blaster tripped and fell. When the employee picked the water blaster back up, his hands were cut by the water pressure. The employee was taken to the hospital and was hospitalized. The cut had to be kept open because of possible debris intrusion in the open wound.

Employee was standing on an externally mounted receptacle located on the wall. The receptacle broke away causing the employee to fall to the ground fracturing his leg. He required a surgical procedure and in patient hospitalization to repair the fracture.

On January 21, 2015, a tag line became entangled around an A-frame metal beam weighing approximately 1400 lb., causing the beam to fall against the leg(s) of a worker. The worker suffered fractures of the right lower leg and was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized with broken ribs while pulling de-energized conductor wiring.

Employee was using a Bobcat with a jack hammer attachment to flip a metal caster lid (that weighs approximately 300 pounds). When the employee flipped the lid, the edge of the metal casting lid hit his leg, injuring him while he was in the Bobcat.
An employee amputated part of the right pinky finger while operating the laminating machine in the appetizers department of the production facility.
Employee was repairing an overhead door when a spring broke releasing the door and striking the employee injuring the shoulder, clavical,  and ribs.  Employee was hospitalized.
An employee was feeding film into the casting machine when his arm was caught between the rollers and broken.
The worker was using a chop box and amputated his left thumb.

An employee suffered a leg injury after being struck by a piece of wood. 

An excavator dropped a utility pole which subsequently caused a piece of wood to hit an adjacent worker.

Employee was working on the carburetor of his company vehicle with gasoline on his hands when it ignited, causing 2nd and 3rd degree burns on his right hand and 2nd degree burns on his stomach and left hand. Employee was treated and hospitalized at Doctor's Hospital in Augusta, Georgia.

Employee was walking beside his truck trailer on two inches of snow that was on top of ice. The employee slipped and fell onto his right side. He suffered a broken right fibula. He was taken to the hospital, admitted, and had surgery.

Employee was loading a commercial chain link fence approximately 45' X 6', 400 to 500 pounds, onto a flatbed of a Dodge 350 truck. The employee fell from the edge of the flatbed to the ground on his lower back and hit his head. The employee hurt his back and fractured his skull but remained conscious.

On or about 1/21/2015 at 9:00am, a worker on a stick machine located on the gin at Johnson's Gin Co. in Silverstone, Texas, fell from a 5ft ladder and landed on top of the stick machine catching his hand on the equipment and breaking both bones in his forearm resulting in hospitalization.
An employee walking out the door of a customer location tripped and fell breaking and dislocating the hip.
Employee fell from an A-frame ladder and fractured his left wrist and elbow.
An employee fell on a concrete floor and sustained a concussion and cuts and contusions to his head.

Employee was injured while demolishing a walkway on a barge.  Employee was working on the second level of the barge when the board on which he was standing broke. He fell through the board, hitting his abdomen on a metal I-Beam as he was falling.

At 9:00AM an employee was working on an oil field energy services tanker removing a camlock cap.  Pressure was on the cap when it was removed. It blew off and struck the employee in the face injuring his jaw and damaging his teeth.  The employee was transferred to different hospitals before receiving treatment. The employee was hospitalized one night in Bismarck.

An employee was operating a manual entry rack that feeds a lathe.  The employee pinched the pointer finger on the left hand between the axle and end stop on the entry rack.  The employee suffered amputation of the left-hand, pointer fingertip.
Employee experienced breathing problems while working around a cleaning product.
An employee was involved in an accident that resulted in the partial amputation of the left pinky finger.
On January 21, 2015, at approximately 9:34 AM, an employee in the meat department suffered a partial amputation of a finger with a small amount of bone loss.
An employee experienced a sharp pain under the left-side rib cage while lifting a box. The employee reported the incident on 1/21/2015, but on 1/23/2015, he was hospitalized.
Employee leaned against break room space heater. His clothing caught fire and while attempting to disrobe, he burned his hands and back. Employee was hospitalized overnight.
Employee slipped on ice and fell in the parking lot, resulting in a fractured hip that required surgery.
Employee coming in to work stepped out of her vehicle and slipped on ice. She broke her left ankle.

On 1/21/15 at about 16:20 pm a worker was hit by the tongs on his right arm, chest, and leg.  He was transported to OU Medical Center where his right hand was amputated.  Immediately before the accident the drilling line was stuck.  The snub line connected to the tongs snapped causing the tongs to swing around and hit the worker.

An employee was clearing a plugged ammonia transmitter when the vat line on the transmitter blew. The employee was sprayed with ammonia and suffered 2nd degree burns on approximately 5% of the body. The employee was admitted to Baton Rouge General Burn Unit for treatment.

Employee was unloading boxes from a delivery truck when some boxes fell. She stepped out of the way, tripped, and hit her head on the conveyor belt used to unload the truck. She sustained a concussion and was hospitalized.

On 1/21/15, at approximately 5:00 a.m., an employee was performing a torching operation when a piece of hot material entered his left safety shoe, causing a burn on the top of the left foot. Employee informed supervisor and supervisor performed first aid by applying burn ointment on burn and wrapping foot. The employee completed his shift. The employee returned to worked and completed his shifts on 1/22 and 1/23 and was not at work on 1/25. The employee came to the supervisor's office on 1/26/15 with a severely infected foot and was told to go to the occupational clinic. The employee went to the occupational clinic on 1/27. The clinic sent the employee to the emergency room and the emergency room doctor admitted the employee.
While rethreading a wire former, employee suffered a severe left hand injury to all four fingers, resulting in employee hospitalization.
Employee performing maintenance on a conveyor fell down an open chute about 10 feet and was hospitalized.
Employee experienced an amputation of three fingertips while attempting to unjam a board from a notch saw.
An employee was injured in a fall on January 22, 2015, at approximately 10:30 PM.  The employee is currently at Miami Valley Hospital in Dayton, OH.

On 1/22/15, at about 9:20 a.m., an employee was standing by a flat bed trailer while a Roll Off Of America forklift driver backed up. The forklift driver ran over the employee's left lower leg.  The employee was transported by ambulance to Texoma Medical Center in Texas and admitted as an in-patient.

On or about January 22, 2015, an employee received a hand injury that required hospitalization. The incident occurred as the employee was testing a new Phlauer Mixer on site; the employee's hand got caught in the mixer.
Employee was installing a slide on a lathe when the slide sliced the tip of his left middle finger off.

On January 22, 2015, at about 8:30 pm, a casing trough was being loaded by a forklift to a truck.  The trough slid off the forks and struck the employee at the midsection of his stomach.  He was pinned between the trough and a pipe rack.  The employee was admitted to OU Medical Center in Oklahoma City around midnight on 1/22/15.
While in the process of moving a floor grating, an employee suffered an amputation of the tip of the left middle finger.
An employee suffered a severe struck-by injury from a bull plug and gauge while repairing the bull plug.
Employee received multiple burns to the body due to a clamp on a hot water line failing.
After exiting her car, an employee slipped on the ice in the employer's parking lot while walking to the hospital and broke her arm.  She was hospitalized.
Employee was loading a vehicle when the employee possibly fell or slipped causing head and back injuries.

Employee was at a company site attempting to gain access to the roof ladder via a fixed ladder .  The height of the platform from the ground was 10 ft, 7 in. The employee slipped and fell to the interior concrete floor. The employee broke his wrist, and bone was exposed.

On January 22, 2015, an employee operating a rough terrain forklift on frozen ground felt a "pop" in his back. The employee reported the incident to management the following day, went to an emergency room on two occasions, visited a doctor, and had an MRI before being diagnosed with a spinal epidural hematoma and admitted into Geisinger Medical Center in Danville, Pennsylvania, on January 28, 2015.
Worker was hit in the head with rebar that fell from an upper elevation on a construction site. The worker was taken to the hospital, where a CT scan indicated a skull fracture.
Employee was working on assembling a trailer when the pneumatic fastening gun she was using got caught on the frame.  The frame fell on the employee, which resulted in a broken leg.
An employee was hospitalized after stepping into molten aluminum. Employee was burned several inches up his boot by the molten aluminum.

Employee backed up his fleet vehicle to park it, then stopped the vehicle and stepped out to load his gear into his personal vehicle.  As he walked away from the flatbed, he slipped on black ice and fell, fracturing his right tibia.   He was admitted to Southern New Hampshire Hospital and had surgery at 11:00 am on 1/23/14 to repair the fractured bone.

On 1/22/15, a bike messenger hit a truck at approximately 9:30 a.m. on the corner of Peoria and Madison in Chicago, Illinois. The employee was taken to the hospital. The employee suffered injuries to the face, spleen, and pelvis. The employee had surgery and was released from the hospital on 1/25/15.

An employee was performing maintenance on the line when he placed his left hand into the moving and high-temperature components of the dehydrator drum. He broke several bones in his hand and the skin was de-gloved. He suffered burns.
Employee was using a 10 lb. sledge hammer to tighten a hammer union.  The employee missed and caught his right index finger between the handle of the hammer and a valve handle.
While clearing the line #2 plastic dicer machine, an employee suffered an amputation of the middle and ring fingertips of the right hand.
Employee hospitalized due to second degree burns from contact with hot product/stock.
The employee was in a snubbing basket. Upon exiting, the employee slid down the emergency fire pole, lost his grip, and fell.
An employee was walking to his work location when he slipped on ice and fell injuring his back.

The employee was making adjustments to a fence staple manufacturing machine. The employee was working on the machine when the flywheel came down, catching his hand between the flywheel cutter and stationary cutter. The employee's left thumb was amputated and the employee was hospitalized.
On January 22, 2015, an employee was hospitalized after falling 12 feet to the ground through a 2' x 3' opening in a centrifuge stand.

Employee helping machine operator attempted to adjust a hydraulic press. The press cycled and pinched the employee's finger between the die and the machine, later resulting in the amputation of the right index finger up to the first knuckle at the hospital.
Worker hospitalized when an infection developed from a razor tool cut.
An employee slipped on ice on the sidewalk of a client's property, fell, and sustained a broken ankle.

Two employees were running the laminator machine. The injured employee was working on the front while another employee was working on the back of the machine. The laminator glues aluminum foil to the paper to create sandwich wraps and bags. The paper developed some wrinkles and the injured employee reached over the guard to try to fix the paper. When the employee reached over the guard, he caught his finger in a nip point where two rollers come together. He jerked his hand back and amputated his finger.

Site Safety Manager reported that this VPP Facility had an incident in which an employee was cut while adjusting a belt with an Allen wrench. This resulted in surgery and amputation of the employee's right index finger up to the first knuckle.
Employee suffered a skin amputation to the left ring finger while using a meat slicer.
A temporary employee got caught in a rotating shaft, resulting in broken bones.
An employee was injured in a construction accident when a bundle of steel concrete supports struck him. Employee sustained a broken leg and was hospitalized.

On 1/22/15 at approximately 8:00 a.m., a worker was working on an overhead shop heater that was mounted on the wall at approximate shoulder height.  He was standing on the floor during the maintenance activity and had pliers in his hand.  He lost his footing and fell on the same level. He fractured his right hip and was hospitalized as a result.
An employee was operating an overhead hoist and got his finger caught in the hook. The tip of his finger was amputated.
Worker slipped on ice and fractured leg. The worker was hospitalized to set the broken bone.
Employee was unjamming a part from a company-made machine when the employee amputated a finger.
Employee was spotting a forklift and was caught between the forklift and trailer, resulting in hospitalization.
Employee was cleaning a room. When she bent down to clean an area inside the door frame, the door swung shut, and severed the employee's right pinky finger at the second joint.
Left index finger amputation.

An employee was on the stabbing board to hang the tong line. He unhooked the derrick climber from his harness and when he let go of it he was hit in the mouth, lost his footing, and fell even though his lanyard was attached. His face hit the standpipe of the derrick and the 3 foot fall injured his back.
On January 23, 2015, an employee slipped and fell in the parking lot due to inclement weather.
An employee was moving a client back in a chair with the aid of a colleague when an umbilical hernia occurred.
Employee suffered serious facial injuries when the valve stem of a pressurized air hydrant hit him resulting in his hospitalization.

Employee was in airplane performing an audit and went to enter the flight deck/cockpit 
and was turning to the left. She fell due to an approximately 6" step down into 
the flight deck/cockpit. Since she was turning to the left before she fell, her 
body twisted and her back struck the center console.

A crew of employees was performing workover services. The crew was attempting to break out a crossover sub, on top of the casing scraper, using tongs. The employee was using a 36-inch wrench on top of the tongs. The tong operator engaged the tong before the employee removed his hand. The tong pinched the employee's finger between the tong and the wrench. The employee lost the fingertip of his right middle finger.
An employee fell down stairs in section 322 of the TD Bank North Garden suffering a broken tailbone.
An employee was burned by fly ash in the Power Department at International Paper and was hospitalized.

An employee was removing a roll from a machine during normal routine operation when he dropped a heavy core and pinched his finger between two objects. His right ring finger was amputated from the tip to roughly one half of the nailbed. The first knuckle is intact.
An employee received a transphalangeal amputation of his left pinky finger while offloading a compactor at the customer's location.
Employee was walking through the facility, tripped over her foot and fell. Employee sustained a hip injury and was admitted to Warren Hospital.

On January 23, 2015, an employee received a severe injury to his left index finger (partially amputated) when a beam fell from a rack that was not secured, making contact with the employee's back and pinching his left hand between the upright and the support bar.

During startup on a glue roller machine, an employee's glove and hand got caught on a chain/sprocket system. The employee's hand was drawn into the chain/sprocket system, resulting in an amputation of his middle finger on his right hand.

While the employees were picking up tubing, a worker grabbed the bell and pulled it back.  The elevator slipped and caught his finger between the horn's elevator and the bottom of the bell.  His middle finger was amputated from the finger nail to the first knuckle of the finger.  He was taken to the hospital, treated and released.
Employee fell through crank scaffold.
Employee was working on a can wrench without the lock out/tag out system in place. The jaws of the machine opened and retracted smashing and amputating the tip of the middle finger on his left hand.
Employee walking on the top of a form tripped and fell resulting in a broken left forearm.
An employee fell approximately 16 feet from the stairway of a drilling rig onto the ground below. The employee suffered multiple fractures and a collapsed lung.
Finger amputation (1/23/2015)
On or about January 23, 2015, an employee was hospitalized when he sustained a water blast injury.
Employee was moving a stock cart when he smashed his left pinky finger between the handle and something else.
Employer reported that at about 10:15 a.m. on Friday, January 23rd, an employee was leaving a patient's room and tripped and fell, breaking the bones at the shoulder joint.

On January 23, 2015, at approximately 6:30 p.m., a worker from the inside machine shop was training another employee on how to sand the face of a flange using a sanding disk mounted onto the tool rest of a lathe. The flange (part of a very long shaft) was on a lathe rotating at approximately 20 rpms. When the worker went to adjust the sanding disk, his left pinky at the first knuckle joint was amputated by one of the holes in the flange.

Employee was hospitalized after falling from a 27-inch stepladder he was using to work on a piece of equipment. The employee fell and struck a piece of metal on another machine, causing him to break one rib and puncture his lung. The employee was admitted to Springhill Medical Center on Friday January 23, 2015.
On January 23, 2015, an employee climbed onto his truck trailer and fell to the ground.
An employee suffered an amputation to the tip of his left pinky finger while attempting to stop a V Belt on an HVAC system with his hand.
An employee amputated the tip of his finger when it was caught between a conveyer and door. The employee was pressing doors in a pneumatic press when the injury occurred.
Employee was transferring a mini dumpster into a larger dumpster when the jib attachment slipped off, hit the ground, bounced, and hit the employee.
An employee was cutting wood using a table saw when a part of his thumb was amputated.

Employee cut finger on a part on 1/19/15 and did not report it to the employer right away. The finger became swollen and painful. The employee therefore reported the incident to the employer on 1/23/15 and was sent to the hospital. The employee was admitted to see a hand surgeon.  Surgery was performed to remove the infection on 1/24/15.
Employee suffered an amputation of the tip of his thumb while using a table saw to cut wood.

Employee was touching a boom truck used to deliver building materials while his co-worker was trying to lower the boom back into the truck. The boom struck a power line and the employee on the ground received an electric shock and was hospitalized.
On or about January 23, 2015, an employee sustained a finger amputation while placing steel in a press.

On 1/23/15 at approximately 4pm, a packing employee was cleaning a conveyor when the employee's arm got caught in a roller.  The employee sustained a compound fracture to the right forearm.  Employee underwent surgery at Strong Memorial hospital, was hospitalized for three nights and released on 1/26/15.
Employee was injured while cleaning a pin setter machine.

Maintenance employee was responding to a jammed machine on line #9.  The employee reached into the machine to remove the jam. The machine cycled, feeding another tray that pinched his right ring fingertip between the tray and the frame of the machine, resulting in the tip being amputated.

An employee was unloading a service truck when he accidently came in contact with a sharp metal edge of a piece of equipment. The tip of his left index finger received a severe laceration. The employee had the tip of his finger amputated (elective medical amputation).

Worker fell off the back of a golf cart like vehicle used to transport materials. Two inmates were riding in the back. The vehicle made a right turn, hit a bump and the inmate fell off the back. No seatbelts used or restraints, inmates were riding in cargo area.

Employee fell off an 8 ft. step ladder while changing a ballast in a Publix Supermarket. Employee fractured his left arm and dislocated his elbow and was hospitalized overnight. Employee underwent surgery.
An employee operating a Skytrak aerial lift was seriously injured when the Skytrak fell on its side.
On January 23, 2015, an employee was injured under a tipped over forklift.
An employee received an amputation injury to the right-hand index finger as a result of a U bolt, which fell during the removal of concrete form work at the new Atlanta Falcons stadium.
An employee became infected with MRSA.
On January 24, 2015, an employee was injured at a plastic extrusion line.

Employee was tending to psychiatric patient in emergency room. Patient became combative and pushed employee to the floor. The employee stuck out arm while falling to the floor and broke wrist. The employee was admitted to the hospital on January 24th, 2015. The employee had surgery on January 25th, 2015. The employee was released from the hospital on January 26th, 2015.
Employee was hospitalized after falling 21 inches through a drain while cleaning. Employee suffered a fractured right knee, fractured rib, and punctured right lung.

Employee chocked the wheels of an inbound airplane.  Then the employee placed the safety delineator.  Employee began visual inspection when she slipped and fell on a patch of ice.  This resulted in a broken wrist and hospitalization.

Employee #1 was removing roofing material from the roof when he fell through the roof.  The employee sustained two broken arms as a result from his fall.  The roof had recently sustained damage from fire and had to be removed and replaced.  The roof is comprised of lightweight concrete, tar, and corrugated metal.
Worker engaged in warehouse activities experienced respiratory distress. Worker was hospitalized due to an allergic reaction to buckwheat flour.
On January 26, 2015, an employee on a truck trailer caught his foot on a stationary air hose, causing the employee to fall to the ground.
Worker amputated the tip of his right thumb while using a knife to cut meat.
A worker was chipping concrete off of a rebar when a big piece of concrete landed on his right ring finger. The worker was hospitalized with lacerations needing 10 stitches.
Employee working around particle board broke his right ankle and left foot when product fell back and struck him. Employee required overnight hospitalization.
A letter carrier fell on an icy driveway at a customer's residence resulting in a broken left ankle that required an in-patient hospitalization and surgical procedure.
On January 24, 2015, an employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell.  The employee suffered fractures to the pelvic area and was hospitalized.

An employee fell while unloading equipment from her vehicle.  The employee went to put the cart in the upward position after coming in from outside.  Her feet were wet and she fell back and broke her hip.
An employee was bitten on the left hand while handling a dog and was hospitalized for about 3 days after the bite became infected.

Employee amputated a fingertip. Employee was cleaning the tower roller located in the tower room when the accident occurred. The employee's bone was shaved approximately 3mm at the hospital. The accident occurred on 1/24/1 at 1:30 a.m.
An employee sustained severe hand injuries while cleaning a saw.
An employee was operating a meat patty machine in the meat department and received fingertip amputations to the ring and middle finger.

Employee injuries resulted in an overnight hospitalization. The employee was cleaning out the trimming machine.  The hood of the trimming machine fell and impacted the employee's hand.  The force of the impact resulted in severe fractures to the hand that required surgery.
An employee slipped and fell on ice, fracturing her leg.

On 1/24/2015, an employee was lifting a tray of mail to load a truck and felt pain in the stomach.  Employee went home ill at about 9:30 a.m.  Later that day, the employee went to Kaiser Hospital in Roseville, California, and was admitted.  The employee had surgery for a double hernia on 1/25/2015.
Employee twisted and injured his right knee while exiting a trailer using the stairs.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery on 1/25/15.

An employee was bringing a newspaper rack out of a storage shed when she slipped on ice/snow that was on the shed's ramp, resulting in her falling to the ground and striking a nearby safety bollard with her leg.  She sustained a fractured tibia and fibula and underwent surgery later that afternoon and was admitted to the hospital.
On or about 1/25/15, an exercise rider, was attempting get on a horse when the horse spooked and turned suddenly.  The employee fell injuring his knee. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee suffered a hernia/hematoma while adding Fluorspar onto the ladle of the electric arc furnace.

While lifting a pallet of cases, three cases fell off the pallet. The forklift operator picked up two cases and stacked them on the dash of the standing forklift. When he went to pick up the third case, the other two cases fell over engaging both the dead man's switch and the joystick, causing the forklift to rotate pinning him against an adjacent forklift.

Employee operating the mold machine reached around a guard to the area where plastic bottles were molded. His hand was caught and fingers were injured. He was taken to the hospital and had surgery on his fingers.

Employee was working in the warehouse using a forklift.  He exited the lift to handle a task and returned to the second forklift that was next to the first one he used.  As he was backing up, he collided with the first forklift injuring his right ankle. He was taken by EMS to Ben Taub Hospital and admitted.
Employee slipped and fell on the ice as she was walking into the store to start her shift.

On January 25, 2015, an employee's thumb was amputated after being smashed by the wringer roll when it came off the adjusting stud. The employee's thumb was caught between the old contact roll base and the bearing box housing of the 10" wringer roll.
Employee slipped on ice in parking lot and was hospitalized for a head injury.

On January 26, 2015, an employee was hospitalized after receiving a deep laceration and possible fracture to the right ankle. Employee slipped while pushing a metal safety cabinet down a roller conveyor line. The employee's foot was lodged between the conveyor and a turn table stretch wrapper.

On 01/26/15, a worker was walking to her vehicle in the parking lot and slipped on the snow and struck her head.  She was transported to the hospital and was admitted overnight because of the impending snowstorm.

Employee sustained a foot injury on 1/14/15 when he stepped on a staple. Employee continued to report pain in the foot.  Employee visited the emergency room on 1/24/15. Employee reported to work on 1/26/15 with continued pain in the foot and was sent to the doctor. The employee was subsequently hospitalized for treatment of cellulitis.

On January 26, 2015, at approximately 6:15 AM, an employee sustained a severe left-hand injury while operating a metal roll forming machine. The employee was hospitalized and required surgical amputation of three fingers.
On January 26, 2015, an employee fell approximately 17 feet from a steel grating platform to the ground.

An employee suffered an amputation of the tip of his thumb while assisting in rolling metal into a power roller machine.  The employee reached back to get a better hold on the material when his thumb got too close to the rolls. His thumb was caught between a roll and the metal.  The second employee backed the rolls up to release the thumb.
Employee was burned while working on a motor.
The employee, walking across a muddy location, slipped and twisted his left ankle and broke his fibula near the ankle.

Two employees were pressure washing mud tanks.  The injured employee slipped and grabbed the end of the wand barrel.  He then came into contact with the pressurized water, resulting in a laceration on his leg.  The water was considered dirty which led to a hospitalization as a precautionary measure.
An accident occurred on or around January 26, 2015, when an employee was working on a MAC valve and was exposed to fly ash.
Employee was setting up an iron worker, aligning lower and upper dies, when it fully cycled.  A piece of the upper die came off when it hit the lower die, striking the employee in the right eye.

A positive displacement pump that marinates chicken was clogged. An employee removed the hose that was secured with a clamp and stuck his finger into the pump. The impellers on the pump amputated the tip of the employee's finger.
Employee suffered amputation of left fourth and fifth index fingers at the first joint while punching metal parts at power press 36 in plant 2.
Employee was helping to move equipment using a front end loader. His finger was amputated by the open pin of the front end loader.

A temporary worker for AUC Group (worker #1) was walking to his truck to leave for the day.  Another worker for AUC Group (worker #2) was backing out a truck owned by AUC Group. Worker #2 struck worker #1 with the vehicle. Worker #1 sustained back injuries caused by the accident, which required a surgical procedure to repair the damage. Worker #1 spent one night in the hospital.

On January 26, 2015, at approximately 10 AM, an employee slipped and fell on snow-covered ice on the sidewalk.  The employee was taken to the hospital for treatment with multiple breaks in her right ankle.
While restraining a cat to draw blood, an employee was bitten on the hand/wrist.

Employee sustained 2nd and 3rd degree burns on 8 to 11% of the employee's back. The wind blew a torch flame around the back side of steel that was being cut and under protective gear, catching the employee's street clothes on fire underneath.

An employee traveled to Target in Decatur, Illinois, in a company vehicle to purchase items for a client. The employee slipped on the ice in the parking lot and fell. The employee struck her head on the pavement and was taken to Decatur Memorial by ambulance for treatment.
An employee working on an accumulation table grabbed a chain and sprocket when he was trying to get up from the ground.  His hand got caught severely lacerating two fingers and crushing one finger.
An employee slipped in the parking lot and suffered a concussion and fractured skull and was admitted overnight to hospital.

Employee received a crushing injury to the right-hand thumb when the collapsible railing on a crusher plant's catwalk vibrated loose and pinned his thumb between the railing and catwalk. The thumb was partially severed and the bone broke. His thumb was later amputated at Rochester Mayo Clinic because blood flow to the thumb could not be re-established.

While making deliveries the vehicle's brakes failed causing the vehicle to roll. The driver tried to stop the vehicle by chocking the wheel. While attempting to chock the passenger side rear wheel the employee's left index finger was trapped between the metal chock and the tire resulting in an amputation.
An employee was walking between buildings at a childhood center when she tripped on a parking lot barrier and fell. She was taken to the hospital and admitted due to a broken hip.

Employee was out on the ramp while driving a tug. He hit a curb and was ejected from the tug. The tug ran over both of his knees, injuring him. He was going to get some baggage from the carousel to load into the airplane. During this process, he hit the curb and got injured.
Employee amputated the tip of his middle finger.

Employee was delivering a curbside delivery. There was a garbage can lid. She dismounted the truck and stepped on the garbage can lid. Her foot rolled and she heard a pop. She dislocated her ankle and broke three bones.
Employee was welding when his shirt caught on fire. He sustained 2nd and 3rd degree burns to his torso.

On January 26, 2015, employee was walking on the roof to tend to a fire in an exhaust stack. The employee slipped on a patch of black ice on the roof and broke an ankle while on the way to the stack.  Employee fell, but did not fall off the roof.

Employee at a customer's residence fell while traversing a stairway on 26 January 2015. She hit her right-side (ribs) against the railing as she tried to catch herself, however, she continued to fall, landing on her upper back. Employee was hospitalized.
An employee was walking down the hall, twisted her ankle, and fell.
An employee fell off the back of a truck and was hospitalized.
While working on a cross cutter machine, the employee sustained a partial amputation on the middle and ring fingers of his right hand.
The employee's right-hand ring finger was amputated while clearing raw metal stock that was jammed in a lathe.
Employee slipped on ice and shattered his left ankle.  Employee admitted to hospital for surgery.
Employee was climbing on some shelving, lost his balance, and fell on top of equipment.

Employee doing routine maintenance of production equipment had a partial amputation of his left ring finger. Employee was installing a heavy-duty magnet in a hopper when he came too close to the side wall. His finger was caught between the magnet and wall, which resulted in an avulsion.  Employee was treated at the scene and then transported to the hospital. To stitch his finger, the doctor had to shave his bone, which resulted in a partial amputation.

At approximately 9:45 AM on January 26, 2015, an employee fell on the sidewalk in front of the entrance to the door.  The employee was using a walker and fell backwards, striking her head on the sidewalk.  The employee was taken to the hospital for treatment and observation.

An employee was in a skid steer with a bucket attachment, and was shoveling up cardboard.  The operator picked up a load and began backing up; he noticed that a piece of plastic was attached to the bucket. The employee decided to detach the plastic from the bucket. In the process of doing this, the employee stood up without disengaging the controls, placed his right hand on the right front post of the skid steer, then reached with his left hand for the plastic. When he reached with his left hand, his chest came in contact with the controls, lowering the bucket. As the bucket lowered, the right arm of the skid steer came in contact with the employee's right index finger and crushed it.
A nurse was backing away from a bed ridden patient and tripped on a portable computer resulting in a fractured vertebrae.
On 1/27/15, an employee was operating a horizontal press brake. The employee's finger got caught between the part being bent and a cover plate on the machine, resulting in an amputation.

The rig crew was rigging down the work floor on the rig to change out a valve on the well head. The injured employee was standing on the rig platform reaching for the pin and lost his balance. He fell and hit the cellar ring of the well head. He injured his right ribs, right shoulder blade and punctured a lung.

Employee opened up a strainer within a processing line that was not de-energized, causing approximately 2000 gallons of TDI to spill out. The employee and two others were sent to the hospital. Two were treated and released, while the employee directly exposed was hospitalized.
Worker fell about 42 inches from a scaffold when a scaffold plank broke.

On January 27, 2015 at approximately 3:07 pm, employees had placed a casket in a five foot grave.  When they lifted the liner to cover the casket, the ground gave out and one employee fell into the grave breaking both his leg (both the tibia and fibula). He was taken to Beaumont Army Medical Center for in-patient hospitalization and surgery to repair his leg.
Employee lost a fingertip during preventative maintenance operations of a conveyor belt.
An orange harvester was on a 13 foot ladder when he became off balance, fell, and landed on the rim of the metal tub.  He suffered a laceration to his liver.
On January 27, 2015, an employee's hand was injured when he reached into a piece of equipment to remove a jam, resulting in hospitalization.
On or about January 27, 2015, an employee sustained an amputation of the left middle finger, distal to the first joint, while removing a jammed product on the Go-Cup Line.
Temporary employee sustained amputation of ring finger while working on wire reel in plant #2 of host company Encore Wire Corp.
On or about January 27, 2015, an employee sustained serious amputation injuries after being struck by a pin setter.
Employee lost a fingertip in the closing lid of an internal valve when removing the trailer's internal valve.

Worker was inspecting a flat roof. The surface of the roof was icy. The worker slipped and fell on the same level, fracturing his tibia and fibula bones directly above the right ankle. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee had the left pinky fingertip amputated while setting up material on a lathe.

Employee was in yard #1 cutting metal with a 6 ft. cutting torch when sparks from the torch ignited his shirt. He sustained second degree burns to the upper right side of his torso, arm, chest, and a portion of his abdomen.

An employee suffered a broken clavicle and a concussion when he collided with another employee while setting up a portion of the downhill ski slope at the Red Tail Finish Line in Beaver Creek, Colorado.  Specifically, the employee was working at the bottom of a jump, while another employee pulling a toboggan failed to see him in time and collided with him.
An employee welding a cable guide pipe to a tank containing road tar suffered burns to his right side legs, arm, neck, and face when the contents of the tank caught on fire.

Employee was operating a drill tap machine.  As he was making an adjustment for a new job on the tooling, his hand contacted the rotating spindle shaft. His glove got caught on the shaft, and his hand was entangled.  This resulted in amputation to the first knuckle of his left-hand middle finger.

On or about January 27, 2015, at 3:45 p.m., an employee was hospitalized for surgeries related to the amputation of the two end phalanges of his index finger and the tip of his thumb on his right hand.  He was injured while using a table saw to cut wood. The piece he was cutting kicked back, and the employee's hand fell into the saw blade. Using a table saw was a biweekly task of about an hour at a time.
Employee slipped on ice and broke the left leg.

Worker had just picked up a load of chemicals for the supplier and he was removing the wheel chocks from the trucks wheels. He had removed the first set of wheel chocks and moved to the second set. As he pulled them free from the wheels, he tripped over the first set he had pulled. He fell to the ground and landed on the second set of chocks. He broke his hip and possibly injured his back.
On 1/27/15, an employee was admitted to the hospital with a fractured skull after falling on ice in the company parking lot.

An employee was moving a mold with a crane in the research development pilot cell.  While the mold was being transported, the end effectors holding the mold became disengaged, allowing the mold to fall approximately 3 to 4 feet to the floor. The mold struck and crushed both of an employee's ankles.
Employee amputated the tip of his left ring finger while cleaning grease from a small print press roller with the equipment running.
Employee was about to get on a forklift when he fell and fractured leg.
The rail that kept beef intact was broken, causing a side of beef to fall on the floor. A worker went to help move the side of beef, which struck his ankle and injured him.
An employee was picking up trash in the turf at a golf course and was bitten by an insect, believed to have been a spider.  He was subsequently hospitalized when his finger became inflamed.

On January 26, 2015, at approximately 8:06 a.m., at the Tel Hai Retirement Community, the worker sustained a partial amputation. At the time of the incident, workers were using a forklift truck to lift a job box (metal box) onto the upper level. While taking the job box off of the forklift truck, the worker's hand was pinched between the forklift truck and the job box. He was taken to Brandywine Hospital Emergency Outpatient. He sustained a bone fracture and partial amputation of his right fourth finger, distal phalanx, distal tuft, with a loss of overlaying soft tissue. He was treated and discharged.
Employee caught his hand in a router.
An employee was unwrapping a pallet of cardboard boxes when he stepped back and his left foot was run over by a forklift, requiring surgery.
An employee had his left hand crushed while using a crow bar to help set a concrete sewage distribution box.

Employee was working on a ladder. He slipped and instinctively grabbed onto a piece of equipment to try and steady himself, causing an avulsion to the left-hand middle and ring fingers. This resulted in hospitalization, and those fingers were amputated.
Employee was cutting a piece of PVC pipe on a table saw when his left middle finger suffered a cut by the blade.
An employee fell after slipping on ice. She hit her head, resulting in a subdural hematoma.
Employee had his left fifth (pinky) fingertip amputated when his hand was pinched between a high-torque wrench and a bolt head.
An employee was in the transport office at approximately 3:30 a.m. using a paper cutter and amputated the tip of his left thumb.

An employee was changing a forklift battery that was suspended from a hoist.  While the employee was moving the hoist, the battery slipped off the hoist hook and fell on the employee's right foot.  Three toes on the employee's right foot were amputated.
On or about January 28, 2015, an employee sustained crush/amputation injuries to the right hand while removing a jammed part on the OBI Press.
Employee was driving an electric pallet jack straight down on a ramp when she lost control and pinned her left leg between the mid-rail and the pallet jack, resulting in a fracture.
Employee slipped on ice going to lunch at Building C.
Employee fell off an eight and a half foot ladder and broke a shoulder.
An employee in Warehouse #1 received a partial amputation of the middle finger of the left hand while working on an extruder machine.

An employee lost his balance after stepping onto the top step of a step ladder and fell onto the concrete below. The employee was admitted to the hospital on the evening of January 28, 2015, with unspecified injuries.

Employee was cutting a plexi-glass panel using an air pressurized hand-held saw.  The head of the saw detached from the body, sending the tool into the back of the employee's left hand. The employee experienced a deep laceration to the back of the left hand, which required surgery and in-patient hospitalization.
Worker was hospitalized due to a fractured thumb from using a 6" grinder.
Worker injured his left pinky and ring finger when his left hand, which was on the line, was pulled into the main hook lock during the untangling of a crane's lines.
Employee fell during the performance of pick-off work at the facility.

The employee was at the laydown yard picking up wood poles to load onto a trailer for some work later. While operating the grapple truck, he picked up two wood poles and as he adjusted the poles to fit onto the trailer, the poles fell. One pole fell to the ground. The other pole struck the employee while he was seated on the machine. The pole glanced off his hard hat and hit his left shoulder and cut the left side of his neck.

On January 28, 2015, an employee was using an 8-foot A-frame ladder to change out pipe fitting at the Hydro Cracker Unit.  The employee fell from the ladder while descending, breaking his lower right leg in the ankle area.  Employee was transported by ambulance to Pauls Valley, then transferred to the Norman Regional Hospital where he had surgery to set the bone.

Worker was hit on the left forearm by a backhoe's bucket while he was standing in a 3 feet deep trench parallel to another trench approximately 4 feet away. The backhoe was approximately 8 feet away from the injured worker. The dirt in the trench where the backhoe was located gave out and caused the backhoe to swing and hit the employee.
Worker fell when exiting a shuttle bus. Worker hit the shuttle stairs and injured lower back and leg.  Worker was hospitalized.

An employee in the lawn/golf course maintenance department was spreading fertilizer and reached into the hopper to push lime further down the hopper. His gloved hand was caught by the agitator causing a deep cut to his left middle fingertip. The employee was hospitalized and the next day part of his finger was amputated.
On or about January 28, 2015, an employee was sent to the hospital when the school bus that he was working under fell off its jack stands and onto the employee crushing his pelvis.

An employee was operating a rotary die press in the die cutting department on January 28, 2015.  The employee sustained an amputation on the left hand below the first joint of the thumb while cleaning it.

At approximately 4:30 PM on January 28, 2015, an employee removing cones in the "closed lane" was struck by a motor vehicle driven by a member of the general public. The employee's left leg sustained a fractured femur and fibula. The employee was transported and admitted to Geisinger Medical Center in Danville, PA.

Maintenance employee for Southwestern Plating was working inside a circuit breaker box that was not locked out. A flash fire occurred, burning the employee's arms (upper and lower), face, neck, and torso.  The employee was rushed to Memorial Hermann Hospital (Burn Unit) where he is currently hospitalized.
Employee was walking into work when she fell breaking her leg in two places.  Employee was hospitalized.
Employee operating an ELVO omnicutter reached into the machine to clear some debris. Employee severed the tip of the right middle finger halfway through the nail. Bone loss occurred.
On January 28, 2015, an employee that was walking through the parking lot slipped on ice and fell due to inclement weather .
Employee was moving a 55-gallon barrel of frozen fruit juice off of a pallet and it landed on the instep of his left foot, fracturing his foot and requiring surgery to repair.
An employee was walking into the establishment when he slipped on ice on the walkway and dislocated two fingers on his hand.

On 1/27/15, the employee was getting a cat out of a carrier with the assistance of another person.  The other person was holding the box and she was getting the cat out.  The cat bit her hand.  After it continued to swell, the employee was admitted on 1/28/15 overnight for IV antibiotics.

The injured employee was using an 8-foot step ladder to apply a vinyl window cling decal to the front store window.  A second employee was holding the base of the step ladder due to windy conditions.  The second employee was unable to prevent the ladder from toppling over as the decal may have acted as a sail.  The injured employee fell to the ground and was hospitalized as a result of the following injuries:  head trauma when he was knocked unconscious, possible concussion, laceration to left side of his head, fractured right arm, and stiches in the right elbow.  He was initially taken to Parkland Health Center in Farmington, Missouri, and then later transported to Barnes Jewish Hospital in St. Louis, Missouri.

Employee was operating a wire press machine.  Employee stepped away and lost his balance. He braced himself on the machine and his right hand came in contact with the wheel.  The employee sustained an amputation of the fingertip flesh and fingernail on his right-hand middle finger. No bone was amputated.
Two workers who were installing a cable ladder were injured when a 15 ft. tower section was blown over; it tipped over in high winds and high wind gusts.
A wall form fell on a worker while constructing an elevator shaft.

Employee was wiping off the plate while the machine was running. The rag got caught in the machine pulling the employee's hand into the machine and catching it between the print cylinder and the anologix cylinder. The right 4th and 5th fingertips were amputated.
Employee was exposed to chlorine gas while performing a line break. He was hospitalized overnight.
Employee was stacking milk crates in a cooler when the crates became unstable. He tripped, hit his head on shelving, and injured his back from the fall to the floor.
Employee was walking out front entrance of retail store when he slipped on a patch of ice and injured his ankle.  Afterwards, he was hospitalized.
A truck driver fell off the truck bed and sustained severe head injuries.

An employee fell through an opening 15 feet to the ground. The employee broke the left hip, ribs, a tibia, and sustained damage to the spleen. The employee was admitted to the hospital and underwent surgery.

Employee was painting the interior space on a 6000-gallon water tank. He was wearing a fresh air respirator; the compressor was outside with a line that ran into the confined space through an access point on top. The tank attendant didn't get a response so 911 was called and entry was restricted until the air was confirmed clear.  By the time the all clear was issued, firefighters arrived and performed rescue operations. The employee was taken to Kootenai Medical Center. He had a pulse and was breathing on his own, but was still unresponsive. His PPE included a  Survivair Respirator with compressor, full enviro air suit, Tychem SL chemical suit, another paint suit underneath, and a Bullard hose system.
Worker was working off a 6 ft scaffold that had been erected the day before. He adjusted the scaffold so he could pour concrete and fell. He was admitted to the hospital.
An employee tripped over the doorway coaming and fell to the same-level surface.  Employee suffered serious injures, including broken bones.

A scaffold board was removed to load mortar onto the scaffold. As the scaffold board was placed back into position, an adjacent scaffold board fell from the third tier, striking an employee in the head. The injured employee was on the ground loading custom bricks into a bucket.  He was taken to the hospital and admitted.

Employee was working on the bed of a bucket truck approximately 5-ft high. He was tightening a bolt on the truck with a wrench; the wrench slipped, causing him to lose his balance. He fell off the truck and hit his head.  He was taken to St. Francis Hospital.  He was in the emergency room and then transferred to the intensive care unit.

On or about February 29, 2015, an employee sustained three broken fingers while lowering a bag filled with ore (manganese) material over a hand rail using a manifold and a rope. Employee's pinky finger was later amputated.
Four employees were cutting an opening in a concrete wall for a door. The wall fell outward onto another employee, striking his back and pelvis area. His injuries required hospitalization.

Employee had just finished unloading a truck into the paving machine. He had his hand on the gate of the truck. The truck operator latched the gate from the cab, crushing the pinky finger on the employee's right hand.
Employee was cutting an avocado when the knife slipped and cutoff the tip of the left ring finger.
An employee on an electric rider pallet jack struck a concrete column and crushed his foot between the pallet jack and the column.  At least one toe was amputated and he was hospitalized overnight.
An employee fell from the second story of a residential home and was injured as a result of the incident.
Worker was burned on her rear shoulder and back when a pressurized hot water hose broke off of a laundry machine.
Employee was cutting a hose with a X-Acto knife when he cut his left hand requiring five to seven stitches.
An employee fell through a skylight while checking for ice on the roof of the building.
An employee was sweeping the facility when a stack of pallets fell and broke the employee's ankle.
On or about January 29, 2015, an employee had his hand pulled into a saw.
On January 29, 2015, an employee driving a pallet jack over a dock plate fell to the ground.

Employee used his hands to straighten and pull boards toward himself in the trough of the trim saw. His finger was caught between two boards coming down the chains, amputating the top of the ring finger of his left hand. He lost flesh and the bone will be cut off.
Worker was injured when he fell out of the back of a pick-up truck. The truck was parked and not moving; the employee tripped over the wheel well. He broke his collar bone and some ribs.

Employee was cleaning out a pre-breaker feed and reached into a rotating auger to remove debris. The auger caught his right index finger. This caused a laceration and an amputation to the tip of his right index finger's first knuckle.
Employee was standing underneath a bridge under construction when a 2x4 piece of lumber fell off the bridge and struck him in the shoulder. He was hospitalized as a result.
Employee cut the tip of his left thumb off with regular scissors while dressing a window at the NorthStar Mall location.
An employee was injured on his right shoulder, arm, and hand by hot water while cleaning a hopper.  Based on his condition, he was sent to the clinic then further referred to the hospital.

On or about 1/29/2015, two employees were riding in the back of a forklift.  One of the employees jumped and was caught by the back of the forklift on his right ankle. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
On or about January 29, 2015, an employee was hospitalized for a finger amputation after an injury was sustained while working on/near racking used to stage lumber.
On January 29, 2015, an employee slipped and fell on a concrete sidewalk due to inclement weather and icy conditions.
An employee was checking on some kids who were on the property up on the hill. When he was coming down the hill, he slipped and twisted his ankle.  He was hospitalized for surgery.
On January 29, 2015, an employee slipped and fell on ice in a parking lot due to inclement weather.

A worker was cleaning a mold. After finishing one side he started to go to the other side when the metal grating moved/shifted. His foot became unbalanced, causing him to slip and fall. His left hand got caught in the clamp or a piece of the machinery, which cut him.
An employee using a miter saw at a customer's house cut off the tip of his finger.

An employee was at a Travel Centers of America truck stop.  The employee was walking in the parking lot and slipped on the ice.  The employee fell and hit their head causing a skull fracture.  The employee was admitted to and hospitalized at OSU Medical Center.
Employee experienced an amputation to the right thumb when exposed to an unguarded pulley.

Employee was opening a curtain on a curtainside trailer. He was pulling two curtains at a time when one of the buckles tore away from the curtain, causing the employee to lose his balance. The employee fell and struck his head on the concrete ground.
On January 29, 2015, an employee slipped and fell on an icy driveway.
An employee was struck by a motor vehicle while crossing the street to return to his vehicle.

On 1/29/15, an employee amputated the tip of the right middle finger. The load on
a forklift struck the load on a cart the employee was holding, which pinched the employee's finger between the cart and the load.

Employee's 3rd finger on his right hand was amputated on January 29, 2015, due to a work related injury which occurred on January 9, 2015. The injury occurred during the repair of an 8 foot mower deck.
An injured employee was hospitalized for surgery following a workplace accident.  The employee was found adjacent to his PIV with crushing injuries to his left foot/ankle.

On or about 01/30/2015, an employee amputated his finger while cutting lumber with a power tool. The lumber was covered with ice; when the blade struck the lumber and ice, it kicked backed and cut the tip of the employee's left thumb.

Worker was using a portable handsaw to cut lumber when the saw jumped to the one side where the worker's left, gloved hand was holding the lumber.  The blade caught the worker's glove pulling it toward the blade and the worker lost the tip of his left thumb.

An employee was operating a lathe in the packing maintenance shop. The employee was using emery cloth to buff a shaft when the employee's gloved right hand was pulled into the lathe. The employee fractured the right wrist and three fingers, requiring an overnight inpatient hospitalization and surgery at UNMC hospital in Omaha, Nebraska.
An employee, who was walking down the jet bridge, fell and injured her right shoulder, requiring surgery.  The jet bridge was slippery from inclement weather.
An employee got his finger caught between a pallet and a platform, while a forklift operator was lowering the pallet down onto the platform.  Employee suffered an amputation.

Employee fell approximately 16 feet through the rafters of an apartment complex.  He had been loading roof with roofing material and was coming down at the time.  He injured his ankle and tibia. Employee was hospitalized for surgery to repair the break.
