A technician was called out for a gas leak.  The Tech was "smelling" out the gas with a meter.  He had been around the residence and crawled under the porch.  He moved some pesticide bottles the owner had under the porch.  When he moved them they released a gas that struck him in the face.
Employee was cleaning the wash tank when the hose disconnected from the pump and sprayed Minncare (a disinfectant) on his lower back. This caused a chemical burn to his lower back.

Employee was at the registration desk. She was moving out of the way of a crowd of people coming in when she stepped on a dolly with her right foot. She lost her balance and fell. Employee suffered a fracture to the left hip.
On or about February 15, 2015, an employee's leg was pinned between a sit-down forklift and a guardrail. Employee sustained broken bones to the left ankle.
On Sunday, 2/15/15, an employee was walking outside to the bag house area when he slipped on ice and rolled his ankle.  The employee required ankle surgery.

A Stericycle employee was labeling 55 gallon drums and a yard employee on a forklift was carrying palettes of fruit. The yard employee struck the Stericycle employee and pinned him between the palettes of fruit and the 55 gallon drums.  The accident resulted in a fracture just above the employee's right ankle.
Employee was assaulted near the main entrance door by a customer. Employee was hospitalized with a laceration to the face, requiring stiches.

On or about February 16, 2015, at the repair shop, an employee was pulling a wrench from a boat and slipped and fell backwards onto the floor, fracturing his hip. The injured employee was taken to the hospital and admitted overnight for treatment.
An employee slipped on black ice in the parking lot as he was walking into work. The employee fractured his T3 vertebrae.

Employee was on a ladder putting up decorations for an upcoming event. Employee was coming down the ladder and missed a rung resulting in a fall to the ground five feet below. Employee fractured the left wrist.

A maintenance employee was trying to unplug the transfer line between the mixer and the packer.  The machine was not locked-out. The employee reached a hand in and it amputated the index and middle finge tips on the right hand.
Employee cut his hand while picking up a piece of metal and stepping on the pedal of the power press brake machine.

Employee was working from a scissor lift approximately 12 feet high when it collapsed and ejected the employee onto a concrete slab.  The employee was admitted to the hospital with a broken arm and a broken back.

The employee was cutting blinds on the blinds cutter machine and then proceeded to remove product while the blade continued to turn. The employee's left hand index fingertip came in contact with the rotating blade and was amputated. The equipment was guarded. The employee had surgery and the fingertip was successfully reattached.
Ski instructor fell while avoiding a minor student, resulting in a broken hip.
An employee was walking in the hallway when she tripped on a mat.  She fell to the floor, hitting her arm on the wall on the way down. She fractured her right arm.

Employee was rotating a plastic 4 x 4 ft. square container counterclockwise when the container slipped and his left pinky finger became trapped between the container and a stationary pole.  Employee's fingernail was taken off and the tip of his finger was amputated.  Employee had in-house surgery on 2-18-2015 to repair his finger.
Employee picking up items to take back to the hospital for sterilization slipped and fell breaking a rib and vertebrae.

Employee was operating a powered pallet jack in a congested area with racks.  When the employee pushed down the handle on the pallet jack, to engage the device, the tip of his left index finger was caught between the rack edge and the handle resulting in an amputation injury.
An employee received an electrical shock from a crust warmer.
Employee's fingertip was amputated while cleaning a printing press roller.

An employee was arc welding on a boiler feed pump shaft that was made of 410 stainless steel.  The employee was wearing a respirator designed for Hexavalent Chromium.  The employee went to the hospital and was admitted for respiratory issues after finishing his shift.
Employee suffered an amputation injury to his right hand pinky finger while performing maintenance work on the Ferris Wheel located at the theme park.
Employee was pulling a banner when she tripped and fell, hitting her head. She received a concussion and was hospitalized.

An employee was assisting in the positioning of a table that is used to guide steel forms. A crane and signalman were used to pick up and position the table. The employee went under the table to ensure that it was going to set level and the table was set down on the employee's left middle finger. Later that day the tip of the finger was removed by a doctor.
An employee operating a forklift had his foot caught between the forklift and a pallet.
On or about February 16, 2015, an employee was injured when a coil of metal weighing approximately 2,000 lbs. fell on his right leg.
Employee was observing a rigging operation. The rigging hook caught on something and when it dislodged, it hit the employee in the face causing a skull fracture in the sinus region.
An employee amputated the middle and ring fingers on the right hand while operating a hot stamp printing machine in the Ace Plastics division of the company.

On 1/16/15 at approximately 10:00 p.m., employee was loading a welding robot.  The employee accidentally activated the lever with his left hand; the clamp cycled and caught the employee's right thumb, resulting in an amputation.

Employee had a finger surgically amputated after sustaining an injury while filling a tanker truck with water. The employee's pinky ring caught on a grease fitting while he was climbing off the truck stripping the skin from the center knuckle to the tip of his finger.
An employee was helping to unload a box truck.  The employee slipped on a dock plate and fell to the ground.  The employee broke his ankle in three areas and sustained a dislocated shin.
Employee cut the second finger on his right hand while operating a panel saw and pushing through some balsam wood components.
The worker fell backwards towards the slump rack stairs while washing his concrete truck and sustained a laceration to the back of his head.

Employee was attempting to close a manually propelled gate associated with a fence system.  The conditions were cold and icy.  The weather conditions were making it difficult for him to close the gate.  The employee had to get extra leverage on the gate to get it closed.  He reached up around/near the gate's rollers as he applied extra leverage to the gate with his body.  The gate suddenly gave way and the employee's finger became trapped in a pinch point created by the gate's roller and the horizontal bar the roller slides across.  His fingertip was amputated by the pinch point between the roller and the bar.

One employee suffered burns to his face and both hands while dousing a fire that started in the paper making machine. The employee remains hospitalized. A second employee sustained smoke inhalation symptoms and was treated and released on the same day. Both employees were using a fire hose to douse the fire with water.
Employee was struck on the side of the head by metal that fell off a flat bed trailer he was loading.
A worker on a dock was loading onto a vessel, when the loading chute fell on his left foot, injuring his pinky toe and the toe next to it.
Employee fell from an 18-inch high platform measuring approximately 18 X 20 inches while performing a corrective action on a packaging machine. Employee fractured ribs and scapula.
An employee was installing a cable on a telephone pole, working from a 28-foot ladder. The employee fell approximately 18 feet while descending the ladder.
Employee was opening a bag of guacamole using a knife without cutting gloves.  The knife went sideways, cutting her left index fingertip.
On or about February 17, 2015, an employee slipped and fell in the employee parking lot injuring her hip.
Employee was walking from the building to a government vehicle and slipped and fell on icy ground.  Employee sustained a head concussion.

A Clark Trucking employee who was supplying a sub-contractor with stone on a construction site was hospitalized after suffering from a severe arm injury when his arm was crushed between a trailer and trailer box.
Employee slipped on ice in the rear parking lot of the nursing home and was hospitalized with an ankle injury.
At 10:45 AM on February 17, 2015, an employee's left leg was struck-by a pipe while unloading a truck causing a deep thigh bruise. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

The injured employee was descending from the roof using a ladder. A second employee started to descend the same ladder. The second employee hit the injured employee on the head and knocked him off the ladder. The injured employee fell about 6 feet to the ground.

While repairing an elevator's counterweight, the mechanic isolated the counterweight by wedging a tool under it. The wedging tool dislodged, the counterweight moved, and the mechanic got his hand caught by the moving cable into the guard of the sheave. The incident de-gloved his hand and caused the skin to be ripped from the bone.

An employee who was working as a picker/packer in the Bulk Packaging Area was moving cartons when the individual suddenly felt extreme pain and was taken to the hospital.  The individual was diagnosed with a hernia and had to undergo surgery. The cartons weighed approximately 35 pounds each.
An employee, unloading lauryl dimethyl amine from a truck, was sprayed with the chemicals. The employee received burns to the face, neck, and abdomen.
An employee was retrieving stock using a 6-foot aluminum step ladder and fell injuring the elbow and hip requiring surgery.

On or about Feb 17, 2015, the injured employee was found by another employee at the bottom of the stairway at a client's facility located at Kasco, LLC (1569 Tower Grove Ave., St Louis, MO). It appears from where the employee was found, that he had attempted to carry five cases of soda up a stairway with a two-wheeled dolly and lost the load. The stairway that was involved in the accident has approximately 16 steps and does not have a landing.
Employee was struck by a forklift as the employee was walking behind it.
Employee was using a skill saw to cut 4X4s. The saw kicked back cutting the employee's finger.
An employee injured his foot while opening a hangar door.
While cutting mangroves, a stem struck the employee's left foot, causing a laceration.
An employee was trimming hedges and lacerated the ring, middle and pinky fingers of the right hand.
An employee was disposing hot oxide out back and the steam radiating from the hot, granular material (1000 F) burned the back of his legs.

On February 17, 2015, at approximately 5:30pm, an arc flash occurred while an employee rolled in a 4kv breaker to the Coal Yard Area. The employee received small first and second degree burns to his right and left hands.
An employee was using a spin blaster on the inside of a pipe when his hand got caught in the sprocket and chain, amputating his left-hand ring finger.
Employee fell and hit his head in the parking lot as he was coming to work. The employee had a bleeding wound to the head and was admitted to Reading Hospital.

A truck backed into the dock crooked, preventing PIT entry into the trailer.  The dock latch was engaged, and the truck needed to pull out and back in again. The injured employee attempted to release the hook. The hook re-engaged, pinching the employee's fingers between the hook and trailer. The employee received an amputation to the right ring finger and scratched the right pinky finger.
While folding a cardboard box an employee tripped and fell onto her hip on the concrete floor.
The employee was delivering mail to a residential home. While walking on blacktop, the employee slipped on the ice and fell, breaking the left ankle.
Employee was hospitalized after falling off a ladder on February 17, 2015.

An employee was using a pneumatic disc grinder when the disc caught on the material being ground and broke into pieces. The disc pieces struck the employee in the side of the face causing a severe laceration from the ear to the jaw bone requiring hospitalization.
The employee was cleaning a bathroom and mixed two chemicals resulting in struggled breathing and possible loss of consciousness for a short time. The employee admitted to a hospital.
Employee sustained a head injury when a bread bin hit her head.
An employee was operating the tie machine when it moved unexpectedly and caught the employee's left foot in between the brakes.

Employee had the tips of his left hand index and ring finger amputated. The employee was performing maintenance on an auger machine. He climbed onto the machine to reach a motor belt and pulley that was seven feet from the ground. He was turning the belt and pulley on the motor to see if it was working properly when another employee energized the auger causing his fingers to get caught by the nip point between the belt and pulley.

While delivering mail on a rural route, employee slipped and fell due to snow and ice. This resulted in a right lower leg fracture of both bones. Employee was hospitalized and needed emergency surgery to repair the leg.
On 2/17/15, an employee operating a manual drill press got a glove caught in the drill bit and suffered an amputation to a portion of the pinky finger.
Employee walking back from pump house slipped and fell on ice and fractured ankle.
The employee's right hand was caught in the feed of the extruder. The tip of the right-hand index finger was amputated.

On 2/17/2015 at approximately 9:00 a.m., an employee was removing a stator (pipe) from a pre-treat oven.  The tooling at the base of the stator caught on a cavity inside the oven.  The crane continued to pull the part up and as the employee was trying to move the part, the hook of the holding device sheared and smashed his left index finger.  The amputation occurred when the employee tried to pull his hand out of the way.
An employee received severe lacerations and was hospitalized when his hand entered an injection mold machine.
On or about February 18, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation of part of his left pinky finger when an entry door slammed on it due to a strong gust of wind.

An employee was standing on a pipe rack using his feet to roll pipe to the edge when his foot was caught by a pipe causing him to fall off the rack. The employee's foot was broken by the pipe that also fell off the rack.

An employee was injured and required hospitalization for a crushed pelvis and ruptured urethra when a waste compactor was activated and the anchor bolts holding it down broke, trapping the employee between the compactor and a wall.
An employee experienced a partial fingertip amputation (only skin; no bone) when his finger was pinched by a mini-excavator bucket.

Employee delivering slabs of solid surface material was standing on a truck flat bed while employees of the receiving company unloaded a slab.  The Abaco clamp holding the material gave way, releasing the load and knocked the injured employee from the truck bed.  The slab broke into pieces and a section fell, striking the injured employee below the knees on both legs breaking them. The injuries required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was injured when he fell from a ladder.
Employee's fingertip was amputated while cleaning the high-speed mixer. At the hospital, they sewed it back on.

The employee was performing a visual inspection of a motor, lost his balance, and placed his hand on a running motor. His right hand slipped below the guard and his fingers slipped into the running belt and spindle, severing the tips of his index and middle fingers.

A maintenance employee was connecting a meter to a disgester. The employee was checking the digester probe when he was splashed by hot condensate from the digester. The employee suffered burns on the right torso, right arm, and right thigh. He was transported to the hospital where he received emergency treatment and was kept overnight for observation.
Employee amputated the tip of her thumb and nail (no bone) using a deli meat slicer.
An employee was using a wax/grease stick to grease the blade of a horizontal band saw. The blade yanked the stick, pulling the employee's hand into the blade amputating the left middle finger.

Am employee  working in the receiving area, sustained amputations of his right middle and ring fingertips on 2/18/15 at 7:30 PM. The employee's fingers were caught and amputated by receiving line gears while attempting to dislodge a cage. He was treated at Beebe Medical Center and hospitalized for 23 hours.
A maintenance technician was struck in the head by a carriage lapper belt.
On Wednesday, February 18, 2015, at approximately 1:15PM, an employee amputated the tips of the right hand ring and middle fingers while operating a table saw.
A worker was carrying hot water in a kettle and was burned when it spilled on both legs.
An employee was shaping a piece of wood with a router. When the employee lifted the guard on the router to shape the wood, the tip of his right ring finger was amputated.
An employee tripped over a rug and fell breaking his hip.
A employee fell off the roof and was hospitalized on 02/18/2015.

Employee was installing outside showers and hose bibs when he was struck on the head and shoulder by a falling piece of material from approximately 50 feet above him. Employee was in-patient hospitalized.

In the warehouse, employee was standing on a 6-foot ladder adjusting some boxes with appliances inside when the ladder shifted a little bit.  He was working from the top step and fell to the concrete floor on his right side.  He sustained five fractured ribs, a laceration to his liver, and a lacerated or punctured spleen.
On or about February 18, 2015, an employee operating a sit down forklift was injured when the employee's hand was caught between the roll cage and the rack.
Employee on mail route slipped on ice, fell and broke the right ankle and leg below the knee.
An employee suffered a left-thumb amputation when it got caught in metal cording used for safety harnessing.

Employee was setting a column form with an overhead hoist, when his finger became caught between a metal bracket and a two by four. The bracket lacerated the tip of the employee's finger and shaved a small portion of the bone. Employee was taken to OccuCare Medical clinic, where he was then referred to a specialist at Memorial Herman Hospital.
An employee suffered hand and wrists injuries at work on 2/18/15 and was hospitalized.

An employee was wearing gloves while operating a jointer. The glove on his right hand got caught between the fence on the machine and a piece of wood. The employee pulled his hand back before the guard could close, resulting in the amputation of approximately two-thirds of the little finger on his right hand.
Employee was shot in the leg while participating in firearms training.
A worker fractured the wrist and left knee after falling while carrying a tray of dental tools. The employee was hospitalized.

Two employees were attempting to take the forks off of a forklift. One employee was using a pry bar to lift the forks and the other employee was using his hands to push the forks. The pry bar slipped from under the fork, causing it to pinch the fingers of the employee who had been pushing the forks. One of the employee's fingers was amputated to the first joint, while another finger had the very tip pinched off.
On or about February 19, 2015, an employee tripped on a call light cord in a patient's room and fell breaking a hip.
Employee fell approximately 7 feet off a highway retaining wall while lowering a jackhammer.
On or before February 19, 2015, an employee slipped and fell on ice while carrying a 2-inch x 30-foot-long piece of pipe, resulting in a tibia/fibula fracture to the right leg.

Employee missed a stair rise while descending a flight of stairs, but did not fall.  After a few hours, the employee complained of pain and was brought to the emergency room.  The doctor's diagnosis was a fractured hip. Employee was admitted to hospital for pending surgery.
An employee was loading a truck. The dock plate that joins the ramp to the truck was frozen, so the employee jumped on it and exacerbated a prior back injury.

Employee was working on the back of the trailer when the lift gate inside the lift was activated. As the lift gate folded, it pinched the employee's left hand between the folds, resulting in an amputation of the left thumb, pointer, and middle fingers.
Employee's little finger was crushed and amputated by an industrial washing machine door.
Employee was euthanizing a sick dog. The dog lunged unexpectedly and bit the employee on the hand/lower arm.
On 2/19/15 at approximately 5:30 PM, an employee slipped on black ice in the parking lot, injuring her tail bone and requiring overnight hospitalization.
On February 19th, an employee fell off a ladder and was hospitalized.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after getting his left forearm caught in the Huw Saw.

On Thursday, February 19, 2015, at 5:36am an employee slipped and fell on black ice while walking towards the facility gate to open it. The employee was admitted to the hospital with a possible compound fracture of his right leg and may require surgery.   On Thursday, February 19, 2015, at 7:20am another employee slipped and fell on ice in the employee parking lot. That employee was admitted for surgery to repair a broken ankle.

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer. These events are captured as one report.
Employee was wrapping a tarp onto an articulating boom bucket mounted and stored on a service truck. Employee fell approximately 6 feet to the ground and suffered fractured ribs.
Employee fell and broke her right leg. This resulted in an overnight stay in the hospital.
Employee was cutting a tree. As the tree fell, it struck another tree and bounced back on the employee. The employee suffered a broken ankle.
Employee was confining a heifer in an attempt to tag her ear. The heifer threw its head, pinning the employee's arm between its head and the pen breaking his arm.

Employee was preparing to euthanize a non-performing hog. He went to the shop and retrieved a Captive Bolt Gun and returned to the pen where the hog was located. He loaded the gun and put the safety on. As he was climbing into the pen, the gun fell. When it hit the floor, the gun discharged, and the 3" projectile attached to the gun struck the caregiver in the right thumb, puncturing his thumb and breaking the bone.

Employee was standing on a pile of metal pipes. He was directing a forklift operator to remove one of the bars. As the forklift operator moved the bar, the employee's legs got caught under the load, injuring both.
Employee was walking to his truck when he slipped on some ice in the parking lot.  Employee fractured his left ankle and underwent surgery.  Employee has been in the hospital for one night.
An employee was walking through the yard to get his equipment and slipped and fell on the ice. The employee twisted his ankle and chipped a bone in his foot which required surgery.
An employee amputated the left index finger while operating the wire mesh looming equipment.

Employee was installing an incline conveyor.  He was using two chain falls and four come-a-longs. One of the come-a-longs was removed, causing the others to become overloaded, and the conveyor fell. The employee suffered broken bones in his legs, feet, spine, and pelvis area.
An employee received a crushing injury while servicing a chain and sprocket drive system.

A vessel was being unloaded with steel pipe. A forklift was coming in to pick up material to be put into a truck. An employee was inspecting the load that was to go into the truck. As he was looking at his check sheet, the forklift operator made a 90-degree turn and backed into him, injuring his right leg and foot.
Employee's leg was caught between a cable and a stable bar when moving an anchor buoy in the Shinecock Inlet.
An employee suffered an amputation while pushing fugitive product back into an auger.
Employee was walking in the back area of the laundry facility when he tripped over his own foot and fell onto a laundry cart and suffered an injury.
An employee fell while pulling a garbage cart.  The employee was admitted to the hospital with an injured hip.
An employee was cleaning up underneath a conveyor and got sawdust in his eyes. He also struck his head when reacting to the sawdust. He required overnight hospitalization.
An employee was hauling freight using an industrial truck. The freight became unstable and fell on top of her while she was transporting it.
An employee was walking and fell fracturing his right hip.
Employee working with crew to remove snow from the roof of a large industrial building fell through a skylight, approximately 40 feet to the floor below. Outcome at time of call was unknown.

An employee performing maintenance to a cell rectifier was standing on the platform where the equipment was located.  The platform stood approximately 1 foot above the ground.  The employee stepped down, slid on black ice, and fell on his back.
Employee slipped on icy stairs and fell. Employee was knocked unconscious, broke ribs, and punctured a lung.

On February 20, 2015, at approximately 6:30 a.m., a maintenance employee was using a 12-inch pedestal grinder to grind spurs off a small piece of metal he was holding in his hand at a 45-degree angle. The end of the piece of metal got caught between the grinding wheel and the work rest, causing the piece part to become lodged in a fixed vertical position against the grinding wheel and catching the employee's left thumb between the piece part and the grinding wheel.  The employee was treated in the emergency room immediately following the accident with a fractured and lacerated thumb. Upon subsequent referral to a hand surgeon, the diagnosis was expanded to include partial amputation of the thumb.
An employee handling/picking materials from a shelf was hospitalized after falling 6 feet from a step ladder.
A postal worker delivering the mail slipped on ice at the end of the driveway and fell and breaking his leg.

An employee was inspecting a ship intake duct that had been fabricated. The employee heard someone grinding above him and when he looked up, a piece of welding slag fell into his mouth. The employee removed the slag from his mouth and continued working. Later that evening at his residence, the employee experienced breathing problems. The employee went to a hospital emergency room for treatment where it was discovered that the employee had welding slag in his throat. The employee was admitted to the hospital and surgery was performed to remove the welding slag.
An employee assembling wooden boxes was hospitalized overnight after a nail was driven into his right kneecap.

Employee was lifting a five gallon bucket up through a manhole, then stepped back, and tripped backwards off of a 12 inch to 18 inch concrete slab he was standing on. Employee broke his foot and was hospitalized.
On or about February 20, 2015, an employee's middle two left-hand fingers were amputated just above the first knuckle when a stainless steel guard came down while working on the auger.
An employee was struck by a portable aluminum extension ladder that fell from the side of the east wall.
Employee installing drywall suffered a broken leg when a slab of drywall fell. Employee was admitted to the hospital.

On 02/20/2015, at approximately 9:00 am, employee was walking to building 103 when he slipped on ice and dislocated his left ankle. He was transported by Huntington Ingalls' emergency medical unit to Riverside Regional Medical Center and admitted.
Employee was climbing onto the back of a disposal truck to clean the blade when he lost his footing and fell, landing on one leg and fracturing the tibia of the right leg.

On February 20, 2015, an employee conducting preventative maintenance work on a heater was injured when the scissor lift he was standing on was struck by the structural steel beam for a gantry crane. He suffered multiple fractures on both sides of his body, as well as a dislocated left hip, when he fell approximately 15 feet to the ground.
A warehouse employee suffered a broken left ankle while unloading material from a wagon and was hospitalized.

On February 20, 2015, at approximately 8:10pm, an employee fractured and lacerated his right hand when it was caught between the cylinder being worked in the lathe and the boring bar. The injury resulted in surgery and hospitalization.
A City Carrier in Nashville was delivering mail when she slipped on ice and fell breaking her ankle. She was hospitalized and underwent surgery to repair her ankle.
On February 20, 2015, an employee was injured when a Genie man lift rolled over. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was working at a decorative line when the tip of the right pinky finger was amputated by the Rademaker machine.
A propane heater burned the back of an employee's legs.
An employee was working at approximately six feet in height when he fell from an A-frame ladder.  The employee suffered a head injury requiring in-patient hospitalization.

On 2/20/2015 a worker was using an overhead crane to move a 200lb lift gate.  The crane fell from its support and landed on the employee's back. The employee broke several ribs and was admitted to the hospital.
A chop saw foot pedal was accidentally activated and cut an employee's right index finger. The finger was amputated.

On 20 February 2015, at approximately 1100hrs, employee was holding a pin that was being hammered by a third-party employee. His right, middle distal phalanx was struck by the hammer and crushed. The employee was taken to Midland Memorial Hospital. The distal phalanx was surgically removed on 23 February 2015 during an outpatient procedure.

Employee was operating a stomp shear with a co-worker. The employee was inserting some metal into the shear to be cut when his fingers slipped into the machine as the co-worker activated the stomp shear.

An employee working on an oil-and-gas service rig suffered partial amputations of the right middle and right ring fingers after his hand was caught between the tong plate and the pin that secures the tongs.
An employee was hospitalized due to an injury sustained when the spray from a power washer contacted his boot, causing a severe laceration. The employee was wearing leather work boots.
Employee's foot became caught under a tire; employee fell and fractured bone.
Employee fell off of rail on truck during bulk feed delivery.  The employee was hospitalized overnight with a dislocated shoulder and fractured ribs.
An employee suffered an amputation injury while operating a press brake.
Employee was setting a place pump for concrete when the pump caught, crushed, and amputated his right ring finger.
Employee's monster truck rolled over, resulting in a cut to the lower left leg and a sprained ankle.  The employee was hospitalized overnight.

The employer reported an amputation that occurred on 1-21-2015 at approximately 3:00pm.  The employee was working on a coil end welding machine when his left index finger was caught in a hydraulic clamp.

Employee was working on a sorting platform approximately 8 feet off of the concrete/ground. As employee descended a fixed ladder, he lost his grip and fell to the ground in a standing position, fracturing his right leg.

An employee was injured when she lost control of a forklift and attempted to dismount it.  The employee was pinned between the forklift and a wall.  The employee was taken to the hospital and received surgery.
An employee's finger was crushed by the t-pusher of the monorail system during maintenance.
Employee reached below a luggage belt to clear a jam in the domestic counter area. He severed three fingers on his right hand (thumb, pinky, ring).
On 2/21/15, an employee's fingertip was amputated. The finger was caught between two bricks on a convert belt and was torn off. The employee was taken to Louisiana Medical Center and Heart Hospital.

An employee was performing maintenance work on a crawler crane's ignition system while standing on the track which provided only 5.5 inches of surface to stand on. The mechanic slipped and fell approximately 59 inches and broke his right leg. He was admitted to the hospital.

An employee sustained an injury to his left pinky finger as he was polishing a coil with a CNC lathe. The door safety interlocks were disengaged allowing the employee to polish parts of the coil as the machine was running.
Employee was climbing a locked fence when his ring finger got caught on the fence and was amputated.
Employee experienced leg injuries when snow fell on the employee's leg(s) while trying to manually dislodge snow/ice from the elevated bed of a dump truck.

On February 22, 2015, a patient microwaved a cup of coffee. The patient then threw this hot cup of coffee into the face of the injured employee. The employee sustained burns to his face and was hospitalized.

On 2/22/2015 at approximately 8:45 PM an employee was carrying several cutting boards from the cook line to the dish area at clean up time. The employee tripped or slipped and fell on his left side. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured leg and hip that required surgery to repair.

Employee amputated the tip of the left-hand pinky finger while pulling 20' long pipe from a pipe rack.  While pulling one section of pipe from the rack, another pipe shifted; the employee's finger became caught between the pipe and pipe rack, which caused the amputation.
Employee was hospitalized due to being struck in the head by a backhoe bucket.
Employee was injured in an 18-foot fall from an access platform between two boilers when the catwalk grating gave way. Employee suffered a broken pelvis, fractured ribs, and a dislocated shoulder.
An employee amputated his fingertip while tearing down a setting tool on the McMaster Pad site.
An employee returning from lunch walked into the store with wet feet and slipped and fell backwards. She fell onto her right leg, but did not hit her head.
Employee had two fingers injured/amputated while unjamming a snow blower.

On February 22, 2015, an employee working for a home healthcare service was going up an icy set of stairs, slipped, and fell.  The employee injured her neck, shoulders, and both thighs.  Employee was hospitalized.
A maintenance worker suffered a crushed arm when he was struck by the moving parts of a tray stacking machine.
An employee suffered electrical arc burns on right hand while performing maintenance on an electrical plug/twist lock on a 2-ton hoist.
Employee was admitted to the hospital for back strains and muscle spasms after subduing a patient.

The employee was working at a production line where breast meat is inspected prior to packaging. The employee reached down and underneath a conveyor belt where her glove was caught in a pinch point, amputating her right index fingertip. The doctor described it as a de-gloving of the fingertip with removal of the bone tip.
An employee sustained a cut to his left index finger when his hand made contact with the blade as he was cutting lamb chops on the band saw.
On February 23, 2015 at approximately 2:50 pm, an employee slipped on a wet floor and fell and broke her hip.
The tip of the employee's thumb was amputated by a knife while chopping cilantro.
An employee slipped on ice and fell in the parking lot.  The employee suffered a broken hip and was hospitalized as a result.

On 2/23/2015, an employee was injured on the job during a conveyor belt operation that is used to move old paper through employees for recycling separation. The belt is moved or powered by a chain and sprocket system.  The employee attempted to remove some debris from the chain. He had on safety gloves, which were caught in the chain and/or sprocket. The employee was injured when his finger was caught and lacerated, but not severed at a joint.
On or about February 23, 2015, employee amputated three fingers while operating the bandsaw.
Employee was walking through hallway and injured right knee requiring hospitalization.

An employee suffered a partial amputation of the right index finger while performing work on the ACW Machine after another employee reconnected a pneumatic line to the machine. The pneumatic ram shot forward and caught the employee's finger in a pinch point.
Employee was walking from the showroom to the parking lot to deliver a car when he slipped on ice and fractured his right leg.

Employee was setting up a 15 foot extension ladder to get onto the roof. After he climbed the ladder, he went to connect the ladder to the building with a bungee cord.  When he was connecting the cord and pulling it tight, he ended up pulling himself off the ladder.
Employee's first three fingers were cut by the stacker while clearing a wood jam. He was hospitalized at Bryan Whitfield Memorial Hospital in Demopolis, Alabama. Amputation is still to be determined.

A forklift operator pushed a pallet into another stack of pallets, which struck the injured employee on the left leg. She sustained a broken leg with multiple fractures. Incident occurred in the distribution-receiving department located in the south side of the building.
Employee operating a forklift was injured, resulting in a compound fracture. Employee underwent surgery and is hospitalized.
Employee fell from a scaffold platform; employee was injured and hospitalized.

An employee suffered a laceration and burn injury to his left cheek while maneuvering a 20-foot-long, 3/4-inch-diameter pipe from the sizing mill area to the hot rack with a mechanical lifting/maneuvering device. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.
Employee got off the bus to go on a break. While walking in front of Ted's Restaurant, he lost his balance and fell on the sidewalk. He hit his head and lost consciousness.
An employee lost his balance while unloading lumber from a rail car and slipped and fell. The individual was found unconscious and taken to the hospital.
An employee's left arm was amputated while working with a noodle-making machine.

Employee's right ring finger was amputated after it came in contact with the blade on a bread divider. During a jam, a photo electric eye is supposed to shut the machine down. The photo electric eye malfunctioned as the employee reached into the machine resulting in the ring finger amputation.

In an attempt to enter a locked room, an employee used a ladder to climb over the door through the false ceiling. He slipped and fell through the false ceiling resulting in a concussion and broken ribs.
Employee's fingertip was amputated. He was operating a pallet jack when his finger was pinched between the jack and a metal bin. The fingertip was reattached.
Employee suffered an amputation past the first joint of his left ring finger and tip of his left pinky finger while operating a machine in the PMP Dept.
Employee was walking to vehicle in parking lot, slipped on ice, and broke hip.  Employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.

On 23 February 2015, at approximately 1030 hrs at the Flogistix manufacturing site in Pampa, Texas, employee was cutting a metal stud on a chop saw when the material kicked back and crushed the distal phalanx of the index finger (right hand). The employee was taken to Pampa Memorial Hospital where physicians opted to amputate due to the extent of the injury.
On or about 23 February 2015, an employee of Coastal Plains Trucking was injured and hospitalized when the vehicle he was driving hit icy roads and overturned.
Employee slipped on ice and fell fracturing the right leg.
Employee's feet became entangled in computer wires underneath her workstation. She tripped and fell as she attempted to get up from her chair, resulting in a fractured left arm.
An employee was bending down on one knee to look at a pro/tracking number on a package when he was struck by a forklift driver who was backing out of a trailer.
Employee suffered a partial amputation of the right index finger while operating a meat slicer to slice onions.
An employee suffered a broken ankle and was hospitalized when a large metal baffle fell from the table and stuck his leg.
Employee's hand got caught in a dump truck gate. Employee suffered a crushing injury to the hand; emergency surgery was conducted.
Employee fractured his ankle when he slipped on ice while walking to the cargo van, resulting in hospitalization and surgery.
On or about February 23, 2015, at 3:10 p.m., an employee slipped on the sidewalk outside the Gram Building and fractured her right elbow. She was hospitalized and required surgery.
The employee was checking the water in the front-end loader. When he stepped down, he fell and fractured his right leg.
An employee cut off the tip of her left-hand pointer finger while cutting bell peppers.
On February 24, 2015, at approximately 7:00 AM, an employee tripped on a call cord and fell.  This fall resulted in a fractured hip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee moving pallets with a pallet jack was hospitalized after he felt pain in the groin area while taking a turn.
On 2/24/15, an employee was injured/hospitalized after falling from a ladder while tying in ductwork.
An employee cut his wrist while operating a polishing wheel and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee suffered a partial pinky finger amputation from being cut on a die.

An employee walked to the rear of a small crane to retrieve his tool bag. The crane operator extended an outrigger that came down on the employee's right foot, causing multiple fractures. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.
Employee's finger was caught between a baler and power jack; employee was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after sustaining injuries during a snowmobile incident where they struck a tree. The employee broke an ankle, requiring in-patient hospitalization and surgery.
On 2/25/2015, an employee's left index finger was caught in a conveyor belt that was being used to move shingles to a rooftop and crushed but not severed.
On 02/24/2015, employee was working in the deli department when she tripped over cords on the floor and fell. She broke her hip and was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a t6 roll-threading machine. He placed a bar into the machine; the machine cycled and caught his hand between the bar and the machine.  His right middle finger was partially amputated.
Employee burned left hand with pot handle and was hospitalized due to infection.
An employee delivering mail slipped on ice in a driveway, causing injury to the left tibia.

Employee was operating a product filling machine and the machine was leaking onto on the containers.  The employee opened up the safety guard and tried to wipe down the heat jaws with a cloth when the jaws closed on his hand, amputating three fingers.
An employee was hospitalized following a collision with another skier on the lower Columbine Trail, which resulted in a broken leg and wrist.

An employee's hand was fractured when a 1700 pound John Deere fuel tank fell from a transporter cart the employee was pushing.  The tank fell because the cart frame broke. The support bar for the tank struck the employee's right hand as it fell. The employee sustained fractures and a severed tendon.
An employee slipped on ice and fell in the truck yard.  The employee was hospitalized with a broken ankle.
An employee slipped and fell down a flight of stairs while exiting a building. Weather conditions were a contributing factor.
Employee fell approximately 15 feet. No fall protection was being used at the time.
An employee was hit by a metal door that was blown open by the wind, knocking the employee to the floor.

On 2/24/2015, at approximately 2:00 PM, an employee was injured while changing a tire on a large forklift in the forklift maintenance shop.  A smaller forklift was being used to lift the tire into position. The employee was holding the tire in place when the smaller forklift ran over his leg.  Incident resulted in broken bones in the lower right leg.  Injured employee was taken to the hospital and received surgery at approximately 7:00 PM.
Employee was delivering lumber when the ladder he was using to access the truck slipped on ice and the employee fell. The resulting injuries required hospitalization.
A powered industrial vehicle ran over an employee's foot, requiring in-patient hospitalization and surgery.

On 2/24/2015, at approximately 2:00 PM, an employee was injured while restocking in the linen department at a department store.  The employee was moving comforters and quilts from the floor to the shelves. The employee's foot got caught on one of the quilts that was on the floor, which caused her to fall onto her right hip.  She could not get back up to her feet from that point.  The injured employee was taken to Kingwood Hospital for treatment and is awaiting possible hip surgery.

While operating a door lifter, an employee became caught on the knob. The employee was lifted up in the air and fell 4 feet when released, sustaining a cut on the leg. The employee received stitches and was kept overnight.

Employee was driving a scissor lift through a large doorway. When the employee released the controls, the scissor lift jerked backward and caused him to hit his head on the top of the doorway. The employee exited the scissor lift, started walking, fell, and struck his head on the concrete floor. Employee was admitted to York Hospital.
At approximately 0800, an employee fell approximately 14 feet to the ground below. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.
Employee was injured by a powered industrial truck that rolled back over the employee's foot. The employee suffered broken bones in the foot.
An employee was coming out of the utility room and caught a finger in the door. The index finger suffered a soft tissue amputation at the end and skin was removed to the first knuckle.
An employee's gloved  hand got caught while operating a lathe, resulting in a broken wrist and laceration of the left pinky finger.

While climbing down a military vehicle (MMPV) access ladder, the employee's wedding ring on his left hand got caught on one of the anti-slip barbs on the step.  When he dismounted the last step, the flesh was pulled from his ring finger, resulting in its ultimate amputation.

On 2/27/15, an employee suffered an in-patient hospitalization. Three employees assembled a stage scene on 2/25/15. The injured employee utilized a self-supported ladder to access the work area, a stage scene of a home with a roof. A portion of the stage scene became unsecure, causing the employee to fall approximately 8 feet from the ladder. The employee struck his shoulder and head and was immediately unconscious. The employee was taken to the hospital.
Employee was cutting a 2-inch by 6-inch piece of metal when his right index finger got caught in the shear. Employee's right index finger was surgically amputated from the first knuckle.

Two employees were hospitalized due to injuries sustained during maintenance operations on a workover rig in the maintenance shop. One employee suffered a crushing injury when a derrick floor fell on his chest, breaking ribs and causing a collapsed lung.  A second employee suffered a broken elbow due to a fall sustained while attempting to hold the falling rig floor.

Employee was taking a load of manure to the manure pad to dump it.  In the process of raising the trailer, the manure load froze while both of the safety latches at the bottom of the tailgate were still engaged.  The employee exited the trailer and began to walk around the trailer to see why the load hadn't released.  As he got near the tailgate, the manure load let loose and broke the two safety latches (1-1/4" steel rod), blowing the tailgate open. The bottom of the tailgate hit him in the leg.  The employee suffered a fracture to the left thigh due to impact.  Employee was transported to Backus Hospital and admitted.

An employee's fingertip was amputated while operating a baler in the back room of the store. The employee was lowering the baler gate when it slammed on the employee's fingertip. The employee was seen in the emergency room, where it was discovered that the fingertip could not be reattached.

On 2/25/2015 at approximately 3:00 PM, an employee was injured while performing her duties at a manufacturing shop.  The employee was inserting pieces of metal into a punch/pressure machine when a portion of her right index finger was amputated by the machine.
On 2/25/15, an employee's finger came in contact with the blade of a table saw as it was powering down. The employee was hospitalized.

On 2/25/15 at approx. 5:15 p.m., an employee was sanitizing the muffin batter depositor pump.  She removed the cover off the side of the equipment, sprayed inside, and then reached into the pump with her right hand to check for remaining batter mix. As a result, three fingertips on her right hand were amputated. The machine was not locked out at the time.
Employee leaving the store slipped on the sidewalk while getting into car and fractured hip. Employee was admitted to the hospital.
Employee was attempting to cut banding with a pocket knife.  The knife slipped and struck the employee in the calf, hitting an artery. Employee was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized on February 25th, 2015, after falling on black ice and sustaining multiple fractures.

An employee was driving a utility vehicle out of the north side of the large transfer building when he turned and struck a parked roll-off truck. The employee struck the roll-off truck with his chest and was hospitalized.

Employee was working from a ladder at a private residence. The ladder was leaned against a pole. The ladder fell away from the pole, and the technician fell with the ladder, injuring the right fingers, hand, and wrist. The employee was hospitalized.

On February 25, 2015, at approximately 10:00 AM, the injured employee was working near racking aisle 600.  A stacker truck bumped into the employee's right foot, which caused the employee to fall on his left side and fracture his left pelvis.

Employee working in the Birchwood North Production area attempted to unjam the freezer tunnel with a tool.  The employee reached in with the tool (a few inches) when the tool became caught and dragged her hand into the equipment. Her right index finger came into contact with a pinch point (a roller and the guard), amputating her fingertip.

Employee was changing out a piece of pipe while installing underground conduits on a directional drilling rig. He was struck by a wrench. The employee was taken to the hospital with injuries to his forearm.

Employee exited his vehicle and was walking to the back of the trailer to open the door to deliver items. He slipped on the icy, snow-covered parking lot and broke his right ankle.  The employee was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee used the running line that was attached to the hook of a crane to pull himself up. The left tip of his middle finger and half of his ring finger got caught between pinch points (the rope and pulley), resulting in an amputation.

Employee was carrying a building truss with a forklift and placed a truss into a stored area. The employee reversed the forklift and walked up to the stored truss. The truss fell on the employee, causing facial injuries and fractured ribs.
An employee skiing on the Larry Fale Trail was struck by another skier. As a result, the employee suffered suspected rib fractures and other potential injuries to the shoulder and torso areas.

An employee was operating the 1708 machine, finishing a tube.  The machine cycled then stopped. The employee noticed the machine had stopped and removed the guarding to investigate the problem.  The employee saw that the material had pushed the home sensor and then pushed the material back manually, causing it to move forward again.  The material got stuck and at the same time pushed the employee's left hand into the clamp, causing an amputation of the left pinky finger, which left bone exposed.  The employee was transported to Unity Medical Center and admitted.
While riding a scissorlift, employee's face struck a doorway. Employee broke the jaw and was admitted for in-patient hospitalization at the University of Virginia Hospital.
An employee going to his car slipped on ice and broke his right leg. The employee went to the hospital and is awaiting surgery.
Employee hospitalized due to being struck by a bale of hay while loading it onto a flatbed trailer. Employee broke ribs, pelvis, and vertebrae.

An employee backed a tractor trailer into the delivery area of a customer store to unload soft drinks. The unloading area has a hydraulic lift platform with a lift gate on two sides because the receiving floor is at ground level, which is  4 feet lower than the trailer bed.  The controls for the platform ride up and down with the platform and are operated by delivery truck drivers.  The employee had finished unloading the product and was preparing to leave. He needed to slightly lower the platform to close the door on the back of his truck. He stood on an 18-inch-wide ledge and fell off. His jacket got caught on the control, which triggered the lift, and he was caught in a pinch point between the lift gate on the platform and the control panel. He suffered a puncture wound in the left groin, a broken pelvis, and a tear in his aorta.
Employee suffered a broken finger and a partial amputation on two separate fingers of the left hand while working at the tilt hoist in the planing mill.
An employee aboard the Gudrun Maersk fell approximately 18 feet off of a shipping container onto the deck of the ship. He was locking a cone on containers that were on the ship.
On February 25, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation of his left thumb to the first knuckle while operating the RAZ machine.

An employee working in the extrusion department was moving racking material with a crane when he pinched his left-hand, third fingertip between the hook and rack. The employee sustained a fingertip amputation and underwent out-patient surgery.
Employee was attempting to dislodge a dumpster that was frozen to the ground.  When the dumpster broke free, it rolled and pinched the employee's left pinky between the dumpster and a parked truck.

An employee was walking beside a crane, lost his balance, and slipped in the mud.  He couldn't get out of the way and was run over by the crane's wheels, damaging both legs. The employee was hospitalized; the extent of damage was unknown at the time of reporting.

Employees were opening a hatch at one of the salt water disposal tanks when a spark created a flash fire. The employee was burned in the flash fire and hospitalized. The other employees received minor skin burns and were examined and released the same day.
Employee received burns to the chest, face, and eyes when an Oxidizer machine containing propyl acetate and alcohol exploded.
Employee clearing trees for a gas/oil pipeline installation was pinned between two trees and broke a leg.
Employee slipped on ice in the hospital parking lot and fell, breaking her leg and ankle.
An employee suffered head injuries and lacerations after falling off of a truck while strapping down materials.

At the  Typhoon Lagoon Water, an employee was checking the slide for cracks or deformities when the employee slipped or tripped and fell. The employee fell forward and struck the right side of his face on the slide.
Employee fell down stairs while delivering mail to a customer, breaking his right upper leg.  Employee was admitted, kept overnight, and had surgery.

An employee was performing a utility locate near the intersection of Summit and Ridge Road in Eagleville, Pennsylvania.  While performing this work, the employee was struck by a car. The employee was taken to Paoli Hospital to be treated for fractures/contusions.

Employee was selecting orders while walking next to an electric pallet jack. The pallet jack drove onto the employee's left foot, pinning it between the pallet jack and the skid of produce in aisle 34. The employee was hospitalized due to multiple fractures to the left foot.

An employee was standing in a room next to the shaft alley of a boat on a dry dock where two employees were heating a steel coupling (shaft that holds the prop on the boat) using two rose buds with forced air and exhaust ventilation established. They were heating the coupling so it would expand and pop loose. After his shift ended, the employee called and reported difficulty breathing. He was admitted to the hospital where he was diagnosed with possible chemical pneumonia.
Employee fell 8 feet when he was transitioning from the ladder to the roof.

On February 26, 2015, an employee amputated a portion of his right middle finger to the first knuckle while arranging 600- to 800-pound I-beams by hand so the load could be picked up with the forklift.
An employee was injured when he slipped on ice and fell trying to push a company van.
Employee tripped over phone cords and was unable to ambulate afterwards.
An employee was hospitalized after falling approximately 18 inches from the first step of a step stool. The employee injured his hip and needed to be hospitalized.

Employee was standing on a pallet talking to another employee. When the employee tried to turn around, she lost her balance and fell to the warehouse floor. The employee injured her right hip and was hospitalized on 02/26/2015.
Employee using a Milwaukee Magna drill had his right index finger amputated at the second joint.
An employee was pulling a trailer in the Peterbilt Facility yard. The trailer turned sharply and the truck turned over.
While fighting a fire at the shop, employee received a burn to the left leg.
Employee slipped off a saw horse and fell resulting in a laceration to his arm that required stitches and an overnight stay at the hospital.
Employee slipped on the ice in the parking lot and fell backwards hitting his head.

Employee was cleaning insulator bushings on top of a de-energized transformer/regulator in preparation for tap switch testing. Upon energizing of control voltage for testing, employee received an electric shock.

Employee reached into the press #78 and his left index finger was severed at the second joint. The press has a pop up release which is activated after the cycle, the employee placed his hand while the pop up release was in operation catching the employee's hand between the part and the top of the press.
On 26 February 2015, an employee was installing drywall from a scissor lift approximately six feet from the ground. While working, the employee fell  off the edge of the scissor lift to the ground.
An employee was starting up a pump and a hose was not secured. As the employee tried to control the hose, he lost his balance and fell at the same level, hitting his head on the concrete.
Employee was operating a yard tractor, backing up a container; it jack-knifed and threw the operator off of the vehicle.

Employee was servicing an HVAC unit at a customer's facility. While disassembling the chiller, the employee stepped off the chiller barrel onto a pipe. The employee's foot slipped off the pipe causing him to fall approximately four feet resulting in a broken rib.
An employee was hospitalized for a possible concussion, after falling down some stairs.

At Sam's Club # 4998 in Lady Lake, Florida, an employee was injured when a forklift ran over his right foot, breaking three toes. The employee was helping to load carts when his foot was crushed by the forklift wheel.

A mobile conveyor was moved out of place for cleaning. An employee tripped over the angle iron bracing that remained on the floor. She fell forward, injuring her right arm and shoulder. She was transported to Lehigh Valley Hospital in Hazleton, then admitted to Lehigh Valley Hospital in Allentown when she experienced loss of feeling in her right hand.
Employee was putting a lock on the trailer door in the parking lot and slipped on ice, fell and broke the right ankle.

The employee was using a long board to push debris out of the conveyor, which was stopped up. The employee reached for a hand-hold and instead grabbed the conveyor. One of the 2' blocks of lumber and hit his thumb, resulting in an amputation.

On 2/26/2015, an employee was using a ladder to change a light bulb.  The employee fell from the ladder and was knocked unconscious.  The employee was hospitalized because of the injuries sustained in the fall.
Employee was burned by sulfuric acid and admitted to the hospital.

An employee had his fingertip amputated while using a rag to de-bur a piece of material coming out of a machine on the slitting line. The machine caught the rag and pulled it with the employee's finger.
On February 26, 2015, an employee suffered severe injuries while operating the A-line machine.  The employee's hand and arm were pulled into the pinch rollers during operation.
Employee was admitted to the hospital after dropping an iron casting on his foot. Employee sustained no broken bones, but foot is swollen and purple.
An employee working in the melting department was burned on the left leg when the exhaust line in the furnace loading pit exploded. The employee was admitted overnight to the hospital.
Employee was reporting for work, got out of the car, slipped on ice, fell and struck the back of the head. He was admitted to the hospital for a brain injury.
Employee was offloading steel from a truck when the load shifted, pinning his right arm between the steel. The employee did not break any bones and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee suffered a fractured left leg and was hospitalized due to being struck by an automated guided vehicle.
An employee fell in the parking lot due to ice on the walking surface.
Employee fell approximately 16 feet through a skylight to the ground inside the building.
While cleaning snow off of a roof, the employee fell through a skylight.
An employee amputated the very tip of his right-hand index finger while skinning a deer.
An employee performing maintenance on a palletizer slipped and fell backwards hitting his head on the concrete floor.

The employee was cleaning a part with a scotch brite pad when he attempted to clean the burrs out of a part while reversing the machine. The pad was caught and drawn into the machine, pulling in the employee's finger and amputating the nail end.
An employee was loading a ladder on the ladder rack of a truck. When the employee went to step down, his ring got caught on the rack and his finger was sliced open.
An employee stacking 115-pound metal skid pallets attempted to straighten a crooked one. Several pallets fell and struck the employee, resulting in a left leg fracture and ligament (MCL) damage.

The injured employee was helping chock pipe when the pipe started rolling. The employee ducked down; three pipes hit him in the back of the head and knocked him unconscious. He was transported and admitted to the hospital.

The injured employee was welding with his back to an overhead crane (fitter). The crane operator was using the crane to lift a 4'x3'x12"-wide beam assembly, but the crane was not centered over the load, causing the load to swing when lifted. The swinging beam assembly struck the bulkhead assembly behind the injured employee, causing the bulkhead assembly to fall over and hit the injured employee's body and legs.  The injured employee was hospitalized with a simple fracture in one ankle and a compound fracture in the other leg.
An employee was standing near a pot belly natural gas heater, and his clothing caught on fire.  The employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee walking at the job site slipped on ice and suffered a spiral fracture of the right femur.

On February 27, 2015, an employee severely injured his finger while moving a 50-pound vise in the Rack Maintenance Area. The employee crushed the upper portion of the right pinky finger. Medical providers removed the untreatable portion of the finger between the first and second knuckle.

The employee was attempting to rework the alignment on a seam in a rolled metal cylinder when the spot welds broke. The metal struck the employee, resulting in a fractured left leg and numerous fractures to both feet.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet from a ladder while climbing to install satellite equipment. The employee broke both ankles and an index finger.
An employee was standing on top of a pallet while stocking shelves. The employee fell from the pallet to the ground and broke her hip. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was walking through the shop, tripped over a curb, and fell backwards.  He hit his head on the floor, sustaining a concussion and three fractured ribs.

Employee was polishing stem using two feet of polishing cloth when the cloth and the employee's glove got caught in the rotating stem. The employee's left hand was pulled into the stem, resulting in a left thumb amputation.

The employee was operating a 6-inch vacuum hose in a sump. The hose kicked back, knocking the employee to the floor. He broke three bones in his right ankle. The employee was hospitalized overnight and required surgery.
An employee was helping to remove reflective pavement markers when debris caused by the sledgehammer hitting the marker struck the employee's eye.  The injured employee was wearing safety glasses.

While disconnecting the chain from the connecting point of the hangar door, the employee's left pinky got caught between the chain and the door. The tip of the pinky and the top part of the nail came off.

An employee was delivering mail to a residence. The mailbox was mounted to the outside of a fence near a gate. A pit-bull/boxer mix that was inside of the fence jumped on the gate, causing it to open. When the dog attacked the employee, she put up her right hand and the dog bit it, resulting in broken bones. She was hospitalized.

The employee was driving the powered industrial truck, stacking product on the top of the third pallet. The employee stacked the pallet and put the forklift in reverse. The employee then placed the forklift in forward, assuming that the forks were still elevated. The forklift fell on its side, causing the employee to break an ankle.
An employee's fingertip was amputated in the workplace.
An employee working on a scoring machine amputated his right pointer finger up to the first knuckle.
An employee had the left index fingertip amputated while trying to clear a jam from the tissue paper convertor machine on February 27, 2015, at 2:00 pm.
An employee was struck by a piece of facade and hospitalized.
An employee was cutting siding into 2-inch strips using a circular saw on a saw horse. The strip started to buckle; the employee reached to grab it, cutting the palm at the finger joint.
An employee amputated his fingers while using a saw.

Employee was attempting to remove meat/fat particle from an auger with a stream of water. The employee then attempted to remove the particle with his hand. While attempting to remove the particle, the employee lost the middle finger on the left hand.
Mail carrier slipped on ice and fell breaking her left ankle. She was wearing spiked shoes at the time of the incident

The employee was helping a truck driver adjust the rear tandems on his tractor trailer.  The employee was under the trailer attempting to adjust the tandems when they slipped forward, pinning is left arm at the elbow area between the trailer and the tandem.  The employee was taken to Creighton University Hospital where doctors amputated the arm midway down his left bicep.
Employee inhaled muriatic acid.
Employee slipped on ice and fell while crossing the street. Employee broke two ribs and punctured a lung.
Employee fell at the jobsite trailer and sustained a leg fracture. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
A worker slipped on ice and fell walking from his mobile crane to the office.  He sustained a broken right ankle and was hospitalized for two nights.
An employee was attaching a compressor to a skid with a pneumatic impact driver. The employee's finger got caught in the driver, which tore off his fingertip; the injury did not involve the bone.

An employee pulled a car around for customers. The customers got in the car. The employee was preparing to close the door when a blue VW ran into him and the car, dragging him 90 feet and then running him over.

The employee helped finish installing deep foundation and began disassembling equipment at the site. While dismantling the crane, the employee used a hammer to knock a pin from a boom to disassemble it. The boom fell on the employee, resulting in an in-patient hospitalization and injuries to the wrist, both ankles, and the leg, as well as a possible back injury.
An employee was injured while unhooking a truck from the wrecker, requiring hospitalization.

An employee dismounted a powered industrial truck before it came to a complete stop. The employee's foot became wedged between the skate rail and was rolled onto by the vehicle, resulting in a crushed ankle.
Employee was walking outside near the engine room office at National Beef when he fell on the ice/snow and broke his tibia and fibula bones.
An employee was conducting a snowboarding class lesson on the ski slope when a customer on a snowboard collided with him, causing serious injuries.
An employee fell off of a ladder and struck their head on a concrete floor. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell while skiing and broke their tibia bone.
An employee was grooming a cat with a nail trimmer when the cat bit the employee. The employee was admitted to the hospital for an infection between the hand and index finger.
Employee was using a band saw in the commissary's butcher shop area to process meat for resale when he amputated the tip of his left thumb.
An employee performing roofing work fell approximately 12 feet.  He was laying down substrate at the time of the accident in preparation for the placement of roof shingles.

An employee was cleaning out a scrap box. The employee waved to the PIT operator to reverse. The operator started to reverse when his foot slipped. The PIT moved forward and pinned the employee between the scrap box and a guardrail.

An employee on a ladder was moving a box of meat from a storage rack when he twisted and reinjured his back. He fell approximately 2 feet and was admitted to the hospital for back treatment/possible surgery.
An employee was setting up a demo cart and preparing for a food demonstration. She turned and tripped on the rubber mat causing a fall that broke her hip.
On 3-1-15 at 12:30 pm, an employee operating a manual vegetable dicer amputated the left index fingertip. The fingertip was pinned and reattached.
An employee was inserting new pumps on the landing gear of an airplane. When the employee dismounted, he felt pain in his back.
On or about March 1, 2015, an employee sustained an amputation injury to the left middle finger while unjamming a snow blower.
On 3/1/15, an employee was struck by a passenger vehicle in a roadside work zone, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was draining condensate out of the treater line when a flash fire occurred, causing second degree burns.
An employee amputated approximately a quarter of an inch of a fingertip and also lost part of another fingertip on the same hand.
An employee amputated his fingertip while sharpening a chisel.
An employee's left ring finger broke due to being smashed between two parts of a dumper food processing machine. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
Employee slipped on ice and fell striking the head.
An employee working in the store was injured when a vehicle struck the building.
An employee got struck by an "I" beam and fell approximately 4 feet.

An employee was lifting a pipe into place with a hoist. The pipe came loose and caught his right hand between the pipe and a fusion machine. The pipe was rigged with a choker but not shackled.  The employee's right little finger was crushed and he was hospitalized.
An employee was working on a pipe with a breakout wrench when it slipped and severed his left ring fingertip.
An employee tripped and fell, striking his head against the corner of the house. He was admitted to hospital for head lacerations and overnight observation.
An employee engaged in roofing activities fell through the roof. He was transported and admitted to Kendall Regional Medical Center in Miami.
An employee was completely engulfed by silage at the entrance of an outdoor silage bunker. The employee sustained a spinal vertebra fracture, right hip fracture, and head laceration.
An employee walking to the break area slipped on mud and fell onto the concrete floor breaking his right femur.
An employee was emptying the contents of an aerosol can. The aerosol can ignited and burned the employee's hands, forearm, neck, and lower part of face.

An employee was cleaning the units on the second floor when he stepped on a loose platform close to the forklift and fell 10 feet to the ground. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right elbow and had surgery.
Employee was cleaning the press filter when he got pinned against a rack by a forklift.

An employee arrived at the facility early in the morning and was shoveling snow off of the front walk when he stepped on some ice. He tried to catch his fall, but the weight of his body broke the lower portion of his left leg. He was hospitalized.
The employee was leaving work. While boarding the shuttle, the employee missed a step and fell, fracturing her right clavicle.
An employee had delivered new appliances and was loading the old appliances onto the truck.  The employee's left middle finger caught in the tailgate, cutting through tendons and part of the bone.

An employee's right index fingertip was amputated on March 3, 2014. The employee was taking down operating room lights at OSU East Hospital. When the employee went to set the light down on the ground, a spring snapped on the light and caught the employee's finger.
An employee was assembling a metal part to a frame when the sheet metal dislodged and cut a tendon above the cut-resistance glove on his arm.

An employee was removing a pump from a roller machine. He took his gloves off to remove bolts. The 86-lb. pump slipped; he went to grab it, and his finger was sheered off between the pump and the frame of the machine.

An employee was on a 6-foot fiberglass stepladder, pulling wire through a conduit for a 24-volt DC fire alarm system. The employee fell off of the stepladder and suffered a head injury and broken rib.
Employee was hospitalized after cutting his finger while operating a water-jet cutting machine.
The driver of a front-end loader waste dump truck fell from the top of the truck to the pavement and was hospitalized with a broken neck.
Employee was pulling copper out of the copper shear when he felt pressure on his left thumb finger. His fingertip was cut when he tried to pull his thumb out.
Around 7:30 PM, an employee tripped over a rope and fell on his right arm. The employee complained about pain on his right elbow and was hospitalized.
A telescopic Kelly bar dropped on an employee's hand while he was digging a hole with an auger, crushing his left index finger.

An employee notified the press operator that he was ready for the press table to be lowered. As the table was lowering, the employee leaned over on the table; his first, right-hand finger got caught between the die strap and the table.

An employee was working from a step ladder to install cable at a bank when the ladder slipped out from underneath him due to snow and ice on the walkway. He broke his leg and was admitted to the hospital.

An employee slammed his left ring finger while attempting to close his truck's double doors.  An approximately 1/4" piece of his left fingertip was amputated (flesh only, not bone), and he sustained a minor fracture in the same fingertip.

An employee was placing plugs into tank bushings. The tester operator actuated the test sequence, causing the safety door to close while the employee's hand was in the door. The employee's left ring finger was amputated halfway down to the fingernail.
An employee shoveling snow outside of the facility slipped and hit his head.
An employee operating a tail stretcher machine sustained a partial finger amputation. The employee's fingers were not guarded and the left index fingertip was smashed.

On 3/02/2015, an employee was working in the freight sorting building on an outbound slide. At approximately 8:30 PM, the employee was sorting freight when she tripped on the edge of a floor mat that was slightly elevated, falling on her right hip. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee's finger was amputated when a piece of unsecured plywood slid off of a forklift and smashed the left-hand pinky finger between two plywood stacks.
An employee driving a forklift collided with a second employee who was driving a forklift with a pallet attached to it. The employee injured the left foot.
An employee slipped on a wet floor and fell.
An employee was fitting plating when the plating shifted and crushed the third and fourth digits on the right hand. The employee was taken to the emergency room where pins were put in.
On or about March 02, 2015, an employee suffered multiple fractures to her right arm requiring hospitalization after being caught in a rolling conveyor.
An employee received burns to his face, head, and chest while refueling a motorhome with propane.
Employee's hand got caught between a belt and sprocket during startup operations. The employee was hospitalized.

The injured employee was standing halfway up a fold-down attic ladder, receiving instructions on what materials/equipment would be needed to fully repair the attic heater. While descending the ladder, the employee missed a step, fell, and fractured a vertebra in the thoracic area of the back.
On March 2, 2015, an employee entering his office from outdoors fell and fractured his hip.  The employee was hospitalized.
Employee's right ring finger was amputated by the blade on the meat-cutting machine.
Employee was walking into work in the parking lot and slipped on ice and fell striking the head.
An employee was attempting to get a ride on a sit-down forklift from another operator when he fell off the side of the forklift. The rear wheel ran over the injured employee's leg.
An employee was working on the third deck. As he was using a ladder to come down, he fell and sustained an injury.
Employee on the roof was checking a stand pipe and slipped and fell breaking a hip.

An employee was returning to the work area when a truck driver lost control, drove through the parking lot, and struck the building where the employee works. The employee was pinned under the truck and building debris.

An employee working on the production line between the window washer and the oven received a severe injury when the employee's arm was pulled into the conveyor system by the employee's smock waist strap.
