Employee fell on ice while delivering mail, resulting in a broken leg and displaced ankle joint.
An employee was loading trash into the back of the garbage truck when he was struck by a drunk driver.
An employee was taking a Rhesus monkey out of the rig. She was unfastening the last head post when the monkey bit her right small finger.

Two large metal doors that swing inward/outward were being closed to perform high-pressure tests on the SB-BOP. The injured employee's left index finger's distal phalanx got pinched/stuck between the doors while closing them. The employee jerked the hand away and sustained an amputation (no bone removal) to the finger.
An employee was working in the edible cutting section using a conveyor fed belt saw. His thumb made contact with the saw blade, removing the tip of his left thumb halfway down the thumbnail.
Employee was in a car accident while delivering food.
Employee got his finger caught in a machine.
An employee climbing a ladder fell 12 feet and injured his right wrist and both ankles.

An employee was inspecting a tooling knife on a slitting machine. The employee fell into the machine when it was jogged forward. His left foot was degloved up to the ankle, and he broke numerous bones. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was injured on the harvest floor while opening shanks. The employee suffered a laceration to the right forearm and was hospitalized.
An employee was using a ladder, missed a step, fell, and fractured his leg.
The employee was salting the sidewalks and slipped on ice and fell resulting in a fracture.

An employee had just retrieved a full 30 lb. propane tank from storage and was walking and carrying the tank to place it on a forklift truck. The employee slipped on ice and fell breaking his fibula and tibia bones.
An employee was unloading a trailer using a forklift. While reversing the forklift, the employee struck the dock door, fracturing the left thumb.
Employee's left hand got caught in a conveyor belt and pulley while increasing the tension. The employee's left index finger was amputated.
An employee was shocked when he pushed the start button on a vibrator to shake material out of a bin. He fell back onto a 32-inch highway concrete barrier and hit his right shoulder and left cheek.

On 3/3/15, an employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell.  The employee was immediately taken for medical treatment where X-rays showed a broken right arm or humerus.  The employee was scheduled to see an Orthopedist on 3/4/15.  Following the appointment with the Orthopedist, the employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery on her broken humerus.
Employee slipped on ice in a customer's parking lot and fell resulting in two broken ribs and a punctured lung.
One employee fell and struck his head against a tree stump.

An employee slipped or tripped when bending over to pick up metal studs from the storage area.  The employee fell onto the pile of metal studs and received a laceration that resulted in a hospitalization and surgery to repair the tendon.
An employee was struck by falling blocks from a crane.
Employee fell approximately 4 four feet from the top of a precast concrete wall, injuring his head and fracturing his ribs.  Sleet was a contributing factor.
An employee was moving equipment when she tripped over equipment cord, hitting her face on a shelf.
While in the parking lot, the employee slipped on black ice and fell on her back resulting in skull fracture.
The injured employee's hair got caught in the unguarded belts of a die-cutting machine as he was making an adjustment to the machine. His hair and scalp were removed.
Molten metal spilled from a ladle onto an employee's left foot, causing burns and hospital admission.

An employee was cleaning a pump near the marination mix tank. She removed the piping but did not remove the cover and reached into the opening. She felt the sharpness of the impeller and quickly withdrew her hand. The distal portion of the third finger on the left hand was amputated.
A robotic arm pinned an employee's head to a CNC machine while he was performing maintenance work.
A worker was cutting steel tubing using a band saw. His right index finger was amputated by the blade.
An employee fell off of a ladder at a jobsite and was admitted to the hospital after sustaining broken ribs.

An employee was hanging a lashing bar on the aft end of the ship. The bar popped out of the corner and pinched the employee's right thumb between the railing and the lashing bar. The thumb tip was severed.
An employee slipped on ice, sustaining a concussion, broken right femur, and crushed knee.
An employee amputated the left index finger at the first knuckle while operating a Skilsaw to cut the end of a board.
A maintenance employee was using a drill press when their left pinky finger was caught in a slot on the work bench, resulting in a fingertip amputation.

Employee was walking between the garage and his truck, carrying an approximately 25 lb. cable reel. He slipped on the snow and fell.  He drove himself to the hospital, suffered a hernia and had surgery.

An employee was operating a shaper to mold pieces of wood when a piece of wood got thrown out of the shaper and caused the employee's fingers to make contact with the shaper knife. He lost the first digit of his ring finger, more than half of his middle finger, and his index fingertip to the bone on the right hand, requiring hospitalization.

A safe door closed on the employee's right middle finger. Her finger was bleeding, so she sat down on the chair by the safe. When she stood up, she fainted and fell forward, hitting her face on the computer console on the edge of the desk. She was discovered by a coworker on the floor. The employee broke her tooth. She was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was exposed to steam that contained sodium sulfate, tetrasodium pyrophosphate, and potassium hydroxide while working on an HVAC system in the basement/mechanical room of the hospital.
An employee was delivering a package when ice and snow fell from the roof and struck her. She sustained a fractured ankle, as well as rib and lung injuries, and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee, who was unloading a truck, slipped on ice, fell, struck his head, and was admitted to hospital.
The employee was traveling through the shop area in the dark to turn on the lights when she tripped over a lawnmower and fractured her left ankle.
An employee slipped on ice and fell suffering a broken wrist which required surgery.
Employee was walking between two buildings and slipped on a side walk and fell landing on her knee.
On March 4, 2015, an employee spreading ice melt slipped on ice and fractured his right ankle.

An employee was using a come-along while performing maintenance on the leaf springs of a bus. The come-along slipped out of position and struck the employee in the right temporal lobe area, resulting in a deep laceration and fractured skull.

On Monday, March 2, 2015, at approximately 7:00 pm, an employee was operating a blow molding machine. The employee reached past the guard, and the machine cycled and smashed four fingers on the employee's right hand. The employee sustained an amputation of the fourth digit, partial amputation of the fifth digit, and a full thickness burn to the right middle finger. The employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee injured his wrist and head when he slipped on a three-rung ladder. He was admitted to the hospital and treated.
An employee sustained head injuries when he fell 54 inches off the back end of a conveyor load truck and landed on the concrete.

An employee fell from the third floor to the second floor when his foot got stuck on a pallet. He fell with the pallet to the second floor. He broke his femur and was admitted to the hospital and treated.
An employee amputated a fingertip while attaching a tandem trailer dolly to the first trailer's pintle hook.
An employee fell through the roof while inspecting the wood to see if it was rotten. He injured his lower lumbar.
An employee was prepping a recreational race course surface by side-slipping his skis.  The employee caught his downhill ski edge and fell, fracturing several ribs and rupturing his spleen.
An employee pushing the breakfast cart across the street from the church kitchen to the school slipped on ice and broke his left ankle, resulting in hospitalization and surgery.
An employee's finger was caught between two flange faces while manually positioning a portable pipe skid.
An employee suffered an amputation of his index fingertip when he tried to unjam the bagging machine.

An employee was using 2-inch, clear packaging tape to secure boxes on a pallet. He inhaled a small piece of the tape while cutting it by mouth, and the tape adhered to a portion of his mid-to-upper throat. He was admitted to the hospital and underwent treatment.

An employee was hand washing an aluminum casting at the "hand wash cabinet" (machine) using 3,700 psi water pressure to remove ceramic materials from the casting. The employee was wearing hand protection (double glove with inner neoprene and outer cut-resistant Kevlar with neoprene coating). The employee suffered a water injection injury to the right middle finger, requiring overnight hospitalization and surgery at Barnes St. Peters.
A maintenance employee slipped from a railing 18 inches from the floor and fractured his elbow.

Employee was standing on the second floor dismantling a metal mod structure when he fell through the sheet metal and cut his left arm to the bone near his elbow. He was wearing fall protection and did not impact the floor but suffered the cut on the way down.

An employee was struck and run over by the front left tire of a rough terrain forklift. The rough terrain forklift was carrying a load of logs, and the forklift operator was driving towards the scale.  The injured employee was hospitalized.
Employee sustained an amputation of the right pinky fingertip while loading a wooden reel onto a pack line. His right little finger was crushed between the flange and the reel.

The employee reached into a poultry skinning machine to push meat through. The metal mesh glove she was wearing became caught and pulled her hand into the machine, amputating her middle fingertip and nail.
Employee fell suffering 3 fractured ribs and a collapsed lung.
On March 4, 2015, an employee was hospitalized due to an electrical shock.

An HVAC maintenance employee was descending five flights of stairs when he slipped and/or lost his footing and fell. The employee sustained fractured ribs and was hospitalized. The employer stated that snow and ice were contributing factors.
The employee was carrying a piece of plywood on the second floor of the residential structure. The employee fell over the edge approximately 8 feet.
An employee fell 6.5 feet from a piece of equipment while installing an exhaust hood.

On March 04, 2015, at approximately 4:30 p.m., two employees were preparing to depart the construction area due to rain. The injured employee went to retrieve his wallet from his lunch pail in the back of the truck they were going to drive. While he was in the back of the truck, a Porta John truck was reversing and sideswiped him between the two trucks. The employee was admitted to Odessa Medical Center Hospital.
Employee cut his hand while moving a glass tabletop from a storage container to a garbage dumpster.
An employee walking down the stairs missed the last step and fell on the floor, fracturing her hip.

On 3/5/15 around noon, an employee fell approximately 8' from a ladder when the ductwork he was releasing swung down, hit the ladder, and rocked it. The employee sustained two left arm fractures (wrist and elbow) and a possible pelvis fracture. The employee was transported to ECMC where he was treated and released.
An employee suffered a leg fracture after slipping and falling approximately four feet off a damp platform.
Employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and fell.
An employee was raking dirt behind a skid loader; the operator did not see him and ran him over. He was transported to the hospital.
An employee slipped on ice and fell injuring his left ankle.

On March 5, 2015, an employee was hospitalized after suffering a foot injury on the job. The employee was standing next to a trench at ground level while lowering a concrete pipe into the ground when the pipe struck the employee in the leg.
Employee was struck in his back with a chain while walking behind a vehicle-mounted drilling rig.
Employee slipped on snow and fell, breaking his ankle in three places.

Employee was cutting the butt end of a utility pole with a chainsaw . The chainsaw made contact with the employee's foot, which was near the point of operation, resulting in severe laceration and broken bones.

An employee was using a forklift to unload sprinkler pipes that were 2 to 4 inches in diameter, roughly 19 feet long, and came in bundles weighing 1,800 to 2,000 pounds. The pipes were delivered on a straight truck. The employee was only able to unload the bundles from one side. The last bundle was 6 inches away, so a lever was used to try and move the bundle towards the forklift. One of the support lumbers shifted, causing the employee to jolt his back.
Employee slipped on ice and fell in a customer parking lot.  The employee will require surgery to repair a broken leg.
An employee was conducting repairs on the horizontal expander. The equipment was not locked out. The gear energized and crushed his left index finger, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee fell from the second floor, at a height of approximately 10 feet, while installing sheetrock. The employee did not have a personal fall arrest system at the time of the accident.
An employee was cleaning a grinder when the grinder blade dropped on his left hand. The employee pulled his hand out of his glove and amputated his left middle fingertip.
An employee cut his ring fingertip while operating a bottling machine, resulting in a finger amputation.
Employee sustained partial amputations of his right-hand index and middle fingers when his hand got caught in a nip point while operating a ball former.
An employee was being trained to operate a forklift when he lost control, bumped a guardrail, and broke his lower right leg.
An employee partially amputated his left-hand middle finger when his hand got caught between the forklift he was operating and a vat dumper safety bar.

The injured employee was auditing inventory/scanning freight using a ladder. The employee was holding on to the ladder with the right hand and held a telxon in the left hand. While descending the ladder, the employee missed the third step and fell approximately 4 feet to the ground. The employee landed on the left leg, breaking it in several places.
An employee was injured on 3-5-15 at 5:00PM when the employee slipped on ice and fell in the parking area. The employee was hospitalized and surgically treated for a foot/ankle injury.

An employee was installing decking on top of bar joists and welding it in place. A piece of decking was not adequately supported by the bar joists. The employee stepped on that piece, which caved in under his weight, and fell about 12' onto the concrete ground, resulting in a hospitalization.
An employee fell from a bicycle while patrolling the park and was hospitalized.
On or about March 5, 2015, an employee suffered fractures to both feet after falling approximately 6 feet during a training exercise (mock drill - high angle rescue).

An employee was performing carpentry work using a nail gun to nail bracing for a new residential dwelling's soffits. He was descending the ladder when the nail gun bumped the ladder and discharged a nail into his kneecap.
The employee was walking on the south side of the facility and slipped on slush and water and fell suffering a fractured hip.
Employee fell on ice when walking across the parking lot.

At approximately 3:30 AM on March 5, 2015, an employee cleaning a pit was pushing mud toward a vacuum hose when he felt a pull in his groin area. A supervisor and employees aided the employee who exited the pit and, upon further examination, determined that a hernia had occurred. The employee was admitted to the hospital and required surgery.
The end of an employee's left-hand middle finger was amputated by an unguarded hole punch machine.
An employee was moving a piece of steel into place for rigging. The piece crushed his fingertip and required closure by a physician. The crushing injury was classified as an amputation.
An employee walking down the ramp at a patient's home slipped and sustained two fractures in the left leg.
A truck driver slipped and broke his right wrist while dismounting from inside the garbage truck.
An employee slipped on ice, fell and hit his head on the ground of a barn while feeding the horses.
An employee was unloading freight from the back of the trailer with a two wheeled dolly when he slipped on the lip of the trailer, fell to the ground, and fractured his left elbow.
An employee was hospitalized after being intoxicated by carbon monoxide at his jobsite.
An employee working on the picker conveyor was hospitalized after cutting his arm between the wrist and elbow on March 6, 2015.

On 3/6/15 at 4:30 p.m., an employee was trying to move a co-extruder towards the extrusion line to get it back on the extrusion line track. The employee used a pry bar to move the machine forward, while a second employee tried to loosen the wheel. The second employee's right index finger got caught between the pry bar and the machine track.
An employee was struck by drywall sheets, which broke his leg at the knee.

An employee was using a saw that kept clogging with sawdust. The employee placed the vac hose at the bottom of the saw, and the hose was sucked into the bottom. He sustained an amputation to his right-hand index finger.
Employee was lifting pipes when the pipes slipped and fell onto the employee's fingers resulting in medical amputation.

An employee was welding black iron pipe for stem lines at the new Limited Brands facility under construction in Johnstown, Ohio. The employee left work early due to an extreme headache. He was taken to the hospital where he was diagnosed with carbon monoxide intoxication.
An employee was working behind the cash register when she became lightheaded and fainted. She fell and hit her head against the cash register. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

A contractor hired to replace an old pipeline damaged it with a backhoe and created a leak. There was a trench about 3 feet deep and 18 inches wide. The injured employee was on scene to evaluate the leak. He moved from one side of the trench to the other. The soil on the opposite side gave way and exposed a tree root; he hit his chin on that root. The employee broke two bones in his left leg about 2 inches from his ankle.
An employee operating a chop saw sustained a partial amputation of his finger when the blade caught his glove. The machine guard had not stopped at the time.
An employee suffered a partial amputation of the thumb tip while using a table saw.
An employee was caulking a commerical building and fell off a ladder approximately 15 feet. The employee sustained injuries such as a fractured left ankle, wrist, and right tibia.
Employee slipped on ice and fell in the parking lot.
Employee slipped on ice and fell in the parking lot while walking from the building to the truck.
An employee tripped over a concrete parking barrier while walking back to the delivery truck, breaking his femur.
Employee slipped on ice and fell when stepping out of his truck. He was admitted to the hospital with rib injuries.

An employee was using a screw gun and handling a metal stud. When he went to put the screw into the metal stud, the tip of the screw gun hit the middle of his hand. The worker was hospitalized and received three stitches.

An employee was injured when the stand-up forklift he was driving hit a parked forklift. One of the parked forklift's forks entered the cab, struck his foot, and cut his foot and leg. He was hospitalized.
An employee slipped on ice walking to the car in the parking lot.  The employee was taken to the hospital and had surgery on the left ankle.
An employee slipped on ice in the facility's parking lot, injuring the back of his head.
An employee's hand/fingers were crushed while positioning a wall form, which was being lifted into place by a crane.
An employee partially amputated his right middle finger while cleaning a metal bar that separates two pieces of a conveyor belt in the bakery department.
An employee broke her ankle when she slipped on ice in the parking lot. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.
An employee was unloading a truck with trusses. He was unbanning the metal band on the side of the truck when the band broke and caused a bundle of trusses to fall on the employee.
An employee was hit by a Bobcat vehicle and was hospitalized.
An employee was walking to the store loading dock when he slipped and fell on ice. He injured his hip and buttocks area.
Employee slipped on black ice on the sidewalk and fell while walking from her car to the building to start her work day.  She hit her head and was knocked unconscious.

On 3/06/2015 at approximately 9:44 AM, an employee was injured when he lost his footing on top of a 9 foot wall while installing ceiling joists and fell backwards onto the concrete floor below. The employee was admitted to the hospital with a brain injury.
An employee walking across the parking into the hospital slipped and fell on ice, injuring her back.

At approximately 11:00 a.m., employees were working at Manchester Terminal onboard a vessel. Approximately 12 employees were loading  5' x 10' steel plates onto the vessel (BBC Plata). The ship's crane was loading the plates inside the vessel with assistance from the employees. During the operation, two of the injured employee's fingers got pinched between two plates. He pulled away, and his left-hand, middle ring fingertip was partially severed (degloving).

On March 7, 2015, at 3 AM, an employee was cleaning a roller with a rag. The roller was in operation at the time. The rag became entangled and was pulled into the roller, pulling the employee's hand in with it and resulting in an amputation to his right ring fingertip.
An employee tripped over a hose connected to a rail car, fell, and landed on his right hip.
An employee was removing a die when another employee started the machine.
An employee was riding on the back of a company pickup truck. As the driver took a right-hand turn, the employee fell off and suffered head trauma.

An employee was working in the small bar finishing area, when he attempted to reach a spray can of lubricant located on the small bar table inside the guarded area. He was using a rod to manipulate the can closer to the guard rail by reaching over the guard rail, when the carry-over arm struck him, pulled him over the guard rail, and dragged him to the floor. The carry-over arm continued its operation as the employee fell below its operation range. The employee received injuries to his shoulder and ribs.
An employee fell from a three-step ladder and struck her head on the floor, resulting in a fractured skull.
An employee was loading a trailer with a covered wagon (all-purpose container) when she looked down and saw that she was bleeding. She was wearing gloves. Her fingertip was amputated.
An employee was making rounds in the Inmate Housing Unit C when he slipped on wet stairs inside of the housing unit and fell injuring his neck and back.

An employee had just adjusted a nut on the motorcycle tire-building machine he was servicing. He instructed the operator to put the machine into auto mode. When the employee's hand entered the machine, the beadset (a movable part on the machine) moved forward, and his wrist got caught in a crush point between the beadset and the drum.
An employee amputated the tip of the left-hand middle finger while operating a drill.
An employee's leg was amputated after being caught in an auger.

An employee was sitting on top of a toolbox while riding in the back of a pickup truck. When the truck made a right turn, the employee slid and fell off the left side of the truck onto the side of the road.
The employee slipped on ice and fell while working in the loading and receiving area of the store.
An employee was replacing an overhead door recoil cable when the cable tightened and pressed his thumb against the overhead door track.  His left thumb was amputated at the tip of the bone.
An employee was struck and injured by another employee's personal vehicle on 03/08/15.
An employee was being trained to operate a stand-up type powered industrial truck, which resulted in the employee's left foot being crushed and lacerated.
An employee amputated her left middle fingertip.
Employee slipped and fell in the parking lot suffering a broken leg.
An employee fell approximately 6 feet off of a rig structure while nippling up the BOP and broke a tibia.

On March 8, 2015, at approximately 8:08 p.m., an employee disconnected a hose from a cylinder of allyl alcohol. He carried the hose to an area and began cleaning the hose with toluene when he experienced shortness of breath. An air evacuation was requested and the employee was air lifted to the hospital and hospitalized for chest pains.
Employee slipped on black ice in the establishment's parking lot and broke his ankle.

An employee was using an air nozzle attached to a hose when she tripped and fell over the hose and a T-handle. The employee broke her left ulna and radial bones in her forearm. She was hospitalized and required surgery to repair the broken bones.
On March 8, 2015, at approximately 10:00 a.m., an employee exited the cab of his hydraulic link belt crane and fell 6 feet to the ground. The employee was hospitalized for a possible rib fracture.
An employee was hospitalized after his arm got caught between two rollers in the slitter machine.

An employee received multiple burns to his upper body when the T-shirt underneath his welding shirt caught on fire while welding. He received second and third degree burns on his head, neck, back, and right arm. The T-shirt was flammable.
An employee was disassembling an HVAC unit on the roof when he fell through a skylight.
An employee fractured his hip because he tripped and fell at a construction site.
After resetting an HMI, an employee crawled over a conveyor and reached up to grab the guarding. His wedding ring got caught on the guarding, resulting in the amputation of his left ring finger.
An employee was burned while operating a grinder.

An employee was on a 12-foot step ladder changing a light bulb in the facility. Another employee drove his vehicle into the building and bumped the ladder; the injured employee fell off and broke both ankles.
Employee slipped and fell in the company parking lot on her way to work and broke her leg.
Mail carrier slipped on ice and fell suffering a chest injury.
The injured employee was stepping off of the bus. When he stepped down, he slipped and fell off of the bus step.
An employee was hospitalized with head trauma after falling from an 8-foot ladder while attempting to open an overhead valve.
An employee was retrieving equipment out of the janitor's closet, and her foot was propping the door open. Her foot slipped and her finger got smashed in the door.
An employee was trying to clean residue off of the trim take-away conveyor motor with a screw driver. The employee's right index fingertip was amputated.
An employee fell 10 feet to the ground from a scissor lift while working on a construction project. Upon impact, the employee broke his nose and other facial bones.
The employee was lining up a hole on a planter axle. The planter axle part shifted (overcentered) and severed the bottom portion of the employee's left index finger (pad).
An employee was pulling a unit load device (container) when his foot slipped, got caught on the MB can, and was amputated.
An employee was stepping up into the back of a trailer in the yard to remove trash when she slipped and fell backwards, hitting her tailbone on the concrete ground.

On 03/09/15, at approximately 10:30 a.m., an employee was working from an aluminum ladder that was leaning against a tank. The employee fell approximately 4 feet off of the ladder and landed on a cement barrier. The employee suffered three broken ribs and a bruised kidney and was admitted to UPMC-Presbyterian.
An employee amputated his left-hand ring finger while operating a molding press. The safety guard was bypassed at the time of the accident.
An employee was washing dishes when she slipped, fell, and broke her hip.  She was hospitalized.
Employee slipped and fell on an icy sidewalk resulting in a compound fracture of the leg.
An employee was running along the road as part of his physical training requirements and was struck by a vehicle.
An employee's foot got caught in the unload auger when he entered a grain bin to move a flexible cord.
A worker slipped and fell breaking her hip.
Employee fell into an 8' manhole.

An employee severely injured his right-hand pinky finger while changing brakes on a truck tractor.  The tool used to hold tension on the brake components slipped, and the components crushed the finger.

On March 9, 2015, an employee sustained distal amputations of the third and fourth right-hand digits while operating a conical paper cup-forming machine. The employee was feeding paper in order to start production on the machine.

An employee slipped on ice in the entryway to the building and broke a leg. A second employee received an electrical shock in the slitting department, causing shortness of breath.

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer. These events are captured as one report.
An employee slipped on ice and caught himself while getting out of his truck at the company-owned quarry. He injured his right, lower leg.
Employee slipped and fell from his truck, breaking his hip.

An employee was helping to run wire cable onto the boom of a crawler crane when the loose part of his safety harness lanyard got caught in the rotating drum. The drum then pulled him into a pinch point. He was hospitalized.

On Tuesday, March 10, 2015, an employee walking through the blocking department/packing area tripped as she was walking around some boxes. She fell to the floor, sustaining fractures to both of her upper arms. She was admitted to the hospital for her injuries.
On or about 3/10/2015, at approximately 7:00 a.m., an employee was injured on a stationary miter saw, which resulted in an amputation to the left ring finger.
On Tuesday, March 10, 2015, at approximately 6:05 AM, an employee slipped on an icy sidewalk at FCI Allenwood and sustained a severe leg and arm injury. She was hospitalized.

On March 10, 2015, two employees were stocking new cabinets on the shelf using a forklift. One of the employees stepped back and tripped over one of the forks. He fell back and hit his head on a steel beam. He was admitted to the hospital with head trauma.
An employee was cleaning the dryer inlet duct from a ladder and fell, which resulted in a fractured right foot.
An employee was shelving items in the meat cooler when he collapsed and fell from a 5-foot, metal A-frame ladder. He was found on the ground with his feet resting on the second rung of the ladder.

On March 10, 2015, at approximately 1:40 p.m., an employee was using a tag line to guide pipe being moved by a trackhoe operator. As the pipe was turned near the well pad, the employee tripped and fell on the blind side of the trackhoe. The trackhoe ran over the employee's left leg, resulting in hospitalization and amputation.

On or about 1555 hours on March 10, 2015, the right intermediate and distal phalanges of an employee's middle finger were amputated after his finger got caught in the pulley of a winch he was operating. The employee was holding the winch cable with his right hand due to a kink in the line and operating the winch with his left hand when his hand was pulled into the pulley. He was hospitalized and the phalanges were surgically removed.
An employee was exiting a 15-passenger van when the van moved forward while he was in the doorway. He fell out to the ground and injured his back and left leg.
An employee was conducting pressure testing on a vertical pipe when the pressure blew the cap off, causing it to hit his nose. He was transported to the hospital to receive medical attention.
An employee fell and fractured her ankle while walking in the parking lot. She was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was disconnecting chlorine gas system tubing to attach a chlorine cylinder to the water treatment system when a small amount of chlorine gas escaped. The employee was taken to the hospital and admitted.
An employee was offloading a unit train when a rail genie ran over his left elbow, causing a laceration and muscle tear to his left bicep.

An employee was working on a pallet dismantler machine when he reached his right hand into the machine to remove a piece of wood that was causing a jam. The tip of the employee's right thumb was amputated.

On March 10, 2015, at approximately 10 a.m., an employee fell down a flight of stairs during work and injured his back. He fell approximately 10 feet from the second floor to the first and was taken to UAB Hospital.
An employee was walking in an office when he tripped over another employee, causing him to strike the corner of a desk and break his hip.
An employee installing gutters fell off an 8 foot step ladder onto the ground (concrete pavers) below.  The employee suffered a fractured hip, which resulted in an overnight stay in the hospital.
An employee attempting to remove a quick-release mechanism suffered a fingertip amputation from a spring-loaded pin in the opening where his finger was inserted.

On or about March 10, 2015, at 2:30 p.m., two employees got struck by a drilling motor and a cart. While pushing the cart from the outside of the building to the inside, the cart tipped and the drilling motor fell off. The cart struck the first employee in the torso area and pinned him underneath. The cart struck the second employee when it tipped and propelled to the side. The second employee sustained a forehead contusion, fractured left ankle, right ear laceration, and fractured facial bone. Both employees were taken to the hospital.

An employee was on a pallet set on top of the Daewoo forklift's forks in order to store furniture on the mezzanine. He fell 14 feet to the ground, fracturing his collar bone and lower back and sustaining trauma to his head.

On or about 3/10/2015, at approximately 9:30 a.m., an employee was seriously injured when a diesel engine fell and struck the employee in the head. The employee was transported to the hospital with a skull fracture.
Employees were overexposed to carbon monoxide during agency operations on 3/10/15.
An employee's left third and fourth digits were amputated while removing a jam from an extrusion line shear.
An employee was moving a chute on the bone and cone line when his right thumb got caught between the wrench and the chute, amputating the thumb tip. The machine was operating at the time.
An employee was hospitalized overnight for observation after she slipped on ice while entering the building and broke her ankle/leg.

Worker was sitting on top of a railroad tank car changing a threaded valve. He slipped and fell approximately 11 feet to the ground below  striking his shoulder and lacerating his forhead requiring three stitches and five staples to close.
Employee slipped and fell approximately 20-30 feet while descending a fixed vertical ship's ladder fracturing the left ankle.

An employee installing electrical conduit in a room with sodium hypochlorite piping fell from the ladder that he was working on and onto the piping. The hazardous chemical splashed on his left leg and arm. The employee was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was tracking and training a belt. After replacing a roller on the conveyor, the employee contacted the rotating part and became entangled in the equipment. The employee suffered injuries and was admitted to Mercy Hospital in Clinton, Iowa.
While lowering sheets of plywood, an employee's finger got caught between a piece of the plywood and the scissor lift.
An employee partially amputated the pinky finger.
An employee delivering packages injured a knee while walking in a snow-covered area.
An employee who was unloading pallets tripped on plastic packing at the same level, fell, and broke his right hip.
An employee was working on a salt auger when his arm got caught in it, causing an injury.
An employee was injured while cutting rebar with a Quickie Saw. The saw kicked backed, striking him on the right side of the face. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was coming down from the roof in a caged ladder when he lost his footing and fell to the ground below.
An employee was using a 7 1/4 inch circular saw to cut the ocean's flooring when the blade lacerated his right thigh, requiring stitches.
An employee was injured by a falling box.
An employee was hospitalized after she injured her right hand and forearm while working on the Neidburg belt sander.
An employee fell 14 feet through a hole in the floor. The hole was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was unloading a bin of auto parts. The rack fell on the employee, trapping his leg and chest underneath.
An employee was moving heavy weight out of a truck to conduct ladder testing when the weight started to fall. His fingers were amputated as he tried to control the weight's fall.
An employee was retrieving a pallet jack. As she stepped over it, she tripped and fell to the floor, fracturing her right femur. She was admitted to the hospital.
A 3-foot x 15-foot steel concrete form was being stripped. During the stripping, the form fell onto the employee's leg and broke it. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was putting raw material into a rubber mixer. The shaft on the ram broke, causing the ram to drop down and crush two fingers on the right hand.

An employee went to measure a concrete beam that had been removed from the ground with an excavator.  The beam, which had been supported on the excavator bucket, fell onto the employee's right foot and crushed it.
A maintenance employee completed a roof inspection and was descending a ladder. He fell from the fourth or fifth rung and fractured his pelvis and elbow.

An employee fell approximately 8 feet from a scaffold. A second employee fell approximately 14 feet from a deck. Both employees were hospitalized.

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer. These events are captured as one report.
An employee disconnected a crane that was holding a 3000-pound die. The die tilted over and fell on top of the employee. The die was not bolted in place at the time of the incident.

An employee was changing a Dayton-style wheel. While removing the lugs, the employee hit the tire with a hammer and loosened the wheel. As the employee removed the last nut, the tire blew out, becoming a projectile that hit the employee in the face.

An employee was unloading a boxed delivery truck using an electric pallet jack. As he was exiting with a load, the truck's roll-up door lowered and struck his left hand. He was hospitalized with a left-hand laceration.
An employee's lower left arm was amputated.

On March 11, 2015, at 9:00 a.m., three maintenance employees were checking a water pump when the system was placed in manual operation. The pressure started to increase, eventually rupturing the water tank and injuring the three employees. Two of the employees were critically injured. All three were taken to UMC hospital in Texas.

On 3/11/2015, at approximately 8:30 AM, an employee was injured when the tank load he was unloading  shifted on his forklift. His finger got caught between the forks and the load when he reached in to secure it. He was taken to the hospital and received surgery.
An employee was removing items from a cupboard. When she turned around, she tripped and fell over a child who was crawling on the floor, resulting in a broken hip.
An employee was using a shovel to clear the conveyor. The shovel got caught in the scraper, which pulled both the shovel and employee's hand into it.
An employee sustained a partial amputation of a left-hand finger while operating a table saw.

At approximately 8:30 a.m., on March 11, 2015, an employee was struck on the face by a battery spreading beam. The employee was hospitalized at Strong Memorial Hospital with a broken nose and fractured cheekbone.
An employee was stabbed and seriously injured by an assailant in a hotel guest room on 3/11/15.
An employee installing insulation from a catwalk fell through a gap in the catwalk and suffered a thigh contusion.
An employee suffered a finger amputation when his finger made contact with a moving fan belt on the aerosol air system control fan.

At approximately 3:00 AM on 3/11/2015, an employee was injured while trying to avoid an animal in the road. His truck swerved, and the tires got caught on the soft shoulder, causing the semi-trailer to roll over. He suffered three broken ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee injured a leg while climbing a vault's fixed ladder.
An employee amputated two fingers on a glue spreader.
An employee was hospitalized and had his right thumb amputated after his hand was injured in the cooling fan of a chiller unit he was troubleshooting.

A maintenance employee slipped while clearing a jam and reached for something that crushed his hand. His left pinky finger was amputated, and he broke and lacerated his third and fourth fingers. He was wearing gloves at the time of the incident.
An employee was injured when an I-beam rolled onto his leg.

An employee driving a tractor with an attached dirt pan struck another employee who was driving a tractor with an attached dirt pan. The employee was thrown out of the back window of the tractor and landed on the ground unconscious, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee amputated his pinky and thumb while cutting wood on a table saw.
An employee fell as he was exiting his truck. To avoid falling backwards, he reached to brace himself with his hands, but ultimately fell to the ground below. He fractured both wrists.
An employee was hospitalized with left-foot injuries that occurred while manually repositioning a dock-leveling plate.

The company had identified that an underground short was occurring on a 7,200-volt line. The company was attempting to locate the short using a DC charge unit known as a "Thumper." The Thumper would shoot a charge through the line, and the employees would use equipment to triangulate the approximate location of the short. During one of these tests, a charge was sent through the line, and an employee received a shock severe enough to require hospitalization.
An employee loosening a bolt with an open wrench fell and was injured when the wrench slipped.
After installing a new utility pole, an employee fell approximately 30 feet to the ground while climbing to the top. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured vertebra.

The injured employee fell from a highway bridge that was under construction on the state road. He was working in an area where two beams met when he fell approximately 20 feet and landed on a toolbox that was on the back of a welding truck. His safety line was unhooked at the time of the incident.
An employee slipped and fell to the same level, breaking a tibia, fibula, and ankle.

The injured employee was preparing to disassemble a meat grinder to clean it. The injured employee unplugged the meat grinder when he unscrewed the collar. The die was tightly fit and he was unable to remove the die and blade. The injured employee plugged the grinder back in to bump the power and then reached down to remove the die. His shoulder hit the power-on switch, amputating his right middle fingertip, which came in contact with the blade.

On or about 3/12/15, at 11:00 a.m., an employee working at a facility shop was using a shaper machine to perform job tasks when his hand made contact with the blade inside the machine. He was admitted to the hospital and had surgery due to lacerations on four left-hand fingers.
An employee was grabbing a tube from a bender when the employee's right pinky finger was smashed between the clamp-block and the radius-block and tube. The right pinky fingertip was amputated.
An employee carrying a pipe from the building slipped on black ice. The employee suffered multiple facial fractures, internal cranial bleeding, and loss of consciousness.
An employee was walking along the path when she slipped on ice and broke her arm. The injury resulted in a compound fracture, hospitalization, and surgery.

An employee was unloading fuel into a tank at a customer location. He was walking while offloading and talking with another employee when he lost consciousness.  A local bystander attempted CPR. Employee was taken to the hospital.
An employee fell off of a one-story metal roof, breaking multiple bones and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was using his finger to align the barrel of a gun while another employee applied pressure. The barrel slid into place, and the finger used to align the barrels was amputated.
An employee performing baton training received a rotator cuff tear and was admitted to the hospital.

An employee amputated his left thumb at the distal joint while using an overhead gantry crane. His thumb got caught in a pinch point between a metal plate weighing approximately 300 pounds and the lifting frame when a magnet holding the plate failed.

An employee operating a forklift was unable to stop the forklift from moving. His hand reached out of the cage to try to stop the lift. When that didn't work, he pulled his hand back in and realized it was injured.

An employee was using a rail mover to move three railcars. An employee on the ground was assisting him, and the two were communicating via radio. The employee on the ground became trapped between two of the railcars. He was taken to the hospital (Erie County Medical Center) with a non-displaced sacral fracture and torn cartilage in his pelvic area.
Employee fell down a single step coming out of a meeting and broke a hip.
An employee lost consciousness and fell on the same level onto a concrete floor, injuring his head. The employee was hospitalized.
A carpet roll fell from a forklift onto an employee in the warehouse. The employee injured his ribs, legs, and back and was hospitalized.
An employee was walking down the stairwell of the hospital parking ramp when she slipped on black ice and fell.
An employee was using a table saw to cut wood when his left thumb made contact with the saw blade, causing a partial amputation.
An employee's leg got caught between the pallet jack the employee was operating and the wall near the batter area.

Employees were building transmission power lines at the site location. They were changing out the cross arm of the power line structure and had the cross arms supported with two slings and a crane.  The injured employee removed the bolt that  held the cross arm onto the pole.  He rested his hand on the edge of the bucket he was working from; the cross arm slipped, landed on his hand in the sling, and pinched his finger between the cross arm and the bucket. His fingertip flesh was removed.

An employee's right ring finger was smashed between hydraulic tongs and a truck bed while running rods. The employee lost the finger from the nail to the end. The employee was transported to the hospital and treated.
An employee driving a cart (similar to a golf cart) struck an oncoming forklift, causing severe internal injuries.
An employee severely cut his finger while cutting meat with a band saw.
An employee was working on the back of a garbage truck and saw a piece of metal. When he reached in to retrieve it, his hand got caught in the compactor.

An employee passed a barricade in order to help seal an oil leak on the top cover plate of the transformer. While retrieving material that was dropped from the top of the transformer, the employee stepped into a hole in the grating and fell approximately 3 feet, landing on an I-beam.  The employee was admitted to a hospital and treated for broken ribs.
An employee was walking from a concrete sidewalk to a gravel area with a client. She tripped on gravel and rolled her left ankle, breaking it in three places. She was hospitalized and had surgery.

An employee was helping to install the top of a fiberglass well when the side wall of the well cracked and allowed the lifting strap to come loose. The tank then dropped, striking the employee and injuring his hip.
An employee fell approximately 3.5 to 4 feet from the bed of a shingle delivery truck to the ground and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee Injured her back while lifting a case of soda and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was injured when he fell from a ladder. He was hospitalized with a ruptured spleen.
On March 12, 2015, an employee slipped on ice and fractured his arm while getting back into his truck at the company's distribution/storage facility.

When an employee disconnected a rinse hose connection from his truck, residual ammonium hydroxide (liquid ammonia) sprayed him in the face and got in his mouth. He was wearing chemical resistant gloves, goggles, and coveralls. His injuries include a minor burn to his lower lip and a 1/2-inch white patch on the tip of his tongue.
An employee fell approximately 15 feet from a deck being constructed and broke multiple bones.
An employee stood up from a chair, lost balance and/or stumbled on the carpet, and then fell.
Employee slipped on a patch of ice on the sidewalk while walking from his car to the building after arriving in the morning.

An employee was inspecting a C-130 aircraft using a 6-foot ladder. While descending the ladder, the employee missed the bottom rung and fell to the floor. The employee sustained a fracture to the right hip and received surgery later that evening.

An employee was setting a structure and was directing an excavator operator on where to dig a hole. He was standing between the bucket and a PCP (concrete) pipe. The operator could not see him behind the bucket. When the operator moved the bucket, the employee was pinned between the bucket and the pipe.
An employee was removing a washer/dryer combo from an apartment and bringing it down the stairs. The unit slipped and landed on the employee's right ankle, requiring surgery.
An employee suffered a broken pelvis when he fell from a machine.
An employee's finger was amputated while operating a service rig.
An employee carrying a ladder slipped and fell. The employee sustained injuries to his head.

An employee was spotting a tractor that was picking up equipment. The employee slipped, and the employee's hand was caught between the tractor and equipment. The hand was crushed and required surgery.
An employee was working in the tire shop when other employees heard an explosion. The employee was burned from the waist down and hospitalized.
An employee was operating a forklift to move materials on a 16-foot high storage rack system. The materials, which weighed approximately 300 pounds, fell on the employee.
An employee was struck in the back by a wall panel, resulting in fractures to the lower vertebrae.
An employee was shocked while working on the roof.
An employee fell while climbing onto a piece of equipment, fracturing his left elbow.
An employee was troubleshooting the preheat oven when his finger got caught between a cylinder and machine frame, amputating his left index fingertip.

An employee was pressure-testing a sand separator in a test booth. The employee entered the test booth to remove a plug on the sand separator. Before entering, he turned off the water hose and turned on the high-pressure pump. As he removed the plug, a failure occurred. The employee sustained a broken arm, and the plug was embedded in his arm.
An employee suffered an amputation of his right hand (to mid-forearm area) when he crawled under the soil sort conveyor to retrieve a cell phone.
An employee fell and injured the right hip after being cut off by another skier while skiing with a patient.
An employee was throwing a garbage bag into the dumpster. She slipped and fell, hitting her left hip. She was admitted into the hospital and had surgery.
An employee was piling lumber on a cart when it dropped on his finger, resulting in a partial amputation of the left middle finger.
A employee was adding water to a forklift. When he stepped down, he missed the last step, fell, and broke his left femur, resulting in surgery.
An employee's hand got pinched between a cylinder and an air cylinder casing; the right index finger and middle finger were amputated.
An employee was stepping down from a box-truck lift gate to the ground and rolled an ankle. The employee dislocated his ankle and broke his lower leg bone.
An employee was hospitalized after receiving burns from falling into a tank containing a 130-degree Fahrenheit chemical solution.
While cleaning a food slicer, an employee amputated the ring finger on her right hand.
While manually moving a cabinet, an employee sustained a hernia.
An employee was cleaning a toilet in the women's bathroom in the NFS Building. He blacked out, hit his head on the floor, and received a laceration. He was admitted to the hospital.
A heavy piece of equipment tipped over onto an employee's leg while the employee was trying to unjam a strap that got caught between the equipment and the pallet it was on.
An employee fell while delivering product to a retail store and hit her head.  She was hospitalized with a brain injury.
An employee was connecting steel trusses when the chain that was holding one of the trusses slipped. The employee's right index finger was smashed between the trusses.
An employee on an oil rig had his left hand amputated by a rock crusher while dislodging rocks from the machine. Lockout procedures were not followed at the time.
An employee experienced a testicular torsion while climbing onto a forklift.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after striking her face on the steering wheel of her tractor while trying to free it from under a tub chassis.
An employee slipped on ice on the main walkway while walking into work, resulting in a fractured left leg.
An employee slipped on black ice, fell, and struck head when walking into the clinic on 3/10/2015.
An employee was injured in the left leg (thigh area) while driving a man lift from the east hangar to the north hangar. The employee hit a bump and drove into another vehicle.
An employee working from an 8-foot ladder received an electrical shock from an electrical pull box. He fell and broke his pelvis.
An employee at the facility was hospitalized after being found unresponsive in the subfloor area.
An employee was skiing out of bounds and hit a tree. The employee fractured the C1/C2 vertebrae and collarbone and injured the spleen.
An employee working on the cheesecake slicer was performing disassembly and cleaning when the unit activated, resulting in the amputation of the right ring fingertip.
An employee carrying a pan of hot water in the kitchen spilled hot water on her right foot; she suffered first and second degree burns.
On March 14, 2015, a meat clerk's right index fingertip was amputated while reaching into a patty-maker to clear meat.
An employee was pinned by a forklift and transferred to a local hospital.
An employee was hospitalized after being shocked while servicing electrical equipment.
An employee was struck by a car while crossing the street. The employee suffered head and upper extremity injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a fracture on his left leg when he was trapped between two vehicles on a shipping line.

An employee collecting trash containers at the facility suffered a finger amputation when his hand got caught between a hitch and a toe bar behind a tractor. The tractor moved forward and amputated a finger. The tractor was parked in neutral gear at the time of the incident.

An employee operating a standup PIT was coming around a corner when he realized he was going to hit a guardrail. About 1 to 3 feet from the rail, the employee jumped clear of the machine, crushing his lower leg between the PIT and the rail.

An employee was conducting maintenance repair on a conveyor system that transports product throughout the distribution facility. The employee's right ring fingertip was amputated when he attempted to remove a chain from a motor sprocket that drove the conveyor system.

An employee was attempting to place the pipe spinner leaver in neutral position when he tripped. His right hand engaged the spinner, and his left hand got caught in the spinner chain, cutting his left pinky and ring fingers.
An employee was injured when he fell from a fence and broke his heels.
An employee was hospitalized after falling at her register.
An employee tripped over wiring while assisting a patient and suffered a hip injury.
An employee was descending a fixed ladder after he sanitized the second level. He fell off of the ladder and hurt his left pelvic area.
An employee sustained a broken-bone injury while providing assistance to another person at a group home.
An employee suffered a broken arm while removing a stack from a combustor. The crew was loosening bolts from the ground level to remove a stack when it pivoted and struck the employee's arm.
An employee fell from a second-floor platform.
An employee was ascending a ladder to go onto a roof for a roof estimate when the ladder shifted.  The employee fell from the ladder to the ground, resulting in multiple rib fractures.
An employee was injured by a nail gun while installing a side light to a trim.
An employee attempted to remove dunnage from under a beam by kicking it. The beam was not steady, causing it to fall and hit the employee on the ankle, which resulted in a fracture.
An employee was transferring product from a tote to a truck when static caused vapors to ignite. The employee was burned on the abdomen and face and has a possible broken ankle.

An employee was retrieving mud flaps to reinstall on a truck. A cotter pin on the winch line, which was secured to the rear of the truck, came loose. The wire on the driver's side became unsecure and struck the employee on the left side, below the shoulder and back.

During the pre-operational PIT inspection process, one of the employees who was moving a stand-up fork truck pinned another employee's foot between his moving truck and a nearby stationary truck, resulting in a foot injury and the employee's hospitalization.

On March 16, 2015, at 4:15 P.M., an employee was working at the charge chute for polyester reactors. The employee had used a hoist to lift and dump an approximately 2,000-pound bag of PET pellets into a hopper that was connected to the reactor. He started to walk over the pallet on the floor toward the empty bag. When he stepped off of the pallet, he lost his balance and landed awkwardly on his left foot.
An employee reached into a recycling shredder conveyor to clear tire shred when his arm was pulled into the machine, which was running at the time.

A driver from a different business was loading a car hauler. The injured employee approached the hauler and got crushed between the vehicle and the hauler when the driver moved. The employee sustained arm and head injuries.
An employee was pulling a hose to pour concrete on the third floor of an apartment building. The employee leaned against a temporary railing that was not secure and fell three stories to the ground.
An employee was relocating a pallet using a pallet jack. She stuck her foot out and pinned it between the palette jack and a yellow post resulting in a broken bone in her left foot.
An employee amputated his left pinky (small) finger while moving a drill pipe and putting it on a rack. As he lowered the drill pipe, he slipped and his pinky got caught beneath the pipe.
An employee was driving and lost control of the company truck. The truck flipped and the employee fractured his neck.
On March 16, 2015, an employee, reached into the discharge while inspecting the line to verify that it was running. This resulted in the amputation of two right-hand fingertips.
An employee walking in the south parking lot tripped on a concrete parking block and sustained a right shoulder injury.
An employee's left middle finger was amputated while repairing a wing machine with two other employees.

An employee fell into an active excavation. The crew was setting trench boxes while the employee stood beside one of them.  As the operator attempted to position the box, it dropped approximately 3 feet, causing the employee to lose his balance and fall into the excavation. The employee sustained serious injuries: a dislocated shoulder, a small chip in a bone, and a slight crack in his pelvis.

An employee fell from a step ladder while drilling holes to blow insulation into a house. He hit an air conditioning unit on the way down and ended by hitting his head on a stone retaining wall. He was hospitalized on 3/16/15.
An employee's right index finger was amputated while greasing the conveyor that feeds the boiler. He had bent down to pick up his radio when his right hand got caught in the chain.
An employee had three fingers crushed and one amputated on a stamping machine. The machine's point of operation was not safeguarded at the time.
An employee was injured by a gasoline-powered concrete saw with a diamond blade.  The employee was cutting a core floor when the saw kicked back and cut his thigh.
An employee was opening a gate when the last finger of the employee's left hand was pinched in a roller; the fingertip was amputated.
An employee was preparing to clean a machine and was installing a plastic cover over a motor when the employee's finger got caught by a chain. The motor was not powered down at the time.
An employee was hospitalized after being injured by a powered industrial truck that was operated by another employee.
An employee was mounting a bracket in an attic area when the employee fell approximately 32 feet to the ground below.

Four employees were moving a large galvanized steel gate from inside the shop to the outside. One employee went and moved a cart with an auger out of the way.  The cart had been sitting on a 1-foot-wide by 6-feet-long piece of chain link mesh, which became elevated off the ground after the cart was moved. The employee tripped over the piece of chain link mesh, falling and breaking the fibula and tibia bones in his leg.
Employee injured his leg while operating an electric pallet.
An employee's left index finger became caught between the shoe and index on a punch press, crushing his finger. The finger was amputated to close the wound.
An employee was injured by the blender lid-locking mechanism located in the bonding area. The employee fractured three right-hand fingers, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee suffered a skin burn when hydraulic fluid caught on fire and landed on his forearm during a welding process.
An employee was struck in the head by a metal frame when a crane hook failed.
An employee was water-blasting a railcar and later complained of cramping. He was taken to the hospital for dehydration.
An employee got the right middle finger crushed in the gears of a manually operated training aid (model of a turbo charger/blower). The employee's fingertip was later amputated.
The employee was stocking boxes of meat into the cooler. He lifted a box and felt a pop in his back, as well as intense pain.
An employee was folding up the troughs at the back of his truck when a front-end loader that was moving material pinned him between the truck and the loader.
An employee was removing a 16"-pipe from a pipe rack by cold cutting. The employee was removed from the pipe rack because he was not feeling well. He was transported to the hospital.
An employee carrying a steel plate lost his grip; the plate fell onto his toes.

An employee was installing a sign while working from an extension ladder. He reached behind the ladder to stick vinyl onto the wall. He slipped and fell approximately 8 feet from the ladder onto the ground, sustaining a concussion, fractured left leg, and cut on his right knee.

An employee reached between the motor driving bar and the frame of a poly tray machine to remove a jam. The bar closed and trapped the employee's arm, resulting in a double fracture to the forearm. The machine was not stopped at the time.

On March 17, 2015, an employee fell off of the fixed ladder on the back of a truck while trying to pull up a 5-gallon bucket of concrete additive. The employee fell backwards, struck another employee standing at the bottom of the ladder, and landed on his right shoulder. He suffered a dislocated shoulder and was admitted to the hospital for a possible broken rib and lung perforation.
An employee exiting a scissor lift missed the last step and fell approximately 4 feet, fracturing the hip.
Employee's right pinky finger was amputated while working in Stratton, OH.
After detaching a portable ladder from a rooftop, an employee fell from a ladder approximately 12 to 18 feet to the ground below. The employee suffered a broken right leg and fractured right elbow.

An employee was placing wire on a sheave with his gloved left hand. His glove was pulled between the tension belt and the sheave, causing his left thumb to be cut to the bone. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee had just changed the upper inner tool on a powdered metal press. The upper inner tool was not properly aligned with the lower die. When the employee cycled the press, the upper outer tool shattered and created shrapnel, which struck the employee in the neck. The employee was hospitalized for surgery to remove the shrapnel from his neck.
An employee was setting up dies in a press and was installing the top die. The bottom die fell out and struck the employee's left foot.
An employee slipped on ice in the parking lot and broke her wrist.

An employee was hooking a crane hook onto bundles of rebar in a ship's cargo hold. Two bundles of rebar got stuck together, so the employee lowered the bundles and cut them from each other using bolt cutters. There was still some tension on one of the pieces of rebar; when the employee cut the bundle strap it swung, hitting and breaking his lower leg.
An employee was stepping across a pile of dirt in the way of his work when he misstepped and fell, shattering his left ankle.
Am employee operating the bead seater tool had his finger impacted by a heavy retaining ring while adjusting the tool for a tire in another size.
An employee sustained a fingertip amputation while cutting beef chuck roast into steaks with a band saw using a boneless blade (no teeth).

A maintenance employee working from a 10-foot extension ladder was putting clips on the shade cloth. The ladder shifted, and the employee and ladder fell. The employee hit the transport rail (rollers), broke five ribs, and lacerated his lung.
An employee was straightening "subs" (pipe-shaped oilfield tools) on a pallet when he caught his finger between two subs. He pulled his hand away, tearing the skin and nail from his fingertip.
An employee was slicing a bone-in NY strip steak when the bone caught his thumb and pulled it into the saw blade.
An employee operating a Microtome machine sustained an amputation injury to her left index finger.
An employee sustained a broken arm after reaching into a conveyor.
An employee fell while descending a ladder after making a splice on a telephone pole.
An employee was carrying a 1-gallon bucket of hot liquid grease when he slipped. The liquid splattered on his right arm, causing third-degree burns to his hand and elbow.
An employee using a saw amputated his index fingertip.
A maintenance employee used their finger to unjam an ice cream carton filling machine. The equipment cycled and caught the employee's finger, causing a partial amputation of the left middle finger.
An employee was injured and hospitalized after attempting to gather stored racking that was to be installed in the store.

An employee entered a restricted area to check on a press hopper. He suffered a broken rib after being struck by a tram car bucket, which pinned him between the bucket and a hopper. The tram car operator was unaware of his presence at the time of the incident.
An employee was cutting lumber stakes on a sawhorse. He was using a handheld circular saw when the stock kicked back and amputated half of his thumb.

An employee was injured on March 18, 2015, at 0730.  The employee was attempting to load and tie down a forklift with a tie down chain when he fell approximately 2 feet off of a trailer ramp area and hit his head. He lost consciousness and suffered swelling to the head.

The last digit on an employee's pinky finger was amputated when caught between a metal plate attached to a pump and a trailer bed while unloading scrap metal into the Peddlers Yard. Suitable safeguarding was not in place at the time of the incident.

An employee was injured when a hoist that he was using malfunctioned, causing the basket on the hoist to fall into a tank of hot water caustic solution. This caused waves of the solution to develop and spill over onto the employee, resulting in severe burns to the employee's legs and feet.
An employee suffered an ankle injury and required hospitalization.
On 3/18/15, a maintenance employee was repairing a web press when he bumped his right-hand index finger knuckle on a part, sustaining a scratch.
An employee was installing anchors when the installer misfired, broke the employee's leg, and caused a severe laceration.
An employee sustained burns to his legs after stepping into an unprotected floor opening with water at about 140 degrees in the production area. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee attempted to straighten logs that were out in the yard when a log fell and hit his left foot, resulting in an open fracture to the foot and hospitalization.
An employee was working in a scissor lift when an overhead gantry crane knocked the lift over. The employee fell and sustained life-threatening injuries.
An employee providing play therapy at the park tripped over a playground-equipment post and broke a tibia and fibula, approximately 4" above the ankle.

Two employees were putting a tractor tire on a rim when the inner tubing ruptured, causing the tire to blow and shoot up approximately 15 feet. The tire struck the two employees on the way up. Both employees were hospitalized.  One employee sustained a broken right arm and facial lacerations.  The other employee sustained multiple fractures in the face and lacerations.
An employee sustained a partial amputation to the left thumb while offloading steel from a truck. The hoisted material shifted, pinching the thumb between the load and the hook.

A maintenance employee was inspecting an oil leak on a yard truck used to pull trailers. The employee placed their body under the truck by lying on the ground. The employee asked another employee to start the truck; when the truck started, it rolled and pinned the employee between the ground and one of the truck tires. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working near the loading dock area. As a forklift passed the employee, some material fell from the forks of the lift and struck the employee in the leg. He fractured his right leg and was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was about to transfer from the scaffold ladder to the deck when his left foot slipped off. He fell 13 feet and sustained fractures in his left shoulder, fourth rib, and cervical vertebra (C4).

An employee cutting cow tongue attempted to hang the tongue on a hook. The tongue started to fall from the employee's left hand. The employee attempted to grab it with the right hand, which held a knife, causing a left-arm laceration.
An employee was putting a hitch on a trailer. As she moved the hitch forward, she lost control of it and it fell on her leg. She broke her leg and was hospitalized.

On March 18, 2015, at approximately 12:05 p.m., an employee fell from the tracks of the track truck while unloading straw bales from the truck bed. He fell 2 to 3 feet and struck his head on the ground, resulting in hospitalization for chest-wall bruising and head injury.
An employee was closing a semi-truck trailer door when the cable to the door broke; the trailer door slammed onto his foot.
An employee fell on the ground outside of a patient's house, fracturing both lower bones in his right leg.
An employee was leaning on an engine to reinstall a radiator when the employee sustained a hernia.
An employee fell on snow in the parking lot and sustained a right hip fracture.

An employee using a pallet jack, which was trailing behind him, attempted to walk through flap doors while a forklift operator was driving through the doors from the opposite direction.  The forklift had a pallet on the forks. The operator drove forward, blew the horn, and continued to drive through the doors, hitting the employee on the left leg with the pallet.
An employee was cleaning moving rollers when her left hand got caught between them.

An employee was descending a 28-foot ladder when a gust of wind knocked the ladder off of the cable. The ladder has a hook at the end, and the employee had the ladder hook on the cable. The hook knocked his ladder off of the cable strand. He broke his leg.
Two employees received serious but non-life-threatening injuries when an M42 type submunition being disassembled exploded.  Both were hospitalized.
An employee was delivering freight to a company when he fell down on the dock. The employee was found unconscious and transported to the hospital.
An employee amputated the second digit on the right hand while using handheld power tools.

An employee was stepping down from the bus when she slipped and landed on her bottom backside. The employee attempted to get up and slipped again, hitting her left side. She was hospitalized with a fractured rib that punctured her lung.

An employee was leaning from a boat to remove a log from Lake Desoto when a wave swell caused an unexpected shift. The shift caused her finger to get caught between the boat and the log, amputating the first segment of her right index finger.
On March 19, 2015, an employee's right thumb was caught in a chain and sprocket on a sealer conveyor, resulting in an amputated fingertip.
An employee was installing two cast iron pipes when the pipes slipped through the bracing and fell onto his right hand, cutting the pinky fingertip.
An employee was burned on the face and hands while refueling a gas-powered air compressor used to spray insulation foam.
On March 19, 2015, at approximately 7:00 a.m., an employee was hospitalized overnight with a fractured bone after being struck by a falling cart on his left ankle.
An employee sustained burns to his left leg after slipping into a hot rinse bath.
A piece of metal was stuck on the conveyor near the shear. An employee climbed onto the moving conveyor to remove the metal and got his leg caught in the conveyor crushing it.

An employee was working on a mechanical arm that accepts or rejects product. He was changing the hose when he lost his balance and fell onto a jagged piece of metal welded to the mechanical equipment. His forearm was cut, causing deep lacerations and severing a tendon.
An employee's arm got caught in the rotating parts of a machine during machine operations.
An employee slipped and fell on wet pavement in the parking lot. The employee had surgery to treat a right hip fracture.

While working on the rotary valve of the tumbler machine, an employee attempted to clear out a clog with his hand; his first four fingers were amputated. The machine was still running at the time of the incident.
An employee was removing a die from a machine when it fell and fractured his right thumb.
While returning to work from a break, an employee (welder) experienced shortness of breath, subsequently requiring medical transport and inpatient hospitalization.

On or about 3/19/15, at about 9:40 PM, an employee was preparing to go to the range and shoot firearms for inspection. The employee loaded the gun outside the range and was disassembling the loaded gun when it fired. The employee was injured with a shot wound to the left hand. The employee was hospitalized, and reconstructive surgery was performed on his hand.
An employee was hospitalized overnight after slipping and hurting their back.
An employee got his foot caught on the hose of a drill that was on a ladder. The drill fell on and lacerated the injured employee's foot.
An employee was moving racking material with a crane when he pinched his left third fingertip pad between the hook and rack. He sustained a fingertip amputation.
An employee fell from a 2-foot ladder and sustained serious injuries.
An employee missed the last rung on a fixed ladder on a delivery truck; he fell and injured his leg.

An employee was operating the fiberglass pipe end abrasive wheel grinder. The grinder has a copper pipe that sprays water onto the abrasive wheel when it sands the fiberglass pipe. The employee struck the pipe with a piece of wood to remove a clog. His hand slipped, and his right index finger was grinded on the face of the abrasive wheel.
An employee was hospitalized after his leg was caught in an unprotected rotated auger.
An employee was injured when his arm was caught in a roll packing machine while oiling it. He sustained severe lacerations and was hospitalized.

An employee was moving the head of a welding machine from one stiffener fitter machine to another. He put his right hand on top of the head to slide it down to the next stiffener. His hand slipped off and landed on the plate that the head rolls on. His right middle finger landed above the hole that is inside the plate, and the head rolled over his fingertip.
An employee sustained fractures in the right foot when a rack fell on it.
An employee fell off of a 10-foot wall ladder while closing a vent. He broke his arm and cut his face.

An employee was smoothing burs off of a piece of metal using a disc sander. The metal got caught and pulled the employee's right thumb into the sander, peeling the skin back. The tip of the bone was removed during subsequent surgery.
On or about March 5, 2015, an employee was hospitalized after incurring a burn to the leg/ankle.
An employee suffered a fractured wrist injury and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after straining his groin area while lifting heavy boards.
An employee fell from a one-level scaffold and received a head injury.
An employee was installing an electrical panel for the new car wash when he was shocked.
Employee fell off of a stepladder.

At approximately 1:00 p.m. on 3/19/15, an employee was unsteady and fell while approaching the water cooler. The employee did not have any serious complaints that afternoon and left at her usual time. She was hospitalized for a broken hip.
An employee lacerated the left-hand middle fingertip while cleaning a meat slicer.
