An employee tripped on an uneven floor surface and suffered a broken hip.
An employee was cleaning an old fixture room. One of the fixtures was on the ground. The employee tripped over the fixture and sustained a fracture.

An employee fractured his right femur when a stack of steel roofing sheets slid off of the staging area and struck him on his right thigh. The stack of sheets was hit by a tractor with steel forks, which caused the stack to slide off and strike the employee.

An employee was operating a pneumatic seal press with a two-hand control. After activation, the employee reached in, and the ram came back down and caught one finger underneath the ram. The employee's right-hand middle finger was amputated.
An employee was walking by a log pile when one of the logs slipped and rolled down the pile, hitting the employee in the back of the leg and breaking it.
A forklift battery fell on and broke an employee's left foot as he was changing the battery.

An employee was climbing down an extension ladder and fell after taking approximately three to four steps. Another employee was holding the ladder; he was unable to control the ladder when it shifted.
An employee was unloading his truck when he was struck by an out-of-control car. He was hospitalized for surgery on a broken ankle.

An employee fell while descending a ladder. The ladder slipped, causing the employee to fall to the hard ground surface below. The ladder also landed on top of the employee after the initial fall. The employee sustained fractures to the femur, as well as a knee injury, and required surgery.
A maintenance employee was troubleshooting the Osgood Equipment when he had his right middle and index fingertips amputated while checking the tension on a chain and sprocket.
An employee was hospitalized and sustained an amputation after having his left index finger pinched between a pallet jack and load.
An employee was struck from behind by a guest skier and sustained broken ribs.

An employee was performing water lancing operations on the U.S.S. Baton at BAE Shipyard in Norfolk, Virginia. The employee was struck by water pressure at the discharge end of the water lancing equipment, resulting in injuries to the right middle finger. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was burned by steam as the employee opened the housing of a condensate steam sump.
A king pin press malfunctioned, snapped back, and caught an employee's finger. He was hospitalized, and his left ring finger was amputated.

An employee was instructing another employee on how to conduct a moisture test by placing baked cookies coming out of the oven (on a conveyor belt) on top of the fan's guard enclosure. A series of three to four fans are attached to the belt to blow down on the cookies (cooling) as they come out of the oven. These fans could be located 6 to 12 inches above the conveyor belt. The oven operators can't see the fans but are able to reach and make physical contact with them. The injured employee took a moisture reading by removing the cookie from the conveyor belt and placing it on top of the fan's guard for cooling. The employee's right-hand middle finger came in contact with rotating fan blades, amputating her fingertip to the knuckle. A spatula that was available for removing cookies from the pan was not used, and the fan guard was broken at the time of the incident.
An employee was positioning an ingredient barrel on a pallet when he lost hold of the drum. His finger was pinched between the drum and a diagonal I-beam. His index fingertip was amputated.
An employee injured a back muscle while pulling a cart of money.
An employee in the receiving area was moving a ladder when it struck a fixture that was stored on top of a metal case. The fixture fell approximately 15 feet and struck the employee's face.

An employee was opening an electric gate. He rested his hand on the top of the gate while taking the slack out of a chain on the gate with his foot. His hand was on a roller on the gate, and his finger got caught between the roller and the top rail on the gate. His left pinky finger was partially amputated.
An employee stepped off of the boat in mud and water up to his knees. He was hospitalized with cellulitis.
An employee was spotting a car (placing the car where he needed it) and was caught between the car and the dock.
An employee reported difficulty breathing due to dust inhalation. He went to the hospital.
An employee was walking on top of a 9-inch-high berm when he lost his balance and landed on the left side of his body. He broke his right leg.
An employee was hospitalized overnight due to a spider bite she sustained while putting trash in the dumpster.
An employee was struck by a 2,000-pound pipe while working on a service rig. He sustained damage to his left ankle.

An employee was descending a ladder after installing communication cables at a communication pole when the ladder moved. He dismounted the ladder approximately 10 feet from the ground and landed on his feet, shattering his right heel and breaking his left ankle.

Employees were dismantling/removing heavy equipment at the Amazon facility. One of the employees got on a stand-up forklift to move some things while cleaning the area and got his leg caught between a concrete wall and the forklift. The employee was not trained to operate the forklift.

On or about March 20, 2015, at 3:30 p.m., an employee was placing/helping to place a structural tube on a concrete pier foundation at the jobsite. While the tube was being set, the bottom of the column slipped off of the pier and hit the employee on the ankle.  The structural tube pier weighed approximately 250 pounds and was approximately 14 to 16 feet long. This structural tube would be used as a vertical support tube.

On March 20, 2015, at approximately 11:00 p.m., an employee was using a core drill to remove anchors from the face of the Bluestone Dam in Hinton, West Virginia. A 1/4" to 3/8" rope became entangled in the 3" core bit. The employee's left arm was pulled into the rotating bit, which resulted in fractures of the radius and ulna.
An employee lost his balance and fell from a ladder.
On March 21, 2015, an employee was struck by a forklift and was pinned between the forklift and racking.
An employee was painting a building exterior on the job site. He was working around a granite panel when a safety pin came loose, causing the panel to fall on him.
An employee's hand got caught between the fixed guard and a pallet while trying to clear a jam. She broke part of her right thumb and the crushed thumb tip was amputated.
An employee was struck by a form panel at 252 East 57 Street, New York, NY, 10022.
On March 21, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation from a milling machine.
While removing scrap metal from a lathe, an employee's right thumb was crushed between the lathe and saddle.
An employee was fixing a sin fin motor when his arm got pulled by a belt. He lost his ring fingertip on the right hand.
An employee operating a forklift backed off of a loading dock and fell. The employee was hospitalized with a concussion.
An employee was cutting meat, felt light-headed/dizzy, and passed out on the floor. Another employee found him unconscious and reported it to management. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee tripped and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was injured when her hand got caught in the cardboard recycle machine.
An employee injured her left middle finger after tripping over temporary water removal equipment in the parking lot.
An employee slipped and fell, breaking his left leg and bruising his hip.
An employee's right ankle and foot were crushed when the "mule" (4 wheeled vehicle with a small bed in the back) he was operating rolled after striking a log. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee fractured his right middle finger while loading a 250-pound test plug onto the back of his truck. The forklift used to raise the load released it, and the employee's finger got caught between the test plug and a supporting bracket. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
A truss collapsed at the Gaylord Palms, resulting in two employees being hospitalized.
An employee was struck on the top of the head by a piece of debris.
An employee fell backwards and hit his/her head on the ground while approaching a semi-truck to open the door. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee working in the mixing department sustained a serious injury to his left arm/shoulder. The employee noticed rubber between the takeaway belt and the end roll, which made the belt pull to one side. The employee began jogging the belt to remove the rubber. His hand got caught between the roll and belt, which pulled him in up to his shoulder.

An employee slipped and fell while a dump box was simultaneously being lowered. The employee's right thumb was caught between a pinch point, which resulted in an amputation of the right thumb at the first knuckle.
An employee working onboard the U.S.S. Eisenhower at Portsmouth Naval Shipyard contacted a piece of energized wire that was encased in a steel pipe conduit.

An employee was washing a 1000-gallon tank on a catwalk. The water in an adjacent tank boiled over, splashing the employee's back with boiling water. The employee sustained first and second degree burns (blistering).
An employee's left index finger was crushed/amputated by a grinder piston while working on the finish grinder. There was no guarding on the piston at the time of the incident.
An employee's finger was injured while using a cloth rag to clean up excess oil near an exposed chain. The employee's finger was caught in the chain.
An employee fell from a platform that was 2 to 2.5 feet high, sustaining a punctured lung, fractured ribs, and fractured vertebrae. The employee was hospitalized.
Three employees were involved in a flash fire during welding operations inside of feed bins.  Two workers were hospitalized.
Employee's hand was caught in a noodle compressor machine.

A machine operator asked the injured employee to change out an air tester. The employee asked another coworker to retrieve airlock seals to change the air tester. The coworker and machine operator went to the tool crib to retrieve seals. During this time, the injured employee reached into the area of operation. A sensor sent the jaw block (hydraulic-operated) down and amputated the employee's left-hand ring finger (half of finger) and pinky (1st joint of finger).

Two employees were 20-feet high on the basket of a scissor lift. Another subcontractor was operating a crane to lift/remove a glass wall/panel. While the glass wall was being lifted, it swung towards the scissor lift and knocked the two employees down. They were both immediately transported to the hospital.
Injured employee was pinned between a concrete wall and the bucket of the backhoe. Another employee was driving the backhoe that struck the injured employee.
Employee broke leg while installing a cap on an irrigation line in a 4-foot trench. The sides of the trench caved in on the employee, fracturing his right leg between the knee and ankle.
An employee was helping to move two carts that contained parts and got a finger caught between the carts. The carts crushed the employee's fingertip.
An employee was placing abrasive material in an injection molding machine to purge the machine.  The employee lost his balance and fell off of the machine, injuring his shoulder and forearm.
On March 23, 2015, an employee pinched their finger between a side section and a support, suffering an avulsion. The employee went to the hospital and received stitches to their left ring finger.
An employee slipped and fell in the parking lot.

The injured employee was removing a section of a protective walkway. He was using a stepladder to climb beside the walkway to remove a sheet of plywood. He stepped from the stepladder to the top of the protective walkway. The walkway collapsed to the ground with the employee on top. He broke his left femur and dislocated his knee.

An employee turned on a chop saw, but it did not start running. The injured employee came over to inspect the saw. He opened the panel and reached in to grab the belt when the belt moved, pulling his right thumb into the flywheel. Approximately a half inch of the right thumb tip was amputated.
An employee was removing boxes from a conveyor belt when the belt grabbed his gloved hand. The employee pulled his hand back and amputated his fingertip.
Employees were relieving pressure from a pressure relief valve assembly. The valve bar or assembly struck the injured employee in the neck and chest.
An employee was placing packs of tortillas into a machine that cuts the tortillas into triangles. The employee's fingers came in contact with the machine where it lowers to cut the strips.

Employees were lifting a BOP using a forklift to work on the bottom of the BOP. While the BOP was suspended by the forklift, the injured employee placed his hand on the forks. The BOP rolled backwards, catching and amputating his left pinky fingertip between the heavy equipment and the fork.

A driver was reversing a truck near a bridge. The injured employee signaled the driver to stop, but the driver accidently stepped on the gas and struck the employee. The employee sustained a fractured pelvis and spine.
An employee was removing a tarp on top of a rice pod when he slid down the pod and landed in a ditch filled with mud, fracturing his tailbone.

On or about March 23, 2015, an employee received a thumb tip amputation while trying to remove a chain and sprocket from a calcium silo system. The system was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee suffered possible broken bones and a partial amputation of the left long finger while attempting to move a steel grate.
An employee was repairing and dismantling a forklift. The forklift mast came loose and hit the employee, injuring his left leg. He was hospitalized.

Two employees working from separate stepladders were replacing a leaky pressure-reducing valve in an overhead low pressure (12 psi upstream from the pressure-reducing valve), 2-inch diameter, steel steam line. There was a shutoff ball valve approximately 8 inches upstream from the pressure-reducing valve. In the process of replacing the pressure-reducing valve that was threaded into the line, the nearby shutoff ball valve (which was also threaded into the line) became disassembled, releasing steam that caused burns to one of the employees. The shutoff valve was closed before beginning the replacement, but it was not locked/tagged out. The main steam valve for the line, which was approximately 15 feet away, was also not closed or locked/tagged out at the time.
An employee fell while greasing an idler wheel, injuring his lower back.
An employee was working at a filler station. A bottle jammed in the machine. The employee reached into the machine to remove the jam and suffered a partial amputation of the right index finger.

An employee who was hitting the side of a feed bin in order to loosen feed fell approximately 15 feet from a catwalk.  The employee was hospitalized with broken ribs, a pelvic injury, and a broken arm.
An employee tried to climb down adjacent shelving after his warehouse picker locked up. The employee fell approximately 14 feet to the concrete floor.

An employee was running the turn table and used a chipper to remove flash from a mold. A flash dropped down into the core pool area; the employee put the table in manual mode so he could manually remove it. The other employee at the table misunderstood what the employee was doing and actuated the part of the turn table, which caused the core to move and amputate the injured employee's right middle finger at the first knuckle.
An employee was herding cattle from a pre-stall barn to the milk barn when one of the cows slipped and fell on the employee's leg. The employee sustained a broken leg.
An employee was involved in a three-car auto accident while transporting a car for Enterprise to a body shop. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee suffered an amputated right pinky fingertip when a 30-inch diameter metal cut-out section struck it. The employee had cut the section from a 13-foot diameter heat exchanger being fabricated and started to grind the cut-out area inside the cylinder. The vibrations from the grinder caused the metal cut-out section to slide approximately 12 inches, striking his finger. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee sustained a broken arm while cleaning a food production roller, which was energized and pulled him into the machine. The rollers were unguarded and not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee sustained an amputation to the right index finger after pushing a rod through a roll of plastic sheeting.
An employee was hand delivering the mail when the dog of the house jumped the fence and attacked her. She was hospitalized.
An employee amputated part of his finger while operating an envelope-printing machine.
An employee was cleaning after the Blue Man Show when she slipped and fell on her wrist.  She was transported to the hospital and admitted for surgery.
An employee got a finger caught in the drive chain of a stretch wrap machine.

An employee was observing palletized material moving down a conveyor. She noticed the sprocket and chain power transmission mechanism rubbing against the conveyor frame. While showing the maintenance lead the problem, she pointed her finger in the direction of the sprocket and chain and set off the photo eye, which activated the chain. Her right middle fingertip got caught and amputated.

On 03/24/15 at 3:05 a.m., an employee was driving a yard truck with a container attached. While maneuvering, the container flipped over and disconnected from the yard truck. The truck bounced, and the employee suffered head trauma, tooth loss, and an ankle fracture.
An employee amputated his right ring finger while operating a molding machine.
Employees were clearing mangroves along the shore on Pearl Harbor. When the cut mangroves were being pulled to shore, the rope broke, and the pulley struck an employee in the head.
When an employee stepped off of a forklift to disconnect it, the unit moved, catching his foot between the forklift and the battery charging station. The employee broke bones in his toes.
An employee had two fingertips amputated on their left hand after reaching into the chute of the fat sucker equipment.

An employee was blowing insulation in an attic while tied off with a harness and lanyard (personal fall arrest system). He went to move to a different spot. While changing anchor points, he stepped into a scuttle hole and injured his back/neck.
An employee was operating the elevators and tongs to run pipe out of the hole when the drilling line broke. The block fell and struck his foot.
An employee's finger was pinched between a motor cover and forklift forks while trying to reposition the load on the forks.
An employee was working on a horizontal milling machine when the employee's finger got caught between the rotating chuck and the metal stationary platform. The machine was unguarded at the time.
An employee operating a sit-down forklift got his left leg pinched between the forklift and the metal racking. He sustained a fracture to the lower leg.
A client pushed his chair back away from the table as an employee walked past. The employee tripped over the chair leg and fell, fracturing the right patella and requiring surgery.
While walking, an employee tripped on a stump and was impaled between the bridge of his nose and eye socket.
An employee fractured the right wrist while operating a mixer used for mixing adhesive(s). The employee's glove got caught on the mixer blade/propeller.
An employee was ripping a board on a table saw when it kicked back. The saw blade amputated two fingers on his left hand.

An employee was assembling piping (10 feet long, weighing approximately 100 pounds) on a pump skid. When the pipe was set down, the employee's finger was caught between the pipe and the flange, amputating the tip of the left ring finger. The employee required surgery.
An employee fell off of a roof and was hospitalized.

An employee amputated his right index finger (at the middle knuckle) when it came in contact with the band saw while cutting meat at about 8:45 a.m. on 03-24-2015. The guards were in place at the time of the incident.
An employee was burned on his lower back and posterior by a heater used to warm equipment and the general environment. He was wearing personal protective equipment.

An employee's fingers got caught between a bladder bag and a tire mold. The employee was hospitalized and received an amputation of the third digit to the second knuckle and the fourth digit to the first knuckle.
An employee was walking into work and slipped on ice. She broke a bone in her leg and required surgery.
An employee was turning a 300- to 400-pound flange to clean it when the chains holding the flange came loose/unhooked. The flange fell on the employee's right foot, breaking five bones.
An employee sustained injuries to his left index finger while rigging down.
An employee working on a 480V electrical panel dropped a metal cage, which created an arc flash and burned the employee's hand.
An employee attempted to clear a jam near the glue pick-up roller on a winder machine. The employee's right index finger made contact with a moving roller, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after being pinned between a remote control dirt compactor and pylon.
An employee injured his right hand when he reached over a rotating mill to adjust the blade.  The rotating mill caught the cuff of the employee's right glove and fractured three bones.
An employee fell from a Segway and injured her right leg while preparing to leave the office to start her work day.

An employee climbing a ladder on the back of a tanker truck fell approximately 14 feet when the truck moved while the employee was climbing. The employee was wearing a full body harness and was attempting to connect to an overhead anchor point just prior to the accident.

The driver drove a chassis with a container up to a crane to have the crane lift the container from the chassis. The pins were not disengaged from the chassis and the crane picked up the chassis and the yard jockey (half-cab). An employee was lifted and dropped and sustained two broken vertebrae.
An employee was burned by a flash fire while connecting equipment to a gas line.

An employee was operating a stand-up, powered pallet jack in an ice cream freezer. While turning the pallet jack, the employee's foot got pinched between the pallet jack and storage racking, amputating part of the left big toe. The employee's left foot was hanging outside of the rider platform at the time of the incident.

An employee entered the blower area to inspect the damper and conduct preventive maintenance.  The employee fell 5 feet off of a ledge onto duct work and sustained body injuries. There was low lighting in the area at the time of the incident.

An employee was on a scissor lift cutting a metal water pipe (15-feet long) with a torch. When the pipe was completely cut, it hit the scissor lift and caused the lift to fall 15 feet to the ground. The employee broke his arm and pelvis and was hospitalized.

An employee arrived in the parking lot at the work site to attend a meeting. She exited her vehicle and fell when she stepped off of the 5- to 6-inch curbing. She landed on the concrete pavement and injured her leg, breaking her tibia in two places.
On March 25, 2015, an employee transporting a racking system contacted a 480-volt busbar. The employee received burns to the torso, head, and shoulder and was hospitalized.
Employee shot a nail from a nail gun into his left thumb.
An employee was stepping from a walkway with guard rails onto the roof when he stumbled and fell off of the roof edge. The roof was approximately 32-feet high.

An employee placed her hand in a screw conveyor to remove a jam. The conveyor was still operational and amputated her fingertip below the fingernail. Two parts of the machine were shut off and a guard or two were removed at the time of the incident.
An employee fell from a ladder and was hospitalized with a broken arm.
Drano splashed into an employee's eye while unclogging a drain.
An employee suffered an amputation of their left middle finger while working on the draw bench. The employee's finger was caught between the faceplate and the knockoff ring.

An employee was installing a doubler plate on a ballast tank on a boat that was in dry dock. He was stooped down with his back against pipes, welding a vertical patch on the tank about 4 to 5 inches from his right leg, when his pants caught fire. The employee was welding in very tight quarters.
An employee was injured when his left leg got caught between the truss press and the table.  The employee sustained a left leg amputation from the knee down.
While working on his route, an employee felt intense pain in his back, going down to the back of his legs. He was hospitalized with a pinched nerve in his back.

An employee was using a capstan and rope. The rope got caught, and the employee attempted to untangle it. The employee's hand was caught between the rope and the capstan spool while wearing a glove. His fingertip was degloved.

The employer was conducting a crane switching operation at the intersection of track three and east track. A component part of the crane fell and released hydraulic fluids, which contacted the injured employee's left forearm. The employee was hospitalized, and the left arm below the elbow was amputated.

An employee was electrically shocked when his right hand made contact with a power line that was inductively charged. There were three power lines, two outer lines with 138kv and a center line that was disconnected but not grounded. The employee grabbed the center power line when he stumbled while trying to exit the tower. He suffered exit wounds to the right shin and a right toe.

An employee was guiding a forklift to set a roll of conveyor belting onto a stand on a table.  The stand collapsed when the roll was set, and the employee was catapulted up and off of the table, landing 12 feet away on a concrete floor in a sitting position. He injured his right hip and buttocks and was hospitalized, and later had surgery to correct hip fractures.

An employee stepping out of the room reached out to stop the door from hitting her when her left-hand pinky finger got caught in the door. The finger was broken, cut, and bleeding, and she was hospitalized.

An employee was testing a pressurized air tank with the pressure at 6 psi. During the testing procedure, he took a metal grinder to grind down a weld. This caused the head of the tank to pressure. The corner of the tank head broke free, struck him in the side of the head/face, and then threw him back 5 to 6 feet onto the ground. The employee sustained cuts and scrapes, as well as injuries to his head, shoulders, and ribs.
An employee was stabbed in the back with a 4-inch knife and was hospitalized.
An employee was picking up a 24-inch valve with an overhead crane. The valve fell, striking the employee on the foot.

An employee was setting a rebar wall panel. After cutting the panel loose, the crane started to ascend. The employee held the crane choker to keep it from getting hung up on anything as it ascended. During this time, he got his finger pinched between the choker and the rebar. He was hospitalized with a potential broken finger on his left hand.
An employee cutting the end of a metal pipe amputated the left middle fingertip when a clamp loosened and struck the employee's fingers.

An employee operating a metal press moved her left hand into the area of operation. The press cycled, injuring her third finger and partially amputating her fourth finger. The employee required surgery.
An employee was operating a truck-mounted crane when the jib fell off and struck the employee's leg. The employee suffered a compound fracture of the left leg.
An employee amputated three left-hand fingertips while clearing a jam on a plate machine.

An employee stopped a conveyor belt and then climbed on top of it to clear a jam. Another employee, who did not know he was on top, turned the conveyor back on. The employee's hand got crushed between the two conveyor rollers.
On 3/25/15, an employee received an amputation to the left index finger when the employee's glove came into contact with the moving router bit.
An employee suffered an amputation to his left index finger when it was crushed by a chain sprocket on a conveyor belt grain thrower. The chain sprocket was unguarded at the time.

At approximately 8:10 p.m., on 3/25/15, an employee fell 20 to 30 feet from an articulating boom bucket to the ground. The employee was tightening bolts for mast arms on traffic signal lights when the clip tie-off point broke and the employee fell. The employee sustained cracked lumbar vertebrae and head lacerations.
A Sanford Medical Center employee was injured when she tripped over an electrical cord. As she fell, she grabbed a med cart, which landed on top of her body and broke her leg.
An employee's right thumb was amputated while using a table saw to cut aluminum for stadium seating.

An employee operating a Wrangler (front-end loader) to unload the pebble line backed into an open area. The rollover cage struck a doorway where a door swings up into the dry fertilizer area. The door came off of the latches that were holding it up and struck him in the back.
An employee was descending a ladder when his foot slipped through, causing him to fall. He put his hand out to break his fall, suffering a broken wrist. He was hospitalized.

An employee in the wood department was cutting a small rip on a table saw when the employee's right pinky finger was severed and three other fingers were lacerated; the right pinky finger was surgically amputated. At the time of the incident, no push stick was used and the guard was not in place.

An employee was injured while cleaning windows when the ladder he was climbing slipped out at the feet on a wet deck. The employee fell on his back onto the deck, suffering a fractured T-12 in his back and a mild head concussion. He was hospitalized overnight.

An employee sustained a severe hand injury after a finger got caught on a piece of metal while descending a mobile stair tower. The employee tore a significant amount of flesh from the hand/finger, requiring hospitalization.
An employee amputated the right index fingertip.
An employee hit his head while traveling through a door on a scissor lift. He was hospitalized.
An employee's right hand and wrist got caught while helping a mechanic declog a piston.

An employee was felling a tree. After the tree was cut, the top of it landed in a hickory tree, causing the felled tree to spring back and break the hinge. The base of the felled tree kicked back and hit the employee, injuring the ribs and the left ring and pinky fingers. The employee was hospitalized.

Employees were hanging a horse head on a well. The injured employee was on a pumping unit, waiting for the horse head to be lifted with rig blocks, with a safety retractable line attached. The line got caught in the blocks and pulled the employee off of the pumping unit, causing the employee to fall 10 to 15 feet before the safety line engaged. At the point of engagement, the safety line snapped, and the employee fell to the ground.
An employee's fingers got caught in a grease pump gearbox. The employee's right index fingertip was later amputated.
An employee was injured on 3/26/15 while working on an inactive, disengaged brake. The employee tripped and was struck by a counterbalance in the chest and abdomen.
An employee's right index finger was crushed between printing press rollers.

An employee was stabbing up in the derrick while a pipe was being brought up on an elevator. As the employee reached to unlatch the elevator, the tongs engaged, striking the employee's left hand resulting in a broken wrist.

An employee was sweeping around the MTB Machine. He bent over at the base of the conveyor and backed into a rotating shaft sticking out of the machine. The shaft caught his jacket/vest and pulled his left arm into it, resulting in multiple fractures. The machine was not shut down at the time.

An employee on an elevated aerial lift was attempting to hang a dead-end structure on a pole. The wire he was holding contacted energized wires (7200 V), shocking the employee. He was hospitalized with burns to his right shoulder and the skin on his stomach.
An employee's left ring fingertip was amputated between two metal storage bins when an empty bin fell while being stacked.
An employee cut two right-hand middle fingers while using a 280-inch band saw. Guards were in place at the time of the incident.
An employee was inspecting ropes from a ropes course. He fainted and fell while descending a ladder, injuring his left knee.
An employee riding on a bus with a client attempted to adjust the liftgate. The bus operator engaged the gate, partially amputating the employee's left middle finger.

Two employees were removing sludge with a vacuum hose and pressure washer inside a frac tank. One of the employees was hit in the foot with the pressurized water (approximately 3500 psi) from the pressure washer, blowing out the employee's boot. The employee sustained a pin-hole injury to the foot and was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was changing dies on a 400-ton Accupress brake press when one of the lifting bars slipped off the die and crushed the employee's hand between the base of the press and the die.
An employee was working on a press machine when he got caught in two nip points, degloving his right hand. The guard on the folder section was bypassed at the time of the incident.
An employee was loading a steer into a truck. The steer got loose and attacked the employee.

An employee was hospitalized with first and second degree burns to 20 percent of his body, on his left arm, shoulder, and back. The employee was preparing to load sand into the tickler attached to a paper machine. He opened the valve and was burned by hot water and flash steam at a temperature of approximately 108 degrees Fahrenheit.

An employee's left index fingertip was amputated by a blade bending machine in the fabrication department. The employee's finger got caught in a pinch point between the machine and a ram while bending the metal 30 degrees.
An employee injured his back while helping a client with a bath at his workplace.
An employee fell 30 feet from the roof area while installing a tin roof on a new building addition. The employee dislocated the left wrist and fractured the right elbow.

An employee was driving a stand-up dock stacker forklift to pick up a pallet. He attempted to avoid hitting a stack of tires by turning the wheel sharply and lost his balance. His left foot became dislodged from the forklift, while his right foot remained on the lift; the lift was therefore still in motion. His foot became pinned under the tires and the forklift.
On or about March 26, 2015, an employee was hospitalized after crushing two fingers while operating the rebar shear line.
An employee's nose was injured by a falling carpet while opening a trailer door.

A PSI blower chip loading system plugged up and tripped the breaker. A maintenance employee locked out the machine, cleared the plug, and restarted the machine. The employee was checking for air flow through the pipes with his right index finger hanging at the stop plate when the mechanical sleeve lacerated the finger pad. The machine amputated a chunk of the right index finger pad. The fingernail and part of the bone were removed to close the skin around the end of the finger.

An employee was found near a night watch station located close to knife room #1. He was walking disoriented and was unable to speak or hear.  The accident occurred around 1:50 p.m.  He was hospitalized with swelling on the right side of his head.
On March 26, 2015, an employee working on a power press reached his hand into the machine and hit a switch causing the press to engage causing a partial amputation of his right pinky finger.

An employee was carrying a tray from the kitchen to the cafeteria. Another employee opened the door, which pushed the tray into the employee's chest. The employee complained of chest pain and was hospitalized.

On 02/26/2015, at approximately 10:30 AM, an employee picked up an electric handsaw that was energized. The employee activated the handsaw with his right hand and amputated the middle finger from his left hand.
An employee fell and fractured a femur while walking up the exterior stairs at a client's house.
An employee was hospitalized due to injuries sustained when she fell to the floor at her desk.

An employee at Quantum Metals in Lebanon, Ohio, was using an industrial belt sander when his finger got caught in the machine. His right ring finger was amputated from the first segment down to the first joint, and his right middle finger was amputated just below the nail.
An employee was struck by a wood wall while dismantling a movie set.
An employee was bending rebar when his finger got caught between a rebar and a pinch point. His right index finger was amputated.

A maintenance employee reached into the back of an evisceration machine and was injured when his fingers contacted the blade. His right ring finger was partially amputated. The machine was still on at the time.

An employee lost their balance while descending the stairs of a John Deere QC-54. When the employee reached out to grab something, the wedding ring on the left hand got caught, avulsing the left ring finger from the second knuckle to the fingertip and removing the fingertip at the first knuckle. The rest of the finger to the second knuckle was removed during surgery.

An employee was helping the overhead crane operator pour a ladle of molten metal when the ladle got wedged under the top railing. The stopper rod opened, and the ladle contents fell out, hit the floor, and splashed the employee. He sustained burns from his hip down to his shin area, with third degree burns on his legs. He also sustained burns to his face near the mustache area, as well as to one arm and both hands.
An employee was unjamming a mixer when a door dropped down, fracturing his arm.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee lost their footing while stepping onto some plastic debris and fell down a grade. The employee was hospitalized with a broken right femur.

An employee was unloading a wire basket from a flatbed truck. As a crane began to lift the basket, he got caught by it and was lifted approximately 6 to 8 feet off the ground. He fell to the ground, breaking his leg and nose.
An employee was burned while lighting a propane-fueled smoker that flashed back on him. He sustained burns to the right side of his face and right arm.

On or about 3/27/2015, at 10:00 AM, an employee was transporting a patient that was lying on a bed.  While pushing/pulling the bed, the employee felt discomfort in the back area. The next day, the employee felt pain in his lower back that extended to his leg. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was exiting the site trailer and fell 3 feet.  The trailer stairs were removed at the time. The employee was hospitalized with lacerations on the back of the head and a fractured hip.
An employee was installing a sink faucet when he cut his finger on the edge of the stainless steel sink.
An employee amputated three left-hand middle fingers and part of the thumb in the station gears of a press machine.
An employee's left index finger was amputated at the first knuckle after she reached into a chain-and-sprocket drive mechanism. The mechanism was moving at the time of the incident.
An employee was feeding metal stock into a straightening roll machine when his right index fingertip and glove got caught in the rollers, amputating the right index fingertip (without bone loss).
An employee's finger got caught in a delimber while making repairs, resulting in an amputation of the end of the middle finger from the last knuckle.
Employee pouring concrete sustained chemical burns to the leg due to prolonged exposure to wet concrete.
An employee was checking an skid loader's alternator when the motor fan caught his left hand, amputating the middle finger and severely cutting the pinky.
On or about March 27, 2015, an employee operating a pasta machine had his arm amputated up to his elbow.
On or about 03/27/2015, an employee was hospitalized with injuries sustained from getting caught between a brake and reel while pushing an empty paper spool.
An employee was operating a stand-up forklift when his left foot became trapped between the lift and an endcap for a rack. He was hospitalized with compound fractures and had his foot amputated.
An employee in the carpenter shop was ripping 2x4's into to smaller slats when they made contact with the blade, resulting in the amputation of finger(s).
An employee was injured and hospitalized after being hit by a falling tree limb while felling trees.

An employee experienced a shock and arc flash when cleaning the inside of electrical gear that was believed to be shut off. The employee received second and third degree burns on the face, hands, and arms.

An employee descending a ladder lost his balance. He reached for something to stabilize himself and put his left hand through the guard on a machine's exhaust fan, breaking his left thumb and middle and ring fingers.
An employee washing her hands in the bakery department tripped and fell, sustaining a broken hip. She was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee preparing to move a damaged light pole to make room for a new one caught his hand between portions of the pole after trying to section it out by cutting it with a reciprocating saw. The light pole bent, and his hand was caught between sections.

Two employees were working in a JLG Lift to install instrument piping. An elevator door above them came loose from its slip and fell. The elevator door hit another object, which caused it to bounce outward and strike the lift basket and the injured employee.
An employee removing rocks from an auger suffered a finger amputation.
While loading plants into a truck, an employee opened the back and was scraped by the door, causing a cut to the stomach area.
An employee was cleaning/washing the counter in the ER department. She slipped and injured her head, neck, and lower back. The floor was wet at the time.

An employee reached in to remove packaging materials from the six-line filler (yogurt machine). The machine was indexing and was not turned off at the time. She injured her left forearm, requiring hospitalization and subsequent surgery.
On March 28, 2015, at approximately 1:00 p.m., an employee was stepping over the tongue on a cart and fell. The employee sustained injuries to the right arm and head, resulting in hospitalization.
On or about March 28, 2015, an employee sustained a foot injury while operating a forklift, which resulted in the partial loss of the left foot.
Employees were connecting a drill pipe. The injured employee suffered a partial amputation to his pinky finger when it got caught between the pipe and tong.
The incident occurred at a press, which rewinds rotating shafts and cycles out. The employee's arms got caught in the rewinder.
An employee dropped a piece of PVC conduit on his thumb, breaking it and damaging tendons.

The injured employee's coworker was moving a rear suspension with a Sky-Trac forklift in the salvage yard located off of Interstate 55, Exit 71, near Blytheville. A piece of the suspension broke off and hit the injured employee in the face, fracturing his jaw, eye socket, and forehead. He was hospitalized for facial reconstruction.
An employee sustained an electrical shock and burns to the hand during construction of electrical power transmission and distribution lines.

An employee was mounting a spare tire onto a wheel that was brought in by a customer. The employee began airing up the tire when the bottom of the wheel blew out and launched the wheel into the air. The wheel hit the employee in the arm and hand. The employee was hospitalized with a broken arm and thumb.
An employee sustained an injury when his foot got caught between a reach truck and a metal beam.
An employee was using a step ladder to get an item for a customer. As she descended the ladder, she missed a step and fell. She was hospitalized with a head injury.
An employee fell on plastic pellets from a hopper and broke his left hip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was conducting maintenance on a jet bridge when a telescoping air duct pipe disconnected and fell. It struck the employee on the right shoulder, knocking him to the ground.
A maintenance employee injured his hand while checking for leaks on the high pressure hydraulic injection on a press. Hydraulic fluid was injected into his left hand, requiring surgery.
An employee went to unplug a piece of equipment and was shocked by a 480-volt dehumidification unit.

An employee was helping to close a bay door that was jammed about 2.5 feet high. The door came loose and slammed down on the employee, trapping him underneath. He sustained a broken leg and was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was found lying on the floor with cuts and abrasions to his head and face. The employee did not respond to his name. He was hospitalized.
Employee was struck by a forklift and broke his right ankle.

On March 29, 2015, at approximately 3:00 p.m., an employee sustained an injury to the middle finger and index finger on his right hand, resulting in amputation. The site port cover was removed from the door-facing press to blow out the fiber incline conveyor. The conveyor was not shut down at the time. An air wand got caught between the conveyor and tail roller, and the employee's hand was pulled into the framework between the air wand and the conveyor housing.

An employee was using a hydraulic vise to secure an "I" beam to the band saw table. The power switch on the vise was triggered, causing the loss of his left-hand middle finger. The employee was hospitalized.

On or about 3/29/15, at 2:00 PM, an employee working in the meat department was helping a customer that requested chicken. The employee proceeded to cut the chicken with a band saw when it slipped and amputated the tip of her right thumb. She was hospitalized to reattach the thumb tip.

On March 29, 2015, an employee sustained an amputation injury to the pinky finger at the base of the fingernail. The employee was trying to keep two patients apart when one of them bit the employee's fingertip off.
An employee was standing on a chair to adjust curtains. The chair slipped, causing the employee to fall and break the tibia just below the knee.

On March 30, 2015, at approximately 3:05 PM, an employee that was directing plant operations climbed on a moving railcar. The employee got crushed between the ladder of the railcar and the bollard and was hospitalized with severe hip injuries.

An employee was injured when she reached into a Bartelt Machine that was being repaired by a maintenance technician. The employee did not notice the maintenance technician and went behind the machine to remove a pouch from it. The machine caught the tip of her glove and pulled her hand back, amputating a portion of her pinky. The  maintenance technician was unaware of her presence.

On March 30, 2015, at approximately 7:30 a.m., employees were using an overhead crane to move a sub-product (billet) from a lower level to a higher level. When the billet was situated on the higher level, the chain loosened; it toppled over and fell the down the stairs, striking the employee who was coming up to unhook it. The employee was hospitalized with a scalp laceration and spine fractures.
An employee was about to load his truck when a coworker deployed an outrigger that hit the employee's foot.
An employee was loosening some bolts and had his wrench (left hand) against an angle iron (brace). The wrench spun and caught a finger between the angle iron and wrench.
An employee's hands were caught in a Stephan mixing machine used for mixing dough and amputated his right-hand index and middle fingers.
An employee was struck and trapped by a tire he was removing. He was hospitalized.

An employee was working inside a trailer with an approximately 7-foot-long tube. The tube is used to straighten the walls of the trailers and has a detachable base. The tube slid down the trailer wall, and the employee's left pinky finger got caught between the tube and the detachable base. He sustained an amputation injury from his first knuckle and was hospitalized.

On Monday, March 30, 2015, at 12:38 p.m., an employee was standing on a 6-foot fiberglass ladder inside the entrance to the first floor when he touched an energized wire and received an electric shock. He fell from the ladder to the floor and fractured his left elbow.

An employee was on a service call, replacing a sensor on a fleet truck. He stood on a battery box, and put his right leg on a cylinder to help hold his balance. His hands were occupied with hand tools in a position above his head. His left foot slipped, putting all of his body weight on his right foot and resulting in a fracture below the knee.
An employee suffered second degree burns while removing a sidewall header from a boiler.  Debris blocked some water and was released onto the employee's arms, hands, and torso.
An employee lost consciousness and fell off of an A-frame ladder while working on a filling line. The employee sustained injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee was moving a 60-inch-diamater pipe on a manual roller table. His right pinky fingertip was amputated in a pinch point created between the metal pipe and the roller.
An employee crawled into a packaging machine to clear a jam. The employee's right thumb got caught under the pressure plate, resulting in surgical amputation of the thumb tip.
An employee was descending on a manlift at the first level. As he stepped onto the floor, he fell into the pit of the manlift.
An employee's hand got caught between elevators and a derrick. The employee sustained a laceration between the ring and small fingers on the right hand, as well as a fractured small finger.

On 3/30/2015, at approximately 1300 hrs., an employee was collecting recyclables for Lebanon Farms Disposal. After collecting recyclable materials, the employee mounted the recycling truck's side step. While the truck was traveling to its next stop, the driver noticed the employee laying in the street. The employee was hospitalized with a head injury.
An employee was injured when bridge piling fell on his leg during highway construction work.
An employee slipped and caught his finger between two pieces of equipment. As the crossover sub fell, he was unable to remove his finger in time. He also broke his wrist.
An employee was walking up the stairs of a work-over rig when he lost his footing and slipped. He landed on the ground at the bottom of the stairs and fractured his hip.
An employee working in the office fell over a laptop bag strap that was on the floor while walking. She injured her right hip, lower back, and right knee.

The injured employee was holding a 1/4" steel plate with another employee while a supervisor operated a crane to move the steel plate. The wind caused the plate to twist, and the injured employee's left hand got crushed between the steel plate and a truck. The injury resulted in an amputation at the hospital.

An employee was on a drilling rig floor during normal drilling operations when pressure built up and blew through a hole. The employee was blown backwards and hit his head and arm. His head and arm sustained lacerations. He was admitted to the hospital for surgery on a fractured skull.
An employee severed his left thumb while using a Skil saw to cut a 2 x 6 board.  He was hospitalized for reattachment surgery.
An employee was hospitalized after coming in contact with a racking system while operating a powered industrial vehicle.
An employee got his arm stuck in a printing press.
While working on the roof of a new commercial building, an employee tripped and fell, landing on a steel purlin. The employee lacerated the left arm and required surgery and hospitalization.
An employee sustained injuries when he fell approximately 27 feet.
An employee was operating a winch to remove a pump for servicing. The cables broke, pinning the employee between the winch and some equipment. The employee sustained an injury to the chest area.
An employee was feeding metal into a rolling machine to bend a part while looking at a computer screen. His hand got pulled into the roller.
An employee was installing duct in a trench box. Because the trench was in an incline, the road plate shifted towards the box and pinched the worker's right forearm, causing it to break.
Employee was sitting in a small, heavy, plastic lawn chair. The back of the chair broke away from the arms of the chair, and the employee fell to the floor.
An employee was sliding wood under an extruder while being lifted by a forklift. The extruder shifted, and the employee's finger was crushed between the extruder and a pallet.
An employee sustained a thumb amputation when he attempted to unclog a rotary valve. The machine was not locked out at the time.

On March 30, 2015, an employee was using a hand-held grinder when it slipped from his hand and struck his left knee. The impact from the grinder left an abrasion that later became infected and required hospitalization.
An employee was servicing a labeling machine. He waved his hand past the light sensor to activate the labeler and got his ring finger caught between the chain and sprocket.

An employee was using a retractable-type box cutter to cut plastic wrap material for a display case/stand.  While cutting the plastic wrap, the employee lacerated his left leg and thigh with the box cutter. He was hospitalized.

A 250-pound tank was being slid from the forks of a forklift into a frame when the injured employee's hand got caught between the frame and the tank. The employee's right-hand, middle finger nailbed was amputated.

An employee working from a ladder was installing a pipe when a fitting came loose. The pipe fell, struck the employee's left leg, and caused him to lose his balance. He fell down the ladder and broke his right heel.

An employee was installing a 3"-diameter syphon pipe with a small valve on a tank car. The employee inserted the pipe into the tank car. The gasket moved, so he lifted it up by hand. While it was in the air under his power, he lost his grip and smashed his palm between the valve and a stud, breaking bones.

On or about 3/31/2015, at approximately 9:00 p.m., an employee's left arm got caught in a bowling pin resetting machine. The employee reached into the side of the machine to adjust a pin and the machine cycled. The machine was not de-energized at the time of the incident. The employee sustained soft tissue injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee was working on a ladder removing screws from a wall when the ladder slipped and the employee fell to the ground.
An employee suffered an amputation of his left, little fingertip when the folding chair on which he was sitting collapsed.
An employee's shirt got caught on the coil winder, pulling her into the machine. She was not wearing her apron at the time.

On March 31, 2015, an employee was working at Gardner Denver Nash in Charleroi, Pennsylvania, when he was injured while operating a radial arm saw. The employee suffered fractures and lacerations to the second, third, and fourth digits on his left hand. He required surgery and was hospitalized.
On March 31, 2015, at approximately 7:15 p.m., an employee was closing the gate when it fell off its wheels and onto the employee.

An employee was operating an injection molding press machine. The injured employee pulled a part out of the press through the door. The door jammed when the injured employee tried to close it, so the employee reached inside the machine to clear the jam. The employee's hand got caught by a machine part; the employee's thumb tip, including part of the thumbnail, was amputated.
An employee was adjusting the rigging holding up a 3'9" tall manway door when the door came loose and fell on the employee's foot.
An employee was removing forms from a column using a positioning hook. When the form came free, the employee fell with the form approximately 5 feet to the ground.
An employee's finger was crushed under a wheel chock while moving a trimmer vehicle. The employee sustained a partial amputation of the left pointer finger.
An employee was collecting plastic scrap in a tote near a press when she tripped and fell backwards, hitting her head on the concrete floor.
An employee tripped on an electrical cord and fell to the floor, sustaining a broken hip.
An employee fell approximately 9 feet from a ladder while ascending to the main deck. The employee was hospitalized with fractures to the number 10 and 11 ribs and a cracked L1.

An employee was riding a three-wheel trike through the plant when he struck a forklift. He sustained a fracture to the face at the cheekbone and temple. He also sustained small cuts on his shoulder and hand and was hospitalized overnight.

A mason employee fell more than 40 feet from the roof of a building after hitting a hydro-mobile while coming off the roof. The employee was wearing a harness and had retractable fall protection available at the time of the incident.

An employee was trying to set up a trim die on a thermal molding machine when his left forearm, thumb, and index finger got crushed. The machine was not locked out at the time. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was helping a coworker remove a forklift that was lodged in the mud. The employee bent over to place boards for traction under the front wheels of the forklift. The coworker used another forklift to lift the lodged forklift out of the mud when the fork slipped off of the wheel frame and struck the employee above the left eye.
An employee injured his fingertip while rebuilding a down-hole tube.  He was taken to the hospital where part of his finger was amputated.
An employee was manipulating a piece of wood on a conveyor when his finger became caught between the conveyor and the piece of wood, causing a partial finger amputation.
An employee was struck by boards being transported by an ATV in the cemetery.
An employee got tangled in a computer cord at her desk and then fell to the ground, fracturing her left arm and requiring major surgery; she also bruised her left ankle and foot.

On or about 3/31/2015, at 9:40 a.m., an employee was picking up garbage. The employee was walking toward a garbage can when he slipped and fell on his back.  Coworkers helped him up and kept working until the employee fell again and could not get back up on his feet. He was hospitalized.
On March 31, 2015, an employee amputated his right middle fingertip when it contacted a part he was deburring on a rotating lathe.
An employee was shocked and received third degree burns while working inside of a 480-volt panel. The panel was not off at the time.
An employee fell on a bed alarm cord after adjusting a bed on 3/31/15. The employee was later hospitalized with a fractured hip and required surgery.
An employee was climbing a tree; he tied into the tree, but the tie-in point broke. The employee fell to the ground, sustaining a broken leg and wrist.

On or about 3/31/2015, at approximately 9:50 p.m., an employee was hospitalized with a chin laceration. The employee was operating a mechanically powered hot trim press. After the press cycle, the work piece became stuck in the upper die of the press. The work piece then fell from the die and struck the hand tongs the employee was holding, which caused the tong's handle to strike the employee in the chin.

An employee was moving a sheet of steel (300 lbs.) with an overhead hoist. The employee was using a magnet to move the metal from the grinding area to the finished stack. When the sheet was over the finished pile of sheets, the magnet released; the sheet fell on his hand, crushing the left middle and ring fingers. He was hospitalized.

An employee was grinding at a pedestal grinder on a small piece of work. The work had been set in place using vice grips. The work slipped from its placement, moving and lodging into the space between the work rest and the disc. The employee's left hand was also moved by the force into this area, lacerating/crushing his index, middle, and ring fingers.
An employee fell 16 feet from a bunk silo, breaking his leg and requiring hospitalization.
While removing a submersible motor from a hydro testing tank, an employee came into contact with the 3200-volt cord running from the motor to the Hipot/Megohmmeter, resulting in an electrical shock.

An employee tried to remove a piece of tape on the housing of a Quackenbush drill he was operating. While reaching around to do so, he became caught in the moving shaft and lost approximately 1/2 inch of his left ring finger.

An employee suffered severe burns to his nose, eyes, forehead, right forearm, and the frontal region of his neck when pressurized, hot product exploded and sprayed on him as he was looking in the cooker machine.

An employee was moving a winch on a cart when a drain in the floor caused the cart to tip and the winch to fall. While trying to grab the falling winch, the employee's thumb was smashed against the floor.

On 4/1/2015, at 4:20 PM, an employee was injured when a coworker operating a PIT contacted the employee's left ankle. The employee sustained micro-fractures and swelling of the ankle, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee was standing underneath a pole when a mass pipe came loose, fell 185 feet, and hit the employee's leg. The employee sustained a compound fracture to the leg and was hospitalized.
An employee was injured from being bitten by a client.

An employee was cutting metal stock using a horizontal band saw when the employee's right index finger got smashed between the stock and the fence of the band saw. The injury removed the flesh from the tip of the right index finger.
An employee was attempting to move a weld table with an overhead hoist when his finger got caught in the chains. He sustained a distal amputation to his left index finger.

At approximately 3:45 AM on April 1, 2015, at the Interbake Foods LLC bakery in North Sioux City, South Dakota, the injured employee was helping other employees move a rotary molder machine by hand. While moving the machine, his right index fingertip was amputated halfway down his fingernail by the hinge on a 2' x 2' control panel box attached to the rotary machine.
An employee working with a pry bar was checking if a bolt hole was properly aligned on the axle of a garbage truck. The axle slipped while his finger was in the hole, amputating his fingertip.

On or about 4/1/2015, at approximately 9:30 a.m., a maintenance employee received an amputation injury to his right thumb while operating a lathe. The employee was using an Emory-type cloth to smooth a part in the lathe when his glove got caught on the part, cloth, and/or machine, causing his injury. He was hospitalized.

On or about 4/1/2015, at approximately 8:30 a.m., a PIV ran over an employee's foot. The injured employee was talking with the PIV operator about a process. After they finished taking, the PIV driver began to turn and reverse and ran over the employee's right foot. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

On or about 4/1/2015, at approximately 7:00 p.m., an employee bypassed an interlock device by climbing over a guarding fence and reached into the cushion roller portion of a material handling system. The machinery was not de-energized at the time. The rollers caught/struck the employee's right hand and arm. The employee was hospitalized.

On or about 4/1/2015 at 2:00 PM, an employee was trimming a ficus hedge using a pole pruner. The pole pruner got stuck in the branch that the employee was trying to cut, so the employee yanked it. The pruner made contact with a power line, which shocked the employee; the employee was unconscious for approximately 1 minute. The employee also sustained burns to the left-hand index finger, as well as ankle burns. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

An employee climbed a closed stepladder that was leaning against a wall. He was carrying a trash can to put it up onto a storage mezzanine. As he swung the can up and released it, it struck the building, ricocheted back into him, and knocked him off the ladder to the floor.
An employee was pouring hot caramel from a bowl to a pan. The caramel spilled, causing the employee to sustain second and third degree burns to both hands.
An employee was clamping a light onto a battery cable when the motor fan turned on and cut the end of his right index finger off.
An employee was attempting to slide a patient onto the CT stretcher when his legs gave out and he fell to the ground. He was hospitalized with a back injury.
An employee with a sledgehammer struck the injured employee's left middle finger while he was holding a board. The injured employee's fingertip was amputated.
An employee pulled on a rope that opens an overhead hatch. The rope broke, causing the employee to lose his balance and fall 30 inches. He broke his hip and required hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was operating a Raymond stand-up lift in an aisle. As he turned to come back down the aisle, he looked up and saw a concrete pole ahead of him. He extended his left leg to stop the lift. His leg got caught between the post and the lift, fracturing his medial tibia plateau.

An employee was walking/working in an aisle when a metal tray weighing approximately 350 pounds was knocked off the third shelf of an adjacent racking system. The tray hit the floor and then hit the employee. He suffered a fractured left femur and a hematoma over one eye.
An employee was troubleshooting a pneumatic ram located in the CYA unit. The employee's left index fingertip got caught in the ram.
An employee was operating a core pusher machine when her left index finger got caught between a hydraulic ram head and the machine itself, resulting in a partial finger amputation.

An employee was feeding trim into a roller when the machine became jammed. The employee went to the rear of the machine, opened the door, and began pulling fiber from the duct work. He reached into the back of the duct work towards the machine; his hand was injured by the rollers.

A crew of four employees was waiting for a concrete truck to arrive at the site to fill the excavation. The crew found that a water reclamation pipe had a leak and sprayed water onto the 4-foot-high excavation wall. Some of the dirt fell back into the excavation, so the injured employee entered the excavation to shovel it out. While he was in the excavation, additional dirt and a piece of parking lot asphalt collapsed into the excavation and struck him.
While cutting a 2x6 board with a chop saw, an employee suffered an amputation of his left-hand thumb.

An employee suffered an injury when his feet and body were pulled through the rollers of the unfolder machine. The employee's feet were tangled on plastic that was on the floor. When the employee reversed the machine, his feet were pulled into it.
An employee was walking in the parking lot and slipped on ice between 5:30 AM and 6:00 AM on April 1, 2015. The employee was hospitalized and sustained two broken ribs and a subdural hematoma.
An employee was coupling trailers. One of the trailers rolled forward, pinching the employee's thumb in the pintle hook.
An employee was attempting to uncouple a railcar. The car rolled forward, trapping and crushing the employee's left ring finger. The employee required surgical amputation.
An employee was repairing an AC unit while working from an A-frame ladder. He fell off of the ladder and struck his head and shoulder on the ground.
On April 1, 2015, an employee amputated his left index finger while cutting wooden stakes using a circular saw. He was hospitalized.

An employee was painting the top of a doorframe while standing on stilts approximately 3 feet off of the ground. He turned to speak to another employee who had spoken to him; while doing so, he bumped his hard hat, causing him to slip and fall to the ground. He fractured his right arm and left elbow. He was hospitalized.
An employee got her foot stuck under a dolly and lost her balance during aircraft-loading operations. She fell and broke her left wrist.

An employee was using a grinding wheel on an engine lathe to grind a roller into specifications. The employee reached around a guard to adjust a belt. The grinding wheel caught the employee's right index finger, amputating the first joint.

An employee climbed onto a scaffold to place his tools on the wall. He reached a section on the scaffolding where he needed to stretch to reach and removed the guarding at the end frame. When he went back to work in the area, he fell through the unguarded section, breaking his knee caps.
On April 1, 2015, the employee was participating in a training session at Las Cruces, New Mexico. At approximately 7:15 p.m., the employee exhibited signs of heat exhaustion and was hospitalized.

An employee was setting up a valve in a lathe. He was tightening the lathe chuck with an Allen wrench; when he tried to remove the wrench from the chuck, his left middle fingertip got caught between the Allen wrench and the machine.
An employee fell from a single story when the employee's work belt was caught on the edge of a man basket.  The employee sustained a broken leg and arm.
An employee was injured when his finger got caught in a batter applicator pump.
An employee fell from a two-rung step ladder while cleaning the company's private airplane, fracturing his left hip.
Two employees were hospitalized due to a fire at the manufacturing facility. They suffered first and second degree burns on the neck, back, and hands.

An employee was removing the track on a dozer when the track slipped and pinched the employee's pinky finger between the track and a 1" pneumatic impact wrench. The employee sustained a left pinky finger amputation.

An employee was taking a lawn mower deck out of a crate. The employee was sliding the deck forward to put the wheels back on when the deck started to drop. The employee's finger got caught between the gauge wheel bracket and the crate, amputating the tip of the left-hand ring finger.
An employee was at a meeting. When he stood up from the table, his foot got tangled in a cable, causing him to fall and injure his hip and elbow. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee running a CNC routing machine tried to manually push down a part that he thought was loose while the machine was cutting it. He got stuck between the moving arm where the router cuts and a stationary arch. He was pinched, fracturing two left ribs and his shoulder.

An employee experienced a fractured mandible while attempting to loosen a bit on a stationary/mounted core drill.  The pipe wrench in use slipped, striking the employee in the face and causing her to fall and strike her forehead, hand, and thumb on nearby shelves and the floor.

An employee was disposing of 12-gauge shotgun shells with a single-shot, 12-gauge shotgun and had disposed of several shells. After a period of disposal, the gun barrel split, causing metal pieces of the gun barrel to strike the employee 's right shoulder.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery to remove the pieces of metal.

An employee working from a platform began descending a ladder while attached to a climbing assist device. The employee reached up to close a hatch above him to prevent an open space where two other employees were working. The employee bumped the hatch and it came down on his right thumb.
An employee fell while she was walking into work. Her foot slipped on a step, causing her to fall and injure her leg.
An employee was walking between empty baggage carts when the baggage tug operator drove over her right foot.

On or about 4/2/15, at 3:15 p.m., an employee was moving a catwalk that provided fall protection at elevated positions during  manufactured home building. The catwalk tilted while being moved. The employee was struck by the falling catwalk and his right foot was crushed.

An employee was using an overhead crane to set a jacket on a rail car. The employee's right hand was caught between the jacket and underframe, crushing his right-hand ring finger. He was hospitalized overnight and required surgical amputation of the finger.
An employee was polishing a piece of a metal rod in a lathe. The employee's right hand got pulled into the lathe, amputating the ends of the two middle fingers.
An employee amputated his finger in the back room while stocking product.
On April 3, 2015, an employee was adjusting the height of the finger jointer machine when  the carriage came forward and amputated the tip of his right middle finger.

An employee was attempting to connect a drill stem to a drill rod inside a bore hole. He was straightening the rod in the hole with his right hand and was using his other hand to run the controls. The cable was still connected at this time.  He lowered the drill rod and used his hand to connect the slipper or hoisting cable from the drill rod in the hole. The cable and the drill rod started to spin around, pulling in and causing an amputation to his right hand and arm.
Employees were replacing equipment to install a cannon ball. As they were replacing the equipment, an employee bumped one of the valves. Pressure was released, spraying onto the employee's neck.
An employee's legs broke in several places after being struck by an automobile that crashed into the facility.
An employee pinched his finger while removing plywood from a work area. His finger got caught between the concrete and plywood; he was hospitalized.
An employee placed his right hand under the guard on a roller machine to push fabric back onto the roller. His right hand got caught between two rollers, resulting in lacerations.

An employee was pressure-washing a metal belt using a diluted solution of Oxofoam (a corrosive material). The spray contacted the employee in the neck/shoulder area, causing chemical burns to the skin.

An employee went to a customer's new construction site to look at a paint issue. He went upstairs to the second floor hallway to look at the issue and stepped back into an open area with no railing installed. He fell 10 feet to the ground and was knocked unconscious. The employee fractured his ribs.
An employee was dismantling a scaffold while unaware that he was tied off onto it. He fell from the scaffold, approximately 7 feet to the ground below.
An employee was moving radiators when the tip of his pointer finger got caught underneath and was amputated.

An employee had finished unjamming logs in the log deck when he asked a coworker to use a log turner on the logs. The area was not completely cleared when the coworker used the log turner. One of the logs escaped and rolled onto the employee, injuring his left knee, fracturing his left fibula, and lacerating his right elbow.

A maintenance employee was inspecting equipment with an equipment consultant. The employee was pointing at a tray wrapper when the machine started, trapping and amputating the employee's right index finger.
An employee was moving a road sign when the sign got caught in wind. The employee fell over with the sign, requiring overnight hospitalization for a punctured lung and broken rib.

On 4/3/2015 at 9:45 a.m., an employee was placing cardboard in the cardboard bailer. The employee closed the gate on his hand, amputating his left middle finger at the first knuckle.  He was hospitalized.
Employees were installing tables in a metal form to be put into concrete. The table shot out and hit an employee, going through one end of the employee's leg and out the other end.
An employee jumped from the back of an F-450 truck because the pulley hoist tipped over, resulting in injuries.
An employee was hospitalized on April 3, 2015, after suffering an injury on the Blow-Mold Machine.
An employee drove a golf cart into a brick wall, injuring her chest and abdomen.
An employee fell from stilts while installing acoustical ceiling, sustaining a shattered or broken right kneecap and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was carrying a box he picked up from a pallet when he caught his shoe on the edge of the pallet and fell.
An employee was unpacking cosmetics when she tripped over boxes, sustaining a left hip fracture. She was hospitalized.

An employee was putting hurricane clips on the first landing of the stairs using a 4-foot ladder. He had one foot on the window sill and one foot on the ladder. There was dew on the window sill.  He slipped and fell to the ground, breaking his right elbow and suffering a concussion and bruises on his forehead.
An employee was decorating the church sanctuary for Easter. He was going up the steps to the platform when he tripped and fell backwards, breaking his hip.
An employee smashed his finger while moving drums from a pallet, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee attempted to stop a stand-up forklift with his foot. His leg got crushed between the forklift and a rack post, requiring hospitalization.
On or about April 3, 2015, an employee fell 18 feet while working on metal decking inside the Nissan Paint and Body Plant.

An employee was struck by an asphalt roller. The injured employee dismounted the roller to clean the front drum. Another employee got on the roller and ran over the injured employee's legs. There was no evidence of an equipment malfunction.
An employee's upper left arm was surgically amputated at the shoulder after it was pulled into the cubing machine during sanitation.

A maintenance employee was repairing a mixer discharge hopper from a plank that had been laid across the hopper. The employee was sitting on the plank and working from it. The employee fell through the boot of the hopper, approximately 14 feet to the concrete floor below.
An employee fell between the dock and a moving truck. His hand was crushed by an aluminum ramp he was carrying.
On April 3, 2015, an employee reached over a guard and suffered injuries to the fingers on his left hand when the machine cycled. The employee was hospitalized.

On or about April 3, 2015, at approximately 10:30 p.m., an employee was operating a pallet rider in the warehouse when his ankle got caught between the pallet rider and a post. He suffered a left ankle fracture and was hospitalized.

An employee injured his leg while delivering some pipe to the Rio Blanco laydown yard off of County Road 5 in Mesa County, Colorado. The employee was helping the driver remove the pipe from a flat bed. When he removed the pipe bindings, one of the pipes fell off and struck his leg.

On April 3, 2015, at approximately 10:30 a.m., an employee was installing a beam on a commercial medical building when the ladder he was on gave out. He fell approximately 10 feet, fracturing his hip bone and injuring his wrist.
An employee was using a Hobart slicer in the kitchen to cut onion when she amputated her right ring fingertip and fractured her right middle finger.
