An employee amputated her right-hand thumb while removing cheese from an automated food slicer. The blade had not stopped turning at the time of the incident.

An employee was working on the pipeline. A pipe came off of the trough and coiled on the floor. The employee tried to straighten out the coiled pipe. His feet became tangled in the pipe, causing him to fall to the floor. He fractured his hip.
An employee fell from a ladder and broke his leg.

An employee was pumping diesel fuel from a fuel cell in the back of a pickup truck when the fumes flashed. The employee suffered second degree burns to his left arm and minor burns to his head, face, and chest.
An employee fell from a 15-foot-high ladder.
A drill alignment template fell on an employee's hand and injured three fingers.
An employee parked on a ramp, then opened the railcar door. The employee's right thumb got caught between the ramp and door, causing a partial amputation.
On Saturday April 4, 2015 an employee's hand got caught in a de-palletizer, requiring hospitalization.

On or about April 3, 2015, an employee was injured and hospitalized while using a winding machine. The bus bar caught the employee's jacket and pulled the employee into the winding coil, breaking the left arm in two places.
An employee was injured and hospitalized when she fell from a 10-foot step ladder.
An employee fell from a scaffold.
Two employees collided while serving food. One employee fell and broke her right hip. She was hospitalized.
The employee was sprayed by caustic when a 1/2" tubing broke while preparing a 3/4" line for maintenance.
Employee was burned when cleaning fryer.
An employee entered the rotational molding unit/oven to retrieve a pin that fell out of a mold.  The employee was struck by rotating fan blades. The employee was hospitalized from the injuries.
An employee was standing up on a moving pushback. He lost his balance, fell, and hit his head and arms.
An employee's left middle fingertip was amputated after getting caught in the door.
An employee tripped in the testing department while walking from one area to another.  He fell to the concrete floor and landed on his left hip.
An employee preparing for food service passed out in the walk-in refrigerator while reaching for supplies.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee standing on an elevated dock leaned against the guardrail system. The rail system gave way, allowing the employee to fall 8.5 feet.
An employee was putting pies in a pie display case when her finger got caught on the side of the display door. She suffered a deep laceration and fracture to her left pinky finger, requiring surgery.

An employee suffered a partial amputation of the left-hand index finger at the first knuckle while working with a hydraulic lift gate system on a truck. The system was in operation at the time of the incident.
An employee was replacing breast cable when a barge stay rope broke free. The rope hit the employee in the back, knocking him to the ground. He landed on his face.

Employees were changing out old aluminum electrical cables and replacing them with new cables.  The cables were in conduit.  The cable to be removed was de-energized.  The employee cut an energized cable and received burns on his right cheek from the resulting electrical arc flash.

An employee was trying to dislodge an airline shipping container that got stuck while transferring freight via elevator equipment from the airplane cargo to a truck. He climbed onto the elevator and got his left middle finger caught on the elevator, amputating his left middle finger at the first digit below the nail.

An employee was injured while working at the recycling yard. He was standing on top of metal sheets and was catapulted between the metal sheets and a forklift. The metal sheets fell on top of him, causing major injuries to his head, back, hand, and leg.

Two employees were injured when they fell to a lower level. The first employee had rigged a draft of pipes in the hatch of a cargo ship and was proceeding to the designated safe area. Before she made it to the safe area, the draft was being picked and started to spin. The second employee saw her freeze up and ran and tackled her before she could be struck by the pipe. They both fell approximately 4 feet. The first employee suffered three broken ribs and a collapsed lung. The second suffered a concussion and head laceration. Both were admitted to the hospital.
An employee's left index fingertip was amputated when he was removing a clamp from a part in the mill. The finger was pinched between the clamp and a bolt.
An employee reached under the guard of the punch press to clear a bottle jam. The trimmer came down and cut his right thumb.
An employee was exposed to mice feces particulates during shop facility cleanup on 4-6-15, where he contracted the Hantavirus.
An employee was participating in a 3-mile march carrying a 45-pound pack as a work capacity test. He experienced labored breathing and lower leg cramps. He was hospitalized.

Employees were dismantling a scaffold by passing the scaffolding materials in a chain.  One employee dropped a 5-foot scaffold pole at a height of approximately 35 to 40 feet.  The pole fell straight down, striking an employee on the ground on the brim of his hardhat.  The employee fell backwards, hitting his head and suffering head contusions.

On Monday April 6, 2015, an employee sustained a right index fingertip amputation after her finger got caught between inspection racks.  The employee was operating a machine that is actuated by a foot pedal.

On April 6, 2015, an employee working on a rig sustained a head injury that required stitches after falling approximately 5.5 feet from the top of the scavenger tank/platform to the matting board.  Guardrails on top of the platform were removed at the time.  The employee was hospitalized overnight.

The microphone/cord of a radio became entangled in a hose feeding Peroxyacetic Acid to a flume operation. When the employee stood up, the mic pulled the hose from the operation; his face and neck were sprayed with acid.
An employee's foot got caught between a stationary work table and a rolling piece.
An employee had to have the tip of his right middle finger amputated due to an injury.
An employee was directing a forklift driver when the forklift backed into him. The employee was hospitalized with injuries to both legs.
An employee was unstrapping packs from an A-frame railcar when a pack of five railroad ties fell from the railcar and struck the employee's leg.
An employee received an abrasion on the second right toe, which escalated to and infection and required amputation.

An employee was delivering a parcel at a residence. She went up three steps and handed the package to the resident. When she came down the steps, she tripped and fractured her ankle. The steps were wet at the time.
An employee was hospitalized after falling from a height while joining two steel beams together.

An employee was feeding cable into the nut tester machine, which has crimp jaws. He held the cable with his left hand and used his right hand to hit the two-hand control, causing the crimping jaws to amputate his middle fingertip.

An employee was pouring molten lead into molds. When lead solidifies, the lead is removed from the mold using an eye bolt and chain attached to a bolt that is poured into the lead cylinder. The employee attempted to lift the lead cylinder from the mold, but the mold was stuck to the lead. The employee attempted to clean the surface of the floor underneath the mold using his hand while the mold and lead cylinder were suspended in the air. The mold released from the lead cylinder and struck him in the right thumb, amputating the thumb behind the thumb nail.

On or about April 8, 2015, an employee amputated the tip of his right index finger when reaching into a peen machine to clear a jam. His index finger got caught between the plastic and the blade. The machine was still running. Protective gloves were not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee received an electrical shock when he placed a tool on to a hanger located at the end of a supply cabinet.
An employee fell through the roof while carrying a metal panel. The wind caught the metal panel, dragging the employee over to an opening in the roof.  The employee fell and cut his forearm.
An employee was feeding branches into the chipper when his arm got pulled into it. The employee's forearm was amputated.

An employee was moving a large metal plate with a forklift. The metal plate was slung under the forks of the lift. As the employee guided it, the load fell and amputated the tip of the employee's left index finger.

On Tuesday, April 7, 2015, a maintenance employee was standing on the fourth step of an 8-foot step ladder, reaching with a pole to unjam an overhead mail tray. He fell from the ladder to the ground below, fracturing his hip and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cutting a wooden 2-by-4 board.  As he cut close to his hand, the saw kicked back and pulled his gloved thumb into the blade, severely cutting his thumb just below the nail.
An employee was standing near the loading dock inside the warehouse when he was struck by a forklift. The employee's big toe was amputated.
An employee was cutting frozen Cornish hen with a band saw when he amputated the tip of his left ring finger.
An employee's right index finger was amputated at the first knuckle, resulting in overnight hospitalization.

An employee was unhooking the air hoses and components of a tractor trailer so he could separate the trailer from the tractor semi-truck. As he stepped down from unhooking the components, he missed the second step and fell to the ground, breaking his left hip. The employee was hospitalized and underwent hip surgery.

An employee was walking beside a truck that was stalled on the highway. The truck trailer then knocked the employee over and ran over both of his thighs. His right thigh and left foot were fractured. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell from a ladder.

An employee working on the sanitation crew at the Further Processing Plant pushed the stop button on a breading machine after removing parts from the upper portion of the machine. The employee then placed his foot into a horizontal auger while climbing down from the machine, causing all five toes on his right foot to be amputated.
An employee was operating a hydraulic trailer ramp when it fell on the employee's foot, breaking his ankle.
On 04/07/2015, an employee lost her right-hand, middle fingertip when she got her hand caught in a rotary press while processing a small piece of foam through the router table.
Employees were using a hydraulic lift to put equipment on a truck. The injured employee suffered an amputation when his finger got caught between a metal bar and a hook on the hydraulic lift.
An employee operating a CNC routing machine sustained lacerations and experienced great blood loss after manually holding the part being cut by machine down with his hand.
An employee was servicing an in-feed roll when the come-along chain came off and pinched the employee's right-hand thumb. The employee lost the tip of the thumb on his right hand.
An employee was parking an electric cart. When she stepped on the brake, the vehicle accelerated and collided with the side of the building, breaking her leg.
While unloading a trailer, the trailer shifted and hit the employee in the leg.

An employee was using a grinding machine to level concrete floors. The machine blade got caught in the ledge, pulling the machine forward and breaking the security barrier. The machine and the employee fell 10 feet.
On 04/07/2015 at 6:30 p.m., an employee feeding wood into the web saw had his right index fingertip amputated 1.5 inches.

On April 7, 2015, an employee sustained a leg injury that required surgery after being struck by a wheelabrator rack while moving the equipment with an overhead crane.  The load shifted during movement, causing the rack to fall over and crush the employee's leg.

An employee was hooking a trailer up to a truck with a coworker. The hitch got stuck; while attempting to unhook the hitch, the employee placed his hand on the hitch. The coworker lowered the trailer, and the employee's right, third fingertip got amputated after getting caught between the hitch and trailer. He was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a line that manufactured two-ply paper towels in the converting area.  While attempting to rethread a sheet to create the two-ply, he fingers got pinched between two rollers. He sustained a laceration of the third and fourth digits and a partial amputation of the distal tips; no digits were fully amputated.

An employee was troubleshooting an assembly line in the needle assembly area. When he bent over to look at the bottom of the machine, he rested his hand on a guard on the belt assembly. His finger overlapped with the edge of the guard, tripping a motion sensor that activated the machine push bar. His right-hand middle finger got caught between the push bar and the machine.

An employee was operating the nose drill machine when he went around to the machine's back side. The drill caught his work glove and pulled his hand in, amputating his left ring fingertip (no bone included).
An employee became dizzy, fainted, and struck his head on the doorframe when he fell to the ground.
An employee amputated his finger while cutting a piece of wood with a table saw.
An employee standing on his delivery truck's bed fell off and hit his head on the pavement. He was hospitalized with head injuries.

An employee was tasked with cleaning and sanitizing the chilling machines and the floor. The employee fell into the chiller machine while it was in operation, sustaining a leg amputation and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working near a stack of square hollow structural steel members. An unloaded gantry crane made contact with the stack and knocked over members. Falling members pinned the employee's leg against an adjacent stack, breaking both ankles and requiring hospitalization.

At approximately 3:45 p.m., on 04/09/2015, a Composite Department employee hit his knee against a cart when he turned a corner. At approximately 10:30 p.m., he lost consciousness. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee's right hand and upper arm got caught while loading clothing into a baling machine used to form 100-pound, shippable units of recycled articles of clothing. The machine got activated during the strapping process to secure the load at various points. His hand/arm were caught inside the machine for at least three hours, causing a laceration and fracture.
An employee amputated a toe at the Quad B construction site.

An employee was removing a printing press gear that was located in front of a gear that runs an ink roller. While performing this task, employees do not de-energize the ink roller gear because the ink will dry up. The employee's finger got caught between the gear being removed and the ink roller gear. The employee's left index finger was amputated, and two other fingers were injured.
An employee fell from the trailer of his truck and struck his head.

An employee fell approximately 15 feet from a fiberglass extension ladder while cutting a cable line at the mid line. The employee was wearing PFAS, but the positioning belt was not connected to the line. The employee sustained a broken collarbone and shoulder.
An employee was jetting tubes for the scrubber cooler tube sheet at ADM. He suffered a laceration when a high-pressure lance grazed his left arm below the elbow.
An employee hit her head on a fitting room shelf while throwing away trash. She felt dizzy and went to the break room to sit down, where she had a seizure. She required overnight hospitalization.

An employee was working from a catwalk while loading an open dump trailer. The cone section of the storage hopper he was drawing from fell off and struck him in the head and hand. He was hospitalized and required hand surgery.
An employee suffered exposure to an unknown gas on 4/8/2015.

An employee was taking inventory of "elements" in the warehouse. The items were stacked on a pallet that rested on a shelf 38 inches from the floor. To obtain an inventory number for one of the elements, he pushed another element out of the way. The pushed element fell towards the employee, striking him in the right femur. He sustained a right femur fracture.
An employee suffered severe cramping and heat exhaustion while performing work in 80-degree weather. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee's right middle finger got smashed and trapped between a Roura Hopper material handling device and the forks on a forklift.

An employee dismounted the back of a slow-moving garbage truck in a residential area to get up into the cab. The employee slipped and fell under the rear tandems and was caught between the wheels and the asphalt. The employee was dragged for an unknown distance.
An employee operating a reach truck was injured on April 9, 2015, when his foot got caught between the reach truck and another piece of equipment.
A worker fell off a lawn mower and broke his ankle.

On April 9, 2015, at approximately 2:45 p.m., an employee suffered an amputation of the left ring finger as he performed maintenance on the new Midwest grinder dust collection system. While installing a belt on the drive pulley, his finger got pinched between the pulley and drive belt, amputating his finger pad.

An employee in the Kimberly Clark Plant in New Milford was working near some machinery that creates a lot of heat.  The employee reported feeling ill and fainted.  The employee went to the emergency room and was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was adjusting a belt on a power washer. While checking the tension, the pump turned back on. This kicked the wrench away from the employee's hand and pulled his hand into the machine. His right pinky fingertip was amputated, and his right thumb was cut.
An employee was helping another employee close the vault door. The injured employee's finger got caught in the door, resulting in a right index fingertip amputation.

An employee was lowering a large hook onto a halo shackle used to move large manufactured parts. The employee was guiding the hook down with the left hand. As the hook reached the edge of the halo cable tray, the force of the hook landing on the cable tray caused an amputation of the left ring finger to the distal joint (below the nail bed).
An employee was operating a powered industrial vehicle (PIV) and got her leg caught between the PIV and the wall resulting in a broken leg and ankle.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a broken leg when the strap being used to move a bundle of steel broke and fell on the employee. The employee was hospitalized and underwent surgery to repair the break.
An employee's shirt got caught in a floor mixer. The employee's right arm was injured.

A worker was stringing up the masonry wire machine. He pressed the single cycle button and when the machine cycled forward it caught his glove and pulled his hand through the pulling knurls amputating one half of his right middle finger.
While performing pre-gutting operations an employee cut his left knee requiring surgery and an overnight hospital stay.

On March 25, 2015, an employee received a dog bite to the lower right leg.  On April 9, 2015, the employee was hospitalized by her primary care physician due to an infection that occurred from the dog bite.

On or about April 9, 2015, at approximately 1300 hrs. an employee suffered the amputation of the distal phalanges on the right hand pinkie finger. The employee was attempting to load a bundle of angle iron onto a vehicle when the load shifted in his hands and pinned his right hand to the structure of the vehicle.
Employee received an amputation of left middle finger while working on a quick change attachment for a bucket loader.
An employee was stung by a bee and hospitalized following an allergic reaction.

On or about 11am, on 4/9/2015, a pipe fitter was working off an 8 ft. A-frame ladder about 5 feet off the ground, trying to loosen a valve on the nitric acid line. The valve broke loose spraying liquid onto the employee. As the employee attempted to block the spray, he lost his balance and fell off the ladder, cracking an L3 vertebrae. He was hospitalized.
An employee was spray painting a ceiling while working from a platform on a mobile scaffold. The employee fell 9 feet from the scaffold  to the floor.
An employee in the field, near Forest Service Road 15-700, was climbing over logs and got his foot caught. He was hospitalized with a broken tibia and fibula.
The employee crushed his right hand while attaching the outrigger pad during the assembly of a crane.
The employee was disassembling shelving units. The employee climbed-up on a shelf to grab something and slipped and fell.

An employee and a contractor were using a scissor lift to reach the top of the black powder spray booth where steel tanks are brought in to be painted. The employee was going to clean the top of the booth, while the contractor was going to work on the lighting in the area above the booth. The product-carrier which brings the steel tanks to the paint booth was not locked out. The product-carrier started to bring a steel tank to the spray booth and made contact with the scissor-lift. The carrier tipped the scissor-lift over. The employees were thrown roughly six feet when the scissor-lift impacted the ground.
Employee injured the left hip after falling to the concrete floor while moving a pane of glass.
An employee standing at the end side of the MC700 press placed his right hand into the pinch point. The press started moving and gripped his hand, injuring three fingers.
An employee installing siding fell from a ladder breaking his left leg below the knee. The ladder was on the deck and slipped due to misty, wet weather conditions.
An employee fell off of a ladder while waterproofing wall between the 25th and 26th floor of the Drexel building. The employee was hospitalized for a fractured small bone in the back.
Employee suffered a skull fracture after slipping and falling on a wet floor which had recently been mopped.

Two employees were preparing two industrial control panels for shipment. The control panel is 5 feet wide, 7 feet tall, 1 foot deep, and weighs approximately 500lbs. They were setting one on the shipping pallet when the second one fell on top of the worker striking him on the back and injuring his right shoulder, ribs, and lung.
An employee was operating a table saw, cutting cardboard tubes used to reinforce pools, when he suffered a right-hand thumb amputation. His thumb was severed across the nail bed.

An employee was opening the back of a trailer during product unloading when boxes from a pallet that shifted during transport fell on him. The employee sustained a fractured femur and a laceration to the head. The employee was subsequently hospitalized.
An employee got a hand caught in an auger while filling a bag with ice.

A Ski Patrol worker was found in the middle of the Rainbow Run trail with no signs of a collision with any customers or objects aside from the ski run.  The worker suffered a fractured C1 vertebrae and was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to climb out of the bottom of a lift station when he fell more than ten feet from a fixed ladder landing on his arm at the bottom of the station. The employee was hospitalized.

The injured employee had been performing landscaping services at a cemetery the day of the injury (6:00am - 3:3pm).  Throughout the day, he was complaining of leg cramps.  After returning to the yard, the employee was leaving (walking) the yard and collapsed.  A passer by came to his attention and the employee asked for them to call 911.  Emergency medical services responded and brought the employee to the hospital.
An employee lacerated the back of his hand while cutting a board with a power saw.
An employee was using his hand to push wood material when a saw pressure beam came down and amputated his left hand.
An employee fell off of a ramp during an evacuation drill, sustaining a left hip fracture and shoulder injury.
On April 10, 2015, at approximately 8:30 a.m., an employee tripped over a shop vac extension cord and fell on her right knee, resulting in a fracture and hospitalization.

On or about April 20, 2015, an employee was dismantling an H.B. Robinson vertical motor in the decontamination room while suspended from an overhead crane. The motor slipped, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was mowing a green and caught his hand in the spinning blade when he went to empty the basket while the mower was still powered.

On or about April 10, 2015, at approximately 1300 hours, an employee was hospitalized with two fractures to his distal tibia and fibula. He was assigned to a four-man team to repair a compressor located at an Oxy-Permian gas facility when he used a golf cart to retrieve equipment at another compressor. He hit a barrier with the golf cart, pinning his leg between the cart and the barrier. He was injured and subsequently hospitalized.
An employee working in the press department suffered a partial amputation when positioning a press machine part on the roller table.

An employee was attempting to hang a 365' drop from the house to the connector wire. He placed his ladder on the strand and proceeded to climb it. The ladder began to slide sideways; the employee started climbing down but was thrown off the ladder at an elevation of approximately 10 feet. The employee landed in a ditch and suffered a compound fracture of the leg.  The ladder was at an approximately 40-degree angle when the employee was thrown from it.

An employee removed a worn out sprocket from a Brehm Tube loader machine. The sprocket was repaired and placed back into the machine. The machine was energized and failed to automatically  feed. The employee opened the machine while the machine was energized to try to engage the machine by pushing a chain with his left index finger. His finger was caught in the machine resulting in an amputation.
An employee was clearing a jam on the powder auger without any tools. Another employee restarted the machine, and the injured employee suffered an amputation on his right middle fingertip.
An employee's foot got crushed between the floor and boom of a drill rig. He broke his big toe.
An employee was tending the tug lines when one snapped and struck him in the face.
An employee was injured while pressure testing an aluminum heat exchanger. The heat exchanger failed and struck the employee, resulting in multiple injuries.
An employee from Packard Sanitation Services was cleaning a casing machine when her glove got caught between the rolls. She lost the middle fingertip on her left hand.
An employee was standing on a chair to change the sign in the window area. She fell, sustaining a facial laceration and tearing something in her right knee.
On April 10, 2015, an employee was bitten by a spider on the right ankle while standing under a tree and patrolling the parking lot.
An employee was sawing wood when his hand was pulled into the guarded saw blade amputating his left pointer finger at the middle knuckle.
An employee's finger and thumb were fractured when he put his hand into the paper face bead machine.
An employee was attempting to free a dock door when the object that was holding the door came loose; the door hit him and broke his ankle.
An employee was connecting steel beams when one of them came out, causing the employee to fall 15 feet. The employee sustained a fractured hip and was hospitalized.
An employee was installing decking on a new construction building. He walked towards the edge of the deck without being tied off and fell approximately 30 feet through an opening.
An employee's arm was fractured after getting caught by a Gloucester bag machine's shuttle.

An employee was installing roof shingles with a nail gun when he tripped over a lanyard and fell onto his hand. The nail gun in the opposite hand landed on his hand, and a nail entered his hand and struck his bone.
On 4/10/15, an employee was walking up the steps to a public sidewalk. The employee tripped on a step and injured their knee, subsequently requiring surgery.
An employee's left leg was burned while cleaning a machine when 180-degree water discharged from a hose. He was hospitalized with a second degree burn to his lower leg and foot.
An employee's finger got stuck between two battery terminals in a forklift machine. The employee clipped a fingertip and was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a conveyor that moves wood products. The employee attempted to remove a board from the moving conveyor and struck his right fingers against the angle iron on the frame of the conveyor resulting in a fracture to the right index finger and an ablation to the right ring finger that required the tip to be medically amputated.
An employee was waxing a moving, horizontal bandsaw blade. The blade caught his work gloves and pulled his hand onto the blade, causing serious injuries.

An employee went upstairs to take measurements of the attic area. He stepped back and fell off of the open floor to the tile beneath. He suffered a fractured vertebra and was bleeding from the head. He was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to clear a paper jam on a press machine when a coworker depressed the controls for the press rollers to go into reverse. As the rollers reversed, the employee's right thumb was pulled into the rollers, causing an amputation. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's arm was injured when reaching behind a taper box machine while cleaning grease on the floor.
An employee using hoisting equipment to move hydro-blasting equipment was struck in the head when the hoisting equipment broke free, resulting in a concussion and hospitalization.

While working in the sawmill, an employee de-energized and locked out a cutter before attempting to perform maintenance. After performing lockout/tagout, the employee manually rotated the wheel according to normal procedure and caught her left pinky and ring fingers in the knife blade.
An employee amputated his thumb while sharpening a meat slicer. Guards were not in place at the time of the incident.
An employee was participating in an obstacle course at Fort Bliss when he went over an obstacle and felt an insect bite his right index finger.

On April 11, 2015, at approximately 0930 hours, an employee was unjamming several bottles passing through a coating hood at the hot end of the man conveyor. As the employee pulled the hot bottles towards himself to unstick them, they hit the floor and shattered. The shattered glass made contact with the hem of his pants, causing a flare up that ignited his clothing. He was burned on approximately 80 percent of his body.
A forklift rack fell on an employee operating a standup forklift, pinning the employee between the rack and the opposite side of the cab area. The employee's head, neck, and back were injured.

An employee was performing cementing operations on a drilling rig. While using an air hoist to hoist a cement plug over a pipe, his thumb got caught between the "wing" of the plug and the plug itself. He sustained an amputation to the left-hand thumb up to the knuckle.

On or about 11 April 2015, at approximately 0830 hours, a Brazos Rock Energy employee received burns on his wrist and face when flammable gasses that accumulated during a pipeline hot tap ignited. The employee was helping a welder weld the pipe sections together when two pin-sized holes on a section of pipe 10 feet from the operation leaked flammable gasses into the pipe and surrounding area. The gasses accumulated to a level sufficient enough to cause a flash fire, which burned the employee.
An employee removed the cargo straps from a load on the trailer. The load shifted and fell on the employee's leg, breaking his ankle.
An employee was removing yarn from a machine roller when his finger got caught and partially amputated by yarn. The machine was turned off with the power button on the control station at the time.
An employee was sweeping the floor when his right pant leg got caught in the pulley shaft of the straight line conveyer in the dry fertilizer facility. The employee's right foot was amputated.
An employee heard a hissing sound from pressure while breaking pipe joints. He then jumped from the rig floor six feet above ground and broke his leg when he landed.
An employee was injured when the ATV he was riding turned over and landed on him.
An employee was using a bevel saw to cut a panel when his right hand hit the saw's blade, resulting in the amputation of his right middle and ring fingers.

On 4/12/2015, at 9:30 a.m., an employee was cleaning the used bin of the icing equipment. The equipment door would not open, so an engineer was called to troubleshoot the issue. The employee was performing a visual check and watching the chains to see which one moved so the engineer could work on the issue. The employee stuck his right hand into the airlock, which resulted in an amputation of three middle fingertips.

On or about 12 April 2015, at approximately 1410 hours, an employee amputated the distal portion of his left-hand, index phalanges (no bone involved). He was installing a hydraulic cylinder on a drilling rig when the cylinder he was holding swung laterally, pinching  his distal phalanges between the cylinder and the drilling rig structure.
An employee's right leg was crushed after being struck by an excavator bucket and pinned between the bucket and a concrete retaining wall. The employee's right leg was amputated above the knee.

An employee was driving a Segway on the hotel sidewalk and maneuvered out of guests' way. While attempting to correct course, the employee was thrown from the Segway and fractured his hip. He was hospitalized.

An employee operating a forklift drove up a wet ramp backwards. The forklift started to slide, so the employee put his foot out to lessen the impact. His left foot was crushed between the forklift and a pillar.

On 4/12/2015, at 4:00p.m., an employee was using the Bridgeport Mill to mill off the logo on a Dooley. His hand slipped and got caught on the tool, resulting in a laceration and fracture on his left hand and wrist.
An employee fell approximately 12 feet while disassembling bleacher risers.
An employee was cleaning and pushing a cart down an aisle when she sprained her knee. She was hospitalized.
An employee suffered an asthma attack and was hospitalized after she inhaled a patient's perfume.
An employee was transferring a patient and felt a pull and pressure.
An employee was walking and talking when she tripped over a new floor cleaning machine wheel that was in the office. She fell on her left hip and was hospitalized.
An employee lost her footing and fell on the floor, injuring her hip.
Nine employees were exposed to high levels of carbon monoxide from a boiler in the hotel basement. The employees felt ill and experienced headaches. One of the employees was hospitalized.
An employee was closing a door to a Pyxis medication holder when she jammed her finger, requiring hospitalization.

On April 13, 2015, at approximately 1:30 p.m., an employee was shot in the left hand. Prior to the incident, a well tender found an issue at a well site. The well tender contacted a roustabout crew to repair and clean the area. The injured employee responded to the job to oversee the work, take pictures, and complete an incident report. After completing his work, he was driving away from the site and was stopped by a suspect dressed in camouflage, standing in the road. The suspect stood on the passenger side of the truck, played a recording that said "stop drilling," and pointed a gun at the employee's head. The employee grabbed the gun and shoved it away from his head; the gun fired into his left hand.  The employee drove off and was hospitalized.

An employee was helping a press break operator form a piece of sheet metal for a gutter downspout. The operator and the employee placed the sheet metal into the break press and aligned the markings that were on the sheet metal under the press bar for the proper bends.  After the sheet metal was aligned in the press, the operator activated it at the control panel. The employee's right hand was in the press, and his two middle fingers were amputated at the first joint.

On April 13, 2015, at approximately 10:50 p.m., an employee attempted to open a bay door to a truck while operating a forklift. He smashed his left hand, severely lacerating his left ring finger and damaging his left pinky finger, which was barely hanging on. The pinky finger was initially reattached, but was eventually surgically amputated up to the second joint.
An employee fell from the roof at a four-story apartment complex while installing roof decking. The employee was wearing a harness at the time.
An employee fell approximately 6 feet from a scaffold. He knocked out some teeth and possibly broke his arm.
An employee slipped while running through a mopped area and hit their trachea on a vertical pole.  The employee required surgery.
An employee was climbing a scaffold to check if the graphics applied to a box truck were peeling. The scaffold tipped over, and the employee fell about 7 to 8 feet.

On or about April 13, 2015, an employee was detailing an airline belt loader. He activated the unit and stuck his hand on the underside of the belt, which was inclined. He sustained a partial amputation of his finger and thumb.
An employee's fingers were crushed while reaching into a hamburger patty machine.
An employee walking with a ladder fell to the ground and injured his torso.
An employee was retrieving coins from a safe located behind the customer service counter. The safe door closed by itself, pinching and amputating the tip of the employee's left thumb.
An employee's right index fingertip was amputated in a rebar bender.

An employee fell from a ladder while repairing a leaking waterline in the ceiling at a residence. He had just finished soldering pipe and was in the clean-up phase of the job when he fell and sustained injuries to the head, face, right wrist, and left thumb.
Two employees were on top of a water tank doing sand blast work. The wind caught them on the tank and blew away a tarp. The tarp struck the injured employee, who landed 20 feet below.

An employee had just finished nailing a fence panel using a nail gun. As he extended his arm down into a resting/hanging position with his finger still on the trigger, another employee walked behind him and was struck in the lower leg with the nail gun, which actuated and drove a nail into his leg. The injured employee was hospitalized overnight.
The employee was doing a quality line check in the hot fill area. As she turned around, she tripped over the water hose, fell, and sustained a comminuted fracture to her left elbow.

An employee was performing maintenance on a scissor lift at a customer's facility. The lift slid on gravel on an incline, causing the employee to lose control. The lift tipped over, and the employee sustained a broken femur and pelvis.

An employee was replacing a belt on a conveyor system with his hand inside the cover to pull the belt. Another employee pushed a button to jog the conveyor. Three of the injured employee's fingers were pulled into the in-running nip point. His little finger was surgically amputated.
A maintenance employee fell through a leaking skylight he was repairing. He fell approximately 12 feet to the concrete floor below and broke several ribs.

On or about April 13, 2015, at 1:50 p.m., a maintenance employee entered a robot cell to determine why the robot stopped working. He either fell off of the work platform or was struck by the work platform or robot, sustaining a compound fracture to his right leg and significant soft tissue damage to his right shoulder. He was hospitalized.
An employee was holding a hydraulic hose while pressurizing a high-torque wrench to remove large nuts from a pressure vessel. The hydraulic hose ruptured, puncturing the employee's left index finger.
An employee was burned by hot steam/water when he was removing a flange off an unused condensation line.
An employee sustained injuries to his legs when the motor block of a tractor blew apart as he started it up.
An employee was injured after being struck by a forklift that was backing up.
An employee experienced shortness of breath and shoulder pain at work and was hospitalized.
On April 13, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation to his left thumb tip when he placed it in a roll form metal bender machine at 2010 North Western Avenue in Hartford, South Dakota.

Two employees were removing service wire that had been de-energized (energy source to street lights in preparation for demolition work for a new ski lodge). The injured employee climbed a utility pole; when he cut the line, it changed the balance of the pole (strain on pole) and caused it to break off at ground level. The employee fell approximately 22 to 25 feet to the ground. He was hospitalized.
An employee exited a stairway and entered an aisle way where she was struck by a forklift.  The employee suffered a broken tibia and was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting a tree with a chainsaw when the tree snapped and threw the employee 50 feet down to the ground.

On April 14, 2015, at approximately 3:30 p.m., an employee's left index finger was amputated while operating the frame straightening machine. The employee was lowering the machine with his left hand while holding a safety bar out of the way with his right hand.  The frame of the machine came down on his left hand, which was laying on/near the top of the foot pedal.

An employee was performing preventive maintenance on the conveyor leading to the robot packer.  He removed the chain drive guard to lubricate the chain; the chain was running at the time.  While trying to replace the guard after finishing, he dropped a bolt near the sprocket. When he went to retrieve the bolt, the chain and sprocket caught the end of his right index finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was helping to load cargo pallets onto an aircraft. The pallets were placed onto a K-loader, and the employee was preparing the cargo to be pushed onto the plane. He lost his balance and fell 8 feet from the work deck onto the asphalt tarmac. He was unconscious and bleeding from the nose, head, and mouth. He also broke his wrist. The employee was hospitalized.
On April 14, 2015, an employee fell down some stairs in the detail shop and was hospitalized.

On or about 14 April 2015, at approximately 1612 hours, a Troy Vines, Inc. employee was replacing the tire on a Redimix truck on Tradewind and Duval Street. He lowered the vehicle to reposition the jack and was caught between the road surface and the truck's structure. The compression caused a hip dislocation and a fracture in his hip area. He was hospitalized.
An employee was pulling cut pieces from a Tsune saw with gloves on. The employee's glove got caught on the blade, pulling his finger into the vise and cutting the tip of his right middle finger off.

A maintenance employee was on his hands and knees extending the legs of a wing segmenter. Another employee bumped her hand truck into a free standing metal table, which then fell and amputated the tip of the maintenance employee's right-hand pinky finger.
An employee was walking in the reception area when a dog jumped on her and pushed her down. She tripped and landed on her side.
An employee sustained broken ribs and a punctured lung after falling while loading a tractor trailer. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was carrying a box of paper and suffered a hernia.
An employee was operating a concrete paving saw. He lost control of the saw, and it hit and severely cut the back of his right leg.
While climbing out of his truck and stepping on the ground, an employee lost his footing and rolled his ankle.
An employee suffered systemic poisoning when he ingested anti-freeze while drinking from an improperly labeled, temporary-use container.

An employee was sitting at a computer putting information into the install program. His foot became tangled in the computer cords under the table. When he got up and started to walk, he fell and broke his left ankle.

An employee sustained a 4" laceration to the palm of his right hand when an aluminum-compressed air pipe was pulled out of his hands after a portion of the air hose became entangled in the blades of a small log machine that was in operation.
An employee working on an aerial, drop-wire telephone cable fell 14 feet from a ladder. The employee injured their right ankle and hips.
An employee was moving a PIV when their foot got caught between the PIV and a bollard. The employee injured the foot and ankle.
An employee walking with a ladder twisted her ankle to the point that it broke. She was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee's finger was smashed when CANT, a cut log that can not be further processed in the saw mill operation, fell out of his hand. The employee lifted the log and lost his grip, and the log started to fall. While trying to change his grip to catch the log, his fingers got pinched between the log and the machine guard.
On April 14, 2015, an employee rolled and broke an ankle on uneven grounds.
Employee got his left arm caught in moving equipment and went to the hospital.

An employee was cleaning carpet using a hot water extractor that contained Pro's Choice Power Gel, a concentrated blend of cleaning agents designed to safely remove spots and stains. After cleaning, the employee experienced fevers and an elevated heart rate. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee attempted to unjam a paper shredder in the pharmacy department. Her left middle finger was pulled in, causing a partial amputation. She was hospitalized and required skin graft surgeries.
An employee and coworkers were pulling fiber optic cables through a horizontal duct beneath the road. The employee passed out and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee standing next to a forklift truck received a glancing blow to the right foot when the  operator started the forklift and turned to the right.
An employee was hospitalized after a dock plate fell and cut off three fingers on the employee's left hand.

A lift cable on a truck crane was being replaced with a new cable.  The new cable was attached to the truck crane drum and a truck. The truck was used to stretch and place tension on the cable so it could be rolled onto the truck crane cable drum. An employee was holding a second cable on the crane to keep it from tangling with the new cable.  As the cable was being stretched by the truck, the cable rose upward and contacted an overhead power line. The employee received electrical burns and was hospitalized.
On April 14, 2015, a bundle of steel landed on an employee's foot. Due to the injuries, four toes and a partial big toe were amputated.

An employee was removing a loin wing from the strip using a vertical band saw. A piece dangled from the loin. The employee tried to grab it, and a finger came in contact with the saw blade. The employee sustained an amputation of the fingertip below the fingernail.
An employee was lifting a garbage can and dumping it into the garbage compactor when the employee suddenly felt pain in the lower back.

An employee operating a tractor was travelling down a steep slope into a water basin when the tractor sped up and travelled down at a high rate of speed. When he reached the bottom, the tractor bounced and jarred him, causing a back injury that required hospitalization.
An employee broke his arm after reaching under a guard on the pail printing machine.
An employee was performing steel erection connector activities when the installed bolts and/or nuts on the end of the steel I-beam failed, causing the employee to fall approximately 30 feet.

A forklift operator moved forward and pinned the injured employee's ankle between the pallet being carried on the forks and a wall. The employee's ankle broke in two places, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee descending a ladder fell and broke their pelvis while surveying an area that would need to have an electrical conduit installed.
One mile south of Black Creek Reservoir,  a smoke jumper was participating in his annual certification jump when he had a hard landing, breaking his right arm and dislocating his right shoulder.
An employee was filling a power washer with gasoline when combustion occurred. The employee was hospitalized for flash burns to his face.
On 4/15/2015, at 11:15 a.m., an employee working on a pad mount transformer came in contact with the 7200V underground cable live wire. The employee sustained a first degree burn on the left hand.
An employee was walking from the back area when she slipped and fell, fracturing her left hip and wrist.
An employee's middle fingertip was amputated while he was lifting and moving two pieces of metal.

On April 15, 2015, a maintenance technician cut all his fingers while using a table saw.  The cuts were stitched at the hospital that day.  On April 23, 2015, two fingers were amputated as a result of infection.
On April 15, 2015, an employee tripped over a trash can and fell to the floor breaking the left shoulder resulting in hospitalization.

An employee was trying to install a new roll of banding metal to the banding roll. A crane operator was lifting the roll on to the machine. When the employee tried to remove the nylon lifting sling, it became stuck. The crane operator tried to remove the stuck sling with the crane. When the operator pulled up on the sling, it pulled the roll of banding off the spool. The banding fell approximately 16 inches onto the employee's foot.
On 4/15/15, at approximately 7:30 a.m., an employee was filling two 1,000-gallon nurse tanks with anhydrous ammonia when he suffered a chemical burn to his inner right arm, requiring hospitalization.

On April 15, 2015, an employee punctured the middle finger of his left hand while repairing a communications cable that had been damaged while cutting tree roots. His finger swelled and the employee was admitted to hospital.
An employee was hospitalized with injuries after falling from a scaffold.

An employee was jogging a conveyor belt to adjust the belt's tracking. The wrench he was using slipped and got caught between the roller and the side of the conveyor, pinning his hand and amputating his right-hand pinky finger at the second knuckle.
An employee was attempting to help a PIV operator move a crate when his finger got caught between the crate and the PIV forks.

On 4/14/15, an employee suffered pain in his calf after completing the yearly "pack test" (walking 1.5 miles with a weighted pack) for physical fitness. He was hospitalized and required surgery for compartment syndrome.
An employee injured his right ankle following a four foot fall from a straight ladder.
While disassembling a piece of machinery for repair, a piece of the machinery came loose and severed the tip of the employee's left thumb. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was sanitizing meat processing equipment. The employee turned the machine on and inserted a hose up the discharge chute to inject a chemical cleaning foam. The mixing head on the end of the machine caught and amputated the employee's finger.

A roll was being lowered into the furnace. The bottom edge of the roll caught the inside of the donut ring, causing the roll to turn out of the rigging shoe. An employee reached for the roll to clean off a refractory that had fallen down, unaware that the roll was out of the rigging. The roll fell through the donut and crushed the employee's hand. The employee suffered an amputation to the first knuckle of the right index finger; the right-hand middle finger was also fractured.
An employee was injured after abandoning a moving vehicle during transport for repair. The car had failed brakes and no brake fluid at the time. The employee landed on concrete and was hospitalized.

An employee was unloading a rail car alone and was found on the ground with a laceration under the left eye. The employee did not remember what happened and there were no witnesses.  A 50-pound tool was found near the injured employee.

On or about April 15, 2015, at 3:30 p.m., an employee climbed up on a 4-foot railing to cut the banding off of a bundle of lumber when he slipped and fell on his back.  He sustained five broken ribs and five cracked vertebrae.
An employee was struck in the abdomen by a tree branch while trimming a tree.
An all terrain forklift ran over and broke an employee's leg.
An employee fell while walking to the office from her car and sustained arm injuries that resulted in hospitalization.
An employee fell 8 to 9 feet from a second floor while sweeping debris. The employee leaned against the guardrail to look down; the guardrails failed, causing him to fall.
An employee reached into a mixing bowl attached to a dough mixer and broke two fingers.

On April 15, 2015, an employee was loading a tank with anhydrous ammonia. He stumbled, which caused the valve to open slightly and release vapor that came in contact with the employee's face.  He immediately washed his face and rinsed his mouth and was later hospitalized.
An employee was using a Hobart meat slicer to cut cucumbers when her hand slipped and crossed over part of the blade. She suffered a partial finger amputation; no bone was removed.
On or about April 15, 2015, an employee was injured and hospitalized when a mini-bulk container fell off of the forks of a forklift and struck him.

An employee was lifting a power assembly out of a locomotive when the assembly slipped. He reached for it, and his left hand got caught between the assembly and the locomotive engine. The top of his left pinky finger was amputated.
An employee's cheek was struck-by a broken grinding wheel while he was using the grinder to clean materials.
A worker was cutting flat meats with a band saw and amputated the tips of his left middle and index fingers.
An employee was struck in the temple by a hydraulic hose fracturing the eye socket and skull.
An employee was cleaning steel beams. The beams rolled and fell on his ankle causing fractures.
An employee suffered a compound fracture of the back from a fall while walking to the corporate office on Main Street.
An employee amputated four fingers in a meat grinder.  The grinder was guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was injured after stepping out of a jobsite trailer that had no stairs. The employee was admitted to the hospital with a fractured right leg.
An employee was leaving a workstation, slipped on a piece of chicken on the floor and fell fracturing the leg and requiring hospital admission.

An employee went under an F-350 truck to repair a locked transmission with the engine turned off. He disconnected the transmission cable and the vehicle moved in reverse naturally due to a slope in the terrain. The left front wheel ran over the employee from the shoulder to the abdomen.
While positioning a Linkbelt 98 track logging yarder, an employee got his left foot caught under the left front track causing crushing injuries to his toes and foot. He was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized following a head injury sustained from a fall from a two foot high platform to the concrete floor below.
On 4/16/2015 at about 10:30 a.m., an employee was oiling, cleaning, and checking tension on a moving chain when the employee's finger got caught up in the chain amputating a fingertip.
An employee was changing a jack-hammer in an air compressor unit and amputated his left ring finger.
An employee was adjusting a loose belt on a conveyor when his left hand fingertip was amputated.
An employee fell three stories down an elevator shaft at a construction project.

An employee was helping to guide a skiff pan onto its side to be painted when the load shifted and the strap came off of the forks of the forklift. The corner of the pan landed on his right foot. The resulting foot fracture required hospitalization and surgery to repair.
An employee reached into a trim press to clear a jam and suffered a fracture to left forearm. The employee was hospitalized and underwent surgery to repair the fracture.

An electrical maintenance technician was trouble shooting an electrical fault on a horizontal machine center (HMC).  The maintenance tech turned the HMC off; however, he did not lockout the HMC.  The maintenance tech went to the back of the HMC and removed a panel to work on the machine and clear the electrical fault.  The maintenance tech cleared the fault.  The setup technician noticed that the fault was cleared from the HMC control panel; and the setup tech pushed the home button to bring the carriage to the starting position.  The maintenance tech was still working on the HMC at the back of machine.  When the setup tech pushed the home button the carriage moved back to the starting position and pinned the maintenance tech's right arm between the carriage and the HMC frame.  The maintenance tech's right arm was broken in two different locations below the elbow.

An employee performing a cable installation at the pole using a ladder was electrocuted and fell 20 feet to the ground. The employee was working alone at the time and was responsive when emergency response transported him to the hospital.

An employee was assisting in installing access plates into a box cover.  The chain on the access plate slipped from the narrow portion of the keyhole to the wide portion of the keyhole which caused the plate to be released.  The employee had his finger below on the plate frame, and the plate fell onto the employee's thumb amputating it immediately below the nail bed.  The plate weighed approximately 1300 - 1400 lbs.

A utility line construction crew was in the process of replacing a wooden utility pole with a new metal utility pole and metal cross arm.  After the new metal pole and cross arm was installed the crew wrapped an insulated blanket around the pole above the cross arm.  Insulators were installed on the cross arm.  A crew member was in a lift bucket and was using metal quick ties to connect the power lines to the cross arm insulators.  The crew member tied one of the quick ties to an insulator and was preparing to tie one of the power lines to the insulator. The free end of the quick tie slipped out of the crew member's hand and curled underneath the insulated blanket contacting the power line.  The power line arced and burned the crew member's face.
As an employee was moving a grill to be cleaned, the employee's finger was caught between the grill and the wall.
An employee suffered a crushing injury to his right leg when the excavator that he was walking behind stopped and backed up.

An employee was in a classroom working with toddlers when she slipped on a manipulative toy (used as a teaching aid) and hit her left knee on the floor. She was unable to stand-up and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was grinding meat without a plunger and his hand was pulled into the grinder resulting in the loss of the pointer, middle and ring fingers on the right hand.
An employee in the spiral freezer production department was taking the tunnel pan cover off the spiral chain when the cover came down and amputated the employee's left hand middle fingertip.

An employee standing adjacent to the process to affix a tag to a wood crate was struck with the stapler nail from another co-worker as they assembled the wood crate using a pneumatic stapler. The nail struck the left side of his chest under his arm.

On April 16, 2015, at about 3 pm, an employee was standing on a step ladder placing boxes on a shelf. He fell to the floor and experienced a cut on the head, a fractured right wrist, back pain, and a concussion. He was admitted to the hospital.
On 4/16/2015 at about 1:45 p.m., an employee was assembling a skid. When he went to step over the skid, he fell backwards and activated the nail gun shooting a nail into his upper leg.

On or about 16 April 2015 at approximately 1530 hrs an employee was leveling a section of the construction site with a 2007 Ingersoll Rand SD77DX Vibratory Smooth Drum Roller, when the vehicle started to slide down the embankment. The employee dismounted the vehicle and injured his neck upon impact with the ground.

On or about 16 April 2015 at approximately 0830 hrs an employee suffered an amputation of the distal phalanges located on the thumb of the left hand. The employee was retrieving keys from a safe when the door was accidently closed pinning her thumb between the door and the frame of the safe.
An employee's thumb tip was amputated while slicing meat for a customer.

An employee was assisting a truck driver putting a tarp on a unit. The employee used a wooden pallet as a ladder to reach the tarp. The pallet slid out from underneath and the employee fell onto the truck fracturing his right lower leg.

A mechanic was at machine 4L-2 in the rough machine center when a machinist asked to borrow the 10-ton overhead gantry crane.  As the machinist moved the crane, the hook struck the mechanic in the head.  Later, the employee had a headache and blurry vision.  He was taken to the hospital and admitted.
An employee was trimming palm trees with a chain saw, fell approximately 20 feet off a ladder, and was struck in the face by the chain saw.
An employee was found on the ground outside the turnstile near the parking lot.  The employee needed staples in his head as a result of the fall.
An employee feeding a molder reached in to clear a jam and cut the right hand little finger.

On Friday, April 17, 2015, at approximately 3:45 PM, a machinist was operating a lathe and grinding attachment to smooth a rubber roller. The employee was checking the roller thickness when his left thumb was pulled into the grinder. The employee sustained an amputation of the fingertip of his left thumb.
An employee was starting up a production line and putting film into two nip rollers. The film caught and pulled a finger into the nip rollers resulting in an amputation injury.

An employee was operating a zero turn lawn mower and became stuck.  When trying to free the mower, the employee lost his footing and fell backwards striking his head on some rocks.  The employee was dazed, but continued to work. The next morning he was found in bed partially paralyzed and could not communicate.
An employee walking from the memory support building to the assisted living building for a meeting tripped and fell injuring the right hip.
An employee was climbing down a ladder from a large forklift and slipped and fell, breaking his leg.

A battery repair employee removed battery cells from a tray of an industrial battery using a hoist and a below-the-hook lifting device, which consisted of a lug that fit onto the hook of the hoist and a metal angle that fit through connectors on the tops of the battery cells. With the right hand, the employee held the below-the-hook lifting device to keep this device from slipping out of the connector and operated the hoist pendant with the left hand. While holding the below-the-hook lifting device, the employee also inserted a finger of the right hand through the handle in the side of the tray. When the employee activated the "up" control on the hoist, the battery cells, each weighing over 100 pounds, moved upward out of the tray, shearing the top of the employee's right middle finger as the cells passed by the handle of the tray.
An employee closed the elevator door on his left index finger which amputated the tip.
An employee stepping out of a scissor lift fell backwards and hit his head. He was hospitalized overnight with injuries to his head and neck, elbow, and ankle.
An employee fell approximately 10 feet and broke his right wrist and left forearm. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to repair a hole in the roof of his commercial trailer (van). In order to do so, he leaned a ladder against the wall inside his trailer. The ladder slid and he fell off the ladder fracturing his right arm and bruising his left knee.  He also lost one tooth and required stitches on his lips.

Two employees were unloading beer from the back of an 18 wheeler. One employee was pulling down the lift gate and the other employee was assisting with his hands flat on the lift gate. The employee with his hands flat on the gate caught his middle finger, on his left hand, in a pinch point. The employee received a partial amputation of the tip of his middle finger, which was later fully amputated at the hospital that night.
An employee was taking a glass door off of a stove when the door shattered.  The employee was wearing safety glasses; however the employee brushed his face with his hand and glass entered his eye.
On April 17, 2015, at approximately 7:00 PM, an employee smashed his hand while changing the knock out machine hammers, which resulted in the amputation of his left middle finger.
An employee was injured when struck-by plastic pipes while unloading.  The worker was hospitalized.
An employee amputated part of his left thumb while using a masonry table saw to cut 4'x8' brick. The saw was guarded at the time of the incident.
A delivery driver from Haviland Drainage was injured by plastic pipes that rolled off of the Haviland delivery truck.  The worker was hospitalized.
An employee was participating in an obstacle course as part of a fundraising event and tripped over a 5 foot wall injuring the left knee.
On April 17, 2015, a forklift operator fell off his forklift and the forklift ran over his arm. No bones were broken, but the employee sustained torn ligaments that required surgery.

An employee was receiving trimmed PVC membrane pieces from a calendar when his finger came in contact with the blade amputating a fingertip. He was wearing cut-resistant gloves at the time of the incident.
On or about April 17, 2015, an employee sustained a avulsion of the tip of the right first finger that later resulted in an amputation.

An employee was removing concrete forms and loading them onto a flatbed tractor trailer when his left index finger got caught in the chain rigging that was in use to move the forms.  The load shifted and amputated his left index finger between the bottom of the finger nail and the top of the knuckle.

A sanitation worker was working at a sink in the production area near the kettles.  A kettle operator was using a forklift to raise drums of hot sauce. A drum was knocked from the pallet, struck a cart, and hit the ground.  A plastic bag within the drum broke open when the drum hit the floor, and the hot sauce contained within the plastic bag hit the back of the sanitation employee.  The employee received first and second degree burns on the head, front, arm and leg. Additionally, an area on the foot received a third degree burn.
An employee operating a pallet jack got his left ankle pinned between the pallet jack and a pallet in storage.
An employee going down the stairs tripped and fell forward and hit a knee on the stairs.
An employee was pulling a dock plate to unload cargo and the dock plate caused a severe laceration of the right hand middle finger.
An employee was injured when a rack of tables being pushed down a lift gate began to travel too quickly. The tables fell off the lift gate and onto the employee.
On April 17, 2015, an employee in the laundry room stepped behind laundry equipment and was injured when caught between the machine and the wall.
An employee fell from the 3rd or 4th rung of a 24 ft. extension ladder that was extended 12 ft.  The employee hit his head and broke ten ribs and was admitted to the hospital for treatment.
A foreman and the employee were in the electric room pulling a cover to test the breaker.  The employee reached in to take the shield off and was shocked.
An employee walking down a plywood ramp that was slick from the rain slipped and fell breaking his leg.
An employee caught his hand in a pinch point between the sub frame assembly and jix figure while picking up and moving a tri-axle frame assembly.

An employee was installing batten bars onto the sheeting panel during the installation of an aluminum dump. His safety harness rope got caught in the aluminum panel and while he was trying to free it, he fell roughly 20 feet to the ground.
An employee received a head injury when a pressurized line came apart.

An employee was using a crane and a C hook to load a roll of coiled steel into a rack. The roll got caught on the rack and fell onto the employee's right leg resulting in hospitalization and amputation of his right leg.
An employee was processing parts and amputated the tip of the index and middle fingers on his right hand while trying to loosen a part.
An employee amputated the tip of the right index finger when his hand got caught in the roller machine.

An employee suffered a partial amputation of the left middle finger when a wedge was being inserted between two flanges using a chain fall to secure an opening on a gas line gasket and the top flange slammed down onto the employee's finger after the chain fall gave way.

An employee and a couple of other guys were removing a 12 inch section of cargo pipe and a 12 inch valve with a crane.  When they lifted the section of pipe, the section swung and the valve hit an employee.  He fell to the deck (on the same level) and was injured.
An employee turned and caught his foot against a bollard post that was there to protect the equipment.  He lost his balance, fell, and broke his hip.  He was hospitalized.

On 4/18/15 an employee was changing doctor blades on tissue machine 2. As the blades were positioned, the employee suffered an amputation injury when his left right finger was caught between a cylinder and the clevis.

An employee sitting on a forklift leaned forward to scan the barcode on the load. The employee's arm went through the mast and as he leaned over his leg pushed the lever upward causing the mast to come together and pinching his right forearm. The employee was kept overnight at the hospital.

Employees were moving a heat exchanger tube bundle with a hydraulic crane.  The crane had set the tube bundle down on a crawler and the employee had disconnected the synthetic sling from the bundle and used hand signals to the crane operator to rise the main line.  The sling caught the tube bundle and rolled off onto the employee.

An employee was using a hot water hose to clean the cook room. He stepped backwards into an open drain trough and the hot water in the drain burned the front of his lower left leg and the top of his left foot. The drain was not covered at the time of the incident.

An employee was elevated between 5-7 ft. in a 4' w x 5' l x 3' tall wire basket attached to the forks of a sit-down rider forklift. The forklift operator began lowering the basket. The basket tilted and the employee fell out. The employee sustained a broken elbow and arm and a cracked pelvis.  No fall protection was used.

An employee was servicing a Gamco concrete paving machine due to a small hydraulic leak.  While servicing the head pulley belt, the employee sustained a puncture wound that released hydraulic fluid into his hand. The puncture wound was cleaned at hospital; however, the employee was hospitalized overnight to ensure there was no remaining hydraulic fluid in his hand.
An employee working at a pump station was hospitalized after being found unconscious on a metal staircase. He was treated for a concussion and shoulder and hip contusions.
An employee sustained a fingertip amputation to the right index finger which included bone loss while operating a swaging machine on April 18, 2015.
The employee was utilizing a knife to cut a plastic roll and amputated the tip of his left thumb.
Two border patrol agents were involved in a boat accident while chasing drug runners.
The crew was installing a transformer when an arc flash occurred.

An employee who was standing on a wooden crane mat was in the process of placing another wooden crane mat when the crane broke the minimal approach distance (MAD) to an energized "live" line and created an arc flash.

An employee was on a catwalk in the boiler room washing out two 2,000 gallon mixing tanks that previously contained diethanolamine (DEA) with water. The water was draining into a 275 gallon poly tote. The tote exploded creating a fire. The employee received burns to the top of his hand and injured his ankle.
An employee was hospitalized when his truck rolled over while hauling produce water to a disposal site due to soft road conditions on 60th Street NW, Williston, ND.

A load of steel pipes was being lowered into a barge.  The employee attempted to direct the load of steel pipes and his right arm and hand were pinned between the barge and the steel pipes.  He sustained multiple fractures.
An employee was playing in the outside yard with a group of children.  The employee slipped in the grass and tore a tendon in her right knee.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery on the knee.
An employee was walking from segregation to medical, when she tripped and fell in the back hallway. There was wet wax on the floor at the time of the incident.
An employee was leaning against an order picker when it moved and the employee fell and broke his hip.

On April 20, 2015, at about 1400 hrs, an employee walking on a concrete floor while conducting an inspection of work in progress, stepped on a covered hole that gave way, and fell 10 feet to the concrete surface below. The employee sustained two broken hips, a broken knee and two broken ribs.

On April 20, 2015, an employee was loading a powered wheel chair weighing approximately 400 lbs into the cargo bay of a 757 aircraft and got his left pinky finger caught between the wheel and the frame of the wheel chair resulting in the amputation of the pinky fingertip.

An employee was working from a scissor lift performing connecting work when the steel beam that was supported by a crane struck the scissor lift knocking it over.  The employee jumped or fell approximately 12 to 14 feet to the ground and then the scissor lift fell on top of him.  The employee suffered two broken ankles and was hospitalized.
On April 20, 2015, an employee was hospitalized as a result of being struck by a forklift.

A truck driver was preparing to load material in a truck. A steel bar fell from the bottom storage rack and caught his finger between the steel bar and the ground.  The employees left middle finger was amputated.

An employee was cleaning the paddles on a bone canon when his frock was caught in the machine. The employee tried to free himself from the machine and in the process his hand was caught in the machine. His left pinky finger was amputated as a result.
An employee crushed the right index finger and removed the tip while utilizing a pedestal welder to weld bolts onto car parts.

An employee working in a corrugated box manufacturing facility was operating a tube saw that became jammed with material. He lifted the guarding system to unclog the machine. He re-loaded the machine with tubes while the guards were in the lifted position. As he began to feed the newly inserted tubes, his gloved right hand was lacerated. He was taken to the hospital.
An employee fell and broke a hip as he was leaving the trailer for the day. Earlier in the day the stairway from the door was moved to another access door.

A project superintendent was walking on a mezzanine made of a series of steel joists with sheets of plywood used for decking.  The employee fell through an unguarded area of the mezzanine, through the mezzanine floor and into an office below, where he hit his head on a desk.  The employee was transported to an area hospital where he was admitted.
An employee was bending a piece of rebar and the employee's hand was caught between the bar and the edge of the work table. The employee's pinky fingertip was amputated a week later.
An employee fell down the steps and broke his ankle. The employee was admitted into the hospital with a neck contusion and a broken ankle.
A field mechanic was working on a vehicle on the side of the road. He pulled a cylinder from the vehicle and it dropped onto his left hand. His left middle finger was amputated.

An employee was in the process of rolling a 22 inch diameter pipe with an instrument called a C-Bar (tool used to roll the pipe).  His finger got caught between the C-Bar and the next joint of pipe to be rolled which resulted in an amputation.
An employee was bitten by a dog on April 17th at 1100.  He was treated and released.  Follow up shots were prescribed.  On his 4th rabies shot he became ill and was hospitalized overnight.
A temporary employee working at the facility was scooping product out of a barrel placed on a plastic pallet and stepped off injuring her left hip. She was subsequently hospitalized for treatment.

During a cast and mold cement job, an employee was trying to remove a tension cable.  The employee's glove got caught and while attempting to remove his hand, the employee's fingertip was injured.  The employee was hospitalized and the fingertip was medically amputated.
An employee passed out while performing ship fitting work and was admitted to the hospital.

On or about 20 April 2015 at approximately 1644 hrs an employee was hospitalized after a blunt force injury to the cranium. The employee was working on the gut table when he stepped on a bladder bag causing the employee to lose his balance and fall off of the table striking the posterior section of his cranium. The employee received a laceration to the posterior cranium and was admitted to the hospital.

On or about 20 April 2015, an employee suffered the amputation of the distal phalanx of her great toe left foot and the complete removal of all three phalanx of the third toe left foot. On or about 30 March 2015, the employee was moving a metal 55 gallon container of fluid from a dolly to a platform raised 12 inches above the surface, when the drum slid off of the platform and fell onto the employee's foot. The employee was driven to the hospital where she was treated and released. On the 15th of April 2015, the great toe and third toe of the left foot were found to contain necrotic tissues and were slated for removal which was conducted on 20 April 2015.

On or about 20 April 2015 at approximately 1345 hrs, an employee suffered a fractured skull and surgical removal of  bone from the cranial vault. The employee was riding on the open tailgate of a moving utility cargo vehicle when he fell off of the tail gate and impacted the asphalt with his cranium (Left side frontal temporal region).

On or about 20 April 2015 at approximately 1000 hrs an employee of Holman Well Service was hospitalized with an injured hand. The employee was assisting in the replacement of a BOP for Apache Bevins East 99-1H well head. The BOP was placed on the ground next to the well head. As the employees were working around the BOP, it fell over pinning the employee's right hand between the BOP body and the structure of the well head. The employee sustained multiple hand fractures.

A driver was preparing an empty dump trailer to be loaded. He unsecured the rear gate, then unfastened the tarp connections.
