As he walked back to the rear of the trailer, the wind caught the gate, swinging it open and striking the driver on his left side, driving him into the side of the trailer on his right side.
An employee leaving work at the end of a shift, was walking down a set of interior stairs, tripped and fell breaking the lower left leg.
An employee was exposed to hydraulic fluid while servicing a hydraulic line.
An employee installing a satellite dish suffered a broken leg when the portable trailer stairs he was working from tipped over as he disconnected his testing equipment.

An employee was coming back from lunch when she was struck by an SUV.  The employee was in the crosswalk of the parking lot near the grocery entrance.  The employee was admitted to the hospital for treatment of a fractured foot/ankle.

The employee stepped on a table to reach a tool that was on top of a piece of equipment. The table collapsed and the employee fell approximately three feet onto his left foot breaking a bone in his heel.
An employee working on the Dapec 3 Line received fractures to the right hand, forearm, and elbow after coming in contact with a rotating shaft.

An employee was operating a panel saw when a piece of laminate became jammed. The employee attempted to clear the jam and accidentally depressed the "on" switch. The employee's finger was partially amputated and then was removed at the hospital.

An employee was installing electrical cables near the ceiling at a manufacturing facility. The employee was operating a scissor lift at a height of approximately 26 feet. While pulling the cable, a portion of the cable end became entangled on the lift and the lift overturned. The employee suffered left leg injuries that required surgery.
An employee reached into a mechanical power press to remove a part that had been pressed when the press cycled amputating the middle fingertip on the employee's left hand.

An employee had his left thumb tip amputated while performing final assembly on an awning.  His left thumb was caught in the winding machine which wraps the awning cloth onto the metal bars that hold the awning.
An employee sustained a broken right leg when a cattle gate that was stacked upright fell on his leg as he attempted to maneuver it onto a pallet.

A crew was removing a tree and had the tree cut down to 13 feet.  As they were removing the stump, the tree fell striking the employee's ankle.  The employee was transported to the hospital where he was admitted for surgery on his ankle.
An employee was carrying 10 pounds of cheese from a cart to the production line when she fell and broke her hip.
A worker experienced a partial finger amputation while removing dough from a machine.
Employer reported a possible amputation of the right pinky finger. An employee was moving a gate that had a stationary roller on top and a finger on the right hand got caught in the roller.
An employee injured a hand working on an electric drill. Surgery was required to repair the hand.

A forklift was operating a tow motor, lifting a machine coolant tote to fill a machine with coolant.   The injured employee was operating the hose that is connected to the tote to fill the machine reservoir. The tote shifted on the forks of the forklift and fell on the hose operator breaking both of his legs.

On 4/20/15 at 3:30pm,a maintenance employee on a 6' ladder fell striking his right side on a parking bollard. The employee sustained injuries including broken ribs and a slight pneumothorax on the right side. The employee was hospitalized.

Worker was in the process of moving a roll off box onto a transport trailer when the lid came down and pinned his hand between the lid and the box.  The worker sustained a crushed hand and fingers, requiring medical attention and an overnight stay at the local hospital.
A worker was descending a 20 foot extension ladder at an apartment complex construction site. At about 6 feet, he slipped and caught his leg in the ladder, breaking it in two places.
An employee suffered the amputation of the right hand middle fingertip while trying to clean dough off the laminator equipment (cookie die cutter) on line #10.
A worker was hospitalized after a cut on the finger became infected.
An employee amputated part of his left little finger when a fusion pipe fell on his hand at the jobsite.

An employee noticed that there was a water leak on the Omasum washer/refiner. As he tightened a thumb screw, the door opened on a timer spraying the employee with 210 degree water on his left arm, chest and abdomen.

On 4-21-15 an employee was walking into the rear entrance of Medical Office Building B when the employee's shoe got caught on the pavement and the employee fell striking his/her face on the sidewalk. The employee was admitted to the hospital for a sub-arachnoid hemorrhage.

An employee suffered a heat-related injury during a PT hike. The employee started to feel dizzy. He collapsed, but remained conscious. First aid was rendered at the scene and the employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee was cutting the pancreas from the gut when the knife slipped and cut the left forearm.
An employee was performing maintenance work at a customer's location. While carrying a large fan, the employee fell and the fan blade struck the employee's right hand and severed the pinky finger.
An employee was hospitalized for a cut on her left forearm while emptying the Horizontal Mixer.

While moving a dumpster form underneath the garbage chute to empty it, the employee's left arm was caught between the dumpster and the wall, breaking it. The fracture required hospitalization and surgery to repair.
An employee fell out of the back of a pickup while bagging in preparation for painting and fell onto another vehicle, fracturing the back.
An employee was hospitalized for a lumbosacral sprain/strain.

A maintenance employee was troubleshooting a cab assembly.  He put his arm between a positive stop and the guide assembly.  The cab assembly was not locked out or blocked, and the assembly dropped, hitting his left forearm.  The arm was broken and the employee was transported to a local hospital and admitted.
An employee's left finger was amputated while removing bolts from a scrapper.

An maintenance worker, inserted his left hand into the mower chute to remove grass while the mower blades were engaged and cut two of his fingers.  He was admitted to the hospital for surgery to reattach the fingers.
An employee fell three to four feet from the back of a truck after delivering food to an American airlines plane.

An employee working on the drilling floor was picking up the jerk chain for the tongs when the driller applied tension to the chain. The employee got the fingers of his left hand pinched between the headache post and the chain.
An employee fell off an A-frame ladder and broke his wrist.
An employee slipped and fell down the stairs injuring his leg.
An employee suffered a thumb amputation while performing demolition work when an excavator pinned the employee's thumb between a wall and a tooth of the excavator bucket.

An employee was performing maintenance (cleaning) on the top and bottom roll coater machine at the end of his shift. During the cleaning process, the employee touched the roller and his left arm was pulled into the machine. The employee was transported to the hospital.
On April 21, 2015, an employee operating a printing press sustained an injury to the right ring finger while attempting to clear a jam resulting in an amputation.
An employee slipped on icing and fell to the floor fracturing the left hip.

An employee was assisting a forklift driver with a drum and drum grabber. The drum slipped and the employee's finger was caught between the drum and the drum grabber. The employee's ring finger was amputated.
Employee ruptured intestinal cysts when he lifted a box of tile while working at the store.
An employee's right pinky fingertip was amputated when it was pulled into a machine.
An employee suffered a right hand amputation while performing a task on a Formax forming machine.
An employee was knocked to the ground when the cab of a mulcher fell on him.
An employee received a neck and back injury while lifting a patient.

An employee was assisting a mechanic in disassembling a gear box. The employee was holding an intermediate assembly inside the gear box when it shifted and created a pinch point between the assembly and the internal bore. The tip of one of the employee's index fingers was amputated.
An employee lost a fingertip on a drill collar.

An employee and coworker attempting to open a rear truck door pushed on it while it was under pressure. As the injured employee looked away, the door swung open. The door handle struck and fractured his left jaw.
An employee fell from a tractor and struck her head on the ground, resulting in a concussion. She was hospitalized overnight.

An Employee was working on the flat steak line running meats over the skinner when his left thumb was cut on the blade amputating the outside edge and end of the right thumb. A skinner is like a planner that removes the outer layer of the meat.

An employee was walking on a 40 inch high work platform and was stepping down to a lower elevation of the work platform when he slipped off the platform and struck his ribs on the left side. The employee suffered a pneumothorax and several fractured ribs and was hospitalized.
An employee received an electric shock while installing a dryer at a customer's home.
An Employee fell into a phosphoric acid tank sustaining burns and was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after being struck by a vehicle that entered a work zone.
An employee's hand was crushed by a cocoa press. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was struck by a forklift while working on the loading dock.  The employee was hospitalized for a right ankle fracture.
An employee was injured due to a fall from a 3-foot ladder.
An employee sustained a left eye orbital fracture and stitches when a pipe split, releasing water from the pressurized pipe machine.
An employee walking to clock out for lunch, tripped and fell breaking his/her arm.

An employee opened the shaver machine door and reached in to remove a Ford F-7 part from the clamp device. The part had not finished coasting down at the time.  The employee contacted the rotating part, which pulled flesh off of his right index fingertip.

An employee experienced light headedness, shortness of breath, and tingling in both arms.  The employee was transported to the ER by another employee after calling his doctor. The employee was working in a manhole the previous day.
An employee was struck by a vehicle while working in a roadside construction zone.
An employee was attempting to retrieve material from the second level by standing on a vertically placed pallet. The pallet shifted causing the employee to fall and break a hip.
An employee suffered an amputation when their left hand (fifth digit) got stuck in a belt behind one of the bowling machines.
An employee suffered a serious leg injury from a power pole while moving a stack of power poles using a Gradall forklift at or near 83rd and 64th in Stanley, North Dakota.
An employee drifted to the shoulder of the road. The employee tried to correct and oversteered, causing the loaded ready-mix truck to roll.

On 4/22/15 at 1:00PM, an employee was moving a load of bent plate steel, 10 pieces @ 200 lbs each, on a material cart.  While pushing the cart over a transition in the floor (between two shops), the material shifted and caught his hand between cart and the material, crushing his left hand forefinger. The employee's finger was surgically amputated at the hospital.

An employee was struck by a section of traffic guardrail. A backhoe was being used to remove the section. When it pulled on the guardrail, a portion of the guardrail flung and struck the employee in his legs.
An employee smashed the left pinky finger when closing a dumpster door. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was exiting an excavator.  The employee's foot got caught on the exit ladder on the excavator, causing the employee to fall backwards onto the ground resulting in a broken right hip.

On April 22, 2015, an employee was crossing over a grassy area between two facility parking lots on her way to work. As she went to step down to the parking lot, a heavy gust of wind from behind made her lose her balance. She fell down and broke her right leg at the femur.
An employee was unhanging wood scraps from an edger when his left hand got caught in a belt and sprocket, amputating his left ring finger and causing other injuries to his left hand.
An employee was hit by the blast of a sand blaster, which injected media into his leg.
An employee was mounting a tire when his finger was caught between the rim and the caliper.  The employee's right index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was working approximately 10 feet inside of a box truck, preparing materials for shipping. He was tightening a ratchet strap to secure gas cylinders. His hand slipped off of the strap and he stumbled approximately 10 feet backwards. He fell out of the back of the truck, approximately 4 feet to the concrete parking lot, and broke his left femur and hip. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

The employee was tasked with cleaning insulators inside a transformer rectifier set.  The employee reached inside the cabinet with a rag that had a mixture of vinegar and water on it to clean the insulator.  An electrical arc struck the fingers of his left hand.  The voltage is 307 volts and the amperage is unknown.

An employee was conducting leak testing on the roof and started to climb down the ladder.  When he was halfway down, a gust of wind caused him to fall. He was wearing a fall protection harness at the time.
An employee fell through an elevator shaft of a two-story home thinking that the door led to a closet. The employee suffered a slight fracture to his lower back.

A temporary worker was attempting to clear a jam on a bark conveyor when his arm was caught by a spool on the machine. The worker suffered a broken arm and was hospitalized. Surgery was performed to treat the injury.

A stack of plywood came out of a press machine and did not fully roll out onto the roller bed to be picked up by a forklift. An employee tried to manually complete the cycle on the machine to move the stack of plywood. The load of wood then smashed his hand, breaking his thumb and lacerating his hand.
An employee received an amputation injury while operating a Vaneaxial fan (Serial# 135).
While operating a tug, an employee was ejected when another employee cut in front of the tug.
An employee was conducting brick work from a scaffold. He fell 6 feet to the ground and broke both arms.
An electrician who was pulling cables and doing rough-in work in an electrical room became ill, possibly due to heat issues.
An employee was disconnecting railroad cars and setting brakes on the railcar. He tripped and fell backwards, trapping and injuring his right arm in the railcar couplings.
An employee was operating a radio frequency machine when he received an electrical shock to his left-hand ring finger on 4/22/15. He was hospitalized.
A employee jumped and/or fell off a box truck and fractured his ankle.
An employee was riding a horse in the feedlot and fell to the ground. He required surgery to repair the damage to his pelvis.

An employee was taking down a scaffold when he fell through a hole in one of the scaffold planks.  He hit the railing on the scaffold when he fell, injuring his ribs. The employee was wearing fall protection at the time. He was hospitalized overnight.

An employee operating an asphalt tank truck was attempting to open the hatch on the trailer to unload the asphalt. The hatch blew open and hot asphalt landed on the employee's body. The employee fell off the trailer and was burned by the hot asphalt. The employee suffered second and third degree burns over his entire body.

An employee grabbed the outside, top edge of the skiff's bulwark when stepping off of the pier and onto the skiff. A wave hit the side of the skiff, causing the employee to lose his balance. His finger got caught between the pier and bulwark, amputating his ring fingertip.

Two employees were using a forklift to lift a chemical tote bag that was being used to blend chemicals together. A chemical reaction occurred, causing the chemicals in the tote bag to spill out over the top of the tote and onto the employees who were underneath. Both employees were hospitalized with chemical burns.
An employee injured his back while using a stair chair to carry a patient.

An employee was lowering material from the first floor to the basement using a hoist.  He put his left hand on the wire rope to position the load as he lowered it. His pinky finger got caught between the wire rope and the hoist.

An employee was checking to see if a tester was clogged on the TRV Machine. The machine was not locked out/tagged out at the time. When he placed his hand to check the tester, the machine came down and cut his right ring fingertip.

An employee was walking back from retrieving a piece of equipment (a steel hook) to attach to a vessel when he tripped on the edge of a mat on the floor. The fall caused a laceration to the employee's elbow; he was hospitalized.
An employee's finger was crushed by a piece of falling casing material. As a result, his finger was later amputated at the first knuckle.
An employee was hospitalized for an infection resulting from a finger wound (metal sliver in skin).

Employees were doing layout work in the building on the floor. They mark lines to know where to set equipment to make wire. The equipment was blocking the layout line. They lifted the bar to set up the equipment with a 2x4. The equipment became imbalanced and titled over on the injured employee, breaking his leg below the knee.

An employee was accessing a door into the fertilizer house. The step to the door was steep, and the platform/walking surface was a little damp. When the employee reached the step, he fell and broke his right hip. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell while standing on a crescent wrench, cutting his leg on a valve.
An employee was sliding mail from a cart to the floor when she felt pain in the middle of her abdomen below the belly button. She was hospitalized for treatment of a hernia and required surgery.

An employee was driving a John Deere tractor from the back of the store to the front. He ran over a speed bump, which caused him to lose control of the tractor. He hit a plant stand and broke his right leg when it got caught between the stand and the mower. He required surgery.
An employee was in a 14-foot excavation installing a concrete box culvert. As he was climbing out of the culvert, he fell approximately 3 feet and broke his right femur. He was hospitalized.
An employee was riding an electric pallet jack and slipped.  She came down and pulled on the handle.  The pallet jack ran over her ankle.
An employee tripped on a phone cord while walking into a meeting, hit her head, and was knocked unconscious.
An employee reached into the bagger machine to pull out a bag that was stuck. His finger was pulled into the machine, resulting in a right middle fingertip amputation.
On 04-23-2015, an employee got his thumb amputated and index finger fractured while removing tack welds to open up the shells in the North Bay.

An employee suffered second degree burns to his left foot when stepping into a walk-in dishwasher drain where the floor grate had been removed and hot water had accumulated. His vision was blocked by a metal chute he was carrying at the time of the incident.
On April 23, 2015, at 6:45 a.m., an employee became pinned between a truss gantry and a table, causing a compression injury to his lower torso. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was walking on the company walking trail when she fell and broke her hip.

Employees were transferring a barge from dry dock to land. The barge commander gave the "stand clear" signal to everyone.  The injured employee's hands were not clear of the lifting cans. The employee's fingers on both hands were crushed between the lifting cans and the bottom of the barge.

An employee was on a 12-foot tall step ladder, closing a junction box that measured 24 x 24 inches. He had placed a strap around the junction box to secure the cover while closing it. He lost his balance because the strap became loose around the junction box and fell approximately 8 feet.

An employee was using a pipe to unjam a board in the sander machine. The pipe kicked back, hit him in the jaw, and broke his chin. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery on his chin and jaw.

An employee was attaching drill pipe to elevators using his hands. His fingers got stuck between the elevator and the drill pipe, which broke two fingers (pointer and middle finger of the right hand).
An employee fell from a ladder on April 23, 2015, causing a broken tibia on the employee's left leg.

An employee received an amputation while working on the Komatsu machine.  The employee placed his hand under a guard and the machine activated, causing the thread roller to come down on the employee's hand.
An employee was trying to replace a blown tire on the right rear side of his truck when the jack slipped, causing the truck to fall on him.

An employee was conducting training on a glass molding machine that is not used for production.  The employee was feeling around the machine for air leaks when it cycled, causing loss of tissue, nail, and nailbed on the left-hand ring finger. The employee received surgery with some bone removal.

A small crew was trimming trees. An employee in the bucket truck was moving a rope when the boom hit the ground and the truck tilted over at a 45-degree angle, causing the employee to sustain a fractured ankle and ribs.

An employee was injured on April 23, 2015, at approximately 11:50 PM, when she was struck by a powered industrial truck driven by another employee. The injured employee sustained fractures of both ankles, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee was moving a heavy steel table that is used to straighten shovel blades when he slipped and fell, hitting his head on the table. He broke his jaw and cheekbone.
An employee dislocated the left index finger after crashing an ATV during the pursuit of subjects.
An employee was loading the strander machine with a coil of wire. The employee was lowering the coil into the cradle of the machine when the cover of the cradle struck the employee.
An employee was dismounting the back of an open deck truck. The employee's left ring finger got caught between the rolled up hoses, causing a finger amputation.
An employee was working on the packing line. The employee's right hand got caught in the conveyor, and the index and middle fingers were amputated. The guard was not in place at the time.
At 4:50 AM on 4/24, an employee was collecting a sample of black liquor. The sample splashed from the cup onto the employee's face, burning his face. He was hospitalized.
An employee was cutting pork loin using a band saw. He amputated two fingertips (middle and ring finger) on his right hand.
An employee was taking apart a metal table to move it to another location. The table slipped and struck the employee on the head, resulting in a laceration.
An employee operating a swager bypassed a guard and smashed the left-hand pointer and middle fingers, resulting in multiple amputations.
An employee was handling lumber and cut his finger. After bandaging the cut, he walked away, passed out, fell to the floor, and struck his head. The employee was unconscious and hospitalized.
An employee was holding a piece of string connected to a drill bit; when the drill cycled, it partially amputated the employee's right index finger.

A pendant line on a crane was secured to the crane's boom. As the boom was being elevated, the pendant line broke loose and went through the crane cab, striking the injured employee in the face/head. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell down stairs, critically injuring himself.

On or about April 24, 2015, at approximately 1:18 PM, an employee fell approximately 10 feet while working from an elevated platform attached to a fork truck. The employee sustained serious injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee was directing a forklift with a load trying to get it on a trailer. The employee got caught between the forklift and the rail while holding the tote support.

An employee was strapping down building material on a trailer. A second employee who was operating a forklift did not see the first employee and backed up. He ran over the first employee, causing a fracture and open wound to the first employee's left leg just above his ankle. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was taking cases of water from a pallet and loading them on a cart. The employee tripped over shrink wrap removed from the pallet, fell, and broke the right hip.
An employee was operating a roller machine to bend a part when his gloved hand was pulled into the machine, crushing two fingers on his right hand.
An employee was hanging electrical conduit at a jobsite in West Lebanon, New Hampshire, at 4 pm on April 24, 2015. He fell approximately 10 feet off of a ladder and was hospitalized.

At approximately 11:20 a.m., four employees were relocating a rolling scaffold hooch. While trying to move the hooch into position, one of the caster wheels got stuck. The employee tried to redirect the caster to align it with the others. His right-hand pinky finger got caught between the hooch's scaffold leg and a steel saw horse, resulting in an amputation to the fourth digit on the right hand just above the first joint.
An employee's left middle finger got caught between the mandell and end of a cold work gun.
An employee was struck-by a co-worker driving a 3/4 ton pick-up truck while walking to the job-site trailer. The employee suffered crushing injuries to the foot, ankle, and leg.
An employee was operating a stand-up forklift in a warehouse when he struck a dock plate and was ejected. He sustained a fractured right lower leg.
An employee was helping a patient stand when the patient lost his/her balance and fell.  The employee was struck in the left leg when the patient fell, sustaining a broken knee.
On April 21, 2015, an employee suffered an abrasion of the right elbow while doing computer animation.
On April 24, 2015, an employee sustained an injury from an electric shock while resetting the power on a water heater, requiring hospitalization.

An employee had the tips of his ring and middle fingers amputated above the fingernail during an outlet valve installation.  The outlet valve moved suddenly during the installation, causing the injury.
An employee placed his arm in a conveyor and broke his wrist.
An employee was hospitalized after a forklift accident.
An employee attempted to open a jammed gun locker that then fell on her finger and amputated the tip. She was hospitalized.

An employee's finger was crushed while performing rigging-down operations at a well site. The employee was hospitalized, and surgery was performed to remove the left index finger to the first knuckle.
An employee stood up to go to the restroom and fell down. She broke her leg.
An employee suffered burns from a flashover fire.

An employee was running a panel that opens/shuts hydraulic valves, pumping nitrogen.  The employee was told to open the valve slowly; a flashover occurred when this action was taken.  The employee was hospitalized for burns.

An employee was helping a customer unload scrap metal at the scrap metal facility in Lebanon, Pennsylvania, when the employee's finger got caught between the tailgate. The employee sustained a left middle finger amputation just below the nail; there was no nerve damage, and the fingertip could not be reattached. The employee was wearing gloves at the time.
An employee went outside to investigate an odor. She approached a dust collector and stuck her right hand into a hopper that contained a rotating discharge valve. She amputated three fingers.
An employee stepped up onto a piece of concrete to turn off a valve approximately 8 feet from the ground below and fell backward, hitting his back on a metal rail behind him.
An employee sustained an amputation to the right middle finger while performing work on a press brake.
An employee was preparing to administer an IV when she slipped and fell. She twisted her ankle and broke two bones in her leg. This resulted in a hospitalization and subsequent surgery.
An employee fell from a 1-tier scaffold and sustained a head injury.

An employee working in the rework line operated the cat puller to remove rubber from a 0.367-inch hose. The employee's right glove was drawn into the rotating belts of the equipment, causing a fracture to the right thumb.

An employee was delivering mail on a mail route. She was moving the postal truck to the next stop when she heard loud engines approaching her vehicle. The racing car was unable to stop before hitting the rear end of the postal vehicle. After impact, the postal vehicle traveled approximately 40 feet. The employee was hospitalized for broken ribs and a broken collar bone.
A maintenance employee partially amputated his left ring finger when replacing pins for the roller machine.
An employee's fingertip was bitten off by a Pitbull while the employee was delivering mail on a walking mail route.
On or about April 25, 2015, an employee was caught-in an ice machine while cleaning it. The unit was not completely powered down at the time, causing an amputation of the right pointer fingertip.
An employee working in the bakery department amputated her right hand index finger while she was operating a large mixer.
An employee was pushing a rolling cooler out of an elevator. The cooler started to tip over and fell on her left foot.

On April 26, 2015, a resident treatment worker intervention specialist (RTWIS) and two supervisors, members of the crisis team, were attempting to stop a resident from traveling from his/her assigned unit to a different unit.  The intervention took place on the landing of the stairwell.  The crisis team used a hold technique on the resident which resulted in the RTWIS falling on his left elbow and both knees.  A cut on the left elbow led to cellulitis (infection of the skin).  The RTWIS was hospitalized from for intravenous antibiotics.

On or about April 26, 2015, an employee was cleaning the inside of a vessel with a water pressure gun when he slipped and his left foot entered the path of the pressure gun causing lacerations. The employee was hospitalized and received stitches.

An employee was installing a fan guard on a refrigeration unit and fell from a one man lift.  The employee had a harness with a single lanyard on at the time of the incident.  He reached up to put guards on top of the unit.  As he was trying to reach a bolt at the 12 o'clock position, he stepped on the middle rail of the lift basket, disconnected the lanyard to tie off on a bracket for the refrigeration unit, flipped, and fell 25-28 feet.
An employee was hospitalized due to a fall caused by missing a step down while exiting the room.
An employee hooked equipment with a pulley, and the clamp pinched his middle finger on his right hand.
An employee was standing next to a pallet containing a box of yarn. The employee fell after twisting while unloading the box and broke his hip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee tripped over a cord and fell on her left side fracturing her pelvis.
An employee fell off of an electric pallet jack onto the concrete floor after turning into an aisle.

An employee fell approximately 15-18 feet off of a rail car during the loading process. Fall protection was worn, but was disconnected at the time of the accident.  The employee fractured three vertebrae in his back and suffered a head laceration that required staples.

An employee was working with a turret winder. During the automatic transfer, the machine malfunctioned and a sheet dropped off. The employee reached under the machine to place the sheet back on. While placing the material back onto the core, his left arm got caught in the machine. The machine lifted his body up breaking his left arm and left leg by wrapping him inside the product on the core.
An employee was at the construction site and tripped and fell to the ground resulting in a broken nose.
An employee fell while walking towards a gate, resulting in a concussion, brain swelling, and a spinal fracture. The cause of the fall is unknown.
An employee's hand was crushed while handling equipment from a forklift to the flat bed trailer.
A worker was installing soffits and while removing old boards a board fell striking the worker's left hand and pushing it into the rotating blade of the skill saw.
An employee fell and fractured his/her back after a fall from the rear of a truck.
Two temporary employees were in a altercation in the workplace and one was hospitalized overnight due to a head injury.
An employee was going to retrieve product from the cooler and slipped on a tray liner that had dropped off of a cookie tray and injured her lower left leg and her head.
An employee stood up from her desk and tripped on the floor mat or her purse and fell. She broke her knee and shoulder.
Employee experienced chest pain while wrenching at work. Employee was hospitalized over night.
An employee was installing a new electrical panel when he sustained burns to his hands and face.

Two employees were performing maintenance on a boom truck.  As employee one was coming down off the truck he placed his hand into the cradle where the boom rests.  Employee two did not see him and started to lower the boom resulting in the amputation of employee one's right middle  fingertip.
On or about April 27, 2015, an employee was injured when he climbed up racking to pull an order and fell 14 feet.

Two employees were separating a motor from a transmission. When the last bolt was taken out the motor dropped approximately 3 inches onto the injured employees right pointer finger pinching it against the cement floor.
An employee tripped on a water hose and broke her right ankle that needed surgery to repair.
An employee was thrown from a Bobcat that overturned and the roll bar struck his left foot resulting into broken toes and swelling.

An employee was oiling the conveyor chains at the end of the main saw roll-case (conveyor) near the lumber backstop.  When lumber from the main saw reaches the end of the roll-case conveyor near the backstop, the lumber trips a lever arm limit switch, activating a lumber sweep that pushes the lumber onto a perpendicular conveyor.  The employee was standing near the sweep when he tripped the limit switch causing the sweep to activate.  The employee was standing in the path of the sweep.  When the sweep activated, it struck his left foot, crushing the 1st joint of his big toe.   The joint was later amputated by a physician.
An employee was operating a bucket truck when the hydraulic line hit a tree and damaged it. When the employee moved the bucket it dropped and struck an employee injuring his arm.

An employee was transferring calcium chloride from a railcar to a silo using a bucket elevator. A heavy downpour occurred during this process and water entered the bucket elevator. The elevator became choked and the employee attempted to clear the choke using water. This created an exothermic reaction and the employee suffered burns and also fell down some stairs as he was leaving the area.
An employee was bitten by a rattlesnake while working in a pasture.

An employee was working from an 8 foot ladder to hang an air hose reel weighing 44 pounds. As the employee was trying to lift up the hose reel, he lost his balance and fell hitting his midsection on the metal lathe chip guard.
An employee fell off a 10 foot ladder while coming down from the roof after performing maintenance.
An employee's left, fourth finger got caught in the roller of the pillowcase folder.
On 04/27/2015, an employee was changing settings on a welding gun and punctured his knee with welding wire.  The employee was admitted to the hospital and treated for cellulitis and an abscess.
An employee had his hand on the back door when someone opened the front door and the draft caused the back door to open and jammed his finger.
The employee was moving furniture and cleaning up at the Red Roof Inn. He finished one room, walked upstairs, and collapsed.
An employee's left hand and wrist were cut while trying to stop a turbine blade.
An employee was stepping out of a forklift when another employee on a pallet jack came around the corner striking the first employee and breaking her leg.
An employee removed the guard from the M-28 Whitener to clean it and his hand was caught in the auger causing an amputation injury.
An employee was injured while welding a joint on a field plate.  When the joint was re-lifted, the weld broke, and a field plate landed on his left foot.  The resulting fractures required surgery.
An employee was cleaning cans from the filler machine when his/her hand was caught in the machine resulting in the amputation of the right 5th finger.
An employee cut a finger with a saw.

At a residential garbage pick up location, an employee was picking up a toilet to place into a Waste Management Bagster Dumpster Bag tote.  The toilet hit the side of the tote and fell from the employees hands.  The employee was cut on the right forearm by pieces of the broken toilet.  The employee was hospitalized overnight for surgery to repair the cut and muscles damaged by the laceration.
An employee was climbing a scaffold used to access the work area and fell 11 feet to the ground.
On or about April 27, 2015, an employee sustained serious injuries to the left foot and right hand after being struck by a steel coil which resulted in a fall.

On 4/27/15 at approximately 10:56pm an employee was walking over to an area where a tree had knocked down power lines and came into contact with the energized line. The employee received 3rd degree burns and was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while operating a miter saw.
On 4/30/201, an employee doing hot work received serious burns.

A worker was in the process of moving a large round plate off of the top of the fixture when the plate became stuck on one of the mounting bolts. The plate then shifted, swung around the fixture, toppled over, and struck the worker in the left foot.

On or about April 28, 2015 at 12:30 PM two employees were repositioning a water buffalo on the jobsite. The water buffalo had been delivered by a dump truck so the spring lock handle was positioned and supported too high to be placed onto a pick up truck hitch. To lower the spring lock handle, the employee kicked away the dunnage that was supporting the handle.  In the process of removing the supporting dunnage the handle became unstable and fell to the ground, striking the  employee's left foot and breaking it.
A maintenance employee was trying to fix a heat seal machine when the machine activated and closed on the employee's hands, causing burns and potential crushing injuries.

A maintenance associate was on top of the scrubber unit on the mezzanine level. The guard rails had been removed to allow access for replacement units. The employee walked backwards off the mezzanine to the floor below.
On 4/28/2015 an employee was tightening a bolt with a wrench resulting in a hernia. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.
An employee was threading material onto a foaming drum on line four when his glove was caught pulling his right hand between the forming drums and injuring his fingers.
An employee partially amputated his right thumb as he attempted to clear a jam on the CSL line machine.
An employee was performing cleaning operations outside near the gas pump, when a vehicle pulled up to the pump and ran over him.
An employee fell and hit his head while delivering Meals On Wheels to a customer's home.
An employee amputated the left thumb while slicing bread in the deli.
An employee was carrying a box up the steps to the walk-in freezer. The employee miss-stepped and fell.

A dump truck driver was dumping on a slight incline when the dump truck tipped over onto its lift side (passenger side). The driver was not wearing a seat belt and fell to the passenger side, fracturing the left femur bone and was hospitalized.
An employee was seriously injured when cases of paper products fell and knocked the employee down fracturing the employee's hip.

An employee was operating a powered pallet jack to take a pallet to the repair area. The pallet jack suddenly stopped. The employee fell off the equipment and onto the floor suffering some broken bones.
An employee was unloading a banded copper wire bale when the banding on the wire broke causing one of the bales to fall and land on the employee's leg fracturing it.

On or about April 28, 2015, an employee sustained a serious injury to the left hand while changing the RLCH chop saw blade located in the finishing department. The saw was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee sustained a right ring fingertip amputation when placing the right hand on the rail of moving equipment.
An employee suffered the amputation of his right index fingertip on April 28, 2015, when a metal fire door in the breezeway slammed shut.
An employee operating a metal shear received a fingertip amputation on the middle finger of his left hand.

A third party contractor was nippling up a production tree. The employee was tightening the bull plug and the wrench slipped off causing the employee to lose balance and to fall approximately 5 feet to the ground.
An employee performing paving operations was stuck by a vehicle and hospitalized.
On 4/28/15 at approximately 6:30am a forklift operator was traveling in reverse down a ramp when he struck and ran over another employee .
An employee was struck by a company truck at the company's construction yard and hospitalized for a broken leg.
An employee was in the process of putting pipe into a machine when a clamp caught his left index finger and removed his fingertip. The employee was treated at the hospital and released.
As an employee was closing two bi-fold doors his right arm got caught between the two doors causing puncture wounds to his lower bicep.
A machine operator was unjamming the Swiss-style screw machine while it was energized.  It activated and amputated his left index finger.

An employee was operating a motorized pallet jack.  He fractured his right thumb when it became caught between the grocery rack and the handle of the pallet jack. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was admitted to the hospital with a fractured tibia and fibula after loosing his balance in the kitchen area.
An employee sustained a fractured pelvis and right leg after being ejected from a personal basket attached to a telehandler and falling approximately 15 feet.
A biology teaching assistant slipped and fell fracturing her femur. There was a water leak from the freezer which caused the slip and fall.
The employee was working as a roll up operator and placed his foot on a roll of carpet which was on the cradle. The carpet rolled onto the employee's right leg, breaking the tibia and fibula.
While climbing a ladder, an employee lost his footing and fell approximately 6 feet and broke his leg.

An employee was overseeing the transport of product from the upper level to the lower level, when he stepped into an opening and caught his upper body in the opening. The employee caught himself with his upper body. He did not fall to the ground.
An employee broke his left leg after he fell off of a baker scaffold.
An employee operating a prime mover slipped and received a contusion on the leg.  Three weeks later, the employee was admitted to the hospital due to an infection of that injury.
An employee was rocking in his work chair and fell backwards resulting in a fractured rib and a punctured left lung.
An employee punctured a lung while moving welding equipment into a work area.
An employee was unloading door material from an elevator when the material fell hitting the employee.  The employee suffered cuts, broken fingers, a broken hip, and an amputated right thumb.
A temporary employee received an amputation injury.
An employee walking with a tool in hand ran into a second employee, lacerating the second employee's right elbow.
An employee was using a table saw to cut a 10' board. The board kicked back and his fingers went into the blades cutting through 4 fingers.  The employee was hospitalized.

An employee got his hand caught in-between a metal auger blade and the metal frame of the auger while in the process of breaking it down for sanitation. The tip of his left hand middle finger was amputated.

An employee struck a tree and broke her right ankle while driving between scheduled delivery points. The employee lost control of her vehicle while attempting to avoid a dog. The brakes locked, causing the vehicle to slide across a grassy area and into a tree. The employee was hospitalized and received surgery.
On or about 04/29/2015, an employee was hospitalized when she fell down the outside steps and landed face down, injuring her head and experiencing tingling and numbness.

An employee was setting up a machine and was de-beaming.  During rethreading, two of his fingers became caught in the hooks and injured the right, middle finger.  He was taken to the hospital and his fingertip was re-attached.

An employee was operating a stand on mower and it got stuck. The employee got off the mower to see if he could dislodge it. When he got off the mower it started to roll. He tried to stop the mower with his body and it rolled on him resulting in injury.
An employee operating a radial saw in the door shop sawed through his left forearm.
On or about 4/29/15, an employee was shocked and fell off a ladder while putting in electrical wiring.
An employee was working in the bakery department freezer and cut the palm of the hand and wrist with a box cutter while opening boxes.
An employee fell either from the roof or ladder of a mobile home unit. He does not remember.   The employee was inspecting the roof for hail and wind damage.

An employee's right middle fingertip was amputated on a Shear machine.  The cylinder, which comes down with the guard and holds the material in place, came down onto the employee's finger when he engaged the foot pedal.
An employee was standing on an order picker to check the quantity of product in a slot, lost his balance, and fell 12 feet.

An employee was on a construction site. He was loading a tractor onto the low boy rig in order to move it to another location. He was also loading another piece of equipment; neither piece of equipment fit. He walked between the pieces to adjust them, and the tractor rolled into him. He got caught between the two pieces in his thigh area.

An employee was delivering roof trusses to a new residential home site.  The delivery truck bed was on an angle allowing the trusses to slide off the truck bed. A wooden girder came off the top of the stack striking the employee in the back and right foot. The employee had broken ribs and a broken right foot.

On or about 4/29/15, an employee's index finger on right hand was amputated while cutting a 2 x 6 wood slab on a table saw. The employee was hospitalized. The employee's 4th and 5th digits on the right hand were repaired as well.
An employee's right hand was caught while removing a mold jam causing his right hand to be severely pinched. The resulting injury required surgery.
An employee was assisting a rigger unload material. While unloading the material, the load leaned and one of the forms (whaler pieces) split out and struck the employee's leg.
An employee amputated the left index fingertip while using the 517 winder trim slitter machine.
An employee, carrying a box down a fight of stairs, lost balance and fell down the stairs and was injured. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee sustained an amputated right little fingertip (1/2 inch) while opening the door to a 30 yard roll off dumpster.
Employee taken to hospital for possible inhalation exposure to product.

On or about April 29, 2015, an employee operating the #3 Bander/Strapper in the Planer Mill was injured when the machine's bump plate came down on the employee's left hand resulting in crushing type injuries.
An employee was hospitalized for burns.
An employee sustained a head injury while working around the G&L machine in the Hill building.  He slipped and fell, hitting his head on a nearby object.
While bolting two metal plates together one plate slipped and severed a finger.

Employees were manually aligning 6"x6"x9' stainless steel beams weighing approximately 300 lbs on the tank stands. The injured employee and another employee were aligning beams in the same sequence on the same line.  The supervisors were making the final adjustments when the employee attempted to help and his right little finger was pinched between the beam and the beam that was already in place.  The employee was wearing gloves at the time of the incident. This resulted in a partial amputation of the little finger on the employee's right hand.
The employee was a passenger in a golf cart and fell out as the cart went around a corner.
An employee was dismantling a scaffold when he fell 12 feet.  He broke his left hip and pelvis.

On or about April 30, 2015, an employee was helping a second employee position a fallen log so that the grapple of the front-end loader could pick the log up from the ground. The second employee struck the log with such force that the log moved horizontally in a right-to-left sweeping motion, striking the first employee in the leg area and resulting in two breaks to the left leg and a broken right ankle.

A 3-foot perforated pipe was being taken out of a trench for assembly.  The pipe had residual methane gas that was ignited when the McElroy fusion equipment was turned on.  An employee was severely burned and required hospitalization.
An employee bypassed the safety trigger on a pressure washer and received lacerations to the hand from water.

On April 30, at 9:15 a.m., an employee fell from a ladder while dismantling a scaffold inside a tank.  The fall was less than 20 feet. The dimensions of the scaffold were 10x10x33. The employee fractured both heels and sustained a small skull fracture that required stitches. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after being struck by soil/dirt while working within a sloped trench that was approximately 9-feet deep. The employee injured the right leg.
An employee was guiding a pipe bundle. The pipe shifted during crane transport and pinched off the employee's fingertip.

An employee working on a core machine in the core room had the right pinkie finger amputated as a result of injury. The spreader box stopped indexing across the carrier. The employee went around to the back side of the core machine and noticed that the dowel pin had broke and the back spreader box support wheel was dislodged from the rail and appeared stuck.  The employee pushed on the bracket just behind the wheel to try to get the spreader box back on rails and the wheel shattered.  The pressurized cylinder snapped forward and caught his pinkie and ring finger on the right hand.  The right pinkie finger was surgically amputated.
An employee was injured by a brush wire and was hospitalized after infection spread to his arm.
On 4/30/15, an employee was found unconscious in the restroom after hitting his head on the floor next to the conveyor in the warehouse.
An employee got his hand caught in an auger while cleaning, resulting in the amputation of his left middle finger at the first joint. The non-interlocked guard was removed at the time.

An employee was elevated in a work platform attached to a forklift when a piece of conduit fell, striking the basket and knocking him from it.  He fell approximately 20 feet and sustained a broken wrist and leg, requiring surgery.

An employee was on the back of a concrete delivery trailer holding onto the fixed ladder. When he stepped to the side to allow another employee down from the ladder he slipped and fell off the back of the truck.  His injury was an open fracture of the right tibia.

Employees were removing downed trees blocking a roadway. A pickup truck got stuck in the mud.  An employee used a dozer to remove the truck, which got wedged next to the tree. The employee used a chainsaw to cut the tree, and the tension caused the tree to snap and injure the employee. Three bones between the knee and left ankle broke. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee reached into the rotating surface grinder and injured their hand between the thumb and forefinger.
An employee was lifting sheet metal to put in the dumpster when he felt a bubble-like substance, resulting in a hernia.
An employee reached into and under the light curtain of an automatic bagger that was jammed. His finger got caught between two pieces of metal, amputating his right ring finger at the first knuckle.
An employee was working near Grand Isle. He tripped over a rock on the side of the road and fell onto a large piece of glass, cutting his hand. He was hospitalized and underwent hand surgery.

An employee was on a lower level roof (unknown height) and was climbing an attached ladder fixed to the building to go to the upper roof. He was almost to the top of the ladder when he missed a step and fell approximately 15' to 18' onto the lower flat roof. He landed on his feet first, then buttocks, and finally his side and was unable to get up. He was hospitalized and required surgery for a broken right femur.
An employee removed screws from a bus bar in a panel board, resulting in an electrical short that caused an arc flash. The employee was hospitalized with severe burns.
An employee reached into a 12-inch pipe opening and a hydraulic valve closed on his left hand, partially amputating three fingers and causing skin loss to the back of his hand. He was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after accidentally ingesting an unknown chemical and vomiting.
An employee was shutting a safe and got her finger caught in the door. Her fingertip was severed, requiring hospitalization and reattachment surgery.
On or about April 30, 2015, an employee was injured while responding to a sales call.
An employee working at the alignment hoist was checking the vehicle suspension.  The hoist dropped down, pinning the employee's left forearm between the car and the hoist.

The employer made sheet metal components for building construction materials out of rolled steel.  The employee was working at the standing seam line (metal roll former machine) when the strippable wrapped around a die.  The employee lifted the guard and clicked the override switch to allow the machine to continue to operate with the guard in the up position.  The employee had a pendant control to jog dies and pulled the strippable with the other hand.  He reached in and grabbed the strippable and hit the reverse button on the pendant control resulting in the employee's hand being pulled between two dies.
An employee was operating a core machine when he got caught in the machine.  He suffered a finger amputation.
A truck driver sustained several broken bones after either being struck by falling trusses during unloading or when diving under the truck to avoid being struck by the falling trusses.
An employee was servicing a forklift and the left index finger was caught in a moving pulley resulting in surgical amputation of the fingertip.

A longshoreman was in Hold #2 preparing to discharge cargo.  The pontoon decking did not fully cover leaving an open hole from the lower tween deck of a ship into a lower hold area (approximately 32 feet).  The employee fell through the open area.  He admitted to the hospital with a head injury (swelling and bleeding), broken ribs, a shattered elbow and heel, fractured vertebrae and a fractured leg.
An employee tripped walking down stairs when exiting the building and broke the left ankle.

On May 1, 2015 at approximately 11:00 AM two employees were riding in an off-road ATV along the Lechate levee pond when the driver hit a rut and lost control of the vehicle. This caused the vehicle to slide and flip, ejecting the driver into the path of the roll over. The driver sustained injuries to his jaw, collarbone, ribs and internal bruising to his liver. The passenger was not injured.

An employee was attempting to offload a car hauler when he lost his balance and jumped off the trailer approximately 5 feet 3 inches landing on his left leg. He sustained multiple fractures to the leg bones and was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee tripped over a cone and fell on her right hip.

An employee was injured when a hydraulic hose from a hydraulic pump busted.  The employee was performing a lug-nut connection on a cable-end. The employee received injuries to his upper right thigh. Hydraulic fluid penetrated into the employee's leg 1/2" wide by 3/4" deep.  The employee was hospitalized for observation.
An employee was preparing to move from a ladder to the catwalk surface of a rail car when the rail car moved. The employee lost his balance and fell approximately 15 feet injuring his pelvis.
An employee was moving a pallet when a swing gate opened causing him to lose balance and fall through the opening approximately 8-9 feet to the ground.

An employee was installing a rear, overhead vehicle door with another employee. During the installation process, the overhead door came down on the employee's right hand index finger and severed a tendon.
Employee performing flow-back operations at an oil and gas well site received burns from a flash fire.

A welder was using a 4 inch handheld carbon tooth cut-off saw to cut an aluminum block off a Bradley vehicle when the saw bounced back and hit him approximately 2 inches above his right knee causing a severe laceration.  The employee was taken to the hospital for surgery to repair the injury.
An employee was bitten by a spider on the left hand which resulted in an infection.

An employee was changing out compressors on the roof of a building. While un-sweating the oil equalizer line, the torch came in contact with the refrigerant oil and caused a flash burn that injured the employee.

The employee was helping to secure a concrete wall panel that a backhoe was putting into place. The panel was secured and then the backhoe released the load, but the bottom of the panel came loose. The panel fell and struck the employee in the chest and left hand. The employee sustained broken ribs and abrasions on his hand.
An employee climbed a ladder inside a fenced area to clean an eye sensor and was injured when the shaker struck his finger. He lost his nail and fingertip.

An employee's glove got stuck when loading a part into Shear # 3.  When the employee used his left hand to pull his right hand out, he kicked the foot pedal and cycled the machine, pinching the end of the middle finger on his right hand between the part and the machine.
An employee was hospitalized for electrical burns to both hands while running an AC hipot test.
An employee was hospitalized for a cut finger.
An employee walking in a corridor was struck by a swinging door. The employee fell and suffered a hip fracture.
An employee suffered a partial amputation injury when his fingers were caught in a pinch point between the hoist line and sheave.
An employee was attempting to put bails of hay into a pulley when his hand slipped between the pulley and belt partially amputating the middle finger on his hand.
An employee got his foot caught in a pallet on the truck that he was moving and fell to the ground breaking his right arm and wrist.
An employee amputated the tip of his right thumb with pneumatic scissors.

An employee was operating a baler when some cardboard got stuck. This affected the operation of the baler. The employee used a hook to dislodge the cardboard. The baler caught the hook and pulled the employee's right hand against the frame of the baler injuring his hand. The employee was sent to the hospital and kept overnight due to his injuries.
An employee got his hand caught in the blade of a grinder cutting the fingertip and nail of the 3rd digit of the right hand. The fingertip was surgically amputated.

An employee was securing a load inside of an enclosed semi-tractor trailer when a tightener came loose.  The employee fell back out of the trailer and busted his leg below his left femur. He was hospitalized.
An employee was on a tubular pile adjusting straps. The pile rolled, catching his foot and causing him to fall, fracturing his right leg. No cribbing was used at the time of the incident.

An employee was drilling on an electrical panel using a cordless Dewalt 20 volt drill when her glove got caught.  Her hand placement was directly behind the 8" drill bit.  The grove somehow wrapped into the bit and pulled it through.
An employee's lawn mower got stuck. Another employee attempted to use a second mower and a sling to pull it out. The sling came loose and struck the employee in the head.
An employee received an amputation injury to fingers on the right hand while changing the cutter on a molder.
Fall

An employee working on table 1 had the distal tip of the 3rd finger on his right hand amputated while operating the coat hanger machine in the Unicore Factory. The machine was not guarded at the time of the incident.

A truck driver was collecting cardboard on his route. While collecting cardboard at a residence, the employee went up on the truck to remove material that had been stuck. The employee leaned on the truck to push the recyclables and fell to ground.
A pinch point between the electric torque and a metal plate caused an employee to amputate the left index fingertip while using an electric torque wrench.

An employee's hand was caught underneath the interlocked door of a DR 2203 machine and the cutter that cuts the snow (e.g. nylon overwrap) amputated his right, middle finger just below the fingernail.
A temporary worker fell through an unguarded open way from the second floor while unloading dry wall.

An employee was working as the aft-inshore general longshoreman on a vessel. A container was being discharged from the vessel onto a chassis truck. As the container was lowered into position, the employee was removing a semi-automatic twist lock from one corner of the container when the top half of his right index finger was caught between the container and the chassis. The employee was hospitalized and his top right index finger was removed.
An employee operating a forklift had his hand on the roller and was turning and caught his hand between the roller and the compactor breaking his finger and cutting his hand.
An employee was climbing down from an auto transporter trailer, lost his balance, and fell about 8 feet landing feet first. The employee complained of a sore ankle and back and was hospitalized.
An employee was injured in Plant B at the 3-2 straightener during a guide change.  The employee was struck by a 1000 pound guide and then fell down the slide/chute into the scale pit.

On Saturday May 2, 2015, at approximately 9:00 a.m. an employee was lowering a 2000 lbs mold onto the assembly table in the assembly area with assitance from another employee. This was a second mold part that the employees were working on that morning. This mold was standing up on the assembly table approximately 3 ft. high. This mold was lowered with an overhead crane and attached straps onto the four 2x4 supports located on the assembly table. The straps were removed and the mold slipped off the supports subsequently falling off the table and striking the employee resulting in a severe left arm laceration (skin graft) and multiple fractures in the right arm, hand, and fingers.

An employee was struck by a car when he was crossing the street to perform grounds duties on the opposite side of the university campus. The employee sustained scrapes to the head, lacerations to the neck and contusions on both legs.
An employee was standing on a rail dock plate. A forklift truck ran over the dock plate causing it to shift. The employee fell  4 ft. to the ground sustaining a head injury.

An employee in the hot food processing area had an aerosol can of cooking spray (an industrial size can of "Pam") that was placed next to a burner.  Approximately 1 to 1/2 hours later, the aerosol can exploded and ignited into a fire ball. The employee received first and second degree burns on the hands and neck, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was working on the buffering lines running a cable. The jacket came off while he was trying to restring the machine. He pulled the yarn and the dance arm became loose pulling the yarn and causing it to tighten. The yarn tightened around his right middle finger causing an above the bone amputation.
An employee had his foot pinned between a pallet jack and a rack.
An employee suffered a chemical burn on the back of the knee from CP 310 cleaning chemical.  The employee was wearing PPE and knee pads. The employee was hospitalized.

On or about May 3, 2015, an employee's right index fingertip was amputated when he tried to unclog an ice shaver with a plastic spoon and accidentally stepped on the control pedal, which engaged the blade.

An employee was cutting boards and making sticks when a board got jammed in the saw. The employee tried to unjam the board and upon removing the jammed board the conveyor to the machine became activated. The employee's right ring finger was amputated.
An employee shopping for a client was struck by a car in the store parking lot.

The employee was pouring metal (aluminum) from one ladle into another ladle that had been freshly coated with mold paint.  When the molten metal hit the wet paint it "popped" and splashed molten metal onto the employee burning the employee's face, arms and body.
An employee was unjamming an infeed on a planer. When he unjammed the feed, his left hand got caught by the pineapple rolls, breaking three fingers.

An employee was stripping concrete form work. The employee was tied off to the concrete form work when it moved and fell to the ground. The employee was pulled by the falling form work and hit the ground. The employee fell 14 feet and was hospitalized with head and back injuries.
An employee sustained a right calf injury, resulting in hospitalization.

On May 4, 2015, an employee was cleaning the strapper on the bailer unit.  The employee suffered a fracture and partial amputation of the right index finger after his finger was pulled into the pinch point between the two pinch wheels of the machine.
While fixing a condenser unit, an employee's glove got caught by the belt pulley, amputating two of his fingers.
An employee broke his foot while trying to leave his car with his wheel chair on 05/04/2015 at 4:30 PM.
An employee was applying a hydraulic clamp when he placed his hand at the point of operation.

On 05/04/2015, at approximately 12:45 PM, an employee was assembling tools to hammer down some parts in the shop area of the work facility. His hand slipped, and the tool struck his right hand, amputating the right little fingertip. He was hospitalized.
A forklift load fell and struck an employee who was walking in the aisle, breaking his leg and cracking his knee.
An employee was standing on a 6-foot scaffold lifting a board when he lost his footing, fell to the ground, and broke his arm.

An employee was threading up a draw block on machine D21 (drawer) in jog mode. During the task, the employee was putting a chain on the draw block to pull wire through it. The employee had their hand under the chain to check the tension. The chain became tight and flipped up on the draw block, pinching and injuring the employee's finger.
An employee was placing stickers on a transformer lid. His left hand was still on the lip of the lid as he closed it; the steel lid slammed down on his hand, catching his left index finger.
An employee was moving a bundle of steel and hurt his back.

An employee was training a junior employee. They were troubleshooting an electrical exhaust fan. The system was locked out at the time. The employee began manually rotating the pulley via the fan belt.  As the employee pulled the belt, he drove his left hand between the belt he was pulling and the pulley. This crushed his left-hand ring fingertip, including the tip of the fourth distal.  He sustained an amputation of the fourth distal, from the nailbed to the fingertip.

A road construction crew was using a track-hoe to cover a hole in the roadway with a steel plate.  The chain rigging used to suspend the plate slipped or otherwise failed, causing the plate to shift.  An employee tried to prevent the plate from falling, which resulted in injuries to the right side of the employee's body, including a broken right pinky finger, lacerations to the right arm, a broken right tibia, and five broken bones in the right foot.  The employee underwent surgery and was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized due to skin damage.
An employee fell 8 feet through a hole on the flat roof after removing roofing material, fracturing his shoulder blades.
On May 4, 2015, an employee suffered a partial finger amputation when his hand became pinched between two steel coils.

An employee was cutting  a piece of scrap steel wire using a propane/oxygen torch. The wire was placed on top of a  scrapped hydraulic cylinder that contained a residual amount of hydraulic fluid.  While cutting the wire, the employee cut through the cylinder, igniting the hydraulic fluid. The flaming fluid spread to the employee's uniform, which also caught fire. The employee suffered second and third degree burns on his back, stomach, and right calf.

Drilling pipe was being rolled off of a truck onto the rack. The pipe kicked back as it reached the bottom, catching an employee's right thumb between the pipe and the stack of pipes. The employee sustained an amputation to half of his thumb tip.
An employee was injured when he fell while climbing down an extension ladder.
While an employee was grinding metal materials with a side grinder, the wheel of the grinder kicked back and lacerated his left arm.
An employee was transitioning from a suspended scaffold to a stair tower when he fell approximately 30 feet to the ground.

An employee was using a vacuum in the cleaning line when he pressed the wrong button and allowed a pipe to roll past his station. He and a coworker tried to move it back up the line, unaware that another pipe was rolling forward. The employee's right-hand pinky finger got pinched between the two pipes and was later surgically amputated.

A maintenance employee was working on a crystallizer. The guard was removed, but the machine was not locked out. He reached into the discharge valve to grab material; the machine cycled, and a small area of his thumb above and behind the nail was amputated.
While a transporter machine was moving a 20'X20' of steel sheet metal, an employee got caught in a 3'X2' hole on the steel sheet metal, lacerating his right lower leg.
An employee injured his ankle when he missed a stair and fell while descending an extension ladder.
An employee suffered hand and torso injuries when a pallet of rebar dowel being lifted by a forklift fell on the employee at 2801 North Joycee Lane in Sioux Falls, South Dakota.
An employee received a crushing injury, resulting in an amputation on the right foot.
An employee was cleaning an Etnyre Maintenance Distributor when he was sprayed with hot tack coat. He suffered second degree burns on his torso and first degree burns on his arms.
An employee reached beneath an energized conveyor for a label that was jammed. Her arm became entangled between a conveyor roller and the belt, resulting in a broken arm.
An employee driving a tanker truck veered off the road and hit a fence, two telephone poles, and a tree. His truck was empty and going to another lease to load up when the accident occurred.
An employee was placing 3/4" conduit into a dumpster. While removing it, the conduit shifted and pinched the employee's right middle finger.
An employee in the machine shop was polishing an in-house die on a horizontal lathe when the employee's finger got caught on the chuck/die and was pulled in. The finger was dislocated.
An employee was cutting welding rod with a band saw when the rod ejected from the cutting surface and impaled the employee above the knee on the left leg.

While using a material handling device, an employee did not realize that the lifting platform had not fully returned to the warehouse floor. The employee stepped off of the platform and fell approximately 30 inches, fracturing her right leg below the knee. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after a forklift ran over the employee's right foot.
An employee developed an infection after having a sliver of metal in his hand.
An employee's hand became caught in in equipment injuring his index finger.
An employee's right-hand fingertip was severed from the nail down after coming in contact with an unguarded router bit.

An employee was setting up a punch press machine and relocated the feeder from the front to the back. The press was not de-energized at the time. The employee hit the feeder command by accident, and the part charged out of the machine and sliced his left bicep.

On May 5, 2015, at approximately 12:30 p.m., an employee stepped onto the side of the box machine to fill the glue pot with glue sticks. The employee's foot slipped off the surface of the machine, causing her to fall to the floor and fracture her hip.

A motorized conveyor flipped over while unloading a trailer. The conveyor belt was stopped; when an employee tried to flip it back to its normal position, the conveyor started back up, pinching his finger between the belt and a roller and resulting in a partial amputation. Approximately 95 percent of his left ring fingernail was removed.
An employee was hospitalized with a hip fracture  after tripping over a material stop and falling to the ground.

An employee was moving an aerial lift. He was attached via a lanyard when the aerial lift basket bounced, catapulting the employee. The employee was still in the basket after the accident occurred. He injured his left knee and fractured his left leg (left open fibula fracture). He was hospitalized.
An employee was changing a tire on a backhoe when he was struck on the head, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was carrying a load of steel coils with a crane. The load he was carrying hit a stack of coils in front of him. The coils fell on the employee, knocking him and the coils behind him to the ground.
An employee slipped and fell out of the back of a Ford F800 truck, amputating the right index and middle finger as the employee attempted to grab onto a ring installed in the back of the truck.
An employee was hospitalized after suffering a laceration on the inner thigh when the RotoZip saw kicked back while dismantling a storage rack.

A maintenance employee was disassembling a machine. The machine was locked out and the alignment pins were installed to hold the part in place.  After the last bolt was removed, the weight of the part sheared both pins and the part fell, striking the employee and breaking his ankle.
On May 5, 2015, an employee fell 15 feet while creating a temporary work surface between two bridge beams with 16-inch long, 4x4 lumber.
An employee fell from the balcony when the guard rail fell.
An employee was using a jack to elevate a truck and change a spring. The jack slipped from under the truck and hit the employee's hand.

An employee was changing the top die on the 12-foot press when the die holder became loose. The ram and assembly dropped about 10 inches onto the employee's hands. He was hospitalized with a fractured right hand.
An employee received flash fire burns while working on a non-functioning vaporizer at the 13-mile, full-service terminal vicinity in Williston, North Dakota.
An employee was moving a large piece of glass. The glass shifted and fell back into him, cutting his arm. He was hospitalized.
An employee suffered an amputation injury when a valve slipped and pinched the employee's finger between the valve and the frame of the truck at or near Micahlucas 2-5H in Dunn County, North Dakota.

An employee was operating a pallet stacker when he placed his hand on a chain associated with the machine. His finger got caught in the chain; he pulled his hand away, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee driving a jockey truck around the yard suffered a collapsed lung as a result of manually adjusting a side mirror.
An employee suffered left leg and right ankle injuries when a pallet jack on a forklift fell against the employee at 707 Airport Road in Bismarck, North Dakota.
An employee sustained injures when his horse kicked him in the right side while dismounting at the cattle feedlot.
An employee was using a carpet grabber to pull up the carpet. The machine slipped/kicked out, which caused employee to fall and fracture his right hip.

An employee was performing routine activities, wrapping hydraulic hose from a bin onto a drum/spoil using a bin whip. The hose was being raised out of the bin onto the drum/spoil to be coiled evenly along the length when the bin whip broke free of the frame and struck the employee on his face and shoulder. He was hospitalized.
An employee's foot got caught on a rack inside a trailer, dislocating his left big toe and requiring hospitalization.
On 5/5/15, an employee was operating a bending machine when his right pinky finger got caught in the clamping mechanism. He sustained an amputation of the first pinky finger digit.

An employee fueling a boat with gasoline heard a clicking noise near the battery compartment. While investigating, a flash vapor fire occurred, causing second degree burns to the employee's right and left forearms.
An employee was struck by a forklift while unloading material.

An employee adjusting a skinner machine locked out the machine with a wrench and loosened a bolt. The wrench slipped off of the blade, causing her right index finger to contact the blade and remove skin.
An employee had just finished giving a resident a shower. When she stepped out, she twisted her left ankle and fell. She was hospitalized and required surgery.

Two employees were attempting to lubricate pinion gears on an overhead crane bridge drive. To prevent overspray, the first employee held a blue shop rag behind the pinion gear being lubricated.  The second employee sprayed the lubricant. The first employee asked the second to move the bridge forward using the crane pendent control, so he could lubricate the entire gear. The second employee inched the crane forward, at which time the blue shop rag and the first employee's finger got pinched between the pinion gear and the drive wheel.

On 05/06/2015, at approximately 4:30 PM, an employee was loading a railcar with finished product using an overhead crane. He was adjusting the lifting attachment for the crane when the load shifted, causing the employee's left thumb to get caught and crushed. He was hospitalized.
