An employee was removing a baffle plate to set in the support arm with cable come a-longs. The employee's finger got pinched between the baffle plate and support arm, resulting in an amputation to the right ring fingertip.
On May 6, 2015, an employee directing traffic in the receiving area was struck by a vehicle operated by another employee driving in the wrong direction down a one-way street.
An employee was exposed to hydrocarbons while tank gauging at or near well site Charging Eagle 14-14-10 in Dunn County, North Dakota.

An employee climbed a fiberglass ladder to trim a tree. The employee told his coworkers below that he was not feeling well and was getting cramps. He had a rope and a strap along with his climbing belt. He had already put the rope around the limb of the tree. His coworkers told him to stop and come down. He stated that he could not move. One of his coworkers ascended the ladder to secure him from falling. They got him down and gave him some water. He got sick and was hospitalized.
An employee tripped over the arm of the dump truck and hit his head.
An employee was inspecting property damage on a roof. He slipped and fell (unknown distance), injuring his right arm and head.
An employee cutting a tree branch fell and sustained a head injury.
An employee fell and sprained an ankle while stepping out of a Connex-style storage container.  The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was completing a lane closure on the off/on ramp. The employee was securing a mobile arrow-board when a third party struck a TMA vehicle that had caution lights flashing. The third-party vehicle lost control, went in front of the arrow-board, and struck it. The board then struck the employee on the leg.

An employee was conducting radial ring maintenance on a tire-building machine. When the employee reached in to remove the ring, the ring moved and amputated the three middle fingers on his right hand.

On 5/6/2015, an employee received chemical burns to his right thigh while he was transferring hydrofluoric acid from a 55-gallon drum to a 5-gallon portable container. He used a siphon pump to transfer the acid. The pump had an undetected cut in the hose, which caused the acid to spray on to the employee's leg. He was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to square up a 90-degree bend with a horizontal pipe using an overhead crane. The horizontal pipe slid off its supports towards the employee who used his hands to push the pipe away. The employee's left ring fingertip got pinched between the 90 and the horizontal pipe, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was making a sales call/visit to his customer when he slipped and fell down the stairs.  He was hospitalized with a dislocated knee and fractured femur.

An employee was opening the bay door when the door's roller came loose from one side and caused the bay door to shift. The bay door's glass window then shattered and impaled the employee in the chest.
An employee was using a forklift to place a mold on a pallet. The injured employee was removing a 4"x4" post from under the mold. The mold tipped, crushing the injured employee's left thumb.
An employee slipped and fell on urine when emptying the urinal in the toilet.  The urine splashed out onto the floor.
An employee was injured during response to a boiler pipe breach/explosion, suffering burns to approximately 50 percent of the body.

An employee fell off of a 10-foot roof. The employee had used a ladder to access the roof and was applying caulking around the chimney. The employee fractured the left wrist and left ankle and was hospitalized.
An employee in the steakhouse kitchen was using a mandolin slicer to slice a potato.  While using  the slicer, the employee amputated the tip of his right index finger (no bone).
An employee fell from an elevated work platform on a drill rig while installing piping for the well.  The employee broke both ankles.
An employee was working from a scissor lift that fell. The employee sustained critical injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee working in a manhole was exposed to a cable falling off a rack.

An employee  attempted to close a gap on an angle by applying pressure with a chain. The chain he was using to pull the two pieces together slipped and struck him in the face. He was later hospitalized.

An employee was exiting his semi-truck when he noticed a puddle of water outside the driver's side door. To avoid getting his feet wet, he stepped between the cab of the truck and the trailer to get to the passenger side.  He dismounted the truck from the passenger side and landed in an awkward position, breaking his right leg between the hip and the knee.
An employee suffered a knee injury when he tripped through a doorway at or near 3815 116th Avenue SW in Dickinson, North Dakota.
An employee was determing the generator when an arc flash occurred, causing severe burns to his face, neck, arms, and hands. The employee has been hospitalized.
An employee broke his right hip when he fell from his chair. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee was struck on the head by a piece of a split rim when he was inflating a tire on a motor grader.

On May 7, 2015, an employee was injured when attempting to align a two-part bucket with a hydraulic cylinder and block. The employee's left hand was crushed between the two bucket parts, sustaining fractures and requiring surgery.
An employee was putting Brake-R chemical on a shelf above his head. The chemical fell from the shelf and the lid came off. Some of the product splashed him, causing chemical burns.
An employee was talking and then slumped over in his chair. He was hospitalized. The incident occurred on 15th floor at the gas control station.
An employee was working in the Oleo Process Unit and collapsed. He fell face forward and hit his face and head on the ground. He was hospitalized.
An employee experienced dizziness while mixing bone cement containing methyl methacrylate.  The employee was hospitalized due to a low heart rate.

An employee was entering the store while an individual was leaving the store with oil.  The individual did not pay for the oil. The employee tried to retrieve the oil and was dragged by the individual's car.
An employee opened the rear door; a skid fell out and struck him in the legs, fracturing his left leg.
An employee injured a thumb while clearing a clogged drill head, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell 12 to 15 feet off of a fiberglass ladder while climbing to the emergency room roof to install roofing.
An employee was standing in the hallway. A resident walking alone (non-assist resident) in the hallway lost her balance and fell into the employee, knocking her down. She fell and broke her pelvis.
An employee's hand was severed just above the knuckle while operating the hub press.

An employee was placing cardboard into the cardboard compactor chute while standing on a work platform with railings. The employee stepped through the railings to step on the cardboard and push it down further into the chute. The compactor was engaged at the time. The employee's leg got caught and became entangled in the moving cardboard. The employee suffered a broken leg and required hospitalization for surgery. The leg had to be amputated at the knee.
An employee was fitting a piece of plate steel to the bottom of a barge when he slipped and fell, breaking his right leg.
An employee fell from a rack in the warehouse.

On May 7, 2015, at approximately 6:15 a.m., an employee fractured his left hand and was hospitalized. The employee was securing a barge to a stationary cell near the river's edge. To tie the barge off to the cell, the employee pulled the ring away from the cell. His finger/hand got pinched between the barge and the ring, which was level with the barge.
An employee sustained an eye injury while operating a powered industrial truck.

An employee was using a pneumatic staple gun to assemble a door unit. The employee hit a knot in the wood frame, causing the staple to fly back into the employee's eye. No eye protection was used at the time.

On May 7, 2015, at approximately 11:00 a.m., an employee received first and second degree burns to his face, hands, left arm, and left leg, resulting in hospitalization.  The employee was troubleshooting an existing switchgear. The employee de-energized the equipment and thought it was safe to perform the work. The buss was still energized with 13,800 volts and an arc flash occurred.
An employee was buffing out a valve on a trailer with a buffer when a piece of metal dislodged from the buffing disc and flew under his safety glasses into his eye. He was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after tripping over a mobile jack stand not in use in the tool room. The employee sustained a leg injury.

An employee was running a deflashing machine. The main auger of the machine registered a fault. The employee cleared the alarm and vacuumed out the media. He reached into the auger to clear the media by hand. The machine was running at the time. His right hand made contact with the moving auger, resulting in a partial amputation of his middle finger.

The corner tip of an employee's left index finger was cut while cutting pork with a band saw. The guard was down above the pork bone. The blade then struck the pork bone. The pork moved away from the blade, and the employee's fingertip made contact with the blade.
An employee suffered a nasal fracture on 5/8/15 after being hit on the nose by a baseball. He was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a fuel-loop maintenance truck. While fueling a bulldozer, he stepped over the fuel hose with his left foot. His right foot twisted and broke at the ankle.

An employee was lifting aluminum stock weighing 15 to 20 pounds. During this activity, the employee aggravated a pre-existing hernia condition in the lower left groin, requiring hospitalization and surgery to repair the hernia.
An employee's back was injured while lifting a waste basket, requiring hospitalization.
An employee's abdomen got caught between a cement hopper and a stationary object at the West Lining building. He was hospitalized.

An employee was burned when he opened a pressure fryer before all the pressure was relieved. The equipment safety device to prevent the lid from opening before all pressure was released malfunctioned at the time of the incident.
On 05/08/2015, at approximately 7:10 a.m., an employee was stripping an MC Wire when he made contact with the live wire and received burns to both hands. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee in the restroom lost her balance and tripped over her pant leg, falling and hitting her head on the wall. She dented her head and required hospitalization.

An employee was removing a lift (Genie AWP-36S) from inside the church (main aisle, towards back of the church). The employee was lowering the lift when another employee heard a "snap" noise. The lift started to fall. The employee moved away to avoid being hit; in the process, he fell backwards, hit his head, and lost consciousness.
An employee was getting out of a front-end loader when he missed the step and fell to the ground, fracturing his pelvis. He was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was using a forklift to load a pipe rack onto a third party's truck. After the pipe rack was placed, he got out of the forklift to help strap down the pipe rack. The pipe rack fell off of the truck onto his lower legs.

An employee was trying to separate a piece of angle iron on the pipe rack with his hands. He separated one side of the angle iron from the other two pieces. He was walking next to the pipe rack to get to the other side when the pipe rack collapsed and landed on him, breaking his leg.

An employee was measuring a form at the manufacturing plant, FMB building. He was standing on the form, approximately 3 feet off the ground. As he stepped back, he lost his balance and fell backwards, landing on his back on the concrete floor.
An employee fell while moving a chair.

Two employees were filling a mixer with ingredients. They were each pouring over magnets from two locations on the same mixer. The first employee picked up his magnet and walked past the second magnet as they prepared to close the mixer. As the second employee closed the mixer doors, the two magnets were attracted together. The first employee's fingers got pinched between them. The injury resulted in amputation of two of his fingertips on 5/11/15.
An employee was digging with a shovel when the shovel hit his ankle. He received a hairline fracture on his ankle.

The first employee was using a backhoe to dig a 12" to 18" trench for the drill slurry, so the slurry water could be pumped away while concrete was being poured. The second employee instructed the first to pull forward so he could dig the pit for the pump head. The first employee put the backhoe in drive, but it lurched forward because it was still throttled up. The first employee tried to pull the shifter down into neutral, but it went all the way down into reverse. It backed up quickly, striking the second employee in the knee.

An employee was cleaning a concrete mixer when the mixer's blade pinched the employee's finger. The employee sustained a partial finger amputation and compound finger fracture on the right-hand, third finger. The mixer was not locked out at the time.
An employee working on a flat roof fell approximately 12 feet, injuring his back and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was resting his left hand on the edge of a roll-over fixture as he used a 2.5-pound "dead-blow hammer" with his right hand to level a cylinder head on the fixture in the salvage drill bed. When he raised the hammer, it struck something above and deflected down onto his left middle finger.  He sustained a partial fingertip amputation, losing his fingernail and fleshy fingertip; there was no bone damage.
An employee was preparing to climb down a ladder and fell.

An employee was changing the door liners of the Bucher holding mixer when a press started closing the gate on his left forearm. He sustained bruising and swelling on his forearm. The gate valve was locked out at the time of the incident.

On May 8, 2015, an employee was putting an additional bend into a double torsion spring at a large servio table (wire bender) machine. He put his left hand on top of the part, and his left finger got caught between the bending mechanism (steel block) and the stationary block. He suffered a left ring finger amputation.

On May 8, 2015, an employee sustained multiple broken bones when cleaning cell 18 in the molding department.  The employee was pinned by the robot against a fixed component; the cell's robot was not locked out during cleaning operations.
An employee's hand got caught in a door, resulting in a right index fingertip amputation.
An employee was injured from tripping while walking up a flight of stairs.

An employee processing manure attempted to adjust a conveyor belt. The belt was in motion at the time. As he lifted the latch to lock it into place, the bracket bar spun 180 degrees and struck the employee in the lower leg.

An employee loading trucks walked from one trailer to a second trailer on the loading dock and did not notice that the second trailer had been moved from that location. He fell off of the loading dock and landed on the ground below, receiving injuries to his right collar bone and pelvis and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was delivering cargo at a local Dollar Tree store, assisted by store employees, when he collapsed. His body temperature was 108 F, possible heat stroke.
An employee was seriously injured after hitting the third digit on his right hand with a hammer. The employee suffered soft tissue trauma.
An employee working in the office area tripped near a desk and landed on their face.  The employee was hospitalized with a cervical injury.
An employee was hospitalized due to an injury sustained from falling off a ladder.
An employee was changing the battery on a forklift when the battery slipped and crushed his thumb, fracturing and lacerating it.
An employee was headed to a meeting in the conference room. She fell as she opened the break room door to cross over to the conference room.
An employee was walking behind a forklift operator. The forklift operator struck the employee, knocked him down, and ran over his foot.
An employee was attempting to fix an air/oiler on an air tank under an asphalt silo. The safety gate released and hit the employee in the head.

An employee was using an oxy-torch to cut a scrap metal drum in half. The scrap metal drum was 13 feet long and 10 feet high and was lying on the ground horizontally during the work process. The employee came across a small piece on the side of the drum; when he went to cut it with the torch, he fell forward, falling 5 to 6 feet onto his face. He received facial contusions and cuts from metal shavings that were on the work floor during the cutting process. The employee received in-patient hospital care for his injuries.

On May 9, 2015, at approximately 10:00 a.m., a maintenance employee was hospitalized after receiving fractures to his left hand. He was injured when he reached into an access panel for the 1951 freight elevator to operate a manual override due to the outer set of doors not opening.  The elevator moved, and his hand got caught between the elevator and shaft.

An employee was performing maintenance on a communications antenna. He was trying to connect a harness to the ladder, but the shackle was hard to open. His arm gave way and he slipped, falling 30 feet.

On May 9, 2015, an employee was operating a Raymond stand-up forklift when the forklift hit a protective rack on the top and caught the arms of the counter leaver.  The aluminum extrusions bundle weighing 1,000 pounds came down and struck the employee. He was hospitalized with injuries to his right arm and ribs.
An employee fell from a two-story roof, sustaining back and neck injuries.
An employee was trying to attach a deep fat fryer basket holder/bracket onto a fryer when her left hand slipped into the fryer grease while the fryer was turned on.
An employee working on a production line in the Parbake Plant amputated three fingertips on his left hand while trying to unjam equipment.

An employee was rolling a piece of metal that got crooked going into the roll machine. The employee attempted to straighten the piece when the roller caught the employee's glove. The roller has an "E" stop and an emergency cable. The employee hit the cable and the rollers stopped.  A coworker hit reverse, and the employee's hand was freed from the machine. The left index finger was crushed, requiring hospitalization; the finger did not break and there were no permanent injuries.

An employee was punching holes and stacking a floor stringer. The packaging process was to flip every other piece onto the previous piece using the overhead crane. The employee tried to increase production by flipping the parts by hand instead of using the crane. One piece fell on his finger, stripping the flesh and nail from his fingertip and leaving the bone.

An employee on a ladder was attempting to reset the breaker inside of a disconnect panel when the flashlight the employee was holding hit something and sparked. The employee was thrown to the ground and required hospitalization.
On May 10, 2015, an employee amputated his left index fingertip while at the workstation.
An employee was being harassed by a coworker. The coworker picked up a product and threw it at the employee, striking his right cheek. He required stitches.
An employee was attempting to set an extension ladder on a house when it started to fall. He was unable to catch the ladder, and his right pinky finger got caught in a pinch point.
An employee was injured when caught between an order-picker powered industrial truck and a storage rack. She received multiple fractures in her back and was hospitalized.
An employee was bitten while restraining a cat and was hospitalized for infection.
An employee was emptying a fryer and spilled hot cooking oil on the legs of a second employee. The second employee was hospitalized.
An employee was shot in the leg during an armed robbery (not fatal).
An employee dismounted an airboat to retrieve his lunch box. When he attempted to climb back onto the airboat, he was struck by the fan blade. He sustained broken ribs and a collapsed lung.
An employee fell while running down steps and broke his leg. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee severed his left little fingertip while clearing a wooden block from a horizontal drilling machine.

An employee delivering and removing skids was injured while unloading 12-inch clamps from the flatbed of the truck. The clamps got caught on the employee's clothing and pulled him off of the truck, injuring his lower back.
An employee was standing on a trailer to load equipment when he fell off of the trailer. A grouting mixing unit then fell on top of him, causing injuries.
An employee's foot came off the pallet jack platform and got caught between the platform of the pallet jack and the product.
On 05/04/15, an employee stepped on a screw, which punctured the employee's boot and foot. The employee was later hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was dismounting the cab of a crane when he fell on the deck barge, injuring his right wrist and right hip.
On or about May 11, 2015, at approximately 7:00 a.m., an employee  fell from a flatbed truck while applying a tarp to it. The employee incurred head and facial injuries and was hospitalized.
An employee sustained a left ring finger amputation while adjusting a guide roller on the case packer machine.
An employee fell from a ladder on 5/11/15 and broke an ankle. The ladder was not set up correctly at the time of the incident.

Two employees were adjusting forks on a forklift before lifting a load of building materials at a distribution warehouse. While attempting to spread the forks apart, one of the forks fell off of the tracks. Because the fork was no longer seated in the tracks, it fell to the ground, striking one of the employees. The employee sustained a broken leg (fibula) approximately 2 to 3 inches above his right ankle and five broken toes on his left foot.
An employee working at the register collapsed and was admitted to the hospital and treated for dehydration.

An employee was walking toward the medication room when her foot got stuck on the floor, causing her to lose her balance. She fell forward and injured head and face on the doorway. She also fractured her left arm.
An employee tripped and fell while walking down a hallway, fracturing her elbow.
An employee's finger was partially amputated on a bus fan belt. The bus driver started the bus while the employee was checking fluid levels.

While entering the right of way, an employee operating a tractor lost sight of the ground where there was a slope; when he turned the wheels to the right, the tractor tipped over. The employee remained in the cab and received multiple fractures.
An employee turned his back on a live high-voltage line as he was uncovering an electrical power he was about to work on, causing burns to his neck and right thigh. He was hospitalized.

On May 11, 2015, an employee in the carpenter shop was using a jointer to remove a 2x4 wood plank. The employee's left-hand ring fingertip was amputated when the wood kicked back and the employee's hand touched the jointer.
A forklift dropped a load on an employees right hand, smashing it. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery on his right thumb.
An employee attempted to reset forks on a PIT using a second PIT. The fork slipped, catching and lacerating the employee's hands. The employee was hospitalized for hand surgery.

A kiln cart struck an employee, breaking the employee's tibia and fibula bones when the employee's leg got caught between the moving cart and a stationary object. The employee was hospitalized and received emergency surgery.
An employee had approximately 8mm of both thumbs amputated while operating a press brake at Jemison Demsey Metals.
An employee was installing a control display on a commercial oven in the Kroger deli when he was shocked by an unknown voltage; he was hospitalized.

On 05/11/2015, at approximately 12:55 a.m., an employee was loading a bin in the loadout area. He was monitoring the material being filled into the bag of litter pellets when the loader dropped some product on the floor. He moved out of the way, stepped on some pellets, slipped, and fell down on the concrete floor. He got up and walked around, but later felt some pain and was hospitalized.
At 3:45 a.m., an employee was injured after stepping into an approximately 11-inch conveyor gap and being struck by a stack (300 to 500 pounds) of veneer boards. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was getting into the LLV when he/she closed the door on and amputated the right index fingertip (no bone loss).

An employee was taking flange coil to the beam line on a coil car. When he stepped off the coil car, he did not remove his hand from the control button. The coil car kept moving, ran over his right foot, and severed all five of his appendages.
While exiting the roof, an employee unhooked his fall arrest system. He slipped and fell approximately 12 feet onto the lower roof.
An employee slipped on the step of the tractor trailer delivery truck and struck his right knee on the step. He was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee working from home fell and broke her leg while getting up out of a chair. She was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was filling a sandblast pot with more media. As he stepped away from it, the hose fitting decoupled, leaving his right leg in line with blasting media discharge. The discharge caused an abrasion in the right curved area of his right leg.
An employee broke his leg tripping over light-pole foundation footing while trying to run out of the way of a falling security fence.
An employee was looking down and reading while walking. She tripped on materials and fell on the right side of her body, fracturing her hip.

An employee received a minor burn on the arm while performing hot work in a CHT septic tank. Later, the employee developed a severe infection in the arm and received treatments including drainage and antibiotics.
An employee was on a loader step to take out a ticket from the loader operator. He lost his balance when he was stepping down and hit the frame of the loader, injuring his neck.

An employee's left-hand little and ring fingertips/pads were amputated when the employee's hand got caught between a 500-pound steel calibration weight and a conveyor frame during a maintenance activity.
An employee was setting up a video presentation and tripped and fell. He broke his leg in four places and was hospitalized.
An employee using a 4-foot A-frame ladder fell while reaching to dust. She broke her arm, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

An employee was performing a butt weld on two metal rods. He lined up the metal rods in the clamp and did not pull his hand out of the way when the clamp took hold and the butt weld was activated. His left index finger was partially degloved and amputated.

An employee was separating a crane that weighed approximately 1 ton and was about 15 feet long from a carriage. The carriage fell on the employee after it was unbolted, resulting in fractures and other injuries.
While removing a fiberglass-reinforced column mold, an employee's left ring finger got pinched between the mold and the spinner, resulting in a left finger amputation.

On or about May 12, 2015, an employee was operating a standup reach truck under the direct supervision of a Hubbell, Inc., manager. While driving backwards, he lost control of the vehicle; the "dead man" pedal/switch was not engaged. The employee tried to jump off the moving vehicle, and his left foot got caught between the side of the vehicle and an I-beam. He sustained severe injuries to his foot and was hospitalized.
An employee missed a step while exiting the building and tripped and fell. The employee sustained an ankle sprain/dislocation, requiring surgery and hospitalization.

On or about May 12, 2015, an employee was operating a skid steer vehicle and had his right foot resting on the edge of the operator cab. His foot slipped off and was caught in the pinch point between the bucket assembly and the cab. He fractured his foot and ankle and was hospitalized.
An employee sustained an amputation of his upper fingertip while operating a press.

An employee was working on a brake caliper bolt that was stuck on the brakes of a school bus. The employee applied force to the ratchet, which freed the bolt and caused the employee to fall, roll, and break his right ankle. He was hospitalized and required surgery.
An employee suffered an amputation injury while cutting lumber at or near 3350 West Main Avenue in Fargo, North Dakota.
An employee pulling wire felt a strange pain in his belly. He was hospitalized to determine the source of the severe pain.
An employee was standing near a baler machine. A coworker bumped the baler with a forklift, causing the baler door to fall off and hit the employee on the foot.

An employee operating an alfalfa bagging machine fell into the machine's hopper. The hopper's paddle wheels struck the employee, lacerating the employee's stomach and breaking the employee's arm and leg (unknown side).
An employee fell to the ground at work and injured her wrist.
An employee was changing the fuel filter on an all-terrain skid loader. The skid loader was turned on while the gear was engaged, causing the unit to roll over and crush the employee's legs.

An employee was cleaning around a drain in the area where milk cartons are placed on a conveyor belt. The employee reached in around the conveyor's chain-and-sprocket drive, which pulled and partially amputated the employee's right thumb between the sprocket and chain.
On May 12, 2015, an employee's lower left leg was burned by a space heater while sitting at their desk.

While being lifted by a derrick air hoist during oil well drilling operations, an employee's steel-toe boot got caught under the steel cross member "girt" of the derrick. The toe was amputated inside the boot.
An employee reached into a Ward die cutter machine while it was IES to set it up. The employee degloved three fingers on his right hand.
An employee fell approximately 13 feet through a roof working surface while preforming a roof replacement project.
Employees were exposed to caught-between hazards while cleaning the patty-maker machine in the grinding room of the meat department due to lack of training on lock-out/tag-out procedures.
An employee was helping to unload a hopper from a forklift to a truck. The employee had his hand next to the hopper when it moved backwards and pinched his finger, amputating his left middle finger.

An employee was operating hydraulic equipment, a directional bore machine, when he thought there was a leak. He moved the hose to check if there was a leak. He placed his hand on it and was injected by oil into his left middle finger.
An employee was working in a dark storage area of the cast iron building using a utility knife to open a box. The knife skipped out of the cut and sliced the employee's wrist.
On May 12, 2015, an employee's left wrist was punctured by tooling on a molding machine when the machine cycled with his hand in the point of operation. He was hospitalized.
An employee fell 8 feet from a 10-foot step ladder while installing an acoustical ceiling grid.
On May 12, 2015, an employee was injured while changing the guillotine blade on the paper machine. The blade fell on his right leg, mid-thigh, resulting in overnight hospitalization.
An employee standing on top of a box beam slipped and fell onto a platform approximately 5 feet below him, breaking his leg.
An employee collapsed while filing and struck their head when they fell to the ground.

An employee feeding the F-Line feeder reached into the luthi packer portion of the machine while it was still running to clear meat that was jammed. The employee's hand was cut by a knife inside the machine, partially amputating the right index fingertip.
An employee received burns resulting in an overnight hospitalization.
On May 13, 2015, an employee performing glass beading caught the upper portion of his right thumb between a roller and the part, resulting in medical amputation.

An employee was assembling oilfield parts. He had a small piece of pipe (approximately 3-feet high) and was attaching another piece (approximately 500 lbs. with an 18" diameter) to the upright stationary pipe. As he lowered the piece with an overhead crane, he began to place the piece inside the stationary pipe and bolt them together. The pipe was disconnected from the crane, and the employee noticed that the bolt holes were not lined up. When he began to reposition the pipe, it slipped and amputated his pinky, ring, and middle fingers on his left hand. He was hospitalized.
An employee tripped over the scanner cord she was using and fell to the ground, resulting in pain in her right shoulder and hospitalization.
An employee fell and broke her left ankle in two places while descending stairs that traversed a conveyor.

On May 13, 2015, at approximately 12:00 midnight, an employee suffered a concussion and was hospitalized after being struck by a 1.5- to 2-inch flex steel hose. The employee was working in the cellar while a rig hand worked on the rig floor 30 feet above. The rig hand disconnected the hydraulic hose, which fell 30 feet and struck the employee in the head.

An employee was on a 10-foot step-ladder installing some piping in a new structure. The ladder started to "walk" and began to kick out. The employee reached up to the pipes to steady himself, but then fell and broke his wrist.
An employee was decorating a cake stationed on a stainless steel table. The employee was standing on a rubber mat (fatigue mat) when she tripped on it. She fell and fractured her left hip.
An employee delivering mail was bitten by a dog and was injured.
An employee was cleaning a meat slicer and did not realize that the machine blade was spinning. She amputated her middle and ring fingertips on her right hand.
A forklift operator backed up and struck a pallet jack and load directly behind with the forks of the truck, pinching the injured employee's left big toe and causing a 1/2-inch toe amputation.
An employee was clamping down an insulated metal panel with an air-actuated jig while his hand rested on the plate. The jig severed his right-hand middle fingertip.

An employee was walking into the truck when another team member raised the manual dock plate. The employee walking tripped and fell into it, causing him to fall on his hand. The employee's hand got caught in the dock plate, severing the middle, ring, and pinky fingertips on his left hand.
An employee was bitten by an insect and had a swollen leg. He was hospitalized to cut/drain the bite area.

An employee was on an 18-foot extension ladder. While looking to see if the concrete was poured over the rebar, he fell 8 feet to the ground with the ladder, breaking both of his forearms. He was hospitalized.
An employee was helping coworkers lift the side of a large HVAC unit. His right middle fingertip got caught under the HVAC unit as it was being lowered to the ground.

A dump truck from another company, broke down in front of the plant, and employees helped to pull it into the yard with a front end loader. The dump truck had a broken V joint. The injured employee kicked the drive shaft back towards the center of the truck while the vehicle was in motion, and the truck's back axle ran over the employee's legs and feet.
An employee talking on a cell phone stepped onto a wooden pallet. Her foot got caught on the pallet, causing her to fall to the ground. She was hospitalized and required surgery for a fractured hip.
An employee was getting ready to get into his delivery truck when he bent over to pick up an air bag and sustained a back injury. He was hospitalized.
An employee operating the roll machine inadvertently put his hand in the roller, which rolled him into the machine and broke his left arm, ribs, and hand.

At approximately 8 a.m. on 05/13/15, an employee calibrating the blade pitch in a primary air fan. The fan was tagged out at the time. She rotated the fan blades by hand while wearing gloves. As she pulled down on a blade with her right hand, the blade caught the glove or fingertip of her left hand, which was resting on the flange. Her left pinky got pinched between the fan blade and fan housing, amputating the finger about 1 cm from the tip.
An employee fell while descending steps in front of the post office to collect mail, fracturing her right ankle and requiring hospitalization.
Employees were trying to maneuver a metal pipe into place using a hoist when the swivel released and caused the pipe to suddenly lift up about 6 inches and strike the injured employee in the jaw.

On May 13, 2015, at approximately 1:00 a.m., an employee suffered a back injury resulting in hospitalization.  The employee was making an over-the-road delivery driving a tractor trailer.  He stopped at a Pilot Fuel Station and was exiting the cab of his tractor trailer when he stepped to the ground and felt a sharp pain in his back.
An employee changing a "barrel" on an extruder machine received a crushing injury to his right index finger. Part of the finger was surgically removed due to the extent of the injury.
An employee suffered a hand injury and was hospitalized when a pressure washer inadvertently operated.

An employee was torqueing a crossover and putting on tubing with a 36-inch pipe wrench. The hydraulic lever lost power. When the employee started troubleshooting the equipment, the wrench swung back and hit the employee in the chest.
An employee was feeding material into a Dado saw when the left and middle ring fingers were amputated.
An employee was operating a table saw when his left index finger came in contact with the rotating blade, cutting his index finger to the bone.
A maintenance employee was changing an apartment window screen. As he started to climb down the ladder, the ladder slipped. The latch was not attached to the ladder rung at the time of the incident.

At approximately 1:00 p.m., on 05/13/15, an employee was preparing to perform cleanout operations to change chemical products on a production line. The employee, who was by herself at the time, got stuck and pulled into an energized Horix Filling Machine. Coworkers arrived after hearing her scream, pressed the stop button on the Horix Filling Machine to shut it down, and used a tool to manually back up the machine belt. The employee was extracted from the machine by her coworkers. She suffered multiple injuries to her right arm and hand, including a 6" laceration (to the bone) on her forearm, a severe laceration to her upper arm, a fracture or break of her wrist or forearm, and a possible right thumb amputation. She was hospitalized.
While loading a desk on a box truck, an employee fell off the back and broke his nose, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was cutting a 2x4 piece of wood with a table saw when it came down on his finger.  He cut his left index finger on the left side.

An employee was cutting pork on a meat cutting bandsaw in the meat department of the store. While he was cutting the pork, he looked up and cut his right ring fingertip and fractured his middle finger. The bandsaw had a guard in place at the time of the incident.
An employee fell from a scaffold rack while unloading scaffolding material from a flatbed truck and sustained a broken wrist and head bump.
An employee turned the wrong way while operating a standup forklift.  He stepped off of the forklift and wedged his foot between the forklift and pallet. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was doing landscaping work when she fell off of a ladder and injured two vertebrae and three ribs.

An employee was side loading an ATV onto a one-ton flatbed truck.  When loading the employee felt the wheels slip, hit the gas and subsequently traveled across the bed of the truck and hit the 4" bump rail.  The ATV flipped and propelled the employee over the handle bars and to the ground and the ATV fell on the employee.
An employee tripped over a box and hit his head on a crate, causing a cut that required hospitalization and six stitches.

An employee was inspecting pipe threads on a production line. A set of stops were removed for single-pipe roll down. After manually moving a pipe, another pipe came into contact with the employee's hand. His hand got caught and crushed between both pipes, resulting in an amputation from the tip to the first joint of his right-hand pinky finger.

In the bindery division, an employee had a partial amputation of his right pinky finger from the bottom knuckle up. The employee was working on the autostacker, which cuts paper product, when the amputation occurred at 11:00 PM on 5/14/15.

On May 14, 2015, an employee was riding a horse at the farm when the horse got scared and threw the rider. While falling, the employee got hit in the face by the horse's foot, injuring his face. He fractured his eye socket and facial bones and was hospitalized.
An employee was in the maintenance shop picking up parts when he lost consciousness; he was found on the floor by a coworker.
An employee received amputation-type injuries.
Employees suffered injuries as a result of a car accident during resident transport.

On 5/14/15, at approximately 2:20 p.m., an employee was moving a box of tile off a forklift. The box fell and caught the employee's right ring finger between the box and the pallet, amputating the ring finger of his right hand.

An employee was cleaning the rollers of a Walco glue applicator and applying cellophane when his sleeve got caught. The machine pulled his right arm into the rollers, causing a degloving injury to the skin on his wrist and shoulder.
An employee stood up from a chair to go turn off his machine. He lost his balance and fell, landing on his right side and fracturing his right hip. He was hospitalized.

An employee was inspecting the attic to verify if workers could access the windows for cleaning. While doing so, he fell approximately 13 feet through the sheetrock ceiling, landing on the floor below.
An employee broke the left forearm while trying to stop a moving van.
An employee was stocking in the freezer when a case of soda fell on her head
An employee was placing plastic bags into a bailer when a forklift truck crushed his left leg.
An employee jumped approximately 8 feet from an aluminum extension ladder while loosening bolts from a metal plate.

An employee's left distal thumb got pinched between a table and a wheel while moving trees in compartment #3. The employee sustained a near amputation of a left distal thumb fracture, complex 5-centimeter laceration, complex nail bed repair, and exposed bone.

A maintenance employee was working on a lathe in the machine shop. He needed to remove a rust spot on the shaft after beveling it.  Wearing gloves, he began removing the rust by placing a small piece of sand paper over the area as the shaft turned on the lathe (polishing). The glove got caught in the rotating shaft, which pulled the employee into the machine and amputated his left pinky finger, broke his left arm, and stretched his wrist tendons.  He was hospitalized and underwent surgery.
An employee was washing windows while standing on a 4-foot stepladder. When she stepped back off of the ladder, she twisted and broke her left ankle, requiring surgery and hospitalization.

An employee was carrying a 12-lb box up the stairs when the box began to slip out of his hand.  He tried to catch it and missed a step. He lost his balance and fell down eight stairs, landing on his left leg.
An employee was putting lumber into the edger. More lumber was placed on the edger than the edger could handle, causing a piece to kick back and make contact with his thigh, breaking the leg.
An employee was run over while strapping down his load.
An employee was injured while stretching aluminum with a coworker. The coworker bumped the metal, pushing the aluminum back and causing it to pinch the employee's left index finger.

On or about May 14, 2015, an employee was walking down a residence hall near the dining area when she slipped and fell due to water left on the floor. She fractured her left knee and required hospitalization.
An employee's left ring fingertip was amputated when it made contact with a moving sprocket while changing a belt on an exhaust fan.

An employee was cutting lumber to size using a swing saw in the pallet shed. The saw blade caught his right glove as it passed and pulled his right arm underneath, amputating his right hand at or above the wrist. He required surgery to amputate his right arm 3 inches below the elbow and was hospitalized.

An employee was disassembling a wire-line tool when a section of the tooling fell onto the employee's hand. The employee sustained deep lacerations to four fingers and small fractures to two fingers, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell approximately 10 to 12 feet while pulling parts from a storage rack located outside; the employee was hospitalized and sustained multiple fractures.
A crane hook broke, causing its load to fall from the crane onto an employee. The employee's head was pinned between the load and a dump truck.
On 5-14-2015, at 8:00 AM, an employee picked up a snake inside of a building and was bitten on the right thumb. She was hospitalized.
An employee walking out of a paint booth tripped while taking off his paint coat.  He broke his right femur.
An employee was using a hand-grinder to remove a burr on a receiver hitch when the grinder wheel broke apart and sent a piece of the wheel into the left side of the employee's knee.
Employee slipped and fell on a wet wooden access ramp at a residential home while delivering mail.

An employee was trying to install two fasteners that hold a dashboard instrument panel onto a firewall. The employee was wearing gloves; a finger on the glove got caught between the socket and the fastener, pulling the employee's finger into the socket and amputating it at the base.
At approximately 8:40 a.m. on Friday, 05/15/2015, an employee sustained a broken right arm after falling from a tipping scaffold to the concrete floor.

An employee was tightening a valve flange under a cargo tank but could not get the valve flange to tighten. The cargo tank contained methanol under pressure. He decided to remove the valve to let vapors out. He was using a cordless drill, which ignited the vapors. The vapors caused second degree burns to his right arm and the back of both legs.
An employee fell from a hole in steel decking and broke bones. The employee was hospitalized.

Three employees were operating a crane on the jobsite. They were getting ready to take some spouting and needed more length on the sling, so they had to remove the jib. The person on the crane platform was attempting to remove the jib and could not get it. Another employee came to help take the pin out.  Once they removed the pin, the jib fell on the employee who was trying to remove the pin, breaking his right leg.

A light-duty pickup truck struck and ran over an employee from behind. The employee was  struck in the hip and fell to the ground; the truck's rear wheel ran over the employee's knee. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was mowing a bank horizontally using a John Deere zero-turn commercial riding mower. The mower flipped onto the employee, puncturing a lung and breaking three left ribs, five right ribs, and the clavicle.

An employee poured water into the concrete mixer and the water splashed into his eyes. Moments later, the employee extended his hand to pick up the bucket when he instead felt a tick on the tip of his left middle finger. His finger got nipped by the concrete mixer paddles. No amputation occurred.

An employee was pushing a plastic bin containing ice to a banquet area when the bin tipped, causing the employee to lose their balance. As the employee fell, the bin fell on top of the employee's hand, amputating the fingertip between the floor and the bin. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was performing work in a 24-volt DC electrical cabinet. While working, a loose wire grounded out and arced; the employee received an electrical shock and his left hand sustained a second degree burn.
An employee's hand was caught in a tray pack machine, resulting in a finger amputation.

On May 15, 2015, at approximately 8:30 a.m., an employee was hospitalized after inhaling smoke from an electrical fire at the Switchgear No. 7 Substation. Before the incident, mechanical technicians working at the oil recovery plant heard an explosion and noticed a fire at the substation.

An employee was in the loading bay counting beer that was to be delivered. He turned around and slipped off the open bay door, falling backwards and hitting his head on the concrete below. The fall was approximately 3 feet. The employee lost consciousness and was hospitalized.

On 5/18/2015, an employee was attempting to change fuses on a control panel for the blast (steel shot cleaning machine). An arc flash occurred and injured both of the employee's hands, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was pushing a cart containing parts when her heel caught on something. She fell on her left hip and required surgery.
An employee was reversing a forklift in the freezer area. He believed he was going to hit the storage rack, so he jumped off and got caught between a pallet and the forklift.
An employee sustained a back injury during a patient lift.
An employee was hashing parcels when he tripped on a tub and fell on the concrete floor, fracturing his right hip. He required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee's left arm got pinned in a machine at the beginning of their shift. The employee was hospitalized.
On May 15, 2015, an employee walked through an area being mopped, slipped, and fell. She injured her knee, requiring surgery and overnight hospitalization.
An employee was greasing the wheel lift on a tow truck when his hand slipped, causing the lift to fall and crush his left middle fingertip, which eventually had to be amputated.
An employee operating a gang saw attempted to clear a jam.  His right hand got crushed between two pieces of wood.

An employee was loading wheel sets onto his flatbed truck trailer when one of them started to roll. The wheel struck him and caused him to fall off the trailer, resulting in a broken hip that required hospitalization.
On 5/15/15, an employee was hospitalized after suffering a laceration to the left pinky finger. The employee was conducting maintenance activities at the time.

On May 15, 2015, an employee picked up an approximately 20-pound box of oil, sat it back down, and experienced pain in his left arm and back. He later found out he pulled a muscle and had a collapsed lung.
On or about May 15, 2015, an employee was injured when struck by a forklift that was backing up.
An employee's arm got caught in conveyor belt guide rollers while troubleshooting the equipment, resulting in hospitalization.

Two employees were installing plastic on a strainer basket inside of a reactor 30' high when the basket slipped and pulled in one employee's glove and middle finger. Approximately 1/4" of the employee's left middle fingertip was amputated. The basket is made of steel and is shaped like a small garbage can measuring 2' x 1.5' and weighing 200 pounds.

On or about May 15, 2015, at approximately 8:00 a.m., an employee was trying to troubleshoot a hopper that was not filling properly. She took the cap off of the hopper and pulled back on an air cylinder.  The air cylinder was on a timer; it actuated as she pulled on it and caught her left ring finger in the movement, amputating the fingertip.

An employee stepped over a pallet (used to store warehouse equipment) on the warehouse floor to retrieve some carpet squares. He picked up the carpet squares and stepped backwards to go back over the pallet. After doing so, he lost his balance and caught his toe on the pallet, which caused him to trip and fall. He landed on his knee and face, suffering an unspecified knee injury and a concussion. He was hospitalized.
An employee was exposed to and came into contact with approximately 46,000 volts of electrical current from a downed power line, resulting in third degree electrical burns.
An employee was using a compound miter saw when the saw came in contact with his left hand.
An employee was cleaning the construction site when a concrete company's cage broke.  The concrete forms inside the cage then fell on the employee, who was hospitalized.

An employee was working in inedible rendering when she went to open a valve for production flow to the birds.  The steam ball valve was either in the open position or steam pressure was still in the line which caused the product flow line to be under pressure. The pressure caused the back feed which overflowed the tallow tank and hot tallow sprayed onto the employees upper left back and right arm and hand resulting in second degree burns.
An employee servicing engines on a 777 aircraft was turning around to go down a Lift-A-Loft ladder when he lost his balance and fell approximately 7 feet to the ground.

An employee was removing a hose from an asphalt truck. When the employee unhooked the hose, the oil remaining in the hose splashed back onto the employee's left arm, causing chemical burns. He was hospitalized.

On May 16, 2015, at approximately 9:15 p.m., a maintenance employee suffered an amputation of the left pinky finger just below the nailbed. The employee was using a Porta power pump and ram to remove a bearing from the end of a roll when the employee's finger got smashed between the ram and bearing. The pump was running at the time of the incident.
On or about May 16, 2015, an employee operating a mobile pallet jack crushed his big toe between the curb and the pallet jack. The toe was amputated at the hospital.

An employee was operating a tension leveling machine, which was running a coil of copper through it at a speed of approximately 200 fpm. The employee was at the delivery end of the machine near the payoff reel when he reached into the moving machine. The machine grabbed the glove on his left hand, pulled his left arm into the machine, and rotated him around five times. He was wrapped inside the copper coil from his left hand to his armpit and was severely injured.

An employee was using a ladder to take a nitrogen purge line off of a unit that was being decommissioned. He lost his balance on the ladder and fell backwards onto his backside. This is not the fall that caused the injury, but was a precursory fall. He gathered himself and headed back toward the control unit when he then tripped over his feet and landed on an approximately 12-inch high dike on his right side, causing the injury. He was hospitalized for a fractured pelvis.
An employee was using a sling attached to a crane to remove a wheel housing from a dyno tester.  His thumb got caught between the sling and wheel housing, amputating his thumb at the distal joint.

An employee was handling a cable that runs between a drum and the spud. He was trying to put slack in the cable line when the spud shifted and caused the cable to tighten. The cable struck and fractured his left leg just above the ankle.

An employee was sanding a golf cart belt with sand paper while the golf cart was running. The belt caught his fingers and pulled them into the system, amputating his left-hand middle and index fingertips.

Around 1:30 AM on Saturday, May 16, 2015, an employee who had been washing accumulated spilled lime near an area utility drain stepped into dry lime, which came up over and into his ~10-inch tall steel-toed work boots. He received third degree chemical burns to his feet and lower legs and was hospitalized.
An employee was injured when struck by and pinned between the counterweight of a forklift and the ship's hatch/deck pontoons that were resting on the dock.
An employee carrying a bucket of water stopped short when cut off by a customer. The water spilled onto the floor, causing the employee to slip, fall, and fracture the left leg.
An employee suffered an amputation injury while rigging up a top drive at or near Parshall, North Dakota.
A forklift driver turned off his forklift and dismounted it. The forklift was still coasting and not fully stopped at the time. His left leg got pinned between the forklift and a wine table.
An employee was washing and servicing a bus. When he started to exit the bus, he turned his right ankle and fell to the ground, fracturing his right ankle and left lower leg.  He was hospitalized.
An employee was carrying a bucket of hot asphalt.  He lost his balance and sat the bucket down, which caused the asphalt to splash on him.  The employee was hospitalized with burns.

An employee entered the back of a semi-trainer to prep for loading. There were approximately five 8' x 10' x 1"-thick sheets of plywood used as dunnage on the previous load that were left on the trailer and needed to be removed. They were stacked on end and secured to the wall of the trailer.  The employee untied them in order to move them.  The dunnage fell on and injured the employee.
An employee was working in the tail section of a G4 jet. He was climbing down a ladder when he slipped. To stop his fall, he grabbed something on the ladder, which cut his finger.

A forklift operator was moving a plastic returnable (3ftX3ftX2in) on the forks of a forklift. The employee was attempting to place the returnable in a cart that has the same dimensions as the returnable base. While attempting to set the returnable on the cart he had difficulty aligning the returnable with the cart.  The cart has casters so it moves around. The employee decided he would go around to the side of the returnable in an attempt to align it with the cart. While backing up he placed his right hand on the outside of the roll bar of the forklift. While doing so he twisted his body in order to look over his right shoulder. As he was backing up, he hit a center column to the building to which a steel sign was attached and protruding. That protruding steel sign severed the middle and ring fingers of his right hand. The signs had been placed on the columns throughout the workplace as a warning for employees to stop before crossing the drive aisle.
An employee fell through a hatch on a cargo vessel, breaking the left wrist and left foot and requiring hospitalization.

An employee severed the right-hand index fingertip while cleaning a mixer used for batter at a food concession. The mixer was still plugged into an electrical outlet and was turned on at the time of the incident. The fingertip was severed when it got caught in the shaft.
An employee was cleaning a mixer in the sink while still plugged into an electrical outlet.  The mixer was turned on and the tip of her right index finger was severed when it was caught in the shaft.
On or about May 18, 2015, an employee became light-headed and "sick" after likely suffering from dehydration on the jobsite. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a (smaller) press brake machine. She placed her finger between the outside of the part and bottom outside face of the die (not in point of operation). While holding the part, she activated the press to finish the bend. The part moved downward and pinched the tip of her finger. This caused a non-bone amputation of the fingertip.

An employee was on a head platform attached to the top of a 200 foot tall elevator guiding a new conveyor belt into the elevator from the top. The belt was inserted about 3/4 of the way when the belt broke and fell on two employees on the platform knocking the employee to the floor of the platform and fracturing his right hip. The second employee received stitches and was released.

An employee was operating a stack truck (PIT). He turned the truck in the wrong direction and struck a metal guardrail post. He had stuck his foot out of the truck before striking the post, and his foot was crushed between the truck and the post.

An employee was reaching into the back of a truck to move boxes when he felt a pop in his back. The pain got progressively worse throughout the day. He was later admitted to the hospital for numbness in the leg.
An employee was working on pressurized pipe.  When he attempted to loosen a pipe to turn a 90-degree angle, the cap on the pipe dislodged and blew into his abdomen.

An employee was chasing down fuel lines in order to decommission an oil cleaning rig. As he was doing so, he began stepping backwards toward an open side panel which had been used to access the trailer. He stepped out of the trailer and fell backwards approximately 49 inches onto the shop floor. He suffered severe head injuries and was hospitalized.

An employee's right thumb was punctured by fencing material when erecting a fence on the ranch property.  The employee began to experience abdominal stomach cramps days later and was admitted to the hospital. Diagnosis may be related to the employee's thumb injury.

An employee was manually transporting a truck body onto a transfer table. As he was setting it down, he pinched his finger between the truck body and the transfer table, sustaining an avulsion to the pinky finger.

An employee was attempting to remove a sewer cover using clamps with his right hand.  He reached under the cap when there was enough room to fit his hand, and the sewer cap fell on his left middle finger.  The finger was amputated between the nail bed and the first knuckle
An employee was bitten by a spider. Two to three days later the bite swelled up and the employee was admitted to the hospital for IV antibiotics.
On 5/18/15, an employee was hospitalized after suffering a laceration to the left hand. The employee was conducting maintenance activities on a pallet conveyor.
An employee suffered an amputation injury while aligning a telescope cylinder with a boom lift.
An employee suffered a finger injury while drilling a blade at or near 101 Sunrise Ridge Road in Brookings, South Dakota.

An employee was using a forklift to transport cardboard from the rear of the building to a storage area. He did not see a structural pole in his path of travel due to a blind spot created by the forklift mast. He struck the pole and was ejected from the forklift. He was not wearing his seatbelt. His head struck the mast of the forklift as he was ejected. He was hospitalized.

An employee received a partial (1/4-inch) amputation to her left middle finger. She was adjusting a wait on top of the Prodo Pak filling machine when her finger got caught in a pinch point and her fingertip was severed.
An employee severely injured the index and middle fingers on the left hand when caught in a mixer before it had stopped. The middle finger was amputated at the most distant knuckle.
An employee was walking up an outside stairwell when he twisted and injured his knee.  He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was using a chop saw to cut a 2" x 6" wedge when two left-hand fingers were amputated.

An employee was standing on a fixed metal ladder at the pivot point on an irrigation system while using an electrical tester to determine if power was getting to the junction box. He incurred injuries from an electrical shock, which caused him to fall off the ladder. He also received head injuries from the fall.

An employee was walking in the plant and collided with another employee and fell to the floor. The employee suffered two separated vertebrae, six broken ribs, a collapsed lung, and a broken right arm.

The employee was preparing to dismantle scaffolding the employer had erected in the north stairwell of the building.  The employee stepped onto a scaffold platform and the walkboard gave way.  The employee fell 3-4 feet.  On the way down, the index and middle fingers of the employee's right hand were injured. The tip of the middle finger was amputated and the tip of the index finger was cut such that the tip was barely attached to the finger. The flesh of the index finger could not be saved and had to be amputated (no bone involvement).
An employee was injured while cleaning a surgical table when he stood up and struck his head. He was hospitalized.
While working with heifers in front of the feed bunk, an employee did not see the feed truck backing up. The driver also did not see her, and she was knocked down under the truck.
An employee amputated the tip of his left index finger, during the closing of a hydraulic tailgate, while unloading material.

An employee was operating a foil stamp machine when a paper misfeed occurred. The employee reached into the machine to grab it, and his right index finger became caught, resulting in hospitalization. The tip of his finger was severed at the nail.
While clearing a paper jam in the embossing section, an employee caught a hand between two rollers.
An employee collapsed while working at a construction site as a flagger. He was hospitalized for a stroke.

An employee was injured when he fell/slipped while performing clean up/janitorial services. He was cleaning equipment with a dough scraper, water bucket, and towel. He was attempting to retrieve a tool when he slipped and fell, pinning his right arm under his body and breaking his right arm.
An employee sliced off their fingertip while operating a meat slicer.
An employee fell approximately 3 feet from a step-ladder and fractured a rib.
While cleaning parts in a parts washer, an employee's foot slipped in a hot solution of water and detergent (180 Degrees).

An employee was loading oil into the gun barrel while on a ladder. The gun barrel caught fire possibly from the electric heating element and ignited the employee's FR clothes. The employee received second degree burns on his forearm, his hand, and behind his ear.
An employee experienced an electrical shock while unplugging a camper.

An employee was trying to help guide a load by grabbing onto a tag line. He tripped over the stands made out of wood that were holding the extension cords off the ground and landed on his left arm, causing a fracture.

An employee was troubleshooting on one of the lines when he decided to place an AVIS strap around an idler roll to reduce its speed. His left index finger became entangled in the AVIS strap, resulting in an amputation to his left index fingertip and bone, which was severed at the middle phalanx.
An employee fell out the side of an 18 wheeler box trailer and hit his head on the concrete floor.
An employee caught his hand between a road-plate and dunnage.
An employee fell about 8 feet from a ladder and fractured his skull. He was hospitalized.

An employee got his finger caught between the pallet racking and the freeze dryer cart as he guided the cart towards the freeze dryer with a motorized pallet jack. The cart became stuck at the dryer, and he tried to push it into the racking system. His right pinky finger got caught and was partially amputated.
An employee was washing the concrete truck after a delivery while standing on the rear fender. He fell 46 inches to the ground below, cracking his ribs and sustaining a possible lung laceration.
A hydraulic cylinder fell, landing on the employee's right thumb, resulting in the amputation of the right thumb fingertip.
On or about May 19, 2015, an employee was cleaning a moving roller on an extrusion machine with a rag when the machine pulled his left hand in. His left-hand index finger was injured.
An employee tripped and fell while stepping off of a palletizer, resulting in a dislocated right shoulder with fracture.
An employee fell while dismantling a scaffolding bridge.

An employee fell from a 15 foot roof surface opening while removing material as part of asbestos remediation. The employee was wearing a personal fall arrest system that initially engaged then failed, causing the employee to strike the concrete pad beneath him.
An employee was struck on the head by falling tent support.
An employee was walking on uneven terrain, slipped on loose gravel, and fractured his ankle. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was performing a quality assurance inspection of can-line valves.  While inspecting the double head tail filters, she placed her finger in the fill nozzle. The valve energized, closed on her right middle finger, and pinched off her fingertip.
An employee caught her left hand in the fiber picker machine. The machine was not guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was nailing 2x4's together with a nail gun. He had several lined up on a table and was ailing them to make 4x4's when he shot a nail through his right middle finger.

An employee was in the picking area staging totes that were in stacks of 15 to 20, with each tote weighing approximately 1 pound. When she reached for the tote, it fell on top of her; she fell back and hit  the floor. She was hospitalized.

An employee was walking in to work for the night shift at around 1400hrs and fell breaking the tibia and fibula of the right leg. The employee has been hospitalized. The employee doesn't recall exactly what happened, but believes that when stepping up onto a curb, a foot slipped off the curb resulting in the fall.
Employees were loading a metal keg onto a truck when the strap slipped and struck the employee on the left big toe. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was operating turn-table #1 and mold #2 when the mold carriage latch amputated the right index finger and broke the right hand.
An employee "rolled" her left ankle while walking down the stairwell. The incident resulted in a fracture of the ankle that required inpatient care.
An employee injured his ankle when he lost balance rolling a dolly down a truck ramp.  The incident resulted in a broken ankle requiring hospitalization.

On or about 05/19/2015, a utility crew was pulling two sections of a utility pole together with come-a-longs. Each section of the pole has rigging plates attached. One of the rigging plates broke loose and struck the employee on the back resulting in a ruptured spleen that required inpatient care and surgery.

An employee was working with another crane operator to move a crane. The employee had taken in the outriggers on his side and was moving one of the pads to a designated spot on the crane. He was walking around to the other side of the crane where the other operator was still putting the outriggers up. He slipped in the muddy conditions and put his left hand out to catch himself. His hand landed on the outrigger being brought in, crushing his ring and middle finger resulting in the amputation of both fingers.

Two employees were moving a hijack to the fourth floor when the stairway gave way/broke, causing the employees and the equipment to fall. They were between the third and fourth floors when it snapped. The injured employee landed on the second floor landing or a little bit below. The second employee was not injured.

On May 19, 2015, at approximately 11:00am, an employee was hospitalized after being struck in the head by a 3 inch rubber air hose fitting.  The employee was operating a drill rig at the time of the incident.  A hose under 300 pounds pressure, broke at the fitting (swivel came off the threads) allowing the hose to whip and strike the employee in the back of the head.  The employee fell 5' from a platform resulting in a fractured skull.
An employee fell from a height, fracturing his left and right ankles and left arm. He was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a CNC router with a coworker. The coworker activated the router, and the employee got caught between the table and the machine frame. The employee was standing on a safety mat that failed at the time of the accident.
An employee suffered a hand injury while performing routine maintenance on a pump jack at or near Pierre Creek Nelson 44-23 HR in McKenzie County, North Dakota.

An employee was replacing a belt on a conveyor when a coworker energized the conveyor. The employee's hand got caught between the drive chain and the sprocket, amputating the first and second fingers of the right hand down to the first knuckle.
An employee had a seizure and fell to the floor, hitting and lacerating his head. He was hospitalized on May 19, 2015.
An employee operating an assembly machine got her finger caught between two clamps when the machine cycled on its own, receiving a near amputation injury.
An employee slipped and fractured an ankle while mowing grass.
On or about  May 19, 2015, an employee exiting a roof onto a ladder was impaled in the back of the knee by a lightning rod.
An employee was hospitalized with an infection due to a foot injury suffered on a jobsite a few weeks prior.
An employee had two fingers on the right hand caught between a push arm and a board at the drop sort.

An employee was descending a ladder when his hammer came loose from his tool belt, striking a shot strip that was lying on the floor. One of the unused shots detonated in the shot strip, causing a metal fragment to strike the employee's right arm.

An employee was working on an air handler-AC2DF return fan. He shut it off and was waiting for the air handler to stop. While it was still moving, he sneezed and his hand got caught in the belt. His left-hand fingertip was severed, requiring surgery.

On May 19, 2015,an employee was carrying money from the safe room. She pushed back the steel door of the safe room with her left hand. The third (ring) finger of her left had was pinched between the door frame and the closing door. The finger tip was amputated.

An employee was walking on stilts (raised up about 3 feet), installing batt insulation in the ceiling (about 8-feet high) with a manual staple hammer. The stilts caught a piece of plastic insulation bundle wrapping, causing the employee to lose his balance on the stilts. He tipped forward on the stilts, striking the floor with his knees. His coworkers offered to help him back up, but they couldn't move him. He was hospitalized with a fractured spine.
An employee fell through a hole in the floor to the decking 14 feet below, breaking both wrists.
An employee suffered a right ring finger amputation while operating a lathe in the manufacturing department.

An employee was driving an RC lift truck towards the drinking water fountain to get a drink of water. As he approached the water fountain, he did not brake in time, so he used his left foot to stop the RC lift truck. His foot got pinned between the RC lift truck and the bollard that surrounded the water fountain. He was hospitalized for surgery on his lacerated left foot.

An employee was attaching shipping steel to a radiant panel. While lining up the shipping steel, the steel got in a bind and sliced off the employee's left index fingertip, including bone. The employee required surgery.

An employee burned his right foot while transferring hot roof tar from one container to another.  The receptacle into which he was pouring broke, causing some tar to spill onto his foot and burning him.

An employee was drilling holes in a beam when the coolant stopped spraying properly. He climbed onto the CNC drilling machine to adjust the coolant. The knob to control the coolant was located above the vertical drill. As the employee made the adjustment, the CNC drill cycled and pulled the employee's left lower leg between the beam and rollers. He was hospitalized for treatment of a compound fracture.
An employee walking backwards in a semi trailer fell out of the trailer and hit the ground. The employee suffered a concussion and was hospitalized.
An employee was performing a rip cut on a table saw when he cut his left thumb approximately 1/2 inch above his knuckle but below the nail. The guard was not in place at the time.
An employee was working on a mount machine when the employee's left-hand ring finger was amputated, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was removing a cash drawer from the safe. Her right hand was on top of the safe; when the safe door was shut, it took the top portion of her right middle finger off.
An employee was adjusting settings on a surface printer and caught his left index finger in between two gears resulting in the amputation of a fingertip.
An employee working in the storage yard was using an extension ladder while stacking the fourth concrete panel. He fell 15 to 20 feet to the ground and fractured his right femur in two places.
An employee sustained a partial right thumb amputation while operating a metal filing band in the building's work area.
An employee injured his back in a patient's apartment when he picked up a bucket of water used to mop the floor from the sink.
An employee had the tip of his finger amputated while operating the slicer machine.
An employee dislocated their left-hand pinky finger. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery to repair torn tendons.

While digging pits under the foundation of the building, a piece of concrete fell and struck two employees. One employee was treated and released with a hand injury; the second employee was hospitalized with a chest injury.
An employee injured his wrists while uploading a trailer truck and driving a powered industrial truck.
An employee fell while coming down the steps of a platform.
An employee was operating a U.S. Postal Service vehicle when the employee was involved and injured in a motor vehicle crash.
An employee was pushing a cart that contained grinder parts. The cart tipped and the grinder bit fell off the cart and struck the employee's left foot. He was hospitalized as a result.
An employee was delivering parts when he complained of chest and arm pain. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell off of a truck and fractured their arm.
A Noble Energy employee was injured by a compressor fire at a company location in rural Northeast Weld County, Colorado. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee at a site location was helping to empty a tip hopper of glass into a truck bed. The employee's right thumb got caught between the hopper and the truck bed. The employee suffered an amputation to the right thumb tip.
An employee was using an A-frame ladder to clean gutters around a building. The employee fell off the ladder, injuring his/her hip.

An employee was preparing paint in the stern thruster room of a vessel tied up to the pier. He had to kneel and crawl on steel surfaces. He wore knee pads, but not all of the time. His left knee became sore, and he was diagnosed with bursitis with a possible infection.

An employee was operating a foot-actuated punch press when a piece of metal got stuck. While attempting to remove the metal, the hole punch actuated and amputated the employee's left index fingertip and thumb tip.

An employee reversing a powered industrial truck (PIT) out-traveled the dock edge, causing the left rear wheel to drop approximately 3 inches to the lower surface. The PIT overturned and landed on its side. He was wearing his seatbelt at the of the time of the incident but removed it during the fall. The employee suffered a right ankle fracture and was hospitalized for surgery.
A tractor ran over and broke an employee's foot while he was loading the tractor onto a truck transporter.
