An employee was using the baler compactor and he manually closed the gate on his right ring finger. The injury resulted in a partial amputation of the right ring finger up to the first knuckle.

An employee was cleaning up hot pulp that had spilled on the floor (approximately 6-inches deep).   The employee's rubber boots became stuck in the pulp. As he tried freeing himself, his left foot came out of his boot. His unprotected foot landed in the pulp, causing second degree burns up to his ankle.

An employee was climbing a 6' stationary ladder in order to unjam a line. He was approximately 6' high when he reached for and missed the handrail. He then lost his balance and fell backwards to the floor, hitting his arm on a conveyer and landing on his backside and knee. He complained of a sore arm and was hospitalized for surgery to the injured arm.
An employee fell approximately 8 feet when the duct work he was working from fell to the floor. Fall protection was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee fell and broke an ankle moving a five-gallon bucket.

An employee was attempting to separate two 3/8" carbon plates using a plate hook. The plate hook became caught and the employee's finger was caught with a block while attempting to move the plate hook. His finger was amputated above the last knuckle.

An employee backed a POV up to the school to unload tools and lumber; the POV was on an incline.   When the employee exited the POV, it began to roll. The engine was running and the brake was not applied at the time. The employee attempted to re-enter and stop the POV, but fell on the ground, breaking the left wrist and sustaining contusions to the left side of the head.
A truck driver was arranging a pallet.  He stood on the pallet jack to reach the top of the pallet and fell, injuring his ribs and head.  He was hospitalized after the incident.
An employee refueling equipment on a truck fell from the truck and hit his/her head.

An employee finished installing the ridge cap on a roof and had removed the fall protection anchors. He stepped back onto the ladder to exit the roof and lost his footing, falling approximately 20 feet. He required surgery for a broken hip and ribs.

An employee was changing out a gasket on the discharge side of the power boiler feed water pump.  Hot water (200+ degrees) released from the pipe and burned the employee's shoulder, chest, and stomach, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from a truck while delivering product to a school.
An employee broke his arm when it became caught in a conveyor roller.

An employee was using a pressure washer to clean the floor. He stopped to talk to his supervisor and placed the nozzle on his right foot. He accidentally squeezed the trigger on his foot, releasing 250-degree Fahrenheit water onto his foot.

An employee was building crates with a pneumatic nail gun. The wood he was nailing split and the nail gun slipped, moving the nail gun to his hand. He shot his hand with the nail gun, requiring hospitalization. The safety pad was in place at the time.

An employee was inspecting seats inside an aircraft that was parked inside a hanger. He bent or knelt and felt a pop in his lower back followed by pain. He pulled a muscle and was eventually hospitalized to treat the pain.

On May 21, 2015, at approximately 9:30 AM, an employee and coworker were using a forklift and floor jack to remove a hydraulic drive motor from the distribution buggy for repairs. The motor slipped from the floor jack and crushed the employee's thumb, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

On or about May 21, 2015, at approximately 1:15 a.m., an employee was injured when a 4,000-pound cart carrying a helicopter transmission rolled over the employee's foot. The employee sustained a deep laceration, resulting in stitches, and a few fractured toes.
An employee suffered a crushing/amputation injury to the right little finger while working on the coil conveyor line in the packaging department.

An employee slipped/tripped and fell in the concrete parking lot while running to his automobile in the rain at an administrative building. The employee severely strained his right hamstring and sustained an abrasion on his right knee, as well as abrasions on the palms of both hands.

A crew worked doing line clearance tree trimming.  An employee not involved in the tree felling operation stood 35 feet from a cherry tree to be felled.  Employees working from bucket trucks limbed the cherry tree to a height of 18 feet.  Then, an employee manually felled the cherry tree.  The cherry tree had a small limb that remained on the back side.  When the employee felling the cherry tree made the back cut and the cherry tree fell, the remaining limb on the cherry tree struck a nearby ash tree.  The ash tree stood 40 feet high.  Because the ash tree was dead, it became uprooted when struck by the falling cherry tree.  When the ash tree fell, it struck the employee standing 35 feet away from the cherry tree.  This employee suffered a dislocated hip, contusions, and a possible concussion.  The employee was hospitalized for his injuries.
An employee was hospitalized after the skid steer loader he was working on rolled over his feet.

A bag of ice on a pallet in the walk-in freezer had a tear, and some of its ice cubes fell onto the floor. An employee went into the walk-in freezer to get product and stepped onto one of the ice cubes, causing the employee to slip, fall, and break the right hip.
An employee checking bulk tankers on a trailer platform fell approximately 3 feet while stepping down. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured tibia and fibula and a dislocated ankle.
An employee was cleaning out the floor scrubber using a water hose. He went to turn off the fountain and slipped, injuring his left hip.
An employee placed her hand between the door and door frame and pinched her left pinky finger. Her fingertip was crushed.
On 5/21/15, an employee was using a panel cutting machine. When he changed the length of the panel, his hand got caught by the blade, amputating three fingers.

An employee was working in the mold department with the mixing machine. While the employee was pushing the mixing machine, his hand slipped into the mixer. His left index, middle, and ring fingers were amputated.
An employee was setting up on block one when his left-hand middle and ring fingers got crushed by a cylinder.
An employee removing a brush guard got their finger caught between the vehicle chassis and brush guard, amputating the left index fingertip.
An employee was lowering a fire hose off of the side of a ship using a rope when the rope became tangled around his index finger, amputating it at the first knuckle. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee operating a forklift turned to back up and his arm went numb. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was moving backwards with a loaded pallet jack when he tripped and fell back on his hip area. The injury led to a pelvic fracture and hospitalization.

An employee was operating an ammunition loading machine. One cartridge did not have a bullet seated in the opening, so he reached into the opening to remove the faulty cartridge. His finger got caught by the transfer bar (feeding mechanism).
An employee was tying off pipes in a partial trench when the trench buried the employee's leg. The employee was hospitalized.
On May 21, 2015, at approximately 3:00 p.m., an employee was running the milling machine when his glove got caught in the milling cutter, amputating his right index finger.
An employee slipped and fell on chicken grease while cleaning up a rotisserie chicken that a customer accidently dropped on the floor.
An employee was cleaning an auger on a production line. He suffered a finger amputation when he reached into the 8-inch auger, which came down on his finger.

An employee was webbing up and feeding paper into a commercial offset web press. He used his right hand to unjam some paper when his hand and fingers got caught and pinched between the blanket cylinders of the press.

An employee was feeding paper into a conveyer belt to be shredded. He saw some paper under the belt and reached for it. His glove became caught in the conveyer belt, which pulled his left hand and forearm over and under the rollers, resulting in a crushing injury. He was hospitalized.

An employee on the north end of the veneer-cutting area was cutting 80-inch by 5.5-inch veneer on a table saw. The employee grabbed the cut from the front of the table saw while it was running. The blade caught the glove on the employee's left index finger and amputated the finger at or near the first knuckle. All guards were in place at the time.

An employee was cutting grass on the north side of Interstate 75 where the ground sloped. The riding mower started to slide; the employee removed his seat belt to get off of the mower. He slipped and his right leg got caught under the mower.
On May 21, 2015, an employee slipped and fell and was hospitalized with a fractured hip.
An employee being trained on pallet-jack operation crashed against pallets.

An employee was in the restroom on the morning of 05/22/2015. After washing her hands, she reached for the paper towel dispenser, and then slipped on the floor as a result of water droplets.  She fell backwards and landed on her right arm fracturing her humerus.
An employee's leg was pinned by elevator doors.
On or about May 22, 2015, an employee was cleaning with a sweeper and tripped over the cord and fell. The employee broke a bone in the left arm between the elbow and the wrist and hurt a hip.

A wooden pallet got stuck on a roller conveyor.  The employee hooked a chain onto the pallet and the other end onto the mast of a forklift.  As the employee hooked the chain onto the mast of the forklift, the forklift operator side shifted the forklift mast, causing the employee's finger to get pinched between the hook on the chain and the forklift mast.  The employee suffered a fingertip amputation of his right index finger.
An employee smashed the middle two fingers of the left hand while connecting two beams.
An employee had three fingers amputated after reaching into a machine through an unguarded opening.
An employee fell while pulling a tarp over a pit, breaking his hip and requiring hospitalization.
An millwright working on a fan in the feed house suffered an amputation of his left pinky finger while rolling a fan belt back onto a pulley.

An employee was working outside at the rear of the facility. A forklift operator was emptying a load of boxes into the trash compactor and struck the employee on the side of her head just below the ear. The employee sustained a fracture to the bone below the ear. It is unknown if the forks or the boxes struck the employee.
An employee was working on a mobile conveyor system when his thumb got caught and injured.

On May 22, 2015, a contractor had removed the stairs from a job trailer in order to install skirting around the trailer.  An employee, who had not heard the warning of the contractor, exited the trailer and fell 40 inches to the gravel below.  The employee fractured his right leg and was transported to a local hospital.

An employee was clearing the bottom of an underpinning excavation when the ceiling collapsed and he became pinned under a large granite rock from the old foundation they were underpinning.  The employee was hospitalized and received surgery to repair broken bones in his back.
An employee suffered an amputation of two fingers on the right hand when a concrete truck lurched backwards crushing the employee's fingers between the delivery chute and an adjacent wall.

An employee working from a ladder to put up bird netting fell 15 feet to the ground below and broke a wrist and cracked the pelvis.  The employee was hospitalized overnight and had surgery on the wrist the following day.
Employee tripped over a fixed safety cable while working on a roof, resulting in a dislocated ankle which required in-patient hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was hospitalized after a sliver from a wire brush punctured his finger and the wound became infected and needed surgery.
Employee was stowing a wheelchair in the bus when she got her finger caught in a pinch point amputating the tip of the right index finger.

An employee was setting trusses on the second floor. A truss shifted causing the employee to lose balance and fall approximately 25 feet to the floor. The employee was hospitalized with a broken arm and head, nose and left hand injuries.
An employee was injured when working on a conveyor.
An employee was on a wooden structural wall pouring concrete when the machine started to malfunction. He jumped from the wall and broke a leg.
An employee experienced a fingertip amputation while working on a piece of machinery.

An operator was instructing a new employee how to operate the hydro blasting machine when it suddenly actuated. The operator suffered injuries to the hand and was admitted to the local hospital for surgery.
An employee fell at the end of her work shift while descending a set of wooden stairs fracturing her right tibia and requiring surgery to repair.

The employee was in the mezzanine pulling tires for a vehicle that was being serviced.  While walking to the mezzanine stairs, he stepped inside of a tire.  As he raised his foot to walk, his heel got caught causing him to lose balance.  He landed on his right knee.  The employee felt he could continue working and did not request medical attention.  He worked the remainder of his shift.  Three weeks later the employee was admitted to the hospital for an infection to the injured knee.
An employee was working on an A/C unit when the blade struck his right hand little finger.
An employee was rolling a piece of steel in a roller and caught his right pinky finger in the roller. The fingertip was amputated.
On 5/22/2015 the injured worker tripped over rebar lying on a pallet and fell breaking his leg above the ankle. The break required surgery to repair.
An employee was climbing over a pallet of product when he got his foot caught and fell off the pallet breaking his knee cap.
An employee broke an arm while attempting to assist a box of product along the conveyor belt.
An employee was coming out of a portable restroom (Port-O-John) when a forklift truck struck and fractured the employee's right leg. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was cleaning an actuator valve for an R&D project. He activated the valve, which opened it. When he then deactivated the valve, he did not remove his finger, and the valve caught his fingertip. He pulled his finger away, removing the pinky fingertip skin on his left hand.
An employee was unloading empty drums from a trailer when he stepped off of a pallet and broke his leg.

On Friday 05/22/15 in the afternoon, an employee was cleaning an empty apartment while wearing rubber gloves. There was a break in the gloves and dirty water from a bucket contacted a pre-existing wound on the right hand causing injury such as, swelling, redness and pain to the hand.  He was transported to the hospital for treatment.
An employee received a severe laceration on left thumb while operating a cutting saw. The accident occurred on 5/23/2015 at 11:45am.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was pushing a cart with steel louvers on the cart. The steel louvers slipped off and crushed the big toe on his left foot.
An employee was moving a cement head that weighs approximately 400 lbs when it fell onto the employee's left foot.

On May 24, 2015, an employee was removing a battery from a Crown Lift Truck with the help of a second employee. During the removal, the battery slipped and fell onto the injured employee's right hand crushing multiple fingers and amputating the right index fingertip.
On May 24, 2015, an employee working near a mud pump suffered an injury to his right leg/knee when he was struck by fluid under pressure when a hose ruptured.
An employee received a burn to the right forearm due to contact with an electrical power line while operating an articulating boom truck.
While exiting a room an employee slipped on a tray that was left by the door causing her to fall and break her right arm.
An employee working on a ship was installing a valve into a pipeline.  The employee slipped and a toe was caught between the valve and pipeline.
An employee was shot in the abdomen during an attempted robbery.
An employee was lifting a bag from the baggage carousel onto the baggage cart when the employee felt a sharp pain in his abdomen.  The employee had emergency surgery.
An employee was hospitalized with a fractured femur after slipping on a nacho lid and falling in the store.
An employee was admitted to the hospital for burns on the left arm and abdomen from Ster-Bac, a liquid quaternary ammonia sanitizer.
An employee's right thumb was pinched between the pattern hanger bar and the base of the machine swing arm on a vertical molding machine.
An employee climbed on top of a chair to make an adjustment to an extruder (E2).  The employee got the middle finger on his right hand caught in rollers causing a partial amputation.
An employee's foot was caught between the PIT he was operating and another parked PIT. The injury resulted in overnight hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was admitted to the hospital for 1st and 2nd degree burns sustained to 40-50 percent of the body after coming in contact with hot pulp and fluids while emptying "junk" traps.

On or about May 25, 2015 at 8 pm, an employee received second degree burns on her hand, leg, and foot from hot oil.  The employee was dumping a bucket of hot oil when her hand slipped off and the hot oil splashed her.

An employee was using a chain saw while "bucking" logs at a small (1/10 acre) forest fire.  The employee suffered second and third degree burns on the arms, neck and face when the chain saw failed/exploded/flashed.
An employee fell approximately 12 ft. to the ground while installing a valve on a aircraft engine. The employee sustained a fractured wrist and head trauma.
An employee was changing out a needle board. The new one he was putting in fell and scratched his hand.  An infection developed and the employee was later admitted to the hospital.
On or about May 25, 2015, at 4:00 pm an employee was supporting a highly mobile resistant resident and fractured her back.  Later, she had trouble moving her feet and was hospitalized for treatment.

The employee was operating a sit-down forklift to load an outbound trailer. Upon forward motion by the trailer, the employee was struck by a metal strap which became dislodged from the interior of the trailer.  The metal lacerated the left leg.

On 5/26/2015, an employee was on a ladder about 4 to 5 feet from the ground and close to the trash chute. When he was reaching over to secure plywood, he lost balance and fell injuring his left leg and wrist.

A four inch diameter drill casing used to load shot when blasting for bridge footings approximately 100 feet deep exploded.  The employee was in a designated area assigned for loading the shot.  The shot was complete and clean-up was being performed.  Once the shot has been ignited in the casing, the casings are retrieved and placed into a scrap trailer.  An employee was attempting to cut the casing with a cutting torch to fit into the scrap trailer when the casing exploded. The employee's face and arms were cut requiring stitches.  He also has ringing in his left ear.
An employee was on a ladder. While coming down the ladder, he missed the bottom step and fell to the ground breaking his hip.
Employee was roll forming steel when his left hand and arm were caught in the rollers. Employee underwent emergency surgery and was hospitalized overnight.
Two employees were working in an excavation placing concrete with a bucket attached to an excavator when the bucket fell from the excavator, striking both of them.
An employee was thrown from an ATV and sustained two cracked vertebrate and three broken ribs.
An employee was deep cleaning a classroom when he slipped on the wet floor and fractured the right hip.
An employee was exiting the forklift truck when he slipped and fell to the ground. The operator suffered a broken femur and was admitted to the local hospital.
An employee amputated the left ring finger while operating a cleat maker machine.
On May 26, 2015, the employee was delivering mail on his route when he collapsed.
An employee was standing at a forklift removing the propane tank when a front-end loader backed into him.  His hip and back were crushed and he was hospitalized.

The injured employee was about to start loading a truck from the mattress staging area which was approximately 7'.  The mattress was standing upright and lined up to form a wall to be loaded onto the truck.  As the injured employee step out of the staging area (blind spot), another associate operating the forklift, could not stop in time and ran over the injured employee's left foot.
An employee walking from the deli department slipped on a piece of lunch meat and fell, fracturing her hip and femur.
On or about May 26, 2015, an employee was hospitalized when struck-by steel angle iron material on a crane.
An employee was shot by a customer while working.

An employee was setting up the in-line vacuum forming machine line. The guard was off at the time of the incident and the interlock held down with a clamp. At the trim press stage, the employee came in contact with the steel rule die and amputated the index and middle fingers on the right hand.

The employee, a rural mail carrier, observed a pick-up truck traveling towards her at a high rate of speed and possibly out of control. She was operating a personal vehicle, and pulled over to avoid the pick-up. The pick-up truck struck the employee's vehicle causing the air bags to deploy. The employee suffered broken ribs.

An employee was standing on a stock picker loading freight onto a pallet when he slipped and fell approximately seven feet injuring both wrists, an eye, and his neck and head. The employee was not wearing a harness at the time of the incident.
An employee was changing out a coil using an indoor crane and rigging chain. His hand was caught  between the coil and rigging chain amputating his right index finger.
An employee was climbing up a ladder and slipped and fell onto his ankle. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was retrieving bolts from a cardboard box onsite when he was bitten on his right hand middle finger by a copper head snake that was in the box. The employee had a reaction to the anti-venom and was hospitalized.

A housekeeping employee received an eye injury while mopping the floors.  The employee had placed the mop in the bucket and turned away.  While the employee was turning back around to get the mop, the handle slipped from its original position and struck the employee in the eye.

On or about May 26, 2015, at 1:30 am, an employee was removing a half barrel keg from a second layer.  The keg, weighing approximately 175 pounds, fell approximately 3 1/2' hitting the employee's foot/toe.  The foot became swollen and the employee had surgery on the foot and was subsequently hospitalized.
An employee was adjusting the rail on a bed and caught his left pinky finger in the rail.  The fingertip was amputated.
An employee was delivering mail when the employee felt knee pain. The employee was admitted to the hospital due to a knee injury that is resulting in surgery.

An employee was making an adjustment on KVAL door manufacturing equipment during which time his hand slipped off of a wrench and came in contact with the rotating, boring bit, causing the loss of skin and a bone on the back of his hand.
An employee operating a runner injured his left foot while making a U turn.
An employee was struck by fragmented pieces of a grinding disk and was hospitalized as a result.

An employee fell from an access platform behind the cab of the truck, falling approximately 3ft onto the pavement and breaking his right femur. The employee was admitted to hospital for treatment of his injuries.
An employee lacerated his right hand and was hospitalized.

An employee was adjusting a belt on an HVAC compressor. The pulley kicked on and the speed of the belt injured the employee, resulting in fingertip amputations on the index and middle fingers of the left hand.

An employee was working in the back room doing salad prep.  While sweeping up lettuce from the floor, the employee bent down to pick something up and tripped on a drain cover in the floor. This caused the employee to fall and fracture the left femur. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.

An employee was working on a pallet dismantler machine when his right hand was caught in the  machine while removing a piece of wood that was causing a jam.  The tip of the employee's right thumb was amputated as a result.
The employee slipped and fell on the way into work. The employee was admitted to the hospital and had surgery for a fractured left femur.
An employee experienced an amputation injury around 10:50 A.M. on 5/26/2015.
An employee slipped and fell to the ground while accessing a loader. The employee broke his collar bone.
An employee was removing material from the attic of the church and fell approximately eight feet through a section of the ceiling landing on the floor.
An employee injured the right ankle while exiting a stall in the restroom.  The employee required surgery and hospitalization as a result.

An employee working as a loader at the warehouse and was cleaning the bottle rack located outdoors when a venomous snake, believed to be a Copperhead, bit the employee's right index finger. The employee was admitted to the hospital for treatment.
An employee suffered the amputation of the right pinky fingertip while trying to secure an access panel that guards a rotating auger.
An employee was lifting a battery and suffered a hernia.  The employee was taken to the hospital and kept for surgery.
An employee was operating a Lectro P.I.V. and struck a PCA air handler while in route to meet a flight.  The employee suffered a lacerated liver, chipped vertebra, and bubbles in the intestine.

An employee was lifting a lid on a tumbler vat that hinged at the bottom and swung downward. The employee was using a chain to lift the lid and the chain slipped catching the employee's left ring finger, removing the fingernail and underlying skin.

A temporary employee was loading an aluminum casting onto a CNC fixture. She placed her hand on the casting to hold it in place until the clamp locked. The clamp grabbed her right glove, smashing her thumb.
A residential trash collection employee was hospitalized after succumbing to dehydration and heat cramps.

An employee was sorting parts in the parking lot when a semi-truck owned and operated by the employer backed into him, causing a right leg laceration and fracture. The employee was taken to the hospital and admitted overnight for observation.

The employee was on site in Claremont, FL taking down a scaffold and moving material. He complained to the site supervisor that he was not feeling well. The employee began to cramp after sitting down and drinking some water. The employee was taken to the hospital and admitted overnight for observation and IV fluids.
An employee performing diagnostic tests on a crane fell approximately 7.5 feet through an open hatch and was hospitalized.
On or about 05/27/2015 an employee came into contact with an energized cable.

On May 27, 2015 at approximately 1:30 p.m., an employee received 2nd and 3rd degree electrical burns to approximately 55% of his body when a crane boom contacted overhead power lines and the employee came in contact with the crane.

An employee was working to remove a tire from a trailer at the trailer shop on the south side of the property. The tire exploded and caused a second tire to hit him. The employee suffered multiple fractures in his leg, neck, and ribs.
An employee received an amputation of the right hand while operating a mechanical power press.
On May 27, 2015 at 14:30 the employee amputated four fingers (all except the thumb) on his right hand while operating a press brake machine.

A temporary employee was setting up a precast form onsite. The employee was attempting to insert a safety pin into the precast form bracket. As he was inserting the pin, his left middle finger was caught between the form and the bracket which crushed/pinched the tip of employee's finger. There was no bone loss; only skin and finger nail.
An employee was removing a section of pipe when the wrench slipped and the employee fell backwards breaking his right leg just above the ankle.
An employee fell from a ladder.
Employee was driving a mini bus in San Antonio City and was involved in a head on collision. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery to treat a laceration to right eye.
An employee slipped off a scaffold that was 45 feet high while hanging curtains from the ceiling of the sanctuary on 5/27/2015 at 8:35pm.

An employee removed a guard on the ST04 to clear a jam in the packaging film.  After clearing the jam, the employee removed meat from the pockets to be rerun.  The employee reached in the seal head area which had a sensor that triggered the lift to raise the form box to the seal head.  The employee's left hand was caught between the seal head and the form box.  The employee sustained third degree burns to the top of their left hand and two broken fingers.

An employee was operating a fastener tool. While checking the tightness of bolts, he lost balance and pinched his right hand pinky finger between the fastener tool and the wall. Employee suffered an open fracture of the right hand pinky finger and was hospitalized.
An employee cut the tip of the finger off using a paper cutter.
An employee was bitten by an insect while cleaning and the employee was allergic to the insect; the employee was taken to the hospital.

The employee was installing plastic electrical conduit onsite. The circuit was energized from a 7200 volt transformer located near the sidewalk. When the employee attempted to connect the conduit to the transformer, his right bicep contacted the transformer. The employee was on his knees when he received the electrical shock and he fell backwards and/or collapsed. He was admitted to the hospital on 5/28/2015 at or around 4:30 p.m. and treated for burns received from the electrical shock.
An employee was putting out a fire that occurred in an auto body paint booth and fell, shattering the right elbow. The employee also suffered burns to the arm and torso.
An employee experienced a left thumb amputation when it was caught in a foam machine auger.

On the morning of 5/27/2015, an employee was bitten on the right hand by a stray cat while on break in the dock area of the plant.  Later that night his right hand and arm were swollen and he was in pain.  He was admitted to the hospital overnight for treatment.
Two employees were engaged in a physical altercation and one employee was knocked unconscious, resulting in a hospitalization.

An employee brushing walls with a masonry brush near the northwest corner stairway attempted to step from a step ladder onto a scaffold resulting in a fall.  The employee was admitted into the hospital with a collapsed lung.

An employee crushed his left ring and middle fingers while flipping material that was going to be machined into a holding plate fixture.  The 280 pound material was on a sling using a basket configuration in which the sling had two holes attached to the 5-ton crane. His fingers were crushed between the material and the work table resulting in the amputation of the fingertip of the ring finger above the knuckle.

An employee was on the ground with a power unit. Another employee was backing up the tug to hook up to the ground power unit.  The employee backing up the tug hit the gas and pinned the injured employee between the tug and the ground power unit.

An employee suffered a broken wrist as he attempted to close a container door while sitting on a forklift. The employee's wrist was caught between the door of the container and the cage of the forklift.

Employees were unloading the BOP from the trailer to start nippling up. The injured employee was assisting in the lift and had his hand on one of the cables. His gloved hand was pulled into a pulley when the BOP shifted, resulting in the amputation of the middle fingertip on his right hand.
An employee was attempting to realign a part in the rotary stencil machine when he amputated the left index finger.

A temporary labor employee was using a grinder outfitted with a cutting wheel to cut metal truss material for the roofers. The employee's glove was caught by the spinning cutting wheel drawing the employee's hand into the cutting blade. The employee suffered lacerations to the wrist and hand area. The employee was sent to the hospital where he was admitted.

An employee was working on a lawn mower on a mower jack with the safety device on. The employee grabbed the safety device and pulled it out causing the lawn mower and jack to lower, catching his left ring finger under the jack. The fingertip was amputated.
An employee was removing a brace from a forklift when the brace fell and severed his left middle fingertip.
A driver was attempting to deliver packages to a private residence when he was attacked by two pit bulls. The driver sustained injuries to the arm and foot.
A propane delivery driver received burns to the face and neck after the relief valve on an underground tank failed spraying propane on the driver.
On or about May 28, 2015, an employee's left index finger was amputated when it was caught in the cutter bar while setting up a pneumatic cutter.

An employee was operating a front end loader to load solid waste/refuse into trucks.  The employee parked the front end loader parallel to a concrete wall.  The employee exited the loader by stepping from the loader onto the concrete wall. The employee slipped off the concrete wall and fell to the ground.  The employee suffered a laceration on the right side of his head, and dislocated his right shoulder.  The employee was hospitalized for surgery to repair his dislocated right shoulder.
An employee suffered second degree burns to the right arm and leg while unclogging a hot wax line. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee working at the register tripped over a gator cord and fell breaking the left knee.
An employee was changing the grinding stone on the grinding  wheel when the grinder came on and the stone broke striking the employee. The employee had surgery for internal injuries.
An employee was injured after falling off a step ladder.
An employee was using a saw to cut vinyl extrusions and cut his right hand across the knuckles.
An employee reached into a crimping machine to unjam product prior to the machine cycling back around to crimp the product and sustained a right index fingertip amputation.
An employee closed a safe door on her thumb, amputating it.

An employee walking across the work room floor became tangled in plastic shipping straps used to hold boxes on a pallet and fell on the right knee.  The employee was admitted to the hospital for knee surgery.
An employee was removing a part in a metal stamping die press and once the part was dislodged, it fell onto the employee's left ring finger causing a fingertip amputation.

An employee was inspecting a manhole vault at the intersection of Lyman Street and Centre Street in Newton, Massachusetts. As he transitioned from an extension ladder to the ground level, he fell approximately 11 feet, 7 inches, back into the manhole vault, breaking his right ankle and requiring hospitalization.
The driver of an asphalt truck hit the overpass of a bridge.

An employee was unloading a trainer (similar in appearance to a tool box on wheels) from a crate to prepare the crate for repair. As the trainer was being rolled down the built-in ramp using a winch, it started to tip off of the side. The employee attempted to prevent the trainer from falling on its side, resulting in the trainer striking the employee's leg. The employee was hospitalized.
Employee strained his back when he was pulling the gas trap lid with his hands.
On or about May 28, 2015, an employee was working on line 1 and suffered a pinky and ring finger amputation injury by coming in contact with a rotating screw auger on the conveyor.

While delivering mail to a private residence, a mail carrier was attacked by a resident's dog.  The carrier received 3 puncture wounds to the arm.  She received treatment the day of the event.  She went to a specialist the next day who admitted her to the hospital.

An employee was struck in the leg by a falling cover to a 55 gallon drum while working in the cover painting area. The employee received a laceration. Later, the employee was hospitalized when the laceration became infected.

An agent was climbing a fence to inspect an abandoned house for illegal aliens when he was attacked by a dog.  The agent fell off the fence striking his head and possibly receiving a concussion due to his inability to remember any details of the event.

An employee was helping to lower a template that was being suspended by a crane when his right thumb got caught between the template and one of its folding parts. He was taken to the hospital for surgery to repair a broken thumb.
An employee had a finger amputation while being trained to run a gas house piston.
The employee, operating a company vehicle, was involved in a two car accident at an intersection.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was adjusting belts on the #130 rotary die cutter machine, when a gloved hand was pulled into the rollers breaking two bones in the right forearm.
An employee was injured while being transported in a personnel basket by a crane.
An employee was replacing a coil. The coil fell and the employee attempted to catch it. The coil lacerated his left hand.

On May 28, 2015, a truck driver entered the scale platform from the opposite direction of its designed use.  The scale platform was designed with a walking surface on the driver's side and a guardrail on the passenger side.  The driver exited his truck and stepped onto the top rail of the guardrail system.  It was raining at the time.  The driver slipped and fell to the ground.  The driver experience a compound fracture to his left arm.  The driver was taken to the hospital, treated, and released the day of the accident.
An employee operating a table saw amputated the middle fingertip (down to the nail bed). The table saw was guarded at the time of the incident.

At approximately 7:00 am on May 28th, the employee (a choker setter) was unhooking the choker while another employee was felling a tree below. The tree fell hitting the skyline which ejected trees and the employee into the air. The employee sustained a broken left tibia and fibula when struck by the tree upon hitting the ground.
An employee fell approximately 12 feet, suffering broken ribs and a collapsed lung.
An employee experienced breathing problems and head pain, possibly related to a previous injury. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee got caught between a dump truck and bailer belt while trying to clean debris from the bailer. The employee sustained rib and lung injuries.
An employee standing on the second floor of the building fell approximately 10 feet to the floor below, injuring his left arm. He was hospitalized and underwent surgery.

An employee was cleaning the laydown saw table (located at 5225 N. Broadway). The saw blade caught the employee's glove and pulled it into the saw, amputating portions of the right ring and pinky fingers.

An employee sustained an abrasion to his head and right hand when he tripped over a pallet while attempting to move a sofa in the warehouse on 5/29/15. He was hospitalized for an infection related to the hand laceration.
An employee's left hand got caught between two sheeter rollers when she lifted the guard to adjust the rolls. She did not break any bones, but was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee accidentally hooked up a 55 gallon drum of solvent instead of a 55 gallon drum of waste water to the evaporative machine to perform cleaning operations.  The machine caught on fire on the inside and then created a flash fire on the outside which caused 2nd and 3rd degree burns to both hands and legs of the employee.
An employee was struck on the hand by a piece of concrete that fell from the ceiling while sweeping the floor. The employee suffered a partial amputation to the left ring finger.

An employee was attending training and started feeling queasy/lightheaded during the module on blood-borne pathogens. He left the room and sat in the northeast stairway.  A short time later, he fell down the stairs and was found unconscious on the landing below by a coworker. His coworker woke him up and asked if he was okay. The injured employee stated that he was okay, just tired. He was later hospitalized for a skull fracture and concussion.
An employee was struck by a steel beam that fell off of a pallet when it was moved.

An employee was placing, compressing, and bolting together large 6x6 or 8x8 cut lumber. The employee's right hand was between two of the boards when the compression began, resulting in a severe crush and subsequent amputation to the second digit of the right pinky.

An employee was working on the bubble-leak tester machine. The employee placed a part inside the machine and engaged it. The machine lowered the part into a water bath and then raised it. As the part lifted, it smashed the employee's middle finger, resulting in an amputation. The machine was not guarded at the time.
A maintenance employee cleaning out a machine motor sustained left forearm lacerations when his hand slipped while trying to stand up.

An employee was transporting boxes of chicken tenders with a pallet jack. The load shifted and pinned the employee's finger between a stainless steel table and the pallet jack handle, amputating the top end of the right thumb.
An employee fell approximately 4.5 feet from a scaffold while installing ceiling material.
An employee pinched two left-hand fingers between the mast and hoist of a moving lift jockey. He was hospitalized and underwent surgery.

An employee used his hand and arm to try to stop a swinging piece of equipment he was moving with an overhead crane. The equipment struck the employee's arm against a guard rail, resulting in a fracture.

An employee took a nap in his pickup truck in the shipyard parking lot because he felt sick. Coworkers found him on the ground next to his truck. He was subsequently hospitalized with a fractured C2-vertebra in his neck.
An employee was injured in a motor vehicle accident while performing work related duties.
An employee was struck in the head while carrying demolition out of a warehouse building.
An employee suffered 2nd and 3rd degree burns on the  right hand while working on a yarn roller which required hospitalization.

An employee was trimming weeds with a gas powered trimmer near a cement culvert.  The employee noticed a small branch resting in the culvert and tried to reach for it.  The employee slipped and fell approximately ten feet. The employee did not have anything in his hand at the time of the accident.

An employee was working from a scissor lift. A bracket had been removed, and he stepped back and fell from the platform onto his back. He broke three ribs, ruptured his spleen, and fractured three vertebrae. He was hospitalized and had surgery on his ruptured spleen.

An employee was engaged in hands-on training on a side-oriented forklift, observed by a trainer/coach. She pulled down a load from a rack and was preparing to set it on the floor. She moved too close to the rack and her trainer directed her to stop and move to the center of the aisle. She stopped the forklift and had her foot on the pedal with the wheels turned. She intended to move forward, but instead reversed. The forklift swung around 180 degrees, reversed, and went partially under the rack. She hit her back on the rack and stopped the forklift. She was held between the rack and the forklift steering wheel, with her foot on the pedal.  The coach/trainer reached the forklift pedal and joystick from the ground and maneuvered the forklift forward. He helped her down and laid her on the floor. She was hospitalized overnight for lumbar fracture pain management.

On the morning of 5/29/2015, employee arrived at work at 6:00 am.  At about 6:05 he was securing a line to roll a cover on a barge. The hook somehow dislodged and became airborne striking the employee in his left upper arm. The hook was 4" and weighed approximately 3 pounds. The cover of the barge became wedged and put tension on the line and then the hook became dislodged striking the employee.

An employee was installing/performing work on an HVAC system and had to enter the attic for an undetermined amount of time. The employee came down into the lobby of the facility where work was being performed, collapsed, and lost consciousness.
An employee suffered a partial finger amputation while using a cutting machine.
An employee was climbing down the fixed ladder, slipped on the front loader's tire and fell 3.5 feet to the ground. The employee was admitted to the hospital with a broken right hip.
An employee was walking when he tripped over the forks of a forklift and fell on his face.
An employee was performing maintenance work on an MRI machine. He had to cross electrical points, and received a discharge burn on his right hand and arm.
While standing and talking, an employee's foot slipped off of the edge of the sidewalk. He fell into the parking lot, breaking his right femur and hip.
An employee suffered a leg injury after being pinned between a concrete form and a concrete truck at or near 25 Airport Road in Minot, North Dakota.
On 06/29/2015, at approximately 3:00 p.m., an employee slipped in the kitchen area, fracturing the lower left leg while placing dishes in the dish rack. The employee was hospitalized.

On May 29, 2015, an employee was working inside a sulpha treat reactor vessel using a high pressure (5000 PSI) water sprayer gun to cut off the congealed catalyst material inside. The employee slipped and fell; the high-pressure water sprayer hit the employee's right foot and punctured a hole through the rubber boot. The employee sustained a puncture open wound on the right foot, second toe. The employee was hospitalized and received treatment.
An employee was burned by an arc flash/blast while troubleshooting an electrical problem.
An employee tripped over a box that was next to her desk. She was hospitalized and underwent surgery for a fractured elbow.
An employee suffered a fractured leg after getting pinned between a semi truck and a tank at or near 58th Street NW in Williston, North Dakota.

An employee suffered an amputation to the right-hand index finger and an injury to the left-hand middle finger when a light curtain failed to protect the point of operation from a press in the manufacturing operation.
An employee sustained a partial amputation while bundling steel.

Employees were removing a drill pin from the drill rig equipment when an employee stuck his left hand in the metal mold. He sustained an amputation to his left index finger and middle finger behind the fingernail.
An employee suffered a crushed-by-type injury while preparing to perform cleaning operations on the fabric calendar line.
An employee slipped and fell while descending the mezzanine work area using a stairway with metal rungs for steps, breaking two ribs.
An employee turned to get a pack of cigarettes and fell, breaking her hip.
An employee was operating a band saw when the saw bound up on him, kicked back, and pulled his hand into the blade, amputating his left-hand, first thumb digit.
A employee was injured after falling into an unfilled pool. He experienced back and neck pain.
A forklift carrying a tote inside a box truck crushed an employee between the tote and the truck wall.

On or about 5/30/15, an employee was bitten by a mosquito while conducting lab work outdoors on Wallops Island in Virginia. The employee was later hospitalized. The mosquito may have been infected with the West Nile virus.

An employee was cleaning the disk of a tractor used for tomato-growing operations with a rag when an insect bit him on his left leg on 5/26/2015. He was later hospitalized when the bite became infected.
An employee tripped and fell, dropped his hose, and sandblasted his own stomach while sandblasting a fuel tank.
A mask machine cut an employee's finger. The guard was removed at the time of the incident.
An employee was performing maintenance on a crane when it fell on the employee.

An employee was loading equipment and tools onto a truck to prepare to leave a well site. The employee was standing on a lubricator rack/catwalk where he was releasing the straps on the crane when the catwalk collapsed. The employee fell approximately 5 feet to the truck below and hit his head. He was hospitalized.

An employee was injured while talking a resident down from a ladder. The individual had secured a butter knife to remove the cover off of a light bulb. The employee was slashed in the eye by the butter knife and required surgery.
An employee held a beam while driving a forklift in the warehouse. He lost control and injured his left hand.

A Santana Textiles employee was working from a ladder when he slipped and fell 4 feet. He tried to grab onto the wall and fell, fracturing his left arm and scraping his forehead. The worksite was very muddy from recent rains at the time of the incident.
A spider bit an employee under the right arm while the employee was setting up a display booth. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was taking apart a cylinder from a Clovis Machine.  The cylinder fell and caught the employee's left middle finger between the cylinder and the work table.
An employee was working on an elevator when it suddenly started to go up. The employee was lifted 12 feet and fell over the guard rail.
A projectile from a CO2 compressor valve struck an employee in the face during maintenance.
An employee was hospitalized after being involved in a rollover accident while riding as a passenger in an ATV. He injured his right knee and required surgery.
An employee was struck by a semi-truck while walking to his vehicle in the parking lot.

On or about 1300 hrs on 31 May 2015, a One Source Industrial Services employee was hospitalized when the employee's vehicle overturned on CR 5000 in Andrews County, Texas. The incident occurred as the employee attempted to turn onto CR 5000. The employee lost control of the vehicle, causing it to overturn and resulting in a broken arm, bruised ribs, and a possible concussion.

An employee was setting up Planer #2, a wood cutting machine, to cut lumber. He dropped his wrench in the machine, which was running at the time. As he reached in to retrieve his wrench, his hand got caught in the roller and the other moving parts, peeling the skin from his right hand and three middle fingers.
An employee reached his hand into the swage/crimp machine and suffered a right index fingertip amputation. The machine was running at the time of the incident.
An employee was hospitalized after hitting his head on the edge of an escalator pit and possibly contacting live electrical parts.
An employee fell to the ground while climbing down from a scaffold.
An employee fractured the right foot while changing the battery in a stand-up electric forklift.
On or about June 1, 2015, an employee was injured and hospitalized while performing pipe cleaning duties and tasks.
An employee lacerated his left forearm from the elbow to the wrist on a dovetail anchor as he poured concrete in formwork. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was performing maintenance on the C-Spinning machine when his left hand got caught in the clamp, amputating his left thumb tip.
An employee received a partial finger amputation after his finger got caught in a chain that was lifting a fuel barrel.

An employee was standing on the fifth rung of an A-step ladder while installing a piece of plywood to the ceiling. The plywood slipped off his hands and pushed him back, causing him to lose his balance and fall on the ground. He broke the lower portion of his right leg.

An employee was placing material inside a drill press when the press came down and caught his right glove. The distal half of his right thumb was amputated at the middle joint. He was hospitalized and received treatment.

An employee was in the break room when a car from the public roadway crashed into the store. The employee was thrown 10 feet across the building and was struck with materials. She was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was taking HVAC equipment to the dumpster and was helping to slide the ducts off the forklift forks. His hand got caught when the duct work slid backwards on the forks, amputating his right thumb tip.
An employee had three fingers crushed/amputated while he was loading a part into a CNC machine with another employee.
An employee severely lacerated the palm of his hand after coming into contact with a chipper blade. The chipper was not running at the time.
An employee was operating a forklift with their foot hanging outside of the equipment. The employee's foot got smashed between two forklifts.
An employee fell to the dock floor and fractured his left elbow during delivery at the VA Hospital in East Orange, New Jersey.
An employee's finger got caught in the manual bender machine while loading a pipe, amputating the right ring fingertip.
An employee was hospitalized after they missed a step while dismounting a bulk semi-trailer. The employee fell 2 to 2.5 feet to the ground, fracturing their right hip.
An employee was removing roof debris from the gutter of a residential house while standing on an extension ladder. As he reached his hand to remove debris, he fell off the ladder and hit the ground.
An employee's hand was resting on a dock plate. The dock plate shifted and amputated the employee's fingertip.

On June 1, 2015, at 10:00 a.m., an employee was moving a 160-pound steel die along a roller conveyor when his finger got caught between the die and a conveyor roller, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee's right index fingertip was amputated after it was caught in a pinch point between a rotating auger blade and the blade's enclosure fixture.

A maintenance employee was installing a lacing wire to the support that runs underneath the floor.  He stepped on the floor tile he had removed, then slipped and hit his head against the tile cross support beam. He injured his head, right shoulder, right wrist, right ankle, and back.
An employee suffered left arm swelling after a suspected insect bite and was later hospitalized for treatment.
Rotating shaft, caught-in hazard located in the bakery section. The hazard was located at the conveyors.
An employee caught the edge of a pallet with his right foot and dislocated his ankle.
An employee's right thumb was partially amputated after a collision that occurred while he was operating a motorized pallet jack.
An employee slipped and fell on a floor that was wet with wax stripper. The employee lost consciousness and sustained a concussion and head lacerations.

An electrical contractor was installing a 480 volt electrical panel at a customer location. The employee pulled wires to the panel the day before the accident, but did not finish the job. When he returned to the facility the next day, he got on a ladder and touched the panel that he thought was cold. At some point between the time he left the panel and returned to finish the job the wires were energized. The employee was shocked and thrown from the ladder. He received burns on his hands and was admitted to the hospital.

On June 2, 2015 an employee was working on an automotive strut. A spring released and penetrated his left hand. The employee was transported to the hospital where surgery was performed to remove the spring from his hand.

An employee sustained middle finger debriding on the left hand when he was engaged in changing the belt between the motor and the gearbox on the log deck and the belt became energized.  Lockout procedures were not initiated prior to maintenance work being conducted.  The employee was taken to the hospital and admitted for surgery to reattach skin.

The employee was leaving the church building and walking within the courtyard.  The employee lost balance and fell on the lawn.  The fall resulted in a fracture of the right arm and the employee was hospitalized.
On or about June 2, 2015, an employee performing maintenance on the EMBA machine injured the left hand when it was pinched between a belt and a cylinder on the machine.
An employee drove a forklift into a freezer trailer. The forks got caught on a floor plate, jarring the forklift. The employee's neck was injured.
A guide was back-country skiing with a client and fell, sustaining serious injuries.
An employee was filling a tire from a piece of farm equipment when the bead broke causing the tire to explode. The employee suffered two broken arms and facial injuries.

While removing and replacing worn wire rope on a hydraulic tugger winch, the injured employee's left foot was caught in the wire rope while the drum was rotating.   The employee was hospitalized and had toes on his left foot amputated.
An employee got her right hand caught in a belt conveyor and received lacerations on the index and middle finger.

A materials delivery truck got stuck in mud. Employees planned on using a loader to pull it out. While in the process of hooking the back of the loader to the delivery truck, the loader rolled backwards and pinched the injured employee between the truck and the loader.
An employee reached into a conveyor to remove a bag that was tipped. His hand got caught in the chain conveyor, resulting in hospitalization.
On or about June 2, 2015, a temporary employee working in the facility was hospitalized after cutting the left hand on a table saw.
On or about June 2, 2015, a forklift's forks dropped unexpectedly, pinning an employee's wrist between the forks of the forklift and the post support.
An employee was descending a ladder when he slipped and fell approximately 8 feet to the ground.
An employee's right index finger was amputated at the second knuckle as the employee adjusted a drive belt that was slipping.

On or about 0530 hrs on the 2nd day of June 2015, an employee was injured when the vehicle he was driving overturned on a lease road approximately five miles east of Mentone Texas. The employee was hospitalized with three broken ribs on the right side of the thorax and a broken rib on the left side of the thorax.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while using a table saw to perform carpentry work.

An employee was inspecting airport contractor equipment for unattended mail.  She heard a noise behind her; she then tripped and fell over the connecting tongue of one of the carts. When she fell to the ground, her left knee cap was broken on impact. She was hospitalized.
An employee was injured after being struck by a powered industrial truck.
An employee sustained a left ring finger amputation while attempting to clear a bind in a reel of electrical cable.

An employee was working on a trailer door and pinched the end of his finger in between two of the panels of the trailer door, amputating the tip of his right ring finger.  The employee took the clamp off the track before attaching a horizontal bracket.  After removing the bracket the employee was unable to hold the door while trying to retrieve a ladder.

An employee was delivering product(chem treat bel1544) to a customer location using a tanker truck. The employee  removed a cap to the discharge line and the chemical sprayed onto his face. As a consequence, the employee had 2nd degree burns in the mouth lips and tip of his tongue. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee fell to the ground from approximately 10 to 12 feet while descending a tree.  The employee broke his left tibia and was admitted as an in-patient at a hospital.
An employee fell 15 feet to  the ground from a walking surface on a section of scaffolding.
On June 2, 2015, an employee was struck by an 18-wheeler truck while flagging traffic on the highway. The employee was hospitalized for multiple injuries.
On June 2, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation to the right index finger while attempting to unjam a pallet washer. Lockout/tagout procedures were not performed at the time of the incident.
An employee was loading a duct jack in a pickup truck with other employees when he slipped and got caught on the truck's tailgate, injuring his right shin/leg. He was hospitalized.

An employee was swinging a sledgehammer to knock pins out of aluminum sows and smashed his left hand pointer finger in the process. The employee was taken to the hospital where it was determined that the finger needed to be amputated.
An employee was using Gatorade bottles to store floor cleaning products.  The employee mistakenly drank the floor cleaner, became very ill, and was hospitalized.
An employee was trying to adjust the belt on a folding machine when his right hand was drawn into the machine. The employees hand was caught (pinched) between two rollers.
An employee was polishing a tool on a polishing lathe when a finger slipped inward resulting in a right index finger injury. The finger was amputated below the first knuckle at the hospital.
An employee suffered an amputation injury while putting parts into a jig at or near 210 First Avenue NE, North Dakota.
An employee was injured and then hospitalized after receiving a wound from a hole punch from a trim press.

An employee was cleaning three different facilities and using a vehicle to get between buildings. She was exiting the vehicle at one of the buildings and fell, striking the curb and fracturing her hip.

On 06/03/2015, around 2:00 P.M., an employee was wearing rubber gloves while handling adhesives in the facility. The employee finished handling the adhesives and went to cut metal pipe banding. As the metal banding was cut, it retracted to the floor and bounced up, cutting the employee at the knuckle on the right middle finger. Company-provided leather gloves were not worn at the time of the incident. The employee was later hospitalized for a possible infection and received antibiotics.

On or about 3 June 2015, at approximately 1825 hours, an AR Daniel Construction employee was hospitalized due to an injury acquired at the jobsite. The employee was working in a trench under the railroad tracks located at Grand and 3rd street in Amarillo, Texas, when he was struck in the face by a piece of angle iron that was being used to hoist the pipeline that he was working near. The angle iron was inside the pipe, and a line was tied to the angle iron to hoist the pipe up enough for the employee to remove wood planking from underneath it. The angle iron became dislodged and struck him, causing multiple facial fractures and lacerations.
An employee was moving sows to an open pen when the right middle finger was caught in the pen gate or locking pin for the gate causing an amputation.
An employee tripped over a computer cord and fell resulting in a fractured patella and right ankle.
Employee lost balance with a leg by the conveyor and sustained a left ankle laceration.

On or about 3 June 2015 at 0715 hrs an employee suffered an amputation of the distal portion of his middle phalanges left hand. The employee was attempting to replace a flange when the flange slipped and pinched his phalanges between it and the structure he was placing the flange on.
An employee operating a PIV(tugger) pinched a finger between the light beacon post on the tugger and a rack, resulting in an amputation of the left middle fingertip.
A worker was disposing of waste into a foot-operated receptacle when the employee fell while using her foot to operate the foot pedal and broke her leg.

An employee working in the prepared food area was rolling a cart loaded with food from a walk-in cooler when the cart tipped over and landed on her left leg fracturing it in multiple places. She was hospitalized for surgery to repair the injuries to her leg.
An employee walking towards the barbecue pit to retrieve a chicken fell and broke his right leg requiring surgery to repair.
An employee was searching for the weld in the wire and suffered an amputation to the right index fingertip when the finger was pinched by the wire annealing machine.

An employee was performing maintenance on a compressor fan and suffered an amputation to the tip of the fourth digit (ring finger) of the left hand when the finger came into contact with the fan blade.

On June 3, at 7:25 PM, an employee disarmed an alarming crash bar; while returning to her desk, she fell to the ground. She hit her left hip, and her left leg gave out and got twisted. She was hospitalized for a fractured hip.

The employee was hooking up the trailer dolly to the trailer. A pin on the dolly had fallen down and the employee reached down to correct the pin. The dolly was still moving and pinned his fingers between the I-ring of the dolly and the trailer hitch. The employee's first digit of his right pinky finger was amputated.

A worker was erecting a one section high rolling scaffold.  He was approximately 5-6 feet off the ground on the platform when the end frame detached while he was trying to install a cross brace. The worker fell and the frame struck his leg.

An employee was working as a laborer on a road paving jobsite when his lower left leg was run over by a tire on a Weber machine, which picks up ground-up road surface material and transfers it to a conveyer belt that drops the material into a paver machine.
An employee fell on the same surface while moving a box of fruit and broke a leg.
An employee tripped over a piece of protruding rebar and fell to the ground.

A border patrol officer was at the gun range working on his annual weapon qualifications.  The officer was drawing and firing his gun from the holster. The weapon discharged as he pulled it out, hitting him in the leg and striking a bone. The officer was admitted to the hospital where they performed surgery.
On or about 6/3/2015, an employee was walking on site carrying equipment for testing. He slipped on gravel and fell while trying to grab the equipment, severing his right thumb.

On the afternoon of 6/03/2015, at approximately 1:20pm, the employee was attempting to load a coil of steel that weighted approximately 378 pounds onto a forklift.  The steel coils are stored in a rack that resembles a bicycle rack.  She went to turn the coil away from the rack so that it could be picked up by the forklift.  She lost control of the steel coil, it tipped over, and struck her right upper leg resulting in a broken bone. She was admitted to the hospital for surgery on 6/04/2015.

An employee was treated at the hospital after falling approximately 5 feet to the concrete floor below while descending nine-foot portable stairs. The employee tore his rotator cuff and received stitches to his left elbow. The employee was attempting to dislodge a chain attached to an overhead crane at the time of the incident. The employee was unloading wire mesh from a delivery truck in the Blue Building garage door area.

The employee was working on the sausage line and caught his finger in the machine while he was trying to remove a piece of hanging sausage.  The incident resulted in the amputation of the third and fourth digit on the right hand.

An employee was moving a pallet of parts down a ramp into the basement using a non-powered pallet jack when the load got away and pinned the employee between the pallet jack and the wall breaking the employee's fibula and tibia.  The employee required surgery to repair the fractures.

An employee arriving for work was walking from her car to the store. While in the crosswalk in front of the main doors, she was struck by a customer's vehicle at around 8:00 p.m. resulting in a loss of consciousness.

An employee was employed as a tour guide for this steel mill facility.  He was giving a tour and was walking down a two step set of stairs when he missed the second step and fell to the floor. Later that day he went to the hospital and was admitted for three broken ribs on his left side.

The injured employee and another co-worker were loading a roll of poly with a rod onto the Line 12 packing machine. The rod goes through the center of a poly-roll. The injured employee was setting the rod into the machine and smashed her left index finger between the rod and the packing machine, amputating the left index fingertip.
An employee was hospitalized due to a fall to floor resulting in a head injury.
On or about 6/3/15, an employee had multiple fingertip amputations while assembling a vertical cylinder.
An employee fell from a table and broke his back.
A temporary employee under on-the-job-training in his first day of work had the tip of his left hand middle finger amputated during the operation of a RAS beading machine.

An employee was operating a Yale forklift when he stuck his left hand outside the cab of the forklift. His left hand got caught between the front left vertical member of the forklift's overhead guard system and the metal horizontal rail of an adjacent grading table. He sustained injuries to his left hand, requiring a left thumb amputation at the hospital.

An employee was stocking parts on the second floor of the building. While walking backwards, he lost his footing and began to fall to the ground. As he fell, he extended his left arm to grab hold of something; his arm instead got caught on one of the fenders on the shelf.

On or about June 4, 2015, at 11:15 a.m., an employee was crushed by a core box when the hand truck, which was supported by a bucket, shifted and pushed him over onto his back while he was still holding the box. He fractured his right hip and was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was moving a countertop from a delivery truck. He stepped off the tailgate and lost his footing. The countertop landed on his right pinky finger, resulting in an amputation at the hospital.
An employee's foot got caught under a forklift, requiring overnight hospitalization.
An employee slipped and fell, resulting in head injuries.

An employee was operating an overhead crane with a plat clamp attachment to reposition a 12-inch diameter by 12-foot long rudder stock to its opposite side. The load was out of position at an approximate 75-degree horizontal angle instead of a vertical 90-degree vertical position beneath the crane. The employee was standing to the right of the rudder stock being moved. As the load began to swing away from him, he attempted to control the swinging motion with his left hand.  His left ring finger got pinched between a nearby metal stand and the rudder stock.
An employee's left ring finger was amputated down to the first knuckle from a rotating chain and sprocket.

An employee was hospitalized for a finger injury when her right ring finger was severed at the knuckle and reattached.  Her ring caught on something while she was reaching for an item on a shelving unit.
An employee was replacing a door lock when a rusty screw went into the employee's finger on Thursday, June 4, 2015.
An employee received a head injury after he fell to the floor and struck his head while taping straws to cups.
While cutting a sandblast hose, an employee cut his left forearm with a box cutter.
An employee welding on the hospital roof suffered heat-related symptoms.
An employee was invited into the house by a customer to discuss Brighthouse products and services. The employee was stung on the back of the neck, requiring hospitalization.
While cutting potatoes, an employee amputated two fingers, about 1 centimeter.
An employee was found on the ground next to a milk tanker trailer after possibly falling from the trailer's ladder. The employee was hospitalized for multiple injuries.

An employee struck a wall while parking a stand-up Toyota lift at the end of the shift. The employee's body hit a metal safety suggestion box, fracturing the employee's pelvis. At the time of the incident, the Toyota lift was missing a safety strap that drags on the floor to dissipate static electricity.

On 6/4/2015, at approximately 12:30 a.m., an employee was operating a sheet metal break press and attempting to bend a sheet metal part. He was performing a two-hand operation, holding one piece of metal with both hands. His right hand was on top of the metal, and his pinky fingertip was crushed by the ram as it lowered. There was no guard in place at the time. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was injured when a coil of steel unrolled off of a pallet and struck the employee's left arm.
An employee was struck by an excavator bucket, sustaining compound fractures and broken bones to the leg. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was performing a gaging around, checking outside operating conditions, and inspecting the equipment in the pharmaceutical unit. A pressurized hose connected to a process line and containing a contaminated chemical mixture of nitrogen and hydrochloric acid was nearby. The hose was pressurized but not flowing; it was closed by the valve. The employee was 3 to 5 feet from the hose when it became disconnected. He sustained burns to his abdomen, arm, and face.
An employee was unloading bushes on a truck flatbed when he/she fell approximately 4 feet to the ground below. The employee was hospitalized and required vertebrae surgery.
An employee was "webbing" a printing press when two of the employee's left-hand fingers got pinched by a unit roller.

An employee was attempting to sit on a chair located on a loading dock when he lost his balance and fell backwards off the loading dock, which was 34 inches above the ground below. He broke three ribs, fractured five vertebrae, and ruptured his spleen, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was moving rolling scaffold when the scaffold ran over a hose and tipped. A worker was on the scaffold at the time.
An employee received an arm injury from a wire stripper machine.
An employee was wearing gloves to handle a hot hose to clean out an auger. The gloves snagged on the auger, amputating the left ring fingertip.
An employee was holding on to the exterior top rail of a moving electric man lift with his left hand. The unit hit a horizontal brace, crushing his left-hand ring and pinky fingers.
An employee was replacing a suspension spring on a rig. He had to insert a pin in the spring as he let out the jack. His fingertip got caught.
An employee lost control of a concrete pumping truck, which then rolled down over the hill. He severed his left leg and broke his arm and pelvis.
An employee performing security walks around trucks stepped on uneven ground and fell, fracturing the left femur.
While driving up a ramp, an employee lost control of a stand-up forklift, attempted to step off of the forklift, and was pinned between the lift and the wall.
An employee working in the wheel polishing department suffered an injury, resulting in a left thumb amputation and a left middle finger fracture.

An employee was on a pump jack scaffold installing siding on a residential home using a nail gun. A nail from the gun bounced off the wall and hit the employee in the eye. The nail got stuck in his eye, and he was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was shoveling potatoes into the waste bin on the flavor line when he slipped backwards and struck his head on the concrete floor, getting knocked unconscious. His left foot struck the waste tote, resulting in a sprained ankle.
An employee sustained a fingertip amputation when a manhole caught his finger between the lid and ground.
An employee dropped a grinder screw on the third and fourth metatarsals of his right foot.
An employee stood from a kneeling position; his knees locked, causing him to fall to the floor.
An amputation injury occurred on June 4, 2015, to a temporary employee working in the Forming Department.
On or about June 5, 2015, an employee working with waste cement drums felt light-headed and was hospitalized.
An employee was inspecting a roof when he stumbled and fell 15 feet through a skylight.
An employee exited a vehicle in the Tyco maintenance area and was struck by a Tyco mechanic driving a second vehicle in the area.
An employee bending down to count snow blades was struck by a forklift being reversed by a coworker. The employee's leg got caught in the forklift's wheel well.
An employee experienced a hand injury on or around 6/5/2015 while operating a CNC machine. The machine conveyors were inadequately guarded at the time.
An employee was working on a baker's scaffold located under some pipes. While accessing the scaffold, he hit his head on a pipe and fell approximately 6 feet.
An employee was removing a ladder from the top of a work van when he lost his balance and fell.
An employee was bitten by a cat on her left thumb on Friday, June 5, 2015, at around 10 AM.  The thumb later swelled, requiring hospitalization and antibiotic IV treatment.
An employee slipped and fell on mud while walking on a steel road plate, breaking his hip.

A beam was being loaded onto a flatbed truck. When the beam was being placed onto the flatbed, the wood and entire deck collapsed, causing the beam to shift. The concrete fell on the employee's left small toe; surgery had to be performed.
An employee dropped steel he was carrying. The steel struck the employee's left bicep, cutting an artery. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery to repair the artery.
An employee slipped on a wet floor and received knee injuries.

An employee was pulled off of the drill floor by a tugger line. The employee was standing behind a safety gate holding the hoist line to put tension on it so it would not get tangled in the hoist drum. Something made the line jerk; the employee did not let go and was pulled over the safety gate, sliding down what the employer called a beaver slide. He was hospitalized to repair his badly damaged hand. He also had 23 stitches put in his head and three fractured vertebrae.
An employee driving a forklift sustained a crushed finger/partial amputation when the employee's finger got caught between the forklift and a storage rack.
An employee was shutting down a piece of equipment when his fingertip got caught in a pulley.  The employee received a partial amputation of the right middle finger.
An employee's left pinky finger was amputated while operating the omasum saw in the menudo room.
An employee received electrical burns from an arc blast at a well site while working on pump service.
An employee was injured while troubleshooting a stacker machine. He fell and his left hand entered the press cavity on an 800-ton press, injuring the third and fourth fingers on his right hand.
An employee on duty after hours went out to close the gates. He lost his grip and fell back, striking his head on the pavement.
An employee amputated their right index finger while using a two-button pedestal welder.

An employee was operating a lathe machine to bore a pipe. The employee went to extract metal shavings inside of the pipe when his right hand got caught in a pinch point.
