He sustained broken bones in his right hand, severed tendons in the right middle and index fingers, and skin removal on the top of his  right hand, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell and broke an elbow in the office hallway.

An employee at a service call for a commercial building was in the attic when he fell through the ceiling and landed on the floor, suffering a fractured right pelvic bone and left wrist, a contusion on the right jaw, and a concussion.

An employee was driving a John Deere Gator truck on a gravel road at the worksite while holding a spray wand, which was attached to the 25-gallon spray tank. As she curbed to the right, she did not realize that the hose unraveled and caught the tires, causing the wand to move and strike her right eye. This resulted in the loss of an eye.

An employee was working on a molding machine that was alarming. The machine was not locked out at the time. The employee's hands were in the machine when the molds closed on his finger. Half of the first joint of his right ring finger (including the nail) was amputated at the hospital.

An employee was putting chutes back into a holder when the edge of the chute got caught on the mixer drum. The drum pushed the chute into a bracket, catching the employee's fingers between the chute and drum. His finger was amputated.
An employee was operating a lift on the back of a truck. When he reached for a chain that had fallen, the ramp came down on his hand and severed his right middle and ring fingers.
An employee was operating a walkie rider (electric pallet jack) after staging two pallets. A forklift clipped the walkie, lacerating his foot and toe.
An employee tore the tendon in his left arm while replacing a hydraulic pump on a blow molding machine.
An employee was climbing down a ladder while carrying a compressor. He fell, and his right-hand ring finger got caught and amputated.
An employee was injured in a motor vehicle accident when he rear-ended another truck.  The employee was hospitalized with potential fractures.
On June 5, 2015, an employee descending a fixed, vertical ladder fell approximately 20 feet to the work floor below.

On or about June 5, 2015, at 4:45 a.m., an employee was replacing a gasket in the hot water line. As he disconnected the hose, hot water doused his lower left leg, resulting in second degree burns and hospitalization. The line was not drained of water at the time of the incident.
An employee installing solar panels fell from the roof to the garage, fracturing a foot.

An employee was responding to an emergency medical call for a near drowning. The employee had to carry equipment about 1/4 mile through tall grass to get to the location. The employee had performed emergency medical treatment and then experienced lightheadedness and shortness of breath. The employee was treated in the emergency room and admitted for observation.

An employee was working on an air conditioner to reset a breaker. The employee reached for a tool box on a pedestal table, which kicked out and away from the employee, causing the employee to fall to the ground and sustain an injury.
On June 5, 2015, an employee using a press reached for a part; the press came down on his left hand, amputating three fingers above the knuckles.

On June 5, 2015, at approximately 11:45 a.m., an employee was working with blenders that are used to grind meat. An opening on the bottom of the grinder allows ground meat to fall into a buggy. The employee reached to remove a small portion of meat and his left hand made contact with an energized, rotating auger.
An employee got dizzy and fell and was hospitalized for fractured ribs.

An employee was pushing a catwalk out of the paint booth. The catwalk caught on an unknown object. He tried to keep pushing the catwalk forward when he fell over the push bar and hit his forehead on the catwalk. He continued falling over the bar and landed on the floor. He was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee fell 3.5 feet while welding a digester lid and broke his leg. He was hospitalized.

An employee was using a large wrench to tighten a bore on a boring pipeline.  When he finished, he gave the all clear to start the boring. The pipe wrench was not removed from the bore; it swung around and struck him on his left-hand pinky finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was hospitalized after feeling a tingling sensation in her leg, which was due to a herniated disk in her back.  Earlier in her shift, the employee had slipped on some moisture on the floor, but caught herself before falling.

An employee was towing baggage carts back to the bag room from the ramp area next to E-11. He applied the brake as he entered the bag room.  The cart jack-knifed and pinned his left foot between the tug and the cart. He fractured his big toe and a bone in his heel.

An employee was helping a tractor trailer driver restack plywood sheets when the skid they were on shifted or tipped over. In the back of the trailer, the plywood shifted and struck the employee, pinning his arm between the plywood sheets and the forward wall of the trailer. He fractured his left humerus and required surgery.

On June 06, 2015, at approximately 8:45 p.m., an employee was struck on the right leg by a rubber discharge hose that had been disconnected on one end after the pump was engaged by the equipment operator.
An employee fell from a ladder and sustained a fractured leg, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

Employees in the rail welding area were backing up a conveyor to remove an overload caused by too many pieces of curved strands. The injured employee's hand got caught between two sections of rail, amputating some of the flesh on the right ring finger. There was no bone loss.
An employee was moving a rolling milk cart when it tipped over. He tried to stop it from falling and it fell on him, breaking his femur and requiring surgery.

An employee was cleaning a ribbon blender. He had the lid open, thus disengaging the interlock switch and disabling the rotating paddles.  After he finished cleaning it, he closed the lid. The blender has a discharge hole at the bottom; unaware that the paddles in the blender were still rotating at a slow rate, the employee reached up through the discharge hole. The paddle amputated the tip of his index finger.
An employee was moving clothes (dresses) from one rack to another rack on the sales floor when she slipped. She required surgery for a broken femur.
An employee operating a stand-up forklift was backing up when his right foot got caught between the forklift he was operating and a parked forklift.
On June 6, 2015, an employee accessing paper goods caught her foot on a pallet. She lost her balance and fell, fracturing her hip.
An employee's hand was crushed by a skidsteer rock bucket as it was being taken off of a pallet.
An employee injured his/her back while stocking kitchen materials on a shelf.
An employee's right ring fingertip was amputated while operating a pallet assembly machine.

An employee was removing a twist lock from a 40-foot refrigerated container (40,000 pounds). The employee's right hand got caught between the chassis and container, fracturing the three middle fingers. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was carrying a pan of hot brisket drippings towards the dishwasher of the meat area and fell while holding the pan of drippings.  The hot drippings spilled and splashed onto the employee.  The employee received serious burns and was hospitalized.
The end of a maintenance employee's left thumb was crushed in the pinch point of a belt and pulley while he was manually pulling on the belt to rotate the parts of a locked-out production machine.
An employee was shocked by 480 volts when his left arm made contact with an energized blower/vacuum unit while removing water from under the blower. He was hospitalized.

On Sunday June 7, 2015, at approximately 4:55 p.m., an employee on the production floor was operating a crimper machine, which is a wire connector crimping machine operated by an unguarded foot pedal. The injured employee was hand-feeding wire pieces into the point of operation when she inadvertently pressed a foot pedal with her right-hand index finger, resulting in an amputation. The point of operation was unguarded at the time.
An employee was going to brush meat off of the boudin grinder when he got his finger caught in the extruder blades, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was closing a gate when the gate became unhinged and fell on him. He was hospitalized and underwent surgery for a fractured pelvis and dislocated hip.
An employee was removing an electrical cord from a water tower when he came into contact with overhead power lines and received electrical burns to his hands.
An employee fell while sitting on a stool, struck her head on the ground, and was hospitalized.
The end of an employee's finger was amputated while operating a Patti-O-Matic burger making machine. The guard was not in place at the time.

An employee received second degree burns to his left palm and third degree burns to his left wrist while swabbing machine oil across the mold in a mold machine.  The mold machine was located in the forming department.
On 6/8/15, an employee received an amputation to the left thumb while operating a band saw.
An employee attempted to free a mail jam in a mail sorting device when the machine amputated his finger.
An employee was spot welding bolts to a piece of metal when his right index fingertip was amputated, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell approximately 20 feet to the ground below. The employee was hospitalized with several broken bones and a head injury.
An employee fell about 8 feet from an A-frame ladder.
An employee shot himself in the leg with a cattle knock gun, breaking his femur.
At a filler machine, an employee who was putting lids on ice cream buckets was injured and received a right thumb amputation.
On 6/6/15, an employee was bitten on the left hand by a stray dog while delivering mail. The bite later became infected and required hospitalization.

The right index finger of an employee working on a plant potting assembly line got caught between a drive chain for a carousel and a metal guide wheel, resulting in an amputation down to the first knuckle from the fingertip.

An employee was manually moving the belt and gears of a high pressure pump. The pump was locked out and tagged out at the time. The employee's right pinky finger got caught in the belt. When the employee pulled his finger out, he lost his fingertip barely down to the bone.
An employee fell while walking in stilts and carrying snips that punctured the employee's abdomen. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was positioning himself on the aerial bucket before tree trimming when the aerial lift lost hydraulic pressure and caused the upper boom to swing down. This caused the employee to be ejected from the bucket while still attached to the bucket with his harness and lanyard. He fell down 28 feet, landing on a nearby fence and hitting his head on the fence or ground. He was hospitalized, where doctors found bleeding in the brain.
An employee was hospitalized when his scissor lift tipped over.

Employees were using a 100-ton hydraulic press to separate a bearing from a drive shaft.  While removing the bearing, the outer bearing race of a ball bearing assembly failed under pressure from the hydraulic press. The part struck the employees.

On June 8, 2015, at approximately 2:30 p.m., an employee was hospitalized for multiple head injuries after suffering a fall. The employee was delivering seven cases of milk from the side door of a freightliner truck with an 18' refrigerated body. The employee was found lying on the surface of the blacktop parking lot.

An employee placed a 4-foot long piece of metal into the passenger seat of a golf cart. The piece of metal hit the gas pedal on the golf cart and the golf cart lurched forward, hitting the employee on the left leg below the knee.
An employee hit a rack with a forklift during training, breaking his leg.

Two employees were at the paint storage room replacing a container pan underneath a paint pail. One employee passed out; later, the second employee passed out.  Both employees were hospitalized. The levels of CO in the paint room were elevated at the time of the incident.
An employee was using a rescue saw to cut a granite curb when it kicked back, hitting him in the face.
An employee struck himself in the head with a hammer.
A maintenance employee got snagged by a belt and was pulled into a machine, seriously injuring his arm and requiring hospitalization.
An employee was looking into the pilger machine when the hood fell, striking the employee on the back.
An employee getting change out of a safe closed the safe door on her right thumb. Her right thumb was crushed, and the entire nail bed came off.
An employee was carrying a 4x6-feet wooden beam when he lost his footing and slipped and fell, pinching his right index finger between a beam corner and the 4x6 beam.

An employee was working on a "Right of Way" on 6/8/2015. He forgot an instrument and got on an ATV to go back for it. While passing the "Right of Way" on a switchback, he hit something (presumably a rock or waterbar) and was thrown from the ATV at approximately 9 a.m. He suffered injuries to the shoulder blades, collarbone, and three ribs (broken) and required hospitalization.
An employee was injured during concrete hammer chipping operations when a concrete piece flew off and caused a contusion on the employee's right forearm. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was struck by another employee operating a pallet jack within the aisles of the dock where both employees were working.
An employee was administering medications to the cows when a cow moved into him and hit his lower right leg, causing a fracture. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee slipped and fell at the Atlanta airport, under Concourse E, Apron level, at the international baggage line. The employee slipped on black dust and broke his hip as a result of the fall.

An employee was polishing a rotating part in a CNC lathe. The glove he was wearing got caught, amputating his middle finger, lacerating his ring finger, and breaking his pinky finger. He was hospitalized.

An employee hooked an extension ladder onto a main overhead cable line and climbed up the ladder. His  task was to replace a secondary cable going from the main cable over the sidewalk to a house. When he cut the old cable, which had tension in it, the cable swung, hit the ladder, and knocked the employee off the ladder to the sidewalk 18 feet below.  The employee was wearing a safety belt and lanyard. The lanyard was not attached to the main cable at the time of the incident.
On 6/9/15, an employee received finger amputations to both hands while operating a crimp machine in set up mode.

An employee was working from a telephone pole when his gear lost tension and he fell, striking the top of a chain link fence. He severely injured his back. Adequate fall protection had not been provided at the time of the incident.
An employee lifted a cover over a crumble roller and reached between the grates to clean a clump of feed off of the grates. The employee's hand got caught between the rolls under the grates.
An employee fell off of a 6-foot ladder and hit his elbow.
An employee folding a piece of paper while walking to the pick area stepped on a plastic clothes clip, slipped, and fell to the concrete floor.

An employee was driving a golf cart on the course on 6/9/2015 at ~8:50 AM, when it is presumed that a wasp or bee flew into his face. The employee received a bite injury on his left cheek that initiated an allergic reaction requiring in-patient hospitalization.
An employee was exposed to an inhalation hazard from the oil mist used in drilling operations.
An employee fell and broke both wrists while on a skating field trip.

An employee was attempting to lift a slurry tank to move with a pallet jack. The tank rolled catching the employee's right middle finger between the slurry tank cribbing and the asphalt ground resulting in an amputation to at least the first knuckle.

On June 9, 2015, an employee wearing flame resistant clothing was retrieving samples of hot, 400 degrees F asphalt from a controlled sample point when he was splashed/sprayed by pressurized hot asphalt. He received second degree burns to his head, neck, chest, and both arms. He also received first and second degree burns on the right side of his face.

An employee was performing duties related to lawn care when he was overcome by heat. The employee complained of a stomach ache and started vomiting. EMT services were called and the employee was taken to a local hospital where he was treated and kept overnight for observation.

An employee was loading material onto a rack in the bed of a pickup truck, and was in the process of tightening a ratchet strap to secure the load. As the employee was tightening the ratchet strap, the employee fell and struck his torso on the opposite side of the bed, breaking five ribs. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

An employee stepped off of his Jung Heinrich stock picker in aisle 30 of the general warehouse area at approximately 10 AM.  The lift was not fully lowered to the floor at the time. He fell 2 to 2.5 feet to the floor, breaking his right hip and requiring hospitalization.
On 6/9/15, an employee was hospitalized due to a finger injury caused by the cleaning of a label press.

An employee was checking cooler chillers. When he passed the chiller blower, the chiller blower's fan sucked his left hand in, cutting off the tip of his index finger. The blower was unguarded at the time because the guard had fallen off.
On or about June 9, 2015, an employee went up on an aerial lift to work on a motor. The belt was still rotating at the time, and it amputated his right index fingertip.

On or about June 9, 2015, an employee was injured when a forklift truck backed into and pinned the employee between the wall and a trailer. The employee sustained a right hip injury and broken pelvis.

An employee was using a stand-on, 36-inch Stander Lawn Mower Machine. As he was operating the machine, he dismounted it and the machine ran over one of his feet. Several of his toes were amputated. The employee was wearing steel-toed shoes at the time.

An employee was making sure that no one was in the way of the forklift as the forklift driver was lowering a 20 ft long metal beam onto the ground. The employee then pulled the hand grinder's electrical cord that was on the ground so that it wouldn't get crushed by the metal beam, but instead his right index finger was crushed by the beam resulting in the amputation of his right index finger from the second knuckle.
An employee injured his right thumb below the nail area while operating a jet horizontal band saw.

An employee was installing solar panels on a residential roof at 33 Wilson Drive Babylon, New York 94402. The employee fell approximately 7 feet to the ground while descending a ladder and injured the right ankle. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee's hand got caught while trying to clear a jam in a baler.
An employee walking through the plant stepped in a shallow trench that was missing a trench cover. The trench contained hot water.

An employee fractured his right femur when he tripped on the platform lip while exiting an electrical pallet jack. At the time, he was trying to move away from a falling pallet overhead. He was hospitalized.

An employee was pressing fenders on a foot-operated punch press. A thin layer of nylon was placed inside the fender before pressing, but it moved out of place. The employee reached to adjust the piece of nylon and stepped on the foot pedal, causing the press to come down on his left arm.

On June 9, 2015, an employee's finger got caught between a dock plate and trailer while attempting to position the dock plate beneath a rear pallet. Her fingertip was severely injured, eventually requiring surgical amputation.
An employee was struck by a reversing forklift, breaking the employee's leg.
On June 9, 2015, an employee's hand was crushed while operating a laminator. The employee was hospitalized. The machine guard was bypassed at the time of the incident.

An employee was using a handheld band saw to cut an old thread pipe. He held the pipe with his left hand while cutting with the right. When he cut through the pipe, he also cut his left index fingertip.
An employee was waiting for an elevator. The elevator stopped higher than floor level. When the employee entered the elevator, she tripped and fractured her leg.

An employee was placing a 450 lb. part on a work table, using a 1-ton hoist and a hook, when the part came loose from the hook and partially fell onto the employee's hand. The employee suffered vascular damage to the left middle and ring fingers, requiring surgery.
A warehouse employee climbed on the racks and fell approximately 20 feet to the floor.
On 06-09-2015, an employee was hospitalized after being found unconscious near the work station. Possibly heat related.

An employee was placing a chock onto pipe to stabilize it on the conveyor. The employee tried to go over the machinery instead of around it, and his right thigh got caught by the moving conveyor machinery. He sustained a severe laceration and torn muscle, requiring surgery.

An employee was on a train car in the yard helping the mobile crane crew unload long pieces of steel from the train car. The employee had just hooked the crane hook to a piece of metal and the operator was tightening the hook when another piece of metal began to fall. The employee jumped down and the steel landed on his right hand, amputating his ring finger and pinky tip.

On June 9, 2015, an employee was running on the side of a waste collection truck as the truck backed down a dead-end street. As the truck was moving, the employee attempted to mount the steps located on the rear. He missed the step and fell. The right rear outside tire ran over his lower left leg, breaking it. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was walking down the hallway and around a corner when her knee gave out.  She fell and broke her left femur bone.

An employee was loading a well with hot oil. The employee had turned valves off and started to fill the well. The pressure in the tank filled due to the hot oil. The pressure release valve released flammable vapors and/or gases. The flammable vapors and/or gases ignited, burning the employee's face (cheeks and ears). The employee was wearing flame resistant clothing, a hard hat, and safety glasses at the time.
An employee partially amputated his right hand while operating a Steinemann printing press.
An employee slipped off a ladder and fractured vertebrae.
An employee suffered a partial amputation of the left ring finger while checking a hoist in the maintenance department.
An employee was discovered sitting in his car just after break. The employee was unresponsive and diagnosed with severe dehydration possibly due to overheating.
An employee was operating a double pallet jack and wanted to move it in reverse. He put the pallet jack in the forward gear instead of reverse and became pinned between the pallet jack and a spur.

The injured employee was building a scaffold. While constructing the scaffold, the leg of the scaffold hit a valve (located above)releasing sulfuric acid. He suffered burns on the left side of his body and was hospitalized.
An employee in the meat department cut his finger while slicing meat with a knife.
An employee was struck by an electrical pole as it was being transferred to the ground by an excavator with a chain.
An employee was working from an extension ladder when he fell breaking his right ankle.
On June 10, 2015, an employee was operating a UTV on the range when the UTV hit a patch of soft sand and flipped. The employee fell out of the UTV, landed on an ammunition can, and injured his back.

An employee was loading a transformer into the bucket of a Bobcat from the side. The Bobcat operator did not see him when he moved the bucket and caught the employee's right pinky finger in the joint/hinge where the bucket is attached and amputated the fingertip.
An employee removed a rubber boot from a rail car and used his hand to push carbon back into the auger below the rail car.  The tip of the employee's left index finger was caught in the auger.
An employee operating a roller jumped off the machine when it began to tilt.  The employee was hospitalized with injuries to his left arm and shoulder.
An employee was injured when she tripped over a plastic band and fell to the floor.
An employee was stepped on by a physical therapy patient, resulting in a fractured left foot.
A parcel driver was hospitalized due to dehydration.
An employee was delivering two containers of pesticide to a customer's farm. While walking to his pickup, he slipped and fell to the ground. It was a rainy evening and the ground was wet and muddy.

An employee was contracted to perform work at another facility to relocate a molding machine.  Normal procedure is to bring the machine within about one inch of the leveling pad so that a bolt can be hand placed to align with the hole on the machine that is being bolted down (to conclude the relocation of the machine). While using a hydraulic jack to perform this task, the hydraulic jack "failed" as the machine came down on the employee's left hand crushing it in 3-4 separate places.

An employee was assisting offloading truck. A supervisor noticed the employee was sweating excessively and looked pale. The supervisor informed the employee to sit inside the air-conditioned truck and cool off. After a period of time the employee came out of the truck and attempted to continue to work. The employee complained that his hands were cramping. The employee was taken to the hospital. At the hospital, it was noted that the employee had high CK levels possibly due to prior heat illness.

A retail associate was walking to the front of the store through clothing racks.  She tripped on a comforter that was left on the floor by a customer and fell.  She fractured her right femur and required surgery to repair the fracture.

A maintenance employee was struck by plastic tub lids that fell from a pallet raised on the forks of a stationary forklift, knocking him to the ground, at which time he struck his head, resulting in head and neck injuries requiring hospitalization.
An employee suffered a finger amputation during machine maintenance.
An employee was performing normal maintenance on a gluer machine, when the employee slipped and came into contact with the gluer machine resulting in a finger amputation.
An employee was hospitalized due to a chemical burn to the tip of the left index finger.

An employee was cutting the banding on a bundle of 5 3/4" steel on dual hoists and a basket hitch on each end using a manual banding cutter and crushed the tip of his pinky finger between two pieces of steel, resulting in the amputation of his fingertip. He was wearing cut level 4 gloves and sleeves, hardhat, safety glasses + side shield, and steel-toed metatarsal boots.
An employee working on a road construction project cleaning up after concrete chipping was struck by the street sweeper and suffered a broken sacrum.
An employee was hospitalized after hurting his back while lifting boxes from a dolly.
An employee suffered a fractured femur when he fell from a scaffold after the spreader beam that he had tied his fall protection to fell to the ground.
An employee experienced back spasms and back strain while loading a hand truck with bottles of water.
An employee received an amputation injury to his left middle finger while cleaning a water meter that was on a conveyor when his finger was caught in the power-driven roller on the conveyor.

An inmate working in the building trade program sustained an amputation of two fingers while using a table router. The inmate was hand feeding a wooden board through the router and his fingers contacted the rotating router blade.
An employee sustained a finger injury when it was caught in a chain hoist.
An employee was spotting for a crane when the employee's fingers got caught in the winch line.

An employee broke his leg above the foot when it was pinned between forklift forks and material. He had started the forklift as he was standing beside it and raised the forks a few inches off the ground. He then went in front of the forklift to adjust the distance of the forks. While he was talking with another employee, the forklift started rolling forward. The emergency brakes were not applied at the time.

An employee was instructing other employees regarding the procedure on how to remove a 36-inch diameter pipe from within a larger diameter pipe. The pipe began moving too fast and rolled up onto his right leg, pinning him and causing his leg to break. He underwent surgery to repair damage and reset the bone.
An employee drove a forklift off a trailer.

An employee suffered an amputation to the 3rd and 4th fingertips on his left hand. He was operating a jib crane to raise the door of a blowout preventer when an approximately 150 piston slid out of it striking his hand.

An employee was moving a steel pipe with a bobcat. The employee shook the bobcat bucket to dislodge the pipe and began to drive away. The pipe was not dislodged and it began swinging and struck another employee in the lower left leg, breaking the leg and resulting in an in-patient hospitalization.

An employee walked close to an elevator opening. He rested his hand on the barricade (chain) that didn't hold his weight. He fell twelve feet resulting in a non-displaced fracture of his lower back and a possible fracture of his right foot.

An employee was using a vacuum pressure hose to clean out water from a sump hole and the suction of the vacuum hose caught the employee's left arm. The resulting arm injury needed a surgical pressure release.

On or about 6/11/2015, at 8:55 a.m., an employee working with a roof cutter attempted to seal a hole that was located on the inside panel of the machine. The employee reached into the machine and his glove got caught in the blade, amputating his ring fingertip and lacerating his middle finger. The machine was running at the time of the incident.
An employee was walking and was run over by the forklift. The employee suffered broken ribs, a collapsed left lung, broken vertebra, and a toe amputation.

An employee was in the back of a trailer attempting to remove product when he either tripped or his foot caught on the trailer, resulting in him falling to the pavement and hitting his head. The employee suffered a closed head skull fracture.
An employee was hospitalized due to experiencing a heat related illness.

An employee was manually feeding tubes into the tube straightener in the warehouse area with two other employees. The employee was feeding a square tube when his left thumb tip was caught between the tube and a roller.

An employee was closing the injection molding door when his left hand glove along with the tip of his middle finger got caught between the door and the frame of the injection molding machine. The employee jerked his hand out and amputated his left middle fingertip.

Two employees were attempting to place a rotor on a pedestal stand while using a forklift and synthetic web sling. The sling slid off the rotor, causing the rotor to fall to the ground and hit an employee's left foot.  The employee was hospitalized afterwards for foot surgery.
An employee was injured while assisting to load a beam onto a flatbed truck. The beam tipped on its side and struck the injured employee.
An employee suffered a serious injury resulting in hospitalization when a steel beam being moved on a crane knocked him off the extension ladder he was on.

An employee operating the resaw was changing the thickness and making adjustments to the line bar. The machine was accidentally started, and his left foot got caught in the chain and sprocket, breaking a bone in the big toe of his left foot.
An employee was hospitalized after falling 20-25 feet through a roof skylight.
On or about June 11, 2015, an employee sustained an amputation to the tip of the left index finger when working with a Banbury mixer in the quality control lab.

An employee went to grab a board before it slid down the chute at the output side of the re-rip saw. He contacted the flat chain that was moving, and his right ring fingertip was cut off. There was no bone loss or nail loss.
On or about June 11, 2015, an employee sustained an amputation to the first joint of the left middle finger when cutting parts on a bandsaw.
An employee was injured on the job while operating a press; his thumb was amputated.

A call from Monroe Community College early in the morning of 6/11/15 said that there was a power outage. Employees were sent on site to restore power. The injured employee inadvertently moved a ground wire in proximity to an energized part and an arc flash occurred. He received second degree burns to his hand and first degree burns to his arm and face.
An employee was struck by material handling equipment (reach truck). He was selecting products from the warehouse racking; the reach truck operator didn't see him and struck him.
On or about 6/11/15, an employee's left middle fingertip was amputated by a moving chain conveyor.

On Thursday, 06/11/2015 at 2:15 PM an employee at the Hampton VA Medical Center was injured on the job in the Main Kitchen (Building 116/Room 103) of the Nutrition & Food Services Department (N&FS). The employee had finished with food production efforts for the day and began daily sanitation/clean-up efforts. The employee was responsible for cleaning and sanitizing a 100-gallon kettle.  At the time of the injury, the equipment was left in the "on" position; the paddles were rotating; and the probe had been removed from the bottom of the kettle thereby creating a small circular opening. The employee was cleaning out the circular opening (finger in upright position through the hole) when the paddle struck his finger. The paddle severed 1/2 inch of his middle finger on his left hand.  Bone was visible. The employee was rushed to the Emergency Room for re-attachment efforts.
An employee was walking in the turbine floor of the boiler area and struck his head on an overhanging pipe and fell to the floor breaking his right femur.

The injured employee was a spotter for a broom tractor. The broom tractor operator was backing up and lost sight of the employee. The employee was struck by the broom tractor resulting in a concussion, a fractured skull and facial lacerations.
A crew was preparing to pave a road. While warming up, the rear of the paving machine caught on fire and burned the employee sitting in the seat.

The injured employee was chasing down someone who was suspected of trying to abduct and assault a client's employee. He and a coworker accosted the suspect, who drew a knife and struck the injured employee on his left shin. The injured employee was hospitalized.
An employee at South Des Moines Station fell while delivering mail. He was walking down a slight grade when he slipped and fell on his ankle, breaking it in two places. He required surgery.
An employee sustained a hernia while loading a piece of lumber onto a molding machine and was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after he cut his leg with a powered hand saw.
Employees were setting up bleachers for an event. One of the employees fell from the bleachers and was injured.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after receiving a laceration from a concrete saw.

On June 11, 2015, an employee was standing on a forklift changing out the seals on the mast. The employee stepped backward, striking the level that lowers the mast with his back. The employee was pinned under the mast and fractured the lumbar region of his back.

An employee sat down on a large rock during a nature hike to take a picture with youth campers. The rock broke away from the ground and the employee slid down the hill with the rock, getting pinned between the rock and hillside. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured pelvis and hip injuries.

An employee was cleaning a running conveyor system with a compressed air wand when the wand became stuck in the conveyor system at a junction between a section of roller conveyors and a belt conveyor.  While trying to free the compressed air wand, the employee's right middle finger either got caught in the conveyor or caught by the compressed air wand, resulting in a partial amputation of the right middle finger. The injury occurred above the right knuckle and involved bone. The employee required surgery to reattach the finger.
In the power press department, an employee crushed four fingers on his right hand while feeding a blade into the press to make two holes in the blade.
An employee was splashed by hot liquid rubber that he was carrying in a bucket, requiring hospitalization for third degree burns.
An employee got dehydrated and was injured when he fainted and hit his head. He was hospitalized and received stitches in his head.
An employee was hospitalized when she was struck in the arm by a nail from a pneumatic nail gun.

An employee was weighing fourteen cattle one at a time. Two cows tried to get on the scale at same time. The employee tried to back one cow off the scale and the other cow ran away. The employee was either knocked unconscious or stepped on by the cattle causing injury. There were no witnesses to the incident.

An employee was monitoring a patient when the patient became agitated.  The patient struck the employee in both of her arms.  The employee fell to the ground and injured her left knee and right shoulder.
An employee sustained a left-hand, middle fingertip amputation while starting a filler lineup.
An employee was walking in front of an electric pallet jack. The pallet jack ran over the back of his foot when the employee stopped suddenly.

An employee who had climbed a ladder to service communication equipment on a pole 18' above the ground was attacked by wasps. During his rapid descent down the ladder, he lost his footing and fell to the ground, resulting in a broken leg and hospitalization.
An employee was injured when a stack of steel beams fell and pinned him, striking him in the legs.
An employee's left foot got pinned between the fork truck he was operating and a wire basket. He sustained an amputation of two toes and a broken big toe.

A maintenance employee was storing the extruder track that is used to move the extruder to and from the die. He was wearing a cut resistant glove that caught on a bur. As he was sliding the track into the storage area, his finger got caught between the sliding rack and storage area.

An employee was performing work at a transformer.  The line the employee was going to work on was de-energized and grounded. The employee came into contact with the energized line, which resulted in burns to both hands.
An employee fell 10 feet from an aluminum ladder while repairing leaks inside of a ground water storage tank.
An employee was cleaning bands on an auto booth paint machine when his right index finger got caught between the band and the rollers, causing an amputation.
An employee operating a press brake suffered amputations of his right pinky, middle, and ring fingers when his right hand got caught in the machine. He was hospitalized and received surgery.

A "Yard Horse" vehicle with a shipping container on board was moving in the yard and accidentally bumped into a rail car.  An employee was standing on that railroad car, locking down containers.  The "bump" caused the employee to fall off the railroad car, and he was caught in a pinch point between the railroad car and the shipping container on board the "Yard Horse." He suffered a crushing laceration to the back of his right leg.
While walking on a sidewalk near construction, an employee tripped and fell, breaking their elbow.
Approximately 0.25 inches of an employee's left-hand index fingertip was amputated by a manual paper cutter, requiring surgery.
An employee was hospitalized after getting his feet caught in a machine.
An employee was traveling west bound on Ross Ave and proceeded into an intersection on a green light. A car ran a red light and struck the employee on the left side.
An employee was bitten by a snake when he stuck his hand inside a cross connect box. The employee did not see the snake inside the cross connect box when he opened the door.

On Friday, June 12, 2015, an employee sustained a puncture/laceration while working the grill in the cafeteria at Norwalk Hospital. The employee was using a boning knife to slice a roll/bread that had not been adequately pre-sliced. He held the roll in his right hand and the knife in his left hand. While attempting to cut the roll, he punctured/lacerated his right forearm.
An employee in the warehouse fell from a pallet tier that was approximately 7 feet high and fractured their left ankle.
On June 12, 2015, an employee exposed to heat stress hazards was hospitalized after he went home with heat stress symptoms.
An employee fell from a 5-foot scaffold.
An employee was burned on the leg while cutting rebar.
An employee's right foot was run over and de-gloved by a forklift being driven by another operator.
An employee checking an electrical panel came into contact with a live wire and was electrocuted.

An employee was throwing away a piece of pipe that was oddly shaped and heavier at the base. He threw it into the scrap metal trash bin and it rebounded against his middle finger, still placed against the edge of the trash bin, amputating his right middle fingertip from the top joint down.
An employee returning to the City Gate facility tripped on an uneven sidewalk, broke her arm, and injured her back, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized following a workplace accident that involved contact with chemicals.  While opening a container of pressurized ammonia, the chemical released into the employee's face.

An employee was cutting meat using a table saw (meat slicer) when the meat slipped from his grasp, causing his hand to contact the blade. His thumb and index finger were severed, causing amputation, and two other fingers were lacerated.
An employee was removing a rod that holds the contacts inside of a metal box when his finger got caught between the rod and the box, amputating his right thumb.

An employee was spotting moving equipment when he noticed a piece of iron that was sticking out from the equipment. He reached up to swivel the iron when his finger got caught between the iron and the parked equipment.

An employee was attempting to remove the chain from the bit of a barge transfer system when the transfer cable snapped up, pinning his right index finger between the bit and the chain. This action removed most of the fleshy tissue of his upper finger. He was hospitalized, and the remaining upper finger was medically amputated.
An employee was hospitalized after she slipped and fell on a plastic dough container while pushing a rolling cart.

On June 13, 2015, an employee was operating a stand-up mower. While going up an incline, he lost his balance and slipped off of the mower. He grabbed onto the handle, which made the mower go backwards, and his ankle went under the deck and was cut. He was hospitalized overnight and received ankle stitches.
An employee fell from a second story balcony while trying to bend a rebar back in place. The rebar snapped, causing the employee to lose his balance and fall off the balcony to the ground.
An employee amputated the tip of his middle finger when his glove got caught in a conveyor.

An employee was disconnecting a set of spreader bars from a crane while working on the dock.  During the process, an extension bar gained momentum and struck the employee, knocking the employee to the ground. The employee suffered a head injury and was hospitalized for testing, with results of intracranial bleeding.

An employee had just started to weld on a broken Tigercat's knife when it immediately flashed, causing a fire. The employee received third degree burns from his waist down. Before welding, the employee poured water around his work location to prevent a forest fire.

An employee was washing out the RS2 screw. While the employee's hand was in the RS2 screw, another employee activated/enabled the A station via the computer, causing the RS2 screw to turn. This action lacerated the employee's palm, severing the tendons. The RS2 screw was not locked out at the time of the accident.
An employee's hand was crushed between a clamp and a frame while he was setting up to weld two steel strip ends together, resulting in multiple fractures, lacerations, and hospitalization.
While cleaning a resident, an employee's leg got caught in a call light cord. The employee fell and fractured their shoulder.

An employee was repairing a molding press when his right leg came in contact with a live conductor, causing him to experience loss of consciousness and burns due to electrocution. He was hospitalized for his injuries.

An employee was helping a coworker move material from reprocessing to the film department, which involved attaching a 4-inch hose to a hopper. Once the hose is hooked up, material flows through a filtering system in the hopper. There is a rotary valve at the bottom of the filter.  The valve rotates and dumps waste into a container. The hopper was jammed or clogged up, so the employees tried to get it to work by cycling the power. The injured employee was going to feel around the rotary valve for the jam or clog when the rotary valve "sucked his hand up" into it and amputated the distal phalanx of the thumb.
An employee was servicing a tire when the equipment hub shattered and the mounted tire struck the employee on the left arm.

On June 15, 2015, at approximately 4:40 PM, an employee cut off his left middle fingertip and cut the tendons in his left hand while using a band saw to cut pork. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee missed a ladder step and fell 6 to 12 feet, breaking a foot and injuring a shoulder.
An employee was in the hallway when a patient ran up and began hitting her in the face. The patient then grabbed the employee's leg and pulled her into a room. The employee fell, injuring her elbow.

At 4:45 p.m., on Monday, June 15, an employee was working on a metal frame near the paint booth. When he moved the frame to prepare for the next stage of work, a second frame fell from a stand onto his arm, lacerating his left bicep. He was hospitalized and underwent surgery.
An employee in the meat market was using a band saw meat cutter. As he ran the meat across the cutter, his fingertip was cut off.
On June 15, 2015, an employee was straightening boxes on a pallet and was struck by the forks of a powered industrial vehicle. The employee was hospitalized due to the injuries received.
An employee, performing duties as a mail career, was hospitalized for dehydration due to heat stress.
An employee was assembling two pieces of sheet steel on a harvester when he slipped and one of sheets amputated his fingertip.

An employee was chipping off hardened chemical residue from the interior walls of a tank.  Twenty minutes into the second 30-minute rotation, he got out of the tank complaining about drowsiness and a severe headache. He was hospitalized.
On or about 6/15/15, an employee operating pipe bender machine was caught in the machine and amputated his left middle fingertip.
An employee sustained a left-hand middle finger amputation while operating a lift gate.
An employee in the production area was operating 60-ton press machine to form and bend metal parts. The movement of the machine amputated his pointer and middle fingertips on his left hand.
An employee lost a fingertip in a stationary bone saw blade.
On or about 6/15/15, an employee's hand got pinched between the forklift roll cage and a spider coil, resulting in a pinky fingertip amputation and severe injury to the ring finger of the right hand.

An employee was turning the corner while riding a PIV electric pallet lift.  The brakes failed, so the employee quickly fell from the PIV.  When he fell, his left foot was run over by a different PIV lift going in the opposite direction.  The employee's foot was smashed; he was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee broke an ankle after falling off the step of a truck-mounted ladder.

An employee fell about 8 feet from a one-story residential house when he stepped onto the ladder from the roof and lost his footing.  He fell onto the concrete and injured his heel, requiring hospitalization.

Employees had removed the canopy top off a small 36" excavator to get it through a doorway.  They were in the process of putting the canopy back on when it slipped and hit the safety lever, which activates the boom.  The boom swung around, and the excavator bucket struck the backside of the injured employee between his ribs and pelvis.  The bucket was constructed of sharp metal, which caused a severe cut that required stitches. The employee was hospitalized overnight for observation.
An employee working in an airplane hanger from a 10' portable ladder fell and hit the ground, injuring his hip, wrist, and spine and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was moving a pipe on a transporter. He was positioned backwards, and his foot went into a 0.5- to 1-inch access opening that connects transporters together.  There were screws missing from the access hatch, which moved the access plate and caused the employee to fall over the side of the transporter from a height of 4 feet, 4.5 inches to the ground. The employee landed on a board, breaking a leg and a rib on his right side.
An employee was changing the tracks on a John Deere bobcat. As he turned the wheel, his finger got caught in the wrong place, snipping off the end of the left index finger.
An employee was washing windows on a logging truck, missed a step, and fell.

An employee was checking a leak on the roof. He fell through the roof (skylight) and ceiling (another 15 feet) to the ground for about 50 feet total. He was hospitalized for a dislocated shoulder, a cut on his left rib, and brain bleeding. He underwent surgery.
While walking to his/her work station, an employee slipped and fell, sustaining a broken wrist.

An employee was working at an oil and gas lease site when he made contact with a 480 V transmission line while working between the distribution box and the well he was inspecting. The employee received third degree burns on his hands and back and was admitted to the hospital.
A Border Patrol Agent was bitten by a tick and eventually required hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized due to an injury received to the rear of his left leg during the operation of a forklift.
An employee was unloading a HVAC condenser from a flat bed truck and his index finger was smashed between the condenser and the guardrail of the flat bed truck, causing a partial amputation.
An employee working from a ladder fell to the elevation below after the ladder tipped over.

An employee was watching a surge pile in the staging area while supervising the work, when he was struck by a forklift that was loading out trucks in the vicinity. The employee's right leg and elbow were injured, resulting in surgery and hospitalization.
An employee cleaning a radial arm saw received an amputation injury on June 16, 2015.
An employee was removing a man hole cover when the cover slipped and smashed the employee's index finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee knocked a can of cooking spray into a deep fryer. The can of cooking spray exploded and the employee received 2nd and 3rd degree burns to his arms, chest, and face.
An employee was driving a pallet jack when he pressed the wrong direction on the machine and caught his fingers in between the pallet jack and a rack.

An employee was working on the production floor and began experiencing heat illness related symptoms, including abdominal and muscle cramping as well as decreased sweating.  He was admitted and treated for heat exhaustion at the hospital.

The injured employee and another worker were working at an elevation of 10 feet, 7 inches on top of a mezzanine while landing bundles of decking that were being  moved by a crane.  The bundle of decking had to be spun by the crane in order to be landed correctly. The employee lost his footing during this process and fell from the beam he was standing on.
An Aerotek temporary employee was attempting to clear a jam on compression molding machine number 4 when the machine cycled and amputated a portion of his right pointer finger.

An employee was standing on a step ladder installing temporary lighting. The employee was handed an electrical whip/flexible conduit. The wires in the conduit were live, 277 volts. The employee received an electric shock from the wiring and fell off the ladder. As the employee fell off the ladder his left foot went between two rungs and he fractured his lower left leg.
An employee was leaving Building 318 after dropping off some work files. She missed a drop of approximately four inches causing a fall that broke her ankle in two places.
An employee caught his hand in a conveyor on the labeling line amputating the tip of a finger, breaking another finger and injuring several others.
An employee was squatting and bending down to reach scrap metal chips from underneath the CNC machine and pinched nerve. He was treated at the hospital.
A winder operator on the end of the production line suffered a fingertip amputation when his hand was caught in the push portion of the winder.

An employee was standing on the third step of an eight foot step ladder pulling a cable through a conduit with a fish tape. The fish tape popped off the cable and the employee fell off the ladder and struck the ground. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured pelvis and chipped vertebrae.
A maintenance employee was troubleshooting the body line machine when it actuated resulting in a two finger amputation (pointer and middle to first knuckle on the right hand).

An employee was operating a powered industrial truck to pick up a pallet of product.  The employee ran over some spilled product in front of the pallet, causing the truck to slide and strike an upright storage rack.  The employee's right foot got caught between the storage rack and the truck.  The employee suffered a partial fracture of his right heel and skin removal, requiring hospitalization for treatment.

An employee was helping to move aluminum tubing and frame-filled crates. The employee was signaling the operator when his left pinky got caught between the board and the crate. His left pinky fingertip was amputated, removing mostly skin and the fingernail.

A driver completed his route for the day when he began to complain of cramps and a headache. The employee was transported to the hospital where he received IV fluids. He was released the following morning.
An employee was operating the shape mill when his left arm got caught between two rolls.  He sustained a broken wrist and forearm, requiring surgery.
An employee was climbing down a fixed ladder when his foot slipped and he fell five feet injuring his left shoulder. He was admitted to the hospital and underwent surgery for a fractured shoulder.
An employee sustained an amputation of three fingers to his left hand while working on a commercial ironing machine.
On or about June 16, 2015, a seasonal employee had the top portion of his finger severed by an auger as he was attempting to replace the plug in the bottom of an ice auger.
The worker may have been clearing a jam or retrieving some mail when he tripped and fell hitting his head on the floor or railing. He was found by another employee and admitted to the hospital.

The refrigerator and ice maker in the break room were leaking causing water to drain onto the floor.  An employee placed items in the refrigerator and was going to the assignment board when she slipped and fell fracturing her patella which required surgery.
An employee was found unresponsive after being missing for approximately one hour. The employee was potentially exposed to struck by hazards while performing lay down hand duties.
On 6/16/15, an employee was injured when he slipped off the forks of a forklift and fell 5 to 6 feet. The employee was hospitalized with cracked ribs and a groin injury.
An employee was operating a forklift and crushed his hand between a racking system and the forklift resulting in hospitalization.

An employee was in one area of the shop cutting metal and welding. He heard a noise and went to investigate at the other end of the shop. He decided to oil the rolling machine. As he was checking the rolling machine his gloved hand was caught and pulled into the machine. His hand was crushed and skin was removed from his hand.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation of the ring finger on his left hand while emptying a dumpster into a roll off container.
An employee was on a ladder when the ladder fell.

On 6-16-2015 at 4:45 PM an employee was injured while dismounting a forklift inside a trailer. The  employee rolled an ankle which caused a dislocation and fracture to his toes requiring hospitalization and surgery to his left foot.
An employee broke a leg while operating a tire changer.
An employee stepped off of a forklift and entered the freezer where he slipped on condensation that had accumulated on the floor causing him to fall backwards.
An employee's hand was pinched between a man basket and the frame of a conveyor.
An employee lacerated the ring and middle fingers of the left hand while running the Hesser machine.
An employee placed a casting on a table. The casting slid off the table and onto the employee's foot resulting in an injury that required stitches.
An employee was admitted to the hospital with several broken bones after being struck by a pole that was not securely rigged.
An employee's right thumb was amputated while trouble shooting a problem on line 5.
An employee cut his finger on a lawnmower blade while clearing a clog and was hospitalized.

An employee was observing a company called Alpha Omega in the process of using a Hydro-Vac Machine when a coupling came apart causing a piece of metal pipe to strike the employee on the right side of his face causing a laceration and then striking his right hand causing it to fracture.

An employee was pushing a powered pallet jack through a set of dock doors with his hands on the outside of the handle. The dock doors closed crushing the middle, ring and pinky fingers on his left hand resulting in an amputation of the pinky fingertip.

An employee was working on a metal conveyor frame. He was cutting off the legs and set it down on saw horses. The frame fell off the saw horse and struck his body. He was hospitalized with abdominal injuries.
An employee operating a stacker/reach truck lost control and was thrown from the lift striking a structural I-beam and fracturing his pelvis.

An HVAC mechanic was working on the back of one of the units at Building 182.  He attempted to adjust a wire, reached in, and the spinning fan blade contacted his fingers. He suffered multiple lacerations on his fingers and a possible amputation.

An employee received an amputation injury while operating molding machine #26. The employee placed a mold into the machine. The mold was crooked so the employee reached in to straighten it. The machine activated and came down on the employee's left hand. He was taken to the hospital where his index and middle finger were amputated above the knuckle. He also received burn injuries to his hand.
An employee was completing general ground maintenance work using a weed eater when he began to feel nauseous and dizzy. The employee fainted and was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.
An employee driving a truck suffered from dehydration.
An employee was sprayed by ADAME, a corrosive chemical, while opening and closing a piping valve requiring hospitalization.
An employee amputated the middle finger, index finger, and thumb on the left hand while operating a table saw.
An employee operating the Unit 26 tooth molding press partially amputated his left hand.

An employee was crushed between two tractors. Employees were using jumper cables to boost a dead battery on a John Deere agriculture tractor when the tractor jumped backwards and the employee became pinned between the weights on the front of the back tractor and the back wheel of the front tractor. The injured employee had internal bleeding, sustained a collapsed lung and a tear in his small intestines.

An employee, operating a pallet jack, was walking with the jack and exiting a room. While exiting, the employee's hand was pinched between the wall and the handle of the pallet jack, amputating the tip of his left pinky finger.
While operating a meat band saw, an employee amputated the tip of his right index finger.  The incident occurred in the cutting room within the meat department.
An employee was injured when she tripped over a loose cord laying across her work space and fell breaking right femur.

An employee was moving film to storage on a platter (metal plate) when it started to fall. The employee tried to catch the plate and crushed her left index fingertip.  Three days later it had to be partially amputated.

An employee was trimming grass when he felt ill due to the heat. His supervisor took him to a shady area and gave him water. The employee went to the hospital the following day where he stayed overnight and was treated for heat-related symptoms.

An employee got out of a garbage truck to loosen a turnbuckle on the back of the truck. Another truck exiting the dump stopped to talk. As the exiting truck began to move again, the turnbuckle popped. The employee stepped backwards (towards exiting truck) to regain balance. The employee's foot was run over by the rear axle of the exiting truck.
An HVAC mechanic was clipped by a fan blade while working on an AC unit which resulted in a finger amputation.
An employee amputated the left pinky fingertip while closing the role down door of a delivery truck.
A forklift accident injured an employee's right foot.
An employee was attempting to connect a hose onto a tank and the tank overflowed. Hot water burned the employee's back.

A grounds maintenance employee was using a ladder to cut a large tree branch with a chainsaw.  The tree branch broke loose, striking the ladder and causing the employee to fall.  The employee was hospitalized and treated for a laceration to the right forearm (involving 40 stitches), a punctured lung, and a fractured pelvis.

An employee was working on a conveyor belt and other workers began to walk by.  The employee tried to move out of the way and put his hand on the conveyor. His left index finger was cut off above the middle knuckle.

The employee was pushing a cart with glass in it. The employee turned the cart and was about to hit a fan that was mounted to a pole. Other employees yelled for him to look out. The yelling startled the employee and he bent forward cutting his right bicep in the process. He was taken to the hospital for treatment.
An employee splitting firewood with a hydraulic log-splitter received an amputation to the left index fingertip while attempting to adjust a log in the splitter.

The employee was walking back to the office after collecting mail when a U-Haul employee, who was servicing a truck, backed it up and ran over the injured employee. The back wheels ran over the employee's abdomen severely injuring him.
Employees exposed to crush-by hazards while conducting automobile high altitude performance testing.
An employees was hospitalized when his foot was run over and crushed by a forklift.

An employee was troubleshooting the operation of a canning labeler.  He removed a guard to clean the belt and pulley power transmission system and the machine unexpectedly started, amputating the employee's index finger in the power transmission system.
On 6/17/15, an employee was hospitalized after falling in the bottle return room and breaking ribs.
A framing employee was admitted to the hospital after trusses the employee was standing on broke causing the employee to fall approximately 9 feet.
An employee fell from a 3-foot high deck truss and caught an adjacent truss just under his ribcage causing a blood vessel to rupture resulting in significant internal bleeding. He was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a broken forearm while changing a coil on a tire machine.

The employee was trying to remove the mast from the forklift that was being held by a chain fall.  He bumped the stuck mast to lower it and it fell.  His arms were caught under the cross piece of the mast.

An electrician at the Ford Motor plant was driving a scissor lift. He stopped the lift to begin work on an electrical panel.  When he stopped the lift it rocked, causing his hand to get caught between the lift basket and the electrical panel.  His left pinky finger was crushed resulting in the amputation of the fingertip.
An employee sustained an injury to the right hand after being exposed to a caught in hazard.

One employee from Chevron and two employees from Exterran were putting  compressors back on line when a rupture on the discharge line occurred.  The Chevron employee was taken to the hospital to removed debris from his left leg and released.  One Exterran employee was not injured and the other employee received a scratch above eye requiring first aid only.
An employee's hand got caught in a machine while attempting to make repairs.
An employee's left bicep was cut by a chain saw while the employee was cutting a tree.
An employee pushing five screen doors felt pain in his back and had difficulty breathing. The employee was hospitalized with a collapsed lung.
On 6/18/2015, an employee was operating a band saw in the frame mill section to cut a piece of wood. A portion of the employee's right thumb (half of nail) was cut off.
An employee was struck-by a manually operated pallet jack as he was moving a load of boxes.
Hydraulic fluid injected into the finger of an employee working on a forklift.

An employee was operating a hydraulic-activated torque wrench to bolt up a flange. The hydraulic hose to the wrench developed a leak. The employee was injured when high pressure hydraulic fluid penetrated his right hand. The hydraulic wrench was a rental unit. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a forklift to unload equipment when he accidentally disabled the parking brake while getting out of the forklift to readjust the load. The forklift started rolling toward him.  In the process of getting out of the way of the forklift, his thigh got cut on the deck of the forklift.  He was hospitalized and received stitches.
An employee on a rear-loader garbage truck fell off the back of the truck.
An employee fell off the roof at a jobsite at New River Marine Corps Station, hitting his head and hurting his back.  He was hospitalized.
An employee was locking the utility chip box with a pin. The pin was not properly inserted and the box started to come down and crushed his right hand, amputating his right index finger.
While cutting a small tree into sections, an employee's left foot was cut by the chain saw he was operating.

An employee on a forklift reached out with her right hand to hit a button to activate the dock door.  Her foot slipped off the brake of the forklift. The forklift rolled forward and the employee's arm was caught between the upright on the forklift and a bollard post. She sustained a laceration to her forearm that required stitches and overnight hospitalization.
An employee was using a 10,000 PSI water blaster and contacted his right foot resulting in a severe laceration.
An employee was helping to cut a hole into a roof to install a new air conditioning unit when he fell through the hole about 10 to 12 feet.
A door clamp came down while an employee was holding onto the door. The employee pulled his hand away, resulting in an avulsion of the right middle finger, which had to be medically amputated.
An employee was repairing an underground propane tank gauge when the propane ignited a fire. The employee sustained second and third degree burns requiring hospitalization.

An employee reached for something hanging on the back of his trailer and fell into a pit that was approximately 10-feet 6-inches deep, fracturing the left femur, shoulder, and right ankle. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee tripped while walking into the break room, shattering her elbow and sustaining bruising.
An employee's left ring fingertip was amputated on June 18, 2015, after reaching his hand in a repelletizer to clear a jam.
An employee was exposed to a live electrical wire while on a ladder installing insulation to the ceiling. The employee came in contact with the wiring.

On or about June 19, 2015, at 11:00 p.m., a 3' x 5' roller rolled over an employee's foot while rolling asphalt.  The employee was working on a Route I-91 jobsite in Enfield, Connecticut. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was on a cat walk operating an ADL boom loader crane. The truck part of the crane started moving forward. The employee got out of the operator's seat and jumped off of the cat walk onto the truck bed, fracturing his right leg.
An employee fell and broke his left arm while descending from an 8-foot step ladder.
An employee was working in a parked trailer at the distribution center when he tripped and fell.
An employee was injured while operating an overhead crane when the beam being lifted shifted and fell from the hooks, landing on the employee's right ankle.

An employee operating a tractor trailer backed the trailer up to the dock. The employee stopped just before the dock to open the trailer doors; as he opened up the left trailer door, he saw a double stacked pallet start to fall from the trailer. He was not able to get out of the way and was struck by the pallet and knocked to the ground. The employee fractured his right hip and right femur, requiring surgery and hospitalization.

An employee was showing another employee how to weld frames and the trainee accidentally contacted the trainer's arm with the hot welding rod. The trainer was wearing an approved welding sleeve. The resulting injury became infected and the employee was hospitalized for treatment.

Two employees were taking measurements under the Route 219 bridge to prepare for their next cut on the bridge. The bridge collapsed. One of the employees was hospitalized for head, neck, and spinal injuries. The other employee was treated for a broken ankle.
An employee sustained an amputation of the left ring fingertip while operating a drill press.
An employee put his hand in the print roller area of an envelope machine to clean it. The machine was operating at the time. He sustained a right-hand pinky finger amputation.
An employee fell down a flight of stairs while showing an apartment. She sustained ankle injuries that required surgery.
An employee's pinky fingertip on the right hand was removed while troubleshooting a problem with the aeration system in a grain bin.
An employee broke their leg while fixing a ceiling.
An employee fell approximately 40 feet through the roof of a building.
On June 19, 2015, an employee missed a step while dismounting from the cab of a front loader truck. He twisted his left knee when he contacted the ground, requiring surgery and hospitalization.

An employee was removing the ejection plate from a mold while a crane was being used to "take a strain" on the plate. The employee was under the mold, which was sitting on saw horses, using a wrench to remove bolts. As he was removing the bolts, the mold shifted and broke his ankle.
An employee was using a hold-down clamp to position material to be sheared. While adjusting the hold-down clamp, the machine cycled, crushing and amputating the tip of his right-hand middle finger.
An employee was spotting for a forklift driver who was moving a crate. The forklift hit a stack of crates, which shifted and caused a second crate to fall on the employee, cutting him on the head.

An employee's hand was in the danger zone of a Hydro machine when a coworker powered up the machine. Three of the employee's fingers were crushed, and one was surgically amputated. The machine guard was not in place at the time of the incident.
An employee fell 12 feet through a floor opening on the 6th floor to the 5th floor. His harness was not attached at the time.

A summer employee was tasked with weed whacking brush on a hill at the amusement area.  He slipped while mowing the hill and severed the tips of three toes.  He was hospitalized where surgery was performed to repair the toes.

An employee's right arm got caught in a conveyor belt system while the employee tried to remove a piece of glass that was stuck on the conveyor belt. The employee's right arm contacted a rotary pulley, causing a laceration to the bicep area. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was working at the 5-foot level of a 10-foot step ladder. The employee fell to the concrete ground below, breaking the left ankle and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was changing the oil and air filter on a septic tank truck. The employee turned and slipped, falling approximately 3.5 feet to the ground below. He was hospitalized for injuries to his back.
An employee was walking in a designated walking area when she was struck by a forklift from behind.

A maintenance employee was trying to free a log jam on the DDM6 machine. The machine was locked and tagged out at the time. He was using a sledge hammer to break the log loose. The sledge hammer slipped, and the employee's left thumb became stuck between the hammer head and the blade on the machine.
An employee's left index fingertip was amputated when it got pinched between a road plate while rigging the plate to a backhoe bucket with a lift chain.
An employee was installing shingles on a roof approximately 20 feet above ground level. The employee fell and was hospitalized. Fall protection was in place at the time.
While cleaning the plunge plate of a pole using a foot pedal, an employee's left foot fractured after getting caught  between the pole and the ladder.

An employee was lifting an 8 ft. x 20 ft. 1/4" flat sheet of steel with a crane to be transported to the burn table to be cut when it slipped out of the lifting plate clamp and fell on his right foot.  He sustained four fractures in his right foot.
A door hit an employee's elbow and forearm, causing a hematoma.
An employee lost their balance and fell while assisting a patient in the bathroom, requiring hospitalization.

An employee appeared to be overheated after installing tires and wheels during the day. The employer asked him to rest. After about 30 minutes, he did not appear to be getting better, so the employer asked him to go home. He was eventually hospitalized.
An employee fell approximately 3 feet when descending from a 1-tier baker scaffold being used for insulation operations on a residential construction project.

An employee fell off the back of a golf cart while trying to get raccoons out of a dumpster. The employee was standing on the back of the golf cart while a coworker was in the driver's seat. The coworker moved the golf cart forward, causing the employee to fall to the ground and sustain an iliac crest fracture. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee had a finger amputated and other fingers crushed while utilizing a skid steer to move stone from a pile into the back of a truck. His fingers were crushed against the back of the truck when he reached for the dash bar resulting in injury to fingers on both hands.

An employee was pumping concrete onto the fifth floor of an apartment complex. The employee's foot became entangled in the hose, which dragged the employee through the corridor and over the balcony onto the ground below.
An employee was hospitalized after being bitten by an insect due to infection.
While working at a residential property, an employee came in contact with an energized electrical wire. As a result, the employee received an electric shock and was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was using de-burring tools to remove burrs from a 25 inch metal diaphragm weighing 135 pounds. Two 2x2s were lying flat on a metal table and the diaphragm was placed on top. The employee had finished de-burring the top side of the diaphragm and was in the process of manually flipping it over when the 2x2 on the left side kicked out and the employee's left hand got caught between the fins on the diaphragm and the metal table, amputating the middle fingertip.
An employee suffered burns on his right leg while using a gas saw to cut steel. The employee was cutting steel when the sparks from the gas saw ignited his jeans. He was hospitalized.

A maintenance employee was completing inspections of the battery charging unit. He was in a caged area that elevated him three levels high, approximately 15 feet from the floor. He was lowering himself and believed he was on the ground level. He raised the guardrail bar and stepped out, falling 4-5 feet to the concrete floor below. The employee suffered a back injury and was admitted to the hospital.
Employees were dismantling a scaffolding stairway to make entry into the pro scrubber. The scaffold collapsed when the scaffold cross brace was taken off and the cross brace struck two employees.
In the meat market, an employee sustained a partial finger amputation when using a meat band saw to cut meat.
An employee slipped and fell while going down stairs and broke his leg.

An employee was emptying a hopper on a forklift when his hand slipped from the release lever. His finger got caught between the forks and the hopper. His left index fingertip was pinched off, requiring surgical removal to the first knuckle.
An employee working on an incline belt was caught between two rollers, breaking her left arm.
An employee was cutting a stump with a chain saw when the tree fell over and rolled into the employee, fracturing his pelvis.

An employee was changing a chemical in a cleaning tank on a plating line when the tank exploded. The chemical, Sirprep 309EC, is an electrical cleaner; it contacted the employee, and he suffered serious chemical burns on 20 percent of his body.
An employee walking on the ground level tripped over a ladder and fell on the ground, requiring hospitalization for a broken hip.
A truck driver fell as he was getting into or out of the driver's side of his truck.  The employee was hospitalized with numerous bodily injuries.
An employee was off loading a counter top and the load slipped. He tried to catch it and his right middle finger was caught between the counter and the truck bed.

A contract truck driver from another company delivered material at the well site and left without unhooking a hose. As the driver drove away, the hose broke and struck an employee, breaking the employee's femur. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee amputated the tip of the little finger on the right hand while operating a Model 1200 Powermatic drill press.
An employee was cleaning a clogged strainer on a pump. Upon removal of the strainer, stored up steam was released and burned the employee's face, chest and right arm.
