An employee was operating the Reed Thread Roll Machine with the guard removed. He pressed the button to operate the machine and it did not cycle. He then stuck his left hand into the machine to diagnose the problem and his left index finger was caught in the machine resulting in an amputation above the first knuckle.
An employee operating an ATV made a left turn and the ATV slid on some gravel causing it to roll over and throwing the employee from the ATV. The employee landed on his shoulder and broke ribs.
Employees were exposed to fall hazards while working on the scaffold.
An employee was walking around the laser control when he tripped on the corner of the pallet and fractured his hip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was transferring wash material from one level to another using a scaffold ladder. He  fell backwards and fractured his back. He as admitted to the hospital.

An employee grabbed the boards as they started to jam up on the conveyor belt for the trim saw.  The employee was pushing a group of boards into another board when the board kicked back forcing the employee's hand into the conveyor belt and amputating the tip of the employee's right thumb.

An employee was spray painting for the second part of the day. He cleaned up his tools and was walking to his car. His legs became wobbly and the supervisor put him in a golf cart to cool him off. He collapsed and was taken by ambulance to the hospital.
A Readymix driver was deploying a cement chute at a job site when his right fore fingertip was pinched by the chute.
An agent fell and hit his/her head.
An employee was cleaning the LMC machine's (glue machine) rollers and caught his right index finger in the chain and sprocket apparatus. His finger was amputated at the first digit.
An employee reached under equipment to retrieve an item on the floor and caught her hair in a rotating shaft resulting in a scalping injury.

An employee was working alone on 6/22/15 setting up TOFC rollers that carry cargo into tractor trailers. The TOFC rollers became loose and struck the employee in the head. The employee suffered head trauma and lacerations to his ear.

A temporary employee suffered a partial amputation of the distal phalanx (fingertip bone) on her right hand. The employee's finger was caught between the metal spindle of a fabric roller and the "pay-out cradle" when she was loading an 87 pound canvas roll into the cutting machine. The cause of the amputation was not related to the fabric cutting mechanism. The amputation was a result of her finger being pinched between the end of the fabric spindle that extends through the shaft of the fabric roll and the cradle which holds that spindle in place.
An employee was injured during a horseback ride when the horse was spooked and flipped over, crushing the employee and injuring her pelvis.
While the employee was bending two pieces of rebar, his left hand pinky finger was pinched by the roller. As he pulled his hand off the glove, the tip of his finger was amputated.
A temporary employee suffered a broken leg after he fell about 44 inches while on a refractory brick cart.

An employee was helping to place a motor on the bed of a truck using a forklift. He reached under the forks to unhook a chain when the forks came down crushing his hand and forearm.  No bones were broken, but he suffered severe bruising and a compression injury. The employee's arm was lanced from the wrist to the elbow to relieve internal pressure.
A temporary employee suffered a severe laceration while operating a wood jointer.
An employee stepped off a ladder onto the roof of a home and fell approximately 10 feet.
An employee finished placing roofing materials on the roof for the customer and as he was stepping onto the ladder, he fell 10 feet to the ground resulting in broken vertebrae.

An employee splicing communication cables pricked himself with a piece of rusted metal debris that was on the ground. Later in the day the wound became infected and the employee was admitted to the hospital for treatment.
An employee amputated the tip of his right hand while clearing a jam on the sealer 2 machine.

On a worksite managed by Whiting-Turner Contracting Company, an employee of Concrete Coring Company of St. Louis, was drilling a hole in bedrock using a core drill. Employees of Gold Mechanical, a plumbing contractor on the worksite, were conducting a live test of piping using pneumatic air. The injured employee was working adjacent to a pipe included in the live test. A cap from the pipe was propelled at a high velocity by the pneumatic air and struck the injured employee in the face and fracturing his jaw. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was on top of a scaffold performing dry blasting operations. The employee was kneeling to reach the lower area and lost balance. The employee blasted the left hand and was hospitalized as a result of the injury.

A limousine service employee was taking a customer to the airport.  After dropping off luggage with the customer, the employee turned to get back into his vehicle and his knee gave out resulting in a broken ankle. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was changing a fuse in a 440v electric panel when the fuse engaged, causing an arc flash that shorted out the panel and sent out a ball of fire. The employee received first and second degree burns on his face and hands. The employee was wearing safety glasses at the time of the incident.

Two employees were in the process of setting up cones to define a control zone in order to start painting traffic lanes. A passing driver struck the company vehicle and one of the two employees who was hospitalized with non-life threatening injuries.

Two employees were pulling wire from one panel to another panel. One panel was energized; the other panel was not. The employee who was working at the energized panel came in contact with the live wires and suffered electrical burns to his hand (277 volt).
An employee was pushing a small part on a table saw when his hand slipped and he amputated the tip of his left thumb.
An employee was struck by and ran over by a forklift.
An employee was injured while setting up a rotating rack used to display canes. The employee suffered a corneal abrasion to the left eye.

On or about 6/22/2015, an employee was attacked by a dog while carrying mail on his route. He sustained severe lacerations to his legs, arms, and face. He was taken to the hospital and received 30 stitches in his nose and 6 stitches in his hand.

An employee was repairing an electrical flash butt welding machine while it was energized. The rail clamp engaged and crushed the employee's right middle and index fingers. The fingertips were surgically removed.

The employer found out through the workers comp carriers on 06/22/2015 at 5:47 pm that an employee was hospitalized and filed a workers comp claim. The employee was at work catering planes. After the second flight he stated that he was dehydrated. He was experiencing pain in his back and chest, dizziness, and was blacking out.
An employee opened the drum and pail kettle to look inside. The cover fell in. The agitator spun the cover around and knocked the employee off the platform resulting in an approximate six foot fall.
An employee severed the left thumb tip off including the entire nail while operating a band saw to process pork roast into chops.

An employee was working near a shelter that was being assembled, walking on a catwalk.  The employee walked onto a section where the catwalk had not yet been fully assembled and fell approximately 5 feet, fracturing the top of his left femur.

An employee was troubleshooting problems with the tooling on a mill roll. As part of the troubleshooting process, he had to feel the polished mill roll for imperfections as the machine was running. As he was feeling the roll with his hand, the roll pulled his hand into razor sharp sheet metal that is formed in the mill machine. Contact with the mill roll partially severed the tip of the employee's left index finger. The employee was hospitalized, and his fingertip was medically removed.
An employee was inside a sewer hole and was turning on a jetting tool when the pressure caused the hose to whip around and strike the employee's lip and elbow.
An employee working on a scaffold breaking off rebar by hand lost his balance and fell over the wall 13 feet to the ground.

An employee was removing plastic tote containers from a tractor trailer. As the employee pulled on the totes, they caught on a piece of the trailer and tumbled over on top of the employee. The employee was taken to the hospital and given a medication that caused an allergic reaction. He was  held overnight for observation due to the allergic reaction.
An employee was climbing a ladder with a caulking gun, lost his footing, and fell six feet injuring the right ankle and the left elbow. The ankle injury required surgery.
An employee was hospitalized when a pneumatic nail gun exploded causing fragments to be embedded in the right thigh and lacerating the right arm.

While cleaning the outside of a bulk meat grinder, an employee's right hand was amputated when he reached through a sample grinder port. This incident took place at approximately 9:00 PM on 6/23/15. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was using a stationary welder with a foot pedal. When she placed the nut within the electrodes she accidentally stepped on the pedal and the welder activated.
Two employees were assaulted by a fellow employee.
An employee operating a powered floor jack inadvertently steered the jack toward himself, pinning his left lower leg between the powered jack and an adjacent storage racking system.

An employee received a partial amputation injury to his left middle finger. The employee was helping to pick up a 55 gallon drum that had fallen/tipped off a forklift when the employee's finger became caught between the drum and the forklift, resulting in injury.
Two employees were shocked by an overhead power line while performing right-of-way clearing along the side of State Route 166.
An employee was walking past another employee who was operating a chain saw and contacted the chain saw.
An employee was exposed to crushing-hazards and sustained serious injuries.

An employee was installing drywall from a 2-foot scaffold. There was a 5-by-5 foot opening adjacent to the scaffold. The scaffold was on an incline and rolled down the slope into the hole.  Once the scaffold hit the hole, the employee flew from the scaffold and made contact with the concrete, breaking three ribs, bruising the right shoulder, and cutting the forehead.
A framer fell down a temporary stairway.

An employee was changing a tire in one of the presses when he reported that he had a light headache. His condition worsened to include nausea and blurry vision. The employee was taken to company healthcare provider and then to the emergency room. His illness was a result of dehydration.

An employee was working on a flour mill to remove a bolt using a breaker bar with a socket on end. The socket slipped off the nut and struck an unguarded moving belt. The breaker bar came back, hit the employee in his jaw and broke it.

On 6/23/15, an employee was hospitalized when he fell from a ladder. It was reported that the strap, which secured the ladder, broke. The employee fractured, broke, and dislocated bones in his right arm and left hand/wrist when he contacted the ground.

While reaching through a hole in a wall an employee stepped on a ladder that was leaning against the lower part of this opening. He stepped above the fulcrum of the ladder. Therefore, the ladder acted like a teeter-totter and the employee fell about two feet and broke his left ankle.

An employee operating a forklift machine went over to pick up a pallet from the floor. The employee was not aware that the machine was jammed.  The next pallet that came out of the machine fell on the employee.
An employee was using a grinder with a cutting blade to cut a stainless steel countertop from below when he sustained a deep cut to his right arm, requiring hospitalization.

An employee placed their hands at the end of the MRI table while a coworker was moving the table to position a patient for testing. The employee's finger got wedged and amputated by the movement of the table.
While a boom was being unlatched at a well site, the boom snapped and threw the pipe off, hitting an employee on the ground.
An employee suffered a partial finger amputation while handling a metal bin.

A temporary employee and three to four additional temporary and permanent employees were attempting to down-stack leaning pallets of product (canned and bottled beverages) from a stack of three loaded pallets. The stack was approximately 15-20 feet high. The pallets fell, for an unknown reason, and the temporary employee was pinned under product and pallets against the wall. He suffered a broken femur and fibula, broken ribs, a punctured lung, and a possible lacerated spleen. He was hospitalized.
An employee was leaning against a pallet while standing and talking to the store manager. The employee fell down to the floor and landed on his back. His head hit the concrete floor.
An employee fell off the back of a truck and sustained a head injury.
An employee was in ladder training.  He climbed 18 feet to the top of the pole. While coming down the ladder, the ladder turned and began to slide off the pole. The employee fell about 15 feet.

An employee was loading a side dump truck while working on a median at the intersection of Lincoln and Lamay in Ft Collins. The driver was given the signal to pull forward just as the injured employee slipped on the curb. The dump truck ran over the employee's leg.
An employee was operating an Accupress press brake and the tooling pinched his middle and ring fingers on his right hand.
An employee was hospitalized due to a flash fire at a compressor station while servicing a stage 2 compressor in Alexander, North Dakota.
An employee was using a boom when a piece of granite slab fell on the employee's leg.
An employee was lifting a roll of pallet film from the ground when he lost his balance and fell to the ground with the roll in his hand. The roll hit the ground and crushed his right index fingertip.

An employee was putting tools into a job box when another employee closed the lid, pinching his left middle fingertip in the handle, resulting in the tip being amputated up to the finger nail. The employee received stitches in the ER and was released on the same day.

An employee was manually turning the gate wheel of a 'Work In Progress' (WIP) storage bin in order to close the gate. He placed his left hand in between a sprocket and the gate wheel and amputated his fourth left finger.

An employee got his right foot and ankle caught in a pallet that was then pulled into the roller on the palletizer. When the pallet was rolling forward it cut his right ankle into the bone. The employee was hospitalized.
One employee was moving logs and one log rolled and caught his foot between the log and a chain.
An employee was hospitalized after being stung by a bee while walking on a powerline right of way.
An employee working construction showed signs of heat exhaustion. The employee taken to the hospital and given fluids and admitted for observation.
An employee was installing a pulley on a machine in the pipe yard. The pulley pulled the employee's left index finger into the machine, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was struck by an air hammer chisel, breaking a bone in his right foot.

An employee was changing a belt on an abrasive blasting machine. The employee placed the belt on the pulley while the machine was still turning. The pulley pulled his finger into the machine.  His left index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was working outside on a very hot day, helping another employee pull 4-inch coiled plastic pipe off a trailer when he started feeling sick, vomiting, and experiencing muscle cramps. He was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee was operating a grinder to sharpen a 6-inch blade when his left thumb got caught in the running grinder. The top of the thumb, including bone, was amputated.

An employee was pulling a plate with a come-a-long inside a pipe vessel.  A forklift was used as an anchor and stopping point for the vessel.  The plate became lodged in the vessel and the next time the employee pulled, the vessel moved and struck the employee on the right side of his body.

An employee was checking the quality of a previous job performed at the site location. The employee was descending a ladder when the ladder shifted. The employee's weight shifted, causing the hook to come off the wire.  The employee stepped off the ladder hard and fractured an ankle.

An employee and a coworker were rolling a cylindrical cyclone hopper down a passageway when the hopper became unbalanced and started to fall. As the employee attempted to catch and re-steady the hopper, his left pinky finger got caught between a metal flange on the hopper and a permanently fixed metal pipe of the building. The employee injured the left pinky finger; the fingertip was amputated at the hospital.
On June 8, 2015, an employee suffered a partial amputation of their right-hand middle finger.
An employee working near an auger hole was injured when something in the hole sparked, causing minor burns to the employee's right and left forearms and cheeks. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a heat-related injury while working when he started to cramp. His condition became critical by the end of his shift. He suffered renal failure and was hospitalized on 6/24/15.

An employee performing tree trimming for an easement lost control of a circle saw and was cut on the bicep of the right arm. He was working from an aerial lift along Rakestraw Road in LaGrange, Georgia.
An employee who became dizzy was hospitalized and treated for heat-related illness.

An employee was putting a 5-ton tool into the thermoformer with a cart. The tool was misaligned and was hitting the alignment block. When the employee reversed the cart, the tool fell off the thermoformer onto the floor, forcing the cart back. The employee was pinned between the cart and a conveyer, causing injuries to his ribs and lungs. He was hospitalized.

An employee was walking in a designated walkway though the warehouse on her way to the break room. A forklift driver drove a forklift into the walkway and did not see the employee. She was struck by the forklift blade on her ankle, and then fell to the concrete floor. She suffered lacerations and contusions to her ankle and thigh, as well as an unspecified head injury. She was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was handling pipe on the drilling rig. His right ring finger got caught between the thread protector and pipe collar.
An employee cut the tip of his left thumb while cutting carpet.
An employee was lifting a spool of wire weighing 82 pounds when he lost his grip. While trying to hold on to the spool, he felt a pop on his back and started feeling pain.
While walking into a refrigerated cooler, an employee slipped on the condensation on the floor, falling and breaking her left hip.

An employee climbed onto a pump-jack 
scaffold to finish some caulking work (26 feet above ground) on an apartment building. After finishing the area where he was caulking, he attempted to climb down from the pump-jack scaffold by placing his feet on the top safety rail of a third floor balcony guardrail. The safety guard rails were two temporary balcony guardrails made up of 2 X 4's placed across the balcony's edge. The top safety rail collapsed, and the employee fell to the ground between the pump-jack scaffold and patio area.
An employee reached into a packaging scale to clean out polyethylene packaging pellets and the pneumatic gate closed on his right hand.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while trying to unclog a conveyer. His finger was amputated while in the pulley of the drive mechanism.
Employee showed signs of heat exhaustion and was admitted to the hospital.
On or about June 24, 2015, at 9:30 a.m., the end third of an employee's second and third right-hand fingers were ground off while feeding meat into the industrial meat grinder.
An employee was cleaning a dough mixer when the mixer was operated, causing the employee to have one finger amputated and two other fingers fractured and severely injured.

A pile up of tiles occurred on line 8. An employee attempted to turn the conveyor off at the switch. The employee was looking at the pile while his hand was aimed at the switch. His hand missed the switch and the back of his hand made contact with the pulley and guard causing a laceration.
An employee was shot in the back.
On or about June 24, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation of the left-hand thumb after coming in contact with the circular blade on the "Jump Saw" located in the wood working area.
An employee was placing brush at the table side of a wood chipper when a piece of wood struck his hand, crushing it at the chipper-side locking mechanism and causing a fingertip amputation.

On June 25, 2015, an employee was repairing a skeet machine in the back shop area, removing a leaky gear box from the side of the machine. When he removed the gear box, the main spring engaged, and the throwing arm released and struck the employee in the face. He received multiple fractures to both sides of the lower jaw, requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee suffered a heat-related injury requiring hospitalization.
An employee was retrieving a 14-pound pallet. When he turned, he tripped over a rack on the floor and hit the ground with his right hip.
An employee was dismounting the cab of a tractor. His foot became stuck on the step and he fell, dislocating his hip.

An employee banged a knee on an outdoor air conditioning unit and sustained a minor cut that was treated as first aid. The employee later noticed swelling and was eventually hospitalized for an aggressive type of infection.
An employee was on a ladder changing a light bulb when she fell to the floor below. She was hospitalized with head trauma and a concussion.
An employee fell from a flatbed trailer while attempting to secure the load, injuring his back.

An employee fell 15 feet to the ground from an extension ladder while moving a drop line on a residential structure. He sustained multiple injuries to his right arm, right leg, and pelvis and was hospitalized.
While placing cardboard pieces into a stapler to create a box for shipping, an employee stapled their right-hand index fingertip, requiring surgical amputation.

An employee was dispatched to a parts distributor to pick up parts. The employee was standing by the loading dock. While doing so, a truck backed up to the dock and pinned the employee against the dock.
While removing a rack from the top shelf in a cooler, an employee experienced a groin injury that required surgery.
An employee's pinky fingertip was amputated when a door shut on it.
An employee slipped and fell, resulting in several fractures and a torn arm muscle.

An employee was assisting in remediation work to include asbestos removal and duct work. The employee was on the roof of a gymnasium when the roof vent on which he was standing/sitting collapsed. The employee fell approximately 15 feet to the lower level. The employee broke his right ankle and right arm as a result of the fall.
An employee collapsed at the fuel pumps for unknown reasons.
An employee laying out a curb line on a road construction project was hit in the work zone by a privately driven vehicle. The employee suffered broken ribs.
An employee was injured when he reached to retrieve a piece from a 100-inch cutter and slipped on oil. The employee struck his face against the frame of the machine, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was injured while operating a pallet jack at Doyle's Wholesale. The pallet jack ran over the employee's foot, requiring reconstructive surgery.
An employee was bitten by a dog while providing physical therapy services at a client's home.
An employee transporting asphalt on a roof tripped and fell, injuring his/her hands and wrists.
An employee was sweating profusely when he came out of the painting booth where he was working. His condition worsened and he was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was injured while cleaning a crusher machine. The employee's left index fingertip was amputated.

On 6/25/15, at 10:30 a.m., an employee was riding her personal Segway on a street at the Navy base.  While between buildings, she hit a dip or pothole in the roadway and lost control of her vehicle.  She crashed her vehicle and was hospitalized overnight for a hip area fracture.
An employee's left pinky fingertip was lacerated when caught in a slip knot during the start-up of the Line 10 machine. The fingertip was amputated during treatment.

An employee was walking towards the copy machine when he fell down on the ceramic floor, causing pain to the back of the head and lower back, as well as a temporary loss of consciousness. He was hospitalized.
An employee was using a step ladder to perform maintenance in the ceiling when he fell, breaking his left femur and requiring hospitalization.
An employee suffered arc flash burns while performing electrical work on an energized bus.

On or about June 25, 2015, an employee working at the Army Corp of Engineers Ensley Engineering Yard located at 2915 Riverport Rd in Memphis, Tennessee, was injured and hospitalized. The employee was operating a forklift to move an air conditioning unit up a ramp when it began to fall backwards.  The employee was injured when he was caught between the forklift and the wall of the dry dock, resulting in a severe laceration to his left wrist.

An employee was helping to attach a trailer to a pick-up truck by guiding the trailer as the driver backed up the truck. As the driver was backing up, his foot slipped off the brake, catching the employee between the truck and trailer.
On June 25, 2015, an employee's left middle fingertip was amputated after getting caught in a machine during process set up.
An employee's right middle finger was amputated in the slurry room of the chemical department when he contacted the rotating belts on the slurry pump.
An employee was struck and pinned by a car when it moved forward instead of backwards in a garage.
An employee was hospitalized for an infection to the forearm as a result of receiving a laceration while handling a davit crank handle.
An employee working from an 8-foot step ladder fell from the sixth rung approximately 69 inches.  At the time of the incident, the employee was working to brace a wood frame panel.
An employee slicing lemons with a knife suffered a fingertip amputation.
An employee was attempting to move a stuck 3000-pound pallet onto a pop-up chain when his finger got caught between the pallet and conveyor frame, amputating it at the nail bed.

An employee amputated a fingertip while operating a filling machine. The employee was operating the tube filler machine to fill empty tubes with paint. The machine's trimming blade jammed. The employee tried to clear the jam and while a finger was in the nip point, the machine cycled, amputating the tip of his finger.

On Friday 6/26/2015, at 9:00 a.m., a maintenance employee was driving, putting a brand new pin into the backhoe/excavator bucket with a slug hammer. A piece of metal from the new pin broke off, struck him and was imbedded in his shoulder. The injury required hospitalization.
Six 150-pound boxes fell over on top of an employee, causing injuries to his lower extremities, which included breaking both legs.
An employee fell approximately 16 feet through a roof opening and struck his head on a table.

An employee was transferring a hoist in need of repairs from the I beam that it worked on to a rail attached to a crane. While disconnecting the two I beams, the rail jumped up, striking the support for the permanent rail and amputating the employee's third distal joint of the thumb on the left hand.

An employee was injured when picking up some steel plates from a pallet. When one piece of steel started to slip, he tried to catch it with the other hand.  His middle finger became pinched between two pieces of steel. He required surgery.

An employee was using a zero-turn riding mower to mow a lawn. The employee slumped forward; as he did so, his left hand was pulled under the mower deck. His left ring finger was amputated, and the blade of the mower sliced into his hand. He was hospitalized.

An employee was assembling a mast on a forklift. The employee's fingers were caught in a pinch point, which resulted in severe lacerations of the middle, ring, and pinky fingers. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.
An employee was sitting in a parked tow truck at 3400 Hwy 75, Richardson, Texas, when another vehicle hit the tow truck from behind.
An employee climbed an 8-foot ladder to get into the crawl space in the ceiling and fell.
On or about June 26, 2015, at approximately 1240 hrs. an employee for J&M Energy Services suffered the amputation of the distal phalanx of his right thumb when it was caught in a pumping unit.

An employee tried to start a tractor from the outside. The tractor had not been checked to see if it was in gear at the time and it moved forward. The employee got caught by the shredder and was knocked down. The tractor ran over his legs. He was hospitalized with a pelvis broken in two areas.
An employee became sick after being bitten by a spider.

An employee was injured when the steel plate (3000 pounds) he was fitting became unattached, striking him and pinning him between two steel plates. He suffered injuries to his right arm and the right side of his abdomen, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was mowing the lawn when an object became tangled in the mower blade. When the employee attempted to remove the object, his right index finger was amputated. The mower was not turned off at the time of the incident.

A maintenance employee was troubleshooting a dust collector that was getting clogged. The employee disconnected the dust collector but did not disconnect the wheelabrator, which continued to rotate. The employee suffered a partial amputation to his right index finger.
An employee suffered injuries to their right foot after being struck by an I-beam.
An employee was removing shims from a pump motor when a tool slipped and partially amputated the employee's left index fingertip.
An employee was loading de-headed catfish onto a filet machine. His hand got caught in the saddle, amputating the right pinky fingertip.

On Saturday, 06/27/2015, an employee was on a roof deck cleaning up after installing a roof parapet when he picked up a piece of plywood and fell through the hole that was underneath, falling approximately 16 feet and breaking his pelvis.
An employee injured his right leg when he tripped over a cord and fell.
While standing on the pavement, an employee was pulling on a rope connected to a truck tarp.  The rope broke and the employee fell fracturing his ankle.
An employee working for Tecnico Corporation at the BAE facility stepped off the ladder and broke his leg.

An employee was loading sawdust onto a live bottom trailer using a small yard dog that he hooked to the trailer. The trailer got stuck in a hole and turned onto the left hand side, and the employee sustained an injury to his back, fractured ribs, an elbow wound that required surgery, and a concussion.
An employee tripped on her chair and fell, fracturing her femur bone.
An employee's left pinky finger was amputated while working with the baler machine.
An employee was servicing a mold servicing tire press when the press cycled and crushed the pinky and ring fingers and part of the right hand. The employee was hospitalized.

A maintenance employee was troubleshooting an automatic tool changer (ATC) on a lathe. The employee thought the ATC was stopped when he stuck his hand in to check the alignment. At that point, the ATC cycled, nipping the tip of his left 2nd finger.
On June 27, at approximately 2:00 p.m., an employee riding on the back of a golf cart fell off and struck his head on the pavement.
An employee's foot got crushed between two motorized pallet jacks, resulting in in-patient hospitalization.
An employee suffered a laceration to the first digit of the right hand ring finger, requiring amputation above the first digit.
An employee lost a finger in a part revolution press while removing a jammed part or scrap.
An employee fell from a ladder, sustaining a concussion and fracture of the wrist.
At the Respiratory Care Services area, an employee experienced respiratory distress from exposure to bleach.
On June 28, 2015, at approximately 0900 hrs., an employee was bitten on the finger by a patient.
At an HEB in McAllen, an employee lifted a case of product, which consisted of six 3-Liter bottles, and strained his back.
An employee missed a step and slipped on the stairs coming out of the sound booth.  She sustained a compound fracture of her right fibula and crushed her right ankle.
An employee received second and third degree burns when his leg broke through a crust on a pit with molten metal.
Two trucks collided in the distribution yard. One employee was hospitalized to receive treatment for broken ribs, a punctured left lung, and spleen removal.

An employee was operating an overhead crane to move steel coils. While raising the crane to remove the lifting chain, the employee had his right hand on the lifting chain. The end of the chain got stuck and started to pull the coil towards an adjacent coil. The employee's right ring and middle fingers were pinched between the coil and lifting chain. The employee required surgery.
An employee working as maintenance staff was removing tight screws with a wrench when the wrench slipped off and hit him in the neck, causing a hematoma.
An employee lost his balance while throwing out garbage from a concrete truck platform.  The employee fell approximately 5.5 feet on to his left elbow and required hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized with a punctured lung after a cart of healthcare linens rolled off a mechanical trailer lift.

An employee placed his right hand on top of a the cylinder of a tamping machine. The tamper came down onto the cylinder, pinching his right little finger and causing an injury that required the amputation of a portion of the right little finger.
An employee's right-hand index finger was amputated while repairing a 48" metal polisher.

An employee was working at DFW Terminal E, cleaning out the debris of an extension joint, when an electric hammer tipped over and fell on the employee's hand. The employee sustained a fractured left middle finger.
An employee was cleaning off an 8' by 4' concrete form when it tipped over, striking his leg and fracturing his femur.

On June 29, 2015, an employee was speaking with a supervisor in the packaging area. Following the conversation, she started to return to her work area at the ovens. She crossed through the transparent curtain adjacent to the packaging area. She crossed into the walkway where it intersects a forklift route. 

A forklift driver was also approaching the intersection. He reported that he slowed and used his horn as he approached the intersection. He did not see her due to an obstructed view. T
he forklift driver continued driving through the intersection. The employee was struck by the forklift and fell to the floor. She suffered a compound fracture to her left ankle and lacerations to her forehead. Her foot/leg was amputated 5-6" below the knee.
An employee's left middle fingertip was amputated when it was pinched between two rack legs that were being bolted together.

While sending air through a pipe for cleaning purposes, an employee used a hammer to hit the pressurized pipe to unclog it. As the employee struck the pipe, a strainer (which lined the inside of the cap) flew off, striking the employee in the forehead. The employee sustained a fracture to the eye socket and skull, which required surgery.

An employee was clearing a clogged dust collector pipe. The employee was standing on a home-made platform that had been elevated approximately 10 feet in the air by a forklift.  The platform measured approximately 12-feet long by 42-inches wide.  The employee stepped off to the side of the platform where the platform was not supported by the forks, and the platform tipped from the forks.  The employee fell approximately 10 feet to the ground below.  The employee sustained nine broken ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee fell while exiting a forklift and hit his head on the concrete floor.

On Monday June 29, 2015, at approximately 10:30 p.m., two maintenance employees were servicing a FLEXO press no. 9 in the FLEXO department. The FLEXO press no. 9 feeds bags for in-printing on the roller. The employee was tightening the driver side chain on the press and then proceeded to check the tension with his right hand to see if it was tight enough. The employee's right hand index finger became caught in the chain and sprocket pinch point resulting in a fracture injury. It is unknown at this time if the sprocket was operating or was manually moved by the injured employee.
An employee suffered renal/kidney failure and severe dehydration while on the job driving a fuel truck, requiring hospitalization.
An employee's right heel was caught in an auger while installing a choke ring on a press in the processing room. The auger caused lacerations/a fracture to his right heel.
An employee was bending sheet metal with a sheet metal bender when some of it got into a bind. As he was working to unbind the sheet metal, a piece popped up and cut him on the right bicep.
An employee fell from a ladder and was injured.

A crew member was attempting to remove a blockage in a 2" discharge line on mud pump #2 when it released, striking him in the right calf and knocking him to the ground.  The crew member was taken to the hospital for medical evaluation and treatment and then transferred to another hospital for surgery and further treatment.
An employee had a possible electric shock when performing phase-to-ground work.
A pipe moving on and with a conveyor belt struck an employee's leg. The employee's leg got caught  between the wall of the conveyor and the pipe, fracturing the employee's leg.

An employee was lifting a cylinder plate (measurements: 7.5 inches tall x 59 inches in diameter, weight 350lbs.) off of a work table to make an adjustment. The part dropped, striking her left foot and resulting in a fracture of the big and second toe, as well as an open dislocation to the third toe. She required surgery.
An employee sustained a facial fracture when attempting to remove a hose from a water pump.
An employee received burn and crush injuries while engaging in maintenance/repair work.
An employee's knee gave out and the employee fell, incurring a mild concussion.
An employee was working at Liberty Tire Recycling when his glove got stuck in the tail end of the pulley area of the conveyor belt and his right middle fingertip was severed.
An employee fell backwards and struck his head while positioning a pallet with a rope that let loose. He was hospitalized as a result of his head injury.
An employee was using their right leg as a work rest while cutting tubing with a razor blade. The employee sustained a severe right leg laceration and was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was helping coworkers trying to undo tension on a 1.5 ton come-a-long. The injured employee struck the angle brace that the come-a-long was attached to. The hook of the come-a-long broke free, striking the employee in the lower jaw/face.
An employee was struck by a rolling power pole and was pinned between the line truck and pole.

An employee was performing a custodial task outside when he felt light-headed. He went back inside and was standing on the dock area with his hands and head resting on the shovel he was holding when he fainted, falling to the ground and striking his head. He was hospitalized for stitches and plastic surgeon care.
At night, an employee was walking to his truck and was hit by a yard tractor.
On 6/29/2015, at 12:30 p.m., an employee was backed into by a company pickup truck, which knocked him down. The tires ran over his legs (knees).

An employee reached between the line and the splash board to retrieve a chicken tender. The employee's hand was pulled forward on the line. She pulled her hand from the machine, which caused an amputation to her left index finger.
An employee was putting a trench box together.  The employee's finger got stuck between the wall and the horizontal spacing bar when the box was lifted.

On June 29, 2015, at 7:00 p.m., an employee was operating a hoist to lift beef when his finger got bumped between the hook of the hoist and the rail, fracturing his index finger. The injury required surgery.
An employee was on an extension ladder resting on the truck's flat bed. The ladder slipped under him; he fell, broke his nose, and was hospitalized.

An employee was taking the cavity out of a cracked mold that weighs between 200 and 300 pounds. A chain was attached to the top of the mold to hold it in place. As the slack was being taken out of chain to lift the mold, the employee reached up to adjust the chain.  His left middle finger was caught between the mold and the chain, severing the finger.  His finger was able to be re-attached during surgery.
The employee was operating a Bobtail truck delivering fuel.  The employee was exiting the cab of the Bobtail truck and slipped and fell.
An employee was walking through the pallet aisles when his left foot was run over by a forklift.

An employee was delivering a truckload to a customer on 6/30/15.  He was shifting freight to the edge of the trailer for customer access by pulling a chain attached to the freight. At approximately 12:05 PM, the chain broke or became detached and the employee fell out of the back of the trailer approximately four feet to the ground. He was admitted to the hospital for in-patient care of three broken ribs and a bruised lung.

An employee was unloading a truck using a PIV. He backed the PIV out of the truck and noticed that some stock had fallen. He got off the PIV without setting the parking brake. The PIV rolled forward and pinched the employee's leg between the pallet and the side of the truck.
An employee was working near a conveyor when the conveyor grabbed his shirt and pulled his arm into the machine, injuring his right hand.
An employee was troubleshooting a sensor on a pallet table for a laser machine.  The table moved and struck the employee breaking the employee's lower leg.
An employee was fixing a jam on an automated saw while the saw was still on and the employee fell. The employee was hospitalized and sustained a broken shoulder blade.
An employee was using a 10ft rolling ladder to restock shelves. She lost her balance and fell fracturing the left leg.  The ladder's wheels were not locked out at the time of the incident.

An employee was drilling into a pipe in the hydrogen process unit when the line flashed. He was hospitalized with second degree burns on his hands, neck, and chest and third degree burns on his fingertips.
An employee amputated his left index finger while using a band saw to cut beef shank in the fabrication department.

On or about June 30, 2015, an employee for Archer Pressure Pumping was hospitalized when he fell off a truck and onto a metal ramp while attempting to cover an equipment truck with a tarp.  The injured employee was standing on the truck and reaching for the tarp when he lost his balance and fell onto the ramp striking his face on the ramp. As a result of the fall, the employee fractured an eye socket and check bone, the right hip and right forearm. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery to repair his injuries.

An employee was loading/unloading a truck. His left index finger got caught between a forklift blade and its extension mechanism. The employee suffered an amputation of the tip of his left index finger.
An employee was struck by a section of rebar panel  26' wide by 40' long when the straps used to lift it came loose. The employee suffered a broken leg.
An aircraft mechanic was walking through Hangar 2, when he tripped over an aircraft air conditioning hose.  The employee broke his right leg and was admitted to the hospital.

An employee was in the process of clamping a metal pipe into a pistol clamp machine, when the part slipped off the fixture while his foot was on the foot pedal, pinning his left finger between the fixture and the part.
An employee, carrying an approximately 45 lb. valve in a bag, turned to the right, tripped over his foot, and fell to the concrete surface onto his right hip.
An employee suffered a finger amputation when he was adjusting the pneumatic cylinder on a press and his finger was caught in the die.

Following a full day of work, an employee began suffering muscle cramps, nausea and generalized ill feeling. He was taken to the hospital and diagnosed with heat exhaustion. The employee was admitted to the hospital, received IV fluids and was kept overnight for observation.
A Room Operations Executive Assistant was walking near the kitchen when she slipped and fell causing her to facture her knee. She was hospitalized as a result.
An employee was looking for frosting in the freezer and slipped and fell.
An employee amputated the tip of a thumb on a meat slicer when the handle broke.
An employee was trying to unjam a shear and caught the pinky finger in a nip point. The sheer was activated when the employee accidentally stepped on the pedal resulting in an amputation injury.
An employee was exiting a cone trailer and slipped off the steps hitting his head on the pavement. The employee was hospitalized with a concussion.

An employee was checking for proper alignment of the Hewsaw Machine. He placed his left hand by the saw box thereby crushing it and resulting in the amputation of his pointer and pinky fingers. He was taken to the hospital where he remained overnight for surgery to attach the fingers.
An employee suffered a de-gloving injury and possible amputation of a thumb.
An employee was performing maintenance on a machine and removed a pin.  A part fell and struck the employee on the leg causing a fracture.
An employee standing in the break room fell over and broke a hip.
An employee disconnected a pipe during a sanitation wash cycle and was burned below the waist by hot water.
An employee was working from an 8 foot ladder and lost his balance while trying to hold onto a electrical drill motor. He slipped and fell.
An employee was descending an extension ladder after working on a telecommunications cable when he miss-stepped, caught his legs between the rungs, and fell four feet to the ground.
An employee reached in to pull a brick out and got his right arm caught. The employee's injuries included a torn bicep, small cuts and a blood clot in the arm.

Employees were running rods downhole on a servicing rig when the pump hit a tight spot causing slack on the rods. The slack resulted in the rod elevator breaking and allowing the rods to come loose. The rod struck the employee in the middle, right side of the back and knocked him to the ground.

The employee was delivering freight out of a bobtail.  He was using an electric pallet jack to maneuver a pallet of freight onto the lift gate and lower the pallet to the ground.  During this process, he fell approximately 3.5 feet off the lift gate to the concrete drive.
Employees were breaking out concrete with an SDS hammer drill and while doing so hit a live line. The two employees sustained 2nd and 3rd degree burns and were hospitalized.

A new employee was observing an experienced employee on how to connect a yard mule to a dump trailer. The fifth wheel on the yard mule and the king pin on the trailer did not engage. The driver did not realize that they did not engage and the injured employee was caught between the cab and the trailer. The injured employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a 110 ton seat belt stamping press. She was manually lubricating the die when the press hit the bottle and pulled her hand into the press amputating part of her right pinky finger.
An employee was attaching a bracket to a metal stud with a battery-operated drill.  The drill slipped off the screw and the Phillips head driver bit went into the employee's left ring finger.

On 7/1/15 an employee was working at the Firestone Plant in the scale house, when it was discovered that a gate on the asphalt silo had a broken bolt and was not functioning properly. At ~ 12:40 AM while attempting to replace the bolt, his crowbar slipped and struck him in the face. He was admitted for in-patient hospitalization for a fractured bone above the eye (no eye loss/damage) and a fractured cheek bone.

An employee slipped as he was climbing down a scaffold ladder. He tried to catch himself by grabbing onto the ladder. His left arm hit the ladder clamp, which cut open his left arm (2 inches below his wrist to about 1 inch above his elbow). The cut was approximately 6 inches.
An employee was exposed to struck by hazards while operating the break out device.
An employee was stung by a bee and had an allergic reaction.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after falling from a ladder and breaking a leg.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion while loading trucks.

An employee entered an 18-wheeler truck to place a label on a shipping load.  When the employee exited the truck, he closed the truck trailer doors on his left pinky finger.  The finger was medically amputated from the first knuckle to the fingertip.

An employee lifted the hinged cover of a peanut bin/hopper and put his left hand in the bin. A moving auger inside the bin caught his left-hand ring finger and amputated the fingertip. The bin cover was not interlocked, and the production line was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.

An employee went to help a coworker who was having problems with his machine. The employee opened the guard for the roll machine to retrieve a part. The roller grabbed his gloves and crushed his hand.
Employee was exposed to struck by hazards due to not setting the brake on his truck.
An employee fixing a generator left an open container with about a gallon of gasoline next to the HVAC intake on the roof. Two employees were hospitalized after being poisoned by gasoline fumes.

An employee was using an alligator shear and reached down to pick up another piece of material while using his right hand to hold himself upright. The shear came down on his right hand amputating three fingers (middle finger, fourth finger, and pinkie finger). Employee was transported to the hospital in an attempt to re-attach his fingers.
A leaking propane tank exploded within the shop injuring two workers.

An employee was operating a Yale electric stand-up fork truck to move a pallet of veneer from the dryer to the veneer storage room. The fork truck was stationed near a wall. The employee accelerated the fork truck while it was in reverse gear, and he lost his balance. He braced himself by placing his left hand on the outside of the carriage. His hand got caught between the carriage and a wall.
Two employees were hospitalized for carbon monoxide exposure.
An employee was hospitalized for treatment of a foot infection the developed as a result of a laceration by a piece of concrete.
An employee was hospitalized when he fell from the forks of a forklift, striking the forks and fracturing his ribs.
An employee suffered a fracture in his back when the mower he was operating slid down the slope on the east side of Building 157.
An employee was struck by a Hostler Truck.
On or about July 1, 2015, an employee slipped in the parking lot and twisted her ankle.

An employee was stacking tire rims when a stack began to fall. The employee tried to catch the falling tire rims, which crushed his pinky finger on his left hand. His pinky finger was surgically amputated to the first knuckle.
An employee was installing a tipper on a garbage truck. The tipper slipped and cut his left thumb, which was later amputated.
An employee sustained a partial amputation of the right index finger while moving a concrete form.
An employee was performing maintenance on a cotton packer when his finger got crushed, resulting in the amputation of his right-hand pinky finger.

An employee was delivering cargo to a construction site. As he pulled the cargo to the back of the truck with a pallet jack, he felt a sharp pain on his abdomen.  The employee was hospitalized and diagnosed with a hernia.
An employee was removing an automotive lift, when the lift lowered on and broke the employee's arm.

An employee was working on a cutting machine that did not have the blade engaged.  He hit the lever that controls the up and down motion of the machine. Gravity pulled the machine down, and the blade struck his left hand.

Several employees were getting their tools ready for the day after performing JSA at a jobsite outside of Kennedy, Texas. One employee went to uncradle the lubricator from the wire line rig, and the employees put the line through the sheave, which is connected to the wellhead.  The operator watched the weight indicator and pulled 300 pounds of tension on the line, which released the wire line clamp. With the camp being removed manually, the injured employee noted that the wire was wrapped around the handle for the blow-out preventers.  The employee released the wire from the handle; the tension on the wire sling shot the sheave up. The sheave directly contacted the injured employee's right hand and amputated his right pinky through his cloth glove.

On July 2, 2015, at 1425 hours, an employee was cutting inside a water tank on the U.S.S. Bataan at BAE Shipyard in the TITAN Dry-dock when he received an electrical shock from a welding lead. He was hospitalized.

Employees were making up float shoes on the first joint of a casing job. The pipe came loose, swung, and caught one of the employees between the manual back-up tong and the back-up snub line.  The employee was hospitalized and treated for injuries to the chest and colon area.
An employee partially amputated his index finger while operating a pneumatic vice.
An employee tripped and fractured/dislocated an ankle.
An employee was hospitalized after a cownose stingray embedded a piece of barb in the employee's right hand.
An employee was struck by the bucket of an excavator, sustaining broken ribs.
An employee's hand was cut/scratched by a piece of metal while cleaning up trash/debris. The employee was later hospitalized for treatment of a hand infection due to the injury.
An employee fell down the stairs, rupturing a tendon in his right knee and requiring hospitalization.
An employee sustained a partial amputation to the tip of one of his fingers while threading fabric through a textile machine.
An employee cleaning a meat cutting table received an electrical shock on the right hand from a wire that was hanging from a thermostat under the cutting table.
An employee was descending a ladder to enter the lower level of a pump house when a steel hatch fell and smashed the employee's right thumb tip, requiring stitches.
An employee fell in the hallway after losing her balance, breaking her left arm.
On July 2, 2015, at approximately 3:00 PM, an employee fell 6 to 8 feet while working in an elevated man basket attached to a forklift. The employee fractured and dislocated the right shoulder.

Three employees were injured during two separate incidents. 1) On Monday, two employees were injured by steam while performing maintenance on the boiler water feed system in the Building 265 Power House. 2) On Tuesday, a production employee injured his hand and required treatment for cuts while grinding.

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer. These events are captured as one report.

On or about July 2, 2015, an employee was operating a press brake when it had a mechanical failure.  The bolts holding the press up sheared off, and the press came down on the employee's right hand, amputating several fingers.
An employee was injured when the PIV he was operating collided with another PIV in a cross section between the aisles. The employee injured his left foot and suffered multiple broken toes.
An employee, who was wearing a life vest, fell from the deck of a barge into the waters of the Mississippi River and lost consciousness.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee walking in the freezer slipped and fell, fracturing his right hip.
An employee fell on the stairwell after her heel got stuck in a crack of the rubber grip strip of a step. The employee went down several steps and hit her head on the wall.
On or about July 2, 2015, an employee was removing a floor hole cover and fell through the hole.

An employee degloved his left ring finger when his ring got caught while performing an adjustment on a straight line inserter machine. The employee was hospitalized and underwent a surgical amputation.
An employee climbed onto shelving and fell, breaking bones in his back.
An employee's right middle fingertip was amputated while closing the gate to the baler.
On July 2, 2015, an employee was rebuilding a furnace when he was struck on the left hand by a piece of steel beam. His left index fingertip was amputated.

On July 3, 2015, at approximately 4:50 a.m., an employee was injured while operating a battery-operated fork tugger industrial truck. The employee picked up a load of VVTs and was backing up when the stand, which had parts on top, struck the corner of a set of steps. This shoved the stand forward, causing the employee's finger to become crushed between the handrail and the stand.  The employee's right index fingertip was amputated.
An employee became dehydrated during work and was hospitalized overnight.
While lowering a swivel arm/gate, an employee's fingertip got caught between the heavy equipment. The fingertip was later amputated.
An employee sawing a femur bone sawed into his/her right index finger, lacerating tendons and requiring hospitalization. No hand guard was worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was involved in a motor vehicle accident on July 03, 2015 at
9:20 am. The employee was stopped at a light. The light changed and the employee started through the intersection when the vehicle was struck by another car turning left. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was tying a horse to a rail with a lead rope when the horse suddenly pulled away. The employee's left thumb got caught in the rope knot. As the horse pulled, the employee's finger got squeezed between the pipe fence and the knot, amputating her thumb between the first and second joints.

An employee was operating a forklift when the unit lost power. The forklift stalled and then rolled back towards some barriers posted in front of the electrical box. The employee stuck his foot outside of the driver's compartment as the forklift approached the barrier. His foot was crushed between the barrier and the forklift.
An employee tripped over a breaker box, fell and hit her forehead, requiring hospitalization and stitches to her forehead.
An employee was inside a manhole when a 2x4 fell into the hole and hit the top of his finger that was grasping the ladder amputating it.
An employee sorting clothes tripped on an apparel rack. The employee could not get up from the floor after falling and required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee's fingertip was amputated when her fingernail was caught by a moving conveyor belt.

An employee was attaching the hitch of a pick-up truck to the tow bar of the air-conditioning unit when his left little finger got caught between both pieces of equipment, resulting in the finger being amputated 1/2" at the tip.

An employee was taste testing salami to provide advice to customers about various products sold within the deli. She suffered an esophageal tear from choking on a piece of the salami and was hospitalized.
An employee amputated a piece of his right pinky finger while cutting a piece of wood.
An employee was struck by a falling piece of metal.
An employee was troubleshooting an oil rig top drive while the main drive was running. The employee sustained an amputation.
An employee rolled his knee while kneeling in his work truck, resulting in a knee infection that required hospitalization.
An employee was moving chem-grate flooring through a door when the employee's fingers got pinched between the door and the metal plate, causing an amputation.
An employee suffered second and third degree burns from hot oil.

An employee was working with a perforating gun on a work bench. He turned the gun and it skipped off the roller wheels and fell on the edge of the table, amputating the index and middle fingertips on his right hand.
Two employees were burned while testing a 4,600-volt electrical line that created an arc flash.
An employee was hospitalized when the ladder he was working on slid out and he fell approximately 20 feet.
An employee was helping a patient get into position for an MRI. While moving the patient, the employee heard/felt a "pop" in the lower right side of her back. She was hospitalized.
An employee was carrying some product from the cooler to the sales floor. The employee slipped on a piece of garbage on the floor, fell to the floor, and suffered a broken kneecap on her left leg.
An employee was injured when he fell while connecting steel on the FMC Tower project in Philadelphia.

On 7/4/15, at about 9:40 p.m., an employee was walking beside a push back vehicle while pushing back an aircraft. While the employee disconnected aircraft from the push back vehicle, the tow bar fell and peeled the skin back on the employee's left ring finger. The employee was hospitalized for a fracture and required surgical reconstruction of the fingertip.
An employee was hanging from the ceiling with silk drapes and practicing her upcoming performance when she fell and hit the floor below.  She was approximately 20 to 25 feet high.
An employee slipped on wet ground while checking a dewatering pump. He hurt his back and was hospitalized.

An employee was assigned to blow dust off the fan blade in a dust collector.  He shut off the fan, opened the inspection door to access the fan, and saw that the fan was still moving slowly.  A V-belt and pulley system was used as the drive system for the fan, but the guard was not in place.  The employee put his hand into the drive system to completely stop the fan. His hand got caught between the V-belt and pulley, amputating half of his ring finger and the little fingertip on his right hand.

Employees were rigging down the workover rig at about 11:30 a.m., on July 5, when an employee's right thumb and first finger were caught between the derrick tip section and stop plate. The employee's thumb had to be surgically amputated.
An employee's left finger was amputated while changing optical fiber spool for rewinding.
An employee was using a spanner wench to remove a cylinder when he slipped, falling to the ground. He fractured his left hip and was hospitalized.
On July 5, 2015, an employee got pinned up against a table lift and a Toro workman and was hospitalized.
An employee fell and fractured bones, requiring hospitalization for treatment.
An employee was adjusting the blade on a bagel slicer when she cut off the tip of her right middle finger.
An employee was applying "chalks" behind a plane engine after the aircraft landed. The employee was blown over by a blast from the plane engine, resulting in a shoulder injury and hospitalization.
An employee was on a 6 foot ladder repairing an HVAC unit.  The employee started to climb down the ladder, lost his balance and fell breaking his left leg.
An employee was greasing a front end loader when grease from the grease gun punctured and entered the employee's hand.
At or about 1:40 p.m., on July 6, 2015, an employee received serious back and spinal injuries as a result of a fall from a swing set. The employee was hospitalized and had to undergo spinal surgery.
An employee tripped and fell while carrying mail, breaking her left hip.

The shoe in the powdered metal press was hanging up so the employee who is a set-up trainee went to trouble shoot it.  The employee unplugged the plant airline to the moving part (shoe). The employee then plugged in the cleaning airline to the shoe. The cleaning airline has much less pressure than the plant airline. The shoe did not move as it should.  The employee tried to maneuver the shoe with her hand and it would not move. The shoe then moved forward and caught her fingertip between the shoe and the die resulting in the amputation of the left middle fingertip.
An employee was on the roof responding to a customer's complaint about the roof. He fell through a skylight to the warehouse area below.
An employee was working at the grinding machine and making an adjustment/alignment. The employee's finger got crushed between two moving parts.
An employee was hospitalized after the powered industrial truck that was being loaded onto a trailer fell off the back of the trailer.
An employee was transporting a patient to a doctor's appointment. When she missed a turn, the patient became violent and bit off the employee's nose.
An employee fell approximately 12 feet from the top of the tanker truck he was washing injuring the left shoulder and upper ribs and suffering a facial fracture.
An employee's left ankle was crushed when an aerator that he was walking down from a truck fell on him. He was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized when a spider bite or puncture wound received while performing landscaping duties became infected.
While attempting to remove a part from the mold of a ceramic press, an employee sustained an amputation of the left middle and ring fingers.

An employee was helping a forklift operator by watching the operator as he pushed a batch of green wood into a dry kiln. The wood was on a metal crate on rail wheels. The employee had the forklift operator stop to check the wood and a 4 x 6 board fell from the top of the stack, which was about 10 to 15 feet in the air, and hit the employee in the head. The employee was wearing a hardhat at the time of the incident.
An employee was unloading trusses and operating a trailer. While dismounting the delivery truck, he hurt his ankle.
An employee working on a swing stage scaffold was lowering the scaffold when his left fingers got pulled into the pulley, partially amputating his middle and index fingertips.
The employee was in a bucket truck pulling wire. The employee touched a live energized line and was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a hammer mill that kept getting jammed. The employee shut down the machine and opened the access door, which had two hinges on both sides to allow the right or left side to open. The employee had removed/unlocked both sides, which caused the door to fall forward. The employee attempted to catch the door, and his right hand got caught between the metal mill door and a metal support beam. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was removing a full "super sack" from beneath the dust collector. A red light indicated a blockage or full sack. The employee attempted to clear the blockage. She reached up into the rotary valve, which still had power. A paddle in the valve caught her right thumb.
An employee running from a dog jumped onto a car and crashed through the windshield.

An employee was on a canning line, blowing down station with an air gun, and the right hand drifted into the conveyor subsequently catching the ring finger on the conveyor resulting in injury. At the hospital, part of the finger needed to be amputated to close the wound.
An employee received an electrical shock of an unknown voltage while trimming trees in close proximity to power lines.

An employee was working on a paper plate machine. The machine jammed; it stopped feeding paper, but was still running. The employee opened the safety gate on the cutting die to stop the machine. When the employee opened the safety gate, the safety switch engaged to de-energize the machine. He reached into the cutting die, and his left-hand middle finger was pinched between two parts of the cutting die. He was hospitalized, and his fingertip was later medically amputated.

An employee was operating an electric pallet jack. She got off the pallet jack and had her hand on the controls. She accidentally twisted the handle and caused the pallet jack to reverse towards her. The pallet jack ran over her right foot, and then smashed her left foot between a pallet and the jack.

An employee banged her eye on a metal rack while stowing 
yga mats.

At 2:30pm on 07/06/2015, an employee was working on the Pines Bender making metal parts. He loaded a part into the pressure die and held onto the part with his left hand so it wouldn't "whip out" as the pressure die closed. The part was not positioned against the locate, and his pinky finger was pinched between the part and the pressure die as the pressure die closed amputating the fingertip.
An employee was delivering mail in an apartment building when he slipped on the wet floor and fell, obtaining injuries which resulted in his hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion/kidney failure.

An employee came in contact with hot water (greater than 105 F) when a hose split while the employee was priming a pump in the neutral plant. The employee received 2nd and 3rd degree burns to his back and upper legs covering approximately 13% of the right side of his body.

An AME palletizing machine had been installed to palletize bottles/stack them on plastic trays. An employee noticed that the machine had trays that were sideways. He opened the gate and entered the machine to straighten the trays. The crane inside the machine activated while he was inside, striking him and crushing him against the side of the machine.
An employee was operating an alligator shear to cut up catalytic converters for scrap. A piece of sharp metal popped up and severed the employee's left middle fingertip.
An employee was using a ladder to gain access to a roof. As he stepped on to the roof, the ladder slipped out from under him. He fell about 8 feet and was hospitalized with a broken pelvis.
On or about July 7, 2015, an employee received a finger amputation while operating the PTO fertilizer.
An employee was operating a CNC Bender (press brake) machine and activated the machine while his thumb was in the point of operation.  The employee's skin and thumb nail were removed.

An employee had been framing the roof deck and was tied off using a personal fall arrest system.  A violent  thunderstorm occurred, and the employee began to exit the roof.  He unhooked his lanyard when he got within 2 feet of the extension ladder used to access and exit the roof. He slipped and fell 12 feet to the concrete floor below and sustained a head injury.
Employee performing trailer disassembly suffered from heat exhaustion.
An employee was interacting with a table saw when the employee's hand became entangled. Multiple fingers were amputated.

A truck driver was making a delivery at another company with a load of material on a flat bed truck. While waiting on a forklift, the truck driver began unloading the pallet by pulling on a strap. The strap broke or he lost his grip, which caused the employee to fall onto the ground landing on his right hip. The injured employee required surgery to repair the hip.
An employee was injured when an excavator operator backed into him. The employee sustained injuries to his left leg and ankle and dislocated his left shoulder. The injured employee was hospitalized.
On July 7, 2015, an employee fell from a 34-inch high platform to the concrete floor below, fracturing his right arm (humerus) and T1 vertebra.
An employee of a tree service company fell approximately 30 feet while trimming a tree.
An employee amputated a fingertip when a tree fell on a telephone wire he was repairing.
An employee was using a Skilsaw to cut wood to form a sidewalk. The wood got caught in the saw and pulled the employee's hand into the saw. The employee's left thumb was cut off at the first knuckle.
An employee was bucked off his horse and hit the floor while penning up the cattle. He injured his back and ribs and sustained a possible concussion. He was hospitalized.

On 7/7/15, an employee helped a coworker load a flatbed truck. The load already on the truck shifted, and the stacked material dislodged. The galvanized material fell and struck the employee's hard hat and his ribs. He was hospitalized for observation and testing.
An employee was lifting black pipe. A sharp edge of the pipe cut through the employee's gloves causing lacerations.
An employee fell backwards off of ladder, striking his head and fracturing his skull.

An employee attending a meeting in a conference room tripped over a data port located on the floor; a cover was missing over the data port at the time. The employee was hospitalized and underwent surgery for a fractured hip.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion on or about 07/07/15 while measuring post-tension cables on the 18th floor of a new high-rise building construction.

An employee was cutting bands off of tubing to separate the electric cable from the tubing when the band cutter came up and hit him in his left eye. Eye protection was not worn at the time. He was hospitalized.
An employee operating a stand-up pallet jack was struck by a sit-down lift truck.  The employee operating the pallet jack was hospitalized with a fractured left ankle.

An employee sheered off the upper tip of his left ring finger while relocating an entry stand under an aircraft.  The employee did not notice his finger was positioned at a pinch point between the entry stand and the aircraft shoring foundations.

On or about July 7, 2015, an employee, sweeping out a semi-truck trailer, was injured and hospitalized when he/she was caught between the wall of the trailer and a fork lift truck that was loading a bale of paper into the trailer.
A truck door closed on an employee's finger, lacerating the middle fingertip on her right hand.

An employee was found lying on the floor inside the Wal-Mart Distribution Center. He had been unloading boxes and materials from a conveyor and loading them into a truck. He was in and out of consciousness and was initially diagnosed as being dehydrated. The employee was hospitalized for further testing.
A employee was hospitalized for heat stress.

A temporary employee's nail bag caught on the brick layer scaffold he was working from causing him to lose balance and fall approximately twelve feet to the ground below fracturing his hip. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.

A crane was removing a heater from a platform. The heater was lifted up to tighten the chains before resuming the lift, but the heater stack (7 ft. pipe) broke off of the heater. The broken piece struck an employee, who suffered a severe concussion and broken bones in the neck.
An employee slipped and fell entering the restroom and broke her hip.
An employee had two fingers partially amputated while working on an unloader boom. The employees fingers were caught between a chain and sprocket.
An employee was taking down a gutter on the edge of a residence's roof and fell approximately 14 feet to the ground, fracturing his right wrist.

An employee was operating a stand-up powered industrial truck on a loading dock. The employee backed the powered industrial truck into a metal column. The employee's leg was impacted and caught by the column, resulting in multiple fractures.

An employee was establishing temporary power for office trailers by installing a ground lug on a ground bar on a motor control center (MCC). The employee used a wrench to tighten the lug and contacted an energized circuit or an energized buss bar of the 480-volt MCC. 

The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized for heat stress after working in Hull TC 74 installing a sprinkler system.

An employee was working in a ceiling crawl space installing an air line. While attempting to switch position, he lost his balance and cut his left wrist with a utility knife. Because the knife hit an artery he was kept over-night while surgeons determined whether or not surgery would be needed.

An iron worker assisting in the unloading of large sheets of glass from a tractor trailer was struck by a pane of glass pinning him to the ground.  The worker was later hospitalized as a result of his injuries.
An employee slipped and fell while climbing an A-Frame ladder, landing on his right side. He was hospitalized for fractured ribs.
An employee was delivering aluminum to a customer. While he unstrapped the aluminum from the wall of the trailer, the pallet fell on his right foot, causing  a fracture.
An employee suffered burns while trying to repair a water heater.
On 7/7/15, an employee began cramping and felt dehydrated. He went back to an office location and the cramping worsened. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a broken ankle as the result of a forklift accident.
An employee was repairing a compressor on a refrigerated truck.  The compressor pinched his hand between the compressor unit and a truck body.
An employee was on a garbage pickup route in Warren County when he started cramping. He was  hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee suffered an amputation of his right middle finger while setting up a printing press on or about July 7, 2015.
An employee attempting to remove plastic from under a conveyor injured his right hand and sustained an amputation to his right pinky. The conveyor was in operation at the time.
A Border Patrol Agent was chasing suspected illegal aliens when he passed out due to dehydration and hit his head.
An employee was changing out a belt on an air handling unit when the belt and pulley caught and amputated the employee's left pinky finger.
An employee was cutting foam board with a concrete saw when the saw kicked back. The blade impacted his arm, causing a laceration that required hospitalization.

An employee pinched his finger between a cell and the cell rack while performing an inspection and moving a cell into the cell rack with a crane. In this process, the cell turned and the finger got caught between the cell handle and the rack that it sits on.

An employee was cutting a piece of wood with a circular saw when the cuff of his shirt sleeve got caught in the saw blade, causing it to kick back on him and cut his right forearm. The employee had surgery to repair his arm.
An employee received a severe laceration to her arm from broken glass when attempting to stop a shoplifter exiting the establishment with stolen merchandise.
An employee fell through a roof and injured his back. He was wearing a PFAS at the time.
An employee got caught between a trailer and truck while directing the truck driver to back up.  The employee's leg was crushed, and the employee was hospitalized.
