An employee injured his right shin while positioning a concrete form structure to weld in place. As the employee was lowering the structure, it slipped and brushed against his right shin. His injury later became infected, requiring hospitalization for observation and treatment.

An employee was operating a power press when he started feeling ill.  He notified his supervisor that he was not feeling well and was taken to a break room to cool off.  His condition did not improve and he was taken to a medical clinic for treatment. At the clinic he received IV treatment and the doctor determined that he was suffering from severe dehydration and kidney failure. The employee was admitted to a hospital.
An employee was using a grinder when a piece of the grinding wheel broke off and struck him in the leg, causing a laceration and fracture. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's left index fingertip was cut while using a chop saw.
An employee was injured from a fall from a ladder and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was handling deck lines when his left ring fingertip got caught in a bit of the rope. There was no bone loss.

Two employees were pouring material into an alloy melting pot when it splashed back onto them. One employee suffered second degree burns to both arms; the second employee suffered second degree burns to his right leg. Both were hospitalized.
An employee sustained a broken leg when 17 sheets of drywall fell on him as he was attempting to look behind them.
An employee loading high-pressure iron into pipe racking suffered a fingertip amputation after his left pinky finger got caught between the pinch point of the iron and pipe racking.
An employee was helping a forklift driver load wood onto a trailer when the lumber struck him and pushed him against other material.
An employee put his finger in a small 1-inch hole in the side of an enclosed conveyor. His fingertip was struck by a conveyor flight.  One-eighth of an inch of his right index fingertip was damaged.

An employee was operating an electric pallet jack carrying three pallets of flour when she lost control of the pallet and ran into another forklift operator. She stuck her left foot out and sustained a crushing injury, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was cutting plywood with a skill saw. He was holding the plywood with his left hand. The saw kicked back, and the lower exposed blade amputated part of his left pinky fingertip and lacerated his ring finger.

While cleaning the blade on a slicer, an employee's hand slipped and got caught on a heating element. The employee was unable to free his hand from the heating element before the blade rotated, amputating a finger.
An employee operating a press machine for 45 minutes was hospitalized from heat stress.

An employee was making a delivery at Case Western Reserve. After unloading his truck, he began to lower the bay door. As the door lowered, his right middle finger got pinched in the door panel, partially amputating the finger.
An employee delivering pizza slipped on a customer's driveway and injured their back, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

A maintenance employee was working to clear a clog in the bottom of a cyclone. He had gone through the lockout/tagout procedure twice and asked the operator to control run the machine to unjam the clog. The employee attempted to clear the jam inside the feeder when his glove got caught and his left middle fingertip was amputated. He was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was adjusting the closer on an egg-packing machine when his finger got caught in the sprocket and chain system. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time.

The employee was working on Line #2. The employee turned on the Mirapack Machine. During startup, the employee had her left hand in an area that was not guarded. The employee's left tip under portion of the finger was amputated. The employee was treated in the Emergency Room and was not hospitalized.
On July 8, 2015, at approximately 6:00 p.m., an employee was struck in the face by a high-pressure hose. The employee suffered multiple facial fractures and was hospitalized.

An operator was carrying steel tubes using a forklift. The load slipped off the forks and landed on another employee's right foot. The employee was taken to the hospital where all of the toes on the right foot were amputated.
Two workers at the National Counter Terrorism Center were on a suspended scaffold when the scaffold malfunctioned causing the employees to fall.
An employee was moving a steel beam on non-gravity rollers when his left middle finger got caught between the roller and steel beam.
On July 9, 2015, while operating a resaw, an employee's hand got caught in some gears, resulting in the loss of his right ring finger.

An employee was greasing a backhoe with a grease gun. The grease fitting did not fit, and the gun popped and hit his right-hand palm. The employee was later hospitalized for a minor surgical procedure to flush the wound.
An employee fell off the back of a truck/loading dock while working.

An employee went  to perform maintenance on a commercial natural gas oven. He opened the outer access door to the oven and went inside. An explosion occurred, and the employee suffered  burns on his arms, legs, and sides of his body.
An employee sustained a puncture wound to the left forearm on July 7, 2015. The employee was later hospitalized for treatment when the hand and forearm became swollen.
On 07/09/2015, an employee delivering a package to a residence was bitten on both hands by the inhabitant's dog. The employee was later hospitalized when both hands became swollen.

An employee was attempting to inventory drums that were behind some lead blocks. He climbed over the plastic-covered lead blocks to get closer to the drums for counting. He fell, hitting and breaking two ribs on the blocks. He was eventually hospitalized.
While delivering a lawnmower to a residence, an employee injured the left ankle, requiring hospitalization and surgery.
An employee cut their thumb with a portable magnetic drill while drilling a hole in steel deck. The cut resulted in the amputation of the left thumb.

An employee was using a nail gun during a re-roof job at a condominium. Walking on the roof deck, the employee stepped on the rope and his ankle rolled. He fell on the roof deck and shot himself above the knee.
An employee cut three fingers while dadoing.
An employee's foot got run over by a forklift, requiring the amputation of one toe and hospitalization.
An employee was experiencing cramps throughout the day. The employee was hospitalized with heat stroke.
An employee was operating a table saw when he cut his left thumb and was hospitalized.

An employee was repairing a seal on a valve operator. He placed the drum cover over the actuator piston using an overhead crane and was manipulating the drum while operating the crane controls. While attempting to lower the drum the final 2 inches, he inadvertently pushed the wrong button on the hoist control, causing the drum to move upward. As a result, his left thumb was pinched between the base plate and drum cover. There was no amputation.
An employee reported heat related symptoms early evening during the shift. The employee sought medical attention after work and was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a press brake to bend metal trim. His right thumb was in the machine opening at the time. When he cycled the machine, it closed down the safety stop, which lacerated his thumb but did not crush it all the way. Part of his thumb bone had to later be surgically amputated.
An employee in the maintenance shop amputated the top portion of his finger on July 9, 2015, and was hospitalized.
An employee operating an assembly press reached into the press to adjust a flange; his finger was pinched in the press.

An employee was on an A-Frame ladder installing a 20-pound piece of aluminum to a light fixture.  The ladder buckled and the employee fell from the second rung of the ladder to the floor, hitting the back of his head on the ground. He was hospitalized.

An operator was unloading pipe from a truck using an excavator. A sling was attached to the pipe. When the operator picked up the pipe, it turned 180 degrees and struck the injured employee, fracturing his pelvis.
An employee was performing a hydrostatic pressure test on a hose when he received a chemical burn from a clear odorless liquid, requiring hospitalization.

An employee amputated the left middle fingertip when he tried to clear a clog on machine #4.  He applied pressure to the foot pedal of the machine which actuated a machine part cutting off the tip of his finger.
An employee was hospitalized as a result of dehydration.
An employee climbed on top of a trenching machine to stabilize it. The employee was thrown off the machine when it became unstable.

An employee working on power lines in an aerial lift in Hinesville, GA became ill. The employee came down, drank water, and went home. He awoke the next day still feeling ill and went to his personal doctor. He was later admitted to the hospital.
On 7/9/15, an employee broke a bone in his face when the string trimmer he was using hit him in the face while he attempted to adjust the string.
An employee on the bed of a stationary work truck lost his balance and fell to the ground below.
An employee was drilling holes with a drill press when his glove got caught in a drill bit, amputating two fingers.
An employee tried to get into the cab of a crane by climbing a fixed ladder.  As he tried to grab the rail, it slipped and he fell to the side.
An employee suffered a left pinky finger amputation when he walked over a skid and tripped over a 2x4, rolling and landing on his finger.

At approximately 12:00 PM on July 9, 2015, an employee fell off of a moveable ladder/platform while waxing the top side of a wing on a corporate jet.  The employee's boot tread got stuck in the tread on the stairs, causing him to lose his footing and fall approximately 48 inches to the ground below. He was hospitalized and sustained three fractured ribs, and possible pelvic and clavicle injuries.
On or about July 9, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation to his left thumb while performing an unjamming activity on the graham cracker packaging machine.
An employee was hospitalized because of heat stroke.

An employee was feeling dehydrated and experiencing cramping after coming down from pressure washing the interior of a water tank. The employee was hospitalized for symptoms related to heat exhaustion.
At 2:30 AM on 7/9/2015, an employee's right arm was crushed by a pizza bread-making conveyor while she was cleaning the conveyor rollers. She required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee was hospitalized after falling from an elevated surface and sustaining injuries to his head, collar bone, and ribs.
An employee slipped on a frayed carpet and fell down the stairs, injuring the left leg.
An employee was stung by an unknown insect on his ear. The injured employee had a severe allergic reaction and was found by a passerby on the ground.
An employee slipped the thoracic disc in her back while helping a driver lift a package into the truck.

An employee was using an electronic power jack to set up pallets when he 
lost control of the jack because of wet conditions. The jack crashed into nearby pallets, causing them to fall on the employee.

An employee was attempting to clear a clog in the rotary air lock of a central vacuum with his fingers. The first and second fingertips on his right hand were amputated, with no bone loss, in the dryer area.
An employee was transferring a patient into the Cat Scan ER room when she closed the cat scan door (double door) on her hand; her left index fingertip was amputated.
An employee sustained second degree burns that were caused by a pressurized hydraulic system.
An employee was injured when a powered industrial vehicle overheated, spraying him with hot water/anti-freeze. The employee received burns to his torso, arms and groin requiring hospitalization.
An employee was struck by a car exiting the garage and onto a driveway. The injured employee was walking behind the vehicle as it backed up to change direction.
An employee sustained a broken wrist when struck by metal cable.

On July 10, 2015, an employee was reaching for a box of bags in the storage room. She tripped on a box and fell to the floor below, sustaining a concussion and injury to the left arm and hand. She was hospitalized.
An employee was injured when aluminum siding he was pulling fell and severed a tendon in the right arm.
An employee offloading rebar from a flatbed truck lost his balance and fell off the truck, breaking both bones in his leg and requiring surgery.
An employee's left small finger was amputated while operating an overhead hoist. The equipment was not locked or tagged out and was unguarded at the time.
An employee fell backwards off of a ladder while removing labels and decals from the back of a truck and suffered a head injury.
An employee was using a step ladder to help erect a pole barn. He fell off when the step ladder tipped, fracturing a heel and some ribs.
An employee fell approximately 9 feet while descending a fixed industrial ladder, fracturing the left knee.
An employee's fingers were caught between the trimmer and stacker resulting in injuries that led to hospitalization and surgery to repair his injured right ring and pinky fingers.
An employee was at a customer location unloading material. The tote he was using had a wire that punctured his hand. The next day his hand became infected and he was hospitalized overnight.
While tearing off the old (rubber) materials on a flat roof that measured 20 x 100 feet, an employee stepped on a weak area and fell approximately 13 feet to the lower level.
An employee was hospitalized due to an allergic reaction to a chemical used to clean a patient's room.
A maintenance employee was troubleshooting batteries for a sprinkler diesel pump when the battery exploded acid into the employee's face. The employee sustained burns.

An employee standing adjacent to an asphalt dump truck received an electric shock that rendered him unconscious when the bed of the dump truck contacted an overhead electric line. The ground on which the injured employee was standing was wet at the time of the incident. The injured employee suffered burns and blistering on his legs and damage to the big toe on his right foot.
An employee was walking out of the kitchen area and lost her footing. She fell and hit her head on the kitchen sink.
An employee was injured after tripping over a cable on the floor.
An employee cut his upper left leg with a circular saw.
An employee was moving high chairs while walking backwards when she slipped, fell, and broke her pelvis. She was hospitalized.
An employee was using a creeper under a truck and hit is head on a steel beam causing a ruptured disk in his neck.
An employee was carrying a piece of hydraulic shoring on his shoulder and it slipped. He grabbed it and pinched his finger, amputating the tip.

Two employees were working together, replacing hinges and remounting a dump trailer door. After welding the door, they checked the alignment and the weld. The dump trailer door fell off and hit one employee, injuring his shoulder, wrist, and pelvis.

An employee working for Waste Management of Youngstown lacerated his left wrist while collecting trash. The employee attempted to collect a TV for bulk pick-up, which broke apart in his hands and caused a laceration.
An employee was unhooking the trailer from the tractor of a tractor-trailer and slipped. The truck ran over his right foot. His left wrist was broken when he fell.
An employee was working on a roof when debris came in contact with an overhead wire causing an arc flash that struck the worker. He fell from the roof.
An employee amputated the left thumb by using an unguarded table saw.

An employee was changing a rocker arm on the Line #4 Pre-Shaker. The employee experienced a partial amputation when his right hand middle finger was caught between the shaker table and the rocker arm.

An employee working inside a store room located in the basement of the facility tripped over a wheel of a cart and fell. The employee sustained injuries to her left hip and shoulder requiring surgery with hospitalization.
An employee was bitten by an insect or spider. The bite area became infected. The employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery to clean out the infected area.

An employee was dispatched to replace a telephone pole after a car accident. While removing the old pole, it snapped approximately 3/4 up causing that section to fall and strike the employee on the left shoulder. The employee was taken to the hospital with non life threatening injuries.

An employee was climbing a fixed ladder approximately 28 feet high and fell from an unknown distance to the floor below.  The employee suffered a head laceration, multiple skull fractures and a blood clot behind an eye. The employee was hospitalized.
A maintenance man removed a guard without LOTO and his left pointer finger was amputated above the first digit.

An employee was sitting down at the Service Operations Desk when he began to feel dizzy and light headed. When he got up he fell to the floor of the service drive. After being assisted by the other associates he was transported to the hospital and diagnosed with heat exhaustion. The temperature at the time of the incident was 86 degrees with the previous 6 hours being between 89 and 91 degrees.
A meat cutter was cutting meat when he sliced off the tip of his left pinky finger.

A motorcycle entered the work zone and struck an employee who was cleaning up a pot hole. 
The work zone had TCD.

An employee was pulling a manual cart with merchandise and caught the back of his foot on the cart. He fell backwards causing a broken hip and abrasions to his head and left forearm. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was doing decking work at an apartment complex being constructed. The employee stepped onto an unsecured truss and fell approximately 14 feet. The employee suffered head injuries and was admitted to the hospital for treatment.
An employee was hospitalized due to dehydration.
An employee was exposed to a struck-by hazard when colliding with the bucket of a Bobcat.
A warehouse worker amputated his left index finger while loading merchandise from a forklift to a truck at the loading dock.

A maintenance employee was assisting another maintenance employee in repairing/replacing a belt on a dryer fan.  He was checking the tension of the belt while the machine was slowing down after being shut down and caught his left hand in the pulley amputating the left thumb tip approximately half way down into the nail.
An employee received 2nd and 3rd degree burns when operating a forklift truck to unload polystyrene rolls from a trailer. It is believed a propane pocket was ignited by static electricity.

An employee removing a pallet jack from a pallet slipped and struck his right knee on the pallet jack. The accident occurred on or about 8:35pm on 7/12/15. The employee was admitted to the hospital overnight.

A sanitation employee was underneath a scissor lift used for lifting pallets preparing to clean the area when a different employee unknowingly lowered the lift onto the employee under the lift consequently fracturing her right lower leg and dislocating the left clavicle.
An employee fell from a drop off, approximately 10 ft., while taking down a tent.
An employee slipped on water and fell in a hallway injuring her knee. The employee was hospitalized and requires surgery.
Employee performing warehouse work injured his left leg when struck by another employee operating a forklift.

A card machine operator assisted a technician who was trying to free up a machine that was in the choke position. When the machine was freed, the employee's right index finger was amputated when it was caught between a belt and pulley.

An employee placed a coffee pot on the counter of the Tiki Bar. When she turned around and bent down, she accidentally struck the counter causing the coffee pot to fall and hit another counter, spilling hot coffee onto her legs and back. She was hospitalized with second degree burns to the back of both legs and her back.
Employee fell while descending a movable ladder with boxes of coffee makers and fractured her left knee.

On July 9, 2015, an employee was providing paramedic services at the home of a patient. While attempting to lift the patient from the floor of a chicken coop, he slipped and fell on his posterior. He got up and continued working. Later, he reported increasing pain and bruising from his fall to his employer. He went to the emergency room and was admitted to the hospital for vitamin K therapy to control muscular bleeding.
An employee was mauled by a Staffordshire Bull Terrier that was kept in the office unsecured resulting in injuries to both arms that required surgery and hospitalization.

An employee was repairing equipment in the waste water treatment room. The employee had to go up and down stairs fifteen times to drain water from equipment. The waste water treatment room is very warm.  The employee was sweating a lot and vomiting.

An employee was water blasting inside the economizer on tubes with a gun at water pressures of 3000-8000 psi when the control to the gun broke. The employee lost control of the gun and the water pressure struck the employee's inner left thigh, causing severe lacerations.
An employee sitting on a nursery cart stood up and the cart rolled away. The employee fell to the floor and fractured a hip.
An employee was walking down some outside steps when he missed a step and fell fracturing three ribs and suffering a punctured lung.
A letter carrier was hospitalized for dehydration.

An employee climbed a fixed ladder to gain access to a roof. When he approached the top of the ladder, he opened a hinged lid and proceeded to climb up the ladder. The hinge failed and the lid struck the employee in the head causing him to fall approximately six feet to the ground below. The employee received a laceration to the face, contusions and bruising to the right shoulder, elbow and knee, and fractured his right ankle. The employee was transported to a local hospital where he was treated and released.
A worker was moving plastic totes around when he lost his balance and his knee gave out. The injured employee was admitted to the hospital for surgery.

An employee was feeding two strips of narrow pieces of steel into a reel. There were some cracked edges on the strip of metal. His hand was pulled toward the spacer causing his finger to get caught in/between the spacer (metal disc) and the steel strip that cuts the steel in the over arm (part of the reel/guide to keep cut straight). This occurred at the 72 slitter on the exit reel.
An employee, pulling a tray of dry goods out of the rear of his truck, lost his balance and fell from the truck. The employee sustained a closed head injury.
An employee amputated four fingers on the left hand while using a total positioning saw.
The injured employee was working the 2nd shift (2:30pm - 11:00pm) packaging bags of lime (material). The employee's arms came in contact with the lime.  He was later hospitalized.
An employee opened the back door of a semi trailer and an unsecured bundle of cardboard weighing approximately 500 pounds fell on him.  The employee was admitted to the hospital.
An employee fractured a knee cap when assisting nurses to put a patient back to bed.
The employee sustained lower back injuries when the yard dog that he was driving turned over. The employee was hospitalized after the incident.
On or about July 13, 2015, an employee was hospitalized after being involved in a robbery.  The employee suffered chest pains and a panic attack.
An employee suffered a fractured left forearm while using a crowbar to clean debris from a conveyor in the shredding area.
A letter carrier was bitten by dog. The carrier fell and injured a wrist.
A truck driver was closing a trailer roll up door when his hand slipped off the door strap and he fell to the ground injuring his back.  He was hospitalized.

An employee was working with an impact hammer when the bit got stuck. The employee twisted the hammer to loosen it and got his right hand ring finger caught between the hammer and the scaffold rail. The employee freed his hand, but his glove got caught tearing skin from his fingertip.
An employee pinched two fingers between the cable and pulley of a portable belt conveyor resulting in an amputation injury.  The motor was not running at the time of the incident.
An employee tripped over his own feet and fell, fracturing his hip and requiring hospitalization.
Employee received electrical shock and burns while working on a 7K distribution panel.
An employee was placing an epoxy mixture in a hole.  Because of vibration, the employee was struck by the epoxy grout under his right arm and side.
An employee operating a hand controlled forklift to remove pallets from a printing press fractured a leg when his leg was caught between the moving lift and a stationary I-beam guard.
An employee received a finger amputation while attempting to trouble shoot a boring machine that would not start.

An employee was working next to a conveyor belt. His hand was caught in the rotating roller which pulled his arm through up to his elbow. He was hospitalized for damage to his tendons as well as abrasions.

Two operators were attempting to clear a "down bottle error" on the blow molding machine. They opened an interlock door and were looking into the bed area. One employee leaned on a metal plate that guides the bottles. The pressure from the leaning employee released a metal flap that caught the employee's right middle finger.

An employee was checking lights with the use of a scissor lift that was extended approximately 19 feet. The scissor lift was struck by a bridge crane. The employee fell with the lift resulting in a break to the employee's left femur. The employee was hospitalized.
On 7/13/15 an employee was hospitalized due to heat exhaustion and dehydration.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion and was given IV fluids. The employee was kept in the hospital for observation.

An employee suffered a partial amputation while operating a power handsaw (cutting clips out of 2 X 4). He was cut when he attempted to unjam the saw that kicked back and cut his left thumb below his nail 45 degrees.
An employee was setting up a core machine and became caught in the machine.
An employee fell approximately 15 feet off an unfinished grating on a catwalk and broke a leg. The fracture required surgery and hospitalization.

A driver was on his route and called management to report he was not feeling well. Management picked up employee on route and took him to the hospital because the employee was suffering from a heat related injury. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was preparing for work at the line 4B tender clipping station. She was adjusting her work stand to the correct height when the stand slipped out of her hand. Her left middle finger was pinched between the work stand framework and the framework of the cone line. Her left middle finger was amputated between the nail-bed and first knuckle.

An employee noticed a hydraulic leak and went to investigate the area where the hydraulic lines attach to the truck. The employee placed his hand in an access point. The boom of the truck came down and crushed the employee's fingers causing an amputation. The employee was taken to the hospital for treatment.
An employee operating a 1000 lb. mixer came in contact with the moving parts of the blade and amputated three fingers on the right hand.

An employee was working outdoors at the "Rover Buying Station." He and a truck driver loaded purchased seed into a truck. The two employees then went into the air conditioned office to cool off. The employee sat down near the air conditioner and became unresponsive. The truck driver called 911. The employee was transported to the hospital.
An employee working on the pharmacy department pick line tripped on a box and fell, breaking her hip and femur. She was taken to the hospital and admitted for surgery.

An employee was found unconscious on the floor of the manufacturing area. It is believed the employee may have fallen against a mold/form used to make burial mounds. The employee was hospitalized for treatment of lacerations to his forehead and possible cracked vertebrae in his neck.

A machine drops dough into a hopper and then onto a conveyor. The machine operator knelt down on the ground and his hand went under the conveyor. His hand activated a sensor that signals the dough cutter to come down and cut/section the dough. The dough cutter, which is not a blade but a chunter, pinched the thumb on his left hand.
An employee tripped over a pallet and fell fracturing the left knee.

An employee was delivering auto parts to a customer location on July 9, 2015 where he was attacked by a dog and bitten on the hand. On July 13, 2015, he was hospitalized to receive vaccinations and to treat the infected wound.

An extrusion operator was removing an airshaft from the steel core on an extrusion plastic processing line with help from another employee. The steel core pinched off the tip of the operator's left middle finger. The injured employee was not hospitalized, but was treated in the emergency room.

An employee was monitoring a palletizer machine. The employee climbed up onto the machine to clear a jam at which time the machine completed its cycle. The employee suffered an injury to her right ankle and was admitted to the hospital for treatment and surgery.
Two employees were injured during an attempted robbery with a weapon.

A crane operator was going to set up for a crane pick for another company. He began taking the outrigger pads off the rack and caught his finger on the pads causing a partial amputation to right index fingertip.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while trimming paper on an unguarded guillotine paper cutter.
An employee was running a rolling press machine and his hand got caught in the in-running nip point.  When he removed his hand, a finger on his hand was torn requiring hospitalization.
An employee was digging a ditch to lay conduit when he began to feel ill. He was taken to the emergency room and was diagnosed with heat illness.

An employee, working as a coner, which is the person who sits on the platform crate/grate behind the road line marking paint truck and picks up and places traffic cones, was picking up cones from the right side of the crate/grate when the truck hit a bump causing it to bounce up and down which caused the employee's right leg to get stuck between the ground and the vehicle breaking the tibia/fibula.

A worker was welding the underside of a truck when the flame flashed back through a stress fracture in the fitting causing slag to hit the torch. The torch fell into his lap causing 2nd and 3rd degree burns.
An employee caught his right hand and arm in a roller on the line 7 slitter.  The employee suffered injuries to the arm and was taken to the hospital for evaluation.
An employee was exiting the warehouse and fell onto her right shoulder.

An employee was using a skill saw to cut wood pieces for use in building forms for poured concrete.  The saw kicked back causing a deep laceration on all four fingers on the employee's right hand. The employee was taken to the hospital for treatment.
An employee was operating a powered pipe threader while wearing gloves.  The left ring finger was caught in the rotating threader and was amputated just above the first joint.

An employee was working with a rotomill machine on the ground checking asphalt depth. The employee used his foot instead of the air wand to remove excess. He caught his foot in the rotomill track injuring the right big toe. A physician amputated bone to close the wound.
An employee fractured his left ankle while working with a forklift.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after suffering from low sodium symptoms.
An employee was testing a valve with a finger when the valve closed, amputating the left index finger to the first knuckle.
An employee was cleaning a screw auger when the employee's hand got caught in the machine amputating two fingers on his right hand.

An employee was operating a fixture that punches a hole through a silicon tube.  She attempted to punch the tube again while holding the tube with her right index finger.  The employee then manually cycled the fixture to perform a punch and the right index finger interfered with the punch, amputating her right index fingertip.
An employee was operating a table saw when the tip of his right thumb was severed by the blade.
An employee was performing landscaping duties when he passed out.  He was taken to the hospital and admitted for heat exhaustion.

A vertical 42' section of 4" drilling pipe was being supported by a forklift tine and sash rope for an electric cable installation. The sash broke and the pipe fell to the ground striking a drilling rig worker and causing a skull fracture.

On July 14, 2015, at approximately 12:45pm, a tree trimmer suffered fractured ribs and injuries to his hip and pelvis after being run over by a Jaraff rubber tired industrial truck used for trimming trees and brush along a right of way.  A three person crew was returning to work after a lunch break. The Jaraff operator climbed into the cab of the equipment and began trimming branches. He raised the blade and drove over a pile of brush. When he exited the brush pile, the tree trimmer rose from the pile of brush and called out to the operator that he had been ran over.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was walking and fell to the ground fracturing her knee cap.

An employee was cleaning the floor around a machine when an unsecured piece of plexiglass (36 in by 36 in) fell about 36 inches from a ledge and landed on the employee's right thumb. The finger was amputated and required 28 stitches to repair.
One employee was admitted to the hospital for possible heat stress.
An employee's toes on the right foot were amputated after being crushed by a 36 foot long pillar.
An employee who was running cable and preparing lights for a film set was hospitalized due to heat stress and dehydration.

An employee was cutting a 2x4 on a table saw using a push stick. After the 2x4 was cut, the employee attempted to retrieve, by hand, a small piece of scrap wood that cleared the guard.  As the employee attempted to push the piece of wood through with his left thumb, the wood caught the blade and pulled his left ring finger into the blade amputating the tip.

An employee was separating steel bundles with an overhead crane when the rigging of one bundle shifted crushing the employee's right index finger. The employee was taken to the hospital and admitted for treatment.
On 7-14-15 a worker was injured when he ran over a foot with a reach truck.

An employee was holding a wall on a new house with five other employees. The bottom top plate broke adding weight to the wall. Everyone let go of the wall except the injured employee. The wall fell on him causing a fracture to his sacrum.

An employee was demolishing a basement floor with a sledgehammer when a section of flooring gave way and the employee fell 10 feet to the subfloor below.  The employee was hospitalized with head, neck, abdominal and back injuries.
An employee amputated the third digit on the right hand while operating a shear.
An employee was adjusting blades on a grinding machine while the machine was still in motion.  The employee got two fingers crushed and one amputated by the grinding wheel.
An employee suffered burns from a flash fire that was created by a trash pump unit powered by a gas generator. It is used to pump oil and water from an open top tank at the well site.

An employee was attempting to clear a product jam from a piece of processing equipment. When the product became free, the employee's hand struck a gear in the equipment resulting in a fracture to the index and little finger. The employee was hospitalized due to a surgical procedure that required the partial amputation of the little fingertip.
An employee was sent to the hospital after experiencing heat stress symptoms.

An employee was inspecting the roof.  As he was coming down the ladder, he lost his grip or his footing and fell 11 feet to the landing below and then continued to fall down the stairs for another four or five feet. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee lacerated his right knee when he came into contact with a sander that was not turned off.
An employee was cutting a board with a circular saw and amputated the tip of his left thumb.

The employee was working in the assembly line on the day of the incident. The employee notified his immediate supervisor that his hands were cramping. The employee was drinking water throughout the time that he was working, but the cramps began to get worse and he notified his supervisor. The employee was admitted to the hospital for dehydration and renal failure.
On July 15, 2015, an employee was shocked while working on a press in the forge department and was hospitalized due to the injuries sustained.
An employee suffered a partial amputation at the planer mill.
An employee moving tables injured his back and was hospitalized.
An employee was trying to access a tool box located on company pick-up truck by climbing the back bumper. His foot slipped and he fell to the ground injuring his hip.
A worker cleaning vents above the grill area suffered a grease burn on his left foot.
On or about July 15, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation of the left pinky tip when it was caught in a conveyor belt.
An employee working in the yard moving trailers with a spotting truck suffered heat stress and was hospitalized.

An employee delivering packages began vomiting excessively and contacted his supervisor.  His supervisor arrived and he was sitting on the ground (in the shade) with customers placing ice packs on him and still vomiting excessively.  He was admitted to the hospital with renal failure.

An employee was working on a skid steer. He had the loader raised. No loader locks, steel bars, or chains were being used to secure the loader in the raised position. The loader came down, pinning him between the boom and the skid steer. He fell to the ground. He was hospitalized for treatment of two cracked vertebrae and broken ribs.
An employee delivering packages complained of cramping to his supervisor and was taken to the hospital where the employee received fluids and was admitted.

An employee was cutting pieces of plate using a band saw. The employee's glove got caught by the saw causing the amputation of a portion of his left thumb. The employee was taken to the hospital for treatment.

An employee was in the process of positioning/flattening a blue polymer strip in a Schneider Senator machine which cuts the strip to the required dimensions.  Both of the employee's hands were in the machine at the time. The employee activated the foot pedal which caused the positioning clamp to come down on the employee's left middle finger resulting in a crushing injury and later amputation of the fingertip.
Employee received burn injuries while setting up the palletizer in the pallet mill.

The employee was connecting a rod for rock coring/sampling.  The rod is approximately 2" in diameter by 5' long, weighing about 15 pounds.  The head of the auger rig turns the rod.  The employee was using a 24" wrench to tighten the rod.  The employee activated the rig to help torque the rod.  The employee was injured when he put his hand between the pipe wrench and the turning auger rig.
An employee operating a tube mill machine received an impalement injury to his left foot by the scratch brush rod. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.
On July 15, 2015 an employee of a temporary staffing agency was operating an electric pallet jack. The employee ran over his foot, resulting in a compound fracture.
An employee was hospitalized for complications due to a muscle injury after working on the battery.
An employee was admitted to the hospital after a punch wound to the left palm became infected.

An employee was cleaning the lollipop machine. Her right hand was caught by the drive pulley which subsequently pulled her arm into the machine up to her shoulder. She was admitted to the hospital for surgery to repair her broken right arm.
The employee was using a hand drill at the shop drilling holes on a 2 inch piece of pipe. The electric drill bound up or jerked while he was holding it. The employee fractured his right hand.
An employee walking through the front doors tripped and fell, fracturing an arm in multiple locations.
An employee working from a pallet mounted on a forklift suffered a fingertip amputation when his finger was caught in the descending forklift mast.
An employee suffered right hand finger amputations while performing maintenance on a running forklift truck.
An employee slipped off the third step of a rollaway dumpster while trying to remove plywood from it and fell.

An employee was placing a piece of pipe on a baler table when the pipe began to roll off the table. The employee tried to catch the rolling pipe and caught his finger between the baler table and the pipe.
An employee became dehydrated while working at a construction site. The employee began to cramp and was taken to the hospital where he was administered IV fluids and kept overnight.
A nail from a pneumatic nail gun struck an employee's eye.  The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.  The incident occurred on 7/15/2015 at approximately 10:30 am.

Two maintenance employees were checking a belt on a CVP (Cold Vacuum Pack) machine and removed a guard to observe the belt slipping. An employee's finger was caught when the machine started automatically resulting in a soft tissue amputation of the third finger on his right hand.
An employee amputated the tip of his thumb while slicing cheese on an electric slicer.
The employee was sharpening a tool on a large bench grinder and his right thumb got caught in the grinder causing a partial amputation.

An employee was operating the extrusion machine. When he slid a piece of equipment inside the machine (Nissan Step Rail) his finger was in a pinch point and he received an acute wound to the left middle fingertip.
While setting a steel plate onto the roadway, the chain came off the hoe and the steel plate fell onto the employee's right arm fracturing it.

Two employees were power washing the interior of a bath house with a fuel powered pressure washer. The door was shut and the employees were overcome by carbon monoxide.  The employees were admitted to the hospital.

Employees were removing the flat plate assembly equipment in preparation for vacuum testing in manholes. During the removal process, one of the employees rolled his ankle and fell into the manhole breaking his ankle.

An employee was working with formwork that has pins and telescope. The finger was in one of the scaffold pin holes and when the scaffold collapsed it took off the tip of his right middle finger. No bone was lost.
An employee was exposed to work place violence.
An employee was bitten by a spider and was hospitalized.

An employee was lowering an automobile garage door when the wind caught the door and pulled it loose. The garage door struck the employee on the head and shoulder. The employee was hospitalized for injuries.
The employee was mail sorting when she tripped over an ergo mat breaking her left leg.  The employee was hospitalized.
An employee slipped and fell injuring her hip that required hospitalization.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation when clearing a jam on the cocoa system.
An employee cut his right pinky fingertip while using a vegetable slicer.

An employee was looking for debris on the rollers of the flexographic printer. She pulled the web back and her left-hand thumb got caught by the impressing roll and print cylinder. Her thumb was degloved and required surgery.

An employee was working near the wash line conveyor in the production area. She reached to remove a bucket from the conveyor when her right-hand pinky and ring fingertips were amputated by a chain and sprocket.

An employee stood on the edge of the top of a fryer to clean the hood. The fryer had a lid over the grease. The lid slipped off, and the employee's right foot and ankle went into the grease, receiving second degree burns.
An employee fell from a ladder while inspecting the roof.

An employee was installing insulation from a step ladder at an approximate height of 5 feet.  The employee twisted to the side and the ladder became unstable. The employee fell to the ground and fractured the upper right arm.

An employee's left ring finger got caught on an air pump as he was hurrying to return to the store.  He fell, dislocating his right thumb and degloving his left ring finger. He was hospitalized and his finger was amputated.

On July 17, 2015, at approximately 1:45pm, an employee was hospitalized after suffering two broken bones to his lower left leg. Before the incident, the employee was standing on the third rung of a 12-foot stepladder, tightening bolts on a flange with a torque wrench.  While applying pressure to the wrench, a reducer on the wrench broke, causing the employee to lose his balance. As he stepped down 34" to the gravel surface, he landed awkwardly on his left foot, causing fractures.
Two employees were hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee's right index finger was amputated while operating a trim press machine.
An employee fell through the roof, breaking his leg.

On July 16, 2015, an employee was using a crank handle to manually turn the shaft of a cement mixer. When the machine started, the crank handle flew out and hit the left side of the employee's face. He was hospitalized for a complex left ear and left upper neck wound.

An employee was cleaning out a powder hopper while standing on a platform ladder. He slipped, and his right hand went into the hopper to the bottom auger, which was about 12 inches from the top of the hopper. He sustained a right index fingertip amputation.
An employee's fingertip was damaged while using a grinder.

An employee was performing demolition work on the old baggage handling system at Terminal B.  The employee was cutting the last 2 U bolts. The pipe-hanger got caught and was hanging on the conveyor when it started to pull forward. It got free and sprung backwards, smashing the employee's hand.
An employee was operating a pole grab machine to load electrical poles onto a trailer.  The pole became dislodged, fell, and hit the employee in the face, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee was standing on a chair to put a box on a shelf when the shelving unit fell toward her. She injured the left side of her back, shoulder, and neck.

An employee was helping a welder install process pipe at the Koch Ag & Energy facility near Enid, Oklahoma. After offloading pipe that had been delivered to the site, he began to experience heat-related symptoms and cramping. He was hospitalized overnight for testing and hydration for heat-related illness.
An employee was replacing a belt on a compressor. The belt caught the employee's finger, causing a deep laceration. The employee was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was driving a powered pallet jack out of the cold storage room. As he was pulling out, a second motorized pallet jack approached from his left and struck his equipment. He attempted to stop the other equipment using his foot. His left big toe was pinched between the mast areas of the two pallet jacks and had to be amputated at the hospital.
An employee's right middle fingertip was amputated while pushing meat into an auger.
An employee was cutting on a five gallon drum with an acetylene torch. The residue in the drum flashed over and the employee suffered burns to his face, chest, and arms and was hospitalized.
An employee was pinned between two trucks and sustained life-threatening injuries requiring hospitalization.
A neutral line was down because of a storm. An employee was attempting to repair the line when he made contact with the live single line.
An employee on travel status fell over a railing to the floor below while waiting for a flight and suffered multiple fractures.

An employee was preparing to perform a complete disconnect of services. He was walking toward the utility pole and noticed a dog. He began running from the dog and fell.  He was hospitalized and had surgery on his left leg.
An employee was pushing a piece of 750-pound equipment up a 30- to 40-degree slope. The equipment rolled back onto him, fracturing his ribs, collarbone, and left femur. He was hospitalized.

An employee was using his hands to move rock from the conveyor belt to a shelf. His finger got caught and smashed between two rocks, resulting in a right index fingertip amputation. A small portion of the bone was surgically removed.
An employee hooked a lanyard to what he thought was a D-ring on his climbing belt, leaned back, and fell to the ground below. He actually hooked up to a tool on his tool belt.

An employee was moving a manual gate on a piece of equipment when the gate slipped from the employee's hand and pinched the left pinky finger between the gate bottom and equipment surface. This caused an amputation of the fingertip above the finger nail.

An employee inside the penitentiary was greasing the motor on an air handling fan. His fingers got caught between a pulley and belt, resulting in three-quarter fingertip amputation and small lacerations to his other fingers. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was up on the platform performing a visual inspection of the CP Roll. There are 3 to 4 rollers that go together to print. He slipped, and his hand entered an in-running nip point between two driven rollers. He sustained a soft-tissue amputation of his right thumb tip.
The employee's left hand was crushed and severely lacerated when he was struck by a fan attenuator.
An employee exiting her vehicle slipped on the curb, falling on her right hip.

Two employees were moving a refrigerator from the second floor to the first floor. One employee lost his grip on the refrigerator while going down the stairs. The refrigerator struck the injured employee, breaking three ribs and requiring hospitalization.

An employee was instructing another operator on how to run a task with a new machine set up in place on the autogrinder machine. He used his right hand to point out a piece of glass as material was being fed into the machine on a small conveyor belt. His finger contacted an in-going nip point on rotating gears, and he sustained a right index fingertip amputation.
An employee suffered a leg injury while performing maintenance work activities when a 1,000 pound submersible pump fell onto the employee, requiring hospitalization.
An employee's left pinky was amputated while closing the safe.
An employee's right arm got caught between a lead conveyor belt and a tail roller in the south crumb line. The employee suffered a compound fracture.
An employee was struck by a powered industrial vehicle.
While stepping off of a crane platform onto a ladder, an employee lost his balance and fell 66.5 inches, injuring his left leg. He was hospitalized for surgery.
While cleaning the kitchen area, an employee slipped on grease on the floor, fracturing his hip and requiring surgery and hospitalization.
An employee reached under a machine to retrieve envelopes. The employee's hand was pulled into the machine, resulting in a right index fingertip amputation.
An employee driving an ATV flipped and broke a leg.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut the walls of a trailer, which were being removed to be disposed of as scrap. The saw kicked back and lacerated his left calf area. He was hospitalized.
On 7/17/15, an employee's thumb was amputated when caught between a large steel ring and a railing during loading of the steel ring onto a trailer.

An employee was helping a coworker upright a 55-gallon drum full of liquid with the forks of a powered industrial truck. The drum fell, and the employee's hand got caught underneath it. He was hospitalized and had his left middle fingertip amputated.
While an employee was moving an empty engine hoist, the lifting arm of the hoist came down and severed the employee's right-hand middle fingertip.
On July 17, 2015, an employee was struck by a piece of a press machine while holding down a flat truss. The piece pinned and broke his leg.

An employee was working on a valve that was suspended in the air with a threaded eye bolt. The eye bolt became unthreaded and the valve fell on the employee's right ring finger. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was unloading water heaters from a forklift. The heater box bottom was faulty and came loose, causing a shift in weight that resulted in the employee falling two stories. The employee's feet and ankles broke.

An employee was picking up some battery cells from the floor of the shop using a forklift. The battery cells were being secured by the employee, but the batteries slid off and his hand got caught between the battery and the floor. He was wearing gloves. The fleshy part of the finger was severed from the hand.
An employee cleaning equipment bumped against a heated roll and suffered burns to the forearm and stomach areas.
An employee experienced heat stress systems while providing waste service to household customers.
An employee was bitten on the wrist by a cat on Friday, 7-17-15, at 5:15 p.m. The wound later became infected and required hospitalization.
An employee sustained a back injury while lifting a 20- to 30-pound box from a cart and was hospitalized.

An employee was installing a Bliss Press by securing four tie bolts using a hydraulic torqueing method. One of the bolts blew apart and struck the employee in the left leg. The employee sustained a fracture to his left tibia.

On 7/17/15, an employee slipped on the bottom two steps while descending a ladder (billy jack stand). He used his right hand to catch his fall. He later experienced swelling on his right wrist and required surgery for a fractured wrist.

While wiring a ground bar in a 1940s electrical system (3 phase sub panel 277 volts AC), an employee contacted live parts. He suffered burns to his hands and arms after an arc blast, requiring hospitalization.
An employee went up a ladder to change a lightbulb, descended the ladder, walked a few steps, and then turned or twisted and heard a pop in the left knee.
An employee was using a handheld portable power drill to hang a job site sign when the drill bit hit his finger.
An employee experienced heat-related symptoms, including dizziness and low blood pressure.  He was hospitalized for dehydration, acute renal failure, rhabdomyolysis, and hypotension.
An employee lost control of his truck while trying to avoid a deer, ran off the highway, and struck a tree.
Employee was hospitalized for chemical burns after cleaning chemicals got on his clothing.

An employee was holding an extension ladder while a coworker was on it. The ladder slipped and the employee's wrist jammed, resulting in a broken wrist. The employee was hospitalized overnight and received surgery.
An employee was repairing an A/C unit. While performing maintenance, the unit started and cut the employee's right hand. He had surgery and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee fell off of a truck trailer and broke his leg. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee slipped and fell.
After talking with a customer, an employee turned around and fell down on the floor, breaking her right tibia. She was hospitalized overnight for surgery.

An employee was standing on a step ladder to retrieve baking trays approximately 7 feet from ground level. While stepping down, she slipped off the ladder and broke her leg, requiring hospitalization.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion while working at the tire store on 7/18/15 and was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was struck by a mule pallet jack while attempting to get past it. His ankle got caught between the mule and a bollard. He fractured his ankle.
An employee was hospitalized for hydrogen sulfide exposure while pulling tank bottoms at an oil and gas waste disposal site.
An employee's thumb tip was amputated after getting stuck between rollers while threading the line.
An employee's foot got caught on a pallet in the lumber department; he fell and injured his left hip.

An employee was cleaning out the grinder for a spray dryer when a finger got caught in a pinch point between the fan blade and the opening to the fan blade housing. The employee sustained a left ring finger amputation.

On or about July 18, 2015, at approximately 8:10 a.m., an employee was dismounting an electric pallet jack in the warehouse.  After bringing the pallet jack to a full stop, she swung her leg out and struck an upright for a steel shelving unit, breaking a bone behind her knee. She was hospitalized.
An employee's finger got caught in a drill press, causing a partial amputation.
An employee was hospitalized after a 55-gallon drum ignited and fractured his leg while torch cutting.

On Saturday, July 18, 2015, around 9:00 a.m., an employee fell through the handrail system of an 8-feet-high platform to the ground while coming out of a grain bin during construction. He was hospitalized with a lacerated spleen.
An employee was struck by a forklift.

Employees were placing a 50-foot wood pole into the ground to support electrical lines. The line truck could not fit between the alleyway where the pole was to be placed. The injured employee was tasked with securing a bonding wire to the pole. He straddled the pole to about 12 feet to begin securing the grounding wire. As he stapled the wire, he lost his balance and fell onto the hard pavement/dirt surface. He was hospitalized and required surgery to repair his lower back.
A maintenance employee servicing a wheel abrading machine was hospitalized after breaking two of his right-hand fingers.
An employee's left-hand middle fingertip was amputated after getting caught between a large bearing housing and a tool rest.
An employee fell on a walking working surface, suffering fractures to the left wrist and knee.

An employee in the thermal forming department was troubleshooting a trim press when the employee sustained a left hand amputation. The equipment was not locked out and the guards were bypassed at the time of the incident.
An employee was hospitalized for severe dehydration.

While connecting an electrical volt meter to a 480V panel, an employee suffered first and second degree burns to the left hand. The employee was not wearing gloves at the time. The employee was hospitalized overnight for observation.

An employee was performing maintenance on a press. The employee was watching the motor and the belt of the press. He reached his left hand in to touch the belt and the belt engaged. His left middle finger was amputated by the belt and pulley.
An employee received third degree burns to the left hand due to steam from a vegetable cooker.

On July 19, at approximately 7:50 p.m., an employee was injured after stepping onto loose grating, which dislodged and allowed his leg to slip into an 18-inch deep trench. The employee received stitches and was later hospitalized for an infection.
An employee was heating up sealer on a seal coating sprayer. The employee lifted up the lid of the sealer container and a flame shot out, burning the employee's left hand and forearm.

On July 19, 2015, an employee was changing a bladder on an E5 tire press. While changing it, the rubber began to tear. He tried to grab the bottom ring on the bladder, and his right middle finger was partially amputated between the ring and the press.

An employee sustained severe injuries while operating a forklift with a clamp attachment. The forklift flipped, and the employee sustained a head concussion and a broken right hand, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was walking near a forklift holding a non-secure joint casing. The employee sustained a compound fracture to the leg when the joint casing rolled off the forklift tines and landed on the employee's leg.
While cleaning the rolls of a mill machine with a rag, an employee's hand got pulled into the rolls, amputating a finger.
An employee fell and fractured his shoulder. He was hospitalized.

An employee was operating a hydro blaster while cleaning a heat exchanger. As he exited a scaffold that was 15 to 20 feet in height, he slipped and fell through the ladder cage onto the concrete surface, injuring his lower back. He was hospitalized for surgery on his lower back.
An employee was cutting a steel pipe with a power grinder. The grinder kicked out and seriously cut the employee's leg.
While operating a table saw, an employee's glove got caught. The employee's hand was pulled into the blade, amputating 2/3 of the third left-hand finger.
An employee slipped on a wet spot in the showroom, fell, and fractured her hip. She was hospitalized and underwent surgery.

On July 20, 2015, an employee was climbing a fiberglass ladder to access a transformer when he was attacked by hornets.  While trying to quickly get off the ladder, he fell and broke his right arm and damaged his spleen.

An employee in the shop's face-frames department was operating a machine press that punches holes into cabinetry. As the clamping mechanism came down, it amputated her left-hand pinky finger. The employee required surgery.
An employee was holding a piece of lumber to cut it with a power saw when the saw kicked back and amputated the right pinky fingertip at the first knuckle.
An employee on a one-story roof was descending a ladder and fell 9 feet onto the asphalt ground, requiring hospitalization for severe bodily injuries.
An employee experienced an electrical shock and then fell from a platform.

Powdered product was being dispensed into a bag when the powder stopped coming out of the fill spout.  An employee reached up into the fill tube with his left hand/arm until his fingers reached the sliding gate valve, which opens/closes to start and stop the product flow. He pressed a button on a nearby solenoid valve with his right hand, opening the sliding gate valve in the fill tube. He then reached farther up in the fill tube and into the sliding gate valve. He released the button on the solenoid  valve, which caused the sliding gate valve inside the fill tube to close and amputate his left-hand middle fingertip.

On or about July 20, 2015, an employee tried to park his small landscape trailer in the Trew Stone parking lot at 901 River Road, Deerfield, MA. As he tried to unhitch it, the trailer started to move backwards. While he was trying to stop the trailer from hitting a pickup truck parked there, he got between the pickup truck and the trailer and his left thigh got pinched. He was hospitalized and received stitches.
An employee was working on a closed I-64 exit ramp at IL Route 177. A vehicle being driven by a site employee struck a nearby roller, which then struck the employee, breaking both legs.
An employee was performing milling work, taking up asphalt. The employee was struck by a semi-truck making a right turn.

An employee in a truck had his left foot on the ground and his right foot on the clutch. The vehicle was not in neutral at the time. When he let off the clutch, he was run over by the truck, breaking his pelvis.
An employee was walking out of an office into the lobby when she slipped on a wet floor. She fell, breaking her left hip.
An employee conducting HVAC maintenance in the base unit of a cell tower was hospitalized with severe dehydration.
A maintenance employee using a metal punch struck his left hand with a hammer, experienced swelling and inflammation, and developed an infection that required hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized due to a fall while climbing up pallets in a truck. He suffered a broken leg when the pallets fell on him.
An employee was helping a coworker replace struts. They were lining up pins when the supportive strap broke. The truck cab fell and crushed the employee's left hand, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee slipped off an 8-foot platform, fracturing his collarbone and bruising his ribs. He was hospitalized.

An employee was performing troubleshooting activities, trying to free a traverse chain. The employee attempted to turn the traverse motor, which drives the chain/conveyor, on and off. The traverse motor jumped 2 feet and impacted the employee's hand.
An employee was walking into work on the main entrance sidewalk on 7/20/15 at approximately 7:50 AM. The employee tripped/fell, fracturing their thoracic spine.

An employee was operating a mini excavator, removing a floor slab in the west annex of the green mile. The floor slab gave way, and the excavator fell one floor. The employee sustained a concussion and a severe laceration to the right forearm.

An employee performing wheel dressing operations on the TGI Centerless Grinder was injured when he reached into the grinding wheel to extract the dummy plug. He sustained a right index finger amputation.
On July 20, 2015, an employee was handling a customer service wire drop when he heard a clap of thunder and then felt a jolt in his left arm and hand. He was hospitalized with heart problems.

Employees were transporting a transformer with a forklift. The injured employee was struck on the foot and ankle by the front tire of the forklift. The employee's left leg was crushed below the mid-ankle, resulting in a left foot amputation.
An employee was pinned between a roll-off and a large construction dumpster.
An employee was offloading product when he fell and hit his head. He was hospitalized for treatment and testing.
On or about July 21, 2015, an employee suffered a left thumb amputation when her hand was pulled into a rotating part while unjamming an Elsner machine.
An employee was walking with a knife when he fell and injured his leg with the knife.
On July 20, 2015, an employee suffered a left finger amputation while clearing a wood jam in a saw.
On July 20, 2015, an employee tripped when the right foot got caught on a printer. The employee fell and fractured the right ankle, requiring surgery.
An employee delivering packages became dehydrated, got lightheaded, and began vomiting. The employee was hospitalized overnight for heat exhaustion.
An employee was positioning lumber in direct sunlight and temporarily lost consciousness. He was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee operating the RPE to pull and prepare product for shipment was hospitalized for dizziness due to possible dehydration.

On July 20, 2015, an employee was loading steel beams onto a truck when the beams fell. The employee tried to prevent the beams from falling with his arm, which got caught between two beans. His arm broke.
An employee fell approximately 35 feet in a ship cargo hold tank. The employee was hospitalized.
Two employees were working on a bakers scaffold when it collapsed.  One employee fell down and was struck by the scaffold, which caused a puncture that required hospitalization and surgery.
An employee fell and broke her ankle when she was descending a flight of stairs.
An employee who suffered heat exhaustion was given IV fluids and hospitalized overnight for observation.
An employee amputated two fingertips while clearing out a product jam on a dust collecting system.
An employee was tightening a clamp down onto a pipe when his finger got caught between the clamp and the pipe.
An employee was walking down the hall towards the bathroom when she slipped and fell, fracturing her right knee.
An employee throwing a desk into the dumpster fell and was injured.
An employee passed out while walking from dehydration. The employee was hospitalized for IV fluid treatment.
An employee suffered a car collision injury while delivering mail at or near 40294 299th Street in Wagner, South Dakota.
An employee attempted to remove a jammed bag from a machine. The machine activated, clamping the employee's finger. A knife came down and cut the tip of the finger.
An employee slipped and fell while walking into the lobby and was injured.
An employee spraying weed killer slipped and fell. The employee experienced back pain and was hospitalized overnight.

On July 21, 2015, at approximately 8:30 p.m., an employee was sweeping up sawdust and carrying a paint can at the ECG Crankshaft mill in Sharon, Pennsylvania. Conductors were sticking out of the metal conduit beneath a saw table at the time. The employee reached down to pick up the paint can, which then contacted the live conduit.  The can exploded, burning the employee's right forearm. The employee was hospitalized overnight.

An employee was tightening the chuck on a lathe using a T-handle when a second employee turned on the lathe, causing the T-handle to spin. The injured employee's right ring finger got caught between the machine and the T-handle, resulting in a soft tissue amputation.
An employee fell when he/she drove the forklift off a loading dock ramp. The loading dock had a broken door and broken ramp that were not guarded or blocked at the time of the incident.

An employee was dumping bags of dry phosphoric acid into a mixer from an elevated platform that was 8-feet, 9-inches high off the ground. A forklift had a pallet of the dry phosphoric acid.  The portion calls for 40 bags to be dumped. The pallet was airborne, not sitting on the platform.  The employee finished dumping the bags, turned to look for something, and fell between the pallet and the platform. The opening between the pallet and platform was 35 inches. The employee was unconscious and required hospitalization.
On or about July 21, 2015, an employee's left pinky got caught and amputated in a pinch point between the frame of an ergonomic lifting device and an adjacent limit adjustment bar.
On July 21, 2015, an employee dismantling a scaffold in an elevator shaft fell approximately 2 stories and sustained spinal injuries requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell 12 feet from a platform, requiring hospitalization.
An employee using a deli slicer was approached by a customer. Her right index finger was amputated by the deli slicer blade.

An employee was struck by a lower roller from a feeding machine. The employee was feeding cloth and rubber from the back of the machine. Tension built up and caused the roll to swing out from the machine. The employee sustained multiple injuries, which led to hospitalization: internal injuries, possible right arm fracture, three broken right-side ribs, and 6-inch laceration to right abdomen.
A flash fire at the acetylene filling plant burned an employee's arm and shoulder, resulting in hospitalization.
An employee experienced head pain. The employee was hospitalized overnight for dehydration and partial kidney function.

An employee sawing a piece of wood hit a knot while making a making a notch cut, causing the saw to grab the piece of lumber, which then pulled his left hand into the saw blade and amputated his fingertip.
On July 10, 2015, an employee scratched his left ring finger while placing the door back on an HVAC unit he was servicing. The finger became infected and required hospitalization.
An employee got his left arm caught in the automatic router.
An employee got his finger caught between a base plate and the ground while setting the footings of an outrigger.

An employee was closing the cover on the equipment he was setting up when his pinky finger got caught between the cover and equipment. His pinky finger was partially amputated between the nail and knuckle.
An employee completed painting activities and started getting cramps. The employee rode the bike to the water station to take a break. The cramping worsened, and the employee was hospitalized.

An employee was attempting to clear a blockage in a corn flaker. The equipment was shut down and locked out at the time. The employee removed a corn cob from the rollers when residual pressure from the rollers smashed the employee's fingertips, resulting in an amputation of the middle left-hand finger.
An employee got up on a conveyor he was placing. The conveyor came over him, breaking both of his arms.
An employee stepped through a cardboard box display and tripped and fell to the ground. The employee injured the right hip and was hospitalized with a possible hip fracture.
An employee was getting supplies from the supply closet when she tripped over the cord of a portable fan. She fell and injured her hip, requiring hospitalization.
An employee got out of his truck to unhook the trailer. His shoelace got caught on a piece of metal and he fell on the ground, injuring his forehead and breaking his arm.
An employee's finger got caught between a chain and the utility pole.

On or about 21 July 2015, at approximately 1000 hrs, an employee for Convent Health Services was injured while performing maintenance work near the Convent Children's Hospital in Lubbock, Texas. He was on the third rung of a ladder when he fell off, causing a laceration and severe ligament damage to his legs. He was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee's leg was run over by a forklift.
An employee was ascending a portable ladder and fell approximately 10 feet, breaking a hip.

An employee was using a crescent wrench and a one-half inch die nut to remove a sharp burr and metal shards from a stud. The employee's hand slipped off the wrench, slid down, and struck the stud, lacerating the left palm. The employee required surgery.
A crane was lifting a debris hopper. The wire-rope sling attached to the debris hopper failed during the lift. The debris hopper fell and struck an employee on the ground.
A crane was moving a load of steel. An employee's left hand was crushed when the magnet holding the load inadvertently turned off and released the load.

An employee was dumping trash in the dumpster when he experienced a headache coupled with nausea and cramping. He was taken to the hospital where he received fluids and was kept overnight for observation.

An employee was using an overhead hoist to move a cement bucket.  His finger was between the bucket handle and overhead hoist hook when the hoist was activated. His right index finger was amputated at the first joint.
On or about July 21, 2015, an employee was working out of a bucket truck. At 5:45 p.m., he lost consciousness. He was hospitalized overnight for heat stress.
While loading a 1,000-pound propane tank onto a trailer, the load shifted and crushed an employee's finger. His injury later required amputation.
An employee was injured and hospitalized when a forklift hit and ran over him.

An employee was working on a pipe-threading machine, placing caps on the end of a pipe. The employee's finger caught the sharp edge of the pipe and was severely lacerated. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee received burns to her hand from a collar and cuff press and was hospitalized.

On or about 19 July 2015, at approximately 1600 hours, an employee of Precision Drilling was lowering a roof over the mud tanks area during rigging down procedures. The roof fell on top of him, fracturing his ribs. He was hospitalized.
An employee's right hand got caught between a conveyor belt and roller, breaking three fingers.
On 07/14/14, around 11:30 p.m., an employee working on an overnight project fell 8 to 10 feet from a fixture while removing overhead racking that was being dismantled.
An employee suffered an amputation while connecting an air puller to the D ring of a hydraulic tong on a servicing rig.
An employee was seriously injured after a wood guardrail failed, allowing the employee to fall an estimated 10 to 12 feet.
An employee was bitten by a spider while cleaning a piece of equipment.

An employee was working on an air-conditioning rooftop unit. He opened the door to reset the unit when the door slammed shut on his finger, amputating the right index fingertip. The compressor was not turned off at the time of the incident.
Two employees were electric shocked and hospitalized.

An employee was in the meat department emptying water into a sink from a tub that is used to soak meat trays when he slipped and fell backwards. The store manager found the employee on the floor and helped him up. He was later hospitalized with a cracked rib and punctured lung.
An employee was bitten by an insect during her break and experienced swelling. The bite was lanced at the emergency room. The lanced area later became infected and the employee was hospitalized.

An employee used a forklift to dump the contents from a small dumpster into a larger dumpster when the cardboard got stuck in the small dumpster. When he pulled the cardboard, the lid on the small dumpster closed and pinched his finger, crushing and lacerating his left index fingertip.  The skin flap from the laceration was later removed during surgery to repair his finger.
An employee's finger got pinched while unloading a coupler from the spinning hanger tripod, resulting in hospitalization.

Two employees lifted a 400-pound deck plate. While landing the deck plate onto a pallet, one of the attachments protruding from the deck plate landed on the injured employee's right foot, fracturing the metatarsal.

On July 22, 2015, an employee was working inside a trench box, attempting to place dunnage under one side of the trench box to protect utility lines. The excavator bucket was used to lift one end of the trench box so dunnage could be placed underneath that section. The bucket unexpectedly released from the boom of the excavator as it raised a portion of the trench box. The bucket fell into the trench box, striking and crushing the employee who was hospitalized and had several surgeries.

In the research and development lab, an employee was testing a vacuum motor prototype. After installing the motor, he turned the power on to test it. The unsecured motor jumped out of its housing. When the employee grabbed the motor, his right index finger was amputated by the blades.

An employee was making adjustments to the "feed dog" on the multi-spindle screw machine located on the east side of the production building. The machine was energized at the time. The "feed dog" engaged, amputating the employee's left thumb.
An employee was repairing a tractor tire using a jack. Something happened where the tire came off the rim and the employee was found underneath the tractor.

An employee was cutting castings with a band saw and placing the cut castings in the walking/working area. He fell on the cut castings and dropped a torque tube on his right ankle, fracturing it in three places.
An employee experienced cramps in his lower legs, which would not stop and increased in the level of pain.
An employee was hospitalized on 7/27/2015 for a bacterial infection in his calf that developed after contacting contaminated water that was in a pipe he was cutting.
An employee walked approximately 30 feet off a second-floor balcony and landed on his feet on the ground below, injuring his knee.

An employee was preparing to repair a die on an aluminum die-casting machine.  While attempting to remove the die screws, the employee moved an oil line.  The line broke and sprayed hot lubricant oil over the employee's face, chest, and back.
