An employee's finger was pinched between a part he was fabricating and the press brake.  He lost his right middle fingertip.

Two employees were attempting to change a mold on a roto. The mold was chained up to a crane, and the employees tried to inch a grate underneath the mold to be bolted down. The second employee turned the grate and the first employee's finger got caught in the grate, amputating his index fingertip.
An employee was cutting into a sheetrock wall with a circular saw. The saw kicked back and cut the employee's left thumb around the first knuckle.
An employee experienced heat-related muscle cramps while loading materials onto a vehicle.
An employee suffered a back injury while stocking linens.
An employee experienced pain on the job site and was hospitalized.
An employee fell off of a step ladder as she was descending it. She fell and broke her right arm. She was hospitalized on 7/22/15 at approximately 9:45 a.m.
An employee's right pinky finger got caught between the door and frame of the bathroom stall.

An employee was setting up press rolls. He was between quests and changing the width of the spider arms on the press to install a different roll on the rotating spider arms. He left one roll on top and removed the bolts that keep the spider arms in a fixed position.  The weight of the roll fell down and hit him in the left shoulder as he was jumping out of the way. His foot got caught on the transfer table, and he twisted and fractured his right ankle. He also bumped his chin and received several scrapes on his right leg.
An employee sustained a finger amputation when a stringer caught his finger while operating an automatic drill.
On or about July 22, 2015, an employee fell at the entrance of the facility, requiring hospitalization for a fractured hip.
An employee was unloading a pallet from a dock when a forklift operator drove over the employee's right foot. He was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized after accidentally drinking chemical hand sanitizer.
An employee was loading a 35% peracetic acid concentrate canister into a sterilizer. The acid sprayed onto the employee, burning her eyes, neck, upper chest, left arm, left hand, and face.
An employee received an electrical shock.

On or about 7/22/2015, at approximately 5:15 p.m., an employee was using a shear saw to cut fiberglass blocks when the employee's finger contacted the saw blade.  The employee had four fingers on one hand amputated and three fingers on the other hand amputated. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was stapling books using the stapling machine and suffered a left ring finger amputation.

An employee attempted to clear stuck parts within a plastic molding machine by retrieving the molded part. The machine cycled and the mold closed, crushing the employee's hand between the two molds. The employee's right index finger was amputated. Lock-out, tag-out procedures were not performed at the time.

At approximately 12:45 p.m., on 23 July 2015, an employee was gathering nitric acid at 67% into an 8oz bottle. The employee filled the bottle and it splashed acid in 
the employee's face, causing chemical burns.
An employee was stung by bees and passed out while checking for a bee infestation at a residential apartment.
An employee was unloading inventory from the trailer of a commercial truck when he became weak and dizzy. The employee was hospitalized for observation and treated for heat exhaustion.

An employee was being trained. The trainer was closing a heavy duty metal door, which requires a skid loader to close it. The trainer did not see the employee and pinched/pinned the employee's lower legs with the door. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee's finger was pinched between the housing and saw blade while setting up a band saw. The employee's fingertip was cut off, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was resetting milk from a two-step ladder. While stepping off of the ladder, she stepped onto a pallet that was lying flat on the floor behind her, causing her to fall onto her right side. She was hospitalized with a broken hip.
An employee's hand became infected after suffering a scratch from metal when moving material.

An employee was cutting a piece of steel using an iron-working machine when the employee's hand got caught between the working metal piece and the machine. The employee's right-hand middle and ring fingertips were amputated.

An employee was standing on the third rung of a ladder while conducting lifting operations with a crane when a part came loose and hit him on his right shoulder area. He fell about 3 feet to the ground and fractured his pelvis and left wrist.
An employee was running a brake press. The brake broke in half, and the ram fell onto and crushed the employee's right hand. The employee had surgery.

A pipe was on a conveyor roll and stopped (both the pipe and conveyor were stopped). An employee was about to put a plastic bump ring on the stationary pipe when another pipe was fed in and bumped the stationary pipe. The employee's arm got caught between the two pipes, resulting in compound fractures to the left arm and left hand.

An employee was retrieving a tool that fell into a chemical tank using a pole. The tool fell off the pole and back into the tank, splashing the chemical on the employee. The employee sustained first, second, and third degree burns on the hands, right knee, thigh, calf, and right foot, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was struck in the head by a piece of plastic piping.

On July 23 2015, around 11:00 a.m., an employee working on a powerlift was adjusting a blade stock from the carriage when the carriage came down and pinched his right leg. He was hospitalized to suture the wound.

An employee attempted to remove a railcar rubber chock that was stuck beneath the wheel.  The employee was going to pull the railcar forward to pull it into the rubber chock. Once it hit the chock, the railcar would roll back, dislodging it.  The metal handle of the chock kicked back and struck him on his chin, fracturing his jaw.
An employee's right thumb was crushed.

An employee attempted to clear a jammed pork belly that had become lodged between the skinner and transfer conveyor in the curing department. The employee's left-hand ring, index, and pinky fingers were amputated after getting caught by the skinner's tooth roller and pulled into the machine.
An employee walked into the ground area where the operator was using a two-hand control to run the mixer/blender. The employee's hand reached into the blender, and his thumb tip was severed off.
An employee shut off the rough knot saw. When he began to exit the area, his right arm got caught in the blade, amputating his right arm above the wrist.
An employee was operating the pallet mill and crumbling machine when his hand got caught and amputated in the machine.
An employee tasked with cleaning out a floor drain on a common floor area was injured when the chemical used to unclog the drain blew back into his face. PPE was not worn at the time.
An employee installing cable at a private residence fell from the top of an extension ladder to the ground, injuring his head, neck, and arm, and fracturing his shoulder.

Employees were trimming a tree. A branch got caught in the crotch of an adjacent tree. They tied one end of the rope to the branch and the other end to a skid steer to pull the branch out.  Due to the orientation of the ground, the rope partially turned around a 6-inch diameter maple tree.  While the skid steer operator advanced the skid steer to tighten the rope, the injured employee stood by the maple tree and applied downward force on the rope to prevent it from "riding up" the tree trunk. The employee's right pinky fingertip got caught between the rope and tree as the rope tightened.  About 1/8 to 1/4 inch of the fingertip was amputated.
On July 23, 2015, an employee fell approximately 5 feet from a machine while performing a mold change and was hospitalized.
An employee suffered a fractured hip when she fell from a 6-foot stepladder while placing stickers on a sign.
An explosion occurred while an employee was performing work on a well head. He sustained burns to 60% to 80% of his body.
An employee stepped off a curb and fell. The employee was hospitalized with potentially cracked ribs.

The employee was setting up stairway forms at the Villages of River Oaks complex when he had some cramping. Later that evening, the employee started to feel additional pain in the stomach and kidney area and went to the hospital emergency room.  The employee had been vomiting and was unable to keep any liquids down. The employee is believed to be suffering acute symptoms of kidney failure due to dehydration. He was hospitalized.
An employee was riding on the back of a trailer. He stepped down to get off. The trailer tire was still moving at the time and rolled over his lower leg.
An employee fell 5 feet from a ladder. His leg got caught in the ladder, and he landed on his back and hit his head on scaffolding. He was hospitalized.

An employee's left hand reached into a tape machine to retrieve tape. His right hand was on the machine guard at the time. His right-hand index finger got caught in the rotating chain, and the top portion of the finger was amputated.
On July 23, 2015, an employee suffered a finger amputation while grinding a casting on a stand grinder.
An employee fell 4 feet from a scissor lift scaffold and was hospitalized.
An employee tripped over a phone cord in a patient's room. The employee fell and struck her torso, breaking a rib puncturing her spleen.
On or about July 24, 2015, an employee was hospitalized after performing job tasks and duties in the restaurant.

An employee was cleaning the area around the flat iron when his hand entered the iron's gear mechanism to clean it. The mechanism was operating at the time.  He removed the cover and his finger got caught between the gears, amputating his right finger to the first knuckle.
An employee sustained a right arm laceration while feeding poultry into slitter equipment.

On 07/24/2015, at 1:15 PM, an employee was struck by the front tire of a forklift truck while stabilizing a compressor that was being transported. The employee stumbled and fell, and the forklift ran up his right leg, crushing it nearly to the knee. The employee's left foot got crushed and he suffered broken bones in his right leg (tibia and fibula).

An employee was crawling in a space near the tilt devices to retrieve skimmers that he had placed under the platform in the work area. The tilt device in the molding area came up and crushed the employee between device and the floor.
An employee was trimming hedge with a hedge trimmer next to a concrete wall when the trimmer flew back and caught his right hand.
On or about July 24, 2015, an employee sustained serious injuries after being pulled into a conveyor by the hair.
On or about 7/25/15, an employee's left ring fingertip was amputated while trying to clear a jam in a press in the production area.
An employee was testing a newly assembled dough divider. While the employee cleared the machine of dough, the guillotine activated and cut the employee's fingertip partway down the nail.

An employee was walking to retrieve tools and/or material when he tripped over the metal tract on the floor. The metal tract is secured to the floor for drywall installation and its lip protrudes up about 1 inch. His toe/boot got caught on the tract and he fell at ground level on his buttocks, possibly fracturing his left hip. He was hospitalized.
While using a copper fitting device, an employee cut his hand on a piece of copper on 7/24/15.
While unloading auto parts from the back of his tractor trailer at a customer's location, an employee fell approximately 4 feet to the ground.
An employee's left-hand middle finger was amputated from the fingernail down.

On 07/24/15, an employee was using a self-retracting safety knife to cut through a zip tie.  The knife got stuck, so the employee attempted to dislodge it. When it came loose, the knife struck the employee's left arm, cutting an artery. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.

On 7/24/15, at 1:15 p.m., an employee sustained a laceration to his left arm near the elbow while moving a 4x10, 26-gauge sheet of sheet metal (36.4 pounds) from one table to another. He was hospitalized.
An employee was constructing a display for the fair. While using a circular saw, he amputated the tip of his second left-hand finger.
An employee was operating a manlift and was struck by a vehicle. He was found on the ground unconscious and was hospitalized.
On July 24, 2015, an employee was adjusting a roll-forming machine when his hand was pulled into the running die. He broke his left thumb and sustained a left index fingertip amputation.
On 7/24/15, an employee activated the trigger of a paint gun that was pointed at his hand.  The pressure of the paint cut his left index finger, which got infected. He was hospitalized.
An employee was exposed to moving parts while removing the lockout pin during servicing operations on a wind turbine power generator. The employee suffered a finger amputation.
An employee was on the second level of a scaffold outside of a building, installing an exterior insulation and finishing system, when he fell six stories. The scaffold was unguarded at the time.

An employee was moving a stack of small beams from one area to another to clear space using an overhead crane. He set the material down and went to pull the chain from between the beams when the hook caught one of the beams. The stack toppled over and trapped his left leg. He was hospitalized with a fractured left leg.
An employee was talking with another employee on the dock. He stepped off the edge of the dock and fell. His hand struck a dumpster and his head struck the ground. He was hospitalized.

An employee was lifting tire assemblies onto a wheel balancer. The assemblies weigh approximately 50 to 100 pounds each. The employee felt a pull in his back; the pain worsened over the day and he required hospitalization.
An employee worked with a foreign object inside his boot. After removing the boot at home, the employee found blood and was later sent to the hospital for an infection.
An employee suffered 2nd degree burns on his foot when molten material splashed onto his boot. He was hospitalized.

An employee was positioning the lift truck to pick up a tub of parts. He backed into parts tubs behind him and made a rapid forward correction. The quick movement threw him off balance and he fell back. He attempted to steady himself by shifting his left foot, which placed the toe of his foot outside the body of the lift truck. His momentum caused him to pull back on the controls, reversing the lift and causing his left foot to get caught between the lift truck and a tub.  The force crushed the steel toe cap of his safety shoe. He sustained bone and tissue damage to the first four toes of his left foot.
An employee was performing tasks when he reached across a conveyor. The guard got knocked off, and his finger got caught and lacerated in the chain and sprocket.

An employee performing service and maintenance on a conveyor system injured his calf muscle on his left leg when it got caught between the conveyor sorter slat and a cross brace. The conveyor was not locked out at the time. The employee's leg required surgery.
An employee sustained an amputation while working on a machine.
An employee fell and ruptured his spleen while unjamming the cyclone on the roof.
An employee was moving a hose when a manual job switch was activated. Her hair got caught and wrapped around the shaft of the post gluer machine when the machine operator went to adjust the machine.

The employee was working on a sewer truck and trying to pull a ladder down. The ladder was stuck and when he forced the ladder to move, his left ring and middle fingers were pinched between the ladder and a utility door. The left ring fingertip was amputated (no bone loss).
An employee was wearing gloves and had a ring on his left ring finger. As he descended the ladder of a JLG scissor lift, his finger got caught in the deck of the lift. His finger was amputated.
An employee operating an articulating man lift was overcome by heat.

An employee parked a van. As the employee exited the vehicle, the van rolled forward and the door struck a pole. The employee was pinned between the van door and van and was hospitalized on or about July 25, 2015.

An employee was aligning highway cones in the construction zone when his legs became pinned between a public driver's car and the rear end of the company's pickup truck, resulting in the amputation of his right leg and the possible amputation of his left leg.
An employee was installing pins on the electric hospital bed when the headboard fell on and broke his wrist. He was hospitalized overnight.
An employee was waiting for welders to complete an isolation on a pipe. The employee started cramping and was hospitalized with a muscle injury.

An employee was walking backwards with a pallet jack that was loaded with two pallets of product on its front forks. He walked into another pallet jack being operated by a coworker. His right ankle/foot struck the operating platform of his pallet jack, breaking bones in his right foot.
An employee was hospitalized for dehydration/heat exhaustion.
An employee got struck by metal shelves and suffered a soft tissue injury.
An employee's feet got hung up on something, causing the employee to fall onto rocks on the ground. The employee was hospitalized on July 26, 2015.
On Sunday, July 26, 2015, an automobile drove through the front of the store; the impact injured an employee.
An employee was moving a metal drum on a pallet when the employee's finger got pinched under the drum edge, amputating the left pinky fingertip.
An employee suffered burns to both hands and the right side of the face while moving a vehicle on the fire line on 7/26/15 at 5 p.m. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized with an ankle injury after falling 4 feet from a pipe lifting machine.

An employee's thumb tip was amputated while operating a band saw to cut boneless ribeye steaks in the meat department. Hand/finger guards were not in place at the time. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
On or about July 27, 2015, an employee sustained a serious leg injury after a steel coil fell on the employee's leg.
An employee was sitting at his desk when he felt itching and pain in his left-leg shin area. He had received a poisonous spider bite and was hospitalized with a 105-degree temperature.

On July 27, 2015, Employee 1 was hospitalized after being struck in the head by a robotic arm.  The employee became unconscious briefly and sustained a laceration injury. On August 12, 2015, Employee 2 was hospitalized after sustaining a foot injury while operating a new stand-up type forklift. The employee's foot was crushed in between a cabinet and the forklift that the worker was operating.

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer. These events are captured as one report.
On 7-27-15, an employee stooped down, hit a leg, and felt a bump under the knee. The employee experienced pain and swelling in the left knee and was later hospitalized for cellulitis.
An employee suffered an amputation while working on a hydraulic cylinder.
An employee working at the foundry building got overheated and was hospitalized.

An employee was tightening a fan motor belt. The belt was energized at the time. His left hand slipped and his fingers came into contact with the spinning fan blades, resulting in multiple lacerations to the left-hand fingers/fingertips. He was hospitalized and received stitches.
An employee had a hole in his safety shoes and water from working with the concrete soaked his foot resulting in chemical burns.  He was hospitalized and scheduled for skin grafts.
An employee was injured when his electric pallet jack accidentally made contact with his ankle, resulting in a broken ankle and fibula.
An employee working from a telescoping multiladder in a step ladder configuration fell from the ladder. The employee was hospitalized with a fractured right wrist.

An employee was working under the hood of a vehicle suspended above him by a hydraulic automobile lift. The vehicle unexpectedly started moving forward while on the lift and struck his shoulder area. He was hospitalized.
An employee walking down a hall with new floor tile slipped and fell.
An employee working on an elevated work platform 5 feet above the floor slipped and fell, striking his head. He was knocked unconscious and was hospitalized overnight with concussion symptoms.
An employee was working on a blast furnace, checking rigging that was used to install the large valve linkage. The employee bent down and started having lower back spasms, requiring hospitalization.

The employee was sitting in the break room and wasn't feeling well.  The employee was given fluids.  The employee passed out and was taken to the hospital. The employee was working in an un-air conditioned building.

An employee was carrying a piece of 2x2 metal angle on a canopy. When he walked to the ledge of the canopy, the retractable pulled him backwards and caused him to fall with the metal angle. As he was falling, he flipped and landed face down with his arms breaking the fall.

On July 27, 2015, a work crew was rigging up. At approximately 11:45 PM, a guardrail was installed. Before the workers secured it with bolts, the injured employee leaned against it and fell 26 feet to the ground below. He sustained five small fractures to his back and was hospitalized.

An employee was ascending a steel fixed ladder.  The employee fell approximately 7 to 9 feet to the ground below. The total elevation change was 9 1/2 feet high.  The employee suffered a head laceration and broken bones and was hospitalized.
An employee lost a fingertip while using a running interleave machine.
On or about July 27, 2015, an employee's hand was caught underneath a load of steel being moved from the ground to a truck bed.  The employee's left index finger was amputated.
Employee was performing maintenance by changing out lubricator. While manually putting the sheave back on, the employee caught a finger between the sheave and belt.

An employee was unloading a container from the loading dock.  He was pulling the metal plate that fits between the loading dock and the container when his right index finger got stuck between the plate and dock and was partially amputated.
A faulty crate of stone weighing approximately 300 pounds tipped over and hit an employee in the leg, breaking his right shin. The employee required surgery.
An employee climbed a ladder to access equipment on a mezzanine at a customer site. The ladder slipped out from under him, and he fell and fractured his L2 vertebra in two places.
An employee's arm got caught in a conveyor while trying to dislodge waste food. The employee sustained a compound fracture of the arm.

An employee was removing a hole cover to align some forms to set up an AC unit. The forms were misaligned and had to be reset.  The employee fell through the hole, approximately 15 to 20 feet. He hit his head experienced swelling. A harness was not worn at the time of the incident.

An employee was running a phase line for an electric customer when the resident's dog chased him. He tried to climb over a 4-foot fence to escape and his left pant leg and foot got caught on a post. He fell over the fence, breaking the tibia and fibula in his left leg.

An employee was loading trash into the back of a truck. He began to feel cramps and was dehydrated. He was placed in an air conditioned van and given fluids, and was hospitalized when his condition worsened.
During a deboning process, an employee's left-hand index fingertip was cut by a knife. The fingertip was medically amputated just below the cuticle line.
An employee was hospitalized after he dismounted a moving pallet jack and his foot got caught between the pallet and the jack.
An employee was using a portable chop saw at a customer's house. The guard got hung up as the saw was raised, and the saw blade severely lacerated and broke bones in the employee's left hand.

An employee was rolling a door casing to form the door when his left hand got pinched between metal rollers, injuring his left index finger. He was hospitalized, and his finger was medically amputated.

An employee was using a full revolution mechanical power press to assemble a small component. The employee cycled the press using a foot pedal. The employee's left index finger was in the point of operation at that time, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was shocked and fell backwards while pushing a button on a conveyor system.
While working at a building supply facility, an employee collapsed from heat exhaustion and was hospitalized.

On or about July 27, 2015 at approximately 9:15 p.m., a maintenance employee experienced shooting pain in the left arm, chest, and back, as well as heart palpitations, while installing a pump with two coworkers.  His left hand was seizing up and he couldn't move it. The employee was hospitalized for dehydration and heat stress.

An employee was working at Tyler Mountain Water facility in Poca, West Virginia. The employee's hand was placed inside a blow mold, and his two middle fingers were squeezed together. The machine was in operation at the time of the incident.

An employee engaged in automobile wiring activities under a raised truck body was crushed when the air line supplying air to the air bags, which raise the truck body, released and caused the truck body to come down on the employee.

On or about July 27, 2015, at approximately 5:30 a.m., an employee fell from a mobile ladder stand and suffered head trauma.  The employee was hospitalized with possible arterial bleeding near the brain.
A maintenance employee was inspecting a fan. His finger got caught between a drive belt and pulley.

On 7/27/15, at 4 PM, an employee was taking out an old power line and adding a new power line on existing poles (working live) using a jumper or mechanical. The employee suffered flash burns on the arm, rib cage, right calf, feet, and body.
An employee's legs were burned while putting gasoline on a pile of wood that was on fire. He was hospitalized.
An employee was admitted to the hospital for heat-related issues after performing roofing activities.
An employee's third and fourth digits were amputated.

An employee had his hand on a spring he was building for a garage door. He pushed the lever to lock the clamp in its place, and his hand got caught under the clamp. He pulled his hand away, amputating his left thumb tip in the process. He was hospitalized and had thumb surgery.
Two employees operating a meat slicer inside the kitchen area lacerated their fingertips requiring amputation.
A patient care technician was helping to move an obese patient when the employee hurt his back and groin.
An employee unloading furniture from a freight truck suffered heat stress and was hospitalized.
On or about July 28, 2015, an employee was bitten by a cat during a restraint and received an infection. She was hospitalized.
An employee tripped in a ditch 4-feet deep by 3-feet wide and banged his face on a rock. He was hospitalized.

On or about July 28, 2015, an employee's right index finger was crushed when it was caught between the body cage of a forklift the employee was operating and a truck trailer. The employee was hospitalized.
On or about July 28, 2015, an employee sustained a partial finger amputation while cleaning out the manifold on a filler machine.
On or about July 28, 2015, employees were moving 20-foot tall racking when a section fell, striking an employee on the head and resulting in serious injuries and hospitalization.
Employee admitted to ICU.  Employer indicated he was low in sodium.
An employee coating gas pipe with solvent experienced a burn to the left arm.
An employee was moving a meat slicer in the trash room. Protective gloves were not worn at the time. The employee sustained a left-hand finger amputation.
An employee was hospitalized with a broken right hip after exiting elevator bank 3 on the first floor of the J. Edgar Hoover Building.
An employee slipped and fell on a recycle conveyor belt, resulting in a second degree burn. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was donning a chemical suit when he lost his balance and fell. He was hospitalized with a fractured leg.
An employee engaged in tree cutting and trimming with a chainsaw fell approximately 30 feet to the ground below when his support rope was cut. He fractured his pelvis.

An employee was sweeping the warehouse floor with his head down. A forklift operator was driving in reverse when he struck the employee and ran over his leg. The employee was admitted to the hospital and underwent surgery for a left leg fracture.
While moving a ladder to a tree, an employee stepped on a wet branch and fell 10 to 12 feet to the ground.
An employee working on a furnace experienced heat-related stomach and leg cramps and was hospitalized.

Two employees were removing a roll up door from a truck for repair.  One employee had the right pinky finger at the distal joint pinched hard enough to cause an amputation.  The second employee received a laceration needing sutures and an open fracture.
An employee was cleaning the build-up off the tube mill roll with a rag. The rag pulled the employee's thumb into the nip point between the turkhead roll and the tube, amputating the left thumb.
An employee received an amputation injury from a latch installation machine after accidentally activating the machine.
On 7/28/15, an employee had been operating lift truck. After getting off the truck, the truck moved and bumped into the employee's leg, breaking it.
An employee's finger was amputated while cutting a 4-inch, 90-degree elbow with a band saw. The blade caught the elbow and pulled the employee's hand into the blade.

On July 28, 2015, employees were attempting to pick up a concrete cure deck bridge. There were three employees (one in the fork lift and one on each side of the bridge holding tag-lines) performing the task. The employees attached rigging on both ends of the bridge to relocate it closer to where the pour will take place. During the pick, the rigging fell out of the hook causing one side of the bridge to fall and hit the employee fracturing the tibia/fibula.
A case of plums fell off of the third level racking system onto an employee working on the ground below.
An employee fell from a 4-foot ladder. The employee experienced temporary paralysis and was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized due to heat stress and dehydration.

On or about July 28, 2015, around 10:00 p.m., an employee slipped on coolant in the machining center. The employee's right wrist hit a milled surface and was cut. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery.

An employee was connecting a pneumatic-charged hose to a piston assembly when the piston started operating. His left-hand little finger was amputated near the first digit and his ring finger was amputated near the second digit. He was hospitalized.
An employee was hospitalized on 7/28/15 at 11:00 a.m., due to a fall while stocking the walk-in cooler/freezer, which resulted in a broken arm.

An employee tripped over a box of oranges in the walk-in refrigerator. She hit her head against the door, scraped both forearms, and fell to the floor on both knees, fracturing one kneecap. She was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee operating a rolling bar of a cold rolling machine (a machine which treads the metal bar) was injured during operation. 

The employee was running a previously treaded metal bar/bolt through the cold rolling machine; while standing on a one foot metal grading/platform.  The employee's shirt got caught on the spinning bar, and as the employee tried to break free, the employee's pant leg got caught, thereby flipping the employee over the bar onto a concrete floor and breaking his leg.
An employee was operating a pasting machine when he began feeling ill. He went to the break room and experience a rapid heart beat. He was hospitalized overnight for heat exhaustion.
An employee was moving a metal beam for a car lift and it fell on his left foot fracturing it. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was working on a dried vegetables turntable in the stuffing department.  The employee 's finger was along the side of the table when 1/8" to 1/4" of the right-hand index fingertip was amputated.

On July 28, 2015 and approximately at 1:30 p.m., a welder was operating a milling machine in the machine shop to fabricate two sheet metal pieces for a printing press (screen printing industry). His left hand middle fingertip became caught in the two sheet metal pieces and a running drill bit of the equipment.
Two employees were injured when the tower section rolled out of the hook on the backhoe and landed on them. Each employee broke a leg.
An employee become overheated while laying bricks during a construction project at a church.
Employee was working in a heated environment (106 degrees) and suffered dehydration.
Employees are exposed to heat-stress related illnesses when working in the hot, humid greenhouse.
An employee attempted to move a pallet jack, lost his balance, and caught his foot between the pallet jack and a stationary pallet jack.
An employee fell 4 feet from a ladder while cutting a barge cover with a cutting torch. He fractured ribs and was hospitalized.

An employee dropped a bottle of BX-DMANPA.  The bottle broke.  The employee cleaned up and worked the rest of the shift.  The employee went to the hospital and was admitted.  The employee had an irritated throat and an allergic reaction to the BX-DMANPA.

An employee fell approximately 8 feet from a loft that was used to store seasonal products. The loft is enclosed and employees gain access by climbing a ladder. The employee backed into a door that is normally locked and fell.  The door was unlocked at the time of the accident. The employee was hospitalized and required surgery for broken bones.
An employee passed out due to heat illness.

An employee stuck her right hand into the covered (stout) part of the snow machine to remove stuck crushed ice. As she was removing her hand, the right middle finger was cut by a sharp metal object, resulting in a partial amputation of the fingertip.

The injured employee states that she was up on a ladder, grabbing something from a top shelf (riser). As she was coming down, she slipped, reached out, grabbed a wire that caught a ring on her left ring finger, and de-gloved her finger. The injured employee required surgery to repair the injury.

An employee was working on a horizontal band saw while cutting stock material. He was advancing the material when his hand came into contact with the blade. His pinky finger and two fingers next to it were amputated. He was hospitalized.
An employee fractured her hip when she tripped over the base of a clothing rack in the ladies dressing department.

An employee was pumping the chemical sump into a tote. He was attempting to connect a 1 in. hose to a portable sump pump via a hose clamp. He plugged the sump pump in before tightening the hose clamp, causing the connection to break and the chemicals to spray into his face. The employee was taken to the hospital and released. The employee is receiving medical treatment.
Part of an employee's left thumb was amputated while operating a circular saw.

An employee suffered an avulsion to the left index finger when it was caught underneath a pipe.  The employee was inspecting a pipe when he/she lost his/her  footing and the pipe fell, catching the left index finger.
An employee was driving an electric pallet jack through the warehouse when her foot slipped. Her left leg broke when it got caught between a support beam and the pallet jack.

An employee was driving a golf cart into the storage area to park it for the day. He attempted to prevent the door from closing using his foot. His foot and leg got pinned between the golf cart and the door.
An employee helping with drywall construction became overheated, felt dizzy, and had a light headache. He was hospitalized overnight and given fluids.

An employee was hospitalized as a result of a struck by hazard to the head.  An employee was operating a yard truck and attempted to disconnect from a trailer. The glad hand snapped and struck him in the head.

After the galvanizing cycle, material (product) is no longer in the zinc, but is still inside the kettle, at which point two workers will skim the zinc off the top of the kettle. Two monorail cranes carry this beam in and out of the kettle housing. The cranes have chains connected to a bow that holds the beam. The chain between the lifting block of the crane and bow failed; one end of the beam fell, hit the molten zinc vat, and caused a splash. The injured employee was wearing a Nomex suit, face shield, and eye glasses at the time. The surface of this vat is at about waist level. The densest portion of the splash hit the injured employee in the groin, burned through the Nomex coveralls, and caused third-degree burns.  Another portion of the splash hit the employee on the chest/abdomen area and caused second-degree burns. A small splash of molten zinc also hit the employee's face, and the last portion landed on one of the injured employee's feet, causing a burn.
An employee was hospitalized overnight for heat exhaustion/dehydration.
The employee was stacking pipe when he was struck by a pipe. His ear was amputated resulting in an overnight hospitalization.
An employee was hospitalized for heat stress after leaving work early.

An employee was holding a ladder for another employee to access the top of a bulk propane tank.  When the employee was in motion to step off of the ladder and onto the tank, the ladder slipped and amputated the employee's right hand thumb.
An employee was hospitalized due to extreme heat.

An employee was unloading a freight trailer pallet loaded with groceries. While in the trailer, a pallet shifted and fell on the employee's leg. The employee was hospitalized with a possible broken leg.
An employee fell from the top of drums loaded on the rear of his service truck while trying to reach absorbent materials. He struck the shelves in the truck, straining and tearing a back muscle.
On or about July 29, 2015, an employee sustained facial injuries after losing balance and falling to the ground striking his/her face on the floor.
An employee was cutting a metal panel with a saw when the blade broke, hitting and cutting his face.

An employee was trying to close a window. As he pushed the window, it broke causing a deep laceration to the little finger on the left hand on the bottom side near the joint. Additionally he had a smaller laceration on the left wrist.
An employee was pulling clots when he felt a pain. He went to the hospital for a hernia.
Four workers were in a crew truck located in a work zone when it was struck by an automobile.
An employee was cutting open a steel barrel. He set the plasma torch/cutter on a barrel beside him and the barrel exploded. The force of the explosion broke his arm.

An employee operating a high-reach truck ran into the forks of another high-reach truck. The forks of the other high-reach truck were approximately 1 foot above the floor. The employee sustained a fractured tibia and fibula and crushed knee on the left leg, requiring hospitalization.

On or about July 29, a temporary employee assigned to demo a commercial building was standing on a six foot ladder pulling speaker and telephone wire when he fell 4-6 feet to the concrete floor breaking his arm and cutting his shoulder.
On or about July 29, 2015, an employee sustained injuries consistent with electrical shock while filling a pop machine.

On or about July 29, 2015 an employee operating a side boom crane was injured when his right ankle was caught between the wench of a backing bulldozer and the bumper of the boom.  The side boom crane operator was attempting to hook up the wench at the time of the accident.
On 7/29/15, an employee was walking to the assembly area when she fainted. She was hospitalized and treated for severe dehydration.
An employee was arc welding brackets on an overhead conveyor with an electric welder when a spark fell on his shirt and caused it to catch on fire. He suffered burn injuries to his back.

An employee was working in an apartment complex installing CFLs/aerators/shower heads for energy efficiency. The employee began experiencing signs of dehydration (light-headed and dizzy). The employee drove himself to the hospital and was admitted.
An employee was finned by a catfish while picking up and sorting the fish. The employee's fingertip was amputated after becoming infected.
An employee was delivering packages. He experienced a gradual onset of cramping in his arms and legs, followed by nausea. He was hospitalized for treatment of heat stress and dehydration.

An employee was walking into the switchboard area and turned to leave the room. The employee tripped on a table leg near the door. The employee fell to the floor fracturing her hip. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was filling propane at a Lowes in Herkimer and received propane burns on both legs.  He was admitted to the hospital for first and second degree burns.
Employee caught his left calf in a hydraulic spooling machine during well drilling.

An employee was helping the lead repairman remove the fan drive from a truck. Both were using a long handle torque wrench. The employee was assisting for leverage. The lead repairman was pushing down the wrench and the employee's right hand was in the way. The employee had 3/4 inch of the tip of his right hand ring finger amputated.
An employee received flash burns as he worked near overhead powerlines.
An employee trimming trees fell approximately 40 feet when the main climbing line anchor broke.

An employee was coming out of a hole with tubing when the tubing broke. A pipe fell and hit the employee on the head, causing the employee to lose consciousness. The employee was wearing a hard hat at the time. The employee was hospitalized overnight with a mild concussion.

Two employees were in a UPS delivery truck trying to replicate an issue a driver had reported with the truck. When the driver took a hard left turn, the employee in the passenger seat fell out of the truck and landed on his head, requiring hospitalization. He was not wearing a seatbelt at the time of the incident.
An employee had his left ring finger amputated when a 35 pound form fell on his hand.  He was carrying the form. He tripped and dropped the form and it landed on his fingers.

An employee was pouring metal from a ladle. As the employee was moving the ladle down the line, the tip of his right index finger got caught between the ladle and the I beam. The employee had about a pencil eraser width of his fingertip amputated.

An employee working South of Delta cooling tower was removing a 380 lb. stuffing box from packaging using a grove crane. The crane was not involved. As the employee was moving the stuffing box on the skid he pinched his left pinky between the box and the shipping crate amputating his left pinky tip.
The employee was working on a ladder.  The ladder broke causing the employee to fall 8 feet to the concrete.  The employee broke his left femur.
An employee delivering mail felt dizzy and passed out. The employee was hospitalized for heat stress.

An employee was delivering a package to the door of a residence. When he walked up the steps of the residence, he felt something pop in his hip. He sustained a hairline fracture on the neck of his hip and was hospitalized.

On July 29, 2015,an employee standing on a tubular steel beam hanging sheeting, untied his safety harness and was in the process of crossing a vertical beam when he slipped and fell resulting in a compound fracture of his right leg.
A concrete saw operator complained about not feeling well and was admitted to the hospital for a possible stroke or heat stroke.
An employee was hospitalized and provided IV fluids for dehydration.
An employee suffered heat exhaustion and was hospitalized.

Two employees were traveling between buildings in a golf cart. Road conditions were wet and slippery from recent rainfall. The golf cart was traveling downhill, and the driver slammed on the brakes to stop the cart. The golf cart overturned, throwing the injured employee out. The cart landed partially on the employee, fracturing his left arm and injuring his shoulder. He was hospitalized for treatment. The injured employee was not wearing a seatbelt at the time.
An employee was doing landscaping work at a new apartment complex and started feeling lightheaded, dizzy, and sick. The employee was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.
An employee was performing MIG welding operations in the hopper department for 4 hours when he became overheated. He passed out and was hospitalized.

While opening a rolling wall in the ballroom of a hotel, an employee's right-hand middle finger got pinched between two portions of the rolling wall. The employee was hospitalized and his middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee was working on a wildlife habitat improvement project. While lifting a rock, he twisted and injured his back, requiring hospitalization.
An employee became sick after mowing and edging the grass at the Omni Hotel and Resort in Fernandina Beach. The employee was hospitalized on July 29, 2015, for dehydration.
An employee was working on a refuse truck collecting garbage and putting it into the truck.  He became ill and started vomiting.

An employee experienced severe cramping in both legs, an arm, and a hand while walking back to work after a rain storm. The employee was hospitalized for treatment and observation for heat exhaustion.
During a fall protection training session, an employee was choked unconscious from the fall protection system.

A delivery driver experienced dehydration symptoms while on his route.  He contacted his supervisor for assistance.  The supervisor then took the driver to the hospital for treatment.  The driver was admitted and provided fluids.

An employee was operating a debarker at a lumber yard.  A limb got stuck and the employee attempted to remove it by wrapping the chain around the limb and using the hoist. The limb came free and hit the deck where the employee was standing and then hit the employee in the foot.
An employee was delivering mail when they experienced dehydration, kidney failure, and heat illness due to heat exposure. The employee was hospitalized for dehydration.
An employee missed a step while descending a step stool, spraining the left ankle and requiring surgery.
An employee was operating a motorized pallet jack when he bumped into a stack of adjacent pallets. The pallets fell on him, causing contusions to his head, arms, legs, and hands.
An employee completed his deliveries for the day and later experienced cramps. He was hospitalized overnight for dehydration.
The top part of an employee's thumb was amputated on a table saw.
An employee was struck by a garbage truck while on delivery route, requiring hospitalization for a serious leg injury.
An employee became nauseous and began vomiting. He was hospitalized overnight for heat exhaustion.
An employee's left hand was struck by a mixer blade while he cleaned the concrete mixer.  His fingers broke and were badly scraped, requiring surgery.

An employee launching a pig and carrying a pushing rod ran to help a coworker when his legs gave out 
and he collapsed.
An employee was wiring an exit sign when he received an electrical shock and suffered a severe burn to his finger.

An employee drove a forklift (standup pick truck) to the end of an aisle way and was unable to stop before running into stopping blocks and a wall. The collision crushed his right foot between the operator platform and the cart that he was carrying, amputating three toes and partially amputating one toe.
An employee slipped and broke their patella.
An employee's finger was partially amputated in the chipper.
An employee was polishing a 3-inch diameter part on a lathe when her hands and arms were drawn in and injured. She was hospitalized.
An employee was found on a pallet by a coworker. The employee had fallen from a man lift and was crushed by it, breaking all of his ribs and requiring hospitalization.
An employee received arc flash burns while cleaning off insulators on a transformer.
An employee was supervising the loading of material onto a pallet when some of the material fell on his left leg.
An employee slipped while walking in the store, injuring his left elbow and requiring surgery.
Two employees were shot by an ex-employee that came to the office and started shooting. Both employees were hospitalized.

An employee was delivering a package to a location on 7/30/15 and was approached by five to six men. The men shot the employee in the right hip and in the middle of his abdomen. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was going to install anchorage and tie off to a 6/12 pitched metal roof for a small repair job. The employee waited for the roof to dry for about an hour. However, the roof was still wet and he slipped and fell off the one-story roof onto the concrete patio of the residence. He landed on his legs, suffered a fractured knee cap, and required surgery.
An employee fell approximately 6 feet to the ground while checking/repairing a cable line at a customer's house, injuring his elbow and requiring surgery.
An employee was working on a pump when material that was 45% potassium hydroxide sprayed out and contacted his face.

An employee accessed the roof to attach his fall protection at the peak so he could start loading shingles. He stepped on a toe board, which dislodged and caused him to fall 10 feet to the ground. He was hospitalized with a back injury.

An employee cutting meat with a band saw in the meat room received a deep laceration to the right hand between the index and middle finger. The push plate guard was removed while the band saw was in operation.
On Thursday, July 30, 2015, an employee suffered a left-hand index fingertip amputation while using a 130-ton hydraulic press brake with another operator.

An employee injured the back of his head when he passed out and struck it against the pavement. The employee passed out after pouring ice water over his head while taking a break from doing landscaping work.

An employee operating a baler-compactor was injured at 2:52 PM on July 30, 2015. The employee's right hand was caught between the machine and a raised bucket. The employee was hospitalized overnight and required surgery to amputate two right-hand fingers.
An employee was hospitalized overnight to receive fluids for swelling and a painful wrist injury from moving a parking berm.

An employee saw a customer stealing brake fluid and followed the customer to the parking lot in front of the store. The customer assaulted the employee with a window squeegee and fist and then ran away. The employee was hospitalized for facial fractures, broken teeth, and brain hemorrhaging.
An employee was picking orders in a warehouse area while riding a powered pallet jack. His left foot was run over by the pallet jack when he stepped off. He was hospitalized.
While working with a coworker to remove a spare tire from under a vehicle, the spare tire fell and crushed an employee's left thumb. One quarter of the employee's left thumb was amputated.

In the loading bay, an employee was standing next to a parked vehicle. He moved a loading cart out of the way. A coworker was driving an armored truck, and the rear tire well hit and pinned the injured employee between the two trucks. He sustained punctures and contusions to his right-leg calf.

An employee was going to turn a switch that adjusts the wood planner settings on a lumber conveyor. The employee sustained a fractured leg while standing on the conveyor, which was located approximately 2 feet above the ground.

On Thursday, July 30, 2015, at 10:15 AM, an employee was placing rectangular inserts into the press to form a window, which is the internal section of a transformer. The employee's hand was either crushed or mashed, resulting in an amputation of his right thumb tip.
An employee made contact with an energized conductor on a transformer while performing a test. The employee received electrical contact burns to the right hand.
An employee felt sick while sitting in his crane and showed signs of heat illness. He was hospitalized for severe dehydration.

An employee had used 2x4 to chock a trencher wheel. While working on the trencher, the wheel slid and caused the trencher to fall on the employee's arm, breaking the right humerus and requiring surgery and overnight hospitalization.
An employee was burned by hot water while disconnecting a pump hose that was under pressure. He was hospitalized.
Two employees were injured and hospitalized after the dead 69000 volt line they were installing came into contact with a lower 12000 volt live line.
An employee was using a punch press and attempted to remove the gasket from the point of operation. The employee's right index and middle fingers were amputated.

An employee was using a groover machine when the employee's left index and middle fingers came into contact with the machine's point of operation. A portion of the left index and middle fingers had to be amputated.
An employee was using a pneumatic torque wrench while working on a well head. The employee lost control of the wrench, which struck his right thumb and fractured the bone.
On July 31, 2015, at approximately 11:00 a.m., an employee was hospitalized after experiencing dizziness, cramping, nausea, and severe sweating due to possible dehydration.

An employee was offloading aqua ammonia from a truck at a customer's site. The employee closed the valve on the customer's side. He disconnected the hose on the truck side, but did not close the valve. The employee was exposed to aqua ammonia fumes and hospitalized.  He was wearing a respirator at the time of the incident.
An employee was injured while attempting to remove a cat from a kennel. The employee was bitten on the left thumb, causing two puncture marks on the left thumb.

At 11:45 a.m., a piece of lumber kicked back while an employee was fitting board through a machine. Three pieces of the lumber got stuck in the employee's forearm, requiring overnight hospitalization.

An employee carrying a tote walked up to the large trash compactor to dump the tote contents. A coworker rolled up a pallet jack carrying a large box to the compactor and struck the employee, pushing him into the trash compactor. The employee's right upper leg broke, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was changing out a pole-mounted transformer. A wire that the employee touched was still energized by the overhead powerlines. The employee was shocked by 7200K volts, suffering electrical burns to both hands and memory loss and requiring hospitalization.
An employee had been working outside at a jobsite in downtown Atlanta, Georgia. He was hospitalized for heat exhaustion.
At the company location, an employee was struck in the head by a board that got caught in the powered rolls and shot out of a wood grinder.
An employee felt pain in his groin after lifting a heavy package. He was hospitalized.

While descending a ladder, an employee encountered a wasp nest. The employee was attempting to swat at the wasps when he fell 6 to 8 feet onto the concrete, causing the employee to break his left hip and fracture his right knee.

An employee was spraying water onto scrap steel that had spilled out of a furnace and had been cut into pieces using an oxygen lance. A steam explosion occurred, causing a second degree steam burn to his face and hands.  He was hospitalized.

An employee received a laceration to the lower right leg while cutting metal. The completed cut of metal fell from the saw table and struck the employee's leg. The employee was hospitalized overnight.
An employee fell 13 feet, 6 inches, to the ground while inspecting a roof. The employee cracked several ribs and was hospitalized.
An employee was putting in a residential service when he suffered heat stress.
An employee tried to clear a jammed part in a machine.  When he reached in, the part moved, pinching and amputating his fingertip.

On 7/31/2015, at approximately 7:30 a.m., an employee in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) was helping a patient turn her body, so that the file film for x-ray preparation could be placed beneath the patient's body. The employee began to walk around the patient's bed when she tripped over IV tubing and fell to the floor. She sustained a right-leg femur bone fracture and bruised her face.

An employee was operating an auto-bend machine. She was inserting a piece of metal bar into the machine when her finger got caught in the machine. Her finger was smashed between the metal bar and the tubing, resulting in a right middle fingertip amputation.
An employee was exposed to molten iron when it poured on his foot.
An employee was stabbing a mud tool into casing when the employee's left-hand thumb was amputated just behind the thumb nail. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was unloading a tractor from a trailer on a customer's property when the brakes disengaged and rolled on top of the employee. The employee sustained left shoulder and right knee injuries.
An employee re-aggravated a prior back injury while bending over to pick up an item, experiencing pain and falling to the floor. She was hospitalized.
A forklift backed over an employee's right foot, resulting in hospitalization.

At approximately 1:55 p.m., on 07/31/15, an employee was performing heat sealing on cotton bags.  A coworker dropped a cap onto the floor. The injured employee bent down to pick up the cap while placing her hand inside the platen press point of operation. She stepped on the guarded foot pedal, cycling the press onto her hand. She received second degree burns to her left hand, requiring hospitalization.

Two employees were involved in an accident on Friday, July 31, 2015. The employees were installing siding from a pump jack scaffolding when one of the support brackets came loose, causing the scaffolding to swing away from the structure. The employees fell to the ground and suffered multiple fractures, requiring hospitalization for treatment.

An employee was changing a shear's die using a hoist. The die became lodged by a piece of dowel. As the employee reached to check where it was stuck, the die dislodged while still under the tension of the hoist, causing the die to move upward and pinch his middle and ring fingers.  Approximately 1/8" of the employee's left middle finger was scraped.

An employee was overseeing a natural gas line repair contractor at the intersection of West Glen 7 North Monroe, Ridgewood, New Jersey. The employee experienced dizziness and light-headedness and was hospitalized for treatment of dehydration and low sodium.
An employee stepped up 6-1/2 inches to his work station and rolled his ankle, fracturing it and requiring hospitalization.
While grinding a gray iron cast, the casting got caught and pulled an employee's finger into the grinder. He sustained a partial amputation of the left-hand little finger.

An employee was using a handheld circular saw to rip cut a short piece of wood stock. The injured employee was positioned close behind the circular saw, helping to hold the short 2 X 6 wood stock.  The blade became bound, causing the circular saw to kick back. The blade struck and amputated the injured employee's left-hand thumb, requiring surgery.
An employee fell approximately 18 feet from a ladder. He was hospitalized with fractured ribs, a fractured clavicle, a collapsed lung, and numerous contusions and abrasions.

An employee was laying a culling table on its right side to access its underside. He tilted it towards himself by reaching across to the far side with his left hand and grasping the near side with his right hand. As he was laying it over, the top edge was approximately 6 inches from the floor when the table legs slipped. He lost control of the table, which fell and struck the floor. His fingertip got caught between the tabletop edge and floor and was amputated. He was hospitalized.
A Baker Boy Bake Shop, Inc., employee was hospitalized after receiving burns from hot water measuring approximately 180F while cleaning a conveyor oven.

An employee was on the back of a flatbed trailer inspecting a load for accuracy before the truck left the store for a delivery. The employee fell off the flatbed, struck his head upon landing, and was hospitalized.
While an employee operated a motorized pallet jack, his right pinky finger got caught and severed between the handle of the pallet jack and a metal machine.

A maintenance employee was getting a glass to rinse out his mouth after having some coffee. He immediately noticed the water tasted funny and spit out the water. A chemical sanitizer, pH+, used in the facility had back-flowed into the potable water lines and contaminated the drinking water. The employee's lips, inside of the mouth, and tongue were burned.

On 08/01/2015, at 0700 a.m., an employee was removing chilled iron from a cupola moat when he sustained burns to his hands, arms, and face. The employee drove the bucket loader into the moat after water was applied to hot sand, which caused steam to burn the employee.
An employee was walking his mail delivery route when he experienced heat stress symptoms. He was hospitalized and treated for heat exhaustion.
An employee operating heavy equipment was backing a unit into the trailer when the employee lost control of the unit. The employee was hospitalized with head, mouth, and nose injuries.
An employee working on the automated parcel bundle sorter machine fell to the floor after tripping on a piece of strapping material. The employee's left arm was injured, requiring hospitalization.
An employee was unloading a produce truck using a powered pallet jack. He backed into a parked forklift and his arm got caught between the forklift's arms. He amputated his right middle fingertip.
An employee working in the kitchen was walking past a co-worker who was working near a dish cart. The employee tripped over the co-worker's foot and fell, suffering a broken hip.

Schindler Elevator employees were removing a 17,000-pound escalator on a dolly. One of the employees tripped, causing him to knock the injured employee to the ground. The injured employee's pinky and right ring finger were then run over by the loaded dolly. The employee was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was removing a door. The door fell, striking him on the left side of his head.

An employee was landing in a jump spot. Upon landing, the employee ran into a coworker who was already on the ground and pulling his parachute in. The employee was hospitalized with C6 and C7 neck fractures.
An employee was lifting a 5-gallon oil container to empty it when he felt a pop. He was hospitalized with a collapsed lung.
While moving a scissor lift, an employee stepped onto the forks of another parked forklift. His foot got stuck on the forks and he fell, injuring his left hip socket.
An employee was called to help with an unruly patient. The patient became violent and hit the employee in the jaw, breaking both jaws and knocking out several teeth.
An employee was overcome by heat while welding building structure materials.
An employee tripped on a pallet of merchandise and broke her hip, requiring surgery.
An employee was cleaning a running tortilla conveyor belt when his left-hand, fifth finger got caught and partially amputated.
An employee was installing a kick panel on a forklift when his finger scraped along the top edge of the panel, cutting his fingertip. He was hospitalized for an amputation.
An employee's finger got pinched between a stationary forklift and a cart loaded with metal products. The finger was amputated.

On August 03, 2015, at approximately 4:00 p.m., an employee operating a forklift was loading a metal part onto a pallet. A second employee saw the part rolling and attempted to stop it with his foot. The pipe rolled off the pallet and his leg got caught and injured under the part.
A maintenance employee was working on a machine with a coworker when his right index finger got amputated in a rotating area.
An employee was setting a pumping unit using an impact hammer. The employee was hospitalized for heat stress.
An employee suffered a right index fingertip amputation while closing a parking gate.
An employee climbed up on to the roof to power wash a mounted air conditioning unit when he fell 7 or 8 feet and was hospitalized. No fall protection was worn at the time.
An employee working on the ground was disassembling the boom of a crane to add another section. A section of the boom landed on and fractured the employee's lower left leg.

An employee was troubleshooting a strapping machine and spraying WD-40 into it when his hand felt like it was going to sleep.  He rested his hand on the machine, and his ring and middle fingers were placed in a pinch point. He fractured two bones just below the nailbed, requiring surgery.
An employee broke a leg after stumbling over a die.
An employee was going up a ladder to the roof to perform tack welding. He had a safety harness on and was trying to tie from the ladder when he fell off.
An employee got caught between two steel forms, resulting in a broken leg and overnight hospitalization.
An employee was tracking a group of illegal aliens down river when he fell into a ground pit that was 15 feet deep, resulting in broken ribs and a punctured lung.
An employee was standing on the back of a box truck when he turned and fell off. The fall was approximately 42 inches. He hit his head and was hospitalized.

An employee was performing maintenance on a polishing machine. The employee was opening the plate/platform to get inside the machine to remove a part. After stepping in the open area of the machine, the employee felt a sharp pain/burning sensation in the right abdomen area. The employee suffered a hernia.

An employee was walking on a steel beam when his personal fall protection got hung up on a wire rope clip while anchored to a horizontal life line. He fell approximately 10 feet to the steel deck below and broke his leg.
An employee was cleaning out a mixer when his right thumb tip was amputated. The mixer was not turned off at the time.
An employee slipped on a scaffold ladder rung, lost his grip, and fell approximately 14 feet to the ground.

On or about August 3, 2015, an employee was painting from a step ladder that was positioned on a scaffold. The employee fell, breaking the orbital bone, nose, jaw, and both wrists. The employee was hospitalized.
On or about August 3, 2015, an employee was struck by a man lift while walking down an aisle.

On August 3, 2015, at approximately 8:48 a.m., an employee was operating a pie and tart press machine. The employee's hand reached into the machine, and his finger got squeezed between both plates during the pressing process. His fingertip was amputated.
An employee was using a handheld drill to drill into a part when the employee's glove caught the drill bit, amputating the left index fingertip.
An employee was filling a bend with hot water when the hot water spilled on him, causing serious burns.
An employee fell off an extension ladder.
An employee was hospitalized as a result of a left upper arm injury.
An employee was attempting to take a sample from the brownie blender. He lifted the lid of the blender. The lid came down and struck his right ring finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was walking across Route 367 and was struck by a motorist's SUV.
An employee climbed up a ladder to replace a faulty aerial drop at the mid-span connection point. He fell from the ladder and sustained a left forearm compound fracture.
An employee was hospitalized after being nauseated and throwing up from working outside in the sun for some time.
An employee got caught in the top plate of a shaper in the dovetail department. The employee was hospitalized for surgery on three left-hand fingers.
A Wood Products, Inc., employee was injured when his hand came into contact with a chop saw blade. The employee was hospitalized for nerve repair.
An employee was hospitalized due to heat-related symptoms.
An employee was walking up some steps and fell. During the fall, he cut his right bicep on a piece of metal.
On 8/3/15, at 10:00 a.m., an employee amputated the left thumb tip while cutting cabbage. The employee's cutting gloves had holes in them at the time.
On or about August 3, 2015, an employee suffered a fingertip (left ring) amputation after entering the point of operation of the hydraulic brake press during production.
An employee was picking up a mail tray on the bottom of a rack when the employee felt back pain.

Employee was in a boom lift elevated approximately 7 ft. high and was maneuvering the lift backwards when he became pinned between an aircraft wing and the lift.  The employee was hospitalized with trauma to his abdomen that required surgery.
An employee was working in the middle foundry molding area when he stepped in a hole and broke his left ankle.
An employee was unwrapping a pallet on the back of a truck. The employee slipped on the plastic, fell off the truck, and was injured, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was operating a PIT when he put his left hand down into the bracket that holds the battery. The employee's finger got caught and crushed between the battery and the bracket, resulting in a fingertip amputation.

On August 4, 2015, at approximately 7:45 a.m., an employee was starting to descend from a crane. As he bent down to grab the hand rail, he flexed his knee and his knee popped. He then called for help to get down from the crane.

An employee opened a rail car that contained sulfur and was possibly exposed to sulfuric acid vapors. The employee either jumped off the rail car or fell off the rail car.  The employee was not wearing fall protection or a respirator. The employee was taken to the hospital.
An employee was making adjustments on the paper feed of a printer when four fingers on his left hand were crushed to the second knuckle in the rollers. He was hospitalized.
A metal ladle struck an employee in the back, resulting in burns.  An interlock failed and the employee was not protected at the time.
An employee was photographing/documenting shipped items on the loading dock. The employee's foot got run over by a fork truck and the employee's leg also broke.
An employee operating a reach truck was trying to avoid a column. While trying to steer clear, she stuck her foot out and fractured her left leg.

An employee was moving a beam with a crane. He unhooked the beam and was lifting the hook when the hook caught the beam. The beam fell, striking him and breaking his right femur. He sustained a compound fracture to the right femur bone.
An employee was picking up a piece of equipment when a mechanism broke off and fell on the employee's lower right leg between the knee and foot.
An employee was trying to move a trailer with a trailer dolly. The trailer slipped off the dolly, causing the dolly to fall on and fracture his ankle.
An employee was working at a sub-station when he experienced cramps and fatigue from hot weather conditions. He was hospitalized for treatment.

An employee was using powered industrial equipment (picker) to retrieve products from a rack.  He was struck by another powered picker machine and his foot got caught between that picker and the rack. He sustained a laceration on the bottom of his big toe and second toe, and his big toe broke. He was hospitalized.
An employee's finger was partially amputated in the pinch point of a weave machine loom.
On or about August 4, 2015, an employee was staging coils with a crane. The two coils came together, pinching and amputating the employee's left middle finger.
An employee was hospitalized as a result of a right hand injury.
An employee was hospitalized due to an ankle fracture.

An employee was running a billet saw and attempted to clear a jam. His glove got caught and his hand was pulled into the saw blade, cutting his right middle finger and right thumb and requiring hospitalization.
An employee working in the store's back room twisted her ankle while pulling a cable from a two-way radio. She fractured her right ankle and was hospitalized.
An employee's foot was run over by an electric power jack and his toe was amputated.

An employee had a piece of weed eater cord tied around his left thumb while driving a golf cart. The weed eater string became entangled in the wheel of the golf cart, causing a partial amputation of his left thumb below the fingernail.
An employee was using a jointer to join two pieces of wood when his left hand slipped into the blade. His left ring finger was amputated.

On 8/4/15, at approximately 5:20 a.m., two employees were robbed while stopped at a Fuel Depot gas station to refuel their work vehicle. The first employee was shot three times in the stomach and the second employee was beaten up, suffering a fractured jaw, busted lip, and bruises all over his body. Both employees were hospitalized.
An employee was doing maintenance on a machine. His right index finger got caught and the fingertip was amputated.

An employee was standing on the floor of a trailer and pulling a piece of furniture. The employee lost his footing and fell to the floor of the trailer. He was unable to get back up and was hospitalized with a hip fracture.
During a baseball game, an employee was struck by a line drive to the head, suffering a skull fracture and dermal hematoma.
On or about August 4, 2015, an employee was moving a glass panel from one location to another when the panel slipped and landed on his legs.  He was hospitalized.

On or about August 4, 2015, an employee installing safety guard rails on the second floor of a building began to feel ill and experienced cramping. He was hospitalized overnight for heat-related illness.

An employee was walking on freshly lain concrete blocks when one of the blocks 
came loose. The employee fell, landing on his face and hitting a PVC pipe.
An employee sustained an amputation while operating a rolling stainless steel plate machine.

An employee was struck by an excavator and got pinned between a building column and the excavator. The employee sustained two broken ribs, a broken shoulder, a punctured lung, and a crushed artery in his right arm.
An employee was attempting to replace an air-conditioning louver on an inside duct when an air filtration unit fell and struck the employee's right pinky finger.
An employee was standing on a piece of equipment.  The drum that spools the cable caught his foot near his left little toe, and the toe was amputated.
An employee was retrieving a check from a safe in the manager's office when she closed the safe door on her right ring finger.  Her right ring fingertip was amputated.
An employee was loading a packaging machine when her pinky finger got pulled into the machine.
An employee was wrapping a load when a log rolled off the load and came down on top of him. The log hit his torso, cracking his ribs, puncturing his lung, and requiring hospitalization.

On 8/4/15, an employee riding the back of a waste collection truck operated the sweep blade control. The truck was in motion at the time. His foot got stuck between the sweep blade and the truck. Three left-foot toes were amputated.

An employee was entering warehouse through a pedestrian door. When the employee reached back to engage the warning buzzer, the door came back on the employee's hand, crushing the left middle finger and resulting in a subsequent amputation.
An employee was operating a lathe on 08/04/2015 when he got some of the shavings in his fingers. He attempted to remove the shavings himself. His finger became infected.

An employee was cutting metal rebar with a powered saw on the Staten Island Expressway (Exit 13) when the saw exploded, splashing gasoline onto the employee's legs. The gasoline caught fire, and the employee sustained third degree burns to the legs. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was using a pedal-activated form roller. The employee was preparing to feed a piece of metal into the form roller, holding the metal above the machine when he inadvertently actuated the foot pedal. His glove got caught in the rollers, and his hand was pulled into the rollers.
An employee was lifting a coil with a hoist and chain when the coil fell on him.

An employee was mowing a lawn using a riding mower.  The employee was mowing on a hillside with wet grass when the mower began to slide down the hill.  The mower eventually contacted a parking curb and the employee was ejected from the mower. His left foot got caught under the mower deck and he sustained amputation injuries to the two small toes on his left foot.

An employee was inspecting a center pivot corner system to determine why the nozzles on the corner arm and overhang were not functioning properly. While navigating the corner arm platform, the platform tipped and caused the employee to fall to the ground and break his leg.
An employee was cleaning and lifting a screen on a vibrating conveyor when the screen fell, smashing and amputating her pinky finger.
An employee was closing off a pressure release valve when hot water sprayed his left arm and stomach.

A maintenance employee was troubleshooting a rotary valve for a pallet on the roof. While cleaning debris around the plug inside the fitting valve, the employee's finger was amputated by rotating blades. The unit was running at the time of the incident.

An employee fabricating highway signs was welding on a metal plate (approximately 530 pounds and 28"x33"x2") when the tack-welds gave way and the metal plate fell onto and crushed the employee's right leg.
An employee was cleaning the gluer rollers with a rag when his right hand got pulled into the rollers. The equipment was running at the time of the incident.
A chef was working when he started to feel fatigued. He was admitted to the hospital for dehydration.
An employee lost three right-hand fingertips in a pants press, which operates by foot pedal and closes on the pant leg.
An employee was struck by a vehicle in the driveway behind the quick lube service area.
On August 5, 2015, at approximately 4:00 p.m., an employee sustained a left index fingertip amputation when it was pinched between two crane pads that were being loaded by a crane.
An employee was holding a cat for a veterinary exam when the cat turned its head and bit into the employee's left-hand tendon between the index finger and thumb.  The employee required surgery.
While getting out of a tugger, a maintenance employee tripped over something, fell, and could not stand up. He broke his right femur just below the hip on his right side and was hospitalized.
An employee was overcome by heat stress while conducting oil-well servicing operations.
