An employee was delivering parts when a shoe string got caught on a door stop at a customer's worksite. The employee tripped and fell, injuring the left knee.
On August 5, 2015, at approximately 12:00 p.m., an employee exited the cab of his crane and fell to the ground, fracturing his right hip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was descending a ladder after loading a high ceiling when he fell from the third rung to the floor, fracturing his vertebrae.
An employee got up to quickly address a patient's alarm. She tripped and fell, lacerating her head and fracturing her arm.
On or about July 7, a window clerk was handling an express mail package when she felt a pop in her neck. The employee went to hospital the next day for a neck injury.

An employee operating a lawnmower in the median was struck by a car that swerved into the median. He sustained injuries to his right leg and chest and experienced bleeding from his ears, requiring hospitalization.
An employee fell from a ladder, striking his head.

On August 5, 2015, at approximately 2:30 p.m., an employee was using plasma cutter to cut a length of 2-inch pipe. The pipe was on an automated table that uses rollers to move the pipe down the line and out of the building for offloading. Towards the end of the process, the employee pushed the pipe to speed up its exit from the building. His glove got caught by the roller, which pulled his arm in and trapped him between the roller and a metal bar. He fractured bones in his arm and hand that required surgery.
An employee fell off of an 8-foot ladder while installing metal canopy.  A beam fell, knocking the ladder out from under the employee who broke a rib and punctured a lung.
An employee working on electrical service started having cramps and was eventually hospitalized.

An employee was performing normal work duties doing a "meter run" when he started to feel badly and went to the Arnett office.  Employees/management at that location thought the employee was suffering from heat related issues and called an ambulance.  The employee was treated at the hospital for heat stress.
An employee was mopping a staircase with multiple sections and landings when he misstepped and fell onto the corner edge of the lower level step.
An employee was cutting a wood plank with a powered circular saw when the saw kicked back and amputated the right-hand middle fingertip.

An employee was pinning tubing together to skid the rig. The employee's hands were placed between the two pieces, and the left pinky and ring fingers got pinched. Both fingers were surgically amputated.

An employee was trying to remove a piece of geo-fabric while installing a 24-foot stormwater pipe when his hand got caught between two sections of the pipe. He partially amputated his left ring finger and lacerated his left middle finger.
An employee at a customer site injured her leg when she tripped and fell on customer-owned exercise equipment.
An employee carrying mail was hospitalized with heat-related illness.
An employee was leading a guided tour when a child started to fall. The employee stretched out to grab the falling child and broke his right ankle.

On August 5, 2015, at approximately 3:15 p.m., an employee was cutting meat on the power meat saw. He tried to cut some very thin steaks and lost his grip; his right thumb came into contact with the meat saw blade, and his right thumb tip was amputated.
An employee became ill from the heat on his delivery route. He was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was cutting pork chops with a meat saw when the employee's right thumb sustained a partial amputation/severe tissue damage.
The last digit of an employee's right-hand index finger was amputated.
On August 5, an employee was cleaning floors and equipment when he hit his head walking underneath a conveyor. He experienced headaches and was eventually hospitalized with a brain blood clot.
An employee was moving cattle to a pen and went to split the cattle herd. The horse the employee was riding tripped and fell with the employee.
An employee amputated two fingers.
An employee was descending from a pole and got into a neutral position. He unclipped his belt and fell approximately 20 feet.

On 08/05/15 at 6:45 pm an employee was moving a steel I-beam with an overhead crane. The rigging caught the beam and the beam fell on the employee.  The employee was hospitalized with a broken right femur.
An employee's right hand got crushed when caught in the nip point between two rollers on a paper winder. The employee's middle and ring fingers were involved.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while cleaning a filler machine.

An employee was working as a laborer cleaning a new road that was done by the company. The employee walked over to a tree and passed out.  The employee was taken to the hospital and admitted for heat stroke.

On 8/5/15, at 7:30 a.m., a new employee received an employer-required vaccination for measles/mumps/rubella. Approximately 30 to 45 minutes after the injection, she experienced an allergic reaction; her neck swelled.  She was hospitalized and treated.

On August 6, 2015, an employee working on a gas leak inside of an excavation was bitten by an unknown insect on the right elbow. As the day continued the bite are became swollen and painful. The employee was admitted into the hospital. On August 10, 2015 a portion of the bite area was removed by doctors.
A worker was servicing a dock door that was out of track when he got his hand caught in the door cable.
An employee's foot was run over by a forklift after he stepped off of the lift resulting in a fractured fourth toe and broken pinky toe. The parking brake was not set on the lift.
One employee was hospitalized after a sample port on a sodium hydroxide line failed, showering the employee with sodium hydroxide at 190 degrees Fahrenheit.
An employee installing conduit for primary underground wire was hospitalized for heat stress.
A crane maintenance employee doing a cable inspection slipped and fell approximately 40 feet. The employee was not wearing PFAS.

The employee caught his arm between two trailer rear end frames while attempting to stop one from moving. He suffered a laceration and was admitted to the hospital. The laceration required surgery and there is nerve damage.

On August 06, 2015, at approximately 9:15 p.m. the team member was setting-up draw machine #5 (Morgan) for a double draw job (7/32 rod to W2.1). The process is to place the first draw under the bull block and the second draw on the upper section of the bull block. The machine was in jog mode while performing the task. An employee had the wire set on the bottom (first draw) and he was in the process of stringing the second draw. The employee noticed that the first bottom wrap was not in place. The employee stopped jogging and shook the wire with his right hand to locate the first wrap in place. While on this task, the employee stepped on the jog pedal as the wire snapped pulling his fingers against the block. The tip of his right middle and ring fingers were amputated. Employee was taken to the hospital where he was treated and released.
Employees were taking down sections of a grain elevator when an employee fell breaking a wrist and foot.
An employee was walking into a room. The materials he was carrying shifted and he tried to catch them.  The door slammed on his right index finger, amputating it from the nailbed.

An employee was trying to combine a low/empty jug of chemicals into a fuller jug of Sani King chemicals, unaware that he was mixing acid and chlorine.  The resulting odor caused him to suffer respiratory issues and he was admitted to a hospital.
An employee was struck by a PIV and admitted to the hospital.
An employee was setting a fan unit into position on a foundation plate when his fingertip became pinched between the two surfaces resulting in a fingertip amputation without bone loss.
An employee operating a table saw came into contact with the saw blade causing a finger amputation.

A metal pipe line was plugged and the injured employee was attempting to remove the plug when the rotary valve positioned nearby was actuating and caught the air line the employee was holding pulling the gloves the employee was wearing into the actuating valve. The employee suffered a partial amputation (bone loss) of the right hand pointer finger up to the first joint.
Employee was in the process of repositioning a vertical lift basket when his right pinky finger was contacted by a cable pulley. The employee went to the hospital were he was treated and released.
An employee, working as a winder, was threading a spool of high grade fishing line and got the right index finger caught up in the line amputating the tip.

On August 6, 2015, an employee was trimming scrap boards with a chop saw at the end of his shift. He activated the foot pedal while his hand was removing boards.  The saw amputated the tips of his middle and ring fingers.  He was transported to the hospital where the doctor removed a portion of the bone in order to close the wound.
An employee amputated the pointer and index fingertips while operating the Macbee 30 draw machine.

An employee pushed a cart through a doorway out of a walk-in oven.  The employee had his hands on the outside of the cart.  As the employee came around a corner, the cart cut the corner and pinched the employee's finger between the cart and the door jam.  The employee sustained an amputation to the tip of the left pinky finger.

An employee was exiting the restroom with her right hand placed on the door jamb.  As she closed the door behind her, her right middle finger was amputated at the base of the fingernail bed or distal joint.

An employee was working a piece of pre breaker when the pipe jammed.  The employee was cutting the pipe to release the jam when the safety gate struck the tip of the employee's third digit amputating the fingertip.
An employee cleaned out a saw while the blade was still turning and the saw blade struck his fingers.

An employee working on a pedal operated resistance welder with no point-of-operation guarding received an amputation to the right hand index finger. The employee had a finger crushed between the electrodes.

On Friday, August 7, 2015, an employee suffered the loss of the fingertip and nail with exposed bone while repairing a band saw. The screw shaft fell out of the head rig (the guide system on the band saw).
While unjamming boards on the planer mill, the employee had his third and fourth digit tips amputated on his right hand.

Employees were dismantling a concrete form when a forklift operator hit the corner of the concrete form and the boom holding the form tipped over onto a worker. The worker suffered three fractured ribs that punctured the kidney and liver.
In the meat department, an employee was injured while using the band saw to cut beef.  The injury resulted in partial amputation of the left index finger.

An employee was using a food processor in the Trim Room of the Salad Bar Department to slice/cut raw broccoli for a pasta salad. A piece of broccoli become lodged in the processor. The employee used the right hand to clear the jam resulting in the amputation of the right index, middle, and pinky fingers.
An employee suffered a soft tissue amputation to the left middle and ring fingers (distal) while operating a product wrapping machine.
An employee suffered a fingertip avulsion while working with a wrench.
An employee amputated the first joint of his left middle finger while performing maintenance on a lapper machine.

An employee was performing maintenance on composer #1. After completing the maintenance task, the employee released the hood from the locked out position and engaged the pneumatics to lower the hood back into place via a lever system. Once this was done, the employee noticed a pair of pliers inside the machine. She placed her left hand on the edge of the machine and reached inside with her right hand to grab the pliers. At that time, the hood came down onto her hand, amputating her left pinky between the first and second knuckle.
An employee was working as a laborer guiding the forklift operator that was carrying a large piece of duct work when the material fell and struck the employee's right big toe.
An employee's finger was amputated while changing a coupling on a drive shaft. The finger was pinched between an indexer sprocket and the cell chain.
An employee suffered a partial finger amputation while cleaning a machine drive belt. While jogging the machine, the cloth that the employee held pulled his hand into a pulley.
An employee was chopping lettuce in the kitchen with a kitchen knife and amputated the tip of his left thumb.
An employee was using a Skilsaw to cut a post. The saw, which was guarded, kicked back and amputated the pinky, ring, and middle fingers of the employee's right hand.

An employee was performing maintenance on a crane. He removed a pin that retained the dead end of the wire rope.  His finger entered the hole where the pin was and the rope shifted causing an amputation of his right index fingertip.
The employee was operating a front end loader moving dirt.  The employee hit a pile of dirt and came to an immediate stop causing the door to slam on his left index fingertip.

During pipeline construction and while stringing pipe, a track hoe operator was unloading pipe from a delivery truck when an employee walked behind the track hoe on the operator's blind side. The track hoe backed up onto the employee's left foot amputating it.

An employee suffered a finger laceration on 7/29/2015 while cutting cheese with a cheese grater. The laceration became infected and on 8/11/15 the left index finger was partially amputated at the knuckle.

An employee was repairing the head stretcher on P2. The employee had electrical LOTO and one air hose removed. While connecting the second air hose, the shaft moved and amputated his left pinky finger down to the knuckle closest to the hand.
An employee was cleaning crumbs/crust from a catwalk and got her right hand caught in an unguarded chain and sprocket conveyor.  Her right hand was amputated during surgery.

A cold saw operator received an amputation to his right pinky fingertip (distal phalanx fracture). He placed a brass bar on top of the machine.  The bar was grabbed by the saw blade and pulled into the machine. The employee grabbed the end of the bar to pull it out while the machine was running, pinching his finger between the bar and a vise.

An employee was finishing up repairs to the 4DC Up Elevator. The employee proceeded to pull slack out of the drive chain.  After cleaning the teeth of the sprocket, the weight of the chain pinched the employee's finger between the chain and a sprocket resulting in the amputation of 3/8 inch of the tip of the left right finger. LOTO was used.

While adjusting the die on press brake #2524, an employee placed his fingers over the die. The back-gauge/positioner moved and caught the employee's finger between the die and the back-gauge/positioner.
An employee had his fingertip amputated when his glove was caught in a chain.
An employee's fingertip was amputated after it got caught by the hold-downs on a shear.
An employee had the tips of two fingers amputated when a sheet of steel fell on his left hand as he was feeding a roll former.
On August 12, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation while performing a die change on a power press.
An employee was moving a piece of switch gear in the electrical building when it tipped and pinched his finger between the switch gear and the floor.
An employee had a finger crushed and later amputated.
An employee was cleaning the blades of a lawn mower. The mower jumped and severed four fingers on his left hand.

An employee was attempting to repair a chain conveyor that pulls fence posts from one area of the facility to another. The employee used the emergency stop to shut the conveyor down. The machine wasn't locked out and tagged. At some point another employee turned the conveyor back on while the maintenance employee still had his hand on the conveyor chain. The employee lost his whole middle finger and the tip of his left pointer finger.
On 8/12/15, a temporary worker sustained an amputation of the tip of his right middle finger while operating a table saw.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation to the left middle finger while performing maintenance on a Bobcat.

The employee was in a front end loader attempting to lift a railroad tie.  She lost her grip on the railroad tie and it fell striking her right hand, middle finger on the bucket blade. Her right middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was getting into the side of a company van to sit on the floor to go to lunch. The employee touched a conduit that was stacked in the van, causing it to shift onto his hand and amputate his right index fingertip.

Two employees were moving a pallet with a manual pallet jack when a piece of the wooden pallet broke. While one of the employee's reached down to grab the piece of wood, the other employee lowered the pallet catching the injured employee's left middle finger. The left middle fingertip was amputated and surgically reattached.

On 8/13/15, an employee was operating a spooling machine when their left-hand glove got caught on a cable and was drawn into an in-running roller nip point. The employee's left ring fingertip was amputated.

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer. These events are captured as one report. 

1) An employee was smoothing a screen under a heat bar as it descended. The bar came down on his hands and trapped them. He was able to free his left hand, but had to rip his right hand from his glove, amputating his middle fingertip and exposing the bone. 2) An employee was hitting a spike with a hammer. The employee was holding the spike with his left hand while holding the hammer in his right. He hit his left little finger with the hammer and crushed his fingertip.

An employee was bringing a steel plate down onto a pillow block. While he was adjusting a piece of sheet metal, the block turned and pinched his finger between the block and plate, amputating his left index fingertip (part of nail).
An employee's left ring finger was amputated while running wood through a table saw.
An employee was lifting metal pallets when a metal pallet slipped out of his hand and crushed his right hand middle finger, breaking it.
An employee was putting foam beneath a die cutter machine when the machine came down, crushing and amputating his left index finger.

The injured employee was working as part of a three-person crew. The crew was removing and disassembling a bin-whip used to unclog a bin. As the bin-whip is raised, a 4-foot section is removed and the remaining part is reattached to the hydraulics used to raise it. 

Another crew member struggled to insert a pin to attach the hydraulics to the bin-whip. The injured employee reached over to help insert the pin and bumped the hydraulic controls with his knee. This caused the pin to rotate and pinch the injured employee's right index finger between the pin and the bin-whip housing. His finger was amputated.

On August 13, 2015, at about 5:30 p.m., an employee was operating a center rider (forklift) to pick up a pallet with his left hand outside of the forklift. He smashed his left-hand little finger against a bollard pole at the warehouse. His fingertip was surgically amputated.
While working on Rollstock equipment, three of an employee's right-hand fingers were amputated in the machine.
An employee was cutting a piece of flat bar stock using an ironworker machine. The machine's hold down jaws caught and amputated the employee's left middle fingertip.

An employee was disconnecting an attachment from the boom of an excavator for a transmission crew. When the connecting pin was removed, the 100-pound auger motor he was working on fell and crushed the end of his left pinky finger. He suffered an amputation of the distal end/joint of that finger.
An employee was using an impact tool to tighten lug nuts on a truck wheel when the truck fell, pinning his hand between the truck frame and the impact tool. His left middle finger was amputated.
An employee's finger was partially amputated after getting caught between a wood part and work table while feeding parts into a gusset machine.

An employee inserted an Allen key into the soft step adjuster of a lip groover to adjust the machine's tension. His left pinky finger was positioned near the machine shaft and shaft housing. The work cell was not de-energized at the time. As he was making the adjustment, the machine cycled, pulling the shaft into the housing and amputating approximately half of his left pinky finger.
On August 14, 2015, an employee's left index finger got caught in the point of operation of a mechanical power press. The distal tip of his finger was surgically amputated (above the first joint).
An employee's finger was amputated while removing the sample port from a blender during cleaning activities. The blender was running at the time.

When an employee made a turn while operating a forklift, the forklift got too close to the wall and caught the employee's finger between the forklift and a hydraulic pipe along the wall. The employee's finger was amputated.

On August 17, 2015, at approximately 11:30 a.m., an employee was injured while assisting a customer with a riding lawnmower positioned on a display. The employee was lowering the display to retrieve the lawnmower.  The display did not operate properly, so the employee lifted up on it to break it loose. The display and lawnmower fell and pinned the employee's left hand between the equipment and the ground, amputating one fingertip and fracturing three fingers.

An employee was on the ground, lining up a load for a flatbed truck. The employee had placed dunnage on the tire and moved it right as the load was put in place. This caused the trailer to level out and catch his finger between the dunnage and the trailer frame. He sustained a partial fingertip amputation, no bone, to the fourth left-hand digit.
An employee was putting auto parts in the grinding machine when his index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was sanding a pipe on a training lathe while wearing gloves. The employee's right glove got caught on the pipe and was drawn into the turning pipe, amputating part of his right thumb tip. He was hospitalized.
An employee was lowering a crane wheel using a crane when his finger got caught between the crane wheel and the steel rope. His right ring fingertip was amputated.
While performing maintenance on a punch press machine, an employee's right-hand middle finger got caught in a rotating wheel and was amputated.
An employee was loading cream on a milk truck using a flexible hose when the employee's finger got caught between the handle and body of a plunger valve, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was dumping a plastic trash cart into a compactor. Her right ring fingertip got stuck between the plastic receptacle and the metal frame around it. She sustained a fingertip amputation.

An employee was doing a service check on a tilt bed trailer. The employee went to the front of the trailer to lock it in place so it wouldn't tilt. There was a small gap in the neck of trailer. A coworker stepped onto the back of the trailer and the trailer went upward, crushing and amputating the employee's finger.

An employee was helping a forklift operator load two pallets of solar panels into a flatbed truck. The employee was holding a piece of dunnage and his finger got pinched when the forklift operator pushed the second pallet farther into the box truck. The employee's right ring fingertip and nail were amputated.

On August 18, 2015, at approximately 7:00 p.m., two employees were performing die setting operations. The first employee used a forklift to place a die in a press. The second employee approached the backside of the press and began to install bolts in the die. The first employee had not finished aligning the die. When the first employee repositioned the die for bolting, it caused the washer and bolt that the second employee was holding to move and pinch the second employee's finger against the die. The second employee's left middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee was performing maintenance on a Cellunator when their left glove got entangled in one of the disks, amputating the left ring fingertip to the first knuckle.
An employee was using a winch to rehang beef that had fallen off the hook when his finger got caught between the trolley and the rail, amputating the fingertip.
While closing a gate to an animal pen, an employee's right ring finger got caught in the gate and was amputated.
On August 19, 2015, an employee severed his right hand middle finger while operating a unguarded auger.
On August 19, an employee was feeding sod into a jammed plug machine. While trying to clear the jam, her finger got cut on the blades, which were still spinning. She later had the tip amputated.
While slicing meat on a meat band saw, an employee's hand slipped and her right middle and index fingertips were amputated.

Two employees were at Blackpoint Marina to repair a fuel leak on a customer's boat. The employees identified a corroded fuel valve (pickup) and replaced it. They were checking for additional leaks when a small explosion occurred in the bilge area. The ignition source may have been static electricity from a cell phone. Both employees received burns to their hands and faces and were hospitalized.
An employee's right ring finger was partially amputated when it got pinched between a reel of veneer and the reel track.

An employee was unloading pipes by cutting the metal band that held them all together. One of the metal pipes came loose and rolled over, falling on the employee's foot. The employee's right big toe was amputated.
An employee was closing the lid that covers the tire shoot when the lid fell on his left hand, partially amputating at least one finger.

An employee was training a coworker on how to operate a CNC machine when she tried to adjust the clamp that holds the part being processed. The clamp is operated by a foot pedal on the floor. While adjusting the clamp, she inadvertently stepped on the foot pedal, activating the clamp and severing her right index and middle fingertips.  She required surgery.

An employee was running parts through a punch press. The part jammed, so he attempted to retrieve the part from the machine. His foot hit the foot pedal and activated the punch, which amputated his left thumb down to the first bone and required surgery. The guard was not in place at the time of the incident.

On or about August 20, 2015 at approximately 4:40 p.m., an employee received a hand injury while working on the pepper production line. The employee was feeling dizzy and went to sit on a small roller conveyor. As he sat down, he put his hand on a moving chain conveyor, which pulled his finger into the sprocket and partially amputated it.

An employee was operating a slitter machine and grabbed the latch. The latch is stopped at 90 degrees by a safety pin, however the safety pin was worn out and it did not stop the latch. The latch continued past the 90 degree angle with the employee still holding it with his left hand and made contact with the metal box that houses the slitter's major bearings. Once the latch made contact with the metal box it crushed employee's left little, ring, and middle fingers. The little finger was amputated at the hospital.

An employee was measuring a pallet of paper on an automated conveyor line. The conveyor cycled and the employee's finger got caught between the paper and an I-beam. The employee's left-hand middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee entered the blast booth service room to investigate why media was not flowing. His leg was amputated when he stepped into a floor auger. The cover guarding the auger was removed at the time of the incident.

An employee was forming parts on a hydraulic press brake. The material being formed rotated and crushed the employee's thumb between the material and the press brake frame. The employee's right thumb tip was amputated.

An employee was helping a flow hand from another company change rubber between two pieces of high-pressure pipe. As the employee was checking to make sure the rubber was seated properly, the clamp slipped, amputating his right-hand middle fingertip.
An employee was adjusting the track control on a conveyor when his hand got caught by the chain, partially amputating his left middle and ring fingers.
An employee was repairing an axle hub when a bolt from the hub came out of the air gun and struck the employee's left index finger. The finger was fractured.
An employee was troubleshooting the vacuum channel of a machine when his hot gloves got pulled into the blocks. Half of his right ring finger was amputated. The guard was not in place at the time.

An employee was loading cars and moving a lever to adjust platform heights. The wrong lever was moved while the employee's hand was resting on a long pole. His left index finger got caught on the hydraulic platform and was partially amputated.

An employee pulled Printing Section # 1 out of the Martin Machine and opened the interlocked cover on the ink rollers. He then took a pair of vise-grips, depressed the jog button, and clamped the button to the housing in the depressed position causing the rollers to rotate slowly. The employee then used a hose to spray water on the partially submerged  ink rollers to clean them. The inside of the container in which the rollers were partially submerged was painted black. The color of the ink was also black. The employee reached his  right hand into the liquid to see if it was clear, and his hand was pulled into the nip points of the rollers resulting in the amputation of the middle and ring fingers and one half of the index finger on his right hand.
An employee was attempting to remove a paper jam in a folding machine when the machine indexed and amputated the employee's right index fingertip.

An employee was helping a coworker assemble a vehicle seat.  The seat was moving down the assembly line on a jig, which allows the seat to tilt forward and backward.  The employee tilted the jig with one hand while his other hand was in a pinch point. The employee's right-hand pinky fingertip got degloved between the first knuckle and the start of the fingernail. The employee was hospitalized.
On August 21, 2015, an employee's left-hand middle and index fingertips were amputated by a saw when the employee attempted to adjust the blade. The saw was running at the time of the incident.

An employee tried to prevent a turkey neck from going through the peeler. The employee's glove got caught in the peeler rollers, which crushed the left middle fingertip. The fingertip was amputated below the fingernail.
An employee was cutting cabbage using a produce knife when she cut her right index fingertip.
An employee experienced an amputation to the right middle finger while clearing a jam from an energized and functional fruit feeder.
An employee amputated the fingertips of the right thumb, index and middle fingers while cleaning the rollers on a printing press. The machine was running at the time of the incident.

A maintenance technician was working on the #2 GB Dust Collector/Grinder to change the belt on the motor. The employee's right pinky finger got caught between the belt and the fly wheel, amputating part of his finger.

An employee was working on the soy bean preparation line when he caught his hand near a clam-shell-like device that stops the flow of soy beans to the scale resulting in the amputation of his left middle fingertip.

An employee performing quality checks on filters leaving the assembly line amputated the left pinky finger from the first knuckle when it was caught between the vertical guide rail and the horizontal dead plate. The force of the backed up filters contributed to the injury.
An employee was walking by an unguarded conveyor belt and amputated the right thumb tip.
An employee caught a finger in a jammed bagging machine resulting in the amputation of the left index fingertip.
An employee amputated the tip of the left pinky finger in a roller conveyor.
An employee fell while standing on the raised forks of a fork truck injuring his hand and leg.

An employee sustained an injury to his left ring finger which resulted in an amputation of a digit on his left ring finger at the hospital. The employee's gloved hand was caught by the wire rope on the crane while he was conducting crane inspection activities.

A worker was wearing leather work gloves and cutting aluminum bar stock on a horizontal band saw.  His hand contacted the moving saw blade and was pulled in causing an amputation of the left index fingertip.

An employee was operating a button making machine when she reached around the guard to pull out the stems before it jammed up. Her foot was still on the foot peddle and it was pressed when her finger was in the point of operation. The machine smashed her right index finger resulting in the amputation of the finger.
An employee severed his right middle fingertip when it got caught in a slot conveyor.
One employee received a partial thumb amputation when it was caught in a pinch point while raising a dock plate.
A temporary  worker suffered a partial amputation of the left index finger when it was caught by a blade inside a pump.

An employee sustained a serious injury when wiping wood dust residue from the notching machine.  The machine caught his glove and pulled the employee's hand into the point of operation. The right hand was amputated.

An employee was removing the exit guard on the bar peeler machine.  The top hinge of the guard fell and caught the tip of the employee's finger between the guard and the machine.  The tip of the employee's right index finger was amputated.  The employee was not hospitalized.
An employee was holding a pin while another employee was driving the pin in with a hammer.  The employee's finger was struck by the hammer resulting in the amputation of the fingertip.
An employee was operating a forklift and crushed his right pinky finger between the forklift and a warehouse rack. The fingertip including the nail was amputated.
On or about August 27, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation to the right index fingertip while cutting fabric with a straight knife cutter.
An employee was putting a bolt into a five foot steel I-beam and suffered the loss of the right thumb tip when it was caught between the end of the beam and the wrench.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while lifting a vehicle hood from one pallet to another pallet. The employee's finger was caught under the hood when the hood was set down on the pallet.
An employee was cleaning a trim blender while it was running and amputated the left index fingertip.

Two maintenance mechanics were adjusting a sensor on a shrink wrapper. The sensor was located under the wrapper table. After adjusting the sensor, the mechanics were moving the table back into position when the table shifted, catching the finger of one of the maintenance mechanics. The employee suffered the partial amputation of the right middle fingertip.
An employee was entering or exiting the cab or a front end loader and amputated the tip of his left thumb (without bone loss) while closing the cab door.

On or about August 27, 2015, an employee suffered the amputation all four fingertips of the on the left hand.  The employee was using a concrete molding machine and in the process of inflating the interior core pinched his/her fingers between the core and the mold.
On or about August 27, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation of the right index fingertip while helping to load a crane onto a flatbed for transport.
On or about August 27, 2015, an employee suffered an amputation to the right middle finger and ring finger while working at a sheer press.

An employee operating a walk behind floor scrubber suffered a right middle fingertip amputation when he reached under the floor scrubber to unclog it and his finger was caught in the rotating fan. The floor scrubber was running at the time.

An employee was repairing the chipper with the guard off and the machine locked out and tagged out. The guard was replaced and the machine was started.  He heard a noise and again powered down the machine and took the guard off. He was leaning up and into the chipper to feel for vibration and his fingers got caught in the blades before the wheel had come to a complete stop amputating the fat pad and the fourth left fingertip.

An employee was operating a brake press to bend a piece of metal. His finger was pinched on the deck of the press resulting in the amputation of the left ring finger just above the finger nail. It was reattached by a surgeon.
An employee amputated the right hand index, middle and ring fingers while running a compound mitre saw.

On or about August 28, 2015, an employee was injured while loading dollies onto a truck.  The dollies became lodged on the lift gate and the employee lost part of his left middle finger trying to move the dollies.

An employee was pushing three pieces of lumber directly into the in feed conveyor of a gang saw and cut his left index and middle fingers. The left index figure was amputated just below the nail while the left middle finger was amputated at the first joint.

An employee was using a meat grinder. He turned the machine off and reached up under the guard and into die because he thought meat was stuck in the die.  The blade hadn't completely stopped and his finger was amputated just above the cuticle.
An employee amputated a finger while rigging material. The rigging material slipped and the employee's finger got caught between the material and the steel beam.

On August 28, 2015, at approximately 6:45pm, while performing maintenance on a machine, another employee activated the machine after receiving verbal confirmation from the mechanic to go ahead. The maintenance mechanic suffered the amputation of his left thumb after it was pinched between a table and material near the entry end of the cap line.
An employee attempted to retrieve a piece of ceramic material that broke off into the tape laminator machine he was using. His right index and middle fingertips were amputated by the machinery.
An employee was working on an oil drilling rig. While attaching a check valve to a vertical pup joint, the employee's right index finger was pinched between the two parts, amputating the fingertip.

Four employees were injured while attempting to set trusses on a barn. The trusses collapsed and the employees fell. Two of the employees were hospitalized. The first suffered a chipped shoulder bone and lacerations to his head. The second suffered compression fractures to three vertebrae.
An employee was attempting to pull a piece of plastic from a grinder plate. The employee's finger hit the rotating plate, resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee performing preventative maintenance was checking a roof vent. She removed the vent top and shut off the vent. Before the vent belt had stopped moving, her finger got pulled in between the pulley and belt. Her left pointer finger was amputated below the nail.

An employee was wearing work gloves while operating a vertical milling machine to fabricate a tube. The employee attempted to adjust the tube in the machine with his left hand when his work glove got caught on a set screw. His left little fingertip was amputated; there was no bone loss.

An employee was filling concrete mix bags on the spout 
at the Old Castle/Anchor Concrete facility. The employee's finger got caught between the metal arms on the spout and the rubber bumpers, amputating the left index fingertip and nail.

An employee was preparing to drill a hole in wax paper using a foot-operated paper drill machine. She placed a stack of paper in the machine using a block to hold the wax paper in place. When she pressed the foot pedal, the machine drilled the tip of her right index finger, causing an amputation-type injury.

An employee was performing maintenance on a broach machine. The machine cycled while his hand was inside, amputating his three right-hand middle fingers. The machine guard was not in place at the time of the incident.

An employee was doing iron fabrication work. While working on a circular saw, the blade "kicked" back the piece of flat strap iron, injuring the employee's left-hand middle finger. The injury resulted in an amputation (bone loss) along the fingertip.

On September 1, 2015, an employee parked his semi truck in the shop on the cement floor for servicing. He was going to lift the truck onto jack stands by first lifting it with the jack lift. While lifting the truck, the employee got down to the floor level to look beneath it. The handle of the jack lift fell, striking his left-hand little finger against the floor and resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was climbing into a bulldozer when wind caused the door to shut on and amputate his thumb.

An employee was assembling a side belt driven conveyor. While checking the motor during the assembly, he noticed a clicking noise. He inspected what was causing the noise while the machine was running. His hand slipped while using a hand tool to adjust the chain that runs the motor, and his thumb went in between the chain and gear. He sustained a partial right thumb amputation.

An employee was operating a chop saw to cut pieces of aluminum. He was holding a piece of aluminum in place while making a cut when his right-hand thumb contacted the saw blade. He suffered a partial amputation of the thumb.

An employee was readjusting a sensor that controls tool pick up and tool changes. While he tried to check the position of the sensor, a coworker operated the Onsrud machine. The hood and airlines were not reattached. The back bush would not operate without the airline, so the injured employee attempted to hold up the back brush with his hand. The machine's platen dropped to pick up a tool; when it ascended, it caught the employee's thumb between the two platens, severely lacerating and fracturing it.
An employee was repairing the coke oven door and pinched a fingertip behind the door latch resulting in the amputation of the fifth digit fingertip.
An employee was loading plywood into a truck when his fingertip got smashed between the sheets of plywood. While pulling his finger out, the tip of the skin on his left ring finger tore off.
An employee was assembling testing equipment. The employee's left index finger got caught between a nut and an impact wrench and was amputated to the knuckle.

An employee was standing at the entrance door of the valet parking office with his left hand resting on the hydraulic door cylinder while he was talking to co-workers. His left ring fingertip was pinched and amputated by the hydraulic cylinder arms when another employee opened the door to enter the office.

On 09/01/2015, at approximately 08:55 a.m., an employee was preparing to open the window section. She retrieved her money from the safe and placed it at the counter and then returned to the safe to secure her compartment and close the safe door. Her right thumb was smashed by the safe door as it closed. The bone was severed and the thumb was attached only by the skin. Her thumb was reattached at the hospital.

An employee was operating a carton filler machine when the machine began to jam. While attempting to clear the jam, the employee's hand contacted the moving chain conveyor system. The employee's left-hand thumb fat pad, first index finger knuckle, and middle finger middle knuckle were amputated.injuring his head
An employee was using a self-propelled lawn mower when he slipped and fell. His left hand went under the mower, resulting in middle and ring fingertip amputations.

A maintenance employee was changing a belt on a fan in a paint booth when the other fans in the booth turned on. This caused the employee's fan to spin, and his finger got caught between the belt and pulley. His left ring finger got crushed and was later amputated. His right index finger was injured and required stitches.

An employee was removing the belt from the pulley of an air handler when his fingers got caught between the pulley and belt. His right pinky fingertip was amputated. LO/TO was in place when this incident happened.
An employee was operating a forklift to gather merchandise. His right index finger got caught and amputated between the side of the forklift and the horizontal bracket.

An employee was handling hides to get them in the deflesher when the "gripper" jaws opened and shut on the employee's left pinky. The employee sustained a soft tissue amputation of the left pinky finger.
An employee was using a band saw to cut boneless pit hams in half to run them through a slicer. The band saw motor ran in reverse, and the employee's middle and ring fingertips were amputated.
An employee was working on the drive sprocket of a fryer when the drive chain grabbed his glove and pulled his finger into the sprocket. His finger was partially amputated.
Two employees engaged in a fight. One employee bit the injured employee's ear off, resulting in an amputation.
An employee was loading bags of cement/asphalt onto a cart at Lowe's when a wheel on the cart broke. The cart collapsed onto the employee's foot, amputating a toe.

A forklift operator was driving the lift back to the dock area when he struck the injured employee. The front side of the forklift hit the employee, then the right front tire ran over his foot.  He was hospitalized, where his foot up to his calf (left leg) was amputated.

An employee was loading parts into a machine when one twisted out of place. The employee tried to adjust the part with their right index finger, which got caught in the machine and was amputated just above the fingernail.
An employee was bleeding pressure from a 4" line.  In the process, a 2" riser pipe ruptured, and the employee was struck in the right leg by flying debris. The employee's foot was amputated.

An employee was putting duct tape on a press machine. The operator jogged the machine, and the employee's finger got caught in the perforation wheel. The employee's left middle fingertip was amputated.
On or about September 3, 2015, an employee amputated or partially amputated three right-hand fingers when they got caught in a sprocket while replacing a chain on the sprocket drive.

An employee activated a pneumatic holding mechanism by foot pedal while placing a plastic door on a machine. The clamp pinched the employee's right middle finger between the clamp and the plastic door. When the employee pulled their finger out, the right middle finger nail and skin were removed.
An employee using a power shear amputated a digit on his left index finger when his finger got caught between the shear blades.
On or about 9/3/15, a temp worker injured her finger while operating a printing machine in the Cardboard Box Department.  Part of her finger had to be amputated.

An employee was using a table saw to cut wood and attempted to clear a jam. When the employee cleared the jam, the saw activated and amputated his middle finger, severed his pointer finger, and mutilated his thumb.
An employee was moving a resident's care bed. Her left pinky finger got caught in a pinch point between a closet door and the bed, crushing her fingertip. The fingertip was surgically amputated.

An employee was slicing cucumbers on the deli slicer. While attempting to retrieve a piece of cucumber, the employee's right hand made contact with the blade, resulting in a right fingertip and fingernail amputation.

An employee was moving furniture using a box truck with a hydraulic lift gate on the back. As he and a coworker raised the lift gate, he got off the lift and grabbed the side of the rail. The coworker began to operate the lift again, which caught and amputated the employee's thumb.
While working on a metal part on a brake press, the employee amputated the tip of his left index finger.

An employee was moving an oil field casing/pipe-related materials in and out of a pipe rack with a forklift. The pipes rolled down the rack and pinched/lacerated the employee's fingertip, which had to be amputated.

On 9/7/15, an employee was cleaning out top flash and trimmings that had fallen on the floor beneath an auto-trimmer. His finger entered the stroke path of the lift cylinder, and his right middle fingertip was amputated.

Employees were starting the granulator when ammonia bypassed the control valve and bled into the granulator. Fumes were released while the employees were nearby, causing chemical burns, respiratory illness, and unconsciousness. Two employees were hospitalized.

An employee was removing a sleeve that goes around a bar weighing approximately 50 to 100 pounds. The sleeve was secured with four bolts; three were partially removed and one was removed completely. As he turned the sleeve, his left ring finger got caught between the sleeve and bar, causing a partial amputation.

An employee was loading bar stock into the lathe when the bar stock became jammed. While he attempted to clear the jam, the energized clamp came down and pinched his finger, resulting in a right ring fingertip amputation (no bone).

An employee was helping to install an elevator. He was lifting a counter weight frame while using a hoist. The rope being used got tangled in the cylinder. While attempting to straighten it, his hand got caught. He tried to withdraw his hand, and three fingertips were amputated.
An employee amputated his thumb, index, and middle fingers while operating a foot-controlled chop saw to cut stock.
On September 8, 2015, at 8:56 AM, an employee suffered a partial amputation of the right middle fingertip while wiping dust near the rotating shaft of a laminator machine.

A maintenance employee was working on a snorkel lift that was up in the air. He reached down to retrieve something and steadied himself by placing his other hand on the sprocket. The sprocket moved and amputated his right thumb tip, including the nail. The lift guard was not in place at the time of the incident.
An employee was cutting a watermelon with a knife when the watermelon rolled and caused the knife to slip. The employee's right middle finger was amputated.

An employee was working on the bar straightening machine when the straightener jammed and was shut down. The bar went back and forth, then came back and crushed the employee's finger, resulting in amputation.
While feeding wood into the notching machine, an employee's left pinky fingertip was amputated on the machine's infeed.
On or about September 9, 2015, an employee's finger was amputated while slicing meat with a meat band saw.

An employee was operating a metal pipe bender in the bender work area. The employee was attempting to adjust the bender when a coworker cycled the machine. The employee's left-hand pinky and ring fingers were crushed, and the distal phalanx of the left-hand middle and ring fingers were surgically removed.
While replacing a gasket in a vibration fixture, a maintenance employee's finger got caught in a pinch point when the fixture dropped 1.5 inches. His index finger was amputated.

An employee was machining a packing tube when a bushing on the bar came loose. The employee attempted to push the bushing back in place and his left hand got caught in the rotating bar, amputating his left index finger and fracturing the adjacent fingers. The employee was wearing gloves at the time of the incident.
On 9/9/2015, an employee suffered a right ring fingertip amputation and fractured rib when a storage rack containing tires fell on top of him after being struck by his forklift.
An employee was cutting flooring material using a table saw. His hand slipped, and his right index finger and thumb were cut. The index finger and thumb tip were amputated at the hospital.

On September 10, 2015, an employee was attempting to close a door to a patient's room while the patient was trying to pull it open. The door slammed shut and the employee's right index finger was caught between the door and the door jam, crushing his fingertip. The fingertip was later surgically amputated.

An employee was checking the gauging on an upper die shoe. The upper die shoe slipped/fell off the pins, and the employee turned and hit the cutting edge of the die. The employee sustained a left pointer finger soft tissue amputation.

An employee was helping to set dies when his left hand got struck by the die as it was being lowered into the parallel. His left-hand middle finger was injured and had to be amputated to the second knuckle.
An employee was attempting to clear a jam on a machine when the blade came down and cut her left middle finger.
Half of an employee's right pinky finger was amputated by a lumber planner he was operating.

An employee was in the cleanup/pump room delivering tools and helping to change belts on a pump. While helping to remove an old guard from a machine to put on a new one, he amputated his right-hand middle and ring fingertips.

On September 10, 2015, at 1:40 PM, an employee's right ring finger was partially amputated by a wire straightening machine. He was checking the gears when one of the tracks fell and cut off his fingertip.
An employee was overcome by carbon monoxide from contractors operating a propane-powered burnishing machine within the store.
On 9/10/15 an employee was using a table saw.  While cutting shelving, he amputated the ring finger on his left hand.
An employee was sanitizing a chocolate enrober. As he attempted to unjam the chocolate pump, the pump started and amputated his left index fingertip.

An employee was rolling a metal piece on an Arcotech rolling machine and got his right ring finger caught between the piece of metal and the roller. The employee's right ring finger was crushed resulting in an amputation.

An employee was cutting wood trim on a table saw. When the employee reached for cut scraps, their left ring finger contacted the rotating saw blade.  The employee's left index fingernail was amputated.
Employee suffered a right pinky finger amputation while using a metal stud cutting tool for carpentry work.

An employee was struck by a forklift and received an injury to the right leg at approximately 6:00PM on September 11, 2015. The employee was transported by ambulance to the hospital, received emergency care and was discharged.

A material handler on the motorized sheet lifter picked up a pack of material with the lifter and was moving the pack around when the pack struck a fixed object. The stack then shifted and caught the worker's fingers between the object and the stack injuring three fingers. The pinky finger was partially amputated from the tip to between the first and second joint.
An employee was preparing to fabricate a clamp for a pipe. As he was rotating the pipe, it pinched his left finger to the knuckle resulting in amputation.
An employee suffered the amputation of the right index fingertip when his finger was caught between the bumper of a truck and a jack.
A steel beam tipped over and fell onto an employee's right ring and middle finger causing an amputation above the knuckle.

Two employees had just finished installing a replacement spindle motor for a CNC machine. The employees started the motor up. As it was coming up to speed, the bottom flange that holds the motor failed and fragments flew through the air striking both employees on their right legs.
On or about September 14, 2015 between 3:30 pm-4:00 pm, an employee operating a chop saw in the Cut Shop had their right hand amputated (four fingers and half of palm).
An employee was operating a punch press when the die pulled the part in causing her left index finger to be amputated.
While cutting aluminum material with a band saw, the blade of the saw jammed and slipped causing the employee's right thumb to be cut by the blade resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was working with a pin press machine and placed his hand inside the machine to remove the pin. The pin press cycled and his right index finger was amputated at the first joint.

On September 14, 2015, at approximately 10:30am, a worker suffered an amputation of the left pinky finger just above the palm while unloading pipe from a pipe trailer.  The employee was standing towards the tractor side of the trailer and a side boom with sling was unloading the pipe.  The load was lowered near the tractor in an effort to raise the pipe above the back stanchion on the trailer.  As the pipe slowly moved, the load struck a stanchion or DOT fender and the employee's hand was crushed in the load of pipe. No tag line was used.
An employee got his fingers pinched between cable and a drum on an excavator resulting in the amputation of the right pinky and index fingers to the first knuckle.
An employee was working on a metal detector that was not locked out or tagged out. The machine started unexpectedly and caught his left hand middle finger resulting in amputation.
On September 14, 2015, an employee was pulling a large roll of carpet when the roller grabbed the employee's hand and amputated his left ring finger to the end of his nail.
An employee operating a jointer amputated the right hand middle and ring fingers.
An employee was repairing the weather stripping around a door and amputated the top of the left middle finger.
An employee was loading advertisements into the tie machine and got his left hand caught in the machine resulting in amputation of the pinky and right fingertips.
An employee was lowering scrap wood from a roofing job when a finger got caught in the rope and skinned the finger from the knuckle to the fingertip.

The heat treat/batch furnace operator had latched the batch furnace carriage with a bar and was moving the carriage to the furnace. The carriage jumped on the track and the latch came loose pushing the bar towards the operator pinning the left hand pinky finger between the bar and the nearby handrail.

The employee was installing a shaker box on a plow when he inadvertently bumped the shaker box causing it to move on the jacks and pinch his right ring finger between the shaker box and the mounting arm of the plow. The employee sustained a fingertip amputation with loss of a finger nail.
The employee was running a card machine.  When the employee tried to remove build up, string wrapped around his left hand middle finger resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was setting a die in the brake press. The employee was attempting to line up the upper holes when he depressed the foot pedal and the brake press lowered onto the employee's left hand thumb causing a fingertip amputation.
An employee was lifting a grader with an air tugger and got her left hand index finger caught in the metal wiring resulting in amputation.

An employee was cleaning the AMC (automated cutting machine) and reached into the machine resulting in the avulsion of the right distal interphalangeal. The machine was not locked and tagged out at the time of the injury.

The employee was operating a shear to fabricate a part for a crane.  The employee placed an aluminum sheet into the machine opening and accidently hit the foot control which activated the press.  The employee's left middle finger was amputated above the first knuckle.  The employee was treated at a local hospital and released the same day.

A worker had shut down a machine and removed the guard to make an adjustment.  The worker restarted the machine and reached into the machine to remove a paper chip. His right hand index finger got caught in a roller and amputated down to the second knuckle.
An employee using a table saw amputated the tip of the right index finger from the first and second knuckle.
An employee operating a forklift caught their right ring finger between lift truck cage support and a stack of pallets causing an amputation.

An employee was standing on the DOT bumper observing a concrete chute. He slipped and in his attempt to restrain his fall, inserted two fingers into the roller on the concrete ready mix truck. Two fingers were crushed requiring amputation.
An employee working in an aerial lift maneuvered the bucket and the tip of his pinky finger was severed in the bi-fold door.
The inured employee was holding and lowering a shaft from machine number GK24 onto a jack stand. The shaft slipped and fell on the worker's finger causing an amputation of the right middle fingertip.
An employee was splitting wood with a hydraulic splitter and got his right pinky finger caught between two pieces of wood amputating the fingertip.
An employee closed the door on her left pinky finger resulting in a partial amputation of the fingertip.

An employee was standing on a movable machine bed. The employee reached up to grab a rail and caught her hand in a shear point between a bearing block and the machine frame. Her right hand pinky and ring fingers were amputated to approximately the second joint.
An employee was making a delivery when another delivery truck's hose exploded spilling cement dust. The employee suffered respiratory illness due to the inhaled cement dust.

On September 17, 2015, at approximately 6:30pm, a worker was injured when the tip of his right index finger was pinched while changing the blade on a horizontal band saw.  Lockout was used to de-energize the machine.  As the employee manually turned the wheel to engage the blade, his finger was pinched between the wheel and the blade, resulting in amputation.
An employee amputated the tips of the long finger and ring finger while operating a shaper saw.
An employee was preparing to change the line over to a different product on the breader elevator and amputated the right index fingertip.

The employee was circulating mud and water and sucking fluid from a steel container with a running vacuum truck. H2S vapor accumulated under the truck. When it reached his hot pump, it caused a flash fire.  The employee suffered burns to his face and hands.
An employee received a partial amputation to the right middle finger while clearing a jam on the Skive Machine (leather trimmer).
An employee was servicing a box sealer that was not de-energized and suffered a broken arm.
An employee amputated his right second and third fingertips with a rope.

An employee was cleaning the fryer machine located in a Tyson Food poultry plant and partially amputated his left ring finger. The machine was not locked or tagged out when the employee removed the guard and was cleaning the machine.
An employee was using a chop saw to cut boards to size and amputated the tips of three fingers on the right hand.
An employee was operating the blow molding machine and bypassed the guard to clear a jam and amputated a finger.
An employee amputated the left index finger on a bag machine producing plastic film.

On September 19, 2015 at approximately 2:30 p.m., two employees were working together to empty a trash container into a dumpster. One of the employee's fingers was smashed between the trash container and the dumpster resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee suffered a partial finger amputation on a band saw.
An employee was operating a bag machine and amputated four fingers.
A temporary employee sustained an amputation injury to the tip of the left middle finger while unjamming Machine #22 Mail Inserter.
An employee was working in the MXBU Trucks department. The employee suffered a partial finger amputation when it was caught between a cylinder and the jig.
An employee was cleaning a polisher when the machine pulled in her cleaning cloth and caught and amputated her left index fingertip. The machine was running at the time.
While he was searching for a missing knife on a gut slide in the casing department, an employee's finger got caught in the moving gut conveyor belt. His right middle finger was amputated.

The employee was in the process of erecting a barrier wall on the side of the road (highway construction).  The employee got his right index finger caught between the panel of the wall and the bolt, pinching/crushing his finger and amputating the fingertip.

An employee took off a magnet tray and his arm reached inside the pipe. His arm came into contact with a rotatory feeder blade that was aligned with the magnet tray, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee utilizing the pace roll groover received a crushing injury to the right index finger that resulted in a partial amputation.

An employee was measuring metal and lost his grip on the measuring tool. When he reached for it, his gloves were caught in the guide rollers resulting in the amputation of two fingers at the first joint.
An employee amputated the right middle finger while operating the brake press.
An employee was adjusting the wire in a bobbin winder with the guard open. The tip of his left index finger was amputated when the wire tightened.
While pushing boards through the sanding shaper machine, an employee's hand got caught between a board and the machine. The tip of her right ring finger was amputated.
An employee was cutting wings with a wing saw and partially amputated the right thumb.
Employee was trimming a piece of pipe with a skill saw and amputated the index fingertip.
An employee removed the guard on a conveyor to perform maintenance. His hand was caught in the chain and sprocket and the left ring fingertip was amputated.
On 09/22/2015, two employees working on a propane gas line to a grain dryer were burned on the face, back, torso and arms when leaking propane gas ignited.
An employee was working in the giblet department loading paper into the wrapping machine and suffered a partial amputation of the right hand middle fingertip.
An employee's finger was caught between the roll housing and the sled while in the process of changing the felt. He subsequently lost the tip of his right index finger.
An employee amputated the tip of his left ring finger between the feed roller of Shaper #3 and a piece of wood board.
An employee amputated the tip of his right ring finger while operating a machine to close boxes.
An employee was working on a conveyor and suffered a partial finger amputation and fracture when the finger was caught in a the chain and sprocket.
On September 22, 2015, a delivery driver amputated a portion of his right hand ring finger while stowing the Tommy Gate on his vehicle after usage.

The employee was loading parts onto a rotating conveyor system when the machine malfunctioned and the parts got wedged in the machine. When the employee reached into the running machine to remove the parts, his finger was pinched resulting in the amputation of the left index finger to the first knuckle.
The injured employee was assisting another employee by holding metal wire. The second employee caught the injured employee's left thumb in the clamp gun resulting in amputation of the left thumb.
An employee was cleaning a stencil machine when his finger got caught in the flow valve. The valve closed on his finger and amputated his left fingertip.
Three employees were replacing a gasket on a liquid fertilizer tank.  While attempting to install the gasket, the injured employee's finger got caught in a pipe, amputating his right index fingertip.

An employee was pushing a crate of sweet potatoes down a ramp to a roller table. His hand got caught and made contact with the drive chain sprocket, severing his right index finger and fracturing his ring and little finger.
An employee was installing laminate on the roof when he stepped into a hole and fell approximately 20 feet. He fractured his left arm, dislocated his pelvis, and required left arm surgery.
On September 23, 2015,an employee suffered a left hand finger amputation when a right angle air drill with a double sided hole saw slipped and caught his Kevlar glove.
The employee was welding the support hood of a railcar. The employee got his left ring finger pinched between the porta power and the break rod support resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee sustained a right index fingertip laceration while clearing a misfeed part in a strapper machine.
Two employees on a lift fell 15 feet when the cable snapped. The first employee broke an ankle and toes. The second employee sustained a back injury and bruised lungs.

An employee was monitoring the process of balancing two cooling fans. The fan guard had been removed for this process. The employee grabbed the belt of the fan, which was not turned on at the time, and the force coming from the adjacent fan caused it to rotate. The employee's hand got caught between the belt and pulley, amputating his right pinky, ring, and middle fingers.
An employee was clearing loose concrete to install a pipe when another employee struck his hand with a sledge hammer resulting in the amputation of the right index fingertip.
While closing the side door of an ambulance, an employee's fingers got shut in the door. The right index fingertip was amputated.
While using a table saw, an employee's right index finger and right middle finger contacted the blade. The employee's right index finger was amputated.
An employee scratched her right leg at work on September 23, 2015.  The scratch became infected and the leg was later amputated.

An employee was cleaning out the air actuator. The employee called out to a second employee who did not hear him correctly and the second employee closed a valve amputating the employee's right middle finger above the finger nail.

An employee was sorting scrap metal by hand. The employee's finger got caught between a piece of metal and the handrail that it was being tossed over into a bin. The piece landed on the fingertip and pinched it between the rail, resulting in an amputation.

An employee was cutting material with a double miter saw. While attempting to clear a piece of material from under the machine's housing, her left hand contacted the saw blade, amputating her finger at the second knuckle.

On September 24, 2015, at approximately 11:15 a.m., an employee's middle fingertip became caught inside the pin hole of a crane that was being used to set up temporary lighting. The employee was coming off the ladder and used the pin hole for leverage. The crane operator thought he was clear to actuate the boom, and while doing so the employee's fingertip was amputated.

An employee had just finished setting up a printer press and was wiping excess ink off of the cylinder when the rag got caught in the roller. While the employee attempted to remove the rag, the machine amputated his right middle finger and injured his index and ring fingers.

An employee was moving a pole containing a security camera downward to adjust the camera. The top portion of his right middle finger got caught and was amputated between the top and lower portion of the pole's hinge.

An employee was trimming trees from a scissor lift at a height of approximately 10 to 12 feet. The employee fell from the scissor lift, sustaining a head injury, punctured lung, torn liver, and broken bones.

On 9/24/15, at approximately 5:15 p.m., an employee was positioning a jack to a block bailer. He put his left hand on the side of the jack and his left middle finger got caught between the cradle and jack set. His left finger was crushed and had to be surgically amputated to the first knuckle.
An employee's index finger was cut by a conveyor belt. The belt was unguarded at the time.
On 9/24/15, at 8:10 a.m., an employee's left middle and ring fingertips (including a portion of the nailbed) were amputated while the employee was setting up a bagger machine.

On 9/24/15, at 7:15 a.m., an employee was operating a brake press. The light curtain on the press break was inoperative at the time. The employee sustained an amputation of the right index finger's first knuckle.

An employee was monitoring the flow of flour bags along a conveyor on a packaging machine.  He noticed a bag that had gotten caught at the top and attempted to reach in to pull it through. His gloved hand got pinched in the machine, lacerating the right middle fingertip.
An employee dropped a large metal rim on his finger tearing flesh from the fingertip. The hospital amputated the finger to the first knuckle due to nerve damage.

An employee was repairing a cooling fan and replacing the fan belt. The employee was using a screw driver to put the belt on when it slipped, catching the employee's finger between the pulley and fan belt. The employee's left fingertip was amputated.
An employee was adjusting machinery to resize envelopes when his thumb got caught and amputated between the collator and the collator wheel. The machine was unguarded at the time.

An employee was carrying a catalytic convertor cutter with his hand in the shearer. The employee accidently stepped on the activation switch closing the shearer and amputating two fingers on the left hand.
An employee amputated the tip of his right thumb just below the fingernail while cutting meat with a meat saw.

An employee placing material on a cut-off (plate) saw was injured when the material caught his left pinky finger and pinched it between the housing of the saw and the material. The finger was surgically amputated.
An employee was cleaning the okra cutter and amputated the tip of the left thumb.
An employee was applying wax to a double-sided planer when his glove got caught by the blades. His right index finger and thumb were amputated.

An employee was troubleshooting the fourth filling spout on an assembly line machine. While attempting to fix it, the employee made contact with the machine and his finger got pinched. He sustained a left-hand fingertip amputation.

An employee was working at the former machine. As the employee attempted to pull out a full stack of trays from inside the machine, the stack pusher engaged upwards to push the trays. The stack pusher caught and partially amputated the employee's right-hand middle finger.
An employee was setting up the roll thread machine when the brake out snagged, catching and amputating his right-hand pinky finger.
An employee was using the paper cutting board when he amputated the end of his left-hand middle finger.

An employee was inside the block plant maintenance shop waiting for a coworker to finish cutting pieces of angle iron with an electric-powered reciprocating saw. While the saw was operating, the employee's finger contacted the belt running between the saw's electric motor and the flywheel.  The employee's left index fingertip was caught between the belt and pulley, resulting in a partial fingertip amputation.

An employee was cleaning wood fiber debris from an airlock when his finger got caught between the metal tip of the vane and the airlock, amputating his left middle finger above the bone. The airlock was not turned off at the time of the incident.
An employee was helping to unload cable reels when his finger got pinched between a forklift fork and a trailer. His right ring finger was amputated at the first knuckle.

An employee was manually pushing a center steel partition to align it in a railcar when his foot slipped. He reached up to the edge of the railcar to catch himself while the ram of the hydraulic radar pusher was coming down. The employee's middle and ring fingers on his right hand were caught in a pinch point, resulting in the amputation of his fingertips.

An employee was resetting a machine center to the home position when his left-hand ring finger got pinched between the spindle and the ball part of the press. This 
de-gloved the finger, which had to be surgically amputated.

On September 28, 2015, at 7:00 p.m., an employee was adjusting the stroke length on a pneumatically powered cylinder. The cylinder actuated when the employee reattached the air source (100 psi) to the pneumatic cylinder, amputating the employee's right-hand pinky fingertip in the pinch point between the end of the cylinder body and the cylinder rod cap.

An employee was servicing and troubleshooting an oven loader when the employee's right index finger got caught and amputated in the chain and sprocket. The chain and sprocket was not covered at the time.

An employee was delivering metal product to a customer's facility by semi-truck. He hooked a load of material to the customer's overhead crane. In the process of moving the material from the truck, his finger got caught between the metal load, amputating his left fingertip up to the first knuckle.
An employee was mounting a specialty tire using a tire machine when the machine's roller amputated his right-hand pinky fingertip.
An employee was helping to lower pipe into a shored trench when the employee's finger got caught between the pipe and one of the trench's shoring jacks.

An employee was pushing a loaded cart when the cart hit a doorway and the load began to shift. The employee then attempted to catch the load and amputated portions of the index and middle fingers on the left hand.
An employee was slicing potatoes and cut off the tip of his pinky finger.
While an employee was holding an air conditioner blower shaft to change the belt, his left hand slipped. His left index finger got caught by the air conditioner blade, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was adjusting guides on a machine when another operator jogged the machine.  The employee's finger got crushed between the rollers, amputating his left ring fingertip.

An employee was holding a metal diaphragm ring with a nylon stick (tool). The roller used to make the lip on a metal ring (diaphragm) came off of the die inside of the machine, causing the piece to be pulled into the rollers as the machine cycled. The employee's right-hand ring finger was amputated by the rollers.
The employee was cleaning pieces of metal off a magnet. The magnets drew together and pinched the employee's right ring finger resulting in amputation.
While operating a food slicer to cut cucumbers in the grocery store, an employee amputated the tip of his right middle finger.
An employee's right middle fingertip was amputated when it came into contact with a band saw that was being used to cut up meat.

An employee operating a lathe attempted to remove a shim located between the jaws of a chuck and pipe. While the employee was removing the shim, the kicker actuated, causing the pipe to move. The employee's finger became stuck between the pipe and the chuck jaws, amputating the right index fingertip.

An employee was loading pipe into a fusion machine when the pipe became crooked. The employee tried to remove the pipe by lifting it with a coworker. His right pinky and ring fingers got caught between the pipe, amputating his fingertips.

An employee was operating a lapper machine when its vacuum hose clogged. He turned the machine off, opened the doors, and attempted to unclog it. His hand got caught in the machine and was crushed, resulting in a hand amputation.

An employee was using elevators to latch pipe. While pulling the elevators back to latch another joint of pipe from the trailer, his fingertip got caught between the horn and bale. He sustained a right index fingertip avulsion.
An employee's backup hammer slipped over the end stud nut, smashing the employee's left index finger between the stud and wrench. The employee's fingertip was amputated.
