An employee was trying to remove a piece of rubber from the cutter of a machine. His finger contacted the blade, amputating his fingertip.
An employee amputated his left middle finger at the first knuckle after it was pinched between a C clamp and an access panel while working on an elevator belt.
An employee was moving a paper roll with an overhead crane. Her right pinky finger got caught and was amputated between the paper roll shaft and the bracket.

An employee and a coworker were installing a drive pin on a filler machine. The employee was holding the equipment while the coworker manually turned the filler. The employee's finger got pinched between the motor casing and the filler drum, amputating the left middle fingertip.

On or around October 1, 2015, an employee was attempting to pry up a refractory plate into a bobcat bucket when his right pinky finger became pinned between the pry bar and the furnace wall. His pinky finger was amputated.
An employee's right pinky finger was amputated up to the first knuckle while operating a hydraulic press.
An employee was assembling an aluminum tailgate when the torque gun he was using to tighten bolts slipped and caught his finger. His left middle finger was amputated.

An employee was winding the end of a roll. He was jogging the end of the material onto the roll when his right hand went between the hold-down device and the take-up reel. When he pulled his hand out, his fingertip was amputated.

An employee working on a vertical polisher machine was installing a saw blade. He was hoisting a blade onto an arbor with a spacer.  While aligning the blade to the bushing and arbor, he pushed the blade and bushing with one hand and operated the hoist with the other.  The blade slipped off the hoist and fell on his left thumb, amputating the tip.
Two employees were in a feed mill man lift. Some component in the lifting mechanism failed, causing the car to fall to the ground. Both employees sustained fractures to both legs.

An employee lost approximately 1/3 of the finger while performing routine daily maintenance on a piece of equipment known as a topsoil screen. Two employees were cleaning debris from the radiator. In order to gain access to the radiator, the motor was moved. While placing the motor back into its proper alignment by placing a pin into a mount, the mount moved catching the employees finger and causing injury.
An SSA Gulf employee was unloading cargo when his finger became caught between the cargo, amputating a portion of his left index finger.
An employee was installing tape to hold the paper protector on a metal roller. The employee's right finger got caught and crushed in the drive gear located next to the roller.

An employee climbed a ladder and attempted to adjust the blow pin assembly of a blow mold machine. The machine was operating at the time. While the employee tried to move a bracket and tighten screws, the machine cycled and the assembly moved up, amputating the employee's right index finger below the first knuckle.

Two employees were cleaning on the ground floor outside when an explosion occurred in the boiler room. Both employees were struck by falling debris. One of the employees fractured his right wrist. The other employee suffered a contusion to his right shoulder and right knee.

An employee was putting a combo inside the trash compactor. Once the combo was inside, he turned on the trash compactor, but the equipment failed to operate normally. He attempted to adjust the combo, and as soon as the combo was adjusted, the compactor reacted quickly and crushed/amputated his right middle fingertip.
An employee was shoveling out a garbage truck at a landfill. The wind blew the side-hinged access door shut on the employee's right thumb, amputating it between the thumbnail and the first knuckle.
A maintenance employee was unclogging a sewer line when the auger cable twisted and wrapped around his left ring finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was cleaning the chuck machine with a green pad when his right index fingertip slipped into the chuck and was amputated. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was cutting a 2x8 board with a power saw when his left ring fingertip was amputated by the saw blade.

On 10/03/2015, an employee was sorting packages when a jam occurred. While attempting to clear the jam, the employee's right hand got caught by a moving conveyor belt, which drug the hand into a transition plate. The employee's right ring fingertip was amputated.

An employee was lifting the roll-up door of a trailer when it buckled back, pinching/catching the employee's finger in the gap of the roll-up panels. The employee's right index fingertip was amputated at the first joint.

Two shop employees were in the process of tearing down a 1250 Ton Slip Type Elevator (STE) and were pulling the carriers and slips out of the STE.  While removing one of the carriers from the slip, utilizing the overhead crane, the entire slip assembly (carrier, slip, and slip hanger) began to rise out of the tool.  As the slip hanger rose the IP reached in to remove it when the slip suddenly released from the carrier pushing the slip hanger back into position.  The IP's finger was caught between the slip hanger and the timing ring of the STE amputating the tip of his left index finger midway up the fingernail.
An employee was operating a soup packaging machine when the die roller amputated his right index finger.

Three employees were in a helicopter that crashed at the company parking lot at or near 214 East Highway 44 in Parkston, South Dakota. The employees suffered head and leg injuries.

3 hospitalized.

An employee was trying to remove metal from the slides of a die cast machine. The machine was powered on at the time. The employee's right hand got caught in the machine, amputating the right middle fingertip.

An employee was weighing off ingredients that went into the plastic homogenization for electrical wire jacket/insulation manufacturing. While he was attempting to remove excess material, a roll mill caught and partially amputated his right index finger.

An employee was chaining a seal on a piece of equipment. He was using a pry bar to lift the shaft so he could use his right index finger to put the seal in. The bar slipped and pinched/amputated his right index finger.

An employee was using a hoist to transfer a heat treat basket which was approximately 3 ft. by 4 ft. long from a staging rack to a conveyor. The basket was loaded with castings that go into the heat treat operation.  The employee detached the hoist and noticed the basket wasn't sitting flat on the cart.  As she manipulated the basket her right middle finger was pinched between the basket and the conveyor resulting in a partial amputation of the fingertip with loss of fingernail and subsequent revision of the tip of the finger. Stitches were used to close the wound. No surgery was required.
An employee was feeding bags into a pulley. When he hit the feed button, his finger was pulled up into the pulley, amputating his right index fingertip.

On October 6, 2015, at approximately 3:30 PM, an employee was helping a coworker roll a full linen rack into his truck. The employee was pushing the rack while the coworker was pulling, and the linen rack began to sway to the right. The employee reached over the right side of the rack and attempted to control it with his left hand. He was not able to stop the rack from swaying to the right. His left hand was on the outside right of the rack, and his right hand was placed on the middle bars of the rack. His left-hand finger got caught between the linen rack and a stationary rack that was to his right, amputating the left middle fingertip.

A delivery driver from another company delivered a tanker load of hot oil emulsion for asphalt to the facility.  The driver arrived onsite and hooked up a hose up from the tanker to the facility's pump.  The pump feeds the emulsion to a storage tank. The driver opened the valve on the tanker and turned on the pump. The driver did not open the valve leading to the storage tank. The pump started making loud noises.  The driver closed valve from the tanker.  A Midland Asphalt Materials, Inc. site employee came out of an office to hit the emergency stop switch for the pump.  At that time, the hose ruptured, spraying the two employees with the hot oil emulsion material.  The temperature of the hot oil emulsion material is approximately 320 degrees Fahrenheit. The Midland Asphalt Materials, Inc. employee sustained second degree burns to the face and hand.

An employee was cleaning equipment using the central vacuum hose. The hose was not working properly.  The employee tried to troubleshoot the issue and reached underneath the rotary feeder catching his finger on the blade and amputating the tip of his right index finger.
An employee's right hand was amputated while rigging new hoisting cables on a crane.
An employee was picking up scraps between two CNC saw tables. One table was in operation and the two tables moved together pinching the employee's left thumb resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was using an hydraulic pipe bender and was setting the pipe in place to bend when a coworker started the machine. The employee's finger got caught between the metal conduit and the yoke of the machine. His right-hand middle finger was amputated above the first knuckle.
An employee was unloading frozen fish from a vessel and got his hand caught in the cable of the vessel's winch and pulley. Two fingers were amputated as a result.

An employee in the fabrication shop was operating a tube saw and amputated her right thumb from the base of the nail bed to the tip when the guard crushed her thumb before she could get her hand out of the way.

On 10/07/2015 at approximately 3:30 PM, an employee was helping a Bobcat operator load a two piece steel barrier wall form onto the bed area of the knuckle boom truck. As the forms were being lowered into place, the tip of his right middle finger was smashed between the two forms pieces.
An employee was working in the production area cutting pineapples with a knife and amputated the left index fingertip.

A bag machine operator was retrieving a bag that jammed the machine and severed the left index fingertip.  The bypass switch on the machine was activated. Once the switch is activated, the machine cycles one more time before it hits the home position and stops. The door was opened before the cycle completed and the star wheel pinched the tip of her left index finger, severing it just above the first knuckle. The incident occurred October 7, 2015 at approximately 9:35hrs.

On or about October 5, 2015, an employee was trying to free the door of a grain dump truck when the locking mechanism got stuck. Once the door was freed, it slammed on the employee's right middle finger. The right middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee was cutting a piece of OSB with a circular saw and amputated his index finger.
On October 7, 2015, an employee operating a floor buffer machine suffered a fingertip amputation when the pinky finger became caught between the machine handle and a door handle.
An employee experienced a partial amputation of the left ring finger while working with another employee to knock out a pin with a sledgehammer.

An employee was cleaning out a knife gate. The equipment was turned off. While using an airline and nozzle to blow out material the airline hit the on/off switch and the gate was activated. The employee's thumb was crushed under the gate and amputated by the machine.

An employee was trying to change the spacer on a bar cut off saw. He reached back to the controls meaning to hit the "spacer toggle button" to adjust the spacer, but hit the "vice close button" instead which made the vice close onto the employee's left hand resulting in a partial amputation of the index and middle fingers.
An employee was removing plywood forms for concrete from beneath a highway overpass.  The lift bucket was side swiped by the trailer of a semi truck.  The employee suffered broken bones.
An employee sliced the top of the pointer finger while using a power saw to cut wood. The employee was treated in the emergency room, but was not admitted.
An employee amputated his right pinky finger while troubleshooting the air handling units in the mechanical room.
An employee was manually setting a post driver on the ground and caught their right index finger between the post driver and the hammer resulting in amputation.
An employee received a partial amputation to the left pinky finger just below the nail bed after the finger was crushed by a closing door.
An employee was clearing a jam on the bucket condenser when the wheel crushed his fingers in between two metal pieces resulting in the amputation of the index and middle fingers on the right hand.

Employee 1 was helping Employee 2 weld a flange to a pipe. Employee 1 was holding a 20" diameter, 2" thick flange in place for Employee 2. The flange was held up by a pipe jack.  The flange slipped and Employee 1's fingers were caught between the flange and the pipe jack.  His right middle finger was amputated between the first and second joint and his ring finger was amputated at the first joint.

An employee was operating a "roto claw" meat processing machine when a meat hook fell into the machine. The employee reached into the machine to retrieve the hook which resulted in the amputation of the employee's right hand pinky finger and injuries to the employee's right hand ring finger.
While straightening a piece of metal using the piranha press, an employee amputated part of a finger.

An employee was operating a tie down machine in shock packaging. The employee was adjusting a tie strap while the tie down machine was cycling. The employee's finger was caught between the pusher head of the pneumatic tie down machine and the splatter washer resulting in amputation of the left index fingertip.
On October 9, 2015, an employee amputated his left index finger to the first knuckle when he was working with an auto-threader machine in the shop.
An employee was struck by a portable electromagnetic drill press and suffered a severe laceration.  This injury later required a partial amputation of the finger.
An employee was counting bags on a conveyor and caught the left ring finger in the conveyor system resulting in the removal of the fingertip including the nail with no bone damage.

On Saturday 10/10/15 at approximately 5:00 AM, an employee's hand slid underneath a fixed guard at the Department 5540 Pleater. The employee's left index finger made contact with a belt and was pulled into a roller resulting in injury.  Medical provider's diagnosis is that of a partial amputation of the left index finger.

An employee was working by a sheeter roll and was using a wedge so it wouldn't move.  When he placed the wedge, the roll moved and it pinched his fingers.  The roll weighs 2,000 lbs.  The hand specialist had to amputate the right middle fingertip.
An employee got his left ring finger caught between a belt and pulley while conducting maintenance on the vacuum fan.  When he jerk his hand out, the skin and nail pulled off the finger to the bone.
An employee was lining up two dies and caught their right index finger in the upper die resulting in a partial amputation of the finger.
An employee was running wood through the gang saw and amputated the pinky and ring fingers on the right hand to the knuckle.
An employee amputated the right ring finger when clearing a jam on the bottling machine.

An employee was moving a toolbox on wheels to set up for his shift. It struck a stationary toolbox and the two handles were close enough in height that the employee's left middle finger was pinched off between the two handles. As part of the surgical repair the distal phalange was removed in order to accommodate the formation of a dermal flap.
An employee was opening the wing gate on an asphalt laydown machine and his right leg was caught in the elevator amputating it above the knee.

On October 12, 2015, at approximately 1:30am, an employee suffered the amputation of his left arm (up to the shoulder) after it became caught in the bridle roller, a power unit that moves the strip of metal at 300 feet per minute, while the employee was troubleshooting it.  A guard was removed and the line lock procedure was not used.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut a piece of plywood and amputated the right index fingertip.
An employee had the flesh removed from the bottom of his right middle finger while using an unguarded table router.
An employee's hand was caught under the grinding wheel of a surface grinder resulting in a left middle finger avulsion. The fingertip was later amputated.

An employee was cleaning the powder filler machine. In the process, a conveyor belt pulled in the cloth she was using to wipe down the machine and the tip of her middle right hand finger was amputated. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was troubleshooting a form fill and seal machine. When the machine inadvertently cycled, the employee's right index finger was amputated above the first joint.

An employee was adjusting a wood molder machine. The employee opened the hood and climbed onto the molding machine partially supporting his body on his right knee and arm. His hand slipped and contacted the machine's "knife" amputating the right hand's middle finger distal phalange.

An employee noticed that a plastic bottle of shampoo had fallen over on the conveyor belt because it was missing the cap. The employee thought he had hit the stop button to shutdown the conveyor belt in order to grab the fallen shampoo bottle, but he didn't thereby his right index finger got caught between the chain and the sprocket. This resulted in the amputation of the fleshy tip of his right index finger.
An employee pinched his right ring finger between a chunk of refractory and a conveyor resulting in the amputation of the right ring fingertip.
A client threw a fire extinguisher at an employee. A second employee attempted to block it and got hit by the fire extinguisher, sustaining a back injury. Both employees were hospitalized.
An employee was cutting wood and lacerated his thumb.
An employee suffered the amputation of the large and second toe on the left foot when the trailer separated from the tracker and fell onto the employee's left foot.

The employee was pulling a safety pin out of an outrigger on the telebelt and had his finger pinched in the outrigger. The employee sustained a flesh amputation to the fingertip of the right hand middle finger.
An employee was delivering mail and caught their right pinky finger in the vehicle door resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was removing a 14 foot jack in a parking garage by releasing clamps on the top and the bottom.  While the employee was releasing the bottom clamp, the top clamp that was previously loosened fell and caught his finger between the top clamp and the back. The left middle finger was amputated.

An employee was cleaning sludge from the storm water/spill collection sump at the tanker unload area. He was attempting to return a section of heavy metal grate back into the operational position when he amputated his fingertip.

An employee was operating a saw to cut pieces of wood. The employee reached in to get a piece of wood out and stepped on the peddle, activating the saw and amputating the tip of the second finger on the left hand.
A maintenance employee amputated his right fingertip while operating a bagging machine.
While an employee was getting out of a car, the car door slammed on and partially amputated the employee's pinky.
An employee was accessing a safe in the cash office to get deposits. While closing the door to the safe, his finger got caught, amputating his left index fingertip near the first knuckle.

An employee was putting air into a tire and having trouble getting the tire bead to seal. The employee put a rag in between the rim and tire to assist the seal. When the employee went to remove the rag, the tire sealed and caught his right index finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was cutting meat when his right-hand thumb tip contacted the blade of the band saw and was amputated.
An employee was cleaning equipment with a water hose and got a hand caught in the potato line auger. The right hand was amputated.
An employee raised a platform scale out of the framework.  The scale fell on the employee's hand and amputated the left thumb.
An employee was inspecting an ammonia leak in the refrigeration system and went into shock due to ammonia exposure.

On 10/16/15 an employee removed the guarding from the chain on a fan fold machine while the machine was running. The employee was attempting to replace the chain after the chain had come off the machine. The employee got his fingers caught in the machine. On 10/19/15 the employee had surgery for a partial traumatic transphalangeal amputation of the left index and middle fingers.

An employee using a pressure washer was injured when the wheel that the employee was spraying shattered. The wheel fragments struck the employee's face, causing his prescription eye glasses to break. Pieces of the eye glass frame became lodged in his eye. He was hospitalized.
An employee was inside an M-1 Tank. He pulled himself up through the turret and pinched his fingertip in a metal joint on the headrest.
An employee was using a saw to cut lumber and amputated a finger.
A temporary employee had his left hand middle finger amputated while using a cut-off saw to cut up scrap OSB on or about October 17, 2015.
An employee was operating a commercial dishwasher.  While inserting a dish rack her gloved finger was caught or pinched and the tip of the left pinky finger was amputated.
An employee amputated two fingertips, pinched a third finger, and fractured a finger on the right hand while cleaning ink off print rollers on a machine that had not been shut off and isolated.
An employee was aligning and storing rack vertical components by hand. His left middle fingertip got caught between two rack foot plates; it was crushed and amputated (distal phalanx, part of nail).
An employee was clearing a jam in a plastic grinder while the machine was running and three fingers were amputated.  The machine was not locked out.
An employee was cutting meat in the meat department when his right hand ring fingertip contacted the band-saw blade and was amputated.

An employee was pushing a dumpster into an enclosure. A gust of wind caught the enclosure door and slammed the door into the dumpster catching the employee's left hand middle finger resulting in amputation.
An employee working on the shipping line conveyor got his right hand caught in the conveyor belt pulley amputating the tip of his fifth digit.

The freight elevator door was left open, which causes a buzzing sound (alarm). The employee walked over and attempted to close the door to stop the alarm. As she pulled the metal door down, the door caught and amputated her left index fingertip.
On or about October 19, 2015, an employee's left-hand index finger was amputated by the chain of a red iron chain conveyor. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was operating a machine that packages frozen pizzas into cartons when her hand was pulled into an in-running nip point, amputating her left-hand middle fingertip.
An employee was rigging pilings for hoisting and pinched a finger between the sling and piling. The tip of the index finger was amputated and reattached.

An employee was attempting to make a delivery and was operating the dock gate that goes in the trailer. The employee was pulling up the dock plate and moving it forward when the employee's left middle finger got caught between the dock plate and trailer. The employee's left middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was starting up an extrusion machine when the machine "kicked out" or faulted. The employee's gloved hand was caught in the auger. The employee sustained a partial amputation of the right index finger between the first and second digit.
While moving a stack of doors, an employee's finger was caught between doors resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was helping to put valves in place on a flatbed truck. A valve shifted and his hand got pinched between two valves, amputating (de-gloving) his right index finger.

On 10/20/2015 at about 11:45 AM, the injured employee was in the process of repositioning forks on a rough terrain forklift with his bare hands (no gloves). His right hand was near the tip end and his left hand at the heel end. He lifted with his right hand so that he could slide the fork along the fork bar. His right hand slipped and his left little finger got caught between the heel and the carriage. The distal end was crushed and severely lacerated (partial amputation).
While operating a stretch wrapping machine, an employee's finger got caught between two rollers. Approximately two-thirds of the employee's right little finger were amputated.
An employee was pulling and laying down pipe and amputated the third digit on the right hand from the tip to the knuckle.

An employee was moving a 220 pound cutting edge (blade) onto a pallet using a forklift. The blade was unstable and the employee exited the forklift to steady the blade. The blade shifted and fell onto her left ring finger resulting in the amputation of the finger up to the first digit.
An employee was pushing a pocket stream feeder cart sideways across the floor. The cart tipped over and fell onto the employee's foot crushing two toes that were later amputated.

An employee was lifting a 70 lb. section of metal duct that needed to be welded to a ship bulkhead that was under construction. The metal duct slipped from the employee's hands and his left index finger was pinched between the metal duct and an I-beam flange. The employee's left index finger was amputated by the emergency room doctor.
An employee amputated the left middle fingertip while using hedge trimmers.
An employee amputated two digits on the left ring finger while operating a milling machine.

An employee was working with seven other employees to manually lift, move and place a section of fencing. While setting the fencing down, the injured employee's finger was pinched resulting in the degloving of the left hand middle fingertip.

An employee was attempting to put a chain back on the sprocket drive of the wood hog machine. Another employee started up the machine and the injured employee's fingers were caught in the machine resulting in the amputation of the pinky fingertip and a broken ring finger.

An employee was dumping powdered graphite/carbon debris from a drum suspended from a crane by a nylon sling into a hopper on the ground. The employee's left hand was on the hopper as the caked carbon material fell out of the drum and into the hopper causing the hopper to shift.  His hand was caught between the edge of the hopper and the drum resulting in the amputation of the left pinky finger between the first and second knuckle.

On October 22, 2015, at about 12:30PM, an employee lacerated the fourth finger on the right hand while removing a piece of concrete that had just been cut. The cut piece measured approximately 60 inches x 18.5 inches by 12 inches thick. When removing the piece, the employee's finger was pinched between the cut piece and the wall.

An employee was clearing a jam and jogging the equipment due to a "barrel trip gate fault."  The operator noticed a large jam and entered a gloved finger into the point of operation to clear the jam while jogging the machine.  The left index finger was caught in the dial (part of the machine that brings the plunger up into the barrel for assembly of the syringe) and the fingertip was amputated.  There are interlock doors on the machine normally guarding this point of operation, but the interlocks did not prevent the machine from functioning in the jog mode with the doors open.  The jog function is controlled by a two-button control that is operated from the handheld pendent hardwired to the machine.  Both job buttons can be operated with the same hand.
An employee was trouble shooting a clam shell machine and got their right hand caught in the chain and sprocket drive resulting in the amputation of the right pinky fingertip.
An employee was using a circular saw to cut wood stakes. The saw kicked back and amputated a left hand fingertip.
An employee's right index finger was partially amputated above the first joint when it was caught in the case machine while unjamming it.
An employee was operating a dye punch machine and amputated the second, third and fourth fingers on the left hand.
An employee was cutting pallets with a chop saw. The employee was clearing a piece of wood and amputated two fingers when his gloved hand was pulled into the running blade.
An employee was moving an ice cream freezer. The freezer slipped and fell onto the employee's hands amputating a middle fingertip.

A marine machinist was assisting qualified riggers in installing an approximately 400 to 500 pound pump when his left middle finger got caught between the pump and pump plate, subsequently amputating the tip of the middle finger without bone loss.
An employee was lowering a mail truck door when their gloved finger was caught in the fold of the door, resulting in a partial amputation of their right middle ring finger just below the finger nail.

The employee was resting his hand on a piece of equipment while preparing to calibrate it. He turned to his right and his left pinky and glove were caught in the belt mount of the equipment. He was transported to the hospital and suffered a partial fingertip amputation with no bone loss. The bone was fractured at the tip.
An employee was untangling a cable from a pulley and caught his fingers between the cable and pulley resulting in the amputation of two fingertips.
While adjusting the shear on the Schlatter machine, an employee's first two fingers on his left hand were amputated.
An employee was cutting wood with a circular saw and amputated two fingers on the left hand.
An employee was loading molding into a machine. The employee's gloved hand was caught in the machine as the blade was coming to a stop. The right middle fingertip was amputated with bone loss.
An employee was inspecting a disassembled actuated ball valve on a workbench. The employee placed a finger on the valve when it cycled and amputated the left middle fingertip.
An employee was delivering supplies and got their right hand caught in a door jam. The right middle finger was pinched and some skin was removed.
An employee lost part of the right index finger while operating a brake press.

Due to heavy rains, the wood chips lying on the #1 Reclaim Circulating Chip Conveyor became saturated and heavy to the extent that the weight yanked the gear box from the structural base.  In order to make repairs, a maintenance employee was manually moving the gearbox chain tooth by tooth.  When he released the chain on the third tooth/notch, he had his ring finger between the chain and the sprocket when the chain jumped causing his finger to be pinched.  As the pinch was occurring, the employee pulled his finger back, which caused the skin to be removed at the tip of his finger.  The incident resulted in the amputation of the fingertip.

An employee was installing a metal flange on a 20-inch pipe and pinched a finger between the pipe and the metal flange while retrieving a nut that dropped between the pipe and flange. The right index fingertip was amputated.
An employee was working on a module feeder and his hand contacted the belt resulting in the amputation of three fingers.

On or about 7:30 a.m. on October 26, 2015, an employee was preparing to change a powered industrial truck battery.  Due to the end stops on the multi-level battery rack being bent out of place, the battery was positioned too far into the rack for the large suction cup on the automatic battery machine to reach it and pull the battery out.  The employee used a strap to try to pull the battery forward and in doing so, his left pinky finger was pinched between the strap and a guardrail in the area, causing a fingertip amputation.
An employee tried to remove stones and dirt from the crusher machine. The rotor had not stopped turning. His glove got caught in the machine resulting in the amputation of the index finger.

An employee was operating a Solbern conveyor. The products being transported on the conveyor became jammed at the end of the conveyor.  The operator attempted to clear the jam by reaching underneath the conveyor and removing the product that was stuck between the conveyor and a tray. The operator's right ring finger was caught in a belt underneath the conveyor and the skin was peeled from the tip of the finger. The finger was amputated just below the finger nail at the hospital.

An employee was servicing the #128 Rotary Die Cutter.  The machine was de-energized and locked out.  The employee was using a timing wrench to adjust a bar and belt in the machine.  As the employee was twisting the wrench, his finger got pinched between the bar and another part of the machine.  The twisting action combined with the pinch point caused the employee to suffer an avulsion to the thumb on his left hand.
The winch rope on a brush chipper got caught on the employee's foot resulting in the amputation of the right foot.
On or about October 26, 2015, an employee sustained serious injuries to the left hand while working on a piece of industrial machinery resulting in multi-digit amputations.
While cutting meat with a meat band saw, an employee's right thumb came in contact with the saw blade.  The thumb tip was amputated.
An employee received an electrical shock while working with equipment within the grinding room.
An employee was bending tubing on a Pines bender and amputated the tip of the index finger.

An employee was operating a stand up forklift travelling east bound, forks trailing, behind another stand up forklift. Forklift 2 began to turn left into a staging lane to deliver parts. The employee attempted to pass Forklift 2 on the right side. As he was passing, he saw an oncoming forklift (3) travelling west. He made a quick right-hand turn to avoid the westbound forklift (3) into aisle 45 and struck a protective barricade that attached to the concrete that protected the barrier. The employee's left foot was pinched between the barricade and the back of his stand up forklift resulting in severe soft tissue damage and multiple leg fractures. The left leg was amputated below the knee.

The employee was operating a forklift and dumping sand.  He got off the forklift to activate the dump hopper lever.  The employee's hand got caught between the fork and the hopper fork pocket amputating the left hand index fingertip.

An employee was putting glue into a AAA glue machine. The machine was running at the time. The cap fell off and fell into the machine. The employee reached into the machine to retrieve the cap and amputated his right hand middle finger.

On or about 8:15 a.m. on October 27, 2015, an employee was operating a com cutter machine when he incurred an amputation to the tip of his left ring finger.  The machine rotates, smooths and cuts commutators that are a component of DC motors.

Four employees were preparing to change a head saw blade.  One employee shut the head saw down and while the blade was still rotating another employee opened a door on the backside of the head saw.  That employee reached inside the door with his right hand and his arm was struck by the saw blade amputating the lower arm.

An employee was attempting to break loose a pipe connection with a pipe wrench when his thumb was caught between the pipe and the wrench when the pipe string was lifted. He suffered a soft tissue amputation to the tip of the thumb.

An employee was removing building jacks from a bolted water tank. He was lowering sections of jacks and as he pulled the pin on the jack his left hand became pinned between two jacks resulting in the amputation of the left hand index and middle fingers.
An employee was manually feeding wire through a guillotine/cutter machine and amputated the tip of the left index finger.

Employees were moving a lubricator onto a flatbed truck. An employee's finger was caught between the collar on the lubricator and the bed of the truck resulting in a right middle fingertip amputation.

An employee was feeding wire into a stripping machine that removes plastic from the wire when his fingers were pulled into the machine.  His fingers were crushed and severely cut. His left index finger was amputated between the first knuckle and the fingertip.

A maintenance employee was troubleshooting an air handler when his left hand got caught in the belt and pulley. He was wearing a glove but received a partial amputation to his middle finger and lacerations to his thumb. The equipment was de-energized at the time of the accident.

Employees were installing two dust collectors. The employees were working on dust collector 1. An employee checked on the other dust collector that was not locked out to look at the dust that was coming out and got his hand caught in a rotary valve resulting in the amputation of the left index, middle and ring fingers.
An employee had his right hand index, middle, and ring fingers amputated when his glove got caught in the horizontal lathe he was using to polish a 7/8 inch pin with an emery cloth.
An employee was installing railroad track when a rail rolled off the jack and pinched a finger resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was changing the bearings in a ventilation system motor. After the motor was put back together, the employee reached behind the motor with his left hand to check the belt tension. While the employee was checking the belt tension, the wind blew through the air duct and caused the ventilation fan pulley to turn. The employee's left pinky and index fingers were pinched between the pulley and belt and amputated.

An employee was loading carts into a distribution truck. While organizing the carts inside the truck, two carts smashed together pinching the employee's right hand resulting in a middle fingertip amputation.
An employee amputated the tip of the left middle finger when he tried to catch the pipe he was carrying and pinching his finger between the pipe and the floor.
The employee was installing a pipe on a new vessel and caught the left hand between the pipe and vessel, crushing the pinky finger. The fingertip was medically amputated.

An employee 

amputated the right index finger to the first knuckle when his right hand was caught in steel double doors in an attempt to keep them from closing.

An employee was attempting to rivet two pieces of metal by hand with a rivet squeezer. The employee was holding the metal with his right hand and was operating the rivet squeezer with lift hand. The employee's right middle finger was caught between the rivet squeezer and the metal resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was in the warehouse area attaching extension bars to the forklift. The extension bars are for longer skids. The extension bar slid off his hand and his right hand got caught between the extension bar and the fork causing the partial amputation of his ring finger.
An employee was operating a hydraulic press and amputated the left index finger to the first knuckle.

An employee was fitting the engine cylinder into its fixture and got his right hand pinched between the 150 lb. cylinder and the fixture resulting in the amputation of the right thumb and ring fingertips.
On October 29, 2015, an temporary employee's left foot small toe was amputated when a cart tipped over and fell on his left foot.
An employee's right hand was caught in the rotating blades of a lawn mower resulting in the amputation of two fingertips just below the finger nails.
A worker was operating a chop saw and amputated the tip of his right middle finger when his finger was pulled into the saw along with the wood to be cut.

An employee was removing a gate from a fence at a substation in preparation for large equipment transfer. The employee sustained an avulsion injury to the right middle finger when it was pinched by the latch on the gate.
An employee was taking the temperature of a mold inside a foaming machine and dropped the temperature probe. As the employee tried to retrieve the probe, the left index finger was amputated.
An employee was loading freight when his finger was caught in between the freight and the carrier amputating his index finger.

On 10/30/15 at approximately 1420, an employee was removing an equipment guard that was 6 inches off the ground.  He removed the top bolt while supporting the bottom of the guard with his right hand. When the top bolt came loose and dropped on his right hand it pinched the top of his ring finger resulting in a partial amputation.

On October 29, 2015, at approximately 4:00pm, a maintenance technician suffered an amputation while troubleshooting an air cylinder on an evaporator foam fixture in the Tooling Department.  The maintenance tech placed his left hand on top of the cylinder hole while looking at the right side of the cylinder.  His arm inadvertently activated the lever in the down position and the tip of his left ring finger was pinched between the cylinder and the hole resulting in amputation.
An employee received a fingertip amputation to the 2nd digit of the left hand.
An employee was clearing a jam on a machine and amputated the left index fingertip.
The employee was manually handling plastic pallets when the employee's left thumb tip was caught in between two pallets resulting in the amputation of the thumb tip.
An employee amputated the right middle fingertip while priming an icing pump on the blue colored icing line.
An employee was threading a conveyor belt on an air lay machine and got the right hand caught in the pin cylinder. The hand was amputated.

An employee was on top of a weaving machine to view a counter. The employee slipped and fell. As the employee fell, the employee's right hand contacted an unguarded chain and sprocket.  The employee's right pinky finger was severely lacerated and amputated at the hospital.
An employee was cleaning around a lint cleaner saw. The employee's sleeve got caught in the saw resulting in the amputation of the left middle finger.
An employee was cutting wood with a table saw and amputated the right index finger at the middle knuckle.

The injured employee was having a difficult time closing the latch of a shipping container door. This employee was standing beside the shipping container door by the handle while another employee, who was operating a forklift, pushed the latch of the container's door per the injured employee's command. The fork struck the injured employee's right hand middle finger resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee amputated half of his nail and finger when an automatic valve closed on his right middle finger.

The employee was approaching  the doors that go into the lunchroom/cafeteria area. Somebody had just come through the doors. As the doors were closing he grabbed the edge of the door trying to catch it before it closed. The doors caught the end of his pinky finger and amputated it.

On or about November 2, 2015, a mechanic was removing a turbo from an engine while standing on a ladder. When dismounting the ladder he fell and his left pinky finger was caught between the turbo and a tank beside the truck and amputated.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation due to contact with an unguarded chain and sprocket located on the packaging conveyor.

Two employees were bolting round flanges into a pipeline formation.  One employee was torqueing with a ratchet while the other was holding a multiplier that was attached to the ratchet with the use of an extender.  There was another 2" flange (which extended further out than the flange that was being bolted) that was in the middle of the flange that they were bolting.  They were torqueing the bolts on the flange in sequence/series.  When they started the last round of torqueing, the employee holding the multiplier got his pinky caught between the multiplier and the center flange.  This resulted in a partial amputation of the left pinky finger.  The employee had removed skin form the very tip of the finger and the nail bed.
An employee was operating a mechanical punch press and amputated the left index finger.

An employee removed a blow out preventer (BOP) from a well head. The BOP was suspended by the rig.  While suspended, the BOP started rotating catching the employee's left ring fingertip between the BOP and the stationary well head resulting in amputation.
An employee was performing maintenance on a product elevator and amputated the index fingertip in the conveyor belt.
The worker's left ring finger was amputated when it was caught in the conveyor belt while unloading packages in the loading dock area.

An employee was operating an overhead crane with the right hand and supporting the part being lifted with the left hand. The employee's left ring fingertip was pinched between the part and the crane while hoisting resulting in the amputation of the fingertip.
An employee was attempting to clear a jam in the chopper and amputated the tips of the left index, middle, and ring fingers.

Employees were working on a brush mower that was elevated on the forks of a skid steer. The fork carriage became dislodged from the skid steer causing the brush mower deck and fork implement to fall injuring three employees. Employee 1 was hospitalized with head injuries. Employee 2 was hospitalized with a broken ankle requiring surgery. The third employee three was treated for a sprained thumb and knee and fractured vertebrae and released.
An employee was operating a press machine and amputated the right middle finger.

A sanitation engineer was hooking the cable hooks to the residential dumpster when his right index finger was pinched in the safety hook latch.  This resulted in a crushing injury and the loss of the right index fingertip.
A press operator was removing a print unit from a press and placing the unit onto a cart when their hand was caught between the cart frame and the print unit.  The left middle finger was amputated.
An employee was operating a mechanical power press and amputated four fingers on the right hand.

A temporary employee was running normal production operations on a stamping press. The employee hand-fed extruded aluminum pieces into the point-of-operation with actuation controlled by two-hand controls located at shoulder height. The employee cycled the press, and once the cycle completed he removed the punched part. Subsequently, he put new blank into the point-of-operation and at that time, without manual actuation, the ram drifted from its top-stop and came down while both of his hands were in the point-of-operation. Both hands were crushed by the ram.

On or about 1:15 p.m. on November 4, 2015, an employee cutting meat on a vertical band saw sustained a partial finger amputation to his left index finger.  The employee wore layered cotton, metal mesh and rubber gloves on his right hand, which he used to turn the meat during cutting/trimming.  He wore layered cotton and rubber gloves on his left hand which he used to take the trimmed pieces of meat and set aside for freezing or packaging.  His left hand inadvertently contacted the moving blade while placing a trimmed piece of meat to the side.

An employee was turning a shaft on a lathe and polishing it with an emery cloth. The employee's glove got caught in the lathe pulling the employee's left hand into the machine and amputating the left middle fingertip and crushing the index and ring fingertips.
An employee was putting a new blade in a vent gun.  Her hand slipped and the blade cut the tip of her finger.
On November 5, 2015, an employee operating a drill press crushed the tip of his right index finger when his glove was caught in the drill. The finger was eventually amputated.
An employee amputated the tip of the right index finger while cleaning a pump and the pump activated.

On November 5, 2015, an employee was attempting to remove the lift hydraulic cylinder from the mast of a forklift. The employee had blocked the mast to prepare to remove the cylinder. The employee used a pry bar because the cylinder was stuck in its mounting points. While using the pry bar, both the blocking for the mast and the cylinder came out, causing the mast to crash down and smash the employee's left index finger between the mast and the frame. The finger was amputated, requiring hospitalization and stitches.
An employee was using an assembling machine and crushed his left thumb resulting in an amputation.

An employee injured his finger with a battery power drill while dismantling scaffolding.  The employee's glove got caught in the drill and twisted. The injury required a partial amputation of the tip of his right ring finger.
An employee was cutting a piece of polycarbonate board with a miter saw. While operating the saw, the employee cut his left index finger. The fingertip was amputated at the hospital.

An employee was transferring an erect package on an erect package cart.  The employee's thumb was underneath the package and when he pulled it out from under the package he sustained an amputation injury.

An employee was spraying water with a hose onto the floor and auger. The employee removed the drain cap from the auger and attempted to remove a piece of meat. The employee's left middle finger got caught and amputated in the auger.
An employee was cutting meat using a band saw. He lost his balance and his thumb went into the saw blade, amputating it.
On or about November 6, 2015, an employee's left ring finger was amputated while pushing a turkey into a hock cutter.
An employee was installing a chain on an accumulator when his left-hand little finger got caught between the chain and the sprocket, amputating the fingertip.

On 11/5/15 a worker delivering foodservice items at a restaurant began to feel back pain while stacking boxes on a hand cart.


On 11/6/15 a worker climbing out of a semi trailer missed a ladder rung on the side of the trailer and fell fracturing ribs and the collar bone. 

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer.  These events are captured as one report.
An employee was attempting to repair a machine and got his hand(s) caught in the machine. The right pinky finger was surgically amputated.
A pipe rack slid off a forklift, catching and amputating an employee's right pinky fingertip.

An employee was adjusting the projection welder machine. The employee's right hand was on the working surface of the machine when the steel shaft came down and amputated the employee's right middle finger.
On 11/08/15, an employee attempted to clear wood debris from a knot saw when the blade amputated the first digit of his right-hand middle finger.
An employee's right thumb was amputated while operating a chop saw.

An employee was setting up steel plates (each approximately 300 pounds) on a mold cart.  Two plates were set up vertically on the cart. One tipped, knocking the other over while the employee was holding the plate.  His right middle fingertip was crushed between the 300-pound steel plate and mold cart.

An employee was inspecting an extruder machine before starting production. He slipped and attempted to steady himself with his hand. His left-hand middle finger slipped into a 2-inch opening of the pneumatic "vent stuffer," amputating the fingertip.
An employee pulled the chain to lower the lift gate on a truck about to be unloaded. The gate caught his finger, partially amputating the side of his left third digit.
An employee was performing sanitation activities when his sleeve got caught on a roller. The machine rollers then pulled his hand into the machine, amputating it.
An employee was removing a piece of unistrut, lost balance, and fell catching a fingertip on the unistrut and amputating it.
An employee was cutting a 4' x 8' x 1/2" piece of gatorboard into 5" strips using a table saw when three of his left-hand fingertips were amputated, requiring surgery.

On 11-9-2015, at 11:00 a.m., an employee was using an electric plumbing coil snake to clear out a drain when the coils wrapped around his left hand and fingers.  His left index finger had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was attempting to remove scrap material from the stamping press. The injured employee's hand got caught in the material, and the right-hand middle finger was partially amputated.

An employee was unrolling a roll of 2-gauge metal by hand.  While pulling against a pipe wrench to roll the metal, he tried to keep the metal from bunching up by placing his hand between the spool and the rollers it sat on.  He pulled on the wrench, and his left-hand ring finger got caught between the rollers. His middle fingertip was partially amputated.
An employee was drilling into studs when the drill kicked back and caught his right-hand index finger.  His fingertip was amputated just behind the fingernail.

An employee was adjusting the rollers on the skinner. The machine was locked out at the time. After the adjustments were finished, the employee removed tools from the machine, removed the lock, and re-energized the skinner. The employee pressed the foot pedal and the machine started. The employee's left hand was on the surface of the skinner, which grabbed the employee's left arm sleeve and pulled it into the skinner, severely lacerating the employee's left hand and partially amputating the left-hand thumb.
An employee was troubleshooting a packaging machine. The machine engaged, and his hand was pushed by the belt. When he pulled his hand back, his fingertip was amputated.

Two employees were working on a labeler.  The first employee was cleaning the fingers of the labeler, while the second was working on a sensor. When the second employee finished his work on the sensor, he closed a door on the machine, causing a rack to move forward and catch the first employee's left-hand middle finger. The first employee suffered an avulsion that required surgical amputation of the fingertip.

An employee was unloading equipment from a tilt trailer. A D-ring from one of the hold-down straps was caught between the trailer and the tilt bed. The employee tried to knock out the D-ring with a sledge hammer. When the D-ring was knocked out, the trailer bed came down and amputated the employee's right index fingertip.

An employee was helping a truck driver unload a truck at the post office dock. As the dock lever pulley was engaged, the front lip of the dock leveler did not extend properly. The employee attempted to lift the front lip and her right index finger entered the hinge where the lip and plate meet. Her finger got caught and her right index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was adjusting a 100-ton jack so that it could push pins that held a gantry tube in position. When the jack was in position and pressure was starting to be applied to the pins, something slipped and caused the employee's fingers to get pinched off. About 1.5 inches of his left ring and middle fingers were amputated.

An employee was attempting to free the arm piece of a pneumatically operated shear line machine. The machine's arm became free and caught the employee's right index finger between the arm and the frame of the machine, amputating it.
An employee's right index fingertip was amputated while he was attempting to remove a jammed piece of wood from a pallet machine.

An employee in the assembly area was moving the turret of an endliner machine. The machine was not powered at the time. His right middle finger got pinched between the starwheel and the dog leg, amputating his fingertip (no bone was amputated).
Half an inch of an employee's left little finger was crushed and amputated between pipes.
An employee was cutting a 2x4 with a chop saw. While holding the board in place, he lost his grip, and his left ring fingertip hit and was amputated by the blade.
An employee was clearing a jammed cotton saw and was turning it by hand. The saw caught his finger and amputated the tip. The saw was not energized at the time of the incident.

Two employees were loading a catwalk and two pipe racks onto a trailer. When the second pipe rack was loaded, the forklift operator did not realize the forks were under the other pipe rack.  The movement caused the pipe rack to roll onto the right pinky finger of the injured employee, amputating the fingertip.
On 11/11/2015, at 3 p.m., an employee was repairing a truck. He was caging the brake chamber when the air fitting slipped and crushed two left-hand fingers, causing bone loss in one finger.

An employee was pulling a dolly from under a manufactured house when three fingers got pinched between the dolly and the frame of the structure. Her left-hand middle, index, and ring fingers were partially amputated (soft tissue only, no bone).
An employee's right-hand middle finger was partially amputated when it got caught in an elevator door he was latching.

An employee was running a brake press and had a piece of rectangular metal. The employee set the dies and pressed (bent) the short end. The employee then turned the piece to bend the long side, adjusted the dies, and leaned forward. The employee's left-hand fingers got caught in the equipment. The employee's left index fingertip and middle finger to the knuckle were surgically amputated; there was also some damage to the ring finger.
An employee was exposed to an amputation of a fingertip while placing a rear bar onto a cart on November 19, 2015.  The bar fell and pinched the finger, severing the tip.
An employee's left ring fingertip was amputated while he was cutting flooring material using a retractable knife.
An employee was using a hoist to move a cast iron curb box from a pallet to a conveyor. The employee's left middle fingertip was amputated between the casting and the side panel of the conveyor.
An employee was operating a cope and drag machine when the employee's hand slipped, causing the employee's thumb to get crushed beneath a plate.

An employee was helping to lift concrete panels when the metal brace slipped out of his hand and cut his right pinky finger. He was wearing gloves at the time. He was hospitalized for surgery, and his right pinky had to eventually be surgically amputated.
An employee was performing preventive maintenance on an extendable conveyor line when his left index finger got caught and amputated between the line and the dock door.
An employee was showing a supervisor something on a punch press die when his foot hit the foot pedal. The press cycled and caught the employees' left index finger, which was amputated.

A wire became jammed in the wire brush manufacturing machine. The employee unjammed the wire and used his left middle finger to check if the feed tube was free of debris. The machine toggled and amputated his left middle fingertip.  The machine was not locked out at the time.
An employee was operating a machine when his finger was amputated.
An employee was ripping wood on a table saw when the blade amputated two of the employee's fingertips. The saw was unguarded at the time.

An employee was preparing to cut some metal material with a chop saw (miter saw) with his right hand holding the material.  The saw blade got caught on the material, causing it to raise and catch two of his fingers. His right index and middle fingertips were amputated.

An employee was moving a load of wood logs with a crane. After disconnecting the metal sling clip attached to the load, the logs shifted, causing the employee's finger to get caught between them. The employee's right middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee was loading a mold onto a forklift when the forklift moved forward and caught his finger between the mold and forks sustaining a 1st digit amputation to the right middle finger.

An employee was moving metal tubes onto a forklift when a tube began to slip out of his hand.  He attempted to pull his hand out of the way, and his finger got caught between two tubes. His left index fingertip was amputated.

On November 13, 2015, an employee was feeding a large-format print into the laminator.  The employee's fingers got caught between the two large rubber rollers.  The employee's left-hand ring fingertip was amputated, while the middle finger was lacerated and required stitches.
A Bobcat employee was loading steel into a punch press when multiple fingers got crushed and amputated in a pinch point.
An employee was changing a roller on a coding machine. His left hand made contact with the roller and the left index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was pulling tarp over the bed of a flatbed truck. As the employee dismounted the truck, the employee's wedding ring got caught on a truck bolt. The ring finger had to be surgically amputated at the first knuckle.

An employee was moving a board inside a trash truck hopper. The blade was moving at the time. The employee's left ring fingertip was amputated between the compactor blade and the side wall of the hopper.
An employee was adjusting a conveyor belt when his fingers got caught between the conveyor belt and a metal roller. The third and fourth fingertips on his left hand were amputated (no bone loss).
While pushing wood through a table-mounted, hand-held router, an employee's left-hand middle finger was cut by the router blade; the ring finger was also  amputated at the first knuckle.

On February 13, 2015, a temporary employee was doing pipe fitting work at the job site and lifted a compressor.  The compressor fell down and injured his left index finger. The finger was later amputated.
An employee lost his balance while using a table router on wood trim. His hand came in contact with the cutter head, partially amputating his right middle finger.

An employee lifted a rare earth magnet from a materials hopper. He handed the magnet to a second employee.  The second employee took the magnet and began to set the magnet down on an adjacent piece of equipment.  As the second employee set the magnet down, the magnet pulled itself to the piece of equipment that he was going to place it on. His left-hand ring finger was crushed between the magnet and the equipment and had to be surgically amputated at the first knuckle.
An employee was attempting to clear a jam in a blow molding machine that makes plastic bottles. The employee's right ring finger got caught in the machine and required medical amputation.

On November 14, 2015, an employee was loading tools and was folding a triangle tool that has steel cables attached to it. The cables had slack in them and when the employee folded them, the cable tightened up and amputated the employee's right pinky fingertip.

Employees were dismantling a scaffold and were handing down a piece of plywood, which was 4-feet by 6-feet, when it slipped from a coworker's hands and fell 50 feet. The plywood struck the injured employee in the left foot behind the steel-toe shoe. His left toes were amputated.

An employee was changing the force draft fan belt. He turned off the fan. Due to the inertia, the belt did not come to a complete stop and began to rotate. The employee's right index finger got caught between the belt and the pulley, and was amputated between the last joint and base of the nail. The machine was not guarded at the time of the incident.

He was making an adjustment to an extrusion machine puller, which allows the belt to go up and down, when his right middle finger got caught in the belt. His right middle fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
While attempting to clean a conveyor belt, an employee's finger was smashed in a gear box. The employee's fingertip was amputated. The conveyor was running at the time of the incident.

An employee was repairing the overhead bracket, which holds the overhead guard, on a customer-owned forklift.  The overhead guard fell and caught the employee's finger between it and the frame of the forklift. The employee's middle left-hand finger was amputated approximately 1/4" to 1/2" from the tip (middle of the fingernail).
An employee was cutting wood tack strips with a band saw and suffered a partial amputation of the left index finger.
An employee was changing out a die in a brake press and pinched a finger between the die and the bed of the machine amputating the fifth fingertip on the right hand.

The employee was trying to dislodge a stone that was stuck on the dump truck.  His right middle finger was stuck between the pin and the locking mechanism on the gate, amputating the tip of his finger.
An employee was emptying the hopper into a dumpster. The hopper shifted and the employee's left index finger was caught in the hopper's dump door amputating the fingertip.

An employee was exiting the rear door of the hospital. A gust of wind caused the door to smash his hand between two arms of the closer creating a pinch point. The employee lost the tip of his right middle finger.
An employee was putting her coat away in a closet that was a fire door. The employee started closing the door and caught her hand in the door. Her right pinky finger was amputated to the first joint.
An employee was loading and guiding tubing into the #1 forming head on the corrugator. As the tubing was loading his right hand got caught in the machine and crushed the middle finger.
An employee had the tip of the left index finger amputated by a 3" peek tube mold.
An employee suffered an avulsion of his left thumb that was later amputated in the hospital.
On November 18, 2015, an employee suffered a fingertip amputation while working on a part revolution punch press.

Two employees were installing the top wall plate and caulking the seams of a previously erected pre-manufactured wall.  One employee was in a man lift and the second employee was working from the ground.  The wall fell over as a result of a sudden wind gust.  The temporary supports holding the wall in place failed and the wall fell onto the man lift and struck both employees. One of the employees sustained two broken ankles and the other employee dislocated the right hip.  The pre-manufactured framed wall (structural insulated pane) measured approximately 18 feet in height by 120 feet in length.
An employee working the paunch table amputated part of his right thumb.
An employee was lifting a forklift attachment and smashed this thumb between the swivel hook and the forklift attachment resulting in the amputation of his right thumb tip.
An employee was repairing a barrel threading machine and amputated the left index fingertip when it became caught between the gun barrel and a clamp.
The tip of a bicycle mechanic's thumb was amputated while servicing the drive chain of a stationary cycle.

On November 19, 2015, an employee was using a hand held air blower to clean wood chips off a shaper table while the cutter head was running. The employee's hand made contact with the cutting head, amputating the right index finger and severely lacerating the right thumb.
An employee was using a stamping machine and suffered the amputation of the left frontal oblique, fourth digit.
An employee was cleaning wet materials from a dust auger and his left hand got caught inside the auger while in operation resulting in the amputation of the thumb tip.
A worker was cutting 8" steel pipe with a pipe cutting machine and got caught in the point of operation amputating the right index and middle fingertips.
An employee got her finger pinched in the conveyor on the packaging line resulting in the amputation of the left ring fingertip.

An employee was operating an angle line fabricator. The angle iron rolls in and it's measured and cut to length by the machine. The employee was adjusting the punch that cuts the angle iron with a wrench between cycles. The punch came down. The angle iron got stuck on the punch and retracted with the punch crushing the tip of the employee's left middle finger between the angle iron and the machine.

An employee was operating a dump truck and another employee was outside the truck attempting to shut the tailgate. The tailgate was stuck open and the employee was pulling on the tailgate trying to get it unstuck. As the employee pulled on the tailgate, the truck moved forward and the tailgate shut on the employee's hand resulting in amputation of the left middle fingertip.

On November 19, 2015, at about 8:00am two employees received electrical burns when they removed a grounding strap from 220Kv lines.  They were working from a personnel platform suspended by a crane on a barge in the San Francisco Bay.

An employee was inspecting a flat glass panel when the panel shifted and pinched the employee's left wrist and pinky finger between the glass panel and the machine's railing. The employee fell and amputated the left pinky finger and broke the left wrist and ankle.
On or about November 20, 2015, a clipper machine operator amputated the right middle fingertip while cutting bundles of veneer.
An employee was operating equipment identified as a paster and amputated the right thumb tip when it was caught in the machine while trying to remove a scrap of paper.
An employee suffered a left hand fingertip amputation when cleaning the hopper of a straw machine.

A maintenance mechanic was using a powered hand drill with a 4 foot long ready rod (attachment) to clean out a pipe that was clogged with powder. When he inserted the rod into the pipe, the rod caught his gloved left hand lacerating his fingers. Because of personal medical reasons, the employee opted to have the tip of his index finger surgically amputated.

Two employees were repairing a hub bearing.  The machine was locked/tagged out and secured.  The first employee attempted to line up the internal keyway slot by reaching in to feel the alignment. The second employee was manually tightening bolts to the hub adapter and when the external housing turned it amputated the tip of the first employee's right index finger.
An employee was cleaning a conveyor while standing on an I-beam approximately 8 feet high. The employee's foot was caught in the conveyor and his big toe was later medically amputated.
An employee was repairing the roof's exhaust and got an index finger caught in the motor's belt resulting in amputation.

An employee was unhooking the initial hook on a cattle's hind leg. While re-hooking it to another shackle, the cattle's leg dropped down. The slack was not removed from the shackle due to mud and manure. The hook went up, and the employee's right thumb got caught in the shackle, causing an initial avulsion that later required surgical amputation above the first knuckle.

An employee was using a band saw when something became caught in the blade. He attempted to push the item through when his left little finger got caught and was lacerated/amputated by the blade. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
An employee was painting a door and pinched a finger in the door hinge amputating the fingertip.
An employee was cleaning/unclogging the cyclone when his middle finger got caught in the machine. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated.

An employee and coworkers were removing a roller from a veneer dryer by hand. The roller slipped out of a coworker's hands, and the employee's finger was  trapped between the roller and the dryer. His left index finger was partially amputated.

An employee was repairing a slicer and was pushing on the pulley when the motor started. His finger got caught between the belt and pulley, amputating his right middle fingertip and requiring surgery.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while reaching into a machine that was actuated by another operator. The employee required reattachment surgery.

On 11/23/15, at about 2:30 a.m., an employee was operating a forklift to empty a hopper of garbage into a dumpster. He placed his hand on top of the fork while pushing up on the hopper tilt release lever. When the hopper tilted forward, the employee's finger was pinched between the top of the fork and the bottom of the dumpster. His left index fingertip was surgically amputated.
An employee was cutting billets using a band saw and amputated his right thumb up to 1/3 of the finger nail.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while the employee attempted to straighten a box in a vertical box conveyer system.
While attempting to clean a jet foam airlock, an employee's fingertips were struck and amputated by the spinning part ("squirrel cage") of the airlock.
An employee was operating a gunning machine to shotcrete a cupola. He contacted the flywheel and amputated his right-hand middle fingertip.

An employee was threading paper into the padded bag line machine. When the paper passed through the notcher section, the employee attempted to support the paper with his hand. The notcher fired and amputated his right ring fingertip. The notcher was not turned off at the time of the incident.

An employee was transferring wire cable from a spool to a cradle. His right-hand middle finger got caught between a washer and a bolt, amputating the distal third of his fingertip. He required reattachment surgery.

An employee was working the winder machine when the slitter blade failed to complete a cut on the paper. He attempted to complete the cut using a box knife when his right index finger got caught under the turning core. His fingertip was ultimately amputated.
An employee was changing a tool inside of a forging press and pinched a finger between the tool and the mold flange. The right index fingertip was amputated without bone loss.
The employee was driving a forklift and pinched their right hand on the warehouse rack resulting in an amputation injury to the right middle finger.

An employee was unloading equipment at a storage facility. A 2" x 6" x 20' steel bar rolled onto the employee's left-hand pinky finger, crushing it between the bar and trailer. The first digit of the finger was surgically amputated.
An employee was moving a strapper machine after making boxes. The machine amputated his left pinky fingertip when he moved it back into position.

An employee received a distal amputation of his left middle finger while transporting a cart loaded with scaffolding. The rolling cart shifted and the employee's hand was pinched between the cart handle and an I-beam.

The employee was sliding 1/4 inch by 14 feet long angle iron from the forks of a forklift onto the storage racks.  The employee pinched his right ring finger between the angle iron and the fork of the forklift.  The incident resulted in the amputation of the employee's right ring fingertip.
An employee was offloading a metal container (auto part dolly) onto a mobile cart when her left-hand ring finger got pinched between the two metal pieces. Her fingertip was amputated below the nail.
An employee's left ring finger was partially amputated while she was removing a valve from a manual valve tester.
An employee amputated her left pinky fingertip while cutting tomatoes during lunch preparation.
An employee suffered a partial amputation of the right middle finger.
An employee was threading paper into a slitter machine and contacted the slitter blade amputating the left index fingertip.
An employee was operating a saw and contacted the saw blade resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An operator was in the process of unclogging a machine when his left ring finger was caught and amputated by the equipment.
An employee crushed their left middle and index fingertips in a patty machine.

An employee was greasing a bearing on the air handler. The employee wiped off excess grease from the moving belt and the employee's finger was caught in the belt resulting in the amputation of the right index fingertip.

An employee was using a Sumner roust-a-bout to lift an I Beam.  The roust-a-bout lost balance and tipped over.  The employee tried to stop the I-Beam from falling.  The I-beam fell and landed on the employee's left pinky finger crushing it. The finger was amputated.
An employee's finger was caught in a rotating part. A finger on the right hand was amputated at the second digit by a physician.
A temporary employee was clearing a jam on a cotton swab machine and sustained a fingertip amputation to the left hand.
An employee amputated the tips of the right middle and ring fingers when a metal plate fell onto his fingers.

After loading a truck, an employee tried to close the door on the trailer. The trailer was moving away, and his finger got caught between the door and the condenser stand that straddles the dock, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee suffered a partial amputation of the left index finger while servicing/cleaning the sensing device on a paper sheeter machine.

An employee was calibrating a machine. As he turned around, he lost his balance and fell. He tried to catch himself by grabbing the machine, which had an exposed mixture arm on it.  The mixture arm was turning and caught the fingers on his right hand, amputating his index and ring fingertips.
An employee's right index finger was amputated while operating a press machine.
An employee was installing a part in a press machine when her leg hit the switch. Her left pinky fingertip got caught in the machine and was partially amputated.

While an employee was operating an automatic welding machine, the foot pedal of the machine was activated. His left thumb got crushed between the pedal of the welding machine, requiring amputation. He was wearing welding gloves at the time of the incident.
On or about December 03, 2015, an employee was lining up paper on the die cutter machine. The machine cycled, and the employee's finger got caught and was amputated between the machine rollers.
An employee was holding a shaft that was being knocked out when his finger got pinched between the shaft and the repair box. His right middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee was holding down product in a weld fixture with their right hand. The employee's right pinky fingertip was pinched in one of two pivot points and the tip was amputated.

An employee was evaluating a jam around the back of the cutter machine. His glove came into contact with a guarded belt and pulley, which caught his glove and pulled his right hand in. A section of his right index finger was amputated.

An employee was demonstrating the function of a sliding axle trailer to a coworker when the trailer drifted unexpectedly and caught the employee's finger in one of the adjustment holes. The employee's right index finger was amputated.
An employee was using a jib crane to pick up a return pig. When using the pendant to lift the pig, his finger got stuck between two chain links, amputating his fourth left-hand finger's first pad.
An employee was wearing gloves and sorting I beams with his hands.  One beam slid and rolled and caught his finger. The employee had half of his middle finger surgically removed.

An employee was manually feeding a plastic sheet through a hydraulic/pneumatic press set on manual mode. The press then cycled and caught his left thumb in the point of operation area, amputating his thumb tip.
While cutting vegetables with a knife, an employee sustained a left middle fingertip amputation.
