An employee was helping to remove a belt from a pulley attached to a fan used in the ginning process. While moving the belt manually, his finger got pinched between the belt and pulley, partially amputating his right pinky fingertip.
An employee's left thumb tip was amputated while she was cutting pork loin with a band saw.

An employee was operating a spindle machine. The process required 14 bolts, but the employee noticed that there was only 13 bolts. When she tried to put in the 14th bolt, moving parts came down and caught her left-hand pinky finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was working on a sample table, loading weights into the benefits inserts of a punch machine. She missed a weight in one of the inserts and shut the machine off to add the weight. The machine restarted and caught the employee's finger between the punch and the insert. Her left index finger was amputated.

An employee was getting ready to load two intermediate bulk containers. The two containers slammed against each other and caught the employee's finger between them. The left pinky fingernail tip was amputated.
An employee's right middle fingertip was amputated while he was cutting meat on a chuck saw.
An employee's right-hand little fingertip was amputated when a 2x4 piece of lumber dropped suddenly and smashed the employee's finger.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while servicing an air unit on the roof of a fast food restaurant.
An employee was trying to pop a load bearing out. He put both fingers into the area of the locking pin and then it came down and amputated the distal aspect of the right index and little fingers.

An employee was disconnecting a piece of flow iron from a pump. He was supporting the piece of pipe with his left hand and hitting it with his right hand when it suddenly disconnected. Due to the weight of the pipe, it dropped about 1 foot, catching his left ring finger between the iron and rear bumper of the pump and amputating the fingertip. He required surgery.
An employee was cleaning the pipes on the ice cream machine when his right index finger was amputated by the pipe's metal paddle. The machine was not locked out at the time.

An employee was loading a scrap wheel into a scrap bin while wearing double cotton gloves. The glove got caught on the edge of the wheel as he set it on the edge of the bin to be thrown in. As he let the wheel go into the bin, his right pinky got caught between the edge of the wheel and the edge of the bin, amputating his right pinky fingertip (without bone loss).
An employee was working on an agitator when one of the pieces of equipment shifted and crushed the employee's pinky finger. The finger had to be partially medically amputated.

An employee reached into a horizontal band saw as it was running to either insert or remove a block. The pipe clamp on the saw closed and pinched her finger between the clamp and the block, partially amputating her left index fingertip.

On or about December 04, 2015, a worker was working on a tie machine when a jam occurred. The worker called the injured employee for assistance. The injured employee disconnected the energy source, a pneumatic airline, and proceeded to clear the jam manually. As the employee tried to clear the jam, the machine's cutting knife was actuated, amputating the employee's right fingertip.

Employees were attempting to insert a section of U-adjuster shackle into a chain link using a sledge hammer. The injured employee was holding the shackle. As a coworker swung on the hammer, the injured employee's hand slipped and got struck by the hammer. His left index finger was partially amputated.
An employee was operating a rigid cable machine when his left hand got caught between a wire and a capstan sheave. While attempting to free his hand, he amputated his left middle and ring fingertips.
An employee was installing a curtain wall when his finger was pinched.
An employee's hand got caught between an unguarded conveyor chain and sprocket. The employee's thumb was amputated.
An employee was troubleshooting a 200KVA welder. The equipment inadvertently cycled and amputated two fingers to the first joint on the employee's right hand.

An employee was helping another employee clear out a 2 x 4 piece of board on a conveyor belt.  The employee's left hand struck the metal frame of the conveyor belt resulting in the amputation of his left index fingertip.
An employee was operating a power press when his left pinky got pinched and amputated by a steel coil.
An employee was moving 55 gallon drums and smashed a finger between a drum and the barrel picker. The fingertip was amputated below the thumb nail.
An employee's right ring fingertip was amputated while using a band saw to repair a tractor.
An employee was drilling a metal bracket onto a machine and was struck by the bracket, suffering an eye injury.
An employee's ring fingertip was amputated when the hinge on a used electrical panel failed, allowing the lid to slam down on his finger.

An employee was operating a Milwaukee drill press when his glove was caught in the drill bit resulting in the amputation of the right index finger. The drill bit was not guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was building a part when his finger got caught and crushed between an angle iron and sheet steel. The end of the finger had to be medically amputated.
An employee was repairing a trailing arm bushing and pinched his finger between the trailing arm and a tool. The medical report later classified it as an oblique amputation.
An employee operating a steel bending machine received a laceration that resulted in the partial amputation of his right pinky finger
An employee's left middle fingertip was amputated while clearing a jam on the clip rail machine.
An employee was assembling calendar pages using a commercial paper cutter when the machine cut the employee's left-hand middle and ring fingers. The fingers were amputated.
A line cook amputated the tip of his left thumb while chopping broccolini.
An employee was cleaning the end of an auger when his left middle fingertip was amputated. The auger was not shut off at the time of the incident.
An employee was cleaning out bottles that were jammed in the filling machine. Another employee cycled the machine amputating the employee's middle fingertip.
Two employees were fusing two sections of polyline. When the fusing device was activated, the area became engulfed in flames. Both employees were hospitalized with burns to the face and hands.

An employee was operating a reach truck while moving a pallet with product form one location to another. He lost control of the forklift and struck a stack of pallets with product, causing him to lose his balance and fall. His foot got caught, severely lacerating and crushing his left big toe and second toe. He was hospitalized, and the second toe was amputated.
An employee was cutting pieces of cardboard with a band saw and amputated the right middle finger above the first knuckle.

An employee attempted to clean rice bran from the trunk of a whitening machine. His right hand contacted a rotating blade, amputating 1 inch of his middle finger. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
On December 9, 2015, at approximately 0720 hrs., an employee was building a hose using a binding clamp tool when the tool broke and a piece struck his left eye.

On December 9, 2015, an employee was using a table saw to cut lumber. As he was making the cut, the board started to rise and kick back. He attempted to control the kickback by pushing down and forward into the saw. His hand was on the trailing end of the board as he pushed, and his right ring finger's first digit was amputated by the saw blade.
An employee was operating a hopper when his right index fingertip was pinched  between the hopper and the frame and amputated.
An employee's hand was smashed between a dressing wheel and the edge of a table during grinding work. His left ring fingertip was amputated.
An employee was holding forklift forks in the upright position when a fork fell and crushed the employee's finger. One-third of the employee's finger was amputated at the hospital.
On 12/9/2015, at 12:15 a.m., an employee was cleaning a conveyor belt when his left hand got caught under the belt. His left ring finger was amputated just above the lowest/first knuckle.
An employee was using a wood joiner to finish the edge on a piece of wood. When the employee attempted to brush away dust with his gloved hand, the blade amputated his right index fingertip.

An employee was helping a second employee remove bolts from a steel plate attached to an axel fixture. One employee was using an air wrench to loosen bolts while the second employee was using a wrench to hold onto the bolt. The first employee loosened the bolt, and the plate slid down and struck the second employee's right index finger, amputating the tip.
An employee's right hand was punctured when it was struck by the hydraulic stop while pulling block from a machine.
An employee amputated the their left index fingertip while loading a weld fixture into a weld robot cell.
An employee was cutting brick using an automated saw when his finger went under the saw blade. His right index finger was amputated below the fingernail.

An employee was troubleshooting an encapsulation machine and bypassed the safety interlock. The employee's hand was caught in moving parts while troubleshooting resulting in the partial amputation of the left middle finger from the tip to the second joint.
On December 10, 2015, an employee amputated the right index finger between the second and third knuckle while clearing a jam at the bacon bellies paper cutter.
An employee's hand got caught in a machine press, amputating the right index finger.

On December 10, 2015, at approximately 3:00 PM, an employee was processing/cutting meat in the production room with a meat saw. The employee's hand slipped off and his right index fingertip was amputated.
An employee suffered a finger amputation (first digit on her left hand index finger) while operating a drill press/reamer. The employee was wearing cotton gloves at the time of the incident.

An employee was moving a suspended heat exchanger unit during the manufacturing process. The part that was to be placed under the heat exchanger unit (roll of steel mesh) fell on top of the employee's hands resulting in a partial amputation of the right index fingertip above the knuckle.

An employee was moving a two-door storage cabinet. As the cabinet was being lowered on its side, the door closest to the employee swung open and caught his index fingertip in the hinge, partially amputating his fingertip.
An employee was working on a machine and smashed three fingers inside the machine resulting in the amputation of the left ring fingertip.
On December 11, 2015, at approximately 6:20pm, an employee amputated the left middle fingertip while operating the trimmer.

An employee was guiding an eight foot piece of aluminum railing through the 3-axis angle machine when his glove got caught on the rollers that pulls in the aluminum piece crushing his hand. His left ring finger was amputated at the first joint.
An employee operating the KM16 5 head saw suffered a partial amputation of his right foot.
While moving a cart off the line, the rack swung back and pinched the tip of the employee's right hand middle finger between the rack and the rolling cart resulting in amputation.
An employee was uncoiling chain and got their fingers caught between the sprocket and chain resulting in the amputation of the right index and middle fingers.
An employee suffered the amputation of the left index fingertip while troubleshooting a packaging machine.

An employee was working in the graphite mixing department. The mixing process creates one pound graphite mix balls. Once the mixing process was completed, the employee dumped the contents of the mixer into a stainless steel box. One of the mix balls landed on the edge of the stainless steel box. The employee reached for the mix ball to throw it into the box. As the employee reached for the mix ball, he lost his balance and pinched his finger between the mix ball and the edge of the stainless steel box.  The employee suffered the amputation of the left middle fingertip as a result of the incident.
An employee amputated her right middle fingertip while operating the card spinning machine.
An employee amputated the left ring fingertip when it was caught in a roller inside the unguarded housing of a pump.
While moving packages on a load chute, an employee's finger got caught between the metal release mechanism, amputating the right middle fingertip.
On December 13, 2015, a portable rack fell on an employee's left-hand little finger as the employee attempted to move it, amputating the fingertip.
An employee amputated three fingers on his left hand while working with a plate roller machine in the Sheet Metal Department.

An employee was working independently underneath a trailer in the yard to repair a lift axle that was jammed. While the axle was rising slowly, he held onto the safety chain. When the arm had enough pressure to release itself from under the axle where it was jammed, the axle shot up, tightening the chain to the axle and amputating three of his right-hand fingers.
An employee was slicing a tomato near a 90-degree belt on a conveyor line when her hand got caught underneath the belt. Her left pinky finger was amputated below the nailbed.
An employee was unloading a palette or shipping crate with a coworker. The coworker dropped the crate and it struck the injured employee's finger. His middle finger was medically amputated.
While attempting to straighten the paper he was feeding into the stacker hopper of a machine, an employee's right hand got caught in the rollers, crushing his fingers.
An employee's finger was amputated while operating a cookie wrapping machine.
An employee was moving a breader into position for a production run when the breader fell off the tracks and the hopper created a pinch point that amputated the employee's left pinky fingertip.

An employee was making sand cores on a core machine when the gas plate cracked. While he was adjusting the ram to align the gas plate, the ram moved downward and contacted his foot, amputating his fourth toe.
An employee amputated his right hand while feeding lumber into a notcher machine. The machine was unguarded at the time.
An employee's hand got caught between a rotating table and a stationary table. Her right index fingertip was amputated.
An employee amputated the left ring finger while setting up a machine.

Four employees were taken to the hospital for burns on their face and hands when a machine blew out hot polyphenylene sulfide (chemical). The chemical is used to manufacturer insulator pipes.   The employees were trouble shooting the extruder when they were burned.  Two employees were hospitalized.

An employee was performing preventative maintenance on piece of conveyor. He reached across and lifted up on the belt.  His back elbow crossed the photo eye, activating the belt.  His finger was caught between the end of the conveyor and the end guard.  When he pulled his hand back, he degloved the right ring finger resulting in medical amputation.
An employee was working on the flap gates of a crate. A flap came down and amputated the right ring fingertip.
An employee crushed a finger between two scrap iron parts on a tray resulting in amputation at the hospital.

Two employees were working from an extension ladder that was placed on the 2nd tier of a scaffold. The scaffold and ladder collapsed resulting in both employees falling approximately 30 feet.  Both employees were hospitalized.

An employee lifted a hatch door by hand and was attempting place the door over the hatch opening when it slipped from his hands and his right ring finger was pinched between the hatch door and the hatch opening.  The right ring finger was amputated.
An employee was attempting to clear a jam at the lumber mill and caught his finger between a board and a roller resulting in the amputation of the left index fingertip.
An employee was cutting a carrot with a knife and amputated the tip of his left thumb.
An employee's ring finger was amputated on or about 12/16/15 at approximately 3:45pm.
An employee was making patties using a Patty-O-Matic patty forming machine and amputated the tips of the left ring and middle fingers.
An employee was operating a stacker. While trying to clear a jam, their right thumb was crushed in the stacker.
An employee was operating the bone cannon machine and amputated part of the right index finger.
On December 17, 2015, an employee was operating the table saw and amputated the top segment of the left thumb.
On or about December 17, 2015, an employee amputated the left middle finger at the first joint when the finger was caught between the 14" X 36" log and the conveyor belt.
A Line Mechanic was adjusting the film on a machine that makes plastic bags. The fingers of his left hand were pulled into the rollers resulting in the amputation of the left middle finger.
An employee was cutting meat and sliced their left thumb on the saw blade. A partial amputation was required to treat the wound.
An employee was using a hand-held blower to clean when his thumb was partially amputated by the impeller on the bottom of the equipment. The impeller was unguarded at the time.

The employee was working with another employee to set up a new operator valve system. While observing the operation of the valve system, one of the employees placed his hand into the opening of the plates and the plates closed onto his fingers.  The employee's index and middle fingers were amputated. There was no guard on the machine at the time.
An employee's right ring finger was amputated while working on a machine.

The employee was unloading a pallet to make a box using the mechanical rollback storage rack. The pallet got stuck and the employee attempted to dislodge the pallet with a rod/pole.  The employee lost his footing and fell. The employee's left pinky finger was smashed by the falling pallet.
An employee was cleaning the injector lid. The lid came down on top of the employee's hand amputating the left index finger.

On 12/18/15 at approximately 9:30am, two employees were offloading pre-cast concrete stairs off of a truck with a link belt crane at a new commercial construction project. As they unloaded the third piece, one of the employees was using both hands to guide the piece to the ground. The suspended stair came into contact with a stair on the ground. As the pieces came together, the employee's left middle finger was pinched between the concrete stairs. A partial fingertip amputation may have occurred.

An employee was checking the wire on strander machine #265. The wire was stranding onto a bobbin and somehow his finger got under the wire. The tip of his left middle finger was amputated to the first joint.
An employee was changing an air filter in the cabin of an aircraft.  The employee cleaned dust off the fan blades and amputated the left hand ring and middle fingertips on the fan blades.
An employee operating a 20 inch masonry saw to cut cinder block amputated his left thumb when the saw kicked back.
An employee was helping another employee adjust the perforator machine. As the employee ran product through the machine, their left pinky finger was amputated. The guard was not in place at the time.
An employee was pushing a food cart and caught her right pinky finger between the corner of the car and the wall resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was packing donuts when a break in the line occurred. The employee tried to correct the problem and amputated the right middle fingertip.

A worker was cleaning the chain of a tenter frame machine. A second worker was jogging the machine for the first worker. The first worker's right hand was caught in the machine resulting in the amputation of the index fingertip.

The employee reached over a safeguard to push a coil towards the wrapping machine.  While pushing, he triggered the proximity switch for the seal bar to come down.  The seal bar came down on top of his hand, which was between the seal bar and the coil.  The safety device, which makes the seal bar retract when it makes contact with an object, failed.  The seal bar remained in the lowered position.  The employee tried to pull his left hand out of the equipment resulting in the amputation of the middle fingertip.
On or about December 22, 2015, an employee amputated a fingertip while fixing a conveyor.
A chipper operator was using an air hose to clean the shaker screen. The employee's left thumb got caught in the belt and pulley drive amputating it to the first knuckle.
On December 21, 2015 at 1:30am an employee was operating the nut welder and amputated her right index finger.

An employee was setting the axle into the axle bracket. The employee used his hands to unjam the axle from the axle bracket. When the axle came free, the employee's middle fingertip was amputated between the axle and the axle bracket.
A worker suffered a thumb tip amputation while cleaning a batch mixer.

An employee was working in Department 24 at the "B" line boxing station.  Welding rods were moving on the indexing cooling conveyor that carries them from the furnace.  The employee was assisting the movement of the rods along the conveyor with his left hand when his right thumb was caught in a pinch point in the conveyor resulting in a fingertip amputation.

The employee was opening the gate to load cows into the holding areas of the facility. The employee was closing the gate when a cow kicked the gate closed  catching the employee's finger in a pinch point. The employee's left index finger was amputated.
An employee lost more than half of his right index finger and severed another finger while cleaning the breader machine while it was cycling.
On or about 12/22/2015, an employee's fingertip was amputated when the lift cart he was operating caught his finger between a shelf and the cart.

An employee was moving a pedestal fan and during movement the cage flexed and the employee's finger contacted the blade amputating a portion of the finger. Amputation occurred on the fleshy part of the finger opposite the nail bed with no bone loss.
An employee was operating the auto-bagger machine when her left middle finger entered the point of operation, amputating her fingertip.
An employee was seriously injured when a vehicle slipped off of an automotive lift while the employee was working underneath it.
An employee operating an electric hand cart struck a concrete wall catching his right ring finger between the cart handle and the wall resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee working on a blow mold machine suffered a fingertip amputation.

An employee was using the manually operated (non-powered) plate bender to bend a plate when a part of the plate bender that he was holding (~20 inches long) slipped out of his hand and fell onto his left index finger causing a fingertip amputation.
An employee was attempting to replace a belt on a conveyor system and suffered a partial amputation to the left thumb.
An iron worker was installing a skillet valve. The employee's right hand became lodged between two pipes near the valve and he suffered a partial amputation of his right thumb.

An employee was loading pallets onto a truck. The pallet hooks shifted and pinched the employee's finger between the pallet and the hook resulting in a partial amputation of the right middle fingertip.

A temporary employee was loading a truck full of pipes. The load became unstable and a pipe rolled off of the truck and onto the temporary worker's legs.  The worker was hospitalized and his left foot was amputated.

A band saw was locked out and the blade was replaced. Then the employee unlocked it, turned it on, and reached for the hose (to wash it down) with his left hand and his right index finger came in contact with the blade and was amputated.
An employee was operating the hamburger pattie making machine and amputated the tips of the left hand middle and ring fingers with no bone loss. The machine was unguarded at the time.

On or about December 26, 2015, at 12:40 pm and employee was pushing a two-yard trailer can dumpster up to the back of the garbage truck when the front caster wheel of the dumpster seized up and twisted sideways pitching the dumpster forward and pinching the tip of the his right ring finger between the dumpster's trunnion bar and the truck.  He was transported to the hospital where the tip of his right ring finger was amputated and repaired.
The employee was lowering a dumpster to the ground when the metal dumpster lid closed on his finger resulting in the amputation of the middle fingertip.
A fingertip on the employee's left hand was amputated while operating an embroidery machine.  The employee's finger was caught between a bar on the machine and the clamp.
An employee was moving and pulling packages from the conveyor when his right hand was caught in the conveyor. His right ring fingertip was degloved.
An employee was changing a tire on a forklift. The tire exploded injuring the employee's right hand and resulting in the medical amputation of the right index finger.
While moving a strainer onto a rack for cleaning, the rack slipped and pinched the employee's finger between the rack and the strainer weighing approximately 40 lbs. The fingertip was amputated.
An employee had three fingers on the right hand crushed when the glove that the employee was wearing got caught in a gear.  Part of one finger had to be surgically amputated.

An operator was packing out powders from the bottom spout on a ribbon blender.  The gate valve on the spout became clogged.  The employee reached into the spout while the blender was running resulting in the amputation of their left middle, ring and index fingers.

An employee was troubleshooting the box taping machine. The employee's hand was caught in the chain drive resulting in the amputation of the left thumb's distal joint. The machine was not locked out at the time.

Maintenance employees were working on the leg quarter conveyor belt.  They made and placed a steel bracket/guide above a chain like belt where it made a 20-30 degree bend around a corner to prevent the belt from popping off.  While the belt was running, the injured employee saw there was a rough edge on top of the bracket/guide, so the employee reached to feel the top of the bracket/guide and his hand was pinched between the belt and the guide.  His left thumb was amputated above the knuckle.
An employee was cutting cores with a radial chop saw and amputated the tips of the left index and middle fingers.

An employee was placing a part into a sizing press. While the employee's hand was in the point of operation, the tooling engaged and pinched the employee's right index finger between the tool and die. The employee suffered an amputation of the right index finger as a result of the incident. The light curtains installed on the press were bypassed at the time of the incident.
A mechanic was repairing a heater in a Bobcat skid steer loader. The employee was in the cab and the door closed on the employee's finger removing a piece of tissue from the left ring finger.
An employee amputated the right index fingertip while operating a hydraulic press brake.
Employee A was filling a cardboard baler when Employee B turned on the baler.  The hydraulic drive door caught employee A's left arm and amputated it below the elbow.

An employee was unjamming a rolling piece of equipment. When it became free it smashed his finger between the rolling equipment and another piece of equipment. The employee went to the hospital and 3/4 of the right hand ring fingertip was amputated.

On or about December 30, 2015, the employee was working on the plastic extruder on the production floor. The employee's right index finger was amputated after being caught in the machine while flushing the extruder. The guard was not in place at the time.

An employee placed a sheet metal pipe for an HVAC duct into a roll former.  His left index finger was caught between the sheet metal pipe and the die when the roller's foot pedal was actuated. The employee's left index fingertip was partially amputated.
An employee was pulling a V-belt. The motor engaged and his right ring and pinky fingers were amputated.

On or about December 30, 2015, an employee's finger was caught between the die and the die bed as the employee was rotating the die in a brake press.  The right middle finger was pinched, removing the flesh part of the finger.
An employee was working the foot popper machine on the kill floor and amputated a fingertip on the left hand.
An employee was operating a fork truck and emptying a trash container. His hand was smashed and part of a finger was amputated.
An employee smashed his finger at a job site while helping to hook up a job trailer to a pickup.
An employee was cleaning on top of the picker when he closed the door on his finger.  The middle ring fingertip was removed.
An employee cut his fingertip while cutting meat with a knife.
On or about January 1, 2016, an employee's left index finger was partially amputated when the employee attempted to clear some stray tablets from the packaging line.
While trying to get a piece of lint out of a lint cleaner, an employee amputated the last digits on the right pinky, ring, and middle fingers.
An employee was pumping water into a trailer piping system when his finger contacted the plunger, amputating his fingertip.
A large portion of an employee's hand was amputated in a grain auger when a coworker bumped or jogged the auger while the employee was cleaning it out.

An employee was flicking chicken material off of his hands when his right index finger got caught between a gap in a cone and a chain link on a track. When he pulled his hand back, his right index fingertip was partially amputated.

An employee was moving a large air compressor that was in front of the metal recycle bin behind the store. The air compressor moved faster than anticipated and smashed the employee's left ring finger between the compressor and recycle bin. The finger was surgically amputated.
An employee was operating a press welder when two of his fingers got caught in the press. His right-hand index and middle fingers were amputated at the first joint.

An employee slipped and fell while cleaning the batter conveyor with a green scrubbing pad. His right index finger got caught in and was partially amputated by a sprocket on the conveyor belt drive train.

On 1/5/2016, at approximately 7:30 p.m., an employee was rinsing out a pump as part of the changeover process. The pump is left on while this is being done. The pump got jammed with sprinkles, so the employee attempted to clear it. His right index fingertip was amputated down to the first knuckle.
An employee was operating the wire-forming machine when the wire got hung up on the end of the machine. The employee pushed the wire to the machine's form, which amputated his right index fingertip.

An employee was de-rimming a tire using a tire-mounting machine. While he was pushing the bead breaker bar, his hand slipped and got caught between the rim and the breaker bar, amputating his right ring fingertip.

An employee was preparing to conduct preventative maintenance activities on an HVAC unit on the roof of the building. He took the front panel off the unit. He slipped/lost his footing, causing his hand to enter the unit and get caught in the desiccant belt wheel.  His left index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was cleaning a dough sheeter when the employee's hand got caught between the in-running nip point of two rolling drums on the machine. The employee's hand was crushed and a fingertip was amputated.

On January 6, 2016, an employee was operating a cold header machine when a mobile welding cart became entangled with the coil wire being fed into the machine. The employee accidentally grabbed the wire, which began to advance in speed, and the employee's hand was pulled into the draw box. The employee's right ring finger was amputated.

An employee was operating the can draw press when he noticed that the transfer had malfunctioned. While he was adjusting the trigger eye, his hand was on the equipment. The machine cycled after he made the adjustment, pinching his hand between the machine and the moving press transfer. His right middle fingertip was amputated.

On 01/06/2015, an employee was manually feeding a work piece into a tabletop-mounted router to remove material/shape the edges of the triangular shaped work piece, which was 5-inches long by 2-inches tall. The work piece momentarily became stuck on debris that surrounded the router bit and then unexpectedly moved toward the bit, which caused the employee's right thumb/hand to go beneath the machine guard. The router bit partially amputated the employee's right thumb, removing the skin on the thumb tip.

An employee was cleaning wheat out of a grain elevator leg, which had filled with wheat and prevented the belt/elevator from moving. The belt was not locked out at the time. A coworker on the floor above was instructed to start the belt to see if it would move while the employee was still clearing wheat. The belt started, and his hand got caught between a bucket and the metal housing of the leg, amputating his hand a few inches above the wrist.
An employee's glove got caught in a metal lathe, amputating the index, middle, ring, and pinky fingers of the right hand.

While attempting to clean a caser machine at Nissin Foods, an employee's thumb got caught in the conveyor drive chain and sprocket. The employee's left thumb was partially amputated. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.
An employee's left-hand pinky, ring, and middle fingers were amputated while he was cutting product on a band saw. He was hospitalized and had surgery.
Two employees using a propane torch to loosen hardened asphalt were hospitalized when a flash flame caused severe burns to their arms and faces.
An employee's left pinky finger was amputated.
An employee was lifting a section of metal roller conveyor when it fell on his left pinky finger, amputating the fingertip.
Finger amputation.
While shoveling sand from a sand silo, two employees were burned when a flash fire/explosion occurred. They were hospitalized with face and hand burns.

An employee 
was doing maintenance on a piece of equipment that was shut down. He grabbed the motor's damper/pulley belt and pulled the belt toward himself. This caused the damper/pulley to rotate, pinning his right-hand thumb between the damper/pulley and the belt. As a result, the top part of his right-hand thumb (approximately 1/8" to 3/16") was amputated.

While attempting to unclog a dust collection bin's rotary valve, an employee's fingers got caught in the flap wheel of the valve. His three left-hand middle fingers were severed above the second knuckle.

An employee was maneuvering a fifth wheel plate onto the bucket of a front-end loader.  The employee and a coworker lost control of the plate, which fell flat.  As it fell, the employee's right middle finger got pinned between the top of the front-end loader bucket and the fifth wheel plate, amputating the tip.

Two employees working from a scissor lift were removing overhead air conditioning duct work at approximately 19 feet in height. When the employees cut the straps that were holding the duct work in place, it swung down and hit the scissor lift, causing it to turn over. The first employee sustained a fractured vertebra and shattered right knee. The second employee suffered a fractured left femur.
Two employees were repairing the Bambury machine and were exposed to carbon dust.
On January 8, 2016, an employee amputated two fingers while operating a table saw to rip lumber.
An employee's fingertips got caught while he was trying to put a chain on a sprocket on a belt conveyor. His right ring and pinky fingertips were amputated.
An employee was trying to remove a metal piece from the punch/iron-work machine when the machine cycled and amputated his left index fingertip.
While bagging product on the packing line, an employee attempted to remove debris from the bagger. The employee's thumb got caught in a roller, amputating the tip.

An employee was preparing to change the tire on an electric pallet jack. A hydraulic jack was used to lift the pallet jack while a jack stand was placed into position. The jack slipped, causing it to fall and injure the employee's left pinky finger. His finger had be surgically treated and partially amputated due to tissue damage.

An employee was trying to determine why an automatic gate was stopping and functioning incorrectly. While attempting to open the gate, the employee's left ring finger got caught inside the gate opening and was partially amputated.

An employee was using a pneumatic strapping tensioner to form a steel coil band around sheets of steel.  When he was repositioning his hand, he grabbed the side of the handle and hit the crimp mechanism. The crimp mechanism clamped down on his left-hand index finger, amputating the finger from the nail to the first joint.

An outside individual entered the facility through the donation door and attacked two employees with a machete and a knife. Both employees were hospitalized and one employee may have suffered an amputation.

An employee was attempting to remove aluminum product that had jammed a conveyor when the conveyor activated, catching his thumb in the chain that makes it move. He was hospitalized with a broken right arm, wrist, and middle finger, and his right thumb was partially amputated.

An employee was operating a shear line to fabricate steel rebar when the rollers on the dump table stopped working. While attempting to diagnose the problem, his left glove was caught in the in-running nip point of the rollers' belt and pulley, amputating his left pinky fingertip.
An employee was troubleshooting the clutch on a press when the press began running, amputating his right-hand ring fingertip.

An employee was running a machine that shakes raw material and fluffs up fiberglass so that it can be processed. The employee heard a sound and attempted to inspect the inside of the machine. The machine's rotating drum partially amputated his right index finger.
An employee was cleaning and performing light maintenance on a bindery when his right index finger got caught in a chain and sprocket, amputating the fingertip.
An employee's right ring finger got caught between furniture and a template press during T-molding operations. The employee's fingernail was amputated.
A steel coil was being flipped while an employee was standing behind the machine. The steel coil came off the machine, hitting and amputating the employee's finger.

An employee was removing a stop from the rollers on a conveyor system, which had been put in place to keep the 55-gallon drums of grease from rolling. A coworker started moving the drum while the employee's finger was still near where the stop was removed. His finger was smashed and amputated between the drum and the metal rollers.

On January 13, 2016, at 4:40 a.m., an employee was working on a press. At the time, one sensor was not in all the way. She had her hand on one of the hand controls while she made the adjustment with the other hand. Her finger was crushed in the process.
An employee's gloved hand got caught and pulled into a wood-working machine, amputating several fingers.
An employee was installing a left port wing panel on an aircraft when his left index fingertip was amputated between the panel and the body of the aircraft wing.

On January 13, 2016, at approximately 10:00 a.m., an employee was using a compound miter saw to cut a board when the plastic guard on the saw shattered, and the guide slammed down and amputated the employee's left-hand ring finger and middle fingertip.

An employee was unbolting screws that secured a steel flange to a collar support at the end of a hydraulic cylinder. After a coworker separated the collar from the flange using a pry bar, the 200- to 300-pound flange fell and crushed the employee's little finger.

An employee was checking the priming mix in the priming machine. When he opened the blast door to the machine, the cable supporting the counter balance for the door broke, causing the door to slam onto and amputate his left middle fingertip.
An employee was feeding paper through a web press roller when his left ring finger got caught between the rollers, amputating his fingertip.
An employee suffered a partial left fingertip amputation while trying to clear a jam in a grinder.

On 1/13/16, at 8:30 a.m., an employee was running a manual assembly press with two hand controls installed. While the employee's hand was in the point of operation, the press activated and pinched the employee's left index finger, amputating the tip.
An employee amputated the middle and ring fingers of his right hand while operating a mixing machine.
An employee's fingers were caught in a safe door when a coworker closed it on the employee's hand.

An employee was using a pneumatic jack to raise up a tractor truck. Once it was raised, and while he was attempting to place the jack stand under the leaf spring, the truck slipped off the jack.  The truck trapped the employee's right hand between the leaf spring and the jack stand, crushing and amputating his right index finger.
On January 14, 2016, an employee was cutting a recycled paper insulation board using a table saw. His right hand came into contact with the blade, amputating his pinky finger.
An employee was cutting a piece of wood with a table saw when two of his left-hand fingers were amputated.
An employee was manually pulling down the gate on a cardboard baler when the gate crushed the employee's left index fingertip.
An employee was operating the mold machine and amputated his right thumb.
On Friday, January 15, 2016, an employee was operating a carding machine when his fingers were drawn into the equipment. Four fingers on his right hand were amputated.
An employee amputated a left hand fingertip while removing a rock from the corn flaking machine.
An employee amputated two fingers when his hand contacted a running vertical band saw while he attempted to remove the ribs from the spine of a cattle rib set.

An employee was placing the steel roof and ridge cap in place on a barn when he slipped and fell. He reached out and grabbed onto a piece of steel that lacerated four fingers and amputated his pinky fingertip.
An employee was re-threading a paper machine. When he attempted to grab paper, his right hand was pulled in and amputated.
An employee amputated the left ring fingertip while operating a deboning machine.
An employee amputated the tip of his left index finger while working with the winder machine.

The employee was attempting to line up the holes of the heat exchanger with the holes in the heat exchanger support structure to reinstall the bolts that hold it together. The heat exchanger moved and caught his left thumb in a pinch point resulting in a partial amputation.
An employee was operating a tenderizer machine and amputated the left index fingertip while removing a jam.

The employee was winding a winch cable. He was guiding the cable with his left hand when, by mistake, he pressed the activation pedal and his left middle finger got caught in the winch cable resulting in amputation above the first joint.
An employee was operating a welder to assemble underbody automobile parts and amputated the tip of the left thumb.

Two employees were observing the transfer of solvent when an explosion occurred.  As a result of the explosion, solvent from the truck was released onto the employees. One of the employees also suffered a ruptured eardrum.

An employee was operating an industrial truck to move materials that were frozen to the ground. When the materials broke free, they struck and injured another employee that was on break sitting at a picnic table. The employee was pinned between the table and a concrete wall suffering broken ribs and a punctured diaphragm.  

A second incident occurred on Jan. 19, 2016. An employee was exposed to carbon monoxide as it was pulled in and accidentally vented through an electrical panel due to a faulty heater unit. The employee was hospitalized and treated.

Note to user: This record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to OSHA by the employer.  These events are captured as one report.
An employee was operating a meat saw and amputated the right index fingertip.
An employee amputated the tip of his right hand ring finger while clearing a jam in the black cocoa line.
An employee amputated the right middle fingertip while using the die machine.

The employee was working with a crew repositioning a large rotor at a power plant. The employees were rotating the rotor 90 degrees. After rotating, the rotor stopped, then rolled back onto his hand resulting in a pinkie finger amputation.

The employee was helping another subcontractor unjam the lock on the dump truck's gate. The employee put his hand on the latch and when it became operational, the lock struck his fingers and amputated the right pinky and ring fingertips.

On January 18, 2016, an employee's finger got caught in the cross auger (screw type auger) while clearing a product jam. The employee initially received an avulsion injury to the right ring finger. The finger was later surgically amputated.
An employee was cutting meat on a band saw and amputated a middle fingertip.
An employee sustained a partial amputation of his left thumb while sanding a part using a hand held disc sander.  The part grabbed and pulled his thumb into the disc causing the amputation.
An employee was cleaning an auger and replacing a plug when the flight of the auger amputated 1/4 of the left middle finger.
An employee was loading boats onto trailers. The employee was moving a large boat and his left hand was caught between two boats resulting in the amputation of the index and middle fingertips.
An employee was relocating a conveyor belt when it shifted in the wrong direction and caught his pinky finger resulting in amputation at the first knuckle.
While pulling on some belts to unchoke the lint cleaner, an employee got his ring finger caught in the belts resulting in a fingertip amputation.
A piece of dough got stuck in the bagel maker machine. The employee tried to remove the stuck piece of dough and got his finger caught in the machine resulting in a partial amputation.
An employee was transporting a battery with a hoist. The employee's left ring finger was caught between the battery and the battery cage resulting in the amputation of the left ring fingertip.

An employee was attempting to repair a carrier truck. When checking the slippage on the alternator belt, the system started and pulled the employee's right thumb through the pulley resulting in amputation of the right thumb tip at the hospital.
An employee was operating a bandsaw. He slipped on a floor mat, fell forward and his right thumb made contact with the saw blade resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was hanging a horsehead on a pump jack. As the employee swung the horsehead into place and reached up to grab the weight, the weight was released. The employee's finger got caught between metal, and the fingertip was surgically amputated.

An employee was working on a folder line. The folder line has two rotating cylinders that apply a stamp. The employee's right hand was caught between two running cylinders resulting in the amputation of the middle, ring and pinky fingertips.
An employee was cleaning the seasoning box. The left index finger was caught in the swirl and amputated.
An employee lacerated a finger when it was caught in a press brake.
An employee got his left thumb caught in a pneumatic clamp which resulted in a partial amputation.
An employee was moving rollers into a truck trailer. A finger was caught in a roller and amputated.
An employee was cutting pork chops using a meat saw when the bone rolled resulting in the amputation (with no bone loss) of his right thumb tip.

A two-man team was adjusting an exposed metal stud wall at a new construction site. Another employee in an aerial lift located on one side of the exposed metal stud wall was on his way back down to ground level and hit a piece of electrical conduit. Upon hitting the piece of conduit, the conduit nudged the exposed metal stud wall and moved the wall. When the wall moved it amputated the left ring finger of an employee who was at ground level and on the other side of the exposed metal wall.
An employee was using a jig saw to cut fabric and cut his left index finger.
An employee was running in the production area, slipped, and struck their right upper arm against a thin 3 inch piece of metal on the side of the conveyor resulting in a laceration.
An employee was cleaning under the pasta pre-dryer and an unguarded fan amputated one finger and injured two other fingers.
An employee was removing pins from the fender of an M88 A-2.  His finger was caught in the pin hole and the fingertip was amputated when the door closed.

On or about January 21, 2016, an employee was installing a fixture onto a machine. As the employee attempted to adjust a locking pin that was not in place, a transfer arm moved and amputated the employee's left small finger.
An employee was moving a bundle of I-beams on a conveyor when the employee's finger was pinched and amputated under a bundle.
While an employee was working on a band saw, the saw grabbed the employee's glove and pulled the left hand into a pinch point, amputating the index and middle fingertips.

On January 21, 2016, a maintenance employee was troubleshooting the heat seal machine when it activated while the employee's hand was in a pinch point. The employee's right little finger was partially amputated.
An employee was cutting wood on a table saw when the saw blade amputated his middle fingertip.

A maintenance employee was rebuilding a valve, using air pressure to compress and seat a spring into place. The air pressure came off and the valve spring released. The employee's left-hand fingers were pinched between the spring and valve housing port, partially amputating a fingertip.
An employee was troubleshooting a motor for air leaks when his fingers contacted the fan, amputating the tips of the left middle and ring fingers.
An employee was cutting wood on a saw when his foot activated the foot pedal and engaged the saw blade, partially amputating two right-hand fingers.

An employee was stepping down from a ramp on a food truck. When she pulled the rolling door closed with her left hand, the door slammed down and smashed her right-hand pinky finger. The finger was later amputated.
An employee was repairing a ground power unit when his hand slipped, causing a severe laceration and partially amputating his fingertip.
An employee was replacing the rubber skirt between the mixer and the cooler when the cooler grabbed the skirt and pulled the employee into it. His left hand was amputated.
An employee was placing a fiberglass beam down to be bolted to the concrete when his left ring finger was caught between the beam and concrete, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was machining a shaft and using sandpaper at a lathe when his right glove got caught in the machine, amputating his right middle and ring fingers at the knuckle.
An I-beam rolled onto an employee's fingers, pinching and amputating the left middle and ring fingertips.
An employee was shutting the door to a forklift. His fingers were caught in the door, amputating his left middle fingertip.

An employee was feeding parts through a machine when his hand contacted the blade, lacerating three left-hand fingers. His middle finger was surgically amputated. The machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.
After an employee cleared jammed material from inside a slicing machine, the machine cycled and amputated the employee's right thumb and index finger.
An employee was retrieving snacks being delivered for a store display. The employee's right index finger was caught and partially amputated while trying to unjam a lift gate that became stuck.

An employee was placing material into a band saw to be cut. When he activated the vise control to hold the material, his finger was caught between the material and vise, amputating his left middle fingertip.
While operating a bandsaw, an employee caught his metal glove on the blade resulting in the amputation of one inch of his left thumb.
An employee's right ring finger was pulled into and amputated by the chain and sprocket of a running machine. The machine was unguarded at the time.
An employee was cleaning an air handling unit when his hand was caught between a pulley and a belt, partially amputating his left middle fingertip.
While an employee was cleaning a bagging machine on 1/23/2016, the employee's fingertip was caught and amputated in the machine.
An employee was working at a drilling machine when the glove on her left hand was caught by the drill bit, partially amputating her left thumb.
An employee's left ring fingertip was amputated by a dock locking device while the employee was loading a truck.

An employee was installing a part in a milling machine using an air hoist. While lowering the part the last inch, the hoist came down and the part dropped, fracturing and partially amputating the employee's right middle finger.
While an employee was lowering a dock plate, the front flap pinched the employee's right middle finger, amputating the nail and the pad under the nail.

An employee had removed a cover for the drive belt and the exit roller so the timing could be adjusted for the inserter. His left index finger was caught between the drive belt and the rotating exit roller, and his index fingertip and approximately two-thirds of the bone were amputated. The machine was not locked out at the time.
An employee was feeding a compound into an injection mold press when his hand got caught in the feeder, partially amputating his left-hand middle finger.
An employee was using an overhead crane to position pipe into a steel holding area. The employee's left hand was caught between the pipe and steel structure, amputating the left thumb tip.

An employee was reviewing blueprints at a work table in the assembly hall when a coworker bumped a piece of angle iron weighing approximately 24 pounds off the table. The angle iron fell on the employee's steel-toe boot, fracturing his left pinky toe. The injury became infected and the toe had to be surgically amputated.
An employee's right-hand ring fingertip/first knuckle was amputated by an excavator bucket while the employee was taking measurements under a tank.

An employee was attempting to retrieve part numbers from a compressor's fan belts to do maintenance on the machine. When the employee manually advanced the belts to better see the numbers, the compressor started up unexpectedly and caught his fingers in the pulley and belt. His left index, middle, and ring fingers were partially amputated. The compressor was not locked out at the time of the incident.
While cutting lettuce in the cafeteria kitchen with a knife, an employee's left ring fingertip was amputated.
An employee was grinding a point on a steel wedge when the grinder pulled the employee's left thumb in and amputated the tip.
An employee was operating a milling machine while wearing gloves when the machine bit lacerated the employee's fingertip. The tip was surgically amputated.
On 01/26/16, an employee's right middle fingertip was amputated when the employee attempted to clear a jam in the cold bead machine.
An employee was using a wrench to loosen bolts when his right index finger was pinched between the wrench and a fixed pipe support, amputating soft tissue.
While an employee was operating a machine to cut a circular test sample, a pin in the machine broke and made contact with the employee's right index finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was performing set up on a wire drawing machine when his hand was pinched between the wire and the block on the machine. His left-hand ring finger was partially amputated and his middle finger was fractured.
An employee was trimming brisket on the boneless meat saw when his hand slipped into the blade, partially amputating his right index finger and lacerating his right middle finger.
An employee's finger was pinched between a cart and table in the kitchen. The right pinky fingertip was partially amputated and reattached.

An employee and a coworker were working on a machine's tool changer because it would not drop a tool. The coworker pushed the machine buttons while the employee's hand was in the tool changer, partially amputating his left thumb and pinky.

An employee saw a pallet fall off a forklift into a bin where it did not belong. He left his forklift and went over to the other forklift.  He rode the forks of the forklift to a 6- to 8-foot high elevation and retrieved the pallet. As he was riding the forks down, his right-hand ring fingertip became trapped and was amputated between the mast and the rack of the forklift.
While an employee was operating a drill collar clamp on a workover rig, his right pinky finger was caught between the clamp and the tubing tongs, amputating the fingertip.
An employee lost his balance while putting a roll on the mandrel and his fingers were pinched between a roller and threading belt. His left middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee reached for a box that was jammed in the ground beef burger tray former machine. When he removed the box, the machine started and pulled his hand into a chain resulting in a partial amputation of the right ring finger.

On or about January 27, 2016, at 3:25 p.m., an employee was pushing a chair cart when his hand was crushed between the wall and the cart due to the cart's momentum.  His right-hand middle finger was amputated.
An employee was adjusting the chute on the T-Belt going to the FB4K hopper resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee amputated a finger while cleaning ginning equipment.

An employee was attempting to close the spray booth door when the suction of the spray booth ventilation caused the door to close suddenly and pinch the employee's left middle finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee amputated the left index fingertip while working with a battery powered circular saw.

An employee was attempting to center a winch drum spacer on a lathe. The winch drum spacer flipped off the lathe and fell onto his right foot resulting in injury. The employee sustained a contusion on upper part of right leg and had four toes amputated.
An employee's left thumb tip was amputated while he was guiding pallets through the process at the bucket tipper machine.
An employee was operating a frozen meat grinder when a piece of meat got stuck in the shoot. When he attempted to dislodge the meat, his right index finger was amputated.
An employee was operating a pasta press and amputated three fingers.
Employees were coming down from a roof along with equipment and tools using an articulating boom lift.  The lift wells gave out, and the employees fell suffering broken bones.

An employee was showing the cleaning contractor where they would be cleaning at the facility.  He opened the hatch to a chute. He pulled on the hatch with his left hand and placed his right hand on the lip of the chute to get more leverage.  His left hand slipped from the handle and he tried to pull  his right hand out of the way, but the fleshy part of his thumb was caught between the hatch lid and the chute lip resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was lubricating equipment.  He was using a rag to clean lubricant from the PT4 conveyor.  The rag was caught in the chain and sprocket, which pulled in the employee's left hand crushing the middle finger in the chain and sprocket. The finger was amputated at the first knuckle at the hospital.
An employee was using a drill when his glove contacted the drill and/or drill bit and amputated his right second digit.

On January 29, 2016, an employee was closing the door to a 30-yard industrial roll-off container when the employee's right middle finger was caught between the door and the latching mechanism. The finger was partially amputated.

On January 29, 2016, an employee was attempting to unjam the nailing machine when a coworker started the machine. The employee's hand was dragged through a chain and sprocket, amputating the right  middle, ring, and little fingers.

An employee was troubleshooting a piece of machinery that was not working properly. When the employee tried to check the tension in the chain with his left index finger, the chain pulled his finger into the chain and sprocket, amputating his left index fingertip. The machine was unguarded and running at the time of the incident.

The employee had completed the work operation and was shutting down the crane.  The employee was asked to check the control switch located on the crane's turn table. The employee's finger got caught in a slot where the switch was located and the crane engaged and started to turn. The employee's left middle finger was crushed. It was later amputated at the first knuckle at the hospital.

Three workers were setting a cast iron tree grate in place. Two lifted the grate while a third placed wooden block underneath to prop it up. When the grate lowered, a worker's finger was caught between the grate and the block, resulting in the amputation of the right little finger from the fingertip to the second knuckle.
An employee's left pinky finger was amputated at the last joint while he was using a horizontal press/trimming machine.

An employee was setting the gap on the granulator blade. When the employee rotated the rotor, the employee's left-hand middle finger was partially amputated (approximately 1/8 inch) by the rotor blade.
An employee was adjusting the weaving machine, which was de-energized, when his right pinky finger was caught in the sector gear. His fingertip was amputated (no bone loss).

On February 1, 2016, an employee was unloading parts from a conveyor when the conveyor stopped because a part was stuck upstream. The employee attempted to retrieve the part when a piece of steel began to index, got caught, and pinched her finger. Her right thumb was amputated.
An employee's right index finger was partially amputated after becoming caught on a trailer door handle.

An employee was helping an aerial access driver load multiple mobile light plants that were off-rent onto an aerial access trailer. The employee was bent down in a squat position, attempting to adjust the tongue of a mobile light tower, when the aerial access driver put his back against the rear light plant and shoved it forward. The employee's index finger was caught between the transport trailer deck and tongue of the mobile light tower, amputating the left index fingertip.
An employee's left ring finger was partially amputated after being struck by a sledge hammer while the employee was repairing a 34-inch pipeline.

An employee was cleaning a plastic recycling line when the fan blades inside the machine hit and partially amputated the employee's right index and middle fingers. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.

An employee was operating a shear to cut metal when the shear's control activated while the employee's hand was in the point of contact. The employee's right middle finger was amputated (half an inch) by the blade.

Two employees were removing sheets of plywood from old shelving when a piece about 3' by 6' slipped. The injured employee's right pinky fingertip was caught against the plywood and the skin tore off (no bone damage) within the employee's glove. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was doing a machine die rotation on a brake press when the die slipped out of place and fell onto the employee's left middle finger, amputating the fingertip.

On Wednesday, February 3, 2016, an employee was getting into the passenger's side of an aerial lift truck when he slipped on ice. He attempted to grab the side of the truck, and a ring on his left ring finger got caught on a bolt on the side of the aerial lift. His left ring finger was amputated.
An employee was troubleshooting equipment and suffered an amputation.

An employee was performing maintenance functions on board an aircraft.  The employee manually reclined a passenger seat back and raised the foot rest to inspect under the seat.  Using his right hand, the employee pulled on the manual release mechanism to lower the foot rest, not realizing that his left thumb was between the foot rest support structure.  As the foot rest was released, it automatically dropped to the folded position, severing off the employee's left thumb at the first knuckle (approximately 1").

An employee was transporting a swivel from one side of the shop to the other. As he was getting ready to lower the swivel to connect it to another machine, the bottom part dropped onto his right pinky finger. The employee was transported to the hospital where his finger was amputated.

An employee was operating the T-80 Kauffman Tapper machine. When he reached into the machine to clear a shaving, he bumped his hand on the spinning tap and suffered a partial amputation on the right index finger involving skin and flesh with no bone loss.
An employee was fabricating a bracket and sharping a piece of metal on a belt sander. The metal bracket slipped out of his hand, rotated and sliced the top of his left thumb.
An employee was using compressed air to remove sawdust from resaw and amputated the right thumb, index and middle fingers.
The employee was cutting shank meat using a band saw and amputated the fleshy tip of the right ring finger. The fingertip was reattached by outpatient surgical procedure.
A temporary employee was removing reject logs from the line 5 conveyor belt when he got his finger caught-in the drive chain sprocket and suffered an amputation of the right middle fingertip.
An employee suffered a left ring finger amputation when loading a damaged vehicle onto a tow truck.
An employee was cutting metal on the shear machine and amputated the left ring fingertip.
An employee was working on the 5 inch pizza dough press. She reached her hand into the machine to clear some debris on the belt and the die cycled amputating the tip of her right ring finger.

An employee was operating the winding machine and knelt down to get a better view. His knee gave out and he fell forward extending his hand to brace himself. His hand contacted the machine blade and amputated the right middle finger.
An employee was cutting turkey with a knife and severed the tip of her left thumb.
An employee was positioning a loading dock leveler. The dock leveler's hinge sprung open and severed the employee's left middle and ring fingertips.
An employee suffered an amputation injury when a skid kicked back on a band saw causing two boards to fold together pinching his finger.

An employee had just completed ripping a piece of wood stock when he changed the process and began to shave it.  While in the process of shaving the wood block it kicked forward causing the employee's hand to move forward into the rotating blade. The employee sustained an amputation injury to the tip of his right thumb.
An employee was working in the saddle pack department taking product off the test line when the actuator activated and amputated the tip of his left thumb.

An employee was lifting a bundle of bars with an overhead crane.  The employee was steadying the load with his ungloved left hand.  The load of bars shifted and pinched his finger.  The employee suffered a partial amputation of his left ring finger.

On February 5, 2016, an employee was using a table saw with a circular saw blade for cutting wood. The employee sustained a severe cut to his left hand thumb that was surgically amputated at the hospital.

On February 5, 2016, at approximately 12:30pm, an employee was injured while operating a full revolution mechanical power press.  The employee was transferring can parts into a redraw die. Two fingers on his right hand became trapped between the can part and the working die as he removed the can part from the machine, resulting in a partial amputation of the middle and ring fingers.
An employee working with a table saw attempted to move material away from the blade and contacted the saw blade resulting in the amputation of one finger and laceration of three fingers.
An employee lost the tip of his right ring finger when it was caught in the trailer door.
An employee crushed his right pinky finger when it was smashed between the door and the door jam, resulting in an amputation from the nail bed up.

Three employees were moving the frame of a trailer to be placed on the bed of the trailer. The employees were guiding the frame, which was suspended from a crane. The injured employee had his finger caught between the frame and the bed of the trailer when the trailer frame was lowered into position, causing an amputation.
A pipe crushed an employee's finger between a pipe and the bucket of a frontend loader resulting in amputation of the left pinky finger at the hospital.
An employee was putting a ramp back into a trailer and the ramp slipped and smashed his finger.

On February 6, 2016, at approximately 12:30 PM, an employee sustained an amputation of the left middle finger to the first joint. The employee was preparing to dump a dumpster elevated by a forklift when the dumpster rolled back onto the employee's hand.
While rolling the belt onto or off a pulley, the employee's glove was caught in between the pulley cutting the right pinky.
An employee was working on a skinner machine and amputated the whole middle finger on the left hand.
On or about February 6, 2016, an employee amputated the right ring fingertip while operating a grinder. The employee was hospitalized.
An employee was removing a pump from a piece of equipment.  The air supply to the pump was knocked loose, closing a valve and amputating the employee's left middle fingertip.

An employee working in the melt department was injured while moving materials by hoist. The employee pinched his 4th and 5th distal ends between the wire rope and the sheave of the load block, resulting in an amputation of the 5th distal digit.
An employee was operating a forklift. While turning into an aisle, the employee lost control of the forklift and put his left hand out catching his left thumb between the forklift and the racking.
On February 7, 2016, an employee cleaning the beef patty machine unit amputated the tip of the left ring finger.
An employee's right-hand index fingertip was amputated by a mixer-grinder machine head. The grinder was still spinning at the time of the incident.
An employee was operating a cut-off saw when his glove was stuck in a chain, pulling his hand into the saw blades. He amputated his pinky finger and part of his right-hand ring finger.
An employee was running production on a spot welder when the employee's hand was caught in the machine's point of operation, amputating the thumb.

Workers were performing tree trimming activities at a residential jobsite. While moving traffic cones that were stored on a wood chipper, an employee's right hand contacted the chipper's fan assembly, amputating his fingertips.
On February 9, 2016, an employee's left thumb was amputated to the first joint while the employee was operating a brake press to bend steel.
On February 9, 2016, an employee was attempting to trip the proximity sensor on the finishing line when the clamp activated, amputating the employee's left thumb distal to the first joint.

On February 9, 2016, an employee was performing maintenance on a front-wheel drive prismatic machine. While the employee was working on the coolant tank, the high-level arm was activated, causing the tank pump to start. The employee's right pinky finger was amputated by the pump impeller.
On or about February 9, 2016, an employee received an amputation while operating a lathe.

An employee was operating a boring mill machine while his right hand rested on top of a metal beam on the shuttle. The beam moved during the operation of the machine and pinched his right middle fingertip between it and another metal beam. His fingertip was amputated.
An employee was loading trailers on a semi-trailer for shipment. While climbing off the trailer, the employee's wedding ring got caught, de-gloving the finger.
An employee was cleaning a conveyor when her left-hand glove was caught in a roller. Her left middle finger was partially amputated, and her left index finger was fractured.
An employee amputated her left pinky finger after contacting a moving part (chain and gear) on a machine.

An employee was using a jib crane to flip a cantilever. He guided the hook with his right hand and used the crane controller with his left hand. The employee hit the "up" button on the controller and his finger was caught between the hook and the cantilever, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee's right middle fingertip was amputated while the employee attempted to unjam a blanker die and block machine.
An employee was working with a chop saw when his hand was exposed to the blade, partially amputating his right index finger.

An employee was cutting a narrow strip of flexi glass using a table saw. He was pushing the flexi glass with a 'push stick' using his right hand and was holding the material with his left hand. As the material was going through the blade, his left index finger was caught by the table saw blade, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was changing the jaws on a CNC lathe when the jaw hydraulic clamps were actuated by the foot control. His right index fingertip was amputated above the first joint between the jaws and the new part.
An employee's hand was caught in the chain at the end of a stinger trailer, amputating two fingertips.
An employee was using an end milling machine while wearing gloves. The machine caught the employee's glove and amputated the left-hand index finger.

A worker was backing a log out of the mill when the log became jammed. When a maintenance employee attempted to push the log out with a block of wood, a chain amputated the maintenance employee's right index finger.

An employee had just completed performing preventative maintenance on a blower unit. When the employee restarted the equipment to determine if it was functioning, his right middle finger was caught in the belt and pulley, amputating the finger at the first joint. The belt guard was not in place at the time of the incident.

An employee was cutting castings off of trees with a saw when the sawblade caught or broke and pulled his hand into the blade.  His right-hand ring finger was amputated, and the back of his hand was lacerated.

On February 11, 2016, an employee was performing a flare test on a 5" metal tube. The employee was holding the tube on the test cone and cycled the hydraulic press. The tube slipped off of the test cone, pinching the employee's finger between the tube and the bottom of the press. The employee's left pointer fingertip was amputated.
An employee's right thumb was amputated when it got caught between the door of the linen room.

An employee responded to a call about issues in the silo. The blower motor amputated the employee's right index and middle fingers, and fractured the employee's ring finger. The employee underwent surgery.
While removing plastic from an injection blow molding machine, an employee's right index fingertip was amputated.
While bending parts on a brake press, and employee's right index fingertip was amputated between the part and the press.
An employee was working with a CNC lathe machine when the machine amputated his right index fingertip. The machine was running at the time of the incident.
An employee was using a hydraulic pop rivet gun to repair a railcar. The employee's finger was amputated when they pulled the trigger.

An employee was operating a table saw to shave 1/2" off a 72" x 30" 3/4" plywood board when the middle finger on his right hand came into contact with the 10" cutting blade. His finger was amputated at the fist knuckle and required surgery.

An employee operating a vertical milling machine was brushing metal chips away while wearing gloves. The tip of the glove and the employee's left index finger became caught in the machine's drill bit, amputating the finger.

While clearing a jam on a material grinder, an employee's fingers came into contact with the material grinder blades. The middle and ring fingers were amputated to the proximal joint. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was fixing a boomerang machine caster. A support fell and pinched the employee's right index finger between the floor and the machine resulting in an amputation injury.
An employee amputated three fingers while working on an auger.
An employee amputated fingertips while operating a shearing machine.
A employee was cleaning the sensing eye on the baler when the baler cycled and caught the employee's right middle fingertip resulting a partial fingertip amputation.
An employee was operating a pepperoni slicer and amputated his finger and severely lacerated several other fingers while attempting to remove food from the machine.

An employee was struck by a forklift when he was trying to warn the driver that a box was about to fall off the forklift. The forklift ran over the employee's right ankle resulting in the amputation of the foot.
On or about February 15, 2016, an employee suffered the amputation of their right index fingertip when it was caught between a conveyor that was being moved on a forklift and a press.

An employee was operating a table saw cutting lumber. A piece of the wood that he was cutting kicked back causing the employee to lose his balance.  His right middle finger struck the saw blade resulting in the loss of bone to the right middle finger.

An employee was drying  the star valve with a paper towel when the machine turned on.  The valve rotated and sucked the towel and the employee's finger into the rotating equipment resulting in the amputation of the middle finger to the first knuckle.
An employee was engaged in sanitation of the meat blender in the blend room and amputated the right thumb.
An employee was cutting wood using a table saw and amputated the tip of his left thumb.
An employee amputated 3/4 of the right index finger while operating a plastic film winder.
An employee was rolling sheet metal into a HYD double pinch plate roller machine when his hand got caught between the rollers resulting in the amputation of his left index finger.
An employee suffered a finger amputation after his finger was injured from a drill bit attached to a roto hammer.  The drill had accidently been actuated as employees were attempting to move it.
An employee was engaged in rigging down activities. The top drive cradle fell from the rig and struck an employee on the leg resulting in amputation of the leg.
An employee was driving a forklift and struck a rack.  She pinned her hand between the rack and the forklift resulting in the amputation of two fingers on her right hand.
