An employee was operating an Ace strap cutting machine and the blade of the machine severed her left hand pointer finger at the knuckle.
An employee was operating a trimmer.  As the employee cleared a jam on the in-feed conveyor, his right middle finger was caught in the chain and sprocket resulting in a fingertip amputation.
While ripping a piece of 2x4 on a table saw, an employee amputated the tip of the right thumb.

An employee was trying to prevent multiple rollers from coming out of the conveyor. Another employee went to point at the area of concern when a roller came out and pinched a finger resulting in the amputation of the right hand index fingertip.
An employee was lowering a scissor lift with the remote control. His left thumb got pinched in the lift resulting in a fingertip amputation.

Two employees were removing a reach rod.  One of the employee was on the top deck lifting the reach rod while the other employee was trying to remove a pin. The reach rod slipped smashing the employee's finger. The employee's left ring fingertip was amputated.
Two workers were passing windows from an elevated trash box on a forklift to a balcony and fell approximately 3 stories, suffering back and head injuries.
An employee was checking the fluid levels on a tug and amputated the left index fingertip when the hood of the tug slammed down on his left hand.

On February 17, 2016, an employee was exiting a scissor lift when his finger became caught in a cable attached to a locking pin.  The locking pin is used to hold a top rail into place at the end of the scissor lift.  The employee's right ring finger was amputated down to the second knuckle.

An employee was replacing the automatic arm for a tarp on a disposal truck. As he reached for a pin, the automatic arm moved and pinched his finger between the top and bottom arms, amputating his left index fingertip.
A door closed on an employee's right pinky tip, severing it.
An employee was moving a 2' base plate with a fork truck and 1/2 inch chain. He caught his finger between the fork and the chain amputating the right index fingertip.

An employee was replacing the backing core of a tufting machine with a new primary backing when her right finger was caught between the backing jack and the backing core of the machine. Her right-hand middle fingertip was amputated.
While an employee was cutting a tomato with a knife, the employee's fourth left-hand fingertip was amputated.

After stopping a press line, an employee walked between the press brake light curtain. The press then cycled and the dye post came down, hitting the employee's right arm. His right forearm and hand were amputated, and he was hospitalized.

Employees were welding a wall plate to connect a structural steel member. The base of the member became unstable, and the structural steel started to fall, causing an employee sitting on a cross member to fall 15 feet to the ground below. A second employee was welding while standing in an aerial lift basket when the structural steel member fell and crashed down on the lift, slamming it to the ground. The employee suffered multiple blunt force trauma injuries and was hospitalized.
The end of an employee's finger was pinched off while working. The employee was hospitalized and the fingertip was surgically amputated.

A crane was lowering an arbor into the bell of a flute machine while an employee guided the arbor into position. The employee's right middle finger was caught between the arbor and the bell  housing, and his fingertip was amputated.

An employee was operating a drill press to drill holes in aluminum stock. When he adjusted the material, his finger contacted the rotating drill bit. His right index finger was amputated above the distal joint.

On February 19, 2016, at approximately 8:15 a.m., an employee was cutting 6-foot lengths of fiberboard down to 43 inches using a miter saw. While holding the material with her left hand, she used her right hand to lower the blade of the saw. The blade made contact with and amputated her left thumb tip.

An employee was performing maintenance on a grinder machine, which was lifted up with a pin placed underneath. The machine fell and pinched the employee's fingers, amputating the right-hand middle and ring fingers at the distal joint.
While slicing ham with a bone saw, an employee's left ring fingertip was amputated.
While attempting to unjam a milk carton from the blow mold machine, an employee's right index finger was amputated.
An employee's left pinky fingertip was amputated by a digger truck's rope drum, which was being used to pull a truck that was stuck.
While an employee was stacking lumber, the lumber fell on and amputated his right-hand middle fingertip.

A maintenance employee was repairing a tapping machine. He was working underneath the machine. To access the conveyor belt, he was moving a product tray out of the way by pushing it. The tray came off the guides and tilted, and his finger was caught between the tray and the machine, amputating his left middle fingertip.
A temporary worker crushed a finger resulting in the amputation of the digit up to the first knuckle.
An employee stocking fiberglass was trying to extend a table leaf. The employee's left fifth finger was caught between the table frame and the table top, resulting in a distal amputation.
An employee's left middle fingertip was amputated while reaching for a part on a press.
An employee sustained an amputation of the right middle fingertip while using a meat saw.
Two employees were installing a protective goal post for overhead power lines when the post made contact with the energized line, causing the employees to receive an electrical shock.
An employee was removing some debris from a conveyor belt when another worker cycled the machine, causing the employee's right index finger to be crushed and partially amputated between two pallets.
An employee was fastening a tug boat to a barge when his fingers were crushed between the boat knee and the barge. His left index and middle fingertips were amputated.

A two-man crew was retrieving trash/debris from a dumpster in the alley behind a bakery. The process involves a truck, which is specially outfitted with a hoisting mechanism and an automatic tipping device. The device lifts the dumpster off the ground and dumps the debris into a hopper attached to the rear of the truck. While the device was lifting the dumpster, the injured employee's left-hand fingers were caught between the lifting mechanism and the trunnion bar. His middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee's right thumb became caught in a mixer he was operating and was amputated at the first knuckle.

On February 22, 2016, two employees turned off a jammed candle-making machine to service it. As the first employee was attempting to pull something out of the machine, the second employee turned it on, crushing the first employee's right-hand middle finger. His finger was surgically amputated.

An employee was unloading steel poles from a trailer. The employee was on the trailer during the rigging, trying to locate the center gravity of the poles. Once he located the center gravity, he went to the other side of the trailer to get off. He lost his balance, slipped, and grabbed one of the rebar supports on the trailer. At that time, the operator began lifting the pole upward. As the pole was lifted, it swung toward the injured employee and caught his right hand between the rebar support and the steel pole. His right middle fingertip was amputated and his right index finger was lacerated.
An employee was loading a refrigerator into the back of a truck when the blade that pushes debris into the truck caught his gloved left hand and partially amputated his middle and ring fingers.
An employee was loading a filter into a casing while a coworker pushed the other end. The employee's fingers were pinched and his right-hand index and middle fingertips were amputated.

An employee was pulling hose to connect to a pump when his hand slipped and his left middle finger struck the moving impeller of the pump. His finger went down the intake pipe and his left middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee's hand became caught in a moving conveyor chain as a conveyor was being tested on February 23, 2016. His second and third fingers were amputated.
An employee was parking a truck on the dock. As he lifted the electronic dock with his right hand, the lift gate came down and fractured his right ring finger, causing a partial amputation.

While operating a stacker machine, an employee attempted to remove a fallen product container that was blocking a sensor that controlled the conveyor. When the fallen container was removed, the conveyor began to move. The employee was wearing cut resistant gloves, and the glove on her right hand was caught by the chain and sprocket of the chain conveyor. She right-hand middle finger was partially amputated and required surgery.

An employee was reaching for a 2x4 board while working with the planer in-feed table. The employee's right thumb went through a 1.5-inch gap in the guarding and was caught between the tipple chain and sprocket, amputating the first digit of the right thumb.
An employee was using a pneumatic cut-off saw to cut a nail when the blade broke and amputated his left ring finger at the second knuckle. The saw was unguarded at the time.

On 2/23/16, an employee sustained an amputation of the ring and middle fingers on his right hand while operating a cutting shear.  The employee was holding a piece of metal in place while another employee operated the pedal for the shear.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while clearing a jammed production part from an assembly machine.
An employee was replacing a pyrite gate on a pulverizer when the gate slipped and struck the end of the employee's left index finger, resulting in a partial amputation.

On February 24, 2016, at approximately 4:00 p.m., an employee placed a 64-inch post in the saw. The blade hit a knot in the post and pulled the employee's hand into the blade, amputating the left thumb tip.
An employee was pushing tubing into a draw bench when a trolley caught the employee's fingertip, causing an avulsion.
On or about February 24, 2016, at 7:30 a.m., an employee was unjamming a plastics grinder when his right middle fingertip was amputated by the grinder's spinning blades.
An employee was dusting off his work station when his thumb was caught in a chain and sprocket, amputating his right thumb tip.
An employee was cutting plywood on a band saw when the blade partially amputated his left index finger at the first knuckle.
An employee's right index finger was amputated while attempting to remove a plastic bottle from a drive chain.
An employee was unloading equipment from a cart. The base of the cart dropped while he was still holding the handle, and his right fifth finger was amputated in a pinch point.
An employee was tightening a safety stand to a pole when the pole shifted, causing the safety stand to move and catch the employee's fingertip between the stand and pole. The fingertip was amputated.
An employee was adjusting a beam inside the nacelle when his finger was pinched between the beam and the beam bracket. His left ring fingertip was amputated.
A forklift was lifting three employees inside a trash box to the third floor. As they were stepping off, the box tilted and the employees fell to the ground. Two of the employees were hospitalized.

An employee was trying to latch the hinged walkway on the in-board side of a turn press. His supervisor pushed the platform to latch it while the employee's hand was in a pinch point. His right ring finger was partially amputated between the latch and platform.
An employee amputated the left middle fingertip while operating a hand held router.

An employee was cleaning mud from a roadway while a trackhoe was being operated nearby. A car came over the hill in the same lane as the employee. When the employee stepped out of the way, he moved in the direction of the turning trackhoe. His overalls were caught by the track, which pulled his left leg underneath. His left leg below the knee had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was attempting to lift a large heavy die using a crow bar when the die fell on the employee's fingers. The employee's right index finger was partially amputated and the thumb was seriously injured.

While an employee was checking for an air leak on the die-cutting machine, the machine was activated by the foot pedal. The employee's left index finger was amputated. The machine was unguarded at the time.

An employee was repairing loose, serrated, expanded metal grating. When he lifted a piece of grating, his middle fingertip was caught between the top piece of grating he was moving and another portion of grating. His fingertip was amputated (no bone loss).

An employee was beveling a pipe with a grinder. The employee put down the grinder after beveling the pipe, placed his hand on the elevated skid, and looked into the pipe. The pipe started to roll and crushed his right index finger, which was partially amputated.
An employee was cleaning out the bed of his dump truck while holding the tailgate with his right hand when the tailgate came down on his right middle finger, amputating the fingertip (no bone loss).
An employee suffered an amputation injury while cutting particle board on a table saw.

An employee experienced an amputation of the left pinky finger while guiding a rod out of a well. The rod was sticky and grabbed the employee's gloved left hand and spun it counterclockwise resulting in the amputation of the pinky finger and dislocation of the ring and middle fingers.

The injured employee was on the deck of a ship, lashing containers and locking them down to the ship. The injured employee's right hand was resting on a container on the deck. A crane operator was bringing another container onto the deck. The employee's right thumb tip was smashed between the container that was already on deck and the container that was being set in place by the crane.

An employee was operating a CNC machine that had a chip conveyor extending from it. The employee turned the CNC machine off to retrieve a chip ball piece of scrap from the conveyor. As he was retrieving the scrap, the machine was unintentionally activated. The employee's glove became caught in the moving parts and his fingers were caught where the conveyor meets the CNC machine. His left-hand index and middle fingers were partially amputated.
An employee was operating a plasma cutter to cut parts from a sheet of steel. When he attempted to adjust a part, his right index fingertip was amputated between the machine and the steel plate.
An employee was putting metal bands into a trash can when his left index finger was caught between the steel cans, partially amputating the finger at the nail.
An employee suffered an amputation injury while closing a door.
An employee's fingertip was amputated after contacting the belt of a running air compressor while  attempting to repair the machine.
An employee was loading materials into a storage room. His finger was caught on the hinge side of a door resulting in a fingertip amputation.

On 02/29/2016 an employee was grinding a steel plate when the work stock got wedged. The work stock flipped up pinching his thumb tip between the work stock and the grinding disc. The employee was taken to the hospital for medical treatment. The employee's right thumb tip was later amputated.
On or about February 29, 2016, an employee received a partial index finger amputation while working on the Magic Box A conveyor belt on the 500 Line in the Bindery Department.

An employee was putting wire on a U-shaped, steel channel frame, balanced on forklift tines, in order to attach the frame to an overhead crane.  The steel frame began to fall backwards, and the employee tried to maintain its balance causing the employee's right pinky finger to get caught between the forklift frame and the fork tines.  The employee's right pinky finger was removed from above the second knuckle.
An employee amputated the right ring fingertip in a pulley assembly.

On 3/1/2016, an employee was performing maintenance on a pin-setting machine when his hand slipped and was caught in the pin-setting equipment while it was in operation. The machine caught the ring on the employee's left finger and amputated it.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while cutting onions with a knife.
An employee was pushing a food cart when wind caught the door of the cart, causing it to swing back and hit the employee's fingers. The employee's left-hand third digit was amputated.

On or about March 1, 2016, an employee was re-installing a pump that was approximately 5 feet long and weighed approximately 300 pounds. The employee's left ring fingertip was amputated when it was caught between the pinch point of the housing and the casting.
An employee was slicing meat in the deli for a customer when the employee's hand slipped off the guard and struck the rotating blade, amputating the right thumb tip.

On Tuesday, March 1, 2016, at approximately 6:15 AM, employees were attempting to unjam the end-matcher machine. The load chain was placed in reverse, and a lug on the chain pulled an employee's right thumb into a guarded area, amputating the tip.

An employee was reaching for a part to be welded with his right hand while his left hand was on an oil table that contained a conveyor. The conveyor cycled by itself, amputating his left middle and index fingertips.
An employee was working on a feed system and attempting to reline the feed line to the machine when her right middle finger was pinched by the homing plate, amputating her fingertip.

On Wednesday, March 2, 2016, at approximately 3:30 PM, an employee was operating a CNC machine. The employee opened the protective door of the machine to clean the chips from the fixture with an air hose. When his hand was close to the spindle area, the cutting tool struck his finger, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was attempting to remove a frozen chicken breast from a belt. The employee's fingertip was amputated when it was caught in the belt.
An employee fell while walking down stairs. His finger was caught in a grate, ripping skin from his finger. His fingertip was surgically amputated.

An employee was part of a crew performing work during the temporary shutdown of a boiler. He was raising a wash beam from inside the boiler by using an electric powered winch.  He was operating the pendant controls of the winch and raising the beam.  While raising the beam, his right hand was on the cable of the winch. The spool of the winch caught his glove, causing his hand to became caught in the winch.  He pulled his hand back, amputating his right ring fingertip just below the nailbed.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while stretching a cable.
An employee was trying to line up two pin holes when the pipes came together and amputated the first two left-hand fingertips.

An employee was helping unravel hose when his hand was placed in the buffer zone between the trailer and hose. His right middle finger was caught between the hose and the trailer, resulting in the traumatic amputation of his fingertip.
An employee's right hand was caught in the rollers while feeding dough into the dough machine, amputating the ring and middle fingertips.
While mixing concrete with a mixer drill, and employee's left index finger was caught in the blades, partially amputating the fingertip.

An employee was waiting for maintenance to clear a jam on a tissue interfolder machine. The employee attempted to grab a scrap of paper as maintenance was jogging and stopping the machine. Her right pinky and ring fingers were pulled into a pinch point and had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was operating an auger and amputated the three middle fingers on the left hand.
An employee was entering the building and was reaching for the closing door when his finger was caught between the door and door jam, causing a soft tissue amputation of his left-hand ring finger.

During the cleaning and sanitation of a dough divider, an employee was checking to see if any food particles were left on the machine. He spotted a small piece of bread dough and tried to flick it off with his finger. The tip of his glove was pinched in the machine, which amputated his right middle fingertip.
An employee was checking one of the label-making machines in the cooler. When she bent down, she lost her balance and grabbed a step ladder. The ladder folded and crushed her left pinky finger.
An employee cleaning a conveyor line came into contact with a chain and sprocket, amputating a fingertip.

An employee was using a dismantler to pull the boards of a pallet apart. His hand became caught in the pallet, and he was unable to remove his hand before the pallet went through the blade of the dismantler. His pinky fingertip was amputated.

An employee was replacing a bearing in a space heater when his leather glove was caught at the edge of the separator bar (the rotating mechanism inside of the heater) as it turned. His right thumb was caught between the separator bar and the outer shroud (the heater's fan with a filtration system) and was amputated from the first joint.
An employee was tapping a part on a milling machine when his glove became caught on the rotating tap. His left thumb was partially amputated under his fingernail.
An employee's finger became caught between two metal doors while he was trying to close them. His left index finger was amputated at the second digit.
An employee was cutting in wall blocking and amputated a finger with the saw.
An employee's left hand was caught between a pontoon and a rigging chain, amputating the left-hand index finger at the first digit.

An employee and coworkers were setting up the small mortar mixer on a concrete masonry unit to allow the mortar to be poured into a wheelbarrow. As he was lifting the mixer, it moved forward, causing him to lose his grip. It slipped out of his hand and pinched his fingers between the top of the concrete masonry unit and the bottom of the back of the mixer, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee's fingertip was amputated while working on the printing press. The machine was running at the time of the incident.
An employee was taking out the garbage when wind caught the door and closed it on the employee's finger. The employee's left index fingertip was amputated.
An employee was moving a steel plate with a gantry crane when his thumb became pinned between the plate and the frame of the crane, amputating his thumb tip.

An employee was diagnosing an issue with malfunctioning ejector plates and was attempting to remove a plastic particle from behind a back plate when a second employee cycled the machine. The plates closed and pinched the first employee's hand, amputating the right middle fingertip.

At approximately 10:20 p.m., an employee was operating one of the moving lifts. When he exited the lift, the vehicle did not stop, and his foot was smashed between the machine and the protective railing, severing his toe.
An employee was operating a mixer when the bowl fell from the guard. The employee's finger was caught in the mixer, amputating his left middle fingertip.
An employee was using a router to cut a groove in a panel when his index finger went into the opening on the router. The bit pulled his glove in and his right index finger was amputated.
An employee was pushing a cart of chrome bundles, which were 2" x 12' long. The bundles shifted and pinched two fingers on his right hand. When he pulled his hand out, his fingertips were amputated.
An employee amputated his left-hand ring and middle fingertips when his hand contacted a running fan belt.

Two employees were operating a manual, foot-operated shear to cut aluminum sheet metal. The injured employee was helping to hold down the sheet metal when the second employee operated the shear, amputating the injured employee's right index and middle fingertips.
While cutting wood with a table saw, an employee contacted the moving saw blade, amputating half of the left middle finger.
An employee's right-hand pinky fingertip was amputated when an equipment facer fell.
Two employees were hospitalized with facial injuries when a shipping case exploded as it was opened.
An employee was operating a cold press and amputated the right index finger from the second knuckle.

An employee was cleaning up the area when he noticed a piece of meat on the frame of an overhead saw (tail cutter). The employee reached up to get the meat but contacted the blade instead, amputating his left index fingertip.

The injured employee and a coworker were picking up supplies from a local supplier in a truck. The dock plate at the local supplier did not engage properly. Both workers got out and were trying to fix the dock plate when it came down on and amputated the injured employee's right index fingertip.

An employee was cutting pieces of copper using a shear when one of the pieces dropped. He reached down to get the piece with his right hand and at the same time his left foot pressed the down pedal of the shear (which has an up pedal and a down pedal). His left-hand index and middle fingertips were amputated above the top knuckles.
An employee was attempting to split a chicken with a saw. As the employee was pushing the chicken onto the saw blade, the employee's left index finger touched the saw blade, amputating the tip.
An employee's hand was caught in a chain drive while the employee attempted to clear a jam, amputating the pinky finger.

An employee was holding a railroad crossing gate for a vehicle to get on the railroad. The vehicle struck the gate and the gate fell on his finger. His left ring finger was lacerated and the fingertip was eventually amputated.
An employee's finger was smashed in a car door in the parking lot. His fingertip was amputated.

An employee was descending the fold down access ladder on the concrete mixer truck after spraying down the hopper. The employee's wedding ring, worn on left ring finger, was caught on a bolt associated with the ladder safety latch, located on the left side of ladder. The injured finger required medical amputation.

An employee was using a riveting machine to rivet a part. As she was removing the part, it became caught on the riveting detail for the pneumatic device. Her finger was then caught in the point of operation when the machine was activated by the foot pedal, partially amputating her right thumb.
While grinding on a disc sander, an employee's finger became lodged between the platform and the sander, amputating the distal tip of his right thumb.

Employees were putting a new tire on a loader/forklift. Two employees were using pry bars to manipulate the split rim in order to get the tire to seal correctly around the rim. The injured employee was manipulating the spare tire. One of the pry bars slipped while the injured employee was positioning the tire, amputating his right ring fingertip.

On 3/9/16 at 9:30am an employee had serviced the planer, removed his lock, and started the machine.  He observed a piece of wood near the point of operation and reached towards the planer blades to remove the wood and his fingers contacted the rotating planer blades resulting in amputation of part of the right-hand index and middle fingers.

An employee was reassembling a bagger head when a metal piece came too close to a metal detector and caused the machine to deactivate. The deactivation caused a valve to close on the employee's left thumb, partially amputating it.

Two employees were removing a 4' x 3' part from the welding jig with an overhead hoist.  The part got stuck, then broke loose, and dropped on the employee's right pinky finger. The finger was amputated at first knuckle.

An employee was helping his foreman crank an electrical generator. The generator's pull starter started whipping around and broke off from the motor's plastic cover. As he tried to turn off the kill switch, the pull starter wrapped around his left thumb and amputated it. He was wearing leather gloves at the time of the incident.

The employee was attempting to push a lawn mower housing into the press area, while pushing a newly pressed lawn mower housing out onto a conveyor. A lift rack that is on a timer rises up to catch the lawn mower housing that has just been pressed.  The employee's left thumb was caught in the rack as it retracted resulting in a crushing injury/amputation to the thumb tip.
An employee's right hand fingers were caught in the chain and sprocket. The ring finger was lacerated and the middle finger was broken.

An employee was helping a coworker move a catwalk away from a piece of equipment for cleaning purposes. The employee's hands were beneath the catwalk to guide the forks of the forklift under the catwalk when the fork caught his right index finger, partially amputating the tip. He was hospitalized for surgery.

An employee was operating a powered industrial truck (PIT) to move product through the shipping area. The employee's PIT collided with another PIT, and the employee suffered a lacerated and fractured left foot, requiring hospitalization.
On or about March 11, 2016, an employee was working on a robot gripper when the gripper activated, pinching and partially amputating his left index finger.

An employee was working with a brake press, pushing a 1-foot by 5-foot piece of metal up under the hold-down dogs, when the machine cycled. The employee's left index finger was crushed and amputated by the hold-down dogs.
An employee was jogging a packaging machine and feeding film through it when his hand contacted the cutter, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was repairing an overhead light in the emergency room when the cover collapsed on his right thumb. The cover cut through the employee's glove and amputated his right thumb tip.

An employee was attempting to align the conveyor belt when his right thumb was caught between the rollers, amputating the thumb below the fingernail. The belt was in motion at the time of the incident.
An employee was running a crimper on the 40 mm line when her right thumb and index finger were crushed by the machine. Her thumb and index finger were surgically amputated.

An employee was slicing meat using a band saw when the movable platform on which the meat was placed stalled.  With his right hand on top of the meat, the employee used his right side hip to apply more force on the moving platform to push the meat toward the operating band saw. He was wearing cotton gloves at the time of the incident. The right-hand cotton glove became caught between the meat and the band saw, which consequently dragged his right ring finger toward the point of operation. His finger was amputated.

An employee was changing a battery and removed the battery plate. As the employee was replacing the plate, it became stuck. The employee tried to unjam the plate; in the process, the plate fell on the left middle finger, amputating the tip.

An employee was attempting to fix a registration issue on a machine's fill and seal line. As he went to remove a cover off the stretch cylinder, the machine cycled. His left middle finger was crushed between the machine's collar and the stretching cylinder, amputating his left middle fingertip.
An employee was cutting meat with a vertical band saw when he cut his middle finger.
An employee was removing boxes from the stack-off conveyer when his glove became caught in a knuckle chain. His right finger was partially amputated.
On or about March 14, 2016, an employee was closing the office safe door when the door closed on her hand, amputating her right thumb.
An employee amputated the fleshy part of a finger when an automatic feeder malfunctioned.

An employee was helping to place a mandrel into a wire reel. The mandrel shot through the hole and pinched the employee's middle finger between the wall and mandrel. The employee's finger was amputated above the first knuckle.
An employee was washing the inside hood of a transformer. As he was closing the hood, his hand slipped off and the hood came down and smashed his left middle finger. His fingertip was amputated.

Two employees were cleaning a 30-foot tube with a chemical mixture of hydrochloric and nitric acids inside. The tubing became over-pressurized and the end cap dislodged, spraying the mixture onto the employees. They were both hospitalized with chemical burns.
An employee was attempting to push down on the anvil in a T-nut machine when his right index finger became trapped in the machine. His finger was partially amputated.
An employee was cleaning around a machine when his cleaning rag and finger were pulled into the machine. His finger was amputated. The machine was running at the time of the incident.
An employee was removing debris from an air compressor when his hand contacted the compressor's rotating fan, fracturing and lacerating three fingers and amputating one finger.
A worker was engaged in steel erection activities when he tripped on his life line and fell off the canopy striking his elbow resulting in a broken elbow.
An employee was placing a core into the core chuck machine when the cylinder actuated while his finger was in the hazard area. His right ring finger was pinched and partially amputated.
An employee was moving a mobile piece of equipment when the caster wheel rolled over his left foot, crushing/amputating half of his little toe.

An employee was using a hand tool (4- to 5-feet-long stainless steel rod with a two-pronged end) to pull meat out of a dump hoist vat and into a hopper. The hand tool (two-pronged end) became caught on the running/rotating hopper paddles, pulling the tool and the employee into the interlocked barrier guard. His finger was caught between the guard and the tool handle, partially amputating the right fourth digit's distal phalanx and lacerating the right fifth digit.

An employee was cutting egg crates using a band saw. While attempting to remove a small scrap from the cutting area, she swept her hand backward into the saw blade, partially amputating her left middle finger at the second knuckle.

On or about March 15, 2016, an employee was attempting to remove a bearing from a conveyor when his finger was pinched between a metal gate and the conveyor, partially amputating his left ring fingertip.
An employee was using a band saw to cut down sirloin steaks when his hands came in contact with the saw blade, amputating his left thumb tip.

On or about March 16, 2016, at approximately 4:00 p.m., an employee was trying to clear a jam on a conveyor that was transporting cones on molds when an automated oven door came down on his hand and pinched his right middle finger, amputating the nail and fingertip. The equipment was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was removing a lineup clamp from a piece of pipe when his finger was caught between the turtle clamp and a metal ring. The tip of his right middle finger was amputated.

An employee was helping to adjust equipment. She tripped as she was walking around the equipment. When she reached out to catch her fall, her right hand entered the point of operation. The equipment activated, pinching and amputating her right pinky finger between the stockholder tab and discharge table.
A maintenance employee had opened a bag of materials with a pocket knife. While attempting to close the knife, the blade shut on his left little fingertip, amputating it.
An employee was opening and closing the doors of vehicles when her right index finger was smashed by a door. Her fingertip was surgically amputated.

An employee was turning steel members to attach a bar code on the material. While flipping one piece of material, the piece next to it rolled back and caught/amputated his left index fingertip in a pinch point.
At 12:20PM on 3/17/2016, an employee was delivering mail on a foot route when the sliding door of a van slammed on his right index finger, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was cutting 2x6 lumber used to frame the exterior of a building. He had the lumber stacked on saw horses and was using a cordless saw to 
trim it. After he completed the cut, a small piece 
of the wood became lodged inside the saw guard, causing the guard to become stuck 
in an open position. Not knowing that the guide was stuck, he set the saw down by 
grabbing it with his left hand. With the combination of the guide being stuck and the 
blade still in motion, the moving saw blade made contact with and amputated his left middle finger.
An employee was emptying trash into the dumpster when their finger got caught between the dumpster and the hand rail resulting in amputation of the left ring finger.
An employee was cutting 4x4 trimming pieces with a radial arm saw when the saw blade amputated three left-hand fingers starting at the pinky.
An employee had replaced a clutch in a drive belt when he tripped on the concrete base and struck his left hand on the unit frame. His fingertip and a small amount of bone were amputated.

On March 18, 2016, at approximately 6:15 a.m., an employee was operating a stand-up forklift and traveling toward the battery changing area when his left hand made contact with the overhead racking system, amputating his left pinky finger near the knuckle.
A worker troubleshooting a hydraulic press cycled the machine while another employee's finger was inside the lower cylinder. The injured employee's fingertip was partially amputated.

An employee was operating an up-cut saw. As he was putting a piece of wood in the saw, his left foot stepped on the foot pedal and cycled the machine. The saw blade amputated his right ring fingertip.

An employee was feeding material into the moulder during the setup process. The employee fed a thin piece of material into the moulder and then thought it was jammed in the machine. When she went to the operator to point out where it was jammed, her glove was pulled into the cutter head and her index and middle fingertips were amputated.
An employee was operating the carbon fiber spinning machine and cleaning out the valve. A finger got pinched when the valve closed resulting in the amputation of the right index finger.
An employee was closing a door to the tool room with a hook chain. The wind  blew and slammed the door shut on the employee's lift index finger, amputating the employee's fingertip.
An employee was attempting to clear a jam at the rotary airlock discharge when the airlock rotated and amputated his fingertip.
An employee was lifting up a metal floor plate to access the switch to reset the escalator. The metal plate fell on his hand, amputating the top third of his finger.
While cutting chicken wings into segments using a back saw, an employee amputated the distal segment of the left-hand thumb.
An employee was operating a pallet jack when her finger became pinned between the handle of the pallet jack and a pallet that was behind her. Her right little finger was amputated at the top joint.
An employee was working with a screw jack when it became stuck. When he tried to move the screw jack, it fell and amputated his left middle fingertip.
An employee was cutting material using a guillotine cutter when the blade came down and crushed/amputated the employee's left index and middle fingers.
On 03-21-2016, an employee was cleaning the rotary valve section of a cheese de-weigher when the valve's rotating paddles amputated the employee's left-hand ring and middle fingers.
Two employees were picking up two angle iron supports and putting them into the metal scrap trash can. The angle iron supports hooked one of the employee's fingers and amputated the fingertip.
An employee was helping a coworker remove fabric from a fabric cutter when the blade came down and partially amputated the employee's second, third, and fourth digits of her left hand.

An employee was using a slitter to cut corrugated cardboard. When he tried to make an adjustment, the input wheel grabbed his glove and pulled his finger in, causing the slitter to crush his finger. His right ring finger was amputated.

An employee was troubleshooting the CNC line glue spreader and was attempting to push and pull a board through the spreader. When the employee pulled the wood through, the wood came down and crushed his finger, which was on a guide, between the guide and wood. His right middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was showing a second employee how to install a drive shaft onto a rotor plate. The drive shaft had to be aligned and seated onto the rotor plate by using a leather mallet and striking the drive shaft repeatedly. While attempting to stabilize the drive shaft, the second employee placed his index finger on the end of the shaft. The first employee struck the second employee's finger against the drive shaft with the leather mallet, crushing his left index finger, which had to be surgically amputated.
An employee's right ring fingertip was amputated when a delivery truck's sliding door closed on it.
An employee was feeding lumber into a planer when a piece jammed. When he attempted to clear the jam, his right little finger was lacerated. The finger had to be medically amputated.

An employee was opening/unfolding a wheelchair by pressing down on the sides of the seat when her finger went between the base and bracket of the wheelchair. When she pulled her finger out, her fingertip was amputated.
An employee was putting snow chains on his tires. While he was tightening the chain cam, his right middle finger became stuck under the tire chain and his fingertip was amputated.

On March 23, 2016, at approximately 1:30 a.m., an employee was cleaning out a vertical blender. When she opened a 10-inch x 10-inch door on the side of the blender, her right hand was caught between the side of the blender and the moving auger, amputating four fingers. The machine was energized at the time of the incident.
While loading friction paper into a laminator, an employee's left hand became caught between platens, lacerating the third and fourth fingers. The fourth finger had to be surgically amputated.
On or about 3/24/2016, an employee's finger was amputated while feeding a thermal former machine.

An employee was changing the air line on a three-station pneumatic press. Her finger was in a porthole on the equipment when she connected the air line to the machine. The air caused a piston in the machine to be actuated while her finger was in the hole, amputating her right pinky finger between the first and second knuckle.
On 3/24/16, at around 2:00 PM, an employee amputated an index fingertip while operating a punch press with pull-back devices.

An employee was working on a brake assembly by installing a pin into the manual brake lever, from the bottom side underneath the railcar, when a fellow employee performed a brake test. The employee's finger was caught in the manual brake assembly resulting in injury and possible amputation.
While cutting aluminum on a saw, an employee sustained a right middle finger amputation.

Two employees were moving a welding positioner into place using an overhead crane. One was handling the base of the positioner as the other was operating the crane. The employee with his hands near the base moved his hand under the positioner as it was lowered, and his left index finger was smashed and partially amputated between the base and the ground.

The injured employee was lifting an oversized package that weighed approximately 98 lbs. with another employee. When the employee lowered the package his finger was severed by a piece of metal on the package.

An employee was webbing the paper through the printing press perf and anvil cylinder.  The employee indexed the cylinders while holding the lead edge of the paper in the gap which drew the finger in, pinching it between two cylinders.  The employee's right index finger was amputated.

An employee was manually feeding 2x4 wood members into a saw when wood cutoffs began interfering with the machine's operation. While attempting to rearrange the wood cutoff debris, his left hand contacted the rotating 10-inch sawblade, amputating one finger and injuring two others.

An employee was helping to move a generator with fold-out handles off the back of a truck. His index finger was caught in the pinch point between the handle and frame of the generator, amputating the distal end of his finger. He was wearing gloves at the time.
An employee was opening small packages with scissors when her left index fingertip was amputated (no bone loss).

An employee got out of an elevated bucket to perform work (he was wearing a fall protection arrest system). When the employee got back into the bucket, he put his hand on the top railing of the bucket. When all of his weight transferred into the bucket, the bucket bounced a bit and his left ring finger was pinched between the railing and the wire tray of the bucket, amputating his fingertip.
An employee had just finished loading his trailer. While closing the rear trailer door, his finger was caught between the door panels, amputating his right index fingertip.

On March 25, 2016, an employee was moving a casting with a magnet when the magnet was turned off and the casting fell onto the employee's right foot resulting in amputation of the toes on the right foot.

An employee was attempting to replace the permeate port on the end-cap of a reverse osmosis vessel. The equipment retained pressure, which caused the end-cap to be forcibly removed. The pressurized end cap struck the employee's right hand against a support member, amputating two fingers.

While diagnosing a vacuum system, an employee removed an exhaust filter to access a vacuum port with his right thumb. The ball valve actuated while his thumb was in the port, amputating his thumb tip.

An employee was performing preventive maintenance on a pocket feeder and was manually lifting a section of the machine when it shifted, pinching and partially amputating his right pinky finger between two sections.
While closing a lift gate on a trailer, an employee's gloved finger was caught between the gate and the trailer doorframe, partially amputating the left middle finger.
An employee was changing out the cutter head when the cutter head activated, partially amputating the employee's index finger.

On March 28, 2016, an employee felt faint and dizzy and blacked out. When the employee came to, the right ring finger was caught between the conveyor and the guide bar. The employee's right ring fingertip was amputated.

On March 28, 2016, at approximately 11:20 p.m., an employee exited his excavator and peered into the bin where he was placing additives. Wearing metatarsal gloves, the employee placed his left hand on the side of the bin. A piece of metal, used as a trough, was not secure and slid against his hand, amputating his left pinky finger down to the knuckle.
An employee was securing a lift hook to a table on a jib crane when the employee's right thumb tip was crushed/amputated between the hook and lift table.
An employee was dumping product onto the auger that takes meat to the slicing machine. When he reached down, his right index fingertip was amputated by the auger.

An employee was operating a power platform stake bed truck to unload production equipment. The employee's left index finger became caught on the equipment, amputating the fingertip at the first knuckle.
An employee was attempting to remove the lock actuating pin and the lock bar shifted severing his left index fingertip.
On or about March 29, 2016, an employee was cutting paper tags with a manual paper/cardboard cutter when the blade came down and amputated the employee's right index fingertip.
While scraping out the hopper inside a mixer/dough divider, an employee's left-hand fingertip was caught and amputated by a shear point. The divider was operating at the time of the incident.

An employee was building a window, finished her portion of the assembly, and pushed the window down the production line to the next employee. When the next employee pulled the window toward them, it caused the window to close, catching and cutting the first employee's right ring finger in the window.

An employee was packing equipment to move to another jobsite when a pendant, weighing approximately 40 pounds, fell on his hand and crushed his right index fingertip. The finger was medically amputated just below the fingernail.
An employee was lifting a part with her left hand when the part slipped and struck her right hand, amputating the first right-hand fingertip.

Employees were measuring the receiving dock bay door area for a replacement dock plate. The dock plate springs opened quickly and the dock plate caught the injured employee's fingers in a pinch point between the dock plate and the dock bay door surface resulting in the amputation of the right middle and index fingertips.

An employee was operating the end boring machine, drilling holes for dials. The employee's finger got caught under the clamp when the clamps came down resulting in the amputation of the left middle fingertip.

An employee was setting up a lift with a beam clamp on a beam with a chain attached. The clamp had a hammerlock that connected the chain and beam lock. The employee's left index finger was between the chain and hammerlock when he hoisted the load. His left index finger was pinched and amputated between the hammerlock and chain when the chain tightened.

An employee was setting up a deep hole drilling machine (honing machine) when the oil pressure head disengaged. The head struck the employee's right hand, amputating his right thumb and right index finger. He was hospitalized.

On 3/30/16, at approximately 10:00pm, an employee crushed his left hand index and middle fingers between the dies of a hydraulic brake press while forming a metal part.  The tip of his index finger was medically amputated.

An employee was in the process of loading a gang bar onto a paint rack in the shop using an overhead crane rigged with a magnet. The gang bar was placed on the rack out of position. The employee released the lifting device and attempted to reposition the gang bar without the lifting device. In the process of repositioning the gang bar, one end came out of the rack and fell pinching the employee's fingertip between the gang bar and the rack resulting in a right middle fingertip amputation.
Two employees were performing maintenance on the Schlatter machine (high speed machine that produces wire shelving). One of the employees suffered the amputation of the left index fingertip.
An employee was using a drill when the glove was caught in the machine resulting in a pinky finger amputation.
On or about March 31, 2016, at 9:00 a.m., an employee in the meat department suffered a fingertip amputation while cutting meat on a band saw.

On or about April 1, 2016, at approximately 10:10 p.m., an employee was walking from the receiving desk at the shipping dock when a forklift driver struck him. His left leg was amputated below the knee.

An employee was checking the operation of the concrete mixer after the belts were replaced and the pulleys were realigned. The employee's right middle finger was caught between the mixer's belt and pulley, partially amputating the right middle fingertip.
An employee was adjusting plug tints/caps on an automatic installer machine when the machine's installing head cycled and amputated the employee's left middle fingertip.
While using a water hose to wash down a piece of equipment, an employee contacted the equipment and amputated the left thumb.

An employee was laying on her back while installing a chain on the sprocket of an egg packer. While she was jogging the machine, her towel became caught. When she attempted to grab the towel, her right middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee was stacking weights when a weight fell on and partially amputated his finger.
An employee was using a pneumatic torque wrench when the locking mechanism pinched his right ring finger. Part of his finger had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was repairing a conveyor that was jammed with product. The employee's fingers were caught in the conveyor pulley when it started back up, amputating the pinky finger and fracturing the right ring finger.

An employee was using a vertical disc grinder to grind a small piece of metal while wearing gloves. His glove was caught on the disc, resulting in the amputation of his left index fingertip just above the tip of his nail.

An employee suffered a partial amputation of the left middle finger while connecting a tow bar to a forklift's attachment. The employee's finger got pinched between the tow bar and the pintle hook on the attachment.
On or about April 5, 2016, an employee was guiding a die in a press when he attempted to remove a scrap. His right middle finger was caught between the die and die stop, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was attempting to remove viscera (guts) with a tool from the machine. The tool he was using was caught in the evisceration machine, and his right ring finger was smashed between the tool and the machine, amputating his fingertip.
Two employees were hospitalized after being buried in dirt when a trench collapsed.
An employee's index finger was jammed between a door frame and the door as he was closing it, amputating his distal phalange.
An employee was using a drill press to drill a hole in a piece of metal when a metal bur contacted his glove and pulled his finger into the drill press. His finger was amputated.

An employee was installing a small motor when the motor slipped out of his hands. The motor fell onto his hands and onto the ground. His left index finger was caught and amputated between the motor and the ground.

An employee was setting up and performing maintenance on a drilling machine with a panel removed. When the machine cycled, its table moved a plastic bin, which smashed the employee's finger between the bin and the ledge of the machine. The employee's left middle fingertip was partially amputated.
An employee was loading a shipping container onto a flatbed truck when his right hand became pinched between the container and the truck. His right pinky fingertip was amputated without bone loss.

An employee was participating in powered industrial vehicle training. As the employee was attempting to pick up a table, the wheels on the lift turned sharply. The lift accelerated quickly, causing it to veer to the right. His right pinky finger was pinned and amputated under an adjacent table next to a wall.

An employee was attempting to push a 400- to 500-pound upright plastic floater when his left ring fingertip was caught between the plastic tank and a forklift tine. He suffered a possible fingertip amputation.

On or about April 6, 2016, an employee was cleaning a food slicer when her right ring fingertip contacted the spinning blade and was amputated. The slicer was unguarded and running at the time of the incident.
An employee's middle fingertip was amputated when a pool table fell on top of the employee's finger.
On 04-07-16, an employee was adjusting/operating a coil machine when two looping blocks came together and pinched the employee's finger, amputating the left index fingertip.

An employee was installing a new auger bag for the CNC machine when his right index finger was partially amputated by the auger blade. The safety tube covering the blades was not in place properly at the time of the incident.

On April 7, 2016, an employee was using a walk-behind skid steer machine to pick up steel debris in the basement of the mill.  While picking up a piece of steel with the bucket, the bucket became stuck due to the weight of the steel. The back end of the skid steer raised up and moved the employee's hand to a flange, where the employee's left ring fingertip was amputated.
An employee working on the Phosphate Line was transferring parts from one bin to another bin when his left thumb was caught on the side of the bin and amputated.

An employee was inspecting a rotary valve airlock system. He opened a hatch to see if it was plugged and attempted to move some plugged material. He contacted the internal rotating parts, partially amputating three left-hand fingers.

An employee was operating a press machine when a part fell into the scrap conveyor. He went to retrieve the part and his glove was caught in the moving conveyor, amputating the end of his left middle finger.
On 4/7/16, an employee was ripping a 2'x10' board on the floor with a circular saw when the blade amputated a quarter-inch of his left finger.
An employee's left middle fingertip was amputated in the chute of an electric grinder while he was grinding beef.

A maintenance employee attempting to repair a machine's gate asked a coworker to trip the mechanism to start the machine. The coworker accidentally started the machine a second time, amputating the employee's right-hand middle and ring fingers between the platen and gate.
An employee was cleaning fiber off a moving part/sprocket and suffered a partial amputation of the right ring finger.

An employee was raising the slide gate on his truck with one hand on the controls and the other hand free. He slipped and his left hand was caught between the truck and rising gate, amputating his left middle fingertip.

A maintenance employee was greasing a bearing and could not get the grease to flow. When he put his finger on the fitting to get the grease to flow, other workers moved the motor, which amputated his right middle fingertip.
An employee was cutting a board with a metric (powered hand saw) saw that is secured to a table when his hand contacted the saw blade, amputating his left index finger.
While cutting lumber using a miter saw, an employee's left index finger was amputated.
An employee's finger was amputated in the point of operation of a brake press.
On or about April 8, 2016, an employee suffered a fingertip amputation when the left middle finger was caught between steel coils on a conveyor.
An employee's right thumb was caught in a safe door she was closing, crushing/amputating her thumb tip above the nail.
On or about April 9, 2016, an employee's hand was caught in an air handler between the belt and pulley. The employee's fourth left-hand finger was amputated.

On April 9, 2016, an employee was sanding a metal part using a stand-alone upright disc sander when the rotating sander part grabbed the metal part and the employee's gloved left thumb. The employee's thumb tip was amputated.

While operating a conveyor, an employee's glove became entangled between the conveyor belt and the belt tensioning roll, causing a finger amputation. The equipment was unguarded at the time of the incident.
A maintenance employee was unjamming a part in a new piece of equipment. The part unjammed and the slide went forward, amputating his right index fingertip.

An employee was showing a maintenance man an issue with a machine. As the employee was pointing to the problem, his finger was pulled into the rotating belt and pulley, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee was removing a piece of plastic product from a mold when the employee's fingers were smashed between the mold and the machine, partially amputating the right-hand ring and middle fingers.

On or about April 11, 2016, an employee was operating a spiral winder when the bobbin ran out of wire. While he worked on the bobbin, the machine activated and pinched the employee's right index finger, partially amputating the fingertip.
While using a magnetic drill, an employee's gloved hand was drawn into the drill, amputating the right thumb above the first knuckle.
An employee was attempting to remove a clog beneath a trim press when the die amputated the employee's left-hand middle fingertip.
On or about April 11, 2016, an employee amputated her right fifth finger after it contacted the blade of a spindle saw.
An employee was cutting croutons with a serrated bread knife and amputated a portion of his thumb.
An employee's right middle finger was amputated while installing a safety guard.
While adjusting the fill levels on a machine with a wrench, an employee amputated the right-hand middle fingertip.
An employee was using a horizontal milling machine to cut a cap for an engine when the employee's right hand was amputated.
An employee was cutting 2" by 4" pieces of lumber with a saw when the saw kicked back and partially amputated his left index finger at the second joint.
An employee's left index finger was partially amputated to the first knuckle while he was using a panel saw to cut the edge off of a board.

An employee was working on a lift truck. While putting the chain back on the lift truck's forks, the employee accidentally knocked it in gear and the boom fell. The forklift chains on the boom amputated the two middle fingers on his right hand. One finger was cut below the nailbed and the other was cut in the middle of the nailbed.

On 4/13/15, at approximately 5:00 p.m., an employee was setting up a metal grinding machine. During the setup process, he attempted to remove the part that was to be worked on. The manual control was in the reverse position at the time. As he pushed the job button with his right hand, his left ring finger was caught between the part and a machine guide, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was helping to take a cable winch system down. The system had been used to pull a heat exchange bundle. The employee's hand was on a poly snatch block when the operator moved the cable. The employee's fingertip was caught between the cable and poly snatch block, resulting in a distal finger amputation.
An employee was installing a scissor assembly on a high reach forklift. A finger was pinched while aligning two holes when the assembly moved resulting in the amputation of the left index fingertip.
An employee was using an electric pulley to raise materials up a scaffold when the employee's finger became stuck in the pulley casing, resulting in a partial finger amputation.

An employee was using a flight simulator and was attempting to slide the right seat (passenger).  The vertical seat adjustment lever was activated instead of the horizontal adjustment, and the seat went down while his right hand was searching underneath for the horizontal seat adjustment mechanism, amputating a fingertip.

An employee was working with a piece of metal on a shear machine while wearing gloves when his hand became caught on the machine guard. The guard pulled the glove and his left middle finger into the machine, amputating the fingertip almost to the first knuckle.
An employee was helping coworkers move a canoe rack when it dropped on his right ring finger, partially amputating his fingertip.
An employee was loading a dolly when the dolly slipped, amputating the employee's left index finger before the first knuckle.

An employee was using a saw to cut the window meeting rail when the saw guard activated and came down on the employee's right thumb, trapping it between the guard and the work table. A coworker came over and tried to help him unpin his thumb. When his coworker grabbed the saw, the sawblade activated and amputated the tip of the employee's trapped right thumb.
An employee was replacing heat tape on the head of a plastic film bagger when the machine head cycled and pinched his left hand, partially amputating his third and fourth fingertips.
An employee was bending rebar when part of his little finger was amputated.

An employee was performing product quality checks on an AccuShear press machine. As she was lining up the product, the press cycled and the cylinder came down, crushing and amputating her third left-hand fingertip.
An employee's finger was partially amputated when it was caught in a strap being used to rig pipe.

An employee was adjusting the chains on a piece of equipment, preparing it to be lifted by an overhead crane. The coworker operating the crane let go of the control button for lowering the chains. The injured employee thought the crane had already come to a complete stop, so he attempted to adjust the chains. His left hand was on one of the chains and while adjusting the other chain with his right hand, the chain tightened and slapped against his left hand, amputating his left middle fingertip.
An employee was splicing two wires using the terminal press when her left index finger entered the point of operation and was amputated.
On 4/15/16, an employee was operating a cutter machine when his right index finger was amputated to about the second knuckle.

An employee was operating a heat sealer machine. The employee was holding a die in place that was used to seal yellow vinyl fabric. When the under plate came down, the employee's finger was crushed, amputating one-third of the right index finger (including the first knuckle).

At approximately 11:00 AM on April 15, 2016, an employee was cutting cow bones using a band saw.  The employee's right hand came into contact with the band saw, amputating the right pinky finger just below the first joint (distal phalanx).

An employee was attempting to reinstall a concrete pouring conveyor cable on a pulley. The employee operated the conveyor controls to cycle the pulley and re-engage the cable. The employee's thumb tip was pinched and partially amputated between the pulley and cable.
While an employee was wiping debris from a plastic compression mold press, the vertical injector plate came down and partially amputated the employee's left middle and index fingertips.
While attempting to clean out clogged material from the fat sucker machine, an employee suffered a partial amputation of the right hand distal middle finger. The machine was running at the time.
An employee amputated two right-hand fingers while cutting meat with a band saw.
While an employee was cutting product in the deli, the employee's knife came into contact with a hole in the employee's glove, amputating the left middle fingertip and fingernail.
An employee's left index finger was amputated while attempting to clear a piece of meat from a meat mixing machine.
An employee's right middle finger was amputated at the first knuckle when the employee attempted to grab a part in the conveyor belt.
An employee's left-hand middle and ring fingers were partially amputated.
An employee suffered four left-hand finger amputations while performing maintenance on the rotating drum of the Opener #1 machine.
An employee was conducting pre-operational adjustments on a DSI machine. While closing a panel, his left pinky finger was caught and amputated between the panel and the machine.
An employee crushed his thumb between a door jamb and the railing on a scissor lift while lowering the lift from inside the basket.

An employee was removing debris from a piece of equipment. He hit the stop button. While reaching for the debris, he activated a proximity sensor. 
The sensor in turn activated a solenoid, which activated the cylinder. This caused the die set to come down and crush/amputate his right index finger.

On or about April 18, 2016, an employee was helping a coworker lift the top combo from a stack of four combos. The combo slid off and cut employee's middle finger. The finger was surgically amputated above the first joint.
An employee was helping to work on a paper machine when his left hand was pulled into the machine, removing flesh on two fingers.
An employee was pushing a rack when the rack fell over on his left ring finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was operating a shear machine when the machine actuated. The hydraulic drop came down and amputated the employee's right index finger.
An employee's hand was caught in a pinch point while raising one of the legs of a cable form, partially amputating the left-hand index finger.
An employee was placing a part into a brake press machine to form it when the machine activated before he removed his finger. The top die pinched off the end of his left index finger.
An employee was using a ratchet wrench to tighten a bolt when the wrench slipped, catching his finger between it and a piece of steel. His left-hand third fingertip was amputated.

An employee was cutting wood using a table saw. The employee's right hand contacted the saw blade resulting in multiple lacerations to the right hand index, ring and pinky fingers. Two digits were amputated.
An employee was cleaning the metal detector with a hose when a ball valve actuator amputated the employee's left middle fingertip.

An employee was replacing a belt on a bagging machine when it activated. The machine jaws amputated a portion of the employee's left middle finger. Lockout/tag-out procedures were not followed at the time of the incident.

An employee was replacing the spring and U-bolt behind a tire. He was replacing the tire when the jack collapsed, catching and amputating the distal phalanges on his right-hand middle and ring fingers.

An employee was working on a workover rig. While the crew was running pipe in the bore hole, the employee's hand was caught between two strands of pipe. The distal phalanges of the employee's right-hand middle finger was crushed and partially amputated.

An employee brought a straddle truck into the shop to change the right rear shoe assembly lifting cylinder. He used a floor jack to support the weight of the lifting shoe so the locking clamp that holds the lifting shoe onto the hydraulic lifting cylinder shaft could be removed. The employee had a crescent wrench in his right hand at the time and taped on the clamp but found that the clamp was already free of the shaft. He attempted to push the back half of the clamp out to remove it from around the cylinder shaft and put the clamp on the floor. As he was doing this with his left hand, he put his right hand down on the floor to support himself while kneeling. The jack came out from under the shoe, and the shoe dropped a few inches to the floor. The wrench the employee had in his right hand was partially under the shoe when it dropped. The shoe fell onto the end of the wrench, and the employee's fingers were caught between the wrench handle and the floor, amputating the right-hand index and middle fingers at the first joint.
An employee was exiting the building when a gust of air grabbed the door. He lost control of the door and it slammed on his left middle finger, amputating the tip on the palm side.

An employee was attempting to load a piece of medical equipment on the bed of a truck when the equipment shifted, crushing and amputating the employee's finger between the truck's lift gate and the equipment.

An employee was preparing to change a table saw's blade. Before doing so, he cut another piece of wood. As he finished cutting the board, the lumber shifted and his left hand was caught in the blade, amputating the last three fingertips on his left hand. The saw's automatic feed guard was removed at the time of the incident.
An employee's left index finger was caught in the concrete delivery chute during installation. The wound would not heal therefore, the finger was medically amputated.

An employee and his coworker were about to change a V-belt on an exhaust fan. They disconnected the power of the fan, but the momentum of the air handler caused the fan to spin in reverse. When the employee attempted to stop the fan blades from moving, his pinky fingertip was amputated.  His middle and ring fingers were also injured.
An employee's right hand was caught between a beam and a pressure roller and amputated.

An employee took the cover off a chain and tried to grease a bearing. The PTO was engaged and the chain was moving at the time. When the employee put one pump in, the chain caught his glove, sending his fingers in through the sprocket and chain. His left thumb was partially amputated, and his index, middle, and ring fingers were lacerated and crushed.

An employee was threading some 3-inch conduit when he identified burrs that needed removal.  He was using his channel locks to get rid of the burrs when the channel locks grabbed and pulled his left hand into the machine. The fingertip of his left pinky finger was surgically amputated above the fingernail.
An employee was clearing a jam on a machine using a hammer.  As he used the hammer to hit the material, his hand struck a metal bar, amputating his right ring finger at the third knuckle.

An employee was operating the pallet machine, which prepares pallets of rice for transport. A bag of rice fell off the pallet while being transported via rollers to where the pallets are wrapped in plastic. The employee went to grab the bag and his right glove was caught between the rollers, amputating his right index finger pad.

Two employees were working at a food preparation and heating cart when a flash fire occurred as they opened the door to the heating compartment, shooting flames out at the employees. One employee received second degree burns to the hands and face; the other employee received third degree burns to the hands and face.

An employee was repairing a forklift used in the facility. While the employee's hands were inside the forklift making repairs, the forklift shifted, amputating the employee's left index finger and lacerating his other fingers.
An employee was holding a part in a machine when the machine cycled and amputated the employee's finger.

On April 22, 2016, at approximately 7:15 a.m., an employee was operating a notch saw. While the employee was placing a 4-foot piece of vinyl in the saw, the saw was activated by the foot pedal. The saw amputated the employee's left index finger below the nail bed.

An employee was feeding metal parts into a rolling machine when her glove became caught in the rollers and her hand was pulled into the machine. She suffered a pinky fracture and index fingertip amputation. Her ring finger required stitches.

While an employee was unloading drums onto the cut porch, he bumped a drum behind him, which had his cell phone on top of it, causing the cell phone to fall into the cutter.  When he attempted to retrieve the cell phone from the cutter area, his right thumb and index finger were amputated right before the knuckle at palm level.

After making a batch of meat the employee opened up a hatch, which automatically shut off the machine. The employee's other hand entered into where the meat comes out of the grinder. The machine did not completely shut off, causing a fingertip amputation.
On April 22, 2016, an employee was cutting sheets of acrylic plastic with an unguarded table saw when his right pinky and ring fingertips were amputated.
An employee was bending parts on a brake press when their finger entered the point of operation while the machine cycled.  The employee sustained a right index finger amputation.

An employee was setting up a powdered metal press for production. While he was attempting to check if the inner punch was firing, his left-hand middle finger was struck by the tooling, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was placing a bottom bar between forms on a module when his right index finger was caught and amputated in a pinch point between the leg of a material cart and the bottom bar.
The employee was cleaning a bag sealing machine cutting blade and the machine cycled resulting in amputation of the right ring fingertip.
On April 23, 2016, at approximately 4:30am, an employee was troubleshooting a press guard that was shaking when the employee's fingertip was amputated by the machine's moving conveyor.

An employee was vertically lowering tubes (16-inch-diameter x 12-feet-long, with a flange on top; approximate weight= 1500 pounds) into an exchanger with an overhead crane. Due to slack in the lifting attachment, the employee grabbed the flange to try to turn the tube and align it with the lower tube sheet. His fingers were pinched between that tube and the adjacent tube, amputating the top joint of his right middle finger.

On 4-23-16, at 11:45 a.m., an employee was attempting to move materials out of the way on the bag line machine when his right index finger was caught between the chain and pulley, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was performing maintenance on a skinner machine when his right hand came in contact with the skinner blade, amputating the third fingertip above the joint and below the nail cuticle.
An employee's hand was caught in a machine.
On April 25, 2016, an employee was attempting to straighten a crooked board on the trimmer machine when his right ring fingertip was pinched and amputated between two boards.

Employees were setting up pipe slips and the well-head ring needed to be centered. The injured employee was attempting to center the ring on the bottom of the flange. When the well flange came down, it caught his right pinky finger and smashed it at the joint. The finger was surgically amputated.

An employee was attempting to clean the glue eye on a paper-covered wire machine when his left ring finger was pulled into the machine, amputating it. The machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was using the pop-up saw to cut scrap lumber into smaller pieces when the saw blade amputated her right thumb at the first knuckle.

An employee attached a counter-weight to a chain that was being adjusted. The employee's glove was then caught on the chain and pulled into the sprocket, amputating the employee's right index fingertip.
An employee suffered finger amputations while operating a bender machine.
An employee was working near the slit coil packaging line when his left index finger was caught between the powered conveyor belt and a 4,000- to 6,000-pound roll of steel, amputating the fingertip.

On April 26, 2016, at approximately 9:30 PM, an employee was spinning a non-energized rotary press by hand to clean excess oil with a rag. The rag was caught in the spinning press, pulling the employee's hand toward the punches. His right middle fingertip was amputated by the downward punch.

On April 26, 2016, at approximately 4:00 p.m., an employee was adjusting the brush table, which is part of the equipment that loads buns into bags. To adjust the brush table, the employee loosens a lock bolt, slides the brush table forward or backward, and retightens the lock bolt. While adjusting the brush table with his right hand, the employee's right index finger was pinched between the pusher on the bagger and the brush table, amputating the fingertip.

An employee working in the maintenance shop was adjusting the bolster of a hydraulic press. While the employee was attempting to align the bolster pinhole with a pinhole in the press frame, the bolster came down and amputated the employee's right index fingertip.
While braking parts on a press brake, an employee's right index finger was caught between a part and the upper die. The fingertip was amputated at the nail.

An employee was attempting to turn off the conveyor using the control sequence lights when his left glove was caught and pulled into the chain and sprocket, resulting in a left index fingertip amputation.
An employee closing a sliding door on a sausage production process pinched their finger between the door and another component causing an amputation of the left ring finger at the first joint.

On April 28, 2016, at 1:20 PM, an employee was using a router table to notch several small pieces of wood. The employee was moving the pieces of wood from left to right. The wood kicked back, allowing the employee's fingers to enter the bit.
