On or about 7/11/16, an employee was moving four pieces of metal weighing about 84 pounds. He hand-carried the metal to a truck bed and set it down on his pinky finger. When he attempted to pull his finger out, he suffered a deep avulsion. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was helping to adjust a row boat line when the employee's left ring finger was caught/amputated at the second digit between the rope and a cleat of the float dock.

Employee 1 was disconnecting a pressurized hose used to offload sulfuric acid from a rail tank car into a storage tank when he was sprayed with sulfuric acid.  Employee 2 tried to help Employee 1 and was also sprayed with sulfuric acid.  Employee 1 was hospitalized for treatment of burns to the arms, face, and chest.  Employee 2 was hospitalized for treatment of burns to the arms.
On July 12, 2016, an employee was offloading a 2-yard dumpster when the employee's finger became caught between the truck and the container lock. The employee suffered a fingertip amputation.

An employee picked up carpet from a carpet cutting machine. The machine was still running and his ring finger got caught on the tip of the blade. The employee was wearing gloves when his finger was struck by the blade resulting in a partial amputation of the right ring finger.
An employee's fingertip was amputated when a drill rig bucket fell on his finger.
On or about July 12, 2016, an employee was attaching two trailers together and crushed their left pinky finger between a dolly and a truck trailer resulting in amputation of the left pinky finger.
An employee was fixing a link on a track. The track pads shifted and pinched the employee's left pinky finger. The finger was later amputated.
An employee amputated the tip of their right index finger and their middle finger when they were caught between a casting and a machine apron while trying to remove the casting from the machine.

An employee was working on the 102-2 envelope machine while it was running. The employee was loosening a bolt with a wrench when the wrench slipped and the employee's right hand entered the machine's scoring section that includes a shaft and two blades. The blades amputated the employee's right index finger to the middle phalanx.

An employee was changing the end tape in a bundler machine and the employee's hand was in the path of the product. The product pushed his hand into the wall resulting in a partial amputation of his right middle finger.

An employee was assembling/testing an automated two-inch ball valve actuator. He put his finger in for alignment and released the air and his left middle finger was partially amputated (partial bone, on the tip of the finger).
Cutting a piece of plexiglass with a table saw when the employee's right hand was pulled into the blade, amputating the ring and middle fingers at the first knuckle.
An employee was working on an air cylinder when it activated and crushed his left index finger resulting in amputation.

An employee was in the process of setting up an RMC machine that takes mozzarella cheese and forms it into a block. The employee was installing a plastic wedge (approx. 2 ft. x 2 ft. x 1 in. thick, weighing approx. 25 lbs.) into the machine and amputated the right index fingertip.

An employee was greasing a conveyor when his foot slipped from the framework he was standing on and ended up on the chain drive and sprocket. The drive and sprocket crushed the toe box of his boot, partially amputating his right big toe.
An employee amputated the tip of his thumb while attempting to help dock a motor boat.

On 07/14/2016, at approximately 11:15 a.m., an employee was using a saw to cut 4'x8' panels. As the employee was retracting the table back to its starting position, the blade cut the employee's right-hand middle, ring, and pinky fingers, amputating the pinky and ring fingertips.

On 07/18/2016, at approximately 11:30 a.m., an employee was operating a flour mill, a machine that consists of a hopper that goes into an airlock. The airlock moves air with a squirrel cage type system. The hopper became clogged, so the employee unbolted and removed a plate to try and clear the clog. The employee's right hand then hit the squirrel cage's assembly, amputating the middle finger at the first knuckle.
An employee was inspecting a conveyor and amputated the right ring fingertip while replacing the guard.

An employee was injured while performing a routine wheel inspection diagnostics checklist. During this inspection and as the wheel assembly was spinning, the employee's right hand entered into the wheel assembly and his index finger extended beyond the spoke of the wheel as it passed the brake caliper assembly. A pinch point occurred between the caliper and the spoke and amputated the fingertip.

An employee was installing insulation in a control panel. When he grounded two wires together an arc flash occurred and the employee's face and hands were burned. Another employee who was standing nearby observing the first employee's work on the control panel was also burned on his face and arms. They were both admitted to the hospital.
An employee was troubleshooting a filler machine. While replacing the guard on the track chain, the employee's left thumb was amputated at the knuckle.
An employee was stamping metal using a press and amputated the pad of the right thumb.

On July, 15, 2016, an employee suffered an amputation of three fingers on their left hand when their hand was crushed between the die and steel rail while operating the rail pierce machine to punch holes in a steel rail.

The employee was working at the stacker end of the cut to length line. The table in the stacker was being raised to be at the same elevation as the conveyor on the cut to length line so product could begin to be stacked. The employee went to remove a board from the table and his right middle finger was caught between the board on the table and the stacker resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was mowing the lawn on the side of a hill. He lost his footing and his foot went under the mower amputating two toes.

An employee was swabbing the inside of the pipes for testing before sauces ran through. A pipe slipped off the employee's shoulder. His right index finger was caught between the end of the pipe and the pump's housing amputating the fingertip.
Two employees received electrical burns when an anchor cable was touched by a live electrical cable near the trench where the employees were working.

With the assistance of a sling swing the employee was loading a big gas valve into a truck with his bare hands. During the loading, the sling rotated thus rotating the valve, which caused the employee to pinch his finger between the sling and the valve resulting in the amputation of his thumb just below the fingernail.

An employee was cleaning up for the day and was setting a metal shelving unit onto the bucket of a backhoe machine. The employee lost control of the shelf and it dropped, pinching his index finger between the bucket and shelf. The finger was amputated at the first joint.
An employee was using a drill press and amputated a portion of the left middle finger.

An employee was dismantling scaffold when a large exhaust fan turned on. The fan blades amputated the employee's right middle fingertip below the nail bed, fractured the right ring finger and lacerated to the right index finger.
An employee was troubleshooting a malfunction on the walking floor near the baler and amputated the left thumb when the door closed on his hand.

An employee was performing maintenance on the B Extruder when he sustained a left pinky finger first digit amputation and fracture. The employee was removing an upper roll for the flat belt. While supporting the roll with one hand and removing bolts with the other hand, the employee lost control of the roll pinching/smashing the left pinky finger between two rollers.

An employee was preparing to cleanout a planer. He removed the exhaust chute and reached into the machine while the planer blades were still coasting resulting in the amputation of the left ring fingertip.

On July 14, 2016, at approximately 9:45 a.m., a cutter operator placed paper in a skid to be cut. When the skid moved, the employee's left pinky finger became caught between the cutter and the lift. The employee's left pinky finger was surgically amputated the following day.

At the end of shift, an employee turned off the grinder and used his right hand to clean meat off the grinder plate. The employee's right index finger went into a hole in the grinder plate and the fingertip was amputated.

An employee was assisting an air conditioning contractor position an air conditioner for the crane lift. The employee's right hand was caught between the air conditioner unit and the curb/asphalt causing the amputation of the right middle fingertip and a fractured finger.

An employee was attempting to remove a stainless steel window sill segment from the drive-thru window system using a cordless drill. The screw he was removing reversed quickly, causing his left thumb tip to become pinched between the stainless steel section and the drill he was operating, resulting in a partial amputation.

On July 19, 2016, at approximately 7:10 p.m., an employee was loading a tube in the tube bender when a clamp closed on the employee's right fourth and fifth fingers. A portion of the fourth finger was surgically removed the following day.
An employee was leaving the evisceration break room when the door started to close and her right middle finger was pinched in the door jam resulting in a partial amputation.

While delivering product to a customer location, the employee's foot slipped off of a second level of concrete on which the ramp was set up. He attempted to regain his balance by using the hand truck (dolly) to stabilize himself, but the hand truck fell and his thumb was pinched between the ground and the hand truck. This caused a portion of his left thumb to be amputated just above the knuckle (just behind fingernail).

An employee and his supervisor were carrying a boiler part (weighing approximately 110 to 120 pounds) in tandem and placing it atop a pile. The employee was wearing Kevlar Gloves covered with rubber gloves (i.e.; two layers of gloves). The employee was helping to stabilize the boiler part on top of another part already stacked in the pile. The part the employee was adjusting shifted and the employee's left index finger was pinched between two parts. The employee tried to pull his finger out of the pinch point, and suffered a fingertip amputation with the loss of some bone.
On July 19, 2016, an employee suffered a partial little finger amputation while guiding the well casing into a bore hole.

On 7/19/2016, an employee was performing maintenance on a palletizer lift elevator. The lift platform was elevated about 3 inches with a chain fall in order to adjust the lower jack bolts. The elevator dropped, crushing the employee's left index finger between the jack bolt and palletizer elevator resulting in an amputation close to the second knuckle on the left index finger.
On July 20, 2016, an employee experienced a fingertip amputation when the ram of a hydraulic press crushed the employee's finger on a trunnion part.
An employee amputated his right index finger when he was fixing the polarizer machine.
The employee observed a broken rubber conveyor band and attempted to remove it. He reached into the conveyor power roller and amputated the right index finger and lacerated the middle finger.

While conducting maintenance on the battery charger of an order picker, an employee's right index fingertip was caught between the chain and cog of the order picker and amputated when the order picker was activated.

An employee was trying to flip a metal stair stringer over when it fell onto his hand and crushed his index finger between the stair stringer and the concrete resulting in the amputation of the index fingertip.

On July 20, 2016, at approximately 12:30 pm, an employee was in the process of moving a loaded barge with a cable that travels through a sheave. The employee's hand became caught in the sheave amputating the employee's right index, middle, and ring fingers at the first knuckle.

An employee was cleaning the material feeder into a mechanical punch press. The employee's glove got caught in a gear of the feeding machine. The finger was pulled into the gear crushing it. This resulted in the amputation of the right  index finger at the first joint
The employee was positioning metal into a hydraulic press brake and amputated the tip of the second digit on his left hand.
An employee working in the deli department was slicing meat when his finger slipped and struck the blade of the deli slicer, resulting in a fingertip amputation to the left pinky finger.

Two employees were working on a motor to prepare it to ship to a customer. One employee was lubricating and greasing the bearings while the other employee was manually turning the shaft. The employee turning the shaft got his finger pinched between the v-belt and pulley amputating his right index finger just below the cuticle.

An employee was cleaning and adjusting the chain on the stationary fixed gear bike (35 pound flywheel) when the towel in his right hand got caught in the chain pulling his right hand in between the cog and chain and amputating the right index fingertip.
While using a band saw to cut pork chops, an employee amputated the right thumb tip, including portions of the finger nail.
An employee was unjamming the cement cylinder gate and amputated his right index fingertip.
An employee was walking by as a coworker was replacing a pallet jack wheel and hitting a safety pin with a hammer. A metal piece of the pin then hit the employee's eye, resulting in an eye loss.

On July 22, 2016, at approximately 4:57 a.m., an employee was attempting to clean a jammed chute when a gate closed and pinched his finger(s) resulting in an amputation to his right index finger just past the first knuckle.

An employee had finished rolling and wrapping a deck sheet and was using a hoist with hooks to lift it when he noticed a problem and grabbed the hook. At the same time, the deck sheet came out of the hook on his side. His finger became wedged between the air bar with the rolled deck sheet and the bracket that holds the air bar on the power roller, partially amputating his left ring fingertip.
An employee was attempting to unplug a sausage grinding machine when the grinder amputated four of his left-hand fingers.
While cleaning the interior of a regrind tank an employee sustained a right ring finger amputation and a partial middle finger amputation. The rotating valves were not guarded at the time.
An employee was preparing to unjam a machine when the machine cycled and amputated the employee's right index fingertip.

On 7/22/16, at 10:30 a.m., an employee was setting up a shear to shear parts and was adjusting the stops. During the setup, the shear cycled and his left middle finger was caught in the pinch point between the bench and the part hold-down, amputating his fingertip.
An employee's right hand got caught in a rolling machine. The ring, index, and middle fingers were amputated to the 2nd knuckle and the thumb tip was amputated.

An employee was trying to install a plug on a blender conveyor to stop meat trimmings from going into the blender. Her fingers then came in contact with the conveyor paddle of the conveyor, amputating a portion of the third finger (from the fingernail to the tip) and causing an avulsion to the second finger.

An employee was operating a crane via wireless remote to move a wrapped coil. The employee noticed the hooks began to slip, so the employee sat down the coil bundle and attempted to remove the paper wrapped around the coil. In doing so, one of the hooks jolted and caught the employee's right index fingertip, amputating it.

An employee was attaching the bush hog arm to the tractor hitch. The arm slipped over the hitch and pinched the tip of the employee's right middle finger resulting in the avulsion of the fingertip and nail.

An employee was wakeboarding when he tried to pull himself closer to the boat with the rope. He let go of the rope and it became wrapped around his left ring finger, amputating his fingertip from the first knuckle up.

An employee was using a brake press to form parts. The employee changed the die to flatten forms that were done incorrectly. When the brake press was actuated, the employee's right index finger was amputated to the first digit. The employee also experienced the avulsion of the right middle fingertip.
An employee was closing a chain-link gate when his middle fingertip became caught in the gate roller and was amputated.
An employee was transferring a block of frozen dog food weighing 50 pounds when the block dropped on his hand, amputating his left index fingertip.
An employee lifted a dog onto a table and suffered a possible hernia.
On July 26, 2016, an employee was rotating a part on a manual lathe when the rotating piece amputated the employee's right index fingertip and lacerated the thumb.

An employee was cleaning a roller and jogging the machine when the machine caught the rag and pulled it and his hand into the machine. His left ring fingertip was amputated and the skin was peeled back.
The employee was emptying chocolate from a melting tank and got his right hand caught between the agitator and the wall of the tank amputating his right ring fingertip.

An employee was using a crane to empty the scrap bin. As he was lowering the scrap bin's handle, his left thumb was caught between the handle and the steel bin, amputating it at the first joint and requiring reattachment surgery.

An employee was cleaning a conveyor. The floor of the immediate area was wet due to cleaning. The employee slipped and attempted to catch himself by grabbing the conveyer. His thumb and forefinger became caught in the conveyor, which was operating in cleanup mode. His left index fingertip and thumb tip were amputated.

Two employees were clearing a tree that had fallen on a utility pole in order to put the pole back in service. A limb from the tree broke off and fell onto the two employees. The first employee suffered broken ribs and a punctured lung. The second employee suffered a broken hip, broken ribs, and a punctured lung. Both employees were hospitalized.

An employee was conducting maintenance on the HVAC when the wind caused the HVAC blades to unexpectedly move, amputating the intermediate phalange of the employee's right middle finger and the distal phalange of the right ring finger.

An employee was loading stock material in a CNC machine when the machine became jammed. As the employee attempted to remove the jam, the machine cycled and amputated 1/4 to 1/2 of an inch of the employee's right middle finger.

The forklift operator was lifting the bin of tootsie pops. The bin slipped and the injured employee was trying to remove the bin that had fallen when his left index finger was caught between the bin and the steel rail. The left index finger was amputated between the first and second joint.
An employee was cleaning the batch mixer when the mixer pinched and amputated the fifth digit fingertip on the employee's left hand.

An employee was attempting to help repair a bag machine that was down. When he used a jog button to energize the machine, the cutting blade partially amputated his right middle finger at the first joint. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.
An employee was working on an outside sand belt when the belt slipped and pulled his hand back, resulting in a left ring finger amputation.

An employee was fabricating parts in a press brake. The employee bent a part and the part fell back. When the employee reached for the part, the press was activated via the foot pedal and pinched the employee's middle finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was operating a pipe threading machine, cutting small pieces from large pieces, when his right thumb was pinched between an elbow and the threader, partially amputating his thumb tip.
An employee was cutting stakes using a skill saw and amputated his left index finger.
An employee was running a rib/navel saw in the fabrication department and amputated the tip of the left middle finger.
An employee was setting a rabbit cage on the dock when his finger got caught between the wheel on the cage and the loading dock.
An employee suffered a right ring finger amputation when the finger was caught between a large metal door on the back of a truck and a metal trash container.
An employee was using a trimmer to cut sections of wood when his hand entered the blade area. At the same time, the blade activated and amputated three fingers on the employee's right hand.
An employee was using a miter saw. As he pulled the miter saw blade down to make a cut, his thumb was in the path of the blade and was amputated below the first joint.

An employee tried to free up a cam follower by turning the belt system. The cam follower loosened and turned very quickly, catching and lacerating the employee's right little finger, with a possible fingertip amputation.
An employee operating a 250-ton model press experienced a left pinky fingertip amputation above the knuckle.

While conducting well-servicing operations, an employee was setting up the work floor of a workover rig. The employee slipped on loose dirt, causing him to lose his grip on the wing portion of the rig floor. The wing portion fell, landing on his left ring finger and amputating the fingertip.

An employee was working on the rollers after the tipper belt on a machine and was replacing a band on the drive shaft. He was trying to get the new band on the drive shaft when his right thumb tip was amputated. The machine was running at the time of the incident.

An employee was working on a machine with a coworker. The coworker jogged the machine without realizing that the employee's hand was inside. His left pinky was caught by the gears, and his fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee's middle finger was partially amputated while using a table saw, requiring reattachment surgery.

An employee was using a pipe threader to thread a pipe. When the employee released the chuck on the pipe threader, the pipe dropped. The cut end then came up and amputated the employee's left ring finger to the first knuckle.
An employee was bitten on the hand by a patient. The right index fingertip (soft tissue only) was amputated.
On July 28, 2016, an employee experienced a finger amputation when using a wrench and hammer to clear a jammed rock from a running conveyor.
While installing a refrigerator and pushing it into place, an employee's finger became stuck between the wall and the refrigerator. The employee's right index fingertip was amputated.
An employee amputated the left middle fingertip while cleaning a mixer.

An employee was assigned to install a small hydraulic cylinder at 6 Clean #1 Payoff hold down roll. The employee had the cylinder in place on the blank end clevis with the pin inserted. While the employee was lining up the rod end clevis, their right hand pinky finger was partially inserted in the pin hole. When the cylinder dropped, it struck the tip of the employee's gloved finger resulting in amputation of an eighth of an inch of the finger. The amputation did not include bone.

Employees were removing sections of side panels from an open ended cooler that was approximately eight feet above the lower surface. As employees carried a disconnected side panel across an unbolted belly panel, the belly panel collapsed. The employees fell through the opening and the side panel they had been carrying fell with them. Employee 1 suffered a fractured left tibia and fibula and a fractured right femur. Employee 2 suffered a fractured left ankle, a dislocated left patella, and a back injury. Both employees were hospitalized.
On July 30, 2016, an employee suffered an arm amputation while working on the 550 ton press.
An employee was using a utility knife to cut cardboard strips out of a full sheet of cardboard and amputated the left ring fingertip.
An employee was troubleshooting a CD 4.2 muffler pack machine when it was cycled resulting in the amputation of the left middle fingertip between the frame and machine arm.

An employee was backing up the stacker truck with his left hand on the control lever when he pinched his left pinky finger between a rack and the stacker truck control lever resulting in the amputation of two-thirds of the pinky finger.

Two employees were performing maintenance on a lift by a tower and were being transported in a basket up the lift line. When the basket arm contacted the sheaves of the tower, the basket jettisoned from the cable. The two employees fell with the basket 25 feet to the ground. Both suffered broken bones and concussions.
An employee was using a sliding table saw to cut wood when the wood kicked back, causing the saw blade to amputate the employee's left index finger.
An employee was preparing to sterilize several hock cutter parts. While the employee was placing the parts into the sterilization container, the employee's left index fingertip was amputated.
An employee was cleaning underneath a band saw when his left-hand pointer and middle fingers were partially amputated by the saw blade. The saw was running at the time of the incident.

An employee and a coworker were trying to hitch a cube wagon to feed cattle. The hitch would not latch onto the ball of the vehicle, so the employee used his finger to check what was causing the problem. The hitch latched onto the ball while his finger was caught in between, amputating his left index fingertip.

An employee was bending rebar when the rebar-bending table he was working at activated while his finger was in the danger area. His left pinky finger was pinched between the machine and the metal rebar, amputating it at the first knuckle.

An employee was operating a forklift. When he went to pull the cord to activate the door opener, his right hand became caught in the cord. As he moved forward, his ring fingertip was caught and amputated between the cord and the roll cage on the forklift.
An employee was retrieving items from a car when the door closed on his left index finger, amputating it below the nail.

An employee collected a sample cylinder of gas and was placing the cylinder into a weather guard job box that is used to organize the sample cylinders. The job box drawer closed on his left hand, amputating his left ring finger at the first joint, right below the nail.
An employee's thumb tip was amputated while feeding wire into a crimping machine.
An employee was bending pipe when his thumb became pinched between the pipe and the bender shoe, amputating his thumb tip.

An employee was helping a coworker change out a plug catcher. After re-inserting the screen, the employees attempted to attach the connection. As the connection cap was pushed forward to prepare it for threading, the loose bolts on the cap allowed for significant play and crushed the employee's left thumb between the cap and flange bolts. The employee's left thumb was partially amputated below the fingernail.
An employee was removing a twisted belt from a motor. A finger got caught between the belt and pulley amputating the employee's middle fingertip.

An employee was performing maintenance on a plastic grinding machine. As he was attempting to dislodge a plastic piece in the machine, his left ring finger was caught between a belt and pulley, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was scanning boxes when an unload device roller rolled over her hand, amputating her left index fingertip.
An employee was grinding on a machine. When he attempted to grab the metal part being worked on, his left ring finger was amputated at the first knuckle.

On 8/2/2016, an employee and a coworker were moving a piece of equipment onto a wooden block. The employee's left index finger was pinched between the equipment and the wooden block, partially amputating his fingertip.
On 8/3/2016, at 1:00 p.m., an employee was holding a boat board with her left hand and using a utility knife to cut it. She slipped and partially amputated her left thumb, requiring stitches.

An employee was using a pneumatic grease gun to grease a trailer chassis when the gun began to malfunction. As he lifted the unit attached to the grease drum to troubleshoot the problem, his left hand slid. The moving piston then amputated his pinky fingertip between the first and second knuckle.

An employee was positioning an air tank for installation using an overhead crane when his thumb was pinned between the frame and the tank's mounting leg. The distal tip of his left thumb was amputated.
An employee was using a meat saw to cut meat when his hand slipped and his right index fingertip was amputated by the saw.

An employee was operating a table saw using an 8-inch blade to cut a piece of wood. The wood piece became caught in the blade and was pulled in along with the employee's left index and middle fingers. His left middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was operating a machine to load wood slabs for processing into doors. As the employee was attempting to remove cardboard from the bottom of the slab being handled, the machine clamped onto the slab. The employee's left middle and ring fingertips were crushed and amputated between the slab and the clamp. The employee was hospitalized.

An employee was working on a machine and jogging it to perform maintenance. The jog button was activated and the machine engaged, pinching and amputating the employee's left ring fingertip in the point of operation.
Two employees were pressure washing the inside of a stairwell when they were overcome by carbon monoxide fumes. They were both hospitalized.
An employee was leaving a mobile tool trailer when the door broke and caught his right index and middle fingers, amputating his fingertips.

An employee was performing maintenance on a trimmer saw. When the employee removed the chock block, the saw blade rotated, amputating a centimeter of his index finger (no nail or bone loss) and avulsing his middle finger.
An employee's finger was caught and amputated in a hydraulic gate lift.
While attempting to put the chain back on a cartoner machine, an employee's fingertip became caught in the chain and sprocket and was amputated.
An employee was trapped under a coil of steel that fell on the employee's foot resulting in the amputation of his foot.
On 8/4/2016, an employee was using a sand blaster when a chain broke and fell on his toe, amputating it.
While removing a flex hose from a machine, an employee's hand slipped and contacted a moving part. The employee's left-hand index and middle fingertips were amputated.
An employee was cleaning a piece of metal on a belt sander when the metal piece slipped out of the employee's control and came back to amputate his fingertip.

An employee was preparing to load a truck of emulsion. While he was lowering the stairs, the truck's loading arm drifted, catching his hand between the loading arm and spring mechanism. His ring finger was partially amputated.

An employee was helping a coworker unload drums using a drum dolly. The coworker had secured the 800 lb. drum to the 1000 lb. capacity drum dolly. As the coworker attempted to tilt the drum dolly back, the employee placed his hand on the back side of the drum. The drum then slipped off the dolly, which in turn fell back into place and caught the employee's hand between the drum being lifted and another drum that was still on the truck. The employee suffered a partial amputation of the right middle and ring fingers.

An employee had just cleared a jam in a conveyor when he turned left to walk away from the conveyor while his right hand was still resting on the guard. His right hand slipped and made contact with the conveyor, and his right pinky and ring fingers became caught between the roller and the fixed roll. His right ring fingertip was amputated, and his right pinky finger was fractured.
On August 5, 2016, at 1:15 PM, an employee's finger was caught in the pinch point of a press brake, amputating his left ring fingertip.

A temporary employee was operating a reach truck when the truck started heading straight toward a pedestrian guardrail. When the employee attempted to dismount the truck, the employee's foot became pinned between the reach truck and the guardrail, resulting in a left foot amputation.
An employee was in the process of attaching handles to a 30-quart cooler when her hand was caught on a piston, amputating her right middle fingertip.
An employee was walking through a metal door when it closed on the employee's right pinky fingertip, amputating it.
A decoiler slipped off of forklift straps and crushed an employee's right-hand pinky and middle fingers, amputating them.

An employee was holding meat in front of a vertical saw blade to cut it when the employee's foot slipped on the floor. The employee's right index finger then impacted the saw blade and was partially amputated with bone loss.
An employee was raising the safety rail on the conveyor and holding onto the vertical support rail. His left middle finger was caught in the hinge amputating the fingertip.
An employee was attempting to secure a nasogastric tube to the bridge of a patient's nose when the patient bit the employee, amputating the employee's right pinky fingertip.
An employee was attempting to fix air conditioning vents on a trolley when the fan blades inside the air conditioning unit amputated his fingertip.

On or about August 6, 2016, an employee was using a vehicle-mounted winch when the holding mechanism malfunctioned and the wire cable kept unwinding. The employee could not pull their right hand back in time and it was pulled into the first "sheave" that was about 6 feet away from the winch, amputating three fingers.

After using the meat cutting band saw, an employee turned off the machine and was pushing down the blade guard. The blade, which was still slowing down, amputated the employee's right middle fingertip.

An employee was loading an LD8 (large cage for baggage) onto a cargo bed dolly. The LD8 shifted and his hand was pinned between the LD8 and the flat bed dolly, possibly amputating his left middle finger.
An employee opened one of the two doors on the rail cars. The door swung around and made contact with the plate and the employee's finger resulting in a distal amputation.

On 8/8/16, an employee was cutting metal on a shear. The employee's gloved hands became caught in the metal hold-down pads that push the metal into the shear. The employee suffered a right-hand middle fingertip amputation, as well as left-hand middle and index fingertip amputations.
An employee opened a door for another person. The door then shut on his right-hand middle finger, partially amputating it.
An employee was crimping tube on a block machine when his left-hand ring finger was caught, crushed, and amputated in the clamps.
An employee was trimming shrubs with gas-powered shears when the shears amputated his right-hand index fingertip.
An employee was trying to readjust a trailer hitch when the employee's finger was caught and partially amputated between the trailer hitch and the ball of the truck.
An employee was using a skill saw to cut plywood for concrete forms and cut his left index finger to the middle of the nailbed (no bone loss).
An employee's left-hand middle fingertip was crushed and amputated while the employee was attempting to repair forming equipment.
An employee was changing the shock absorber on a military truck when the replacement shock absorber shifted during installation and amputated 1/2 an inch of the employee's left index finger.
An employee was working behind a piece of equipment when he tripped and fell into a belt and pulley, amputating his left index and middle fingers up to the first joint.
An employee's foot/ankle was crushed after getting caught between a wall and a pallet jack.
On or about August 8, 2016, an employee attempted to wipe away dust near the pinch point on a press machine. The press came down and amputated the employee's right thumb tip.
An employee's right index fingertip was amputated.

An employee and a coworker were working on the glass front entryway door. The employee was adjusting the door-closing mechanism with the door closed. The coworker opened the door while the employee had his finger in the closing mechanism. It closed like a scissor and amputated the employee's right index fingertip.
An employee was manually turning a drive belt when their thumb was caught between the roller and the belt resulting in a partial amputation of the right thumb.

An employee was staging a part on a coordinate measuring machine. The employee put the part onto the fixture. A hole in the casting into which the fixture pin is placed was not big enough. The employee placed the part on its side to deburr the hole out. The employee was repositioning the part onto the fixture when it slipped and crushed his finger between the part and the fixture, amputating his fingertip. The part weighed about 56 pounds.
An employee was removing a clump of fertilizer from a screw conveyor when two fingers on his left hand became caught and partially amputated in the conveyor.
An employee's left-hand pinky finger was crushed between press dies, requiring a partial amputation.
An employee was attempting to pull a long piece of material through a rotary cutter when two of his fingers were caught in the machine. His right index and ring fingertips were amputated.
An employee was using a choker chain and hoist to lift material and relocate it. The hook slipped and pinched his left ring fingertip, amputating the fingertip.

When the employee placed a piece of metal into the shear, the weight difference between the heavy end and lighter end caused the piece of metal to be raised above the shear table. The shear cycle then activated via the foot pedal, and the hold-downs and guard lowered and forced the piece of metal down toward the shear table. The employee's right index fingertip was pinched and amputated between the metal and the shear table.
An employee was cleaning a laminate glue machine when his right thumb became stuck in the machine rollers, amputating his thumb tip.

A belt on an auger became jammed with wheat. An employee turned off the power to the auger and attempted to loosen the belt. The belt temporarily released and pulled the employee's finger between the belt and a pulley, amputating the employee's left index fingertip.
An employee was removing a tire from a split rim wheel on a heavy truck when the lock ring was blown off of the assembly. The force amputated the employee's 3rd, 4th, and 5th digits on the left hand.

An employee was operating a table saw to cut a piece of wood when the wood became bound in the saw blade and kicked back, causing the employee's left thumb to contact the blade. The thumb tip was amputated with some bone loss.

On 8/11/2016, at approximately 3:05 PM, an employee was cutting a stair stringer with a circular saw when the board moved. As he attempted to grab the board, the saw kicked back and amputated his left middle fingertip.
An employee was cleaning a roll of steel when the roll cycled and amputated his right index finger.

An employee was using a 2-inch screw pipe to remove a coupler. He used a pipe threading machine and pipe wrench to force the coupler to screw off. His right ring finger was pinched between the pipe wrench and the pipe threading machine, amputating his distal fingertip.
An employee was disassembling equipment when his hand contacted a running belt and was drawn into a pinch point, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was moving a vat on a vat lift. When he attempted to correct the alignment of the vat, his finger was pinched between the vat and the vat lift, amputating his fingertip.

On or about August 11, 2016, an employee was cutting steel bar stock on a band saw when the employee's left index finger was caught between the band saw stop and the bar stock as a vertical vice closed to secure the bar stock. The distal phalange on the finger had to be surgically amputated.
While repairing a grill exhaust fan, an employee suffered an amputation of the right index finger at the first joint and a fractured right middle finger at the first joint.

On or about August 11, 2016, an employee was adding ink to the decorator can printing machine when the ink fell. When the employee attempted to grab it, the employee's hand became caught between the plate cylinder and the blanket segment, amputating the left ring finger.
An employee was operating a bread molder/slicer machine. His right index finger was caught in the machine, amputating his right fingertip above the fingernail.
An employee amputated a fingertip (no bone) while slicing onions with a knife.
An employee was performing maintenance work on the cotton gin when a piece of the equipment shifted and amputated the left index fingertip.

An employee was moving a 55-gallon drum off a tommy-lift to a pickup truck. The employee tilted the drum back to roll it off the lift and released the drum. The drum pinched the employee's left pinky finger between the other drum, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was holding a piece of plywood in his right hand by the steel structure of a conveyor. A forklift was returning a dumpster to that area and the forklift struck the plywood pressing the employee's finger between the plywood and the steel structure of a conveyor. The tip of the employee's right ring finger was amputated.

An employee was working on the extrusion line. During the process of removing the shaft from the roll, the employee used his right index finger to release the air from the shaft. He pushed the button to move the shaft carriage system upward with the left hand. The shaft carriage system crushed his right finger between the shaft carriage system and the shaft, amputating his index fingertip.
An employee was cleaning and sharpening the food slicer's blade when her left hand contacted the blade, amputating her pointer and middle fingertips.

An employee was helping other workers dispose of a small engine that was attached to a pulley and a shaft. The workers were turning the small engine to load it on a pallet jack, and the employee reached between them to help load the engine onto the jack. The pulley then slid down the shaft and smashed his pinky finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was working on a sheet metal cutting machine when two fingers on his right hand were caught in a chain and sprocket, amputating his pointer and middle fingertips.

An employee was using a wood processor to process logs. The logs, which were being held down by a clamp, tipped, so the employee opened the processor screen. The clamp then came down and smashed his left-hand little finger. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was running products and laying parts down for sensors to operate. The employee stood a part up, which bypassed the sensors. Four parts were in the catcher and one was being crushed in the machine. The employee attempted to pull the part out and his ring finger was amputated by the stamping machine's lock seamer.
As an employee was verifying that the air pressure on a die-cast machine was at the correct level, the valve actuated and amputated the employee's third right-hand distal phalange.
An employee slipped off a conveyor railing while leveling cheese and his hand entered the tumbler resulting in a partial amputation without bone loss to the right pinky fingertip.

While troubleshooting a machine, an employee leaned against an adjacent hopper machine and propped himself up with his left hand. The hopper housing moved under his weight and pinched this thumb, fracturing bone and amputating his thumb tip.

On Saturday, August 13, 2016, around 4:15 p.m., an employee was attempting to clean the push arm of a conveyor when a positioning device activated and caught the employee's right middle finger, amputating approximately 1 centimeter.
An employee was repairing a motorized tarp on a side-dumper semi-trailer when his fingers became caught in the drive chain and sprocket, amputating his left ring finger to the first knuckle.
An employee was closing the bank vault door and got their finger caught in the door resulting in amputation of the left ring fingertip.
An employee was retrieving a piece of meat from under a deli slicer when her right ring fingertip made contact with the blade and was amputated.
An employee was using an 8-foot ladder when he slipped. As he reached to catch himself, his little finger was caught on a shackle, amputating it.
An employee was observing equipment being offloaded when a piece of wood bounced out and hit his thumb, amputating the tip.

An employee was oiling the production line conveyor during routine preventative maintenance when a rag he was using was pulled into the conveyor along with his left middle finger, partially amputating his fingertip.
An employee was cutting tubing on a cutter when the tubing slipped out of place. She used her left hand to hold it in place. When the blade was activated, it amputated her left index fingertip.

An employee was working on a project on site. He was cutting trim with a circular saw when the trim piece slipped and he tried to keep it from falling. In the process of grabbing the piece of falling trim, his left index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was operating a panel line machine. When he attempted to clean dirt off a panel of sheet metal, his fingers were caught in the rollers of the machine, crushing bones in his left middle and ring fingers. His middle and ring fingertips had to be surgically amputated.
An employee had removed money from a safe in the office area and was closing the safe door when her hand was crushed between the safe door and the door jam. Her right thumb was partially amputated.

An employee was feeding rebar coil into a coil bender machine. He was trying to free a jammed coil from the measuring wheel with a screwdriver when the tool became jammed in the measuring wheel. This caused the coil to snag his glove and drag his thumb and index finger back into the transport wheels. His right index finger was partially amputated.

An employee was adjusting a pedestal fan when his fingers went through a gap on the underside of the fan and contacted the running blades. His left middle finger was amputated and his index finger was cut.
An employee was cleaning fiber from vacuum tubing that had a cut-off valve (piston). The piston closed on his hand, amputating his left-hand index fingertip.
An employee was in the shop using a permanently mounted punch machine, which makes 1-2" diameter holes in steel, and amputated his left index fingertip.

An employee was operating a 10-inch table saw to cut a piece of 1/4-inch plywood when the plywood kicked back and caught his finger. Due to the extent of the injury, his left index finger had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was moving a part while a die-cutting machine was idle when his hand slipped underneath the machine and struck the chain and sprocket, partially amputating his left-hand pinky fingertip and nail.

On 8/17/16, an employee was helping to remove swabbing tools from an oil well when the swab lubricator pipe fell onto his hands, amputating his right thumb and injuring his left thumb and pinky finger.
An employee was preforming maintenance on a dryer and was greasing the gears when his right middle finger was caught between the gears, amputating his right middle fingertip.

An employee was attempting to remove a bucket attachment from an excavator when his right middle finger was caught between the attachment and the attachment point. His fingertip was smashed and subsequently amputated.
An employee sustained a right index finger amputation while cutting all-thread pipe using a portable band saw.
An employee was cleaning the rollers of a vane machine when his right index finger became caught in the rollers, amputating it to the first knuckle.

An employee was installing a fan belt while another mechanic was rotating the sheave by hand to walk the belt on. The injured employee's glove became caught between the belt and the motor sheave, and the employee's fingertip was pulled between the belt and sheave, amputating it to the first joint.
An employee was trying to unbind a conveyor chain by turning the drive pulley backwards. The chain jumped causing his left thumb to become caught and amputated in the chain and pulley.
Two employees sustained severe burns after coming into contact with hot molasses as it overflowed from a holding tank in the production area.
Two employees were shocked when the ladder they were holding contacted a powerline.
An employee was setting up a vertical lathe machine. The employee was adjusting the tool holder when it dropped, striking the employee's left pinky finger and amputating the fingertip.
While cutting pork with a vertical band saw, an employee suffered a left index finger amputation.
An employee was feeding material into an extruder when his right finger(s) were caught and amputated in the machine.

On or about August 20, 2016, at 5:30 p.m., an employee was helping another employee to move a mold to be repaired on the 18-station blow molder when his right pinky finger was caught in the machine. His pinky fingertip had to be surgically amputated just past the nailbed.
An employee was positioning a heavy steel "dog bone" on a flat surface when the steel crushed and amputated his right little fingertip.
An employee was using a knife to cut chicken when the knife cut his finger, resulting in the amputation of his left index fingertip (no bone loss).
On August 21, 2016, an employee was removing a locking pin in the bead room when the employee's left index finger was pinched and partially amputated between the drive shaft and locking pin.
An employee was removing a guarding panel on a conveyor belt. When the last bolt was removed, the panel swung down and amputated the employee's left ring fingertip.

While preforming preventative maintenance on a machine, an employee's rag was caught. When the employee attempted to grab the rag, the employee's fingertip was caught and amputated in the chain and sprocket.

While using a table saw to cut down plastic parts, the tip of an employee's glove was caught by the saw pulling the employee's thumb into the saw and removing the flesh from the very tip of the right thumb. No bone was removed.
An employee suffered an amputation while checking a new die.
An employee was trying to release materials caught in the knife area at the end of the flexible bagging machine when the guillotine knife blade amputated the first joint of the left index finger.

An employee was changing a roll on a packaging machine when a roll of paper became hung up on a frame. The employee attempted to free it by pushing on the roll. When it came free, the employee's right index finger was caught between the frame and the roll of paper, amputating it at the first digit just behind the nail.

An employee was operating a brake press to bend a 10-inch piece of metal with the long end in the machine. His hand entered the point of operation, crushing and avulsing his left ring and middle fingertips, which had to be amputated.
An employee was moving a mobile conveyor belt when his hand was caught between a roof support column and the conveyor, amputating his left pinky finger just below the nailbed.
An employee was shearing a U-shaped piece of metal when the metal folded over and pinched his right index fingertip, amputating it.

An employee was standing on a ladder plugging in the garage door opener motor. He began to fall and grabbed the metal frame that holds the motor to the ceiling. When his hand contacted the metal, he sustained a laceration to the first knuckle of his left ring finger and his pinky finger was amputated.
On August 22, 2016, an employee suffered a partial finger amputation while trying to unjam the hammer in the zinc mold department.

An employee was using a 5-inch pry bar with an angled end to clean glue off from a roller wheel when his left third finger was struck by the angled end of the tool, causing a laceration that required sutures and a partial amputation.

An employee was trying to prevent a machine guard from falling onto the product on the machine when his hand was caught in the machine's pulley system, amputating his right middle finger down to the first knuckle.
On 8/22/16, an employee suffered amputations to the thumb, index, and middle fingers on the right hand (just below the nails).

An employee was working on the deck of the barge assisting with securing the dredge swing anchor. The employee placed his left hand between the anchor and the side of the barge. While lifting the anchor, the employee's left thumb was crushed and suffered a partial amputation (above the knuckle).
While installing steel beams inside of an elevator shaft, an employee's left thumb was caught between two steel beam columns, amputating the tip.
An employee was operating a press brake machine, stamping and bending parts, when his right thumb was caught and amputated in the machine.

An employee was walking and got their left foot caught on a portable set of steps that are along the bottom of the table on the north side. The employee attempted to break the fall and their right hand was caught in a machine amputating the right finger up to the first knuckle.
An employee was changing spools on a wire drawing machine when his right thumb was caught between the lift structure and a spacer block, amputating the thumb tip (no bone loss).
An employee was lifting a bale on the deck of a ship and got a finger caught between the deck lifting eye and the bale resulting in partial amputation of the finger.
While packaging tacos on the taco line, an employee's right ring finger was partially amputated.

Excess sodium hypochlorite was added to a treatment tank causing the pH of an adjacent tank to spike. Sulfuric acid was added to the adjacent tank in hopes of lowering the pH.  Eight employees were taken to local hospitals for exposure to chlorine gas. Two were hospitalized for respiratory irritation.
An employee was securing loads of angle iron when his right ring finger was caught between the two stacks, amputating it below the knuckle.
An employee was slicing meat on a meat slicer and amputated the tip of the ring finger.
An employee was replacing the push/pull solenoid on the sugar receiver and amputated the right index finger while attempting to remove debris from the solenoid.
Two employees were hospitalized after an arc flash burned their hands, arms and faces.
An employee was troubleshooting a conveyor belt and got a hand caught in the sprocket resulting in the amputation of the left pinky finger.

An excavator was lifting a compactor out of an excavation. The cable that was used to lift the compactor slipped and an employee was repositioning the cable when his finger was caught between the cable and the compactor resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was cutting a turkey leg using a slicer and amputated the 3rd and 4th fingertips on his right hand.
Two employees were training at the shooting range and were struck by shrapnel. One employee was struck in the head and the other employee was struck in the abdomen. Both employees were hospitalized.
An employee was unjamming the Gayler, slipped, and caught his left hand in the blades resulting in amputation of four fingers below the knuckle and the thumb tip.
An employee was mowing a residential property and stopped to adjust the blade on the mower. When he reached under the mowing deck, his left middle finger was lacerated and later amputated.
On August 25, 2016, an employee suffered a partial amputation of the right pinky finger while using a metal casting machine to form dimples in the castings.
An employee was clamping lumber pieces together and pinched his left pinky finger amputating the fingertip.

An employee's foot was caught in a pinch point between the shell of the melting furnace and the casting floor mezzanine while attempting to unlatch a hook related to the safety bin chute. Three toes on the employee's left foot were amputated.
An employee was operating a standing dock forklift and got his foot caught between a pole and the forklift. The employee's left foot was crushed and partially amputated at the hospital.

An employee was reversing the right-angle pneumatic driver equipped with a tapping bit when the driver caught his glove and twisted it around the tapping bit, damaging his left pinky finger. The pinky finger was amputated at the first joint in the emergency room.
An employee was delivering mail to a residential home and cut their finger on a mailbox resulting in amputation of the finger.

On August 28, 2016, the owner of the independent contractor crew and his laborer were moving a wheel barrow of material when it struck a metal pole of a pump jack scaffold. The pump jack scaffold was dislodged and the top pole of the scaffold struck an overhead power line. Both men attempted to move the wheel barrow and the scaffold with their hands and received an electrical shock and third degree burns to their hands. Both were hospitalized.
An employee was operating an undercut saw and amputated the right middle fingertip (no bone loss).
An employee was cutting steaks while wearing metal cut gloves when the knife went through a hole in her gloves resulting in a left index fingertip amputation without bone loss.
An employee was troubleshooting the dough pump and amputated the fleshy tip of the right middle finger.
On August 26, 2016, an employee sustained a fingertip amputation after contacting a rotating blade on a moulder machine.
On 8/26/16 an employee was operating a brake press and lost part of his left middle finger.
An employee was cleaning the dough dividing machine when it started and amputated two fingertips on the right hand.
An employee was working on a conveyor and got their right hand caught in the chain and sprocket resulting in amputation of the little finger at the first joint.

A crane operator and another employee were lifting two steel beams. The crane operator did not notice that the other employee had his hand between the beams. When he began lifting the beams the other employee's hand became caught between the beams resulting in amputation of the right middle fingertip.
An employee's small finger was amputated when pinched between a part and the punch press machine frame while the employee was catching parts coming off the machine.
An employee was starting up a bagging machine and suffered a fingertip amputation.
On August 26, 2016, an employee sustained a fingertip amputation while cutting paper off of a bag folding machine.

An employee was checking bolts on a truck mounted rolling concrete mixer. The employee reached for a wrench that was stuck on the mixer and pinched the right index finger between the wrench and truck mounted pedestal. The initial injury was a severe laceration that later became a surgical amputation.
The employee was bending over to remove a bad printed copy. Their left hand was on the stacker/bundler when the plunger engaged and amputated the left index finger.

A temporary employee was cutting molding on a miter saw. The saw blade hit a knot and caused the wood molding to kick back. The employee's hand was pulled into the saw blade and her right index finger was amputated.

A employee's left ring finger was amputated when the employee and another employee were moving a wheeled cart with two I beams on it. The cart ran over a bump, the I beams shifted, and the employee's left ring finger was crushed between the two beams.

An employee was cleaning a dough press machine while it was running. The machine caught the rag in the employee's hand and pulled her index finger into the blades. The index finger was amputated from the first knuckle.
An employee was removing a bolt from the die and caught their left index finger in between the die and the bolt resulting in amputation of the finger.
An employee was lowering an aircraft door and caught a finger in the track amputating one half of his left index finger.

The employee was reaching into a tool box and slipped and fell to the ground. During the fall, the employee grabbed the tool chain which caused the tool box lid to slam against his fingers resulting in a partial amputation of a finger.

The metal shelf inside a wheeled container of mail was loose and fell on an employee's finger while the container was being pulled, causing a serious laceration. The finger may have to be surgically amputated.
An employee was ripping a board using a circular saw and amputated part of his left thumb.

An employee had his hand on a screen printer while another employee was performing a calibration. The machine went to park and caught the employee's left thumb. The left thumb was amputated from the nail forward.

An employee was organizing round metal stock on a table in the saw area. The stock rolled and the employee's right ring finger was caught between the stock and the metal table. The fingertip was crushed and later amputated.

An employee was using an industrial blender to screen beads. The employee reached into the bottom of the blender and contacted the rotating blades resulting in a laceration to the middle finger and an amputation of the index finger at the middle joint.

An employee was pulling the release rope on a self dumping hopper. As the hopper was dumping, the hopper slid forward and the safety chain separated causing the hopper to fall off the forks of the lift truck. The employee still grasped the release rope and as the hopper fell his left ring finger was amputated between the fingernail and the first knuckle.
An employee was feeding lumber into the saw and amputated the left ring fingertip.

Two employees were moving a piece of angle iron approximately 19 feet long. The injured employee picked up one end of the angle iron and the other employee pushed the opposite end causing the injured employee to drop the angle iron. His left middle finger was pinched between the angle iron and a joiner bulkhead coaming on the deck resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was operating a hoist and while trying to unhook the basket the employee's right middle finger was caught by the hook and the fingertip was amputated.
An employee was straightening lumber on the landing table to the trimmer when a board or a cant caught his left middle finger between another board amputating it at the middle knuckle.
On or about August 30, 2016, an employee was troubleshooting an issue on a washer when their left hand was caught by the belt and flywheel resulting in an amputation injury.
An employee was changing the battery on a forklift. The battery shifted and smashed the employee's left middle finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip.
An employee was operating a chop saw and amputated one or more fingers on the left hand.

An employee was unjamming a board on the planer mill. A 14' poplar board came off the planer mill belt and pinned the employee's left hand between the board and the barrier guard causing an amputation of the left index and middle fingertips.
An employee's finger was between two steel containers. When a forklift struck the steel container the employee's finger was crushed between the two containers and amputated at the hospital.

On or about August 31, 2016, an employee working in KC-3 maneuvered a floor tile. The floor tile slipped and contacted the employees fingertip between the edge of the tile and the floor opening. The employee suffered a partial amputation of the right middle finger.

An employee was driving a forklift out of the back of a truck when the truck started to roll. The employee jumped from the truck and fractured his foot and degloved the left big toe. Later, two toes were amputated.
An employee was opening boxes with a box cutter and lacerated their left thumb.
An employee was using a wrench to install a belt on the vent fan unit and amputated the ring finger in the belt and pulley.

On August 31, 2016, an employee was reaching for parts that had accumulated on a chain conveyor when their glove was pulled into a chain and sprocket resulting in a partial amputation of the right pinky finger.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation.

An employee was manually pushing into place a rigged bundle of round bar stock onto a storage shelf. The steel rolls shifted and a round bar weighing approximately 120 pounds rolled onto his left middle finger resulting in an amputation at the first knuckle.
An employee amputated the left middle and ring fingers while running metal through the flat press.

An employee and a crane operator were preparing to lift a cutter head (tool) into a transport rack. The crane operator picked up the tool and the employee's finger was caught in a pinch point between the tool and the transport rack resulting in the amputation of the right index fingertip.
An employee was working as a panel saw helper and lacerated the left middle fingertip. The distal phalanx was later amputated.
An employee was cleaning PVC purge from the barrel of an extruder and amputated a half inch of his left index finger.

An employee was exiting the bus when he fell backwards striking his hand on and breaking the fan guard. The fan blade cut his finger resulting in a partial amputation of the right pinky finger distal phalanx.

An employee was using a drill press to drill holes into a part. The employee was wearing gloves and the left glove got caught on the drill bit. The rotating drill bit pulled the employee's fingers into the drill causing an amputation of the left ring fingertip.
An employee suffered the amputation of the right ring and pinky fingertips while moving furniture when the couch fell onto his hand on 09/01/2016 at 11:00 a.m.

An employee was performing maintenance on an air handler unit.  The equipment was shut down, but the belt was still moving.  The employee shined a flashlight on the belt to inspect it and the flashlight contacted the belt, causing her glove to be pulled into the moving belt.  She sustained a partial amputation to her right ring finger.
An employee was helping a delivery driver move the dock plate by hand. The driver let go of the dock plate and it fell onto the employee's hand and amputated a finger.

An employee was installing a frame on a chiller. The employee was positioning two pieces of angle iron to line up the bolt holes when a piece slipped and caught his finger. The left index fingertip was amputated.
An employee suffered the amputation of his right thumb fingertip while verifying the gap of a compressed air valve (80 psi).

An employee was trying to open a door to the work area while a coworker was on the other side of the door washing their hands in the sink. The door was blocked causing it to slam on the injured employee's finger, amputating it halfway up the right middle fingernail.

An employee was positioning the bucket on an aerial lift when his fingertip was caught between the bucket and a ceramic insulator that was hanging from the pole. He suffered a partial fingertip amputation of the left middle finger (distal phalanx).
An employee was cleaning a bread dough machine when the blades amputated the employee's index, middle, and ring fingertips.

On September 5, 2016, an employee was cleaning a conveyor belt when the employee's cleaning rag fell in the machine. While attempting to retrieve the rag, the employee's fingertip was caught and amputated in the conveyor belt rollers.

An employee was manually assembling a steel-framed structure that would eventually be used as a mock-up for training riggers when his left middle finger was caught between a steel I-beam and a metal plate, severing the top half-inch of the finger.
An employee's hand was in the cutting area of a cutter machine when a coworker activated the equipment. The cutter cycled and partially amputated the employee's left index fingertip.

On or about September 6, 2016, at 5:20 p.m., a temporary employee was attempting to remove a piece of plastic from a running machine when the machine caught and partially amputated the employee's right index finger.

An employee was attempting to dump a tilt hopper. He held onto the area where the hopper slides onto the forks and attempted to push the tilt hopper to empty it.  When it dumped, the hopper base pinched his finger between the fork and base, amputating the first digit of his left-hand pointer finger.
An employee tripped while pumping waste water. His left hand landed on the belt of the leachate pump, which pulled his glove and amputated his middle finger.
An employee was repairing the rod on a bore machine when a clamp closed on his left hand, amputating his middle fingertip.
An employee was cutting bacon with a knife when the blade amputated his right index fingertip.
While removing a chain from a sprocket, an employee's hand was drawn into the sprocket, amputating the index finger and injuring the middle, ring, and little fingers.

Two employees were removing form panels from an upper elevation while working from the basket of a lift. One of the employees had his right hand on the basket's handrail, which came in contact with the building's steel beam. The employee suffered a partial amputation of the right ring fingertip.

On or about 9/7/16, at 3:45 a.m., an employee was operating an electric pallet jack with a 6' load when the employee collided with another pallet jack operator. The collision resulted in the employee's left foot being struck by/caught between the pallet jacks, partially amputating three toes.
Two employees were conducting plumbing operations at a construction site when a lull operator hit a beam, causing a roof collapse. Both employees were struck by a beam, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was putting a collar on the shaft of a fixture on a machine when it energized. The employee's right thumb tip was caught between the collar and the shaft on the machine, requiring surgical amputation.

On September 7, 2016, at approximately 12:05 p.m., an employee was lifting a manhole lid when it slipped and pinched his finger between the cover and manhole opening, amputating his right middle fingertip.
An employee was cutting a stake with a skill saw when the saw amputated about one inch of his right index finger.

On or about September 8, 2016, at approximately 3:35 a.m., an employee was turning a belt within a bailer when his fingers were pinched between the belt and sprocket. His left index and middle fingertips were amputated.

An employee was cleaning asphalt material from the back of a truck with a scraper when the truck's tailgate moved and trapped his right pinky finger in a pinch point, amputating it to the second joint.
An employee was using a portable bandsaw to cut a metal I-beam when the saw blade amputated the employee's left index finger.
On or about 9/8/16, an employee was adjusting the forks on a forklift when the left pinky finger was caught and amputated between the forks and a slide bar.
Two employees were mixing Sulphur in a mixer when it exploded, causing burn injuries to both of the employee's hands. They were hospitalized.
An employee severed his left index finger and lacerated his left middle finger.

An employee was going to weld on the casing of a drilling rig. The employee was sitting on/near the control panel with the right hand on the traveling chain and left hand near the controls. The employee's left hand bumped the controls, causing the traveling chain to move. The chain caught the employee's right hand, amputating three fingertips to the first knuckle.

An employee was moving a portable bagging conveyor when the legs folded, causing the employee to fall onto the conveyor. The employee's left- and right-hand fingers were then caught between the legs of the conveyor and the conveyor itself. The left ring and middle fingers were amputated to the first knuckle, and the right index finger required stitches.

An employee was feeling to see if there was a leak at the location when his right middle finger slipped into a hole. A butterfly valve below the hole actuated and caused a partial amputation of the right middle finger.
An employee was unjamming the slitter machine and experienced a crushing injury to a fingertip.

An employee was delivering feed to a client when the line became clogged. When he attempted to unclog the nozzle, his right ring finger and right middle fingertip were partially amputated. The auger was running at the time of the incident.
While loading milk into a tanker truck, an employee's right middle fingertip was pinched and partially amputated between a valve and the tanker truck wall.

On or about September 09, 2016, an employee was cutting a small section of 3" PVC piping with a battery-powered bandsaw. The employee's left middle finger came in contact with the blade, amputating the fingertip.
While setting up a handheld grinder, an employee's hand was caught between the grinding wheel and the lift table, avulsing/amputating the employee's left thumb tip.
An employee suffered a partial amputation to the left ring fingertip while cutting insulation boards with a table saw.

On or about September 9, 2016, an employee was unrolling scrap film from one roll and placing it onto another roll when the edge of the roll slipped off the roller bearings. The employee and a coworker attempted to lift the roll approximately 1/16" back onto the roller bearings, but the roll shifted, pinching and amputating the meaty portion of the left middle finger between the roll and the cradle.

An employee was using a vertical meat cutting bandsaw to cut short ribs. The employee's glove became caught in the working section of the sawblade, resulting in the amputation of the left ring and little fingertips.
An employee suffered a partial amputation of the right thumb when his finger was caught between a metal table frame and a metal box that was raised by a forklift to be moved.
An employee was attempting to unjam a compound machine when the plate came down and amputated the employee's right middle fingertip.
An employee was lifting a dock plate when the plate fell and crushed three left-hand fingers. The fingertips had to be partially amputated.

On or about September 11, 2016, an employee was helping to replace a hydraulic cylinder when the employee's finger was caught between the end of the cylinder and the mounting collar, amputating the left index fingertip.

An employee was troubleshooting a blockage in a dry mix unloading machine. As he was removing a flexible coupling, his finger was lacerated by a rotary air lock fin. He suffered a partial amputation of the right-hand middle finger above the first joint.
An employee was pulling a basket out of the extractor when his right pinky finger was caught between the wall and the basket, amputating 1/2-inch of the fingertip.
An employee was changing a water nipple/bracket when a pig pushed him up against the wall causing the amputation of the second finger on his left hand at about the first knuckle.

An employee was working at the post peeler when the chain that rolls the post peeler became jammed and would not turn over. He shut everything off, but the belt energized and caught his hand in the gear box belt and pulley, amputating his left ring finger.
On 9/12/2016, at 4:30 PM, an employee was driving a powered industrial truck down an aisle. As he turned left, he crashed into a rack and suffered a left thumb amputation.
Sparks from a grinding operation made contact with an open container of flammable liquid, causing it to ignite. Two employees were burned as they attempted to move the container outside.

An employee was adjusting the legs of a floor scale while a coworker lifted the corner of the scale with a pry bar. The pry bar slipped and the floor scale fell and pinched the employee's left index finger, amputating his fingertip.
An employee's left Index finger was caught in a man door, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was holding the corner of a piece of 3/8" steel plate as it was being cut by a shear. The blade failed to cut but caused the plate to tip, applying pressure to the plate corner, which amputated the employee's right middle fingertip.

An employee was helping a coworker place a forklift battery into a forklift when the battery fell over on its side and smashed two of the employee's left-hand fingers (3rd and 4th finger) between the battery and the concrete floor.
Two employees were cutting a jumper wire with cutters when their tool made contact with a live line. They were severely electric shocked, suffering second- and third-degree burns.
An employee was adjusting a bag of salt while it was held up by a forklift when his left ring finger was pinched between the load and the forks, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was working with a take-up spool on a winch when the employee's fingers were caught in the spool, amputating the middle and ring fingertips.
An employee was unclogging the mixer machine and amputated the right middle and ring fingers.
An employee was on a work platform clearing a product line when he slipped and got his hand caught in a metering valve resulting in the amputation of a finger and thumb.

An employee was checking the belt tension and adjusting the motor bracket on a conveyor when his glove was caught in the belt. The pulley then pinched and amputated his left-hand index finger. The belt guard was removed at the time.
An employee was using a date stamper on boxes when her left index finger was caught in the date stamper mechanism, amputating her fingertip.
An employee was operating a hydraulic side-mounted lift on a trash truck when his right middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee was cutting a piece of wood with a skill saw when the saw kicked back and amputated two fingers.

An employee was cleaning the filling machine and emptying it of liquid. She then attempted to see if there was any remaining liquid. Her left index finger was inside a quarter-sized hole where a piston was when the machine activated, causing the piston to move and amputate approximately 1/8" of her left index fingertip. The machine's air source was connected at the time of the incident.
An employee suffered a fingertip amputation.

An employee was pushing a heavy trash bin with a pallet jack when it struck a concrete column, causing the load to shift and crush the employee's finger between 3/4" plywood and the edge of the metal trash bin. His right middle fingertip was amputated without bone loss.
An employee was performing maintenance on a conveyor when his hand was caught between the conveyor and the sprocket, amputating his left thumb.
An employee unplugged the carding machine and then opened the door to clean out debris. The machine then amputated his right index fingertip. The machine was still in motion at the time.
An employee suffered a partial left finger amputation while changing the de-hacking brick machine settings for the next product size that was to be packaged.

An employee was installing a roller jig section with a chain jack. The employee's hand was on the jig while his other hand reached for the chain jack. The jig shifted and caught his fingers between two pieces of steel.
