An employee was cleaning the chain on a motorcycle with a rag when the rag was caught in the chain. The employee's fingers were then pulled into the chain, amputating the right middle and pointer fingertips. The motorcycle wheel was spinning at the time.
An employee's left ring fingertip was amputated while operating a panel saw.

An employee was standing on the mezzanine level while cleaning the dryer hopper. He was using a hose and spraying water into a cleaning port at the top of the hopper. There are moving parts inside the hopper, and it has to be cleaned while the parts are moving. The employee climbed down to ground level at the base of the hopper. There was another port at the base of the hopper, which contained a vane valve on a rotating shaft. The employee's left index finger entered this port, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was loading a cow into a chute when the cow raised her head and smashed the employee's right hand next to the chute, amputating her pinky finger to the first joint.
An employee was using the band saw when his left hand slipped into the blade, cutting a finger. His finger had to be partially amputated.
An employee was cutting a piece of metal on an ironworker machine when his right index finger contacted the underside of the metal piece, amputating the skin from the bottom of his finger.

The employee was operating a hydraulic torqueing machine, completing a torque sequence on a 16" discharge valve. He was using both hands to pick up and position the hydraulic torqueing machine wrench head onto the bolt. The employee had been working with a coworker who was operating the remote controller of the hydraulic torque wrench head. The coworker then activated the wrench head, which was set at 2800 psi and amputated the right index fingertip of the injured employee.
An employee was unjamming a machine when the scrap knives struck the employee's right middle finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was webbing up a press when his finger was caught in the press, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was removing a ball from the throat on a machine when his right index fingertip was amputated in a pinch point.
An employee was re-threading a portion of the re-winder machine when his left middle finger became caught in the machine, amputating his fingertip.

An employee and coworkers were using machetes to cut overgrown brush and grass to create a clear path to use surveying equipment. A coworker's machete struck the left hand of the employee, amputating the employee's left index finger.
An employee's right index fingertip was pinched by a hydraulic cylinder and amputated while performing maintenance work on a press.
An employee was removing left bottom roll belts from a pin at the DR machine. The end of the employee's finger was then caught between the pin and a horizontal brace on a hoist.

An employee was setting up tire force testing machines and changing out rims to fit the size of the tire being tested. He was mounting the bottom portion of a rim. During the mounting, the cylinder is lifted up to ensure the machine lines up properly. The rim he was mounting was off center. When he lowered the cylinder, the rim fell on his index and middle fingers. His index finger was fractured and his middle finger sustained a deep laceration between the hand and first knuckle. His finger had to be surgically amputated.
A temporary employee was cleaning out a running saw and amputated the right pinky finger.
An employee was attempting to install a belt on a pulley system on a PVC mixer machine when his finger was caught between the pulley and the belt, amputating his pinky finger above the fingernail.

An employee was attaching base timber to a green house structure. The employee was drilling holes in the lumber with a power drill when the drill bit caught the aligning string. The string subsequently wrapped around the end of the employee's left middle finger and amputated the fingertip.
An employee was setting up the bagged milk production line when a clamp activated and caught his fingertip, amputating the finger tissue.

On September 16, 2016, around 6:00 p.m., an employee was moving away from an area where she had been adjusting a rail to align boxes to the box stop air cylinder when the actuating cylinder of the conveyor belt pinched her left middle finger. Her fingertip was amputated.

An employee was sorting cauliflower on a machine when it became jammed. While trying to remove the jam, the employee's glove became caught in the feed belt and the employee's left index finger came in contact with the blades, partially amputating it.
An employee suffered a left middle finger amputation while clearing a jam at the seed wheel of the packet filling station. The machine was not shut off and locked out at the time.

An employee was attempting to set up a dryer system to dry peanuts before shipment to a processing facility. The employee's right hand went through the grating of the face of the dryer and the fan blades amputated three fingers. The dryer was in operation at the time of the incident.
An employee was clearing a jam on an energized packaging machine and amputated the end of the right thumb.
On September 17, 2016, while operating a chamfering machine, an employee's third left finger was amputated in the machine's point of operation. The machine's safety buttons were bypassed at the time.
An employee was using a bender machine to bend 4x45x36 conduit elbows. As he went to remove an elbow from the bender, the bender's rear clamp closed, pinching and amputated fingers on his right hand.

An employee was cleaning a conveyor motor chain with a rag and oil when the towel he was using to wipe off excess oil was caught in the chain, along with his hand. Two of his fingers were smashed, and his right thumb tip was partially amputated. The chain was moving and the guard was removed at the time of the incident.

An employee was using a vertical belt sander to deburr a piece of metal. The metal became caught between the sanding belt and a tool rest, which pulled his thumb into the belt behind the tool rest and amputated his left thumb tip. The sander was guarded at the time.

An employee was moving a forklift mounting plate from a shelf onto a pallet. The pallet was lifted on a forklift and the mounting plates were slid from a 3.5-feet-tall shelf to the pallet. The plates have a notch in them, and while the employee was guiding the second plate onto the pallet, his right index finger was amputated at the first knuckle.

An employee was removing clevises from under a blowout preventer (BOP). The employee retrieved the first clevis, but the second clevis was trapped underneath one of the BOPs. He lifted the BOP up and stuck the first clevis underneath to support the BOP's weight (this allowed him to retrieve the second clevis). When he attempted to lift the BOP back up to remove the first clevis, the BOP slipped and fell. His right index fingertip was caught/pinched between the two BOPs, resulting in a finger amputation.
An employee was injured while trying to clear a jam on an injection molding machine.

On September 19, 2016, an employee was sliding a ductwork transition across the ground and tripped over a 4-inch step. The employee fell to the ground and the flange on the ductwork amputated the employee's fingertip.

A crane operator was lowering material and an employee went to remove the hook from the material when the crane moved, causing the chain to tighten and pinch the employee's right index finger between the hook and material. The employee's fingertip was amputated.
A temporary employee was running a punch press when the punch press tripped, amputating his left-hand at the wrist.

An employee was stacking wrapped chicken tender packages when he noticed chicken tenders that had become lodged in the edge sealer of the packaging machine and attempted to remove them. At that point, the machine activated and the blade of the edge sealer impacted and amputated his right index fingertip.
An employee was conducting repairs on the bender machine when his right hand was caught in the machine, amputating his index, middle, and ring fingertips.
An employee was outside of a grain elevator watching the auger operation. When he entered the grain elevator, his left leg was caught and amputated in a running auger.
An employee was bending a piece of rebar when the employee's glove was caught between the rebar and the table, causing an amputation without bone loss.
The employee was replacing a bag on the airlock system when the motor started running. The machine's moving parts amputated the employee's right middle finger.
An employee was performing maintenance and changing the belt on a chip transport pump when his left index finger was caught between the belt and pulley, amputating his fingertip below the fingernail.
While attempting to pull a tray out of an egg wash machine, an employee's fingertip was amputated by the machine's conveyor belt.
An employee was at the labeler station located in the conveyor system. His hand was caught between the moving pallet and the reflector of the photo eye sensor, amputating his right index fingertip.
Two employees received second degree burns to the arms, face, and neck while installing a switch on a pole.
An employee was trying to troubleshoot a case sealer when his left finger was caught in the belt and pulley drive, amputating his left ring finger.
While tripping pipe on a derrick, an employee's left index finger was pinched between a metal beam and a driller collar, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was attempting to cut a piece of trim (wood) with a battery-powered circular saw when his index fingertip was amputated.

On September 21, 2016, around 3:30 a.m., an employee was changing out a 1,400-pound seal-in roller with a hoist when the roller rolled on to his left thumb tip. The thumb tip had to be surgically amputated.

After filling up the milk tanker truck, the employee was closing the plunger valve by hand. The employee's finger was over the edge of the flange, and when the valve was sucked in it amputated the right middle fingertip.

On September 21, 2016, at approximately 7:30 a.m., an employee and two coworkers were conducting routine checks on the plating line when a piece of debris was noted riding on top of the running strip line/plating solution. The employee attempted to remove the debris from the running strip line with a 12-inch spud wrench when his right hand was pulled into the rotating plating rolls, amputating his index finger, breaking his ring finger, and causing an abrasion to his hand.
An employee slipped while inspecting the pre-chiller rocker drive. When he tried to catch himself, his right index finger was caught and amputated in a moving belt.

An employee was helping to load a barrier rail clamp onto a lowboy trailer. When the clamp was over the correct stop on the trailer, he directed the operator to lower the clamp. His left hand was resting on the clamp. As the clamp settled on the trailer, it closed enough to catch and amputate his left ring fingertip.

On or about September 22, 2016, an employee was performing maintenance on a converting machine that makes corrugated boxes when the hinged door swung shut, partially amputating his right ring finger to the distal knuckle.

An employee was helping a coworker empty trash carts into a dumpster. They were lifting the trash cart manually from a loading dock. The trash cart slipped and caught the employee's left middle finger between the trash cart metal frame and the trash cart, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was using a rubber tub to pour water out of a double hung window when the top section of the window slipped and amputated the employee's left index fingertip.
A temporary employee was lining up a concrete form during a changeover. His left middle finger was in a bolt hole when the concrete form slid into position and amputated his fingertip.
An employee was disconnecting a dolly from a trailer when the dolly kicked up and smashed the employee's right thumb.

An employee was picking plastic parts off a machine. When he attempted to dislodge a part that was caught in the machine, the machine blade amputated his left middle finger and lacerated his left index and ring fingers. The guard was in place at the time.
An employee was using a coin press when it crushed and amputated her middle fingertip. The press guard was in place at the time.

An employee was greasing the rollers of the concrete mixing truck when his glove was caught in the pinch point of the moving drum and his fingers were crushed. His right fifth digit was amputated at the first knuckle.
An employee was attempting to clear a jam on a food packaging machine when his left ring fingertip was amputated.
An employee was pushing a wood block along a wood shaper when the blade cut his left forefinger.
An employee was trying to unjam the slide gate on a conveyor when the slide gate contacted and amputated his left middle fingertip. The device was not locked out at the time.

An employee was operating the T-nut machine. She put a piece of stock in the machine and was going to install a T-nut into the end of the stock. She activated the machine for the T-nut installation, but the T-nut did not go into the stock properly. As she attempted to remove the T-nut from between the stock and the ram, her hand hit the limit switch. The ram then plunged forward, pinching her right middle finger between the ram and stock. Her fingertip was amputated. The guard was in place at the time.
An employee was cutting a whole piece of loin into steaks when the bone of the loin caught the saw blade and drew the employee's left index finger into the blade, amputating it.
On or about 9/25/2016, an employee was cutting a squash with a manual vegetable slicer when the slicer amputated part of his nail and his right middle fingertip.
An employee was installing a metal cage in parts storage. The cage had a sliding door, which closed on and amputated the employee's left index fingertip.
An employee was loosening bolts on an axle when it swung down and pinched the employee's finger between the axle and fixture, amputating the right pinky fingertip to the first knuckle.
An employee was cutting wood with a notching machine when the machine's saw blade amputated the employee's left middle finger.
While installing metal ducting, an employee's finger made contact with fan blades, amputating the fingertip.
While attempting to change the railroad track direction, an employee's left thumb was caught and amputated between tracks.
An employee was cleaning the starch feeder hopper when his right index fingertip was amputated by the 2-inch auger at the bottom.
Two employees were struck by amine and suffered burns, requiring hospitalization.

An employee was in the cooler taking boxes of chicken off a conveyor when his glove and right ring fingertip were caught in a knuckle chain on the conveyor. The first distal segment of the employee's ring finger was damaged and had to be amputated.

An employee was holding a 2x3-inch piece of wood and cutting it with a circular saw when the blade amputated his right index finger just below the fingernail. The saw was guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was using a utility knife to scrape sealing seams on a tractor when the part he was holding slipped and the knife cut his right thumb tip. Proper PPE was not worn at the time of the incident.

On the R2 Hoods machine in the warehouse, an employee caught her right index finger in the machine when trying to place a piece of cloth between the pieces of metal. The injury resulted in surgical amputation of the right index fingertip.
An employee suffered a traumatic amputation of the right distal thumb.

An employee was using a crane to lift and move steel tubing onto a roller bed. The chain sling slipped from the crane hook as the tubing was being lowered and the employee's left thumb was pinched between the tubing and a steel beam that was in the roller bed. The employee's thumb was amputated just below the fingernail.

An employee was tipping a pouring cup into a mold (to mark it as bad) while his right hand was on the conveyor belt. The conveyor belt automatically moves when it's ready for the next mold. When it moved forward, his hand became caught between the mold and conveyor belt, amputating his right pinky fingertip.

Two employees were standing side by side attempting to make repairs when the kick-out bar engaged. The kick-out bar ran over the first employee's left foot and caught the second employee's leg between the bar and a bale. The first employee suffered two broken bones between the left knee and ankle. The second employee suffered a laceration and two broken bones in the left foot. They were both hospitalized.
While doing preventative maintenance on a stamping press, an employee's right index finger was caught and partially amputated in the door's chain and sprocket.
An employee was cleaning a pump when the pump actuated and amputated the employee's left ring fingertip.
An employee was installing an auger on a digger derrick. As he slid the kelly bar down into the sleeve, the bar/sleeve amputated his fingertip.

An employee was moving a board that was double-stacked on a chain conveyor. When he moved the top board, his right index finger was pinched by the boards or chain conveyor and his fingertip had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was leveling a washer machine that washes bottling equipment. He placed his hands underneath the machine to remove a shim inside of it when a 6-inch by 6-inch block support cracked, causing the machine to crush and amputate the upper part of his left index finger.

An employee was attempting to close the door of a shipping trailer when the spring from the trailer came loose and was hanging free. As the employee attempted to replace the spring, it recoiled and caught his right thumb, amputating the tip to the first knuckle.
While removing a clog in a coffee bean vacuum, an employee's right index finger came into contact with rotating parts, partially amputating it.

An employee was cleaning bag machine plates with a rag when the rag and his left hand were pulled into the machine, amputating his fingertip between a plate cylinder and impression roller. The machine was running at the time.
An employee was loading/unloading a punch press machine when she suffered a left thumb amputation. The safety guard was in place at the time.
While clearing out a cutting machine's path, an employee's fingertip was cut by the machine. The machine was in operation at the time.

On 09/30/16, at 11:30 a.m., an employee was grinding stock on a pedestal belt sander when the stock became caught, pulling the employee's hand against the sander. The employee's left thumb was partially amputated.
An employee was moving a cabinet when he lost his balance and pinched his left pinky between the cabinet and the door frame. The finger had to be amputated at the first joint.
An employee was using a chef's knife to cut steak when the knife cut her thumb, amputating the tip.
An employee was delivering mail to a resident's home when a dog attacked him, causing an amputation injury to his left index finger.

Employees were using an overhead crane to lift steel plates from the bed of a truck.  An employee attempted to attach chains to offload the steel plates from the truck. As he was lowering the steel plate onto the floor, the plate began to move. His right hand was on the plate and his middle finger was caught between the lip of the plate and the hook, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was trying to free a planet car from a temporary guardrail. When the car became free, the employee's right thumb was amputated below the nailbed.
An employee was near the roll-bending machine while the machine operator was feeding metal into the roller. The employee's index and middle fingers were then caught and amputated in the roller.

An employee noticed that there was lint built up on a mounted fan. He then got a paper towel and began to wipe the lint off. His finger went between the guard, and the fan blades amputated his left index fingertip. The fan was on at the time.

An employee was attempting to fix the gusset of a bag on a bagging machine when the machine closed on his fingers, amputating his right middle fingertip and lacerating his right index fingertip. The guard was in place at the time.

Two employees were installing a 25-foot, 1000-watt halide light onto anchor brackets using a forklift when the metal fixture broke at the knuckle, striking one employee in the head and the other in the back. The first employee was hospitalized with a head injury, and the second was hospitalized with fractured vertebrae.
An employee was trying to correct loose taping on boxes that were on a moving machine when his right middle finger became caught in the machine's moving chain and was amputated.
An employee tripped over a box of coins while closing a safe door. As she fell, her right index finger was caught in the closing door, amputating her fingertip.

A maintenance employee was cleaning out a pump and attempted to flick out a piece of meat. His hand became stuck, and he sustained a partial amputation of his right index finger when he pulled out his hand. The pump was not locked out at the time.
A maintenance employee was manually rotating a pulley to oil the bearings on an air handler when the pulley caught and amputated his left small fingertip. The power was locked out at the time.
An employee was cutting pork loins with a meat-cutting bandsaw when his left middle fingertip contacted the rotating blade and was amputated.

On October 4, 2016, an employee was positioning a mold that was to be lifted by a gantry. The employee's hand was on one of the chains attached to the mold. When the chain was tightened, the employee's left thumb was caught and partially amputated by the chain (tissue and nail loss; no bone loss).
On October 4, 2016, while performing maintenance on a fan, an employee's gloved hand was pulled into a belt and pulley, amputating a fingertip.
On October 5, 2016, an employee suffered a left thumb tip amputation while removing a part from a bale cutter.
Employees experienced dizziness, drowsiness, and headaches after being exposed to carbon monoxide. They were hospitalized.

An employee was helping to move a stick pipe. He was standing on the ground by the pipe wrangler and had his left hand on the pipe. The pipe skate was too close to the pipe so he motioned to the pipe wrangler operator to move the skate back. However, the skate moverd forward, pinching the employee's left index finger between the skate and the pipe. His left index finger was partially amputated.
An employee was attempting to lift a 300-pound stone to place a lifting strap underneath it when his left index finger was caught beneath the stone, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was positioning metal next to hydraulic clamps to prepare the metal for tack welding. The clamp actuated while the employee's finger was between the metal and the clamp, crushing the employee's fingertip. The fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was changing a knockout on a press die when a chain came loose. The employee's left ring finger was then pinched between the die stem and the die knockout, amputating the fingertip.
A maintenance employee was using a sledgehammer to drive a launder pin out when the sledgehammer struck his left pinky finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was walking by an air handler when he heard a strange mechanical noise. He walked behind the air handler to investigate and attempted to stop the machine's moving rubber belt. His right middle finger contacted the belt and was amputated above the knuckle.
An employee as attempting to stop the fan belt on a fan motor pulley when the pulley lacerated his right middle finger.

An employee was dumping trash from a gondola style trash bin into a dumpster. The trash bin began to tip over into the dumpster and the employee grabbed it. The employee's finger was smashed between the bin and dumpster, amputating a fingertip.

An employee was using a sanding cloth to smooth a long shaft in an engine lathe. As he got to the end of the shaft farthest away from the chuck end, his glove became caught between the sanding cloth and the shaft, wrapping his fingers on both hands within the shredding cut-resistant fibers of the gloves. He suffered one finger amputation, a broken left wrist, and right hand lacerations.
An employee was pulling a ground power unit to attach it to a truck when a coworker pushed the unit, which caught and amputated the employee's left ring finger.

On October 6, 2016, an employee was changing out cutter blades when he saw a piece of plastic. As he removed the plastic, his left hand contacted the blades, injuring his index, middle, and ring fingers and amputating his middle finger.

An employee was adjusting the blade on a horizontal coating machine when the spring popped off. The employee and a coworker tried to fix the machine by holding up the blade and reattaching the spring. The spring then partially amputated the employee's finger in a pinch point.
An employee was trying to unjam a turret machine when his right ring finger was caught and partially amputated between the turret wheel and the side of the bowl.
An employee was greasing the rollers of a mixer using a rag. As he was greasing near the rollers, his right hand contacted the roller, crushing and amputating his right index finger.

An employee was replacing a gear on a strapping machine conveyor. Bundles (of aluminum) continued to be put on the strapping conveyor while the employee was installing the gear. When a bundle hit the photo eye, the conveyor belt engaged and amputated the employee's right index finger below the second knuckle. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time.

On 10/6/16, an employee was helping to replace a high-pressure pump that failed. He was attempting to guide the belts back on the pulley when his right index finger wrapped around the belt and slipped onto the pulley. His fingertip was caught and amputated between the belt and pulley.

An employee was cutting wood wedges with a skill saw on a boom lift when the saw jumped and cut the three middle fingers on his left hand. His middle finger was amputated from the bottom of the fingernail up.

An employee was operating a front deck mower. As he was reversing, the mower slid. The employee grabbed the roll bar, and the right index finger was caught between the roll bar and a support beam. The employee sustained a partial amputation of the right index fingertip.

On October 7, 2016, an employee was operating a press brake to bend metal material when the left index fingertip became caught between the material and the front of the machine. A small portion of the finger had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was working at a drum dump station, dumping material into a tumbler.  He was putting a 55-pound steel drum onto the dump station when the drum fell. When he tried catching the drum, his right index finger was caught between the falling drum and the next drum in line to be dumped, amputating his fingertip.
An employee's pinky finger pad was amputated while bending pipe.
An employee's hands were pinched between two pieces of machinery while assembling equipment, resulting in a finger amputation.
An employee was attempting to help a coworker free a jammed/stuck part on a mold press machine when his finger was caught in a defective clamp, which pinched/amputated his left ring fingertip.
An employee was changing a die set on a metal roller form machine using a breaker bar. The breaker bar slipped off the bolt head and struck his right ring finger, resulting in an amputation.

On 10/07/2016, at approximately 8:45 a.m., two employees suffered electrical shock. An employee was shocked while using a concrete saw. Another employee attempted to move the first employee out of the water and was also injured. The employees were hospitalized.
An employee was checking a gap in a pipe machine when his finger was pinched between two rollers, amputating his left middle fingertip.
While performing sawmill operations for the pallet mill, an employee went to unjam a wood board from a saw. His left thumb was then amputated in a chain and sprocket pinch point.

An employee was trying to square a bundle of steel sheets using a 4X4 piece of wood up against an I-beam. The sheets caught the employee's left little finger, removing flesh from the knuckle to the fingertip. The fingertip had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was lowering a folding trailer tongue with a coworker when they lost control of the towing arm. The arm caught the employee's hand, severing the right thumb and partially severing the right pinky finger.
While greasing the ring on a truck drum, an employee's index and middle fingertips were caught and amputated between the rollers and the ring.
An employee was pushing vats of chicken in the deboning area. The employee's left thumb was caught and partially amputated between two vats.

While getting off a salmon cage to board a barge, an employee grabbed the rope attached to a winch system.  The winch was in operation (lowering and raising a hose) and the employee's right hand was pulled into the winch, amputating the ring and middle fingers to the lower knuckles.

On October 10, 2016, an employee installed an oil plug on a crowd gate lubricator. He was using a ladder to descend the crowd gate when the ladder moved. He lost his balance, started falling backward, and grabbed the machine's chain, which pulled his finger through the sprocket. The top portion of his left-hand index finger was amputated.
On 10/10/16, an employee was unjamming a hydraulic shear when his left thumb was amputated.

An employee was loading equipment onto storage racks using a hoist. The hoist's up button was activated, causing the hoist hook to jump. The employee's left pinky finger was caught in the pinch point between the hook and the equipment, amputating her finger to the first knuckle.

An employee was using a 1-ton, 460V electric chain hoist to separate the inner lid of a die from the base (part of a mold die). After removing the material, the die would only partially separate or open about 6 inches. The employee lowered the hoist by a few inches and looked into the die to identify any causes as to why it was not separating. To support himself, he placed his hand on the hoist hook. When he was ready to lift the die again, he grasped the chain and his finger went between the electric hoist hook throat opening. The epoxy seal then gave way and caused an immediate tensioning of the chain, pinching his finger between the chain and throat opening. When he pulled back, his right index fingertip was amputated.
An employee was pushing a board though a saw blade when a splinter entered his hand. His left hand then jerked and hit the turning saw blade, amputating his left thumb above the knuckle.
An employee was removing a net from underneath an airline metal pallet (PMC) when the cargo pallet broke and fell from a forklift onto the employee's thumb, amputating it.
An employee was clearing a jam on the pan washing station conveyor when the employee's left ring finger was caught between two pans, amputating the fingertip.
A slide gate closed on and severely cut an employee's left wrist, resulting in a left hand amputation.

On October 10, 2016, an employee was installing and positioning a regulator on a platform. His left hand was holding the base of the regulator about 1.5 inches above the tie down when his second fingertip was pinched between the regulator and the platform. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was working on a vehicle at the hospital when his thumb was caught between the frame and the switch, amputating his thumb at the joint.

An employee was troubleshooting a machine. The hydraulic clamps were not functioning properly. When the employee placed his hand on the side of the heater, the clamp closed, pinching and amputating his left middle finger.
An employee suffered two fingertip amputations when they were caught in a machine's belt and pulley during an inspection. The machine was LOTO at the time.
An employee was changing a tire using a tire machine when it pinched/amputated his right middle fingertip without bone loss.

While servicing a valve, an employee sent a solenoid to the valve to open it and see if the rubber seat was damaged. The solenoid coil disconnected, which interrupted the solenoid signal and caused the valve to close on the employee's thumb. The thumb had to be surgically amputated.

On October 12, 2016, at 3:10 p.m., two employees were setting up to cut the main 8" gas pipe to install a new pipeline when the pipe coupling failed and the pipe exploded. Debris struck the employees, who suffered facial lacerations and fractures. Both employees were hospitalized.

An employee was in a bucket truck with a jib (rope and pulley system). The employee was using the pulley system to pull up an insulator. While trying to pull up the insulator, the employee's hand was caught between the rope and the pulley resulting in a left index fingertip amputation.
An employee was working on a loose bagasse feeder belt when his right finger come into contact with the belt resulting in amputation.
A temporary employee was operating a packaging machine and amputated the right index finger. The guard was removed at the time of the incident.

An employee's left ring finger was amputated at the first knuckle on October 12, 2016. While the employee was loading a part on a CNC machine, his hand was caught between the casting and the clamp. The employee was not wearing gloves at the time.
An employee servicing a wood chipper suffered a partial am[utation of the right ring finger after going under the machine to engage the belt. The chipper was not locked out/tagged out at the time.
Employees were cutting a water main when a pressurized pipe burst and struck them, causing contusions and lacerations.
An employee was cleaning up granules that spilled onto the floor from a vent hole at the resin transfer system and amputated the left index fingertip.
While rotating a motor housing on an auxiliary oil pump, an employee's left ring finger was pinched in the bolt hole resulting in the loss of left ring fingertip.

An employee was attempting to remove a 1/2 inch drill bit from a battery operated drill equipped with a keyless chuck. The employee was wearing cotton rubber palm gloves and squeezing the keyless chuck to remove the bit. As he pushed the trigger increasing the torque to the keyless chuck his grip slipped and the bit caught the fingertip of his glove twisting it and his fingertip into the bit causing lacerations and a fracture to the employee's left index fingertip.

An employee conducted a pull test on deck tie downs. He then went to move the test unit to dislodge the hook and the swivel nut and all thread shaft shifted catching the employee's right middle fingertip between the test unit foundation and swivel nut. The fingertip was amputated.

An employee was pressing a small steel bracket against a rotating sanding wheel with his hands and fingers to smooth the edge. The bracket flew out of his hand and amputated the right index fingertip.

On October 13, 2016, an employee was troubleshooting a squealing roller on a conveyor. The guard was removed and the employee tapped on the roller with a hammer. The roller caught the hammer and pulled his finger into it. He was transferred to the hospital where the left index finger was amputated at the first joint.
An employee was resizing parts in a press machine and amputated the finger print portion of his left middle finger. Lockout/tagout controls were not in place at the time of the incident.
An employee was cleaning a jam in the cryo-vac machine and caught the left index fingertip on the propeller resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was adjusting a fixture in a hydraulic press and amputated the right index finger behind the nail bed.

An employee was leaning against the truck frame in the back of the truck with his hand resting on the edge of the frame close to the truck's mud flap spring release. A student unknowingly pushed down on the spring amputating the employee's left pinky fingertip.
An employee suffered the amputation of four right hand fingers after their hand was caught in the smooth mill.
An employee was unjamming the tapper machine and amputated the right index fingertip.

An employee was checking the alignment on a blasting machine while it was locked out. The injured employee reached into the machine to check clearance when another employee rotated the wheel by hand. The injured employee suffered the amputation of 3/16 of the index finger.

An employee was using a PIT to carry a plastic 55 gallon drum. The drum became wedged between the forks. When the employee tried to maneuver the drum, his pinky finger was caught resulting in a partial amputation.
An employee was cleaning a running pump and amputated the left middle fingertip.
An employee was unjamming a piece of equipment and two fingers were caught resulting in a deep laceration to one finger and a fingertip amputation on the other.
An employee was cleaning out a gin stand and slipped. Two fingertips on the right hand were amputated when they contacted a sharp edge inside the cotton gin.
A temporary employee operating a "Set Out Press" amputated half an inch of a finger while retrieving a metal part from the press.

On October 14, 2016, an employee had her finger in a pivot point on a backhoe assembly to determine if the two holes were aligned. The employee operated a hydraulic control that moved the pivot point and amputated her right index finger. The pivot point on the backhoe assembly was not guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was preparing to pick up a dumpster and empty it. As the employee was unhooking the winch line from the rear of the truck, the employee's hand was on the hook/line and he inadvertently activated the winch reel in control instead of the reel out.  The line tightened and caught his left middle fingertip between it and the truck body resulting in amputation at the first joint.
A worker was performing maintenance work on an air handling unit when his hand was caught between the belt and sheave, resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was positioning a rock and smashed his fingertips resulting in an amputation.
An employee was adjusting rollers that were not lined up to move boxes of plastic pellets when his finger was caught between the rollers resulting in an amputation.
An employee's hand slipped while he was sanding the metal part on a 12-inch sanding machine, catching and partially amputating his right thumb between the part and the sanding disk.

An employee was rebuilding an intensifier on a high-pressure pump when the machine became energized by a remote operator. The piston on the pump extended on a hydraulic cylinder while the employee's hands were in the machine, pinching and amputating a finger between the cylinder and machine.
An employee was fastening cargo nets to a pallet when his right index fingertip was pinched and amputated between the pallet and the pallet net lock.

An employee was working on a trim cell unit where engine blocks are trimmed out. As he was picking up the block, he was wearing a hot mill style glove. His pinky went into the chain belt and was caught between the backside of the chain belt and the guard. His left pinky finger was amputated.
An employee was using scissors to cut a piece of plastic when the scissors cut and amputated her left index fingertip.

An employee was unjamming a pipe in a grinder machine. As the pipe loosened, the door to the grinder slammed shut on his right ring fingertip, amputating it from the tip to the middle of the fingernail.

The employee was attempting to couple a pipe trailer to a hitch on a backhoe and got a finger caught between the coupler on the trailer and the receiver on the backhoe after lifting it to connect the two. The right index finger was amputated.
An employee partially amputated the left index finger while using a 9-inch chef's knife to chop food.
An employee was operating a 60-ton press to cut steel and amputated the tip of his right middle finger.

An employee was raking parts off the top of a slow moving conveyor (4.5"/minute) when a loud noise startled him and his finger entered a gap between the conveyor and the exit chute. The chute then shifted and dropped pinching his finger and removing his nail and fingertip.
An employee amputated their right ring finger while in the process of washing wooden pallets. The machine was not locked out at the time.

An employee was stacking rods to space out a pump. His finger was caught between the polishing rod and load cell resulting in the traumatic amputation of the distal and middle phalanx at the proximal interphalangeal joint of the right index finger.
An employee was cleaning a carcass wash cabinet when the cabinet lid came down and lacerated his right pinky finger.  During treatment, the fingertip was amputated.
An employee closed their right thumb in the safe door resulting in amputation of the thumb tip.

An employee was feeding wire to a wire stripping machine when he noticed that the wire had a loop in it. He reached to get the loop out and while his left thumb was in the loop the machine tightened the loop resulting in the amputation of the tip of his left thumb.
An employee was unchocking a piece of equipment when his right hand was caught by the machine belt amputating the fourth finger at the first knuckle.
An employee was stacking lumber and amputated three fingers on the right hand in a chain and sprocket.
An employee's right big toe was amputated when the loading dock platform was lowered onto his toe.
An employee was removing dough from the mixer and amputated a finger on his right hand.
While cleaning a sensor, an employee's right thumb was caught in a drive chain and amputated.
An employee was making a packaging sample and amputated the right thumb tip.
During repositioning of a load of angle bars, an employee caught his fingers in the bundle of iron resulting in a fingertip amputation and lacerations/fractures to two other fingers.
An employee was operating a sugar mill and partially amputated the right index finger.
An employee was repairing a belt on the core/tenoner machine. A glove got caught in the moving chain and a fingertip was amputated.
An employee's right ring fingertip was amputated while operating a vertical milling machine.
An employee was setting up the dry curd press to package a product when the machine cycled causing an amputation to the employee's right ring fingertip.
An employee suffered right index, middle, and ring finger amputations while cleaning a dust collector.
An employee suffered left index and middle fingertip amputations.
An employee was stacking pallets at the end of a production line when she tripped over stretch wrap and fell, fracturing her left hip.
An employee was flipping the top half of a tank when the tank fell out of its frame and partially amputated his left big toe.
An employee was placing a hatch cover on a barge when it landed on and amputated the end of the employee's right pinky finger.

An employee was troubleshooting a seized motor when the motor started and pulled the employee's thumb through the pulley. The employee suffered an amputation of the left thumb above the knuckle and bruising to the left middle and ring fingers.
An employee was working on a piece of exercise equipment when a portion of the machine slipped off of the track and amputated his thumb tip.
An employee was opening the cover to an exhaust fan when the motor pulley wheel and sheave caught and severely pinched the employee's left index finger, partially amputating the fingertip.

On October 21, 2016, an employee was packing finished goods onto trays. The trays were on a flexible conveyor system. One of the trays turned sideways and as the employee attempted to straighten the tray out , her right ring fingertip was caught and amputated between two links of the conveyor.
An employee suffered a left index finger amputation while feeding pig bellies into the chain and sprocket.
An employee was pushing lumber through a table saw when his hand slipped and made contact with the blade, amputating his left middle finger.

On October 22, 2016, an employee was pushing a stick cart. The employee had his left hand on top of the stick cart when he hit another stick cart. The wooden sticks came towards his hand amputating the distal part of his left middle finger.

An employee had just unjammed a roll former and was running another flat piece through the rollers to try and determine what had caused the jam. The flat metal piece became caught in the rollers. The employee was trying to pull it through with his hands when his gloves were caught and both of his hands were pulled between the rollers. Two of his right-hand fingertips were amputated, and four left fingers were smashed. The machine was unguarded at the time.

An employee was monitoring a potato conveyor line when the rollers began sticking due to mud and dirt. He was using a crowbar to remove the mud and dirt when it was drawn into the conveyor.  His gloves were also drawn in, crushing and amputating his left thumb.

On a three head saw machine, an employee was using a hand tool/bar to lift a chain that had a jammed buckle. The employee pressed the foot pedal to move the chain and free the buckle. When the pedal was pressed, the chain moved and caused the hand tool/bar to jerk, which pinched and amputated the employee's right-hand index finger between the chain guard and tool.
An employee was cutting cucumbers on a slicer and amputated the tip of her right thumb.
While riding and backing up a forklift, an employee's right hand was pinned between the forklift and a loading table, partially amputating a finger.
An employee was pushing a rolling table when his right index finger was caught between the table and a wheel, amputating the fingertip.
An employee cut the tip of his left index and middle fingers while using the Verticut overseeding machine.
An employee was removing trash out of the building. As he was dumping the trash from a rubber container into a steel dumpster, his left ring fingertip was smashed and amputated.

Employees were standing at the company truck about to break for lunch when a log truck came down the road and a tire blew. The weight of the logs broke an axle on the log truck and the tire and wheel broke off striking two of the employees standing at the company truck.
An employee was presorting mail when his right index fingertip was caught and amputated on the underside of the mail tray conveyor.

On October 24, 2016, at approximately 3:00 p.m., an employee was attempting to move a shutter head assemble from the shutter head machine on Line 16. The equipment was stuck. The employee went to get help and the two employees jogged the piece and the 40 pound shutter head fell approximately 18 inches. While the equipment was falling, the employee tried to catch it and his left middle fingertip was caught between the equipment and wood board resulting in amputation of the fingertip.
An employee restarted the binder machine and amputated a fingertip. The machine was not guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was reaching into a 6-inch opening under a machine conveyor to retrieve a part when the employee's right hand contacted the rotating sprocket, amputating the ring fingertip and avulsing the middle finger.
An employee was operating a router when his hand slipped and contacted the machine, amputating his middle finger and lacerating his index finger.
An employee was cycling the bending machine after an electrical repair. The injured employee was resting his hand on the machine and his right thumb tip was amputated when the machine cycled.
On October 25, 2016, an employee sustained an amputation injury after the employee's shirt was caught in a belt and pulley pulling the hand in.

Two employees were installing siding on the third floor of a stair landing from a makeshift scaffold. Both employee's fell approximately 30 feet to the ground when the scaffold failed. Employee 1 suffered a broken back and neck. Employee 2 suffered fractures to the pelvis, tailbone and lower back. Both employees were hospitalized.
An employee was closing the trailer door when he inadvertently pinched his right middle finger in the door latch causing a fingertip amputation.

An employee was working on equipment that was not in operation. A chain on the equipment was bound up and had tension on it. The employee took a bar to pry and loosen the chain because the chain had some energy in it. When the chain became free, the chain moved slightly, energized. His finger was above the chain and it slipped between the sprocket and the chain. His right index fingertip was caught between the chain and the sprocket and amputated.

An employee was drilling a hole in a piece of aluminum about 12-inches by 3-inches wide using a pedestal drill press and amputated his left index finger at the first knuckle. The employee was wearing tight fitted grip gloves. The machine was not guarded at the time of the incident.
On October 25, 2016, an employee's distal right index finger was amputated when a metal door closed on the finger.

On October 25, 2016, at 7:10 a.m., an employee was disassembling a load of precast concrete hollow core planks and tried to remove the stacking block before the plank had cleared the stack. The plank broke and amputated the tip and fingernail of his left index finger. He was hospitalized for treatment.
An employee was operating a machine and amputated the right index fingertip. The machine was not guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee removed a guard from a conveyor belt motor to check the chain and sprockets for tension. The employee reached toward the running chain and sprocket and his left thumb was caught between the chain and sprocket resulting in an amputation of 1/4 inch to 1/2 inch of the thumb. The machine was energized at the time of the incident.
An employee was cleaning an area of the conveyor belt when a tip of his glove got caught in the belt resulting in the amputation of the right ring finger at the first knuckle.
An employee pulled the generator string and his left hand got caught in the string as it returned into the generator amputating the middle fingertip and thumb tip.

A truck driver was tarping the load while on the live shed. As he was coming down, he braced himself and his left index and middle fingers were caught in a moving fan resulting in the amputation of the fingers above the knuckle.
An employee was operating a jointer machine and his left hand contacted the blade amputating the left index fingertip.
An employee was cleaning the food composter discharge chute while it was running and amputated two fingertips and damaged a third.

An employee placed a torpedo level on a post to straighten and level the post. Another employee was operating a hydraulic ram. When that employee activated the machine the first employee's left index finger was crushed. The finger was amputated at the hospital.
Two employees were leaning over the safety handrails to grab a 4'x8' piece of sheathing and the Perry Scaffold fell over injuring three employees. Two employees were hospitalized.
While cutting a soup bone, an employee's hand slipped into the path of the saw blade resulting in an amputation injury.
On October 26, 2016, an employee was operating a punch press and suffered the  amputation of the left 4th and 5th fingers.

On October 26, 2016, at 12:00 p.m., an employee was using a pry-bar to raise the manholes to the level of the new pavement. The manhole cover slipped off of the pry-bar as he was reaching under the manhole cover and crushed the tip of his left middle finger. The tip of his left middle finger with some bone was amputated at the hospital.
An employee was removing a fuel tank with a screwdriver when the hatch fell on his left ring finger amputating the fingertip and nail.

Two employees were entering a sewer manhole. One of the employee's hands slipped and the second employee's middle finger was caught and amputated at the first joint as the manhole cover fell back into place.
An employee was preparing a mobile crane for transport and amputated a portion of the left index finger when the jib moved into place.

On October 27, 2016, at 4:40 p.m., an employee was engaged in a flip operation and was using a hammer to tap the fixture holding the part. The hammer glanced the fixture and struck/severed the machinist's left index fingertip.
An employee was unjamming a piece of fabric from the rotary fabric cutter and amputated the left pinky fingertip. The machine was running at the time.
An employee was transferring a package onto the conveyor of the metal detector when her finger was caught in an exposed belt and pulley. A portion of the employee's finger was amputated.
The employee was measuring the thickness of the granite and got caught between the granite and the roller on the conveyor. The employee's left index finger was amputated.
Employee was operating a brake press when she placed her fingers in the press brake die opening during the downward stroke of the ram and amputated three fingertips on her left hand.
An employee was repairing a pallet jack. He lifted the pallet jack by hand. When he went to lower the pallet jack, the wheel mechanism severed his right index finger at the first joint.

An employee was capping an 8 inch PVC water line. Backpressure built up in the line from a leaking valve and blew the cap off resulting in amputation of the employee's left pinky finger and a partial amputation of the left ring finger.

Employees were near a hydraulic power unit that was slipping off a forklift. As the employees attempted to get out of the way, they tripped over other equipment and fell. One employee sustained a knee injury. The second employee sustained a head laceration.
Two employees were conducting maintenance on a gas processing unit when a flash fire occurred. Both employees received burns and were hospitalized. See also 1151826.
An employee was feeding wood into the chop saw. The employee's left thumb was amputated when the saw was activated. The saw was guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was operating a packaging/sealing machine and amputated the left index fingertip.

Employees were moving a vehicle on to steel rims in the salvage yard when an employee's hand was caught between the car and the bumper. The employee suffered an amputation to the soft tissue pulp of the left pinky finger.
A temporary worker was operating equipment when his right arm was caught between the rollers. The employee suffered a compound fracture of the right arm and partially amputated the thumb.
An employee was cutting meat with a band saw and suffered an amputation to the right thumb.

At approximately 2:40 a.m. on October 27, 2016, the injured employee and other employees were removing an 80 lb. bolt from a stamping press. The bolt had to be moved approximately 2 ft. over the edge of the press. The bolt was attached to a chain fall and sitting on the lip or edge of the press. An employee pulled the bolt with the tag line, but could not move the bolt over the edge. The injured employee then pushed the bolt with his hands. The bolt moved, and his right hand or finger was caught between the bolt and the edge. The employee suffered a crush/dislocation injury and his right pinky fingertip was medically amputated below the fingernail.
While cutting wood with a portable saw to make shelving, an employee suffered an amputation of the left index finger below the nail.
An employee was going into the office and her left pinky finger was caught and amputated in the door when it closed due to high winds.
An employee was rolling pipes on a metal forming machine and smashed his left index finger in the machine resulting in amputation.
A hydraulic dock plate was not lowering to floor completely and an employee used his hands to push it down causing the dock plate to release and amputate the tip of his right hand ring finger.
An employee was measuring a bundle on a moving conveyor belt. His index left finger got caught between a roller and the bundle and the fingertip was amputated.
An employee was installing a conveyor system using a pry bar to separate parts and amputated a fingertip when the tool slipped and pinched his finger between the two parts.
When handling a 4 foot waler and loosening bolts, an employee's finger was caught between metal bolts and the waler, amputating the left middle distal fingertip.
An employee was operating a loader. A bus drove by the loader causing the door to slam closed on the employee's thumb and amputate 1/4 inch of the thumb.
Two employees were hospitalized for injuries sustained during a roof truss collapse.
An employee was attempting to stop a pipe from rolling when his left hand was caught between the pipe and guardrail of a table in the pressure washer area. His left middle fingertip was amputated.
On October 31, 2016, at approximately 9:15 a.m., two employees were exposed to elevated levels of carbon monoxide from a boiler with a cracked heat exchanger.
An employee amputated his fingertip when it became caught under the clamp on the cutting machine.
An employee's left index finger was amputated between the first and second knuckle by the cutting head on the DCM sleeve cut machine.
On November 1, 2016, an employee was reaching for a bolt in a lint cleaner when his right arm became caught and wedged, cutting his arm off.

An employee was standing near a base cover while it was being lowered by crane. The employee noticed damage on the cover and started to spin it to access the part that needed repairs. The crane operator was not aware of the employee and continued to lower the cover. The employee's fingers were caught between the cover and the crane, amputating the left fourth finger mid-nailbed and the third fingertip.

An employee was starting to clean the cabin of an off-road haul truck used for rough terrain when his left middle finger was caught between the truck frame and the truck door, amputating the fingertip.

The bucket on a backhoe froze up and an employee tried to free it up. When the bucket moved, the employee's right hand  was pinched between the moving pin and the hole that it was inserted into resulting in a right thumb amputation.
An employee was setting up a centerfire machine and smashed a fingertip in the machine. The tip was re-attached. There was no bone loss.

An employee was operating a feed mill grinder when a belt started slipping. As he was checking the belt, the machine energized and pulled his right middle finger in, pinching it between the belt and pulley and amputating his fingertip. The machine was not locked out or guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was troubleshooting a chain and sprocket inside a welder machine conveyor when a coworker started the machine from the other end while the employee's hand was still inside. His left fourth fingertip was amputated.

An employee was operating a forklift and unloading materials from a tractor trailer when he noticed dunnage under the pallet and got off the forklift to remove it. The forks then crushed his left middle finger, requiring surgical amputation of the fingertip.

An employee was disassembling the Y-axis ball on a CNC machine when the ball came loose. He moved the ball screw and it became dislodged and struck his left index finger, amputating it just behind the fingernail.
An employee was using a chop saw to cut wooden pieces for window frames when the saw amputated two of his fingers.
An employee was cutting paper with a large paper cutter when her left thumb entered the cutting area. The paper cutter then amputated the tip of her left thumb.

An employee was trying to bring cement into a silo. When he stuck his hand into a butterfly valve, the valve closed, smashing multiple fingers on his right hand. His middle fingertip was surgically removed.

On 11/03/2016, at approximately 5:15 PM, an employee was troubleshooting a gizzard machine that was not running properly. He was attempting to identify the problem and got assistance from a coworker. He closed the cover and shut down the machine. The machine was turned back on while the employee's right hand was in the moving/rotating parts of the chain drive and sprocket, amputating 3/4 of his index finger and 1/2 of his middle finger.
An employee was checking a truck when he saw a wire in the engine compartment. When he attempted to grab the wire, his right index finger was amputated by the fan belt.
An employee was cutting metal with an electric saw. The saw blade jammed with material and cut the employee's right index finger.
An employee suffered a right middle finger amputation while using a wood working machine.

On Friday November 4, 2016, at approximately 5:30 a.m., a temporary employee was working with a coworker to hand feed fabric into a fabric cutter machine. At some point during the operation, fabric entangled the employee's hand and pulled it into the point of operation. The employee suffered a partial right ring fingertip amputation and lacerations to the right middle and pinky fingers.

On Friday November 4, 2016, at approximately 8:00 a.m., an employee was loading corn onto a running conveyor while a trailer was dumping corn nearby. The employee's right arm was caught on and amputated by the rotating power-take-off shaft of the auger, requiring hospitalization.
On November 4, 2016, an employee was moving laminated beams when one fell, hit the ground, bounced back up, and pinched the employee's right middle fingertip, resulting in an amputation.

An employee was guiding a hydraulic cylinder ram into its storage rack while it was supported by a small jib crane. As he was guiding the cylinder, the ram slowly retracted. The head of the ram then pinched the employee's finger against the bolt and the frame, crushing and partially amputating his right index finger.
An employee's right hand was pulled into machine rollers, amputating the right index fingertip (above the knuckle).

An employee was moving a cart in a warehouse when a nearby pallet that was being moved pushed the cart and smashed the employee's finger between the cart and a pole, amputating the left ring fingertip.
An employee was attempting to feed foam through a jammed slitter when his left thumb was caught on a roller and pulled into the blade compartment. He suffered a left thumb amputation.
While working on a derrick, an employee's right thumb was caught between a rotator and a stuffing box during a drilling process. The first digit of the employee's right thumb was amputated.
An employee was cleaning the surface of a grinding plate when the plate amputated a right-hand fingertip.

An employee was troubleshooting a press machine. The machine completed its cycle while the employee's hand was next to an air cylinder, partially amputating the employee's left middle finger and fracturing the left ring finger.
An employee was stowing a jib crane when his right ring finger was caught and partially amputated between the crane's frame and the bump stop, requiring surgery.

On November 7, 2016, an employee tripped and fell while picking up scrap buckets and stuck out the left hand to catch him/herself from falling. The employee's left hand entered a cut-out on a turning machine mechanism, amputating the middle fingertip.

Two employees were changing out a belt on a piece of equipment. They locked out the machine and were pulling belts on a pulley. The first employee was aligning the belt around the next groove when the second employee manually gave the shaft another turn, trapping the first employee's finger under the belt and above the pulley. His left index fingertip was amputated.
An employee was working on a new recycler, when a piece of the recycler fell on and partially amputated the employee's middle finger.

An employee was removing a door wedge to close a door when the employee's left pinky finger was pinched in the closing door. The employee's left pinky was amputated to the first knuckle just above the nail.
An employee was preparing to re-thread ropes on a sheave pulley when his right middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was working on a vehicle on the lift with the engine running. The employee attempted to stop the spinning front wheel and caught their left index finger in the wheel spokes resulting in amputation at the first knuckle.
An employee was performing maintenance on a conveyor when a roller caught and amputated the employee's left middle and ring fingertips.
An employee was attempting to close the safety clasp on a lifting hook when his right middle finger became stuck in the clasp and was partially amputated.
An employee was trying to pry a bar away from a lint cleaner drum when the pry bar slipped, catching the employee's left little finger and amputating it at the first knuckle.
On November 9, 2016, at 3:45 p.m., an employee was using a cutting torch to cut through an I-beam that rested on a forklift when the I-beam fell and crushed the employee's foot, amputating two toes.

As an employee was reversing the forklift, he placed his right hand on the forklift cage. His thumb struck against a cylinder protruding from one of the plastics machines, amputating three-quarters of the thumb.
An employee was attempting to clear a jam from a tapper machine when his right index finger was pinched between the shuttle piece and the metal frame, partially amputating his fingertip.
An employee's left ring finger was pinched and partially amputated between two parts while stacking parts on a rack.

An employee was packaging lunch meat containers on a conveyor line when one of the container lids became dislodged. When she tried to retrieve the lid, her fingers were caught in the middle of the two adjoining conveyer lines. Her right ring and middle fingers were severely lacerated, and her ring finger had to be medically amputated.
An employee was manually operating a filler machine with a coworker. While he was moving the filler, one of his fingertips was amputated before the first knuckle.
An employee sustained a fingertip amputation when it was caught in a door slammed by another person.
An employee was unloading a hopper when the hopper door closed on his left thumb, amputating the tip.
An employee was attempting to reinstall a chain on a drive sprocket when his right thumb was pinched as the chain rolled the chain sprocket, amputating his thumb below the knuckle.
An employee suffered an amputation while working on a trim press.
An employee's fingertip was amputated in a machine.

An employee was using an overhead crane to load a raft onto a pre-former. As the raft went down into place on the pre-former, the employee's left middle finger was between the raft and the pre-former. This resulted in a pinch point that amputated his left middle fingertip/pad and fingernail.
An employee was cutting laminate on a table saw when he became dizzy and put his hand down on the table to catch his balance. The sawblade then amputated his left index fingertip.
An employee's fingertip was caught and amputated in a paper coating machine. The machine was not locked and/or tagged out at the time.
Two employees were installing wood trusses on the balcony of an apartment when they fell approximately 30 feet, suffering bumps and bruises and a fractured hand.
On November 10, 2016, an employee's right ring finger was caught and avulsed between a guard and a band saw, requiring amputation.
An employee's left middle finger was caught and amputated between a refrigerator door and a room door.
An employee's finger was struck by a locking mechanism resulting in amputation.
While attempting to unclog a jammed leaf blower, an employee's left index fingertip was amputated by rotating parts.

On November 11, 2016, at approximately 1:30 p.m., two employees were hospitalized after receiving second degree burns to the face and third degree burns to both arms from a flash fire that occurred during a natural gas leak at a wellhead.
An employee suffered a left index fingertip amputation when attempting to open a package of salmon using a chef's knife.
An employee suffered index and middle finger amputations while cleaning the sealing machine. The machine was running at the time.

An employee was preparing to install pipe into a bore hole when the pipe began bouncing on cribbing. He put his right hand underneath the pipe, and his right pinky fingertip was pinched and amputated between the pipe and the cribbing.

An employee went to the top of an asphalt silo to check on a drag conveyor. His left hand became caught in a drive pulley, amputating his middle finger, lacerating his index finger, and fracturing his wrist. The drive pulley was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was slicing four sirloin tip roasts on a bandsaw when the roast jerked and pulled his right ring finger into the sawblade, partially amputating his fingertip.
An employee was using a pie press to press crusts onto pies when her finger was crushed and amputated between two parts of the press.
An employee had locked/tagged out equipment and was pulling the belt manually to clean it when the employee's left pinky was pinched and amputated above the knuckle between the belt and the pulley.
While cutting meat for a customer, an employee's thumb became caught in the guard/bandsaw, amputating it to the knuckle.
An employee's finger was pinned between a trailer's interior wall and a drum of material while loading a 450 lb. drum on a pallet skid. The employee's left middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee's pinky fingertip was amputated in a door jamb when the door shut.
On November 13, 2016, an employee dropped a cleaning pad while cleaning a hopper. When reaching down to retrieve it, the employee contacted a moving part and suffered a fingertip amputation.

Two employees were attempting to clear a clog from a cellar with a water hose. As they moved the hose into the cellar, an obstruction came out and pushed the hose out.  The hose whipped around, striking both employees in the face, causing lacerations and facial bone fractures.
An employee was cutting wood on a table saw when the blade amputated his right thumb tip. The saw was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was trying to fix a belt on the corrugated paper cutting machine when the belt engaged and pulled his hand through the belt and pulley, amputating his right middle finger.
An employee was attempting to sharpen a tool with a grinding wheel when the employee's finger entered the wheel and was amputated.
An employee was holding a metal piece in place in a milling machine when the clamp came down and struck his hand, amputating his right pinky finger.
An employee's left middle fingertip was amputated.

An employee was attempting to turn down the speed of production on a production line using the speed control, which was located on the bottom of the line. The guard had to be removed to run the shaft. The employee's right hand then came in contact with the bevel gear, completely amputating the right index finger.
An employee was sawing laminate on a table saw and amputated three fingers on the left hand.
On November 14, 2016, an employee suffered a right index fingertip amputation while operating a pneumatic crimper machine in the assembly area.

An employee was using an overhead crane to unload wooden floor boards onto the sub-assembly of a tractor-trailer frame when his left middle fingertip was caught between a load spreader bar and a sub-assembly cross member, requiring medical amputation.
While operating a packaging machine, an employee's hand was caught between the ceiling head and the die, amputating the right middle fingertip. The guard was removed at the time.

An employee was to trying to make sure the bottom outlet port of a mixer was clear when the mixer blades partially amputated the employee's fourth and fifth fingers. The mixer was operating at the time of the incident.

An employee was removing lashing turn-buckles on the bottom level of a container when a turn-buckle fell. The turn-buckle swivel crushed the employee's left middle finger between deck plating, and his fingertip had to be medically amputated.
An employee's left ring fingertip was amputated while using a fabric saw to cut a stack of fabric.
An employee was lining up a garment on the track of the garment cutter when the cutting wheel activated and amputated her right thumb tip.
An employee was separating two stacks of bridge railing when one slipped and smashed his right little finger, amputating the fingertip.
An employee suffered a left index fingertip amputation when his hand was pinched by the wheel of the Bid-Well workbridge.
An employee's left little fingertip was amputated between a cart and a machine.

On November 16, 2016, an employee was retrieving parts from a new washer when his glove was caught in the chain conveyor and subsequently caught between the chain and a rotating shaft. His right middle fingertip was amputated. The chain and shaft were unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was attempting to adjust the handle on a case packer when he lost balance and leaned his left index finger into a pinch point, partially amputating his fingertip.

An employee entered a trash cart as part of a process where a forklift operator would raise the cart off the ground so the employee could shovel trash out of the cart and into a compactor. The metal cart slid on the forks toward the forklift while the employee was holding onto the edge, and the employee's left middle finger was amputated when the trash cart made contact with the forklift apron guard.

On November 16, 2016, at approximately 8:51 p.m., an employee was disposing of pieces of trim in the vacuum system of a single phase machine. The employee's left hand slipped and the ring finger made contact with the score bar. The finger was lacerated and had to be amputated.
An employee was jointing a piece of wood when his hand slipped. His pinky finger went into the blade and was amputated.
An employee was cleaning the chute on a ready-mix truck. As he extended the chute, two of his right-hand fingers were caught/pinched between two chute sections.

On November 17, 2016, an employee was operating a napkin printing press and noticed a defect.  The employee turned the machine off and felt the printing plate to see if it was lifting off the cylinder. The jog button was pressed while his right hand was feeling the plate and his hand was caught between the plate and the impression roll. He suffered an amputation of his right thumb pad and laceration to his right index finger.

An employee was attempting to light a handheld propane torch when an explosion occurred. The employee received second degree burns to the face, hand, and other body parts. A second employee also suffered injuries.
On November 17, 2016, an employee who works in plastic recovery sustained a fingertip amputation.

An employee was moving a manufactured steel part that weighed approximately 70 lbs. from a pair of saw horses to the ground. He then tripped over one of the sawhorses, and three of his right-hand fingers were pinched between the steel part and the ground, amputating his middle fingertip and injuring the other two.
An employee was cutting 2x4" lumber on a radial arm saw when the saw blade lowered on and amputated his right middle finger. The saw was guarded at the time.

An employee was operating a press brake and attempting to remove a piece when the clamp came down and amputated his left middle fingertip and avulsed his left ring finger. The machine was cycling at the time of the incident.

On November 17, 2016, an employee's fingers were caught in the in-running nip point of a printing press while he was attempting to thread new paper through the press. One of his fingertips was amputated and another was badly injured.

Two employees were resurfacing part of an interstate when a car entered the construction area and struck a nearby work trailer. The trailer then struck the employees. The first employee suffered a broken left leg, and the second employee suffered left leg lacerations.

An employee was installing a rotor lock pin in a bearing housing when the magnets in the lifting system failed. The rotor lock pin then dropped into the bearing housing, pinching the employee's fingers between the flange of the pin and the housing. Two of his fingers were amputated to the first knuckle.

An employee was helping to assemble a standard duty wrecker and was in the process of guiding a part into position when a component inside of the part shifted and pinched/partially amputated the employee's finger between two sections.

An employee was operating a radial arm saw when a piece of wood became caught in the travel slot behind the saw blade. When the employee attempted to remove it, the blade lacerated his right index finger. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee's left index fingertip was amputated by a closing freezing door.

An employee was visually checking a rope that was pulling a conductor from an underground application through a block. As he turned to walk away, he put his arms down to his side. The rope caught the tip of his left-hand glove and pulled his fingers into the block. His left ring and pinky fingers were amputated.
An employee was attempting to free wire that was hung up in a dolly. When the wire was freed, it pulled his left hand into the dolly, partially amputating his left pinky finger.
On November 20, 2016, at 2:30 p.m., an employee suffered a partial amputation to the left middle finger while attempting to retrieve bread that was stuck in a bagel machine.
While attempting to remove a steel piece from a forklift, a temporary employee's left finger was caught and amputated between the fork and another piece of metal.
An employee was lubricating a drive chain on a conveyer when his rag and hand were drawn into the chain and sprocket, partially amputating his finger.
An employee was performing maintenance on a material handling conveyor system when his right index finger was amputated above the first joint.

An employee was removing excess tuna from the rear of a filler machine when her right hand became caught in the star wheel (carries empty cans to the filler machine). Her middle and index fingers were amputated, and her right hand suffered multiple fractures.
An employee was operating a high-reach forklift to move product when the employee's left thumb was caught and partially amputated between a section of racking and the forklift's support beam.

An employee was moving a part (about 12"x18"x1" thick) by hand from a pallet to a work table. His right thumb was inside a hole in the part. As he pulled the part, the hole closed, amputating his right thumb tip.
An employee was rebuilding shafts and bearings on a slicer and amputated his left pinky finger when it was caught in the machine.
An employee was using an electric torque gun to tighten bolts when his right thumb was caught and partially amputated between the gun and the steel.
