An employee was sliding T-beams from a staging area to a forklift when a beam pinched and amputated his left fingertip.
An employee suffered a partial amputation to the right index finger while cleaning a drive chain on a band saw while the machine was in operation.
An employee was using a sliding hammer to remove injectors from a farm implement when the employee's left thumb was crushed between the handle and the top of the tool, amputating the tip.
An employee's gloved hand was caught in the rotation fan of a welder unit during repairs, amputating the thumb.
An employee suffered a left index fingertip amputation while using a ribbon cutting machine.

On 11/21/2016, an employee and his supervisor were washing a vehicle together on a track. When the supervisor turned on the track to begin moving the vehicle, the employee was still washing the rim. As soon as the rollers popped up, the moving wheel of the car lacerated the employee's right-hand finger and amputated it at the first joint. PPE was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was cutting meat with a band saw and amputated his right thumb at the first knuckle.

An employee was dressing a grinding wheel with a rag when the rag became caught in the wheel. The employee's left hand was then pulled into the grinding wheel, amputating the index finger and lacerating the third, fourth, and fifth fingers.

An employee was standing on a trailer to pull down the roll-up door. It was raining and the employee slipped and fell which caused the door to come down on his left hand amputating the left middle and ring fingers at the first joint.

A pallet was jammed at a pallet magazine discharge area. An employee attempted to unjam the pallet using a hook attached to a rod about 36 inches long. When the hook did not work, the employee grabbed the pallet with her hands. At the same time, the machine cycled the next pallet in place, causing the pallet that she was grabbing to raise. Her left thumb became caught between the pallet and the metal frame of the machine, amputating her thumb tip.

An employee was cleaning a rib cage when his arm became stuck in two rollers that are designed to crush chicken bones. His left arm broke in multiple places and had to be surgically amputated above the elbow. The crusher was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee suffered a left thumb amputation while cutting wood on a table saw.
An employee was re-entering the facility from the parking lot when the wind forced the door closed, slamming it on and amputating his right index fingertip.

An employee was working with replacement belts when the belts tightened around his right-hand middle finger, partially amputating his fingertip. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.

An employee was packaging components as they came off the press when his glove was snagged on the hexagon-shaped component of the conveyor, amputating the tip of his left index finger from the fingernail to the first knuckle.
On 11/23/2016, at approximately 1445, an employee was cleaning a straightener machine when his hand became caught in a portion of the machine, partially amputating his left ring fingertip.
On 11/22/16, an employee was cleaning a glue roller with a scraper when the employee's right-hand middle finger was caught between glue rollers. The fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was using a 10-inch chef's knife to slice salmon. The slicing motion pulled the knife through the salmon and amputated the employee's fingertip.
An employee was using an angle iron when it moved downward toward the vise and amputated the employee's left ring fingertip.

An employee and a coworker were closing the perimeter gate at the end of the day when he stopped to remove some cardboard that was blocking the gate. His coworker kept pushing the gate and the employee's second finger became stuck in the gate rollers, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was inserting a blank piece of pipe into the chucks of a CNC machine when the blank fell and his right finger was caught between the blank and the metal bar inside the machine. His right ring fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
An employee was delivering a package to a customer when the customer's dog attacked and partially amputated the employee's left ring finger.

An employee was standing on top of a plywood sheet to reach for something when he slipped and fell. The plywood sheet then fell onto his fingers, fracturing and lacerating them. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated. The plywood was not secure at the time of the incident.

On November 25, 2016, at 2:30 PM, an employee was watching a coworker set up a die in a full revolution mechanical power press when the employee's left hand entered the top ejection post that was attached to the platen. The coworker then jogged the machine and the top rod crushed four fingers on the employee's left hand. The middle and ring fingers had to be medically amputated below the first joint.
An employee was repacking a pump when his right-hand pointer and middle fingers were amputated. The pump was not locked/tagged out at the time.

An employee was working at a sausage stuffing machine. She had placed an empty sausage casing on the horn of the machine and was feeding it to the chuck when the machine was activated. Her right index fingertip was caught and amputated between the chuck and horn.

An employee was adjusting the alignment on a case erector head. He activated the emergency stop and raised the head to the horizontal position, creating a pinch point that amputated his right pinky fingertip.
An employee was trying to close the back door, which was not closing properly. When she forced it closed, it slammed on her left little finger and amputated the fingertip.
An employee was unhooking a tractor trailer from a dolly when his finger was caught between the dolly and the tractor trailer, amputating his left pinky fingertip.

An employee was picking recyclable waste from a conveyor belt and placing it in the appropriate bins when the employee's left pinky finger became caught and amputated between the belt and the metal portion of the shoot.
An employee suffered left ring and middle fingertip amputations while cutting sheet metal with a mechanical shear.
An employee was drilling a bushing out of a part when his glove was caught on the rotating drill, pulling his hand into the drill and amputating the right index finger and middle fingertip.
An employee was removing snow from a tarp covering a trailer when the spring loaded tarp arm shut and caught the employee's finger resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was removing a goose neck from a die casting machine when the chain sling hook crushed his index fingertip. His fingertip had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was using a planter machine to plant broccoli. As he was pulling a plant from the planter machine's cup, the cup turned and amputated his right index fingertip. The machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An electrical current traveled through a crane to a nearby tractor, where two employees were electrocuted.

An employee was using a handheld, air-powered wire bender tool (used to straighten wire coil so it can be welded to the end of another wire coil). He was holding the wire bender handle with his right hand while his left hand was holding the end of the wire bender. The tool was actuated, and his left middle finger was caught between the wire and the tool, partially amputating his left middle finger.
On 11/29/2016 at 12:30 p.m., an employee was attempting to reset the tooling in a turret punch press when the tooling came off and pinched the employee's right middle fingertip, amputating it.
An employee was working on a die cut machine that manufactures metal caps when the machine amputated his right pointer finger.
An employee was cleaning the marker machine puck and press assembly when his hand was caught between the press and the puck, amputating his left index finger to the first knuckle.
An employee was unloading snacks from the rear of a truck when the truck door came down and severed the employee's left middle fingertip.
An employee was collecting saliva from a hippo when the hippo's mouth closed and caught the employee's left pinky fingertip, amputating it.

An employee was unjamming the core baler machine when the right hand was pulled into the core cutting nip. The employee suffered open fractures to the second, third and fourth digits on the right hand. Two days later the employee's middle fingertip was surgically amputated.
An employee was cleaning the slicer and amputated the tip of the third finger on the right hand.

An employee was punching cases on an assembly line when he noticed a pair of pliers near the chain and sprocket. As he attempted to retrieve the pliers, the chain snagged his glove, pulling his middle finger between the chain and sprocket and amputating his fingertip. The machine was active and unguarded at the time of the incident.
While moving a 125-pound wooden door to a table, an employee's finger was caught between the table edge and the door frame. The employee's right middle fingertip was amputated and fractured.

Employees were installing a fiber optic cable along a rural roadway and were cleaning up the site at the end of the day when a vehicle approached the work site, left the road, and traveled through the ditch, striking two employees. The first employee suffered lacerations and contusions, while the other suffered a fractured leg. Both were hospitalized.

Employees were unloading a pallet from a rack. When they released the pallet, the injured employee's left middle finger was not clear and became caught and amputated between the pallet and the ground.

An employee was using compressed air to blow dust off the photo eye at the stacker machine when his glove was caught in the chain tensioner, severing his left ring fingertip. The machine was unguarded and operating at the time of the incident.
An employee was greasing the back of a milling machine when the operator reversed the machine and crushed the employee's ankle that may result in a medical amputation.

An employee was removing a temporary barrier wall. A loader with forks was used to lift the wall to relieve pressure so the employee could pull pins from it. The pin shifted as he was pulling it and his right index finger was caught between the bolt and the barrier wall, amputating it at the first knuckle.
An employee was operating a molding machine and amputated the left index finger.

An employee was checking the sensor of a valve. As he was closing the lid, he lost control of it. When he attempted to grab the lid so it did not slam, it crushed and partially amputated his right third fingernail.
An employee was fixing a fan belt on the roof when his thumb was caught and amputated in the fan belt/wheel.
On December 2, 2016, an employee was using a hoist to move a 945-pound casting into a paint booth when the casting fell from the hoist and onto the employee's left foot, amputating all toes.

An employee was disconnecting a bolt from an I-bolt attached to the top frame rail of the side wall of a trailer. The bolt goes through the threaded portion of the I-bolt to hold it in place, and a crane hook goes through the I-bolt.  The crane hook was still attached to the I-bolt.  As the employee was removing the tension bolt, the crane trolley was moved, and the employee's finger was pinched/amputated between the bolt head and the trailer frame rail.
An employee's right index fingertip was caught in the pinch point of moving equipment, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was picking up the wheel end of a hand dolly. When he sat it down, his left pinky finger was pinched between the wheel and the housing, causing a distal amputation.

An employee was using a 4'x8' 3/4" MDO plywood to construct an 8' trash bin. The employee was using the plywood as a saw horse to put another side on the bin. He went to cut the wood using an electric circular saw and the vibration caused the wood to fall which caused the saw to kick back and amputate his left index finger below the second knuckle and cut his left thumb.
An employee was cleaning the hopper on a combine with an air hose when the employee's right leg was caught in the combine auger, amputating it mid-calf.
An employee was cutting a dock plate when it came loose and landed on the employee's left foot, injuring several toes. Two toes had to later be surgically amputated.

An employee was working on the chain and sprocket to a tape machine. As he used a tool to tighten the chain, his hand slipped and his right index finger contacted the moving chain. His right index finger was partially amputated (approximately 2-2.5 cm). The machine was running and was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.

An employee was investigating the discharge of a rotary airlock.  He removed the inspection door, visually inspected the spout, and thought he saw a suspicious buildup.  When he attempted to remove the buildup inside the spout with his left hand, his glove was caught by the running airlock, which then pulled his hand in and amputated three fingertips.
An employee was wrapping a roll on a packaging crater when his right middle finger and ring finger were caught between a chain guard and a wind-up roller switch. His middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee's fingertip was caught and amputated in a conveyor belt.
An employee pulled the cord on a small water pump motor and their hand was pulled into the flywheel amputating a fingertip (without bone loss).

An employee was removing a link arm part from a crane sling to set it down on top of other stacked link arms. One side of the link arm was down on top of the stack and the other side was elevated.  When the employee removed a piece of wood to lower the elevated side of the link arm, it came down and amputated the employee's left middle fingertip.
An employee was pushing boards into a chipper when the ends of two boards closed together and caught the employee's right middle fingertip, amputating approximately one-third of the fingernail.

An employee was assembling a tool when he noticed water coming out of the tool's drain hole. He tipped the tool upwards to drain the water. When he was setting the tool down, it pinched and amputated his right middle fingertip between the seal support frame and the tray lifter.

An employee was attempting to push product packaging into the cellophane film wrapper when the crimper shaft that cuts, heats, and seals the cellophane film amputated her left middle fingertip. The machine was guarded at the time.
An employee was building a set using a guarded Skil Saw. When he was cutting the wood, the wood jolted causing his hand to move and resulting in amputation of the left pinkie fingertip.
An employee was attempting to remove a paper jam in a machine when the machine blade amputated his left index fingertip.
On 12/5/2016, an employee suffered an amputation of the right index fingertip while cleaning the caramel depositor machine when his finger got caught in the air actuated slide that opens and closes.
An employee was connecting a trailer to the ball of a truck. His finger was in the coupling when the trailer came down and amputated his fingertip.
While servicing an HVAC unit on the roof of a commercial building, an employee's finger was caught and amputated or avulsed in the fan belt of the HVAC unit.

An employee was using a bulldozer when it became stuck. He attached the lifting slings to the brackets and was lifting the bulldozer and placing it on top of cargo. After hooking up the shackles/sling to the bulldozer, he held onto the cable with his left hand and flagged the crane operator to lift with his right hand. When the slack was taken up, the employee's left pinky was pinched between the cable and the cab of the bulldozer, partially amputating his pinky fingertip.

An employee was attempting to unclog a transfer auger and had removed three to four bolts from the housing. The employee was scraping the product with the left hand when the left middle finger was caught in a pinch point between the auger and casing, amputating half of the finger. The auger was turning at the time of the incident.
An employee was training a new coworker on cutting PVC pipe when the saw blade amputated the employee's left index finger just below the first knuckle. The saw was guarded at the time.

On December 7, 2016, an employee was cutting metal tubing on a band saw. The employee was attempting to retrieve a part in the saw housing when the blade amputated the employee's right index fingertip.

An employee was cleaning a bolt on a piece of equipment when a coworker who was tightening a bolt on the same piece of equipment dropped a bracket. The bracket struck and amputated the employee's left pinky fingertip.
An employee was cutting half-inch wooden boards on a table saw. When he reached out to move the fallen wood out of the way, the end of his thumb contacted the blade and was partially amputated.
An employee was readjusting an edge guard and a strap smashed their left thumb tip.
An employee was using a table saw when it amputated his left-hand fingers.
An employee was unhooking a trailer from a tractor when his left hand was caught between the trailer and tractor, amputating his left index fingertip at the first knuckle.

An employee was loading bags of ice when the ice machine became jammed. The employee was using a metal pole to unload the auger when the auger grabbed the pole and pinned the employee's left index finger to the machine, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was putting plates on a tie under a rail when the tamper head fell off the rail, causing the rail to fall on and amputate the employee's fingertip.

An employee was attempting to clear a clump of starch from an overhead duster when the plate that controls the flow of the starch closed and amputated the employee's right-hand index, middle, and ring fingertips. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.
An employee was tending to a machine when his right-hand index fingertip was amputated. The machine was running at the time of the incident.

On 12/08/2016, at 4:08 AM, an employee was washing a processing line. The employee removed the cover plate from an auger, reached in, and suffered a left index fingertip amputation at the top knuckle.
An employee was changing the  wheels on a cart when it fell off the shims, crushing and amputating his right ring finger.
An employee was preparing a winder machine to start a new spool of twine. When she started the machine, it caught and damaged her right index fingertip, requiring surgical amputation.

An employee was working on a tractor trailer and loading equipment for a customer. As he was trying to shut the back trailer door, the driver of the trailer pulled forward and the door closed on his left middle finger, partially amputating his fingertip.
An employee was attempting to thread a machine and position the zipper when the machine's roller amputated her fingertip.

On 12/9/2016, at 7:50 p.m., an employee was pushing out a bar that fits into a metal core on a line winder. When he pushed the bar, his left index fingernail was caught on the core. As he pulled his finger back, his left index fingertip was amputated.
An employee was offloading cargo from a truck when a vehicle struck a hand-truck and the hand-truck then struck the employee. The employee was sent flying into the air and suffered a severed ear.

An employee was clearing compound material (resin) from the hopper above a jammed extruder machine when his fingers became pinched between the hopper and the extruder. His left index and middle fingers were amputated.

An employee was adjusting the rolls on a pellet mill and had to jog it when he noticed a burning smell in the firebox. He was attempting to remove a buildup in the pellet mill when his hand was crushed, injuring his left middle and ring fingers. His left ring finger was partially amputated up to the second knuckle.
On December 10, 2016, an employee's hand was pulled into a conveyor belt while attempting to remove stuck rubber, amputating three fingertips.
On December 10, 2016, at 9:30 a.m., an employee was removing shoring equipment when his right thumb tip was pinched and amputated between shoring and an I-beam.

An employee was emptying trash from a small collection unit (hopper) into a much larger collection unit (roll-off dumpster). This required the employee to stage the hopper up and over the roll-off dumpster with a forklift and then dismount the forklift to manually pull a mechanical lever that releases the hopper vault and dumps the hopper contents into the roll-off. The employee grabbed the releasing handle with his right hand and placed his left-hand fingers on the bottom cross-section of the hopper between the bottom of the forklift fork and the hopper frame. When he released the hopper vault, the hopper frame sprang suddenly and violently upwards until it stopped by the bottom of the fork and created a pinch point. The employee's left-hand ring, middle, and index fingertips were caught and amputated in the pinch point.
On 12/12/16, at 2:30 p.m., an employee was working on an assembly line and filling bags at the airlock bottom of a dust collector when four of her fingers were amputated.
While cutting meat on a band saw, an employee's thumb tip was amputated by the blade.
An employee was taking garbage out to the trash dumpster when his right pinky finger was pinched in the hinged portion of the trash lid amputating his fingertip.

An employee was attempting to restart a cooker's infeed screw. After locking out the equipment, he tried to pull the belts backward to get the screw motor to turn over. He then attempted to start the equipment. When the equipment started, the motor turned over and the belt caught his glove, causing his left index finger to contact the belt/pulley. His fingertip was amputated. The machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.
An employee and a coworker were rolling tubes with flanges on the ends when the employee's pinky finger was crushed and amputated under the flange.

An employee replaced a hydraulic cylinder in a packer press. Then the machine was cycled to test it. While observing the cylinder cycle to ensure there were no leaks, the employee's hand entered the machine and his right index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was setting up concrete cylinder targets on a gun range. A forklift was pressing a metal plate against the cylinders to help position them tightly as the employee was using his hands to position them. His thumb was then caught between the metal plate and concrete cylinder, tearing some skin off his thumb tip and requiring surgical amputation.

An employee was setting/welding a door onto a truck. The door was being supported by a crane. After the door was welded and the support was removed, the door slid off from the truck and pinched the employee's right index fingertip, amputating it.

An employee was connecting a cable that had been looped around a pipe to hook the pipe onto an excavator bucket and lay it across the highway. As the excavator operator raised the boom, the employee's hand became caught between the cable and the hook, amputating his left index fingertip.
While cutting a 2 x 4 piece of wood with a miter saw, an employee suffered amputations of the index to ring fingers.

An employee was taking a tire off a tire balancing machine when his finger was pinched between the shaft of the tire balancing machine and the rim of the tire. His left index finger was partially amputated.

An employee was removing rope from a pipe on a blast booth machine when the machine indexed to move the pipe. The employee's gloved hand became tangled in the rope, and the index fingertip was amputated between the pipe and the machine's roller.
An employee was trying to move product in a hopper when the blades amputated two fingers.
An employee was building a bridge girder when his left middle finger was caught between the flange and a splice plate, amputating his left middle fingertip without bone loss.
An employee was adjusting a plate using a shim. The side planer was activated and the employee's right index fingertip was amputated.

Two employees were lighting LP gas fryers in preparation for a catering event when a fire occurred and both employees were hospitalized with burns. The first employee suffered first degree burns to the face. The second employee suffered second degree burns to both forearms.

An employee was performing forklift/rigging operations (material handling) with a telescopic handler (telescoping forklift). While adjusting the forks on the handler, the employee's right index finger was caught in a pinch point between the adjustment box and the forks, lacerating and fracturing it. The finger was amputated down to the first knuckle.
On December 14, 2016, an employee was operating the vertical mill and removing shavings from the bit when the employee's right index finger was partially amputated.
An employee was unloading small packages from a conveyor belt when his right thumb was caught and amputated between the belt and the roller.

An employee was operating a horizontal bender machine to bend rebar. While he was adjusting the rebar for the second bend, his foot contacted the footswitch and activated the machine, which then crushed/amputated his right index finger.

An employee was using a hand grinder with a wire wheel to buff the side rail of a panel form when the wheel grabbed a piece of tie wire and whipped it around. The wheel hit and amputated his left middle fingertip.
An employee was exiting a room and closing the door when the sliding door handle amputated the employee's right little fingertip.

An employee was operating a cartridge seal machine when the machine jogged, pinching her finger between the seal transfer and seal cutting die. Her left index finger was amputated at the first knuckle. The machine was guarded at the time of the incident.
On 12/14/16, an employee was operating a horizontal band saw when the blade moved unexpectedly, amputating the left ring fingertip and lacerating the left middle finger.
A dock plate fell on an employee's hand and amputated a fingertip.
On December 15, 2016, an employee was operating a book binder cutter when the machine jammed. As he attempted to clear the jam, the blade came down and amputated his left ring finger's first knuckle.
An employee's pinky fingertip was amputated by a pulley.

An employee and a coworker were placing a cold case (refrigerator) into a counter when the coworker lost his grip, causing the employee to also lose his grip. The employee's right-hand pinky finger was caught between the cold case and the counter, amputating it at the first knuckle.
An employee was lifting a board from a pallet when his fingers were smashed between the board and pallet, amputating his right thumb tip and index fingertip.
An employee's left index finger was caught between a chain and a 1,500-pound part that was being lifted by an overhead crane, partially amputating the fingertip.
An employee was unloading a coil from a forklift when the forklift pinched the employee's hand, crushing the right ring finger. The finger had to be amputated.
An employee was clearing a jam on an assembly machine when the machine cycled and amputated the employee's right middle fingertip.
An employee was sawing wood with a table saw when the blade amputated two fingers. The saw was unguarded at the time.
An employee suffered a finger amputation.

On December 16, 2016, an employee was inspecting a ball valve for correct assembly and testing it using air. When the air was applied, it caused the valve to close on and amputate his left index fingertip.
An employee was cutting meat with a saw and amputated his right thumb tip.
An employee was attempting to remove poly film lid debris from a filling machine when the employee's right thumb was caught and amputated in the machine.

On December 17, 2016, an employee was attempting to clear a jam during a plastic grinding process when the airlock's rotating mechanical paddle wheel caught the employee's hand. The employee's left middle and ring fingers were amputated at the second knuckle.
On December 17, 2016, at 7:30 a.m., an employee was jogging a machine while attempting to adjust a poly wrapper when a plate came down and amputated his left middle fingertip.
An employee was manually turning the gears to a slitter machine that had just been cleaned when his right middle and ring fingers were caught in the gears, pinching and amputating the fingertips.
An employee was changing the motor on a machine when the motor slipped and amputated his left index finger.

An employee was monitoring the production line when he saw that a board on the line was not straight. As he attempted to straighten the board, his left ring finger was caught between the board and a flapper, amputating it just below the fingernail.

An employee was preparing to mix batter in a commercial mixer. When the machine started, the bowl started to move out of the frame. The employee attempted to catch the bowl and his hand was caught between the frame and the bowl, pinching and amputating a finger.
An employee was pushing a dryer rack cart when his left hand was caught between two carts, amputating the tip of the third digit on his left hand.

An employee was stepping down a ladder while restocking shelves when he missed a step. He reached out to catch himself by grabbing the shelving and his left ring finger was caught and amputated in the grid of the shelf.

A temporary employee was operating the protein mixer when the extruder stopped extruding. He began pulling out the protein when he contacted the mixer's metal blade, amputating his middle and ring fingers to the second knuckle and index finger to the first knuckle. The mixer was running at the time of the incident.
An employee was mooring a vessel when the employee's right ring finger was caught between the mooring line and a metal cleat, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was feeding paper through various rollers on a paper converting machine when his left index fingertip was caught and amputated in an ingoing roller nip.

An employee was attempting to repair a small portable pneumatic barrel pump that appeared to be frozen. The employee had his left ring finger inside the pump plunger when it activated, amputating his left ring finger.
An employee was removing dunnage from under a rig when the right index finger was caught between the dunnage and the stem of the jack resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was operating a jelly cup packing machine when it became energized. The employee's left index finger then contacted a moving part, amputating the distal tip.
An employee was resting their right hand on a test stand when a piece of the test (shielding) equipment fell onto the employee's hand resulting in a partial amputation of the right ring fingertip.

An employee was loading a hydraulic hammer into the back of a truck when he lost his footing and control of the hammer. It then rolled back and caught his hand between the hammer and the bucket of the tractor, amputating his left ring finger.
An employee was making adjustments to a chain conveyor with a come-along when the chain slipped and caught the employee's left hand, amputating the middle fingertip at the nailbed.
An employee was driving a forklift when his foot was pinched between two forklifts, amputating two left toes.
An employee was using a table saw to cut wood for cabinets when the blade partially amputated the employee's right index finger. The saw was unguarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was rolling a driveway using a compact roller (equipped with a rollover protective system and canopy) when he drove into a tree limb. His right pinky finger was caught and amputated on the tree limb.

An employee and a coworker were working at a machine press to bend metal parts. The employee was placing metal pieces while the coworker operated the machine. The coworker cycled the machine while the employee's fingers were still under it, smashing and fracturing them. The employee's fingers later had to be amputated.

During rigging down of a drilling rig, two employees attempted to lift/move an I-beam by hand. The I-beam shifted and crushed one of the employee's right middle finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip/print pad.

A temporary employee was mixing dough when he noticed dough stuck on a rod at an adjacent machine. He was attempting to clear out the dough when a moving part pinched and amputated his right ring fingertip between the part and the rod.

On December 22, 2016, at approximately 6:25 a.m., an employee was making adjustments to the GN machine 3030-7 contact heater when his hand slipped down into the cutting knife resulting in the amputation of the right index finger at the first knuckle.
A temporary employee was operating a forklift while carrying a nylon sling outside of the cab. The sling got caught under the rear tire of the forklift resulting in a left arm amputation.
An employee was operating a table saw and cut his right index finger resulting in amputation of the finger at the knuckle.
An employee was performing maintenance work using a grinder when their left thumb contacted the grinding wheel resulting in an amputation injury.

On December 22, 2016, at 11:00 a.m. an employee was manually moving a snow plow blade on a parked forklift and caught his finger under the blade and between a fork on the forklift resulting in a left middle fingertip amputation.
On December 22, 2016, at 11:30 am, an employee was bagging product and suffered a left index finger amputation.
An employee was operating a mechanical hydraulic press and cut the tip of his left hand middle finger at the point of operation. The tip was surgically amputated the following day.

Two employees were repairing a sofa. The injured employee's finger got caught between the springs and when the second employee pulled the springs the injured employee's left middle fingertip was amputated.
An employee's right arm was amputated while he was operating an edge grinder machine.

On November 30, 2016, an employee was working on the magna vc line and received a crushing injury when a finger was pinched between the slide and the part that was being repaired. On December 23, 2016, the right index finger was amputated.
An employee was operating a forklift and collided with another forklift traveling in the same direction resulting in amputation of a toe on the right foot.
An employee was troubleshooting a hydraulic power press and suffered the amputation of the right and left middle fingers above the first knuckle.
An employee was clearing a plug in a rotary feeder at the base of the bag filter and amputated four fingers on the left hand.
An employee was slicing a tomato using the meat/cheese slicer and amputated the right index fingertip.
Two employees received burns to their arms, hands and face while working in the shop area when the facility caught fire.

An employee was dumping scrap granite using a forklift. The employee placed his hand on the forks while pulling the lever to dump the bucket. The employee's left pinky finger was caught between the bucket and the fork resulting in amputation.
An employee's left thumb was partially amputated when it got caught between a beam and the hook of the overhead crane used to lift the beam.

On December 27, 2016, at approximately 10:50 p.m., an employee was changing the shackles on an evisceration line when his right thumb was amputated by the line. The shackle line was not turned off at the time of the incident.

An employee was setting up tools on a CNC machine. He had commanded a tool change when he noticed the coolant line was in the path of the tool changer. When he attempted to move the coolant line, the tool changer went into motion. His right index fingertip was then amputated between the tool and the changer (no bone loss).
An employee was using a handheld skill saw when the employee's glove was caught in the blade. The employee's left ring finger was then amputated up to the first knuckle.
An employee suffered a right-hand middle finger amputation while cleaning a lint filter.
An employee was getting ready to hook up to the dome while using the vault cart. The employee's left thumb was caught in the vault cart winch and the end of his thumb was amputated.

Two employees were sprayed with black liquor as they attempted to replace a refractometer. One employee was sprayed in the left eye, while the second employee was sprayed in the neck area. They suffered chemical burns.
An employee was performing duties as a derrick hand at an oil/gas production site when his right index fingertip was pinched and amputated between a pipe and a latch.
An employee was using a meat saw when his hand slipped and his right middle finger engaged with the blade, lacerating his fingernail and fingertip.

An employee was operating an LPM machine to seal small mustard packages. A mustard package jammed up the LPN machine and when the employee tried to pull the mustard package out, part of her left index finger was removed. The machine was guarded at the time.
An employee's gloved hand was caught between the moving rollers while removing strings from the powered conveyor resulting in the amputation of his right finger above the first knuckle.

An employee was using a hand grinder when he saw something wrong with the guard.  When he attempted to adjust the guard, the grinder caught his gloved hand and amputated his left index finger. The grinder was still in operation at the time of the incident.
An employee was obtaining a storm water sample when the storm water grate fell and pinched the employee's finger, amputating the fingertip.
Two employees were checking a dust collector when a flash fire occurred, seriously burning their faces, necks, shoulders, and hands. Both employees were hospitalized.
An employee was grinding parts on a pedestal belt grinder and suffered a left thumb amputation.
An employee was moving a ladder and caught their right index finger in the hinge resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was adjusting the cable on the electric hoist when his left index finger got caught up in the hoist cable and the fingertip was amputated.
An employee was cutting top sirloin on a meat saw and amputated the right index finger.
An employee was lowering the frame of the bread rounder back into place on the conveyor and pinched their right thumb resulting in amputation of the thumb.

An employee was using an air impact wrench to tighten lug nuts on the vehicle he was servicing. His glove got caught on the rotating spindle as he was tightening the lug nuts on the vehicle and the employee suffered an open fracture and amputation of his left little fingertip.
On January 03, 2017, an employee was closing a trailer door when their fingers were caught in the door and the left middle finger was amputated.
An employee was loading skylight panels onto a trailer when the employee's right pinky fingertip was caught and amputated between the panels and the trailer.
An employee was using a circular saw to rip a plywood counter top brace when the saw bound up and kicked back, partially amputating the employee's thumb.
An employee was using a cheese cutter when the blade amputated his finger.

An employee was using a pallet machine and was trying to clear a nail that was jammed in a nail bowl when the nailer came down and amputated the employee's left pinky fingertip. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time.
An employee was checking a vehicle and had his left hand in the motor belt when a coworker started the vehicle. The motor belt then moved and amputated his left middle, ring, and pinky fingers.
An employee was cutting cardboard that was on top of a pallet with a utility knife when the knife slipped and partially amputated his left thumb tip.
An employee was assisting in a dowel drilling operation and attempting to steady the drill when his glove was caught in the drill bit. His left fourth fingertip was then amputated by the drill bit.
An employee was threading bale wire through a paper scrap baler when the baler was activated. The employee's index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was stocking shelves and loading a baler with empty cardboard boxes. She was pulling a rope attached to the baler door to close it when her left pinky fingertip was caught and amputated in the door.

An employee was working on the rig floor of a workover rig. The crew was picking up pipe from the hole. The operator descended the block to the rig floor to connect to the pipe. The bails and elevators were connected to the blocks. When the elevators came down, the employee's finger was caught between the elevator and bail resulting in a left middle finger amputation at the first digit.
An employee suffered a finger amputation while operating a saw. The saw was guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was working at the shop running a 10-inch-long, 3-inch-wide piece of metal through a homemade roller machine. The employee was attempting to curve the piece of metal so that it would go on a wheel. While running the piece of metal through the roller, the employee's index finger was caught between the metal and the roller. The employee's right index fingertip was smashed and cut, resulting in a soft tissue amputation.

On January 5, 2017, at approximately 10:20 AM, employees were moving a small safe in order to renovate the floor and wall behind the safe. They attempted to lift the safe one corner at a time to place a shim under each corner. While they were placing a shim under a corner, the safe slipped off the pry bar and caught the injured employee's left-hand index finger, crushing it to the middle knuckle. The finger had to be amputated.
An employee was loading a diesel generator onto a trailer when the load shifted and pinched the employee's left index fingertip, amputating it.

An employee was cutting a 4' x 8' sheet of particle board with a table saw when the board kicked up, causing the saw's guard to flip up. He attempted to stop the board, but his right index and middle fingers were caught in the saw, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee was lifting 6" by 6" lumber when he slipped and fell after stepping on a steel plate, causing the lumber to fall on his right hand and amputate his middle and ring fingertips.
An employee was working on a saw when his right index finger came in contact with the saw blade resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was opening a valve he was repairing when he dropped the valve hand wheel. As he tried to catch it, the wheel crushed his middle fingertip, which had to be amputated.

On January 6, 2017, at approximately 6:00 p.m., an employee was injured while working at the cant deck in the resaw area. Standing near four motor driven chains, the employee noted two 6-8 inch cants that were not laying flat. Wearing leather gloves, the employee adjusted the cants when his left thumb became jammed between the chain and one cant, resulting in amputation of the tip of his thumb.
An employee was placing a tire on a tire changing machine when the machine was activated via the foot pedal. The machine then caught and amputated the employee's fingertip.

An employee was placing a zinc ingot into an induction melting electric furnace. When the zinc ingot contacted the molten metal, the furnace blew up, causing severe burns to the employee's upper body and minor burns to a coworker.

An employee was cleaning a cotton bale press and was attempting to hit the stop button when his arm hit the ram-down button, causing the ram to come down and crush his right hand. His hand was amputated.
An employee was retrieving a plastic part from inside a cooling tunnel when her finger became caught in a conveyor nip point, amputating her right middle fingertip.
On January 6, 2017, at approximately 11:45 a.m., an employee was operating a radial arm saw and amputated a ring finger.

An employee was on a ladder, visually checking and listening for possible air leaks on a line, when he slipped and grabbed a support structure next to the 180 gear. The forward motion of his weight caused his right hand to slide into the plastic gear, which amputated his right middle finger.
On January 7, 2017, an employee suffered a thumb tip amputation while using a band saw to cut meat.
An employee suffered a right middle fingertip amputation while cleaning a roller.

On January 7, 2017, an employee was operating an overhead crane to lower a section of tooling into a stationary stamping die. He leaned on the stationary stamping die to ensure that the tooling was lined up. As he lowered the tooling, his left fingertip was caught and partially amputated in the opening/pinch point.
A temporary employee was operating a drill press when their glove was caught and their left thumb was amputated to the first knuckle.
An employee was reaching for a box on a shelving unit when he slipped and his ring became caught on the shelf. His left ring finger was then partially amputated.
An employee was flattening out sheets of wire mesh when his right middle finger was caught between two wire bundle sheets, amputating his right middle fingertip without bone loss.

An employee was mounting the rear riding step of a refuse truck when his hand entered the refuse truck hopper where the sweep blade was running. The sweep blade caught and amputated his right middle fingertip.
An employee was assisting a press operator and attempting to remove a piece of scrap from the press when the machine cycled and amputated his right hand.
An employee was dumping items from a lugger into a metal dumpster. When the employee lifted the lugger and released the handle, the handle hit and amputated his left third fingertip.

An employee was operating a hydraulic lift on the back of a pickup truck to lift a washing machine when the employee's left index finger was pinched and partially amputated to the first knuckle. The lift was not guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee was setting up his equipment and caught his finger between the anti-lock roll and doctor roll crushing and severing the right middle finger. The employee was hospitalized for surgery.

Employees were laying a tarp over a section of a trench. Two employees slipped and fell approximately eight feet into the trench. Both employees were hospitalized. Employee 1 suffered broken ribs. Employee 2 suffered torn tendons/ligaments in his hands.

An employee was filling an oxygen cylinder from a large cylinder. Another employee pushed the booster pump and the cylinder exploded. Both employee were hospitalized for burns to the abdomen, arms, chest and face.

Two employees were removing an air bladder shaft from a paper core inside a plastic roll.  The roll was on a pallet on the floor.  An employee was stationed at each side of the roll.  The injured employee (temporary employee) was pushing the air release valve signaling the other employee to remove the shaft.  When the shaft was removed, the injured employee's right index finger was caught between the core and the air release valve causing a fracture/laceration to his right index finger.  The injured employee was wearing cut resistant gloves.

An employee was operating the waste chopper. The auger of the waste chopper is driven by two belts that are on a single wheel/sprocket; the belts and the motor that drives them are locked in a cabinet. As the employee was accessing the cabinet to retrieve a tool, his right thumb was caught in a pinch point between the belt and pulley, resulting in amputation. The machine was running at the time.

An employee was using a table saw to cut plywood to size.  The employee's right ring and middle fingertips were amputated at the first joint when the fingers came in contact with the table saw blade. The saw was not guarded at the time of the incident.
An employee amputated a finger while working with a machine.
An employee was cleaning the tumbler and amputated the left pinky fingertip.

An employee was preparing to cut a skin sliver with a meat saw. The meat slipped and the employee's fingers contacted the saw blade resulting in the amputation of the right middle and index fingertips.

An employee was operating a Haeger Press and inserting a pem stud into a flat steel part.  While his hands were between the tooling on the machine, the machine activated causing his left thumb to be caught between the top anvil and the steel part and amputating the tip.

An employee was moving warped metal from one conveyor to another when a faulty control switch caused a retractable conveyor to extend and pinch the employee's finger. The fingertip was medically amputated.

An employee was attempting to remove a piece of wood that was lodged between the rollers and a piece of metal on the conveyor belt using a wrench. The employee's gloved hand was caught in the machine resulting in the amputation of the right pinky fingertip.

An employee was using the table saw in the maintenance shop when the saw kicked back and cut his fingers. He suffered a right thumb laceration and amputation of skin from his first and second fingers. The saw was not guarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was in a bucket truck removing a tree limb from an overhead cable wire when the limb fell on his hand and smashed his right ring finger against the control panel of the bucket truck. His fingertip was medically amputated.

An employee was attempting to remove a jammed piece of wood from a waste wood vibrator conveyor and his index finger was pinched between the wood and the vibrator conveyor, amputating his fingertip down to the bone.

An employee was driving a reach truck down an aisle and stopped. When he started the truck back up, it struck a rack. The employee's left hand was pinned between the reach truck and the rack resulting in the amputation of his left index finger and middle fingertip.

An employee was operating an automated gang saw/flat bed saw and had loaded a new part. He was attempting to clean cut chip debris from the saw when the clamp came down and caught his left hand, partially amputating his pinky finger.

An employee was rigging up a building top-drive track and had the drive track hoisted when he saw something in the pin hole. As he attempted to remove the object, his right index fingertip was caught and amputated in the pin hole.

An employee was troubleshooting a press. The powdered metal is gravity fed through a tube into the die and the die shoe was not moving properly. The press was put into set up mode and the employee attempted to jog the shoe slightly. While the arm was jogging, a small metal arm of the shoe caught the employee's finger and pinched it between the shaker and the shake stop box. The fingertip was later amputated.
Two employees were conducting a pre-job assessment. When the employees opened an electrical box an arc flash occurred burning both employees on the face.

An employee was moving a 6-inch diameter, 13 foot length pipe onto a pipe rack. The injured employee went to help this employee move the pipe and grabbed the end of the pipe with his hand. The pipe became too heavy and the employee dropped it. The pipe came down on the employee's hand, pinching his hand between the pipe and some angle iron resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was operating a press and as the employee was removing an 8 inch tall part, the employee's pinky finger was partially amputated.

On January 13, 2017, an employee's left ring fingertip was amputated while clearing a jam from the mesh machine with a hook-like tool. Upon removing the plug, stored air pressure released causing the cylinder to come down on a fixed part and created a pinch point.

An employee was operating a mixer in the production department and was forming a 15 inch round concrete pipe. The employee's right hand was caught inside the pipe between a concrete rotor and the form resulting in the amputation of three fingers.

An employee was attempting to move a tool, described as a tool to assemble/disassemble generators, from a storage shelf to the floor with the assistance of a second employee. While moving the tool, the employee's right thumb was caught in a movable bracket. The employee was wearing cut resistant gloves; however, when the bracket pinched his thumb he jerked his hand and tore skin from the end of the thumb. The employee's thumb tip and finger nail were amputated.

An employee was cleaning the air-lock machine attached to a cooker. The equipment was not locked out and it energized while the employee's hand was in the machine resulting in the amputation of the left index finger to the first joint.
A temporary employee was operating an upcut saw and amputated his right thumb.
An employee was cleaning meat from the door of a meat mixer and amputated the right middle finger above the first knuckle.

An employee was moving a pallet of goods from one slot to another using a pallet jack when the employee's finger became caught between the pallet jack handle and fixed racking resulting in amputation.

An employee was using a razor knife to cut film. The employee was cutting with his right hand and steadying the film with his left hand. The employee cut towards his body and amputated the left index fingertip.

The injured employee was wiping off a roll of steel with a rag and cleaner. The employee directed another employee to rotate the roll. As the roll rotated, it pinched the injured employee's right pinky finger between the rolls of steel. The fingertip had to be amputated. The machine was not locked out/tagged out at the time.
An employee was using a band saw to cut metal pipe. The pipe slipped and the employee's right thumb was amputated.
An employee was working the first base media entrance and stepped between the magnetometer and the bag check table. She tripped over cable and fell breaking a hip.

An employee was trying to remove a tool extender bit from a hand drill wearing slip-resistant gloves. The employee grasped the tool extender bit and when the drill was turned on, the glove became entangled and torqued. His finger was squeezed between the glove and drill bit, amputating the left pinky fingertip.
An employee was pulling a truck out of a ditch with the winch from another truck and amputated the left pinky fingertip.
An employee was cutting shingles with a manual shingle cutter and amputated the left index fingertip.
An employee was moving a trailer when the tongue dropped and landed on his finger resulting in a partial amputation of the right ring finger.

An employee and a coworker were lifting a trash cart to empty its contents inside a dumpster when the employee's left middle finger was caught between the metal dumpster and the trash cart. The employee's fingertip was amputated up to the nail bed.
An employee's left middle and ring fingers were partially amputated by the knives on a cutter machine.
Two employees were hospitalized after a motor vehicle accident inside a military installation.

An employee was preparing to unload a truck mounted shipping container by activating the dock plate which is manually operated with a handle. While lowering the dock plate onto the back of the truck, the dock plate recoiled upon striking the right side of the truck causing the plate not to clear the truck as required to lay flat for unloading operations. The employee's left ring finger was pinched between the steel dock plate and left side steel edge of the dock plate.
An employee was operating a punch press to punch holes in an aluminum door frame when his left middle finger was caught in a ram, amputating his fingertip. The ram was unguarded at the time.

On January 19, 2017, an employee was operating an overhead crane to raise an 1,800-pound load. During the ascent, the load began to swing and pinched the employee's left thumb between a stationary object and the load. The employee's thumb was amputated.
An employee was using a chisel, punch, and hammer to remove rivets from the frame of a train tender when the chisel flew loose and struck the employee's left eye, requiring surgery.
An employee was running a milling machine when a software glitch allowed the machine's clamp to close on and amputate the employee's fingertip.
An employee's right thumb tip was caught and amputated in a chuck saw.
An employee was working on a tractor alternator belt when a coworker started the engine. The employee's right second and third fingertips were then amputated by the moving belt.

An employee turned off a gang rip saw to clear debris from it with his left hand. The saw blades were still in motion and amputated his left fingers. The saw was unguarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was working with a high-pressure processing machine and was trying to put the push arm back when the machine reset and caught the employee's finger between the sheet metal and the push arm. The employee suffered a contusion and amputation to the left ring fingertip.

An employee was using a jib crane to lower a mold onto a carrier that had a bolt laying on top of it. When the employee attempted to pull the bolt from beneath the mold, it dropped down and smashed his left middle finger between the mold and carrier. His left middle fingertip was partially amputated.
An employee was placing a safety collar on the cylinder when the machine cycled crushing his right middle finger between the safety collar and the cylinder and causing a partial amputation.

On January 21, 2017, an employee was using a rag to clean grease off a printing press when the rag became caught in the machine. A moving part then pulled the employee's left index finger into the machine, amputating the fingertip. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time.

An employee was working with a flat automated calling system machine and over-the-road container when the container shifted, catching her left hand between the container and a dumper restrain bar. She suffered a left ring finger amputation and fracture.
An employee's right hand became caught in an electrical meat grinder, partially amputating the middle and ring fingers.

An employee was operating an extruding repalletizer. The line jammed and when he broke the line loose, his fingers were pulled into the machine resulting in the amputation of the left index and middle fingertips. The machine was energized at the time of the incident.

A crew of three employees had just repaired a heater/treater water leg 3" vitriolic coupling and had pressured it up with a pump. A leak appeared at a bolt on the unit and the two injured employees proceeded to tighten it. While the two were tightening the bolt, they heard a pop and something gave away. They were drenched with liquid and gas. The third employee saw this and shut the pump down and was going to isolate the unit when it caught fire near the coupling. The fire spread to the two drenched employees. One employee suffered third degree burns while the second employee suffered second degree burns.

An employee was operating a packer machine when he attempted to grab a piece of flex duct that was hanging from the back. His right index finger was caught and amputated by the machine, and his middle finger was cut.

An employee on a scissor lift that had a manually extendible boom was replacing a furnace door. As he was maneuvering the door, he placed his left hand on the lift's top rail assembly, which consisted of a square tubing channel and a U-shaped channel. When he pushed the door against the lift, his left pinky was caught and amputated (above the knuckle) between the two channels.

An employee was preparing a finished boat for shipment. He was placing a battery in the motor box when the lid of the box inadvertently closed and crushed his right big toe, amputating part of the bone.

An employee was entering the plant through another building when a door closed on her right ring finger. The doctor diagnosed the injury as an amputation of the distal portion of her right ring finger.

An employee was using a pipe threading machine to attach a four-way coupling onto a threaded steel pipe. The employee used a pipe wrench to hold the coupling in place. When the pipe wrench was released from the coupling, the foot pedal was engaged and the pipe wrench came down and crushed the employee's fingertip, amputating it.
An employee was working on a chain and sprocket conveyor when the machine restarted and amputated the distal tip of his left ring finger up to the first knuckle.

The employee was operating a mill machine to put flats on round bar stock. The employee reached behind the stock to check on a radius and was caught between the bit and the stock amputating the right index fingertip.

A graduate assistant teacher was preparing to run a column chromatograph7 purification wearing a flame retardant lab coat and safety glasses, as well as gloves, long pants and closed toed shoes. A second graduate assistant teacher was sitting at his desk in the same lab at the time. The first teacher struck the bottom of a 4L glass bottle of hexanes on the edge of the bench, while attempting to put the bottle down. The bottom of the bottle sheared off on contact with the bench and the contents spilled onto the ground. Some of the hexane spilled onto the teacher's lab coat, long pants (left leg) and shoe (left foot).  After an initial assessment of the spill, the teacher collected absorbent towels and paper towels to begin to contain and clean up the spill. He was assisted by the second teacher who heard the breakage while sitting at his desk.  Shortly after the teachers began to contain the spill, it ignited explosively causing a flash fire. Both teachers were burned and admitted to the hospital.

An employee was transporting a scaffold section from the hall of a school under construction to a bathroom to begin masonry work. The employee had his hand against the wall as he was waiting to erect the scaffold. Another employee slid a section of the scaffold down to the injured employee. At that point the section slid down and amputated the employee's left pinky fingertip.
An employee was demonstrating the metal bender to another employee when their glove was caught between two rollers resulting in the partial amputation of the left index finger.

An employee was assisting in moving a portable truck scale when the load shifted, fell approximately 10 feet, and caught the employee's left-hand fingers between the cribbing and the asphalt resulting in three fingertip amputations and fractures.

An employee was climbing a ladder to access the blower motor. The employee was standing on the fourth rung when their right hand came in contact with the running pulley belt resulting in amputation of the right middle fingertip.
An employee was walking through a door with a ladder when the wind caught the door and slammed it closed on the employee's left ring finger, resulting in amputation at the first joint.
An employee engaged in bead building activities had their right ring fingertip amputated when it was caught in a pinch point on the bead wire spool.
An employee was cutting wood profile samples when his finger was caught under a pneumatic guiding/clamping tool resulting in a partial fingertip amputation.
An employee was  adjusting the tension of a saw belt. The saw was locked out. The employee manually rotated the pulley and caught his right thumb in the belt amputating the tip.
An employee was operating the pop up saw and amputated the right middle fingertip.
An employee was working on the motor of the scrap out conveyor when his glove was caught in the chain amputating the right index finger.
An employee was manually lifting a roll of fabric material with a metal pole. The employee placed the pole into its holder and pinched their left index finger resulting in a partial amputation.
An employee was unloading metal beams when their left hand was caught between two beams. The employee suffered a severe laceration that resulted in medical amputation.
Two employees were installing a battery on the police boat when the fuel vapors ignited causing a flash fire. The employees suffered third degree burns to the face and arms.
An employee amputated the left pinky fingertip with a shaper machine.
An employee was observing a switch operation during troubleshooting and got a finger caught in the motor belt resulting in two fingertip amputations.

An employee was lining up pipes to be connected when the clamp that holds the pipes together broke and the employee's left index finger was caught in the lifting chains amputating it at the first knuckle.

On January 27, 2017, at 9:45 a.m. an employee was attempting to reposition the upper of two loaded Ropak pallets in the Pack Area to gain visual access to the shipping label on the pallet for inventory purposes. The employee's left pinky finger became caught between the two pallets resulting in a partial amputation.

An employee was moving a transport dolly loaded with approximately 200 pounds of sheet metal. As he was turning the dolly, his right pinky finger got caught between a stationary table and the dolly handle resulting in the amputation of his right pinky fingertip without bone loss.

An employee was changing out a motor on a drag conveyor. Lock out/tag out was removed and power restored to check rotation. When the motor started, the employee's fingers were pulled into the chain and gear box amputating the left index and middle fingertips. The left ring finger sustained a laceration requiring stitches.
An employee moving meat on a conveyor amputated her left middle finger.
An employee was retrieving documents from a safe and closed their left pinky finger in the safe door resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was slipping new drilling line when his right hand got caught in the sheave resulting in the amputation of four fingers. The thumb was not affected.
An employee was using a wrench to loosen a nut. The wrench slipped resulting in the amputation of the left thumb tip.
An employee was using a coping grinder to grind a piece of flat bar. The flat bar gave way and the employee's hand was caught in the machine amputating the left little finger to the second knuckle.
An employee was operating a vertical wrapper and amputated the left middle fingertip.
An employee was checking the rice bagging machine when his hand was caught in the jaws of the machine severing the left index finger at the first joint.
An employee suffered a double finger amputation injury to his right hand when he contacted the table saw blade in an attempt to dislodge a jammed board.
An employee was operating the shaper that bevels the edges of small pieces angled to fit into a garage door and contacted the shaper blade amputating a fingertip.
An employee amputated his index fingertip on a band saw.
An employee was operating a metal sheet roller when a glove got caught in a roller amputating the left index fingertip.

An employee was installing a life ring at the entrance of the floating dock. The dock had become misaligned and off level on the rocks after a recent Nor'easter. A 2x4x8 foot piece of lumber was used to pry up the anchored side of the dock. The lumber snapped and the employee's right thumb was pinched between the lumber and a rock resulting in a partial amputation of the right thumb tip including the nail.
An employee was operating a shear machine and amputated the left middle fingertip.
An employee was operating the boring mill and amputated the left ring finger at the first knuckle.
An employee was operating a punch press and crushed a finger in the point of operation resulting in a partial amputation to the right index fingertip.

An employee was replacing the transmission in a one-ton truck using a jack. The transmission shifted and the employee's third finger on the right hand was crushed between the transmission and the jack resulting in a partial amputation of the finger above the first knuckle.

An employee was walking alongside a Lull (forklift) while balancing a 21 ft. long pipe next to the front tire. As the operator moved forward, the Lull ran over his foot. The employee's foot was amputated.

An employee was assembling the printer pinion gear at his work bench when his right pinky finger was pinched between the bearing housing and the housing of the gear box resulting in the amputation of his right pinky fingertip without bone loss.
An employee was moving a work bench when the bench leg collapsed. The bench then amputated his left third finger.
A temporary employee was working on a machine used to split pillar cores when a piece of log broke off into the machine. As he attempted to retrieve the piece, the machine amputated his thumb tip.
An employee was troubleshooting a malfunctioning descalper machine when the employee's right middle finger was pinched and amputated between a belt and pulley. The belt was guarded at the time.
An employee was picking up pieces of scrap from the floor when his finger was caught between a belt and pulley on a vibrating conveyor. His right ring fingertip was amputated.
An employee was operating a chime spray machine when his finger was caught between the chime and the lid, amputating his right index fingertip.

An employee was driving a stand-up rider powered industrial truck (PIT) beside food storage racks when his left thumb was pinched between an upright post for the PIT's overhead guard and a storage rack, de-gloving/amputating his thumb tip.
Two employees were injured by an explosion at the worksite, suffering bone fractures, burns, and internal injuries.

An employee was cleaning the floors in the mixing room. The employee was below the running mixer and attempted to remove product residue with his right hand. His fingers contacted the rotating auger resulting in amputation of the right middle finger at the first joint.

The employee was picking up rocks in the field and placing them in a tractor trailer. One of the rocks slipped and smashed his fingertip between it and the tractor bucket resulting in amputation at the first knuckle.
An employee was lowering the lift gate on a stake truck when his fingers were caught and smashed beneath the closing gate. His left middle finger was partially amputated.

While adjusting the steel arms (a lifting device) over a stacker pad for wooden truss manufacturing, an employee's left middle finger was crushed and partially amputated between the lifting arm and a wooden truss.
An employee was throwing scrap iron into a bin when a piece of scrap iron became caught on his left ring finger, partially amputating the distal tip.

An employee was lifting a feed cover. The cover would not lift any farther, so the employee decided to place the cover back down. In the descent, the employee's right middle finger became pinched and amputated between the cover and a fixed object.
An employee was using a bandsaw to cut a bone-in ham when the meat rolled and his right thumb contacted the blade, amputating the tip.

On 2/5/16, at approximately 6:12 p.m., an employee was checking to see if a plate was loose in a case packer when his hand entered a pinch point on the running machine. He suffered two fingertip amputations.
An employee suffered a left index finger amputation behind the fingernail while moving an auger.

An employee was feeding material into a set of calendar rolls when the operator started the machine. The employee's gloved hand was then caught in the machine and his finger was amputated. The machine was not locked out at the time of the incident.
An employee was replacing gears on a machine when the shaft moved during the lift and caught his left thumb, amputating the tip. The machine was locked out at the time.

An employee was watching a crane drive a timber pile into the ground. His hand was between the cable and the timber pile as the crane operator lifted the cable. The cable then pulled tight, pinching and amputating his right thumb tip.
An employee was exiting the "dog house" when his right pinky finger was caught and amputated between the door and the doorway.
An employee was using a hand drill to drill a hole through a header when the paddle bit went through the wood and drilled into his right index finger.
An employee was cutting meat with a band saw when the blade amputated his left thumb tip.
An employee suffered a right index finger amputation while using a shear machine.
An employee was loading wood into a molder when the employee's fingers were caught between two pieces of wood, causing a partial fingertip amputation.
An employee was exiting a vehicle when the employee's left middle fingertip was caught and amputated between the door and a trailer.

An employee was trying to change over the robot settings on a pneumatic welding machine when a coworker pressed a button and a plate came down and partially amputated the employee's right ring fingertip.
An employee was loading a conveyor belt with lumber when his left pinky fingertip was caught and amputated between the sprocket and chain on the conveyor belt.
An employee was gauging a chemical transport tank when a hatch fell on and amputated his finger.

While packing product on a conveyor system, an employee observed product accumulating at a part on the conveying line. When he attempted to clear the jam, his right hand was caught in the operating equipment, amputating his middle fingertip.
An employee was cutting paper. When the employee depressed the cutter, the right middle fingertip was caught in the clamp and amputated.
An employee was attempting to free a coil chain from a coil when his left middle finger was caught between the chain and the coil, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was inserting the bracket into a press brake and lining it up when the press was activated via the foot switch. The press die then lowered onto his right middle and ring fingers, amputating his fingertips.
An employee was setting up equipment to move a load of steel coils via an overhead crane when his left index finger was smashed between the lifting hook and lifting device, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was preparing to clean the drum of a mixer truck. To access the drum, the employee raised the hopper located at the rear of the truck and placed a brace underneath it. The hopper slipped from the brace and fell onto the employee's right index finger crushing it. The finger was surgically amputated between the first and second digit.
An employee was installing a fan belt on an exhaust fan when his glove was caught and his right thumb tip was partially amputated by the belt.
An employee suffered a left thumb tip amputation while operating a band saw. Cut-resistant gloves were not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was feeding a roll into a tube-cutting machine when his hand entered the hopper area of the machine. The internal cutting blade then amputated his right middle finger.
An employee was opening a window when it fell down and pinched the employee's right index finger between the metal sash and the bottom of the window, amputating the fingertip.
An employee was pulling belts on a large blower when his hand became caught on a belt. His right ring fingertip was amputated and a bone broke in his right index finger.

An employee was preparing a shell core machine to make shells. The employee installed the right half of the pattern and placed the left into position. The employee activated the machine to bring the two pattern frames together. The rotating cylinder became stuck and the employee hit it with a hammer. The frames then closed on his left ring finger amputating it below the first knuckle.

An employee was hand feeding a copper tube into a finning machine with her right hand. The employee rested her left hand on top of the slide gate guard with her fingertips behind the guard. The machine was in the automatic mode. The slide gate activated and amputated her left small fingertip.

An employee was on a man lift with a coworker erecting product racks. The employee had his hand on the rail of the basket of the man lift while it was being raised. His left middle finger was then caught between the racking and the rail of the man lift, partially amputating the fingertip.
On February 8, 2017, at about 9:30 AM, an employee was inspecting air handling units and amputated his right middle fingertip when it was caught between the moving belt and pulley of a fan blower.

An employee was working on a tractor with a blow gun when the gun's air pressure removed the bolt. The employee's left middle finger was then smashed between the brake chamber and tractor, partially amputating his fingertip.

An employee was hooking up a strap to connect a small excavator to a concrete saw. While a coworker was picking up the saw with the excavator, he attempted to readjust the straps at the moment the two pieces of equipment came together. His left ring finger was caught and amputated from the nail between the excavator bucket and the concrete saw.
An employee was making adjustments to a planer when his left hand contacted the fan motor, partially amputating his ring and middle fingers.

An employee was removing a steel pot that was in the upright position. The steel pot was supported by its own weight on the ground. In trying to do so, the steel pot shifted and leaned to one side. The steel pot landed on a piece of cement wall that was adjacent to the steel pot. The employee's finger was caught between the steel pot and the cement wall. The employee's right middle finger was amputated at the last knuckle.
An employee was bending a sheet metal part in a press brake when the employee's left middle fingertip was pinched and amputated between the tool bed of the press brake and the sheet metal part.

An employee was operating a pipe grooving machine when the employee's glove and hand were pulled into the point of operation, partially amputating the right index finger to the second knuckle and the middle fingertip to the first knuckle.
An employee was cutting food with a knife when the blade amputated the employee's left thumb. Personal protective equipment was not worn at the time of the incident.
An employee was de-burring a machine part when the employee's right fingertip contacted the machine and was amputated.

An employee was operating a skid pusher to push freight into a trailer while he pulled the door down. The door came down fast and caught his hand between the door latch and the edge of the skid pusher, amputating a fingertip and causing a fracture.

An employee was shifting a material support stand with a coworker when the employee's left thumb was pinched between the tops of the support being moved and an adjacent support. The distal tip of the employee's left thumb was amputated.

An employee was beginning to do a pre-operational inspection on equipment. She was visually inspecting a running tail cutter when she noticed some debris in the wheel. She put on her glove and attempted to clear the machine of debris. When she did, her glove was caught by the equipment, which then amputated her right index fingertip.

An employee was helping a forklift operator load a non-working truck into a cargo shipping container. The truck was being placed into the shipping container facing outward when the tires slipped off of the lip of the container and the truck bounced.
