The employee's left ring finger was caught and pinched in the hood, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was loading a semi trailer when his right middle finger was caught on an E-track inside the trailer, amputating his distal phalanx.

Two employees were unloading equipment with a truck-mounted spooling crane cable. They attempted to untangle the cable by spooling it out. The first employee's hand was on the spool when the second employee engaged it. The cable then amputated the first employee's thumb.
An employee was removing shoring material when it slipped out of the employee's hand and amputated the right pinky fingertip.

An employee was trying to run a sand line down a hole when the line stopped. The stopping motion threw a loop in the line. When the employee attempted to grab the line, it dropped down the hole and amputated three of his right-hand fingers.
An employee was clearing a jam in a cutting machine when the machine started up and amputated the employee's fingers.

An employee was installing an arch pipe in a driveway. After the employee released the mechanism on the hoisting apparatus that held the pipe, the pipe fell on the employee's finger, pinching it between the pipe and the concrete driveway. The employee's right ring finger was amputated at the first joint.
Two employees were working on a scaffold when the scaffold's saddle hanger broke, causing them to fall approximately 24 feet to the concrete below. They were hospitalized.
An employee was cleaning a channel on an anti-caking machine when his glove was caught in a rotating part, amputating his right index fingertip.
An employee was removing concrete product from the molds and got a finger pinched between the pulling beam and the pulled concrete product. The employee's left little finger was medically amputated.
An employee was pulling a cow head off a slide when another head slid down and amputated the employee's left middle finger.
An employee was preparing to weld when his left index finger entered the path of the weld, partially amputating his fingertip.

An employee was using a crane to lower a 3-inch plate onto support boards. He was down on one knee while positioning the plate and operating the crane when he lost his balance and slipped. As he put his hand out to brace the fall, it was caught between the motor plate and a pallet. His left middle and ring fingertips were amputated.
An employee was repairing a fixture to hold a shotgun stock when an air clamp actuated and amputated the employee's left ring fingertip.
An employee was retrieving mailbox keys from a safe when the safe door closed on and partially amputated his right pinky finger.

An employee was cutting a bone-in pork chop with a band saw when the bone became snagged on the blade and pulled the employee's fingers into the blade. The employee's right middle finger was partially amputated.

On 2/13/17, an employee was operating a crane and hook to load material onto a truck. When the employee lowered the crane hook to remove a sheet lifter, the employee's right index finger was pinched and amputated within the D-ring.
An employee was opening a security gate and attempting to release a bent locking mechanism when his right ring finger was caught in the mechanism, amputating his fingertip.

An employee was cleaning trim extruders on the lower side of a locked out auger. During the cleaning process, the equipment was unlocked. At that time, the employee's right finger entered the auger's drain port and was amputated.

An employee was operating a skid steer to remove snow during a snowstorm when he felt something in the blades of the skid steer. He shut down the PTO switch, got out, and attempted to retrieve the object. During this process, his coat pulled the PTO switch back to the on position, and the equipment caught his glove and then hand, amputating his left index fingertip below the first joint.

An employee was driving a reach truck when it malfunctioned, stopped suddenly, turned right, and collided into another reach truck. The employee's leg was amputated below the knee during the collision.
An employee was helping a coworker hoist a motor to change out an auger when his right pinky became caught between the motor and the railing, amputating his fingertip.

An employee and several coworkers were moving a storage rack that was on pallet jacks when the storage rack struck another unit and the employee's right pinky fingertip was pinched and amputated between the rack and a wood shelf.

An employee was forming metal on a press brake when he experienced a cramp in his leg and began to stretch his leg to get the cramp out. In the process of taking care of the cramp, the foot pedal was engaged which caused the machine to cycle and partially amputate his left ring and middle fingers.

An employee was attempting to remove steel plates from a case packing machine that was held in position by two bolts. After the employee removed the top bolt and loosened the bottom one, the plate swung down and struck the employee's left hand, partially amputating the left thumb.

The employee was standing on a catwalk and using a cord tied to his hands to remove an empty film roll from a machine. The cord got caught in a roller beneath the catwalk and amputated the employee's left ring and index fingers.
An employee was manufacturing metal cylinders. A cylinder slipped and fell 12 inches. As the employee tried to catch it, two fingertips on the left hand were amputated.

Two employees were carrying a sheet of metal decking. When they went to put the sheet down, one employee's finger was caught between the cement wall and the sheet of metal decking, amputating the left index fingertip.

An employee was cleaning out the drain port underneath a mixer tank. He removed the drain port cap and was attempting to clear out the port when the mixer ribbon (metal agitator) struck his hand and partially amputated three fingers.

An employee was using compressed air to clean out materials in a saw. The employee's left hand was on the frame of the machine when it cycled and a brass rail caught the employee's thumb and pinched it against the frame. The employee's left thumb tip had to be surgically amputated. The machine was unguarded at the time of the incident.

An employee was putting parts into boxes near the rolling mill when the mill needed to be loaded with a new coil. During the loading process, the employee's glove was caught and pulled into the mill, and the employee's left pinky fingertip was amputated.
An employee was changing tooling at the form molding machine when the tooling fell and struck the employee's left thumb, amputating the tip.
An employee was inserting a locking pin into a bushing when the locking pin amputated the employee's right thumb.
An employee's left thumb was caught between a hydraulic clamp and the copper tube that was in the clamp. The thumb was surgically amputated at the last knuckle.

An employee was packing tubes in a box from a moving plastic cleated conveyor in the Packaging Department. The employee's work glove was caught on the moving conveyor pulling his hand into the static plate on the conveyor and amputating the right index finger.

An employee was helping a coworker lower and position a steel beam onto a rolling cart when his right middle finger was caught between the steel beam and the rolling cart, amputating his fingertip at the nailbed.
An employee's right index finger was caught on a shackle on a rehang line, amputating it above the second joint.
A temporary employee was using a sander and cut her left ring finger. Her fingertip was surgically amputated.
While closing two oven doors, an employee's fingers went through the door handles and were pinched between the doors, amputating two fingertips.
On February 15, 2017, an employee was working cables for dry dock spray curtains with a capstan. His left index finger was caught in the cable where it meets the drum, amputating his fingertip.
An employee was unloading a dumpster when his hand was pinched between the forks of a forklift and a dumpster attachment, partially amputating his left pinky finger.

An employee was helping a Lull operator offload crates of switch gear from a truck when one crate became caught on another. The Lull operator then tilted the forks down. The products slid down and pinched the employee's right fingertip, amputating it.

An employee and a coworker were exchanging a mold. The coworker raised the mold with a stand forklift while the employee used a hand to lift a part. The employee's fingertip was then caught and amputated between the upper part of the mold and the forklift structure.

An employee was walking to a dock door to meet a delivery person. She opened the folding hand truck before opening the overhead dock door. The two sections of the hand truck pinched her left little fingertip, severely lacerating and amputating it.
On 2/15/2017, an employee was trimming parts on a trimming press and had a finger on the right hand crushed, resulting in amputation.

An employee was re-installing a roller assembly after working on a motor beneath it when the roller assembly slipped and pinched his fingers between it and a cross-member. His right middle and ring fingertips were amputated.
An employee was closing the bulk mail container's metal door when it fell on his right hand, amputating his middle fingertip.
An employee was positioning equipment while getting ready to repair an over-the-road container when his left pinky finger was caught and amputated in the container door.
An employee was changing the tool in a CNC stamping machine when the tool fell and smashed the employee's left pinky fingertip, resulting in an amputation.

An employee was inspecting a pump house frame when he discovered the back board box was installed upside down. He enlisted a coworker to help remove and reinstall the box. His left hand was inside the box and his right hand was underneath it as it moved a few inches. When it cleared the framework, the box fell and pinched the employee's finger between it and a piece of angle iron below. His right middle fingertip was partially amputated.
An employee was attempting to clear a chocolate outlet tube when a rotating agitator inside the chocolate tube amputated her right middle finger above the top joint.
An employee was fixing damage to a custom trailer door using a pry bar and block of wood when the door shifted at the top and amputated the employee's right finger.
An employee was using a machine when it caught his glove and pulled his finger in, amputating his fingertip. The machine was guarded at the time.
An employee was lifting stone material with a suction cup when the slab came loose and crushed the employee's right middle finger, amputating the fingertip without bone loss.
An employee's hand was on the inside of a doorframe while a coworker was holding the door. The coworker closed the door, which amputated the employee's right ring fingertip.
An employee was lowering a cover die with an overhead crane when his left index finger was pinched and amputated between the cover die and the machine sleeve.
While fabricating a metal bench, an employee placed a metal clamp on top of the bench. The clamp was not secured and fell on the employee's right thumb, amputating the tip.
An employee was cleaning a piece of equipment when a piece fell and amputated his thumb tip.

On February 18, 2017, at approximately 5:30 p.m., an employee was replacing the chain on a breading machine conveyor that was turned off. The power was restored to the machine while the employee was checking the tension of the chain. The moving chain caught and amputated the employee's right index fingertip.
An employee was cutting meat on a band saw and amputated the tip of his pinky finger.
As an employee was manually moving a part onto the forks of a forklift, the part slipped and pinched the employee's finger between it and the ground, amputating the right middle fingertip.

An employee was operating a scaler at the batter depositor. The depositor needed to be adjusted for the weight of the batter being deposited in the cake pan. The employee was fixing the adjustment handle and amputated their left pinky fingertip.

An employee was using a portable band saw to create quality samples from steel tubing. He held the band saw with his right hand and attempted to catch the sample piece with his left. The saw blade bound up inside the tubing. He was attempting to steady the saw with his left hand when the blade cut and amputated his left index fingertip.
A temporary employee was operating a machine in the assembly department and amputated the right middle fingertip.
An employee loosening nuts using a hydraulic torque wrench pinched his left ring finger between the nut and wrench. The finger was amputated up to the first knuckle.

An employee was holding the rigging line while he was signaling the operator to lift the load. As the load was lifted up, it shifted and his left hand little finger was caught between the rigging strap and the lifting box and was amputated.
An employee was trimming bushes at a jobsite. As he was attempting to grab a hedge lopper, he grabbed the bottom of the tool and hit the trigger. The blade then amputated his left ring fingertip.

An employee was collecting willow branches and using pneumatic clippers to cut the material to length. As the employee was cutting a branch, he amputated the tip of his left thumb without bone loss. The hospital reattached the tip of the thumb.

An employee was installing bearings onto an axle hub with a handheld bearing press. The press malfunctioned and became stuck in the down position. When the employee reached into the bearing press to free the plunger, it shot up and partially amputated his left thumb tip.

An employee was performing maintenance on a roll-on ball dispensing machine. He was wiping the machine with a towel when his finger was pulled into the machine and was crushed between the drive pulley and belt. His left index fingertip was amputated. The machine was in operation at the time of the incident.
The cover of a splice box closed on an employee's hand, amputating the ring and middle finger down to the middle knuckle and a small portion of the pinky.

An employee was changing out the tensioner wheel on a roll grinding machine when the pneumatic positioner activated. His left thumb and index finger then became wedged between the positioner guide and the sanding belt housing. His index finger was partially amputated.

An employee was trying to dislodge a dock plate that was stuck to a trailer door when someone pushed the activation button for the plate. His right middle finger was then caught and possibly amputated between the dock plate and the door latch of the trailer.
An employee was attempting to unjam a stacker machine when the employee's left hand was caught in the machine, amputating the index and middle fingertips.
An employee replaced a belt on a vacuum pump. When the employee was checking the belt alignment, his left hand ring finger was caught in a nip point causing a fingertip amputation.
An employee suffered a left index fingertip amputation.
An employee was helping to load a backhoe hammer into a trailer when the employee's thumb was caught and partially amputated between a chain and the side of the trailer.
An employee was closing the door to the rapid enforcement lane booth when a gust of wind caused the door to slam shut on his right hand, amputating his fourth fingertip.

An employee was helping a maintenance crew put hammers back on the rotors of a hammer mill. The employee was positioning the rotor while a coworker used a bar to lift it. The rotor rotated downward while being lifted, and the employee's hand was caught in a pinch point between the key stop and frame of the rotor. The employee's left index fingertip was amputated.
On February 22, 2017, at approximately 4:00 PM, an employee was operating a circular saw to cut a small block of a 2x4 when the saw amputated his left thumb.

An employee was cutting a piece of plywood on a table saw when his left glove and hand were caught and pulled into the saw blade, amputating his index and middle fingers and lacerating his ring finger.
An employee was reversing a pallet jack when his hand was caught between the jack and a rack, partially amputating his right pinky finger.

An employee was running a food packaging machine when it jammed with packaging material. When the employee went to clear the machine, her right middle finger was pinched and partially amputated by the heat sealing jaws. The machine was guarded at the time.

An employee was feeding bar stock into a CNC Machine when the bar stock became jammed in the feeder. When he pushed the bar stock forward, it rammed into the side of the machine and struck his left middle finger, partially amputating it and avulsing a nailbed.
An employee and a coworker were attempting to remove a sewer grate when the grate shifted and pinched the employee's thumb between it and the ground. The employee's thumb was partially amputated.

Two employees were offloading materials on the loading dock when a truck driver backed into and struck them. They were pinned between the loading dock and the lift gate of the truck, suffering compound fractures to their femurs.

An employee was operating a banding machine and reached into the machine to remove a piece of wood. The platen that clamps the board closed on the employee's right index finger crushing the fingertip and fingernail.

An employee was operating a machine that cuts penne pasta when strands of pasta became jammed in the machine. He attempted to clear the jam and removed the flexible plastic tubing. He saw that the pasta was jammed in the cone and tried to push the dough out of the bottom of the cone. The moving blade then amputated his index fingertip. The machine was not locked or tagged out at the time.

On February 22, 2017, at approximately 1:00 PM, an employee was helping to set up a pump on the skid. While lowering the pump, the employee attempted to align the bolts and caught his finger between the skid and the pump. The employee suffered a right middle fingertip amputation.

An employee was pressing an air valve on a shaft to let air out. When the air was released, the roll moved on the shaft and the employee's right index fingertip was caught and amputated between the indentation on the shaft and roll core.

An employee was operating an electric-powered ride-on sweeper. When the employee raised the seat to gain access to a brush belt and pulley assembly, the employee's thumb tip was caught and amputated between the belt and pulley.

An employee's left ring fingertip was amputated while removing twine that was entangled in a roller. The employee's glove got entangled with the twine pulling the employee's finger into the feed roller. As the employee pulled the hand back, the fingertip was amputated by the twine.

Employees were attempting to tow a stuck vehicle. The quick connect on the loader engaged and the injured employee's left hand was struck by a hydraulic pin resulting in the partial amputation of two fingers.
On February 23, 2017, an employee was cutting a piece of polycarbonate with a foot shear when the hold-down came down and amputated the employee's right ring fingertip and crushed the pinky finger.
An employee was running a punch press and amputated their right index finger.

An employee was operating a foot saw. The employee reached under the machine in order to clear a jam and her thumb was caught in an unguarded chain and sprocket causing an amputation of her left thumb to the first knuckle.
On February 24, 2017, an employee was sanitizing the hock cutter when it amputated his finger pad.

On February 24, 2017, a temporary employee was using tongs with his right hand to remove the hot metal/stamped piece from the point-of-operation on the forging punch press and placed it on the nearby heat belt (conveyor). Then, the employee sprayed the point-of-operation with his left hand holding the sprayer bottle. The employee reached into the point-of-operation with the sprayer bottle and his left hand was caught and crushed by the closing dies of the forging punch press. His left index finger was amputated at the middle knuckle.

An employee opened the cleanout on a screw conveyor that had stopped. As he was removing the super sack string that had bound it up, the screw conveyor continued turning and amputated his right ring finger.
An employee was operating a saw on 2-24-2017 to cut melamine board/particle board and amputated the left middle finger. The saw was guarded at the time.
An employee was adjusting a saw assembly on a machine when the saw blade amputated his left index fingertip to the bone. The saw was online at the time of the incident.

An employee was cleaning the rollers that apply chemical treatment and paints to metal coils when his hand was caught in the metal coils. His right pinky finger, ring finger, and thumb tip had to be surgically amputated.

An employee was checking flow rates on a material pump. As he descended from the pump platform, his wedding band was caught on an exposed machine screw head. The band pinched and partially amputated his ring finger.
An employee was feeding wire mesh into a rotary shear when the employee's right hand was pulled into the shear blade, amputating the index finger and damaging the thumb.
An employee was attempting to unclog and then reattach a hose. Her left hand was in the pour hole when the machine cycled and a finger was crushed by the ram resulting in a fingertip amputation.

The employee was assembling a pneumatic activated butterfly valve assembly.  He also attached the air source to it. As the employee was reinstalling the valve his right thumb was inside the valve assembly. The valve activated pinching the employee's right thumb tip resulting in amputation of the thumb tip including bone and the nail.
An employee was sawing plywood using a table saw and amputated the left index and middle fingertips.

An employee of another unit was moving bar stock with a forklift when it became stuck as he went through a doorway. The injured employee was helping to move the bar stock and when the forklift lowered, the bar stock fell onto the injured employee's hand amputating his middle finger.
An employee was using a meat-cutting saw and amputated her left middle fingertip.
An employee was manually moving steel plates and caught a finger in a hole in the steel plate resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was removing excess material from the blade of the 90 degree saw and amputated the right ring finger.
An employee was operating a punch press and amputated four fingers on the left hand.
An employee was cleaning near the fryer conveyor belt and made contact with the sprocket amputating the right middle finger at the first knuckle.

While one student operated the controls, another welding student lifted up the rubber flap on the rear side of the hydraulic metal shear to trim a small piece of metal. The student's left index fingertip was amputated during the process.
An employee was welding side rails together for a ladder. The rails slipped and pinched the right pinky fingertip resulting in a partial amputation.
The employee was using an air wand to spray off excess shot from the steel beam. The steel beam rolled over onto the tip of his right middle finger causing a fingertip amputation.

On March 1, 2017, at approximately 3:00 a.m., an employee was injured while visually checking a belt drive in the Thistle Area. A jam had occurred in the crusher. The machine was locked out, the jam was cleared, and the machine was started back up. The employee gained access to a catwalk and knelt down to check the tightness of the belt drive when his knee made contact with a piece of metal causing him to react by throwing his hand out. His gloved hand made contact with the unguarded, moving belt drive resulting in a fracture and amputation of the left ring fingertip.
An employee was cleaning a spray dryer, at or near the rotary valve, and amputated fingers on the right hand.

An employee was delivering a 55 gallon drum. The drum was lying on its side in the trailer. As the employee was trying to steady the drum, it shifted and caught his right hand resulting in amputation of the right pinky fingertip.
An employee was operating a machine (similar to a wood lathe) when he noticed a sound suggesting a loose belt. While troubleshooting, his fingers were caught in the pulley and crushed.
An employee was operating a mechanical power press and amputated the right index fingertip.
An employee was operating the trimming machine and amputated the right index fingertip.
An employee was clearing a jam from the crystallizer machine when her hand was caught in the rotating throat resulting in amputation of her hand. The machine was not locked out at the time.
An employee was checking the belt on an AC unit when the belt suddenly turned on and amputated part of his right middle finger.
An employee was training on the stand-up forklift and lost control. The forklift struck a building beam resulting in amputation of the employee's left foot.
An inmate suffered the amputation of two fingers when they contacted the running belts of an air handling unit.

An employee was using a chop saw to cut a pipe. The pipe was wet and his hand slipped from the pipe up into the saw blade. The employee's left index finger was amputated at the first knuckle and the left middle finger was lacerated.

An employee was lifting a hatch to gain access to the underground area. As he was lifting the hatch, his right pinky finger was caught between the hatch and the ground amputating it at the first knuckle.

An employee was under a conveyor to retrieve a bird in live hang and caught their right hand in an unguarded, moving chain and sprocket resulting in partial amputation of the right middle, ring, and pinky fingers.

On March 02, 2017, an employee was at a customer site attempting to remove a tire from a forklift. While removing the lug nuts, the tire exploded severing the employee's left thumb, below the knuckle.
An employee was moving a table (on rollers) that was loaded with square tubing into his work area. The square tubing shifted and a piece rolled and smashed right thumb.

An employee was driving a tugger back to the loading area. When the employee turned a corner the train he was pulling jack-knifed. A forklift driver was straightening the tugger. As the employee was opening the pintle hitch, the forklift driver was lifting the cart and pinched the employee's left index finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip.
An employee was closing a guard over a machine when the guard slipped out of his hand and pinched his hand between the guard and the slicer resulting in amputation of the right ring fingertip.

An employee was about to weld a piece of cable from the east side cable to the west side cable. The west side was already clamped off and the employee was putting the east side into the clamp on the cable welder. As he was lowering the guard, the clamp guard actuated catching his right middle finger in the clamp and amputating the fingertip.

An employee was loading a cream truck. The employee was getting all of the liquid out of the line when his finger was sucked into the hose causing the valve to close and amputate the tip of the left index finger.

An employee was using a table saw to cut a 24-inch by 15-inch section of plywood to make a battery floor and amputated his left index finger just below the second knuckle. The employee also sustained a laceration to his left thumb and middle finger.

An employee was removing a finished part from a CNC lathe. With his hand on the part, he inadvertently stepped on a foot control that actuated a hold down ram. The ram came back in on the part and amputated the upper portion of the employee's right thumb.

An employee was walking past a waste trommel and lost his footing. He grabbed for the machine and the machine grabbed his glove and pulled his hand in resulting in amputation of the left index, middle and pinky fingers.

The employee was moving a manifold via three portable pipe stands when one of the stand's casters got stuck in a divot in the cement floor. As the employee attempted to push the manifold from the first stand, the weight of the manifold became unevenly distributed causing the manifold to fall from the pipe stands. The employee's finger was caught between the pipe stand and the manifold resulting in the amputation of the employee's first digit of the right thumb.
An employee was using a blender and as he pushed cilantro into the blender he suffered the partial amputation of his right middle and index fingers.
An employee suffered a toe amputation when his foot was caught between the roller and the sheet.

On March 3, 2017, an employee sustained amputation injuries to the right hand after coming in contact with the shell auger. The shell auger moves eggs shells from production to a load out trucking area.

An employee was operating a table-top miter saw when his glove got caught in the saw blade, pulling his left fifth finger into the saw blade. A physician later amputated part of the employee's finger.
An employee amputated fingers on his left hand while using the 12-ton pneumatic brake press to attach a blanket to a U-shaped bar.

An employee was pouring flour into a vat. The bucket slipped from the employee's hand and fell into the vat. The employee tried to pull the bucket out of the vat and suffered a left ring fingertip amputation when the finger was caught between the lip of the vat and the bucket.

An employee was attempting to move a conveyor back into its original position after moving it to grease a bearing on an adjacent conveyor. The employee grabbed the bottom legs of the conveyor and tried to pull it back into place. As he pulled on the bottom leg of the conveyor, the top end of the conveyor tilted or rocked which allowed his right gloved hand to travel down the conveyor leg and was smashed between the base plate of the conveyor leg and the floor amputating the fingertip.
An employee amputated the right index fingertip while cleaning a deli meat slicer.
An employee was operating a machine and amputated the right middle fingertip when it was caught in a screw while trying to remove a piece of plastic.
An employee was moving an attachment member and got his left index finger caught between the attachment member and a dolly cart resulting in amputation of the finger.
An employee was measuring a piece of steel and amputated the right pinky fingertip.

An employee was installing a dust collector air seal. As the employee was hooking up the air lines, he touched the rubber seal to verify the seal was engaged and another employee working with the him activated the air (start button). The injured employee's right index fingertip was amputated.

Two employees were removing bolts from a flange. One employee was loosening the bolts by hand and another employee was using a pneumatic socket wrench. The wrench has a bar that travels with it and the bar pinched the first employee's finger resulting in amputation of the right index fingertip.
An employee's left index finger was caught between the chain and the concrete while unloading a precast concrete box, resulting in amputation of his fingertip.
On March 6, 2017, an employee was setting up a press and amputated part of the left index finger.

An employee suffered the partial amputation and open fracture of the distal phalanx of the left thumb when an outside door in the loading dock area was caught by the wind and shut on the employee's hand.
An employee was attempting to place a core plug into a core at the hard roll towel area and pinched his left middle finger between the core and the core plug resulting in amputation of the fingertip.

An employee was installing a 400 pound cable tray into a skid when his hand was caught between the cable tray and the skid when the cable tray was lowered. The employee suffered the amputation of the distal phalanx on his right pinky finger.
An employee climbed up onto a machine and reached to remove accumulated chicken parts. The right ring fingertip was amputated by the guarded saw blade.
An employee suffered a diagonal amputation of the thumb tip while using a paper guillotine.
An employee was parking her forklift and suffered a crushing injury to the left foot resulting in amputation of two toes.
An employee was lubricating a machine and amputated the right index fingertip.

On March 9, 2017, at approximately 10:30 a.m., an employee was injured while handling cants from the gang saw to the roof top chain. As a 5 1/2 inch x 7 1/4 inch cant came out of the saw, it fell short of the chain and fell towards the floor. The employee reached for the end of the cant and as the cant raised, the employee's right thumb was caught between the cant and the steel hood of the gang saw resulting in a severe cut behind the nail bed above the knuckle. The employee was transported to the hospital where the employee received stitches. The injury was classified as a partial amputation with the tip of the bone broken, but no nerve damage.

An employee was operating a shear while standing at the end to catch material as it came out. The employee saw a piece of plastic balling up and attempted to remove it when a quarter inch of his left finger was amputated.
An employee was operating a vegetable slicer and amputated the right index fingertip.

The employee was holding the dock plate handles up so that the forklift operator could maneuver the forks into the handles. The employee's left index finger was crushed in the dock plate handle resulting in partial amputation.

An employee was changing an auger bit on a drilling rig when the employee noticed the pin hole was filled with dirt. The employee used his right middle finger to clear the hole when the Kelly bar moved and amputated his finger.

An employee was attempting to replace a belt on the pulley system in the bagging area. The machine was stopped when the employee pulled on the pulley. Due to high tension on the belt, the employee's right hand was pulled between the belt and pulley resulting in amputation of the first two fingertips on the right hand.
While releasing a turnbuckle for a poured concrete wall, an employee's right ring finger was amputated at the first knuckle.

On March 9, 2017, an employee was maneuvering a steel frame close to the concrete floor when it slid off a block of wood that was supporting one end of the frame and struck the employee's right middle finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip.
An employee was checking the banding in the strapper machine when the lid fell onto the employee's hand amputating the left ring and middle fingertips.
An employee was unjamming the sawdust feeder and amputated the left index and middle fingertips.
An employee was operating a cutting machine and amputated two fingertips while unplugging a clog. The machine was running and unguarded at the time of the incident.

On March 10, 2017, an employee was operating a press machine with his hand resting on the machine's track. The automated mold platform pinched his left index finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip.

An employee was cleaning a rotary valve machine when a coworker activated the machine, which then amputated the employee's index finger between the first knuckle and fingernail. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time.

An employee was performing maintenance, lubricating a drive train with a rag, when the rag became caught. When he attempted to pull out the rag, his right hand was caught in the chain sprocket, amputating half of his right pinky finger.
An employee's right index finger was caught and amputated in a rolling/crimping machine.

On March 11, 2017, an employee was guiding a finished roof truss down exit rollers past the finish press using a pivot pole as a guide. The employee's left ring finger was caught between the finished roof truss and the pivot pole, partially amputating the distal fingertip.

An employee was assembling a large gearbox using the lifting hoist. Each end has swivel hooks hooked onto the assembly on the shaft ends. When he went to hook the hoist to the customer end the hook swiveled with his gloved hand on the chain hoist. As the weight shifted, his left index finger was caught between the chain and the chain adjustment resulting in amputation up to the first distal joint.
An employee amputated two fingers when casing loosened from a retention nut, fell and struck the employee.
An employee was loading insulation into a blow machine when he tripped. As he tried to catch himself, his left thumb tip hit a gear and was amputated.
An employee was using a band saw to cut meat when his hand came into contact with the saw blade, amputating his left thumb tip.

An employee was operating an electric pallet jack and moved it onto the lift gate. The lift gate 
was wet and slippery from running a previous pallet that contained product packed in ice. The jack starting sliding 
toward the curbside of the platform. As the pallet was sliding to the edge, the associate tried to 
keep the pallet level by placing his arm on the pallet, to keep it from falling. The pallet jack continued to slide and as the employee attempted to get out of the way, his finger slid across the pallet jack and was amputated.
An employee was attempting to move pails on a conveyor line when his fingertip was caught and amputated.
An employee was using a meat blender when the blade amputated the employee's right ring finger.
An employee was moving a grill component with a lift. When the lift released, the component fell onto his right index finger amputating the fingertip.
An employee was cutting plywood with a powered hand saw when his left index finger touched the saw blade and was amputated.
An employee was cutting chicken with a knife when he amputated approximately 1/4" of his left thumb tip.
On March 13, 2017, at approximately 10:30 PM, an employee was troubleshooting a vacuum pump when a belt lacerated his left middle finger down the bone. His finger was partially amputated.

An employee was using a dolly to transport boxes. When she pulled back on the handle, she was unable to keep it upright and the dolly came down, trapping her finger between the handle and ground. When she attempted to pull her finger out, her skin was removed and her fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
Two employees were cleaning out a tank with a vacuum hose and an air lamp when a flash fire occurred burning both employees on the face.

An employee was performing preventive maintenance on the line 2 case erector, a machine that forms corrugated into a box. The employee was looking to see if a bearing was running smoothly in the machine and had a shop rag in his right hand. The rag got caught in the moving chain and sprocket assembly, pulling his right index finger into the assembly. The finger was severely lacerated and contorted such that it was amputated at the hospital.
An employee was on a 6 foot A-frame ladder cutting a 2x6 using a circular saw and amputated a finger.
An employee was helping to build a turf roller when the employee's glove got caught between the shaft on the roller and the sand paper resulting in amputation of the left thumb.
Employees were servicing a well. When the injured employee lifted tubing, his finger was caught between the slip segments and the well head resulting in amputation of the middle fingertip.

An employee was hand clearing parts from a machine press. The manufactured part from the last cycle got stuck to the upper part of the die. When the employee went to reach for the part, it fell and struck his left middle finger resulting in a fingertip amputation. The part weighed approximately 21 lbs.

Employees were setting up utility poles using a boom truck. They were using choker chains to hold the pole and set it. The chain rolled and the pole caught the injured employee's left ring finger resulting in amputation of the finger.
An employee was operating a shear and amputated the middle fingertip.
An employee was setting up an offline printer and got a finger caught between the roller and a guard resulting in an amputation injury.

On March 15, 2017, at approximately 7:30 a.m., an employee was injured while checking the function of a pump being used to transfer oil from a tank to a compressor station engine. The pump was being heated and a tarp had been placed over the pump in an effort to hold heat due to the outdoor freezing temperatures. The employee reached under the tarp and made contact with a moving piston inside an air exhaust port resulting in the amputation of the right index fingertip.
An employee was working on the yogurt filling line and amputated one-half inch of her right middle finger.

An employee was removing Mylar coating from a stainless steel pipe. He was wearing cut resistant gloves at the time. He then placed the steel pipe on a lathe to sand the coating off the pipe. The rotating steel pipe caught his gloved right hand and pulled it in amputating the middle and ring fingers at the far distal joint.
An employee was cutting wood with a saw and amputated a fingertip.
An employee suffered a pinky fingertip amputation while retracting the parcel chute that delivers packages into the trailers.
On March 16, 2017, an employee was operating an iron worker machine and amputated a finger.
An employee was putting a sheet of metal into a pyramid roller when his gloved left hand was pulled into the rollers resulting in amputation of the left right fingertip.

An employee was moving and reinstalling equipment. The employee was adjusting the spacer board underneath the piece of equipment when the forklift operator lowered the equipment onto the employee's right middle finger resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee had just made a delivery to a restaurant and was preparing the delivery truck for travel. The employee's little finger was caught in the rising tail gate and partially amputated.
An employee was troubleshooting one of the vacuum cleaners and contacted the motor fan blade resulting in amputation of his right middle fingertip.

An employee was operating a rail spike machine and noticed that a steel bar was not feeding properly into the pinch wheel. The employee used his hand to manipulate the bar to feed properly and caught his right middle finger in a pinch point resulting in a fingertip amputation.

An employee was trying to unjam a boxing machine. The machine cycled and his right hand was caught in a chain and sprocket resulting in several broken fingers. The right pinky finger was later amputated.

An employee was performing preventive maintenance on a conveyor and was wiping down the conveyor frame with a rag when the rag got caught between the conveyor belt and the roller. The employee's right hand was pulled into the machine and his right middle and index fingers were severely lacerated resulting in amputation. The conveyor was not locked/tagged out at the time.
On March 17, 2017, an employee was using a band saw to cut meat and suffered a pinky fingertip amputation and a laceration to the ring finger. Cut resistant gloves were worn at the time.
An employee was helping to unload the loader off of the trailer when their left ring finger was caught between the ramp and loader bucket resulting in amputation.

An employee was using a manual lathe to polish a small pin used in mold manufacturing. He was polishing the rotating pin using a piece of sandpaper. The glove on his middle right finger got caught by the rotating part pulling his hand in resulting in amputation of the right middle finger and a broken ring finger.

An employee was bending to pick up a broom that was laying on the floor against the wall in the linen department when a fire extinguisher fell off the wall and landed on his right thumb. His thumb was amputated from just below the thumbnail up.
An employee was attempting to clear a jam in a small metal scrap baler. The baler engaged while the employee's left foot was in the machine resulting in amputation of the foot at the ankle.

An employee was operating a roll-in band saw. He was using the roll control to move parts into the blade area and then pulling the cut parts out with his left hand. As the employee was reaching for a cut part, his left hand contacted the blade amputating the middle, ring, and pinky fingers.

An employee was placing rotors on a shelf using a step ladder and holding onto the shelf support bar. When the employee stepped off the ladder, the shelf collapsed on the employee's left hand resulting in a partial amputation of the left index finger.

An employee was working on a piece of equipment and was adjusting the tube valve (approx. 30lbs) which has a manual handle and was not in the lock position. The employee put his hand inside the valve to check to see if it was flush. The lift handle released itself while the employee's finger was still in the tube resulting in the partial amputation of the third finger on the left hand.

An employee was attempting to position a pipe on the swage unit using an F wrench style tool. When the employee was applying force to the tool, it slipped off of the pipe and the employee struck his hand on the metal table runner. The employee's hand was pinched between the tool and the table runner resulting in partial amputation of the right middle finger.
An employee amputated their index fingertip while cutting a piece of pipe with a pipe cutter.
An employee was cleaning a discharge chain on a conveyor when his thumb was caught in the chain, amputating his right thumb nail and bone. The conveyor was not locked/tagged out at the time.
An employee was greasing bearings on a running machine and his left index finger was caught in the chain and sprocket resulting in amputation at the first knuckle. The guard was removed at the time.
An employee was deburring a piece of steel on a belt sander when the metal flipped up and caught/amputated his right thumb tip between it and the belt.
An employee was operating a press break to bend sheet metal and amputated the middle two fingertips on the right hand when they were pinched between the upper and lower dies.

An employee suffered a fingertip amputation while working with conduit on a concrete floor. The injured employee was manually bracing a piece of metal conduit while another employee applied pressure to bend it. The conduit rolled and caught the injured employee's finger between the conduit and the concrete floor resulting in amputation of the left middle fingertip.
An employee was unjamming a multi-aspirator system when the machine cycled, resulting in amputation of his left hand middle finger.
On 3/20/17, an employee was operating a brake press to bend a piece of metal. While he was feeding the press, his right hand entered the machine, amputating his right middle and ring fingertips.

An employee was attempting to load material into a monorail cart. As the employee was pushing the material into the monorail material cups, the employee's right middle finger was pinched between the material shell bar and monorail cart cups. The fingertip had to be surgically amputated.

On March 21, 2017, an employee was using a baler to compress metal parts into a block. The employee's left foot was pushing some wire into the baler when the horizontal door caught the foot and amputated two toes. The baler was running at the time.
An employee suffered a finger amputation while placing pieces in a press brake.
An employee was feeding wire into a wire-pulling unit when the employee's fingertip entered a pinch point on the machine and was partially amputated.
An employee was troubleshooting a drive motor on an embossing machine when the employee's fingertip was caught and amputated in two of the motor gears.
An employee was loading pre-fabricated racks of 4-inch conduits from a cart onto a trailer when his finger was caught between the cart and the conduit, amputating his right ring fingertip.

An employee was lifting a mold with a crane. He had rigged the mold using chain slings through eye bolts secured to the mold. He was operating the crane with his right hand and placed his left hand on the chain sling/top of the eye bolt. As the slings became tighter, the chains came together and pinched the end of his left thumb, causing an open fracture of his left thumb tip. His thumb tip had to be surgically amputated.
On March 21, 2017, an employee was checking an empty chemical hopper and amputated two fingers on the right hand when the slide gate struck the employee's right hand.

A temporary employee was removing a part from a neck down machine when the machine was activated via the foot control. His left middle fingertip was then caught and amputated in the machine's nip point.

An employee was winding fiberglass onto a spinning mandrel when his gloved right hand was caught by the fiberglass/mandrel and pulled into the winder. When he pulled his hand out, his middle and ring fingertips were amputated.

An employee was unloading a car engine with a coworker when the engine became caught on the truck bed and fell. As the injured employee attempted to catch the engine, his left index finger was caught between the pallet and the engine, amputating his fingertip.

On 3/22/17, at about 06:14 a.m., an employee was dumping trash from a trash hopper into a larger trash bin when the employee's left ring fingertip was caught and amputated between the two trash receptacles.
An employee was offloading perforating guns from a trailer to the ground when his fingertip was pinched between two sections of pipe, resulting in an amputation.

An employee was attempting to adjust the print plate on a printer machine when his left ring and middle fingers were caught between the machine's rollers. His left ring fingertip was amputated, and his middle finger was lacerated. The machine was unguarded at the time.
An employee was transporting forklift mast pieces using a crane and sling when the pieces slipped in the sling. The material shifted and pinched his right pinky finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was repairing a floor with a handheld saw. The employee shut the saw off, reached near the saw, and made contact with the blade, which was still coasting to a stop. The employee's left index fingertip was amputated.

An employee was standing at the end of a conveyor catching long crossouts to be bundled. A crossout landed on the frame of the conveyor rather than falling off the end of the conveyor belt. The employee's left middle fingertip was caught and amputated between the crossout and conveyor frame.

An employee was clearing a jam on an indexing conveyor belt when the belt indexed unexpectedly, catching and amputating the employee's right ring finger at the first digit. The conveyor's emergency stop was not activated at the time of the incident.
An employee's left index finger was amputated after contacting moving parts in an exhaust fan in the paint department. The exhaust fan was unguarded at the time.
An employee was cutting chicken with a knife when his left thumb tip was amputated. Cut-resistant gloves were not worn at the time.

An employee had changed the packing on a frac pump and was preparing to install the plunger when the plunger slipped and smashed his finger against the corner of the fluid end, amputating a portion of his left pinky.

On March 23, 2017, an employee was at the nut welder retrieving an extra nut dropped by the nut feeder when the employee's left fingertip was caught and amputated between the nut being retrieved and the tip of the welder.
On March 23, 2017, an employee was working at the anilox roller when it began to move and caught the employee's left hand, amputating two fingers. The roller was energized at the time.
An employee was cutting wood with a table saw when his hand was pulled in and his finger was amputated. The saw was unguarded at the time.
An employee was using a saw to cut a wood doorframe when the blade amputated the employee's left thumb tip.

An employee was moving a metal table on wheels next to another metal table when his right hand was smashed between the two. His pinky finger was avulsed and had to be surgically amputated to the knuckle.

An employee was running a brake press, bending flat aluminum sheets to form louvers. While she was handling an aluminum sheet, her right hand slipped and went toward the point of operation, which had a press knife. When she pulled her right hand back, the press knife amputated her right middle fingertip.
An employee was removing a 4" valve with a flange. As he was removing the valve, his right pinky finger was caught between the flange of the valve and the pad-I, amputating it at the first joint.
An employee was moving equipment from a stand to the ground when his right middle fingertip was pinched and amputated between the equipment and the stand.

On March 25, 2017, at 10:30 AM, an employee was operating a drill press to drill holes in shower shelves when the employee's right middle fingertip was caught on the drill bit. The fingertip had to be amputated up to the first knuckle.
An employee was putting jewelry into a safe as part of closing procedures. As she closed the safe doors, they closed on and amputated her right middle and index fingertips.
An employee was removing the flywheel from a paver when it came off and came down on his right pinky finger, amputating the tip.

An employee and a coworker were positioning a wood panel on the bed of a milling machine when the coworker turned on the milling machine vacuum system. The vacuum sucked the wood panel down into the milling machine, and the panel pinched and amputated the employee's right middle fingertip between it and the milling machine bed.
An employee was closing the vault door in the bank when the door caught her left index finger. As she pulled her left hand back, her index fingertip was detached and had to be medically amputated.

An employee hooked up a chain sling to a section of I-beam so a bridge crew could move it with a crane. He was guiding the material as the crane moved it when the chain sling slid and allowed the beam to roll. His right index fingertip was then caught and amputated between the chain and I-beam.

An employee was cutting 2x4s with a circular saw for grout forms. The boards were on saw horses. The saw kicked back and the employee's hand slipped under the saw resulting in amputation of the right ring fingertip.

On March 28, 2017, around 1:30 AM, an employee was using an air hose to clean equipment when the hose became wrapped on a steel stand. The steel stand was propping open a metal door. The employee tugged on the hose, which caused the steel stand to move and the metal door to close on and amputate the employee's left middle fingertip.

An employee was cleaning a patch kit machine after use. The employee was using an air wand to blow sand from around the machine. There was a clump of sand that he couldn't get out with the air pressure so he attempted to remove the clump of sand with his hand. At that point, the machine cycled and amputated his left index finger. The machine was guarded at the time.
An employee smashed his left pinky finger while pulling the lever of a 6-yard tilt dumpster. Half of his finger had to be medically amputated.
An employee was changing the die press brake when the machine re-cycled and amputated her right index finger.

An employee was cleaning a roll-forming machine when her right hand was caught between two rollers. Her right middle finger was crushed and had to be amputated. The machine was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.
An employee was changing a light bulb when the globe around the bulb broke. The broken glass then amputated his fingertip.

An employee was cutting a band from a bundle when the bars started to roll. The employee tried to brace himself, but his hand went out toward the bars and his fingertip was pinched and partially amputated between two bars.
An employee was lowering a box of clay pigeons into a container when the container lid fell on his left middle finger, resulting in an amputation without bone loss.
A derrick on a workover rig fell and struck an employee in the head. He was wearing a hardhat at the time.
An employee suffered a right ring finger distal amputation while operating a sheeter machine. The machine was guarded at the time.
An employee was cutting a piece of aluminum with a rotary saw when it kicked back and amputated his left index finger.
An employee was operating a disc sanding machine when the tips of the left index and middle fingers were amputated.

On March 29, 2017, an employee was clearing out jammed material in a machine when his hand was caught in the air lock. The rotating fan blades partially amputated his second, third, and fourth fingers on his right hand.

On March 29, 2017, an employee was moving a roll of steel coil with a coil caddy and crane. The employee saw the coil tipping and tried to stop if from tipping over. As the coil tipped, the employee's left hand was caught between the coil caddy and steel coil, amputating the first and second fingers and breaking the third finger.

On March 29, 2017, an employee was troubleshooting an overhead door opener when their left finger became caught between the chain and sprocket of the side mounted overhead door opener, resulting in a left pinky fingertip amputation.
An employee was cleaning out the cluster machine (mixer) while it was running and amputated a fingertip.
An employee was reading a meter at a residence when she was bitten by a dog and suffered the amputation of her right pinky fingertip.

An employee was cleaning a blender machine and amputated his left ring finger, a portion of his left middle finger, and lacerated his left index finger. The blender machine was operating at the time of the incident.
An employee was cutting framing materials with a fillet cutter and amputated his right index fingertip.

An employee was conducting a test on a valve, located on a trolley system. The valve is hydrostatically tested. The valve fell off the trolley system and landed on the employee, resulting in amputation of the employee's index and ring fingers.
On March 30, 2017, an employee was guiding a ply of paper into the winder machine when his right hand was caught under the machine belt, amputating part of his right thumb and index finger.
On March 30, 2017, an employee was operating a press and suffered a partial amputation of the right middle finger.
An employee was testing a new matrix for respiratory care when a valve closed on the employee's right middle finger, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was operating a baler machine.  The employee installed a new spool of baling wire on the back of the machine and then threaded the new wire through the eyelets and was twisting the new wire onto the old wire when the machine cycled severing his left hand. The machine was not guarded at the time.
A temporary employee was operating a reach truck and struck a rack resulting in amputation of the left thumb at the first knuckle.

An employee was lifting sheet metal bundles with a crane. He intended to separate and pass a strap between two bundles. 
The top one fell and trapped his left middle fingertip, amputating it with no bone loss.

An employee was using a winch to collect waste material in a rear load trash truck. As the winch was retracting, he held the winch cable to one side away from a cable bracket with his left hand. His left index finger was then caught between the cable and the bracket, amputating his fingertip.

An employee's left index finger was severely lacerated while helping another employee clear a clogged mower chute on a commercial zero-turn lawn mower. The mower was turned off and the cutting blades disengaged, however the blower fan was still moving when the injured employee's  left hand entered the blower fan. The finger had to be amputated.
An employee was trying to get sand to flow through a slot gate when it closed and amputated two of the employee's fingertips.

An employee was driving a forklift that overturned on him. The employee's left leg was caught by the forklift's mast crushing his toes which were amputated at the hospital. All five toes on the left foot were amputated.

The injured employee was cleaning the lower plates of a printing press with a towel wrapped around his right hand. A second employee was cleaning/setting up the upper portion of the press. The injured employee's hand was pulled into the press, due to the towel; partially amputating his right thumb and crushing the right ring finger.
An employee was using a table router to trim a part when their finger was pulled into the blade resulting in amputation of the left index fingertip.
An employee was opening the lid to the vacuum hopper. The lid slipped out of his grasp and fell crushing his left index finger between the lid and the hopper resulting in amputation of the fingertip.
An employee was cutting material with a miter saw when the blade amputated his left index finger at the first knuckle.
An employee was reaching in front of his weapon during qualifications when the weapon discharged amputating the first digit of his left index finger.
An employee was leveling off debris from a trash box directly underneath the airlock system when the employee's hand was caught in the airlock, amputating the left index finger distal tip.

On April 3, 2017, an employee was adjusting a roll of plastic material being fed into a thermoforming machine while standing on a small metal grated platform. The employee stumbled and the employee's hand was caught in a pinch point where the machine chain drew the material in, resulting in amputation of the right middle fingertip.

The employee was beginning the clean-in-place process. The employee disconnected the air line which de-energized the valve causing it to close on the employee's right index finger and amputate the fingertip.

An employee was using a manual paper cutter and aligning the material to be cut when the cutter arm fell and lacerated the employee's left hand middle finger. The fingertip was amputated in order to close the wound.
The employee was descending from the basket of a boom truck when his left ring finger was caught in a bracket that held the bucket to the truck resulting in amputation.
An employee suffered the amputation of the left index finger while trying to dislodge a piece that was stuck in the die of the machine.
An employee amputated the left pinky finger above the first knuckle in a bushing machine.
An employee was working on a mill press and suffered a fingertip amputation.
An employee was drilling holes into steel when his glove was pulled into the drill resulting in a finger amputation at the knuckle.

An employee was running a 30-minute boiler test on a diesel fueled boiler and caught the fingers on their right hand in the spinning belt and pulley. The boiler's diesel pump had been turned off but the belt and pulleys were still spinning. The employee's right middle finger was amputated below the first joint. The guard was not in place at the time.
An employee's left index fingertip was partially amputated while placing livers into position on the giblet harvester.

An employee was lifting the engine compartment door of a tank when it slipped out of his left hand. He attempted to catch the door with his right hand and crushed his pinky finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip.

An employee was performing maintenance on a setting tool used in hydraulic fracturing. He opened a vise and turned the tool 180 degrees to make it easier to service. As he was sliding the tool back into the vise, the tool fell and caught his finger between the tool and the vise, amputating his left middle finger below the nailbed.
An employee was removing a 360 lb. block of cheese from the cutting harp and suffered an amputation injury to the left hand.
An employee was cleaning a conveyor belt with a dust rag when the conveyor caught the rag and pulled her finger into the belt, amputating her fingertip.
On April 5, 2017, an employee was disassembling a setting tool when the employee's right third finger was caught in the tool, partially amputating the fingertip.
An employee was repairing a kettle motor and amputated the right pinky finger when it was caught between the belt and pulley while putting the belt back onto the machine.
An employee was working in the valve box of a railroad car when the manway lid fell on his left hand, amputating his thumb.

An employee was unjamming product from a machine when the equipment started and the employee's left hand was caught in the auger resulting in amputation of three fingers. The auger guard was not in place at the time.
On April 5, 2017, at approximately 1:30 a.m., an employee was operating a band saw when the employee's left hand contacted the running blade, amputating the thumb, index, and middle fingertips.
An employee was attempting to dislodge meat from the inside of a meat processing machine when the machine was activtated and amputated several of the employee's fingers.
On April 6, 2017, an employee was cleaning a canning machine when the employee's right index fingertip contacted a rotating auger and was amputated. The machine was running and unguarded at the time.
An employee was attempting to push a sandwich through a wrapper machine when his left index and middle fingertips were partially amputated by the wrapper jaws. The machine was guarded at the time.

On April 6, 2017, an employee was cleaning the coffee grinder of an espresso machine when a door to the machine's hopper opened. As the employee was attempting to close the door, he made contact with the hopper and the piston came down, amputating his right index finger between the base of his fingernail and the first knuckle joint.

An employee was cleaning a build-up of metal shavings on the carrier plate of the double disc grinder when her right middle finger was caught and amputated between a hole in the carrier plate and the rotating disc.

An employee was emptying a trash dumpster into a 30-yard, roll-off container at the loading dock when the dumpster started falling into the container. The employee attempted to catch the dumpster when it slid down and amputated the last digit of his ring finger between the dumpster and roll-off container.
An employee suffered a right middle fingertip amputation while attempting to remove film from a packaging machine. The machine was not guarded at the time.
An employee was cleaning a glue roller machine when the employee's finger was caught in the rollers amputating the fingertip. The machine was running at the time.

An employee was troubleshooting a pouring station when the cylinder activated and his right fingertip was caught between the plunger and the stop plate. The flesh on his right index fingertip was amputated (no bone loss). The pouring station was not locked/tagged out at the time of the incident.

An employee was attempting to repair the welding machine with a pair of pliers when the pliers became caught and pulled the employee's hand into the machine, partially amputating the left ring finger.

An employee was using a saw to cut metal recreational vehicle parts. He was changing from cutting one type of part to another when he saw some of the old material inside the guard of the machine. As he attempted to remove the material, the saw blade amputated his left ring finger.

An employee was performing maintenance and clearing out a jam in the granulator when a section of the machine fell on and amputated his fingertip.
The machine was locked out at the time.
An employee was loading supplies into a truck and closing the tailgate when his right ring finger was caught in the tailgate, amputating his fingertip.
On 4/8/17, an employee was cutting bacon with a bandsaw when he made contact with the blade, amputating his right index finger. The saw was guarded at the time.
An employee was attempting to close the tail on an aircraft when the employee's right index finger was smashed and amputated in the mobile tail enclosure.

An employee was repairing a feed line auger that had tension in the system. The employee thought he had the energy released, but it was spring loaded. When the energy released, it pinched his finger against the cage. His finger was surgically amputated.
An employee suffered a right index fingertip amputation while using a meat saw to cut meat.

An employee was operating a cut-off bar saw when a counterweight that keeps the saw elevated broke, causing the saw blade to come down on and partially amputate his left thumb and left index and middle fingers.

An employee was using the right hand to push meat across a meat slicer when the employee's vinyl glove was caught by the slicer blade, pulling the employee's right thumb into the blade. The employee's right thumb tip was amputated along with part of the thumbnail.
On April 10, 2017, an employee was cleaning equipment when it partially amputated the employee's left middle and ring fingers. The equipment was not locked out at the time.
An employee was operating band saw when he sneezed several times and his hand went into the blade, amputating his left thumb.
A steel beam fell on an employee's leg, resulting in amputation of the left foot.
While attempting to remove an obstruction from a valve that was located inside of a rail car, the valve closed and amputated an employee's left ring finger.
An employee was cutting meat on a meat saw and amputated the middle fingertip without bone loss.
While removing aluminum flash from the die of a hydraulic trim press, an employee amputated his middle finger when the press malfunctioned.

An employee was checking the ID of a pipe for smoothness. While she was checking the inside of the pipe with her thumb, the machine cycled pushing the pipe back against a back stop and trapping her thumb between the back stop and the wall of the pipe. The tip of her thumb was amputated.

An employee was setting up a hydraulic pull tester station (5000 lbs. capacity). A plastic chain product was put under tension. While the employee was adjusting some locking washers with a spanner wrench, the plastic chain snapped and the employee's left middle fingertip was caught and amputated between the washer and a table.
An employee was assisting in a saw re-build. The employee tried to grab a ball screw as it was falling and his finger was crushed/pinched between the falling part and the machinery housing.
An employee was threading stock into the core machine and suffered a partial amputation of the right ring finger.

Employees were removing a gearbox from the frame of a laser-guided truck. After removing the last two bolts holding the gearbox to the frame, the gearbox fell and struck the employees' feet. Both employees suffered five broken toes.
An employee was struck by the raised fork of a forklift, losing an eye.
An employee was struck by a vehicle resulting in amputation of his right leg.
An employee was cutting plywood with a planer and lacerated three fingers on the right hand and amputated a fingertip. The planer was unguarded at the time.

An employee was using compressed air to clean coolant from the bottom of a part that was suspended by a magnet. The part fell from the magnet and the employee's index finger was struck by either the air hose or the falling part resulting in a partial amputation.
An employee was cutting T-bone steaks on a vertical band saw and amputated his left middle fingertip.

On April 12, 2017, at 2:20PM, an employee was setting a shim on a press. When the press cycled, the employee's fingers were caught in the clamp used to secure the product resulting in a partial amputation of the left index and middle fingers.
An employee was installing a band saw V-belt and amputated the right index fingertip in the belt and pulley. The machine was not locked out/tagged out at the time.

An employee was releasing water from the hopper that was in operation. As he was releasing connections, he braced himself with his hand on an opening. His hand slipped and contacted the hopper lift resulting in amputation of the index, middle, and ring fingers up to the middle knuckles on his left hand.

An employee was cleaning grease from a sprocket with a rag when the rag got caught in the sprocket and pulled the employee's fingers into the sprocket and chain. The employee's right index and middle fingers were partially amputated.
An employee was operating a bending machine and crushed their right thumb in the machine resulting in amputation at the first knuckle.

An employee was transporting a container of liquid nitrogen on a dolly. Upon entering a building the container fell off the dolly and pinched the employee's finger between it and the dolly resulting in a left index finger amputation at the tip of the distal interphalangeal joint.
An employee was mixing mortar with a battery powered drill. The employee's glove was caught in the drill chuck pulling his hand into the drill resulting in amputation of the thumb.

An employee was transporting a patient on a stretcher out of a room. In the process, the door handle trapped her pinky finger between the door handle and the stretcher resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was using a knife to cut food when the blade amputated his fingertip.

An employee was weighing 55-gallon drums that were on a pallet next to a scale. When he tried to rotate a drum off the pallet and onto the scale, his right thumb was pinched between two drums, amputating the thumb tip.

On 4-13-17, two employees were working in an aerial lift when it ran over a septic tank cover. The cover then collapsed, causing one employee to be catapulted out of the lift and the other to slam into the guardrails of the lift.

An employee was cutting drywall with a table saw and contacted the saw blade resulting in amputation of the left middle finger between the first and second joint and a laceration to the left index finger that required medical amputation.
On April 13, 2017, an employee was attempting to "block off" a cylindrical boiler and caught their right index finger between the boiler and the dunnage resulting in a fingertip amputation.
An employee was performing maintenance on the cutter machine and partially amputated their left middle and ring fingers.
An employee was loading and unloading 3" pipe from a trailer to the ground when a pipe rolled and pinched his finger. His finger was amputated.

An employee was operating a machinery line to make PVC pipes when a pipe became stuck or misaligned. The employee was attempting to fix the problem when his right middle and ring fingers were smashed between two pipes, amputating the fingers to the first joint.

An employee was adjusting a dock plate with a trailer when the dock plate became stuck. When the employee attempted to unjam the dock plate, the employee's right pinky finger was caught between the dock plate and the trailer, amputating the fingertip.

An employee was removing debris from a machine while waiting on the machine's cooling process to be completed. Due to a software error, the interlock system failed, allowing the machine's die to move and contact the employee's right thumb, which suffered an open fracture. The thump tip had to be medically amputated.

An employee was sanitizing equipment on a filling line. The drain valve was opened while his finger was in one of the filler holes. The filler then cycled and amputated his left middle fingertip above the top knuckle.
An employee was connecting two baggage transporters when the hinge of one dropped, pinching and amputating the employee's left middle finger.

The injured employee was pressing down a rail car pusher arm with a crow bar when another employee moved the rail car forward and crushed the injured employee's left index finger resulting in a partial amputation between the distal and middle joints.

An employee was working on the green stacker laying sticks. As the last course of lumber was coming towards the employee, a paper ticket blew off. The employee pulled the e-stop and picked up the ticket and handed it to another employee (the injured employee) who contacted the machine amputating the right ring finger.

An employee was changing a semi tire. While the employee was trying to mount the tire to the axle, the jack fell and severed the tip of the employee's pinky finger between the bottom rail and the tire.
An employee was operating a chop saw and suffered a fingertip amputation.

On April 17, 2017, an employee was using a stand-up tugger to move a cart to a staging area when his right index finger was caught between the light pole on the tugger and a frame that was on the cart that he was moving resulting in the amputation of the right index fingertip.
An employee was cleaning the quill puller (defeathering machine) with water and amputated the right pinky finger. The machine was not locked out at the time.

An employee was emptying debris using a dump box on a forklift at a construction site. The employee released the latch on the dump box in order to tip it into the dumpster. At the time, the employee slipped and when he tried to catch himself his left hand got caught between the fork and the dump box pinching his middle and ring fingers resulting in a crushing injury to the ring finger and a middle fingertip amputation.
On April 17, 2017, an employee was hoisting material via crane and suffered a distal finger amputation after it was caught between the crane hook and hoist attachment.

On April 18, 2017, an employee was attempting to remove finished product from a magnetic wheel at the end of the conveyor when the employee's glove was caught in an unguarded moving chain and sprocket resulting in a thumb tip amputation.
An employee was cutting wood using the trim track machine when the machine jammed. After clearing the jam, the employee's left middle, ring and pinky fingers were amputated by the saw blade.

Four employees were in a utility terrain vehicle (UTV) going up-hill when it tipped backwards and rolled down the hill. Two employee were hospitalized. One employee was hospitalized for a broken pelvis and the second employee was hospitalized for leg injuries.

An employee was working on a fresh air intake fan. The electrical source of energy was locked out, but the residual sources of energy were in the process of being locked out when his hand was caught in the pulleys resulting in the amputation of his left pinky at the knuckle and amputation of the ring, middle, and index fingers.
An employee was cleaning wood pieces out of a chop saw and suffered a partial amputation of the left index fingertip.
An employee was placing a metal stabilizing ring on a cardboard drum when his left pinky finger was pinched between the stabilizing ring and the drum, partially amputating his fingertip.
An employee was cutting wood with a circular saw when the saw kicked back and amputated the employee's left index finger.
An employee dumped wet mud out of a dump truck and was closing the tail gate when it smashed the ring and middle fingers on both hands, causing an amputation.
An employee was letting down a car lift when the lift came down on his left hand, amputating his middle finger.

An employee was drilling holes in copper tubing while wearing gloves.
